description: Our client is a fast-growing, licensed Digital Wealth Management fintech platform based in Singapore.  Working closely with key partners, they have established a product pipeline of highly desired, alpha-generating investment opportunities across various asset classes, including private equity, bonds, ESG and crypto. They then leverage technology to significantly lower the minimum investment size, as well as provide an end-to-end, customer-centric digital solution, to distribute the product to a wider investor base in Singapore and around the region. They are backed by both leading financial institutions as well as prominent VCs.  This will be an exciting role for an inspiring and results-orientated Head of Sales & Distribution to grow the Sales & Distribution team, as well as ensure high level of client service. He/ She will work very closely with the CEO to ensure that entire onboarding, KYC, due diligence, book-building and post-investment experience for investors is as optimizes as possible, while ensuring that the company achieves its target revenue The client is willing to offer an excellent compensation package with attract share options for the right candidate  Roles & Responsibilities Lead and formulate company’s execution on distribution of private market products to the mass affluent investors and EAMs (External Asset Managers), reporting to the CEO Oversee and coordinate sales functions working alongside marketing, and product development teams, and in ensuring good user journey and smooth process flows. To ensure delivery on revenue targets by working with internal teams and external partnerships Attract and develop sales talent while promoting company’s core value and culture  Requirements At least >7 years of experience within the financial services industry in a sales, relationship manager, investment advisor, or similar role At least 3 years of experience in fintech platforms, trading platforms, capital markets, or similar industry Entrepreneurial with track record in problem solving and decision-making within highly ambiguous and fast-changing environment Strong communicator, excellent interpersonal and leadership skills Prior working experience in as a licensed representative in a MAS-regulated financial institution is a must  Interested candidates, please send your updated CV to Leonnard Lee (R1106231) at leonnard.lee@hrnetone.com / HRnet One Pte Ltd (EA Licence: 16S8408)

Company Description  Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant’s approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats.  Job Description  We are seeking a proven, tactical and strategic Director, Regional Sales to drive growth across the Region. You will lead, develop and grow an experienced team of Enterprise sales professionals.  Responsibilities: Supporting direct reports by participating and leading in client and prospect meetings within assigned regions. Ongoing mentoring and development of the Region Enterprise sales team which includes recruiting, hiring and training Conducting weekly forecast meetings. Coach direct reports regarding strategies to drive closure Reporting on sales activity and forecast to senior sales management Consistently monitoring the sales activity of the team, and tracking the results  Qualifications  Requirements: Must have 10+ years of enterprise software sales experience and a minimum of 5+ years of experience leading an enterprise software sales team. Ideally within the Computer Networking and Security industry.  Additional Qualifications: Proven record of sales success in a similar enterprise technology sales role Excellent presentation and listening skills Must be able to thrive in a very fast paced environment Ability to hire and train new enterprise sales representatives

description: About this opportunity FastJobs has consistently ranked among the top recruitment apps in Singapore since our launch in April 2015. Our team is committed to making job opportunities accessible to everyone, and we're continuing to develop new solutions to help that happen. We have a great product, fantastic feedback from the market, and are embarking on our next ambitious goal for the Singapore market- to be the top of mind for all employers looking to hire. To join us in that journey, we're looking for a driven and inspirational Head of Sales to grow and lead the sales team.  Job Description Reporting to the General Manager for Singapore, this role will be responsible for leading a team of account managers to hit aggressive growth targets. You will craft sales strategy together with the GM and lead your team to execute those strategies. As a sales leader, you enable, guide and grow your team members, and in building a strong team servicing our employers, establish FastJobs as a leading solution for employers.   The success of this role will be measured on the following criteria:  Team management and creating a robust culture Driving and optimising sales strategies based on data & feedback Sales target achievement & P&L management Engaging the key clients and providing the best solutions to address their business needs Client satisfaction, experience and retention Constructive collaboration with the rest of the FastJobs team  The Successful Applicant As a successful applicant, you will have:  8 years or more experience in B2B sales with at least 5 years in Singapore Minimum 2 years in a leadership role Expertise in crafting sales strategies to maximise limited resources Expertise in identifying, qualifying and closing business Strong collaborative player that believes in developing the strengths of the team Excellent attitude and strong communication skills An affinity to working in a build-test-learn environment  What's on Offer This is a challenging role aimed at individuals who are looking for a growth environment that rewards based on team success.

‘Looking for a hard core senior sales professional who can work tirelessly to join the mission to create a global company. The person will be responsible for generating sales leads and converting them into sales in South East Asia. Prior experience of selling financial market data platforms in Indonesia, Philippines, Malaysia, Singapore and Thailand is a must.

Bottomline is at the forefront of digital transformation. We are a growing global market leader uniquely equipped to address the changing needs of how businesses pay and get paid. Our culture of Working with and for each other enables us to delight our customers. We empower our teams to think like owners driving customer satisfaction, helping them grow their business and win in their markets.  We are looking for a Head of Business Development to innovate, win, and grow with us.  This role demands a qualification, or significant experience in the Financial Messaging and Payment solutions in a hosted environment. The candidate is expected to have qualification in Business Development, Economics, Finance or Marketing.  As Head of Business Development, the candidate should also possess the below soft skills: High-level communication skills Stakeholder management skills Proven ability to negotiate Experience with design and implementation of business development strategy Conflict resolution The ability to self-motivate and motivate a team Experience working to and exceeding target. Business Development Role Develop effective Sales strategy to acquire new customer for the Finance Messaging market in Singapore, Australia and South Pacific Region Build Strong Pipeline for the company hosted solution in Financial Messaging Account for at least SGD 500K in new business in each financial year Lead and managed large RFP responses to ensure corporate objectives for profitability, sustainability and operational delivery. Partner Channel Role Manage existing Partner/Distributor in setting sales quota and target. Supporting and assisting the Partners to achieve their sales target Cultivate new business partnerships and deepen existing relationships to drive business particularly in Australia, Malaysia and Thailand. Transform poor performing distributors into successful growing partners, through developing individual growth plans and participating in their execution. Bottomline is a participating employer in the Employment Verification (E-Verify) program EOE/AA/M/F/V/D/E-Verify Employer.  Bottomline Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  You’ll love Bottomline because in everything we do we seek to delight our customers and we are passionate about building a company of which we can all be proud, and this starts with building amazing teams filled with team members that challenge you every day.

description: Job Title:             APAC Sales Director, DCS Location:             Singapore Division:              Data Centre Solutions Reports to:         Senior Managing Director, Asia Pacific  CBRE Data Centre Solutions (DCS) is the world's leading full-service data centre services partner. We deliver superior uptime, innovation and intelligence for leading organizations worldwide. Our offering encompasses global strategy consulting, acquisition and disposal, project management and facilities management services. As an employer of choice, we invest heavily in our people offering industry-leading training and a dynamic working environment.  The APAC Head of Sales is responsible for the implementation of strategic direction and leadership of the DCS business development team in region. He/she is responsible for overseeing the team that will drive the sales process associated with new clients as well as the expansion and renewal of contracts associated with existing clients.  Emphasis is on growing market share across a diverse APAC market. Guides both direct and indirect reports in client service orientation and consultative sales as well as the effective, efficient and ethical operation of their respective teams or accounts. Builds a cohesive, diverse team dedicated to ongoing improvement of service delivery platform and client relationship.  Key Responsibilities:  Business Development: Analyzes financial performance indicators and related industry activity. Responsible for expanding client relationships/key markets to target as business growth opportunities. Collaborates with Senior Managing Director of the APAC DCS business and his leadership team to develop a concise plan to accomplish the retention and acquisition of clients, focusing on our value-add as “expert advisors” rather than “tactical or transaction specialists”. Meets business growth objectives consistently. Leads horizontal banding and integration strategy within the line of business and between all lines of business to maximize performance of the company’s platform.  Business Operations:  Builds strong business operations and sets specific, measurable, challenging yet achievable goals and objectives. Evaluates industry and business trends in market areas for potential impact on operations. Formulates, negotiates and executes contracts with the clients. Ensures consistency of service delivery that meets CBRE service delivery guidelines.  Financial Performance: Assists the leadership team in preparing short- and long-range plans, priorities, objectives and the annual budget. Responsible for meeting the sales targets of the DCS APAC business.  Leadership: Creates, communicates and monitors the vision, mission, strategy, objectives, business plan, budget, policies and operating plans. Serves as a change agent for business improvements. Develops buy-in and support for new initiatives and processes. Provides effective presentations to senior management, employees and prospects/clients. Serves as a key industry and division/line of business/company spokesperson to community.  Team Management: Provides for the recruitment, selection, performance management, development and retention of high caliber team to carry out the organization’s mission. Guides team in strengthening their competencies. Implements a career development and succession plan, along with an effective retention program for key personnel, while creating a more diverse organization. Recognizes expertise and empowers peers and employees to build a dynamic team that is viewed by others as highly productive, capable and the best in the industry.   Job Requirements: Education & Experience: Bachelor’s Degree (BA or BS) from four-year college or university required.  Approximately seven (7) or more years progressively responsible sales experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience, sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job. Possesses strong experience in managing a regional & diverse team. Has strong understanding of industry and facilities management. Fosters a strong service-orientation and an “advisory role” in client relationships. Uses ability to think strategically and to synthesize the most complex business and financial data. Utilizes an entrepreneurial approach and develops innovative solutions.  Financial Knowledge: Possess advanced financial skills and knowledge to review the complex financial reports prepared by others and to make recommendations to executives that impact division/line of business/company  Other Skills: A strong entrepreneurial and creative spirit. Some knowledge and understanding of all facets of facilities management, critical facilities / Data Centre industry knowledge and/or experience will be beneficial. High level of integrity and ethics is critical.
industries: Commercial Real Estate, Facilities Services, and Real Estate

description: The Regional Sales Director role is an individual-contributor role as an enterprise software seller, heavily focused on new business selling. Ideal candidates will be well-versed in communicating complex value propositions to large customer accounts in Southeast Asia. Preferably, candidates will have sold SaaS solutions to Accounting and Finance buyer groups.  The Regional Sales Director is responsible for obtaining new business from Executive level buyers and influencers in either private or publicly traded companies. Successful candidates will build relationships and identify Workiva products and services that meet customer needs to drive customer acquisition within a specific geography or industry. Sales growth is attained through new customer subscriptions, professional services, and set up and training.  What You’ll Do Prospects new business by conducting research to identify key decision makers and influencers within target accounts Works with Sales Development Representatives to generate initial customer interest to secure an introductory meeting Presents to Customers: Uses the facts found in the needs analysis phase to present a compelling demonstration of the Workiva suite of products and create a customer belief that they must have Workiva products Handles Objections: Skillfully probes for objections and removes obstacles or eliminates barriers to gain commitment; understands the difference between a stall and an objection Closes Sales: Naturally leads the sales process to a close by demonstrating Workiva superior value proposition Negotiates the Sale: Facilitates successful outcomes to optimize profits Reports Customer Contacts: Updates customer relationship management tools regularly and timely Forecasts Sales: Provides consistent and accurate forward-looking information though pipeline analysis Plans Sales Strategy: Plans and executes sales strategy with purposeful action to complete the sale Optimizes Internal Resources: Gathers internal support to pursue an account Prioritizes selling activities and follows through in a timely fashion Maintains a strong knowledge of Workiva products through a commitment to ongoing training  What You'll Need Understanding of the Software as a Service business model Ability to demonstrate various software applications Executive presence; ability to communicate at the most senior level Ability to identify and understand the power of influencers versus buyers and how to navigate the nuances of each during sales cycle. Ability to manage multiple transactions at one time Ability to manage multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously Ability to negotiate pricing with a focus on retaining value 8+ years of solution selling to Executives - Software as a Service model preferred B.A./B.S. degree preferred Depending on assigned work location, walking outdoors between company campus facilities in a variety of weather conditions may be necessary to perform responsibilities of this position Works virtually, residing in the territory 30% travel for regular customer meetings and sales calls Fluency in English is required. Additional fluency in Mandarin, Cantonese, Thai, Malay and/or Bahasa Indonesia a plus.  Where You’ll Work  Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created. Customer Success: Always delight our customers. Trust: Rely on each other. Integrity: Do the right thing, every time. Collaboration: Share resources and work together. Innovation: Keep creating solutions and finding better ways. Inclusion: Support a diverse community where we all belong. Accountability: Be responsible for your success and failure.  We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.  At Workiva, you’ll enjoy: Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office. Involvement: Ability to participate in Employee Resource Groups, (Women in Tech, Women in Sales, Ethnic Diversity, Veterans, Rainbow (LGBTQ), Remote Employees, Caregiving) Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and more Work-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.  Learn more: http://https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/workiva-life-and-careers/  Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic.  Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Coverage: South East Asia & Pacific (SEAPAC) regions covering 12 countries. Identify business opportunities and generate profitable sales in both new and existing accounts that meet and exceed new business revenue goals relating to the portfolio of customers assigned and payable in SEAPAC region. Ability to understand unique customer supply chain requirements in High Tech, and/or Automotive and/or Consumer Retail sector and drive particular customer solutions. Retention is mission critical to the role. Senior relationship management and service execution are two key components to insure account retention is achieved. Retain, grow portfolio of accounts across all product/service types within CEVA. Drive collaborative efforts between country and product leaders within CEVA to meet the needs of customers in region. Prospecting for all potential opportunities and delivering compelling solutions, value and pricing Develop and execute an Account Plan for the customer that will encompass a strategic roadmap defining multi-year growth, targets by key supply chain (forecasts, budgets and operating plans). Ability to work in a matrix organization along with virtual teams & build strong internal relationships with Sponsor/Global/Regional/Sector team leaders as required for the account. Build strategic relationships with key contacts within customer organizations to understand opportunities for creating value. Conduct regular business review meetings for all customers and drive meeting content to ensure operations, support and execution teams are present to support these reviews. Conduct quarterly business review (QBR) meetings including executive sessions for strategic alignment between CEVA and the customer. Responsible to communicate all expectations on these review meetings to the operations and support teams for implementation or improvements. Develop a deep understanding of business streams of each customer and a detailed Relationship Map for each Account designated using CEVA’s CRM system. Leverage on Sectors Focused Solutions to penetrate account growth and development (example: Use of case studies and key solutions within CEVA) Work with implementation teams on new projects to ensure customer expectations are communicated. Work to define all customer reporting requirements with customer (Country/Regional/Global Levels and all KPI (Service Metrics) with customers to be reviewed in business meetings conducted.  Education & Qualifications A good degree majoring in supply chain/logistics/transportation management/sales and marketing/international business  Experience In-depth knowledge of all air, sea, ground and contract logistics products and services. Excellent planning, time management, collaboration, decision making, organization, presentation and negotiating skills. Experienced in financial management (P&L's, Balance Sheets, forecasting and budgets) to effectuate return on investment. Manages complex or emotional customer situations promptly and professionally meeting commitments for service and assistance. Maintains stable performance under pressure or opposition; handling stress in a manner that is acceptable to others and the organization. Uses appropriate methods and a flexible interpersonal style to help build a cohesive team and facilitates the completion of team goals. Good presentation skills.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: This is a career-defining opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing tech company that is successfully implementing key building pieces of the world’s blockchain infrastructure that will power the digital agreements of the future.  Our ambitions are limitless, and we believe this open source technology will change the world.  In this leadership position which reports to the Head of Sales, you will work directly with our CEO, CMO, and your BD and Sales colleagues to help grow the adoption of Chainlink's leading blockchain technology across DeFi, decentralized insurance, blockchain gaming, and other decentralized application verticals.  Manage a Time Zone Team That Is Responsible For Onboarding and growing quality blockchain projects to Chainlink solutions and services Providing post-sales account management to drive product usage and customer satisfaction Build a world-class sales pipeline; executing effectively on each phase of the process Close deals in collaboration with colleagues from legal, engineering, marketing and product Identify, negotiate, and sign deals with new partners ranging from emerging startups to multi-billion dollar organizations  Requirements Professional Sales Management or Business Development Management experience Experience in blockchain / crypto space and conviction that it has the power to change the world for the better Exceptional track record of meeting goals, closing partnerships and deals in the blockchain industry Skilled at communicating with senior executives Our Principles  At Chainlink Labs, we’re committed to the key operating principles of ownership, focus, and open dialogue. We practice complete ownership, where everyone goes the extra mile to own outcomes into success. We understand that unflinching focus is a superpower and is how we channel our activity into technological achievements for the benefit of our entire ecosystem. We embrace open dialogue and critical feedback to arrive at an accurate and truthful picture of reality that promotes both personal and organizational growth.  About Chainlink Labs  Chainlink is the industry standard oracle network for connecting smart contracts to the real world. With Chainlink, developers can build hybrid smart contracts that combine on-chain code with an extensive collection of secure off-chain services powered by Decentralized Oracle Networks. Managed by a global, decentralized community of hundreds of thousands of people, Chainlink is introducing a fairer model for contracts. Its network currently secures billions of dollars in value for smart contracts across the decentralized finance (DeFi), insurance, and gaming ecosystems, among others. The full vision of the Chainlink Network can be found in the Chainlink 2.0 whitepaper. Chainlink is trusted by hundreds of organizations—from global enterprises to projects at the forefront of the blockchain economy—to deliver definitive truth via secure, reliable data.  This role is location agnostic anywhere in the world, but we ask that you overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).  We are a fully distributed team and have the tools and benefits to support you in your remote work environment.  Chainlink Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: HipVan, a leading home & living e-commerce company, is looking for an experienced and driven Business Development Director. The prime responsibility of the director will be to increase company revenue and profit by developing and implementing long-term growth strategies. The ideal candidate has strong experience in B2C e-commerce, leading cross-functional teams, and exposure to working with various teams such as digital marketing, product management, and merchandising.  Responsibilities Develop long-term cross-functional growth strategies Analyze existing product usage to inform future growth plans. Take ownership of growth-oriented KPIs Developing and managing strategic partnerships to grow business. Work with the product team to devise strategies for product-led growth Conduct monthly and quarterly reviews to find sources for growth Assessing marketing and sales as well as supplier and vendor operations and recommending improvements as needed Lead and mentor other team members Researching emerging trends and devise new company offerings Requirements 5+ years experience in B2C e-commerce Proven record of driving revenue growth at scale Strong business acumen Exceptional leadership and management skills

jobTitle: Head of Sales, APAC (Remote - APAC Region)
description: We’re looking for open-minded individuals who want to expand the ways technology can help people. We work fast, collaborate, and celebrate as a team. We’re united by a commitment to shaping Tile’s culture around the needs of our colleagues and customers, and by our desire to build a diverse and welcoming workplace.  We are looking for a Head of Sales, APAC to grow our Tile retail business in the Asia-Pacific region. This person will be responsible for achieving APAC retail sales targets by finding new business opportunities and driving our distributor and retail relationships. In this role, the APAC Retail Sales Leader will manage a small, but growing, team and work closely with our marketing and operations teams in the US to ensure optimal in-store and online experiences for Tile products. This leader must be willing to be involved with the entire sales process while we scale the business and the team. This position reports to the Global Sales Leader and requires regular meetings with executive level staff in the US (via zoom) and travel (when safe to do so) within the APAC region.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Direct sales efforts for APAC retail business, owning distribution relationships and developing key retailer relationships Meet/exceed sales targets while carefully tracking channel inventory levels Lead annual business planning and sales strategy for APAC Lead investigation and execution of new business opportunities for our hardware including partnerships, new retail channels and new countries Provide regular sales forecasting, updating twice monthly, ensure accuracy Ensure timely and accurate sell through and inventory data is provided to headquarters team Conduct QBR meetings with distribution partners and key cross functional partners internally to review business, priorities and opportunities Hire, develop and train a strong sales team. Ensure the team is executing on plans, discovering new opportunities and are developing in their careers Partner with the channel marketing team on in-store and online merchandising needs as well as budget updates for channel and promotional spends Provide competitive market and sales performance updates monthly during international monthly meetings with the headquarters team Partner with the marketing team to ensure we are appropriately building out awareness and consideration for the region. Advocate for what is needed, help make connections to in-region agencies or resources Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 10-15 years of APAC sales experience, as well as recent experience leading and driving a regional strategy Strong management and leadership skills leading a remote sales team Experience in Consumer Electronics, Consumer Goods, or Sporting Goods industries Experience working for a US-based company Experience managing retail and distribution partner relationships Strong relationships with retailers and distributors Excellent problem-solving skills, analytical approach Proven ability to operate well in a matrixed organization and with a Excellent communication skills - can communicate effectively with all levels of management Fluent in English required Location: Candidate must be located in the APAC region, potential locations (but not limited to): Singapore, Hong Kong, Shanghai Benefits Own equity in the company - every employee is a stakeholder in our future Work with an adept team of people who love what they do Flexible work program Remote work environment To learn more about Tile, click here to be directed to our careers page!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
industries: Consumer Services

description: A Head of Sales job has become available at one of the most exciting start-ups in the e-commerce and manufacturing space.  About The Head Of Sales Role  Reporting to the CEO, you will be driving the overall sales strategy for the APAC region. You will also be setting up teams from scratch.  Key Responsibilities Drive overall sales strategy for the APAC region Leverage sales acumen and relationship-building skills to convert leads, acquire new customers, as well as maintain relationships and optimise the service for existing customers Manage the entire sales development life cycle, utilising strong knowledge of the plastics space whilst developing a sales funnel to improve conversion at all stages Effectively grow and manage the customer base which will consist of large, medium and small businesses across multiple verticals Closely collaborate with internal stakeholders across the business such as the Chief Executive Officer, Head of Supply & Logistics to provide market intelligence from customers and give key input into product considerations Lead and mentor a team of Sales Executives spread across the region, with a focus on building an autonomous team of individual contributors that can effectively source, negotiate and execute on new business The successful candidate should have a good understanding of the plastics industry and should have relevant direct sales experience as well as relationship management experience with key customers.  Key Requirements A degree in business At least 10 years of sales and account management experience in the plastics/chemicals space Proven track record of leading sales teams Strong leadership skills, setting effective sales targets whilst also empowering an autonomous cross-disciplinary team First-hand experience with a high-volume product Strong stakeholder engagement skills Work for one of the world's most exciting start-ups in the e-commerce and manufacturing space. Backed by a global chemical conglomerate with a deep understanding of the plastics ecosystem and value chain, this Head of Sales role is an opportunity to be part of a brand new venture in a plastics marketplace.  If you have an entrepreneurial streak and would like to be part of a disruptive e-commerce business in a traditional industry, this Head of Sales role is for you.  Apply today or contact me to discuss further.  Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.  Robert Walters (Singapore) Pte Ltd  ROC No.: 199706961E | EA Licence No.: 03C5451  EA Registration No.: R1109068 LingXiang Lee

description: Navagis is a Google Cloud Premier Partner based in the US with offices in San Francisco, Japan, Singapore, and the Philippines. Navagis is a Location Intelligence company that empowers organizations to leverage geospatial information to efficiently run their multiple operations via web and mobile applications. Navagis software solutions are built using Google Maps and Google Cloud technologies and open systems to integrate various information sources into a map-driven common operating picture for the entire enterprise.  To expand our APAC operations, we are in need of a Senior Sales Director to join our fast-growing team.  If you are an independent problem solver, have a strong drive to excel, and are looking for an opportunity to grow fast and to make a big impact, this is the right place for you.  Your Role: Identify, qualify and close new customer sales opportunities to generate sales revenues that meet or exceed assigned goals Collaborate with the leadership team to define our overall sales strategy to develop products and solutions responsive to the customer’s business Conducts introductory and high-level presentations including the demonstration of Navagis solution Work closely with Partners to build a network of contacts in Navagis’ key market verticals, to produce opportunities Forecasts business and sales pipeline as required, updating management on the status of all prospects, in-process sales cycles and potential revenue Conducts continuous prospecting activities and build a sales pipeline sufficient to support the achievement of sales revenue goals Delivers timely technical and administrative product and solution information to create long-term, ongoing business relationships to set the stage for future opportunities Work with Project Manager(s) during implementation to ensure communication is handled Serve alongside the technical team to ensure direction is presented to potential partners, customers and/or investors Stay in the loop during implementation to build a successful track record with the customer base Understand customer’s challenges and objectives to help them achieve them. Travel throughout assigned territory and beyond, as required Maintain closeness with customers and the market through frequent interactions as well as serving as the primary executive contact for high-value deals, escalations, and prospect/customer issues Develop and implement go-to-market and sales operations best practices and processes that will enable rapid scaling and ensure sales discipline  Requirements Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Marketing, Sales and/or any related courses 7 years of relevant enterprise-scales sales experience in technology, software Proven track record of consistently meeting and/or exceeding sales performance metrics: i.e., quotas, pipeline, forecast accuracy, etc. Demonstrated proficiency in managing complex sales cycles typically defined as six months or longer with multiple stakeholders, decision-makers and influencers at multiple levels Track record of success by consistently exceeding performance metrics Demonstrate effective oral and written communication skills especially in the ability to present concepts and articulate business value Display a sense of creativity and innovation, with integrity and respect for others Amenable to travel to the Philippines and other APAC countries if needed  Benefits Highly flexible and Long Term environment. Our Executive Team is mostly comprised of Ex-Googlers. We work hard and have fun while doing it! We have a active international community. We also offer comprehensive benefits in all the countries we operate in. Our employees develop and support high-end solutions. Every day, we push technical boundaries to advance the field of Location Intelligence. We believe mapping is essential to the world and we are extremely dedicated when it comes to quality and performance. Learn from the BEST and make a difference. Our team is composed of some of the best engineers in the world. As a young dynamic company, the work you do will make a big difference. At Navagis, you will be surrounded by top talent who have years of experience in mapping and cloud infrastructure, deep learning, and more.

description: Description  Job ID: 22-497  Come Join Our Passionate Team! At Barracuda, we make the world a safer place. We believe every business deserves access to cloud-enabled, enterprise-grade security solutions that are easy to buy, deploy, and use. We protect email, networks, data, and applications with innovative solutions that grow and adapt with our customers’ journey. More than 220,000 organizations worldwide trust Barracuda to protect them — in ways they may not even know they are at risk — so they can focus on taking their business to the next level.  We know a diverse workforce adds to our collective value and strength as an organization. Barracuda Networks is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to equal employment opportunity and equitable compensation regardless of race, gender, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability.  Envision yourself at Barracuda!  Barracuda Networks is looking to expand its sales leadership in the APAC Region as the company moves to the next phase of its growth evolution.  The team comprises of End User Touch and Channel Sales combined with a Pre-Sales Engineering. The region has been growing for the last number of years and we require a Senior Leader to develop and drive the sales strategy to accelerate this growth and bring scale and leadership to the team.  We are looking for an individual that brings a combination of skills in developing and executing sales strategies that cover market segments from SMB to Mid Enterprise end user customers. Additionally, this person will bring experience in doing business, not only in a traditional perpetual license model but also has experience of SaaS solutions and monthly billing models.  The role is based in Singapore and you will have strong, proven leadership capabilities that demonstrate your ability to lead and motivate a team to exceed targets. You will report to the VP Sales, APAC and be a member of the APAC Sales Leadership Team.  What You Will Be Working On Act as a strong sales leader for Barracuda Networks in Southeast Asia to maximize revenue opportunities across the region and develop the region’s channel business. Drive, meet and exceed monthly and quarterly balanced business results while building a long-term sustainable business to deliver revenue and market share growth, while balancing short- and medium-term objectives. Generate new ideas and innovative approaches to accelerate the development of the business in the Region. Implement corporate and APAC strategies and objectives, adapting and building execution plans for the region. Ensure the region develops and maintains strong sales pipeline growth across all product and market segments. Drive operational excellence across Southeast Asia. Manage Talent: Recruit, hire, develop, retain top talent and build a strong talent pipeline. Establish strong relationships with key partners in the region, including channel partners and ISV partners. Work closely with marketing to develop programs and activities across the region to drive channel development and lead generation programs. Play a hands-on role with key relationships in both our partner and end-user eco-system. Remain current on medium- and long-term security marketplace trends. Monitor competitor activity and anticipates market changes. Manage forecasting activities, preparing internal reports for management, month-end bookings, develop understanding and strategies to minimise churn, setting strategy and tactical approaches for maximizing new business sales and renewals retention rates across the APAC Region. What You Will Bring To The Role A solid understanding and experience of the cybersecurity markets, with experience selling SaaS solutions. Demonstrable sales leadership with multimillion $ targets. Act as an integral part of the APAC Management Team, contributing with innovative ideas, sharing success cases and practices and leading by example. Proven track record as a sales leader with the ability to build, lead, motivate and manage both managers and sales reps. Deep Experience in managing a business of both End User Touch end user sales combined with a strong channel sales background. Must be willing to travel in the region. Ability to set stretching goals and manage deliverables and priorities. Provide performance management oversight, to ensure our teams are inspected, targeted, measured and held accountable for deliverables. Ability to lead on commercial negotiations, ensuring we profitably grow revenues and margins across all opportunities. Bring proven relationships with customers, partners and key market players. Inspiring & motivating others through well-executed communications and ability to lead and motivate a diverse team. Building strong partner and customer relationships, to increase Barracuda’s mindshare and establish Barracuda as one of their key business partners. Improve performance through a focus on people and organizational development, as well as talent attraction, succession planning and retention of RSA talent. You will be a strategic thinker, able to translate this into executable plans for your team and deliver a vision for the region. Strong Business Acumen and a clear track record of driving execution, delivering operational Excellence in the field. You will possess a clear Sales Presence and be an inspirational sales and people leader with strong influencing and skills What You Will Get From Us A great work environment, working as part of an international leadership team, , interacting with customers across the your Region. Autonomy to lead your team to achieve the best results. Uncapped Earnings, including bonus elements and accelerators on over-achievement of targets A thorough on-boarding program, enabling you to understand and learn the Barracuda product portfolio Career growth opportunities – we train and develop our team to grow within Barracuda A great social environment, with regular social events. We know a diverse workforce adds to our collective value and strength as an organization. Barracuda Networks is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to equal employment opportunity and equitable compensation regardless of race, gender, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer & Network Security, and Security and Investigations

description: Regional Head of Sales – Middle East (based in Singapore)  A leading global player in online payments, seeks an experienced, driven, and ambitious sales leader to oversee their team focused on the Middle East market.  You will be responsible for building and managing a team, and growing the business - identifying and developing new business opportunities, and negotiating agreements with key external stakeholders , merchants, and business partners. You will be expert in the Middle East region and be able to draw upon and demonstrate a proven track record of revenue growth through direct sales and capturing market / growth opportunities. You will be work cross-functionally with other senior stakeholders and leaders in the organization and take a leading role in building strategic relationships with key leaders in merchant organizations and partners at the C-level and driving pipeline activity in the region for both sales and market development. The business and e-commerce landscape across the Middle East is experiencing hypergrowth, and the role presents an opportunity to drive growth in the region.  Responsibilities: Define and implement the business strategy to drive and maximize growth for the Middle East market and establish the firm as the leading PSP in the cross-border payment space. Identify new business growth opportunities and clearly articulate the benefits which can be driven. Take responsibility for the overall P&L of the business including establishing business and revenue goals and strategies. Build a high-performance sales team capable of delivering and exceeding targets.  Manage the sales pipeline and drive discipline around prospecting and onboarding new customers, as well as relationship -based growth of existing portfolio.  Drive “operational excellence” by leveraging regional infrastructure to maximize efficiency and synergy of the organizations. Represent the company both internally and externally to communicate key business objectives, build partnerships and seek resources. Partner with all affiliates to cross/up-sell user for merchandise as well as payment volume.  Qualifications & Experience: An experienced “Hunter” with a proven track record of commercial success, both individually and as the developer and leader of teams. Direct sales focus from working for Payment Gateways, Wallets, or Merchant Acquiring in Banks/ Financial Services. Experience of growing Sales teams within a start-up / scale-up business is advantageous. You should not have sold through partners or channels, rather you will be able to demonstrate a history of closing deals with merchants directly. Appropriate industry knowledge of payments and eCommerce. People leadership experience leading and building high-performance sales teams Must have an excellent command of both verbal and written English. Proficiency of one of the commonly used languages in the region is highly desirable, but not necessary.  Interested?         Please contact me to talk in strictest confidence - Andrew Cook | +44 (0) 7801 953 663 | andrew.cook@head-count.com
industries: Banking and Financial Services

jobTitle: VP of Sales APAC - Exciting Global SaaS Vendor
description: The organisation I am working with has continued to grow on a global scale due to their innovative SaaS solutions. They are headquartered in the US, have won multiple awards for their culture, have continued to expand during covid-19 as their products help solve some of the biggest video challenges the world currently faces. As they are now looking to enter their next phase of growth, they now require an experienced VP of Sales - APAC to join their business and help develop and growth the business in the region.  This VP will be a high-level business executive with strategic insight and in-depth experience leading multi-disciplinary teams across the region. This person is expected to have a proven track record of successful of driving sales teams, strong leadership experience and a drive and passion for growing a business.  This role can be based in either Singapore, Hong Kong of Australia.  Responsibilities  Provide tactical and strategic leadership to the APAC region to drive growth and margins. Directly lead the sales team across the region and work closely with cross function teams such as Sales Development, Marketing, Operations and Customer Success. Develop and executive go-to-market strategies to drive business. Ensure the development of a sales and services operation with a strong focus on people management, team motivation, new logos and hiring new employees. Represent the company at the highest level in the region to customer and partner organisations whilst maintaining a hands-on presence in the field. Have a clear understanding of the evolving market and trends to ensure the correct decision making on strategy is being implemented. Be the spokesperson for the vendor in the APAC region. Partner with the executive team globally to define strategies and programs in increase revenue growth.  Required Experience  A successful history of managing a sales team including hiring, onboarding and developing enterprise level sales talent. Experience in the software/SaaS industry is a must. Advantageous if you have experience working for a Video, HCM, LMS, E-Learning or similar company. Proven track record of meeting revenue and margin commitments. Success leading go-to-market strategies targeting new customers and markets. A disciplined sales methodology and process as well as proven success growing a business. Ability to drive and secure new deals as well as create new partnerships and programs across multiple countries. A natural influencing style with effective verbal and written communication skills. He or she should expect travel  Package  A competitive package will be on offer for the successful candidate based on their skills and experience.  If this sounds like you then please apply now!  To see more jobs and updates follow Kaliba on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/kaliba

jobTitle: Director of Sales and Business Development APAC
description: COMPANY  Janes enables militaries, governments and defence companies to make critical decisions. Our expert-driven tradecraft, developed over 120 years, combined with human-machine teaming, delivers assured open-source intelligence across military capabilities and order of battle, equipment, events, countries, companies and markets.  Linking millions of assured data points, Janes data model creates a framework of interconnected open-source defence intelligence. This allows our customers to integrate all relevant data and connections into a single intelligence environment to deliver a more complete and accurate answer. Using Janes, our customers can use their scarce resource more effectively, to get to better decisions with higher confidence, more quickly.   JOB PURPOSE  Janes is searching for a Director of Sales & Business Development for the APAC region. This is a key leadership role in developing and executing the Janes business strategy for the APAC region, and will be focused on managing a team of sales and business development executives.   The key mission of the team is to renew existing business with customers and grow revenue through upsells at existing customers and new customer acquisition. The leader will be responsible for providing cross-functional leadership and be able to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.   HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AT JANES  Develop and execute detailed strategy and business plan for retaining and growing Janes APAC business while understanding Janes overall strategic direction. Ensure the team is building and maintaining qualified pipeline of opportunities to hit targeted growth. Develop the sales team’s skills through active coaching, account and opportunity reviews, and participation in customer meetings. Establish consistent account management process to ensure high rate of retention and upsell for current customers. Screen and qualify opportunities to determine probability to win (PWin) and make Bid/No Bid decisions. Direct sales forecasting activities and set performance goals accordingly. Track, measure, and report progress and performance to Janes Senior Leadership team. Continuously analyse market strategies/efforts and pipeline opportunities to  develop strategic partnership relationships Supportive leader to get involved and coach to close/help team close new business.  THE IDEAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE FOR THIS ROLE ARE  Proven successful leadership experience within Sales/Business Development. Previous experience in Defence and/or Intelligence Community either selling to this customer base and/or being employed directly in the community. Strong knowledge of cultural norms across the APAC region.  Ability to coach and guide team on successful strategies to employ for success. Proven ability to work in cross-functional and resource constrained environment. Experience developing, managing, and leading sales and business development teams. Ability to coach and develop talent and create high-performing teams. Passion to succeed and achieve meaningful business results with a strong sense of accountability and ownership; strong organisation, prioritisation, and persuasive communication skills. Strategic thinker balanced with strong attention to detail. High-energy, results-oriented, creative leadership approach.   For successful candidates, Janes provides a supportive, stretching and dynamic environment with the ability for you to grow rapidly both personally and professionally.   We value diversity at Janes and are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. We welcome applicants regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, race, colour, religious beliefs, disability, sexual orientation and age.

Brief Profile: The Head – Business Development will be responsible for developing key growth sales plans, tactics and action plans for successful execution of strategies required to achieve the organizations financial targets.  Job Description:     Understanding the supply demand dynamics of the services we provide globally, network with key industry players, and major customers in particular.     Aware  of  major infrastructure projects  in  the  world  (construction of  port  terminals, jetty,  other  major  marine infrastructure) that are currently at  the planning and  bidding stage, that requires movement of aggregates via barges/dry bulk vessels, etc..     Maintain close relationship with the key decision makers and next in-line of major infrastructure companies (Cement companies, building material companies, Infrastructure companies) to achieve closure of sale.   Developing proficiency in all areas of shipping sales, industry concepts, theories and maritime case studies/ news.    Search, webinars to keep self-up to date on industry/ market news and client/ customer/ decision maker specific news and updates.     Build strong network with key decision makers, existing and retired files, spreadsheets and CRMs) as well as plan, strategize and define next action points.    Set up meetings, create/ demonstrate client presentations, proposals, negotiate best rates/ contracts and other routine sales modalities.    Organize regular/ periodic and situation specific sales meetings with seniors and management.   Maintain, track and regularly update sales pipeline dashboards.   Innovate new techniques and methods to increase sales, revenue and profit margins.   Train, direct and supervise a sales team, if assigned by Management.   Coordinate the operations of the sales department across the globe by establishing goals and monitoring the volume of sales.   Prepare and review progress reports, which will help determine sales potential, customer needs, and the pricing of products or services.  Qualification, Experience & Competencies:    MBA in Marketing and Bachelor’s Degree in any discipline    Minimum 10 years work relevant work experience    Exemplary leader with excellent time and team management skills, multi-tasker, consultative thought process and analytical mind-set.   Proficient in using latest systems, computers/ technologies, desktop/ laptops, peripherals, mobiles, software’s and applications.   Existing connections, strong network and associations in shipping/ maritime industry globally.   Fully aware of key players, competition, local and global companies in Maritime Security, Tug & Barge Ops, UTG, Underwater Services, Offshore, Chartering and Dry Docking among other technical services.   Go-getter,  multitasker,  flexible  and  adapts  quickly  to  new  and  challenging  environment of  fact  paced  growing organization.  KPI’s:  Revenue growth 60% Revenue per client, increase by 10% per quarter Opportunity-to-Win Ratio: Number of wins / closed deals per quarter Pricing Against Competitors / Market Intelligence: Aware of their pricing to create a competitive strategy – 100% accuracy  New clients and Client retention rate 20% Existing Client Engagement 0 oversight Maintain good rapport with customers after the sale is complete 0 lapse MIS for Customer satisfaction survey: Every quarter New client engagement rate 20% increase per quarter  Social Media Management 10% Generate leads by constant display/ promotion of our services & updates on social media for brand interaction.  People Management, self and team development 10% Self: Attend seminars / webinars 1 every 6 months for industry trends, networking and insights Network within the industry for exposure and client reach Team Training and development: Each team member to complete minimum 1 per year seminars, courses applicable to line of work. 100% of appraisals completed for the team Team retention rate – 80%

First Digital Trust is looking for an experienced Head of Business Development to lead our sales and partnership efforts. The role is responsible for leading and running all aspects of the business development process, from lead identification and qualification to developing deep market analyses, exploring new revenue models, and creating strategic business partnerships. Outstanding presentation and negotiation skills are required as well as the ability to close US$100k+ deals and maintain year-over-year growth of over 30%. Of particular interest are candidates with an excellent grasp of the blockchain and digital assets industry and the cultural trends of the crypto community.  Responsibilities:  Deliver and manage a sales and business development strategy that aligns with the company's direction for growth, revenue, and profit Lead the pipeline of opportunities, prioritize according to growth value, and deliver timely reporting on sales funnel and progress towards goals to the leadership team, broader team, and other senior leaders Produce incremental value from ongoing strategic relationships and identify, structure, negotiate and close significant new strategic partnership opportunities and sophisticated deals with strategic partners, such as (but not limited to) tech providers, banks, money service businesses, and other financial intermediaries Identify, lead and negotiate key deals from end-to-end (from due diligence to contract negotiations and post-deal management) with cross-functional input aligned to business/service strategy. Overseeing the day to day management and mentoring of the business development team Explore and implement new possible revenue streams as well as develop new business models Work closely with the CEO, marketing, and product teams on deal structures and product strategy. This will include an ongoing focus on discovery around the products, pricing, recurring revenue opportunities, and more Influence and connect with key internal partners, including regional country heads, brands, and the strategic team at HQ, including Finance, Legal, Marketing, and Product teams. Act as a brand ambassador - attend conferences, panels, and events where you advocate for FDT  Experience & Proficiencies:  University Degree in Business Administration, Marketing or Finance desired At least 5-10 years of deal-making experience, with a solid understanding of and exposure to the financial services industry or another high growth tech environment Business level proficiency in English and a second language Executive presence with outstanding presentation, communication, and consultative selling skills Experience working with financial institutions, Banks, and Broker/Dealers, Exchanges, and Asset Management partners is a plus. Excellent organizational and project planning/leadership skills coupled with the ability to operate in an ambiguous environment or unstructured situations with a high degree of autonomy People-oriented and a great teammate combined with entrepreneurial skills Excellent analytical and finance skills with a good understanding of contract law with the ability to work in a self-directed manner Proven track record of adapting to new environments and working effectively with people from all levels and from a diverse group of backgrounds through excellent influencing and adaptable communication skills – comfortable making pitches to the board and C-suite and skilled at developing relations with key stakeholders.

Work with marketing to identify and strategize new markets, Develop sales plan to maximize sales revenue for assigned markets (primarily Singapore, and other South-east Asian countries), Ensure a healthy pipeline of leads, Provide leadership and coaching to sales team, Ensure renewal of subscriptions, Participate in product demonstrations and events, Develop executive level relationship with customers and associations, Innovate to increase productivity of sales processes, Monitor and manage collection of overdue payments. As you may be communicating with partners from China and Hong Kong, proficiency in Mandarin and Cantonese is essential.  Salary: OTE SGD 130,000 per annum.

About Capgemini  The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Account Executive (Banking) (Director)  Account Executive develops and owns the relationship within assigned account to maximize Capgemini’s footprint within them. Incumbents effectively collaborate with other extended teams to formulate go-to-market strategies and drive growth. Your focus will be helping our clients deliver results against some of their most complex business and technology initiatives in Financial Services. The Account Executive will partner with and ensure the long-term success of our clients. Different projects could challenge you to succeed as a highly consultative senior management advisor or to drive highly visible technical projects based on your planning, execution, and client relationship management skills.   Expand sales within existing accounts while building relationships with key decision makers. Develop & execute a comprehensive business plan, including identifying core customer requirements and mapping Capgemini’s solutions to them. Establish collaborative partnership with key stakeholders to assess and recommend optimal business and technical solutions. Accountable for accurate forecasting, regular revenue delivery, and the implementation of agreed account and business plans. Maximize brand recognition and mindshare at all levels, and publicizes success stories. Provide customer feedback to internal stakeholders for solutions and process improvements. At this level, incumbents will have expert-level knowledge of selling the solutions within financial services market. Incumbents routinely sell-to and interact with executive-level customer decision makers, to include up to CXO levels.  Key Requirements  8+ years of professional experience Experience in shaping & structuring sales proposals in Consulting or IT Services solutions, preferably in Financial Services space. Experience in selling Digital Solutions, Transformation / M&A projects, preferred Expert-level presentation, customer service, financial/business acumen, and negotiation skills at all levels of customer engagement. Complete, “big-picture” understanding of the business and technical contexts of the account. Driven, self-starter who exudes leadership on account set and compels others to get on board. Fully adept at consultative effectiveness and establishing trust with internal and external customers.

description: Job Description & Requirements  About Sun Wealth Group  Sun Wealth Group is a global enterprise with Singapore as its headquarter. Our business covers SEA – Malaysia, India, Thailand, Vietnam, and other countries. Our business focuses on asset and investment advisory, fintech, new energy, health, and wellness business. Asset and investment advisory includes fund management, family offices, company listings, corporate mergers, and acquisitions. The health and wellness business includes health care products, bioengineering, and medical equipment.  Our vision is to discover values for investment and to empower dreams for people and support communities.  Responsibilities Organize and lead the Fund Sales team, make a proper direction to ensure all needs are met as it pertains to the team and individual KPI’s objectives. Take the initiative to develop and expand customers, manage the development of the marketing team，drive revenue, and team performance. Report to key decision-makers to identify and close profitable sales management and data analytics engagements in the target markets. Communicate with the product manager the differentiated offering, and help the product manager enhance market standing. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Development or Business. Minimum 5 years of experience in asset sale management. Rich sales channels and customer resources. A team player with a strong sense of responsibility & self-motivation to get tasks done independently. Pioneering, innovative, and Self-driven executives. Good communication, writing, and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in both English and Mandarin. Remuneration can be negotiated.

Objective Of The Role  The goal for this position is to drive exponential growth by boosting the lead generation of startups across APAC. You will have full ownership of the outreach strategy in your vertical to become the number one financial operating system for startups in the region. The core responsibilities will be to hire/train/manage a Business Development team, develop a robust lead strategy and work closely with the commercial management team to launch new products that fit customers requirements.  As the Head of BD for our FX vertical, you will be reporting and working closely with the Head of Sales. Your mission will be to make Aspire the #1 Financial OS for startups in APAC.  Your Responsibilities Growing our FX vertical as a standalone business unit with well-defined performance targets in terms of growth Build, manage and train a business development team of overachievers focused on cross border payers. Keeping a tab on latest developments in the industry and identify growth opportunities for the company Identify new sales and marketing opportunities for new products, features and customer acquisition channels Work along with sales teams to ensure that we deliver on the performance targets committed to our investors Track, measure, and report progress and performance to the head of sales We would love to get to know you if you have the following: 7-10 years of experience spanning business development, sales, for a card provider (Amex/Visa/Mastercard) or payment gateway (PayPal/Braintree,Shopify, etc.) Successful track record of hitting ambitious targets and possesses a wide network of digital companies across Singapore Experience in hunting B2B companies in South East Asia and digital companies in particular would be an advantage Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can coach / mentor their sales team while establishing a healthy working culture based on the Aspire principle Exceptional communication and collaboration capabilities Ability to coach and guide teams on successful strategies to employ for success. High-energy, results-oriented, creative leadership approach.

description: Director Business Development, GlobalData Disruptor Team Singapore  GlobalData is the gold standard business information provider to the world’s largest industries, we continuously collect and analyze terabytes of data to create the most comprehensive, authoritative, and granular market intelligence. We leverage the collective expertise of our in-house research analysts, consultants, and journalists, as well as thousands of external thought-leaders, to create differentiated and actionable insight. We have over 4,000 worldwide clients in 16 industry sectors including pharma, technology, finance, and retail. There are over 3,400 of us at GlobalData and we’re growing fast. Over the last five years, we’ve made over 20 acquisitions.  We’re gearing up for an exciting and fast-paced next phase in our expansion and we’re looking for the right people to join us and help make it happen. We’re investing significantly in new Products and Cutting-edge Business Solutions and are looking for a business development director who understand how technology is reshaping the future and its impact on business ecosystem.  GlobalData is currently looking for an enthusiastic Business Development Director as an addition to our growing global sales team, representing the GlobalData Disruptive Team . Candidate needs to have a strong track record of nurturing clients and building bespoke, complex solutions for large enterprise clients, and an independent worker based out of our Singapore Office.   What we are looking for in the candidate:  10+ years B2B sales experience (with at least 3 years proven track record of consistently initiating & closing deals), of driving client outreach initiatives with tenacity and persuasiveness to make a direct revenue impact Experience in selling data-driven SaaS solutions to the Corporate Strategy, Innovation, M&A/VC, Digital Transformation teams across sectors Comfortable with aligning client’s ambiguous business challenges with the features of Disruptor IC– which helps clients identify critical information on emergence of digital natives, promising start-ups, technology led innovations, latest sector trends, consumer insights, and venture capital portfolio investments – and help them covert Disruptor into success Capable of managing long sales timelines (3-6 months) and consistently ‘nurturing’ leads. description: Today, most countries across the world lack access to the internet and with that, the resources to do business, exchange ideas and learn.   Severe bottlenecks at all levels, what we call the Global Internet Distribution Challenge, has led to more than 50% of the world left unconnected entirely OR connected but with extremely poor access to the Internet. The outcome is that large swaths of the global population are hence prevented from accessing life-changing and economy-driving tools and services offered by the Internet.  What if you could really change the future?  We are building a space laser network to deliver the future of Internet Distribution worldwide. This will be the fastest way to bring the rest of the world up on the bandwidth and connectivity curve. Right now, we are using the same technology to provide a rapidly deployable, affordable, low cost and high speed Last Mile Connectivity solution, CENTAURI, which speeds up adoption of 4G and 5G globally, especially dense residential areas during COVID-19 period which require urgent bandwidth upgrades.  Join our team if you want to define the rules of how our civilisation communicates!  Global Sales Lead   RESPONSIBILITIES:  Drive the revenue generation & margin contribution for the CENTAURI product across all major markets and relevant industry verticals Full ownership for executing the sales strategy for driving growth in APAC, Oceania, EMEA and US, Canada & LATAM markets Lead the Growth (Product Marketing), Sales, Sales Engineering and Customer Success teams (which, together, form the entire Commercial team)  Improving and building the entire customer lifecycle from entry, to continued success Connect with global leaders in Telecommunications industry to build brand recognition and the disruptive nature of the technology Overall accountability for financial results including annual budget for the Global Commercial Team, bookings, revenue and margin contribution, cost center management, and incentive programs Working closely and collaboratively with the Product, Engineering and Finance team leads to ensure our commercial learnings are brought into the organization as soon as possible   QUALIFICATIONS:  Degree in Engineering or Business More than 10+ years of progressive sales leadership roles, including leading a direct sales organization in the telecommunications sector  PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:  Track record of closing large deals consistently, including deals up to 100 million USD in size A demonstrable track record of building a multi-theatre sales team for both direct and channel sales while delivering budget expectations Experience selling wireless transmission products and solutions (including hardware, software and services)  Experience defining and executing GTM strategies for new products and new markets. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong business relationships with stakeholders at senior levels Strong business acumen coupled with the ability to understand pivots in bids and recommend to our customers and stakeholders the best solution that meets business objectives Executive presence with excellent written and verbal communication skills Consistent track record of building and scaling high achieving sales teams for long term success Demonstrated ability to build trust and relationships at senior levels across different customers, cultures and industries Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively across functions and geographies, and to influence and support beyond formal reporting lines World class understanding of sales and marketing in the digital world and proven experience in execution Creative and challenging mindset – Senior strategy or sales and marketing professional with strong business acumen   Building the Future of Internet Distribution  Founded in Dec 2016, the Transcelestial team is located in Singapore and is backed by major investors such as Wavemaker Partners, EDBI, Airbus Ventures, Cap Vista, SEEDS Capital (Enterprise SG), Entrepreneur First, Partech Ventures, 500 Startups, AirTree Ventures, Tekton Ventures, SGInnovate, SparkLabs Global Ventures, Michael Seibel (CEO of Y-Combinator, Founder of Twitch.tv), Charles Songhurst (Microsoft’s former Head of Corporate Strategy) and other investors.  Transcelestial has won numerous industry and global awards such as SPIFFY San Andreas Award for Most Disruptive Technology by Telecom Council, The Most Ambitious Start-Up in Photonics Award by The Optical Society (OSA), etc.   COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:  A monthly book and hobby fund 1 Friday for “Space Themed” personal projects Personal Office Computer Flexible work hours Best in industry health plans  JOIN US: You should include in your application  Your CV, and/or LinkedIn page Links to projects or other work which will definitely impress everyone  Email us at jobs@transcelestial.com
industries: Telecommunications, Internet, and Research
