description: Head of Growth & Strategy (Singapore)  WhyQ (www.whyq.sg) is a full service digital ecosystem enabling SMEs in the F&B space to create e-shops and go online, manage accounts, record transactions via a POS system, improve customer retention with simple CRM tools and order supplies for cooking and packaging.   We are looking for the best, highly driven and highly motivated talents who can thrive in a startup culture. You will be working with the founders (in Singapore) and our leadership team in Singapore, Malaysia, and India, to strategize and lead the growth of SaaS products in Singapore. You will help define our strategies for acquiring vendors and driving revenue from our digitalization solutions. You will also recruit and lead a team of sales persons and work closely with the founders based in Singapore.   Role Overview Lead, along with our head of partnerships, the expansion into B2B digitalization solutions for Singapore’s largest and fastest growing startup for small food businesses. Help define strategies for vendor acquisition and driving revenue, and build a team to execute this vision.  Responsibilities Defining strategies for vendor acquisition and driving revenue Working closely with founders and leadership team Building a team for sales and merchant acquisition Interest and motivation to disrupt Singapore’s SMESs industry and support them in their digitization journey  Ability to build rapport quickly and effectively with SMEs  Result-oriented and demonstrate adaptability, flexibility and resourcefulness  Qualifications and Experience Young go-getter who is comfortable working in a tech startup environment and has worked on the launch of new products/services previously. Minimum 2 years work experience working in a tech startup environment. Previous experience working in food delivery or logistics is an advantage. Maximum of 10 years work experience Familiarity with the region and local languages Self-motivated and results-oriented team player with initiative and drive with ‘can do’ startup mindset and attitude Able to go on the ground, roll up their sleeves and onboard food vendors  Able to manage key strategic partner relations with banks, e-wallet companies; be a brand ambassador of the business Results-oriented with a focus to deliver top line targets Independent and able to navigate a resource-constrained and challenging startup environment Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills  Please read the responsibilities, qualifications and experience sections carefully before applying.  About WhyQ Having launched in 2017 in Singapore; WhyQ partners with over 4,000 hawker stalls, street food and small eateries, making us Singapore’s largest food delivery service in this vendor segment. With no commissions, no on-boarding fees, and same day payments, WhyQ connects small food businesses digitally to customers and suppliers. WhyQ has created an in-house batch aggregation delivery model to ensure food delivery remains affordable for customers and reduces cost of supplies for our partner vendors.  WhyQ’s digital vendor operating system (Vendor OS) that enables vendors to manage accounts, record transactions via POS systems, improve customer awareness and retention via automated CRM and marketing tools, manage customer and supplier credit lines, and order supplies for cooking and packaging. WhyQ is backed by Delivery Hero and has formed key partnerships in Singapore with DBS Bank, foodpanda, NTUC Enterprise, various government bodies and hawker associations to help increase market penetration.

About The Company  Pixalate is a cross-platform digital advertising fraud intelligence company, offering the only system of coordinated invalid traffic (“IVT”) detection solutions across desktop, mobile web, mobile in-app, and OTT/CTV for better detection, diagnosis, and elimination of ad fraud.  We are under midst one of the biggest shifts in ad tech right now with overwhelming industry demand for greater transparency and protection against ad fraud. Concurrently, media spends are steadily shifting more towards newer channels like OTT/CTV which are poised to explode, yet present difficult challenges around measurement and fraud protection. Pixalate is uniquely positioned to capitalize on these industry trends by being the first fraud protection provider to offer MRC accredited omni-channel fraud protection solutions that are focused on actually reducing fraud, not just measuring it, and our explosive growth over the last quarters reflect that!  Position Overview  Pixalate is hiring an International Sales Director/Manager, to build new business and partnerships within brands, agencies, and the ad tech space as a whole. This candidate is based in Singapore and will be responsible for bringing in revenue within the Asia-Pacific (APAC) markets as well as working with our existing client base there. We are looking for a candidate that has many years of ad tech experience and reliable contacts within the mobile and digital advertising space and gets the details as well such as digital ad serving, ad targeting and measurement. The position will require one to be strategically collaborative, highly motivated, and have a passion for selling such as jumping on a plane to help close deals face to face!  What will you do? Create, identify, and execute new growth opportunities through creative partnership deals to drive client solutions and new revenue streams Develop sales strategy and execute plans to generate revenue within the Asia-Pacific region Build weekly revenue pipeline development through qualified meetings in the field with key prospects and stakeholders Meet and exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets Help further enhance our go to market strategy and share crucial feedback from the field. Collaborate closely with our Customer Success, Data Science, Ad Ops, Engineering, Legal, and Marketing teams to provide an exceptional end product to our clients. Travels as necessary in support of business objectives (prospect/client meetings, conferences, internal meetings)  What skills, education and experience should you possess? Bachelor's degree (BA or BS) from four-year college or university Fluent knowledge of ad tech, with bonus points for understanding various supply models, buying models across different channels like desktop, mobile in-app, OTT, video, etc. Ideally have also sold on a SaaS model before 3+ years of account management or account-based selling within ad tech or SaaS Strong industry knowledge and contacts within mobile in-app and OTT space Proven track record of meeting sales quota Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; ability to communicate well with people at all levels of an organization both internally and externally, both written and verbally Ability to prioritize initiatives, formulate action plans and execute initiatives Thorough working knowledge of sales tools, including Salesforce.com Strong technical aptitude Understand the necessity of being seen as a trustworthy consultant by clients and balance that effectively to transcend the typical “vendor” relationship. Self-motivated, organized, resourceful  Would you like working at Pixalate? Everyone’s a data addict and an analytical thinker Titles don’t mean much; you attain respect by producing results We appreciate small, highly-productive teams Slack is a way of life; short emails are encouraged A fearless attitude towards the industry does well, as well as bold ideas Chess players do well We revere collaboration, collaboration, collaboration!  What perks do we have to offer? We focus on doing things differently and challenge each other to be the best we can be, offering our employees: Experienced leadership and founding team Fun team events High performing team that wants to win and have fun doing it Extremely competitive compensation Opportunity for advancement (Pixalate will be what you make it) This job is paying over $20k a year  What does the media say about us? Pixalate expands its MRC Accreditations: Pixalate launches Video Seller Trust Index: Pixalate discovers a sophisticated mobile app fraud: For the most current news stories about Pixalate:  Powered by JazzHR  gqDn36BWCg
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Oracle Cloud SaaS Applications Oracle’s Software as a Service (SaaS) business applications includes Customer Experience (Sales, Marketing, Social & Service) Cloud, HR Cloud, ERP Cloud, EPM Cloud, SCM Cloud, Oracle Internet of Things (IoT) Applications Cloud, Oracle AI/ML Analytics, and Blockchain Cloud offerings. Oracle APAC Applications business is transforming to become the #1 SaaS provider in the region and offers one of the industry’s most comprehensive portfolios (breadth and depth) with a modern set of best-practice business applications that leverage Oracle’s Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) to deliver business outcomes to our customers.  About APAC Applications Solution Engineering (SE) To achieve our business goal of being the #1 SaaS provider in the APAC region, the Applications (SaaS) Solution Engineering (SE) mission is as follows: ·      DELIVER TRANSFORMATIONAL BUSINESS: Identify, Develop, & Win More Transformational Opportunities ·      INSPIRE CUSTOMERS: A New Benchmark (Best-Practice) Standard for Every Solution Engineering engagement ·      MAXIMISE EFFICIENCY: An Integrated Solution Engineering eco-system Delivering Highest Quality Services ·      ENERGIZE OUR CULTURE: A Positive, Continuous-Learning, High-Performance Culture  Job Overview The Business Solution Lead (BSL) leads consultative engagements with complex enterprise customers, partnering with key stakeholders to create compelling visions while advising and executing on strategies. They serve as hands-on advisors, using strong interpersonal skills, functional and/or technical knowledge, Oracle SaaS product knowledge, industry experience, consulting experience, and knowledge of their client’s business to deliver ROI.   The BSL obtains customer acceptance by understanding and delivering the right strategic vision, and driving the difficult conversations necessary to execute business strategies. They are proficient at analyzing issues and obstacles, weighing options, choosing appropriate courses of action, and measuring and revising strategy based on results. They interact with both technical and functional stakeholders to understand requirements, analyze information, and design comprehensive solutions. They also show a strong understanding of typical business challenges faced by customers and common objectives. Oracle seeks an agile, high-energy, and passionate individual who can build on past success in developing and implementing new formats of customer engagements, lead boardroom conversations with authority, coach & mentor Sales and Solution Engineering teams on the subject and changing market dynamics, and drive towards the successful outcome of exceeding revenue targets. We offer you a truly international working environment that is fun, exciting and always challenging.  Job Responsibilities ·      Provide Solution Engineering (SE) leadership role on large, complex, multi-pillar SaaS sales opportunities by working with the Oracle Sales Teams and Sales Executives, Oracle Pillar SEs, and Customer stake-holders, including at the executive level ·      Engage with Product Management for solution blue print and status ·      Engage/ communicate with Pillar-specific solution teams like CX, HCM, ERPM, and PaaS to define overall solution strategy for a customer ·      Engage with Sales on strategy, such as Customer-to-Cloud approaches business/ IT transformation, and complex hybrid solution architecture ·      Manage solution pursuit to secure appropriate resources for all qualified opportunities ·      Provide specific industry expertise, architect the solution, and develop/ execute solution strategies to win opportunities ·      Present/ demonstrate solutions to high-level clients and industry conference attendees ·      Build the structures and culture to ensure teams in the region are leveraging their combined strengths to drive success for Oracle and our customers ·      Design/ leverage and implement programs that result in pipeline necessary to ensure over-achievement of APAC SaaS revenue targets ·      Coach Sales Teams on effective ways to address competitive traps and objection handling ·      Act as an acknowledged technical authority within the organization and provide mentoring to less experienced SEs. Act as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. jobTitle: Regional Sales Director, Global SaaS Company
description: Our client, a global Software as a Service (SaaS) Company listed in Nasdaq is looking for a Regional Sales Director to look after the ASEAN region. This is a newly created role as part of the global expansion.  The Regional Sales Director will have full ownership and responsibility for managing sales activities and ensuring the achievement of significant new revenue growth targets. As a Sales Director, you will manage and grow a globally distributed team responsible for direct sales in the Asia Pacific region.  You must be able to articulate a clear vision and set the overall strategy and goals for the business. You will identify new opportunities in industry verticals and driving expansion into them. You will support your direct reports by participating and leading in some sales meetings and engaging other corporate resources as required.  Ideal candidates must have at least 14 years of proven software sales experience with expertise in sales management, territory management, and with proven ability in building and developing high-performance teams. You must have regional exposure with an excellent understanding of growing and sustaining businesses in a highly competitive and changing marketplace.  You must have sound business acumen skills; and able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment. You must have experience working within a high-growth technology company with the ability to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly. description: Founded in Singapore in 2013, Castlery is an online furniture brand that creates its own distinctive, quality furniture designs and offers them at accessible prices via a seamless, fuss-free experience for the modern furniture shopper. Since then, we have grown into overseas markets like the United States and Australia.  As an e-commerce tech start-up, we move decisively on insightful data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that is as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. It is a place where all ideas are listened to; where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark.  If you are eager to make an impact at a fast-growing technology company and you have a passion for moving the needle, come join us!  Job Responsibilities  Our Sales Team seats central in providing a seamless online-to-offline strategy for our Singapore Market – situated in our Showroom at Jit Poh Building, they are responsible for providing a great shopping experience in store as well as helping potential customers choose the right products for their dream home. As our Head of Sales, you will be taking on a leaderships position and overseeing the current Sales Team, as well as executing various strategic initiatives to scale the business. Your job responsibilities are as per below. Responsible to articulate and implement organisation’s strategy for selling products and to develop forecasts and strategies to achieve sales. Lead the team to motivate and ensure effective performance of Relationships Managers and Sales Consultants. Manage sales team individual performance – sales targets, leads conversion and customer engagement. Develop and maintain sales training program to train and retrain sales full timers and part-timers. Focusing on sales techniques, product knowledge, customer services and personal grooming. Set sales strategy, align sales structure with the strategy and manage staff to implement sales processes. Work closely with marketing in launching new collections to ensure best showroom exposure. Constantly seeking to increase average order value. Store operational excellence by ensuring general store maintenance, visual merchandising and monthly stocktake. Monitor closely in business intelligent (BI) to drive performance from various main categories to SKU level. Assist and influence the HQ team to provide insight to the wider team. Work closely with marketing and purchasing team to influence forecast demand and ensure consistent supply amidst seasonal trends. Work closely with marketing and demand team to execute exit strategies for unproductive inventory. Build staff hiring plan to fully execute business vision. Organise effective regular sales meeting with team and cross departments. Engage regularly with Castlery management and department heads to ensure continued alignment between brands and functions. Keeps abreast of Castlery’s product range, product applications, technical services, market conditions, competitive activities, advertising and promotional trends by consulting with various departments.  Requirements Strong track record in retail operations management and driving strategic growth. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Prior leadership/people management experience, taking care of a team of more than 5 sales representatives. Preferred university qualifications or professional equivalent. At least 8 to 10 Years of experience in a similar role, with a minimum of 5 years in a Managerial & Leadership level role. Be able to perform under volume workload and stress during peak season. A professional, pro-active and ‘can do' attitude with good attention to detail and a passion for providing outstanding customer service. Familiar with Freshworks or similar software is preferred. By the very nature of our clients’ requirements, the incumbent will be skilled in leveraging the wider organisation and external strategic partners to create winning sales propositions & bid teams.  Key Responsibilities Lead Business Development activities in Singapore with a primary focus on the Financial Services and Travel sectors but with specific opportunities in other select industries. To own a territory Business Development Target and achieve Pipeline, Sales Revenue and Gross Margin metrics Identify target key decision makers and influencers among qualified prospects and build commercially viable relationships via Networking and proactive dialogue/engagement To develop deep and wide relationships within B2B targets where decision makers and influencers can be extensive. To deeply understand prospect business needs and challenges To design and articulate complex business solutions into saleable solutions for both new and existing clients that meet the needs of targets. Nurture and optimize Strategic partnerships to support commercial goals Project manage client opportunities in conjunction with Business Solutions and Country teams Deliver on administration and reporting processes to support efficient working, including Salesforce updates, Bid Qualification processes, commercial, legal and operational sign off. Represent Collinson at Key industry events Knowledge, Skills And Experience Required Demonstrable self-starter who can close out solutions contracts of significant scale 7+ years in loyalty or Customer engagement selling Track record of Consultative, solution selling with strong customer centric mindset Evidence of building pipelines and converting large scale deals Gravitas to effectively engage at C level in large organizations PERSON SPECIFICATION The DNA of a solutions sales person who craves to understand the customer in depth, their business environment, and their business needs deeply before even starting to talk about Collinson. A natural hunter with the inherent drive to find new opportunities and 'close’ new business A proven track record of winning new loyalty or customer engagement solutions deals. A high level of discipline in opportunity qualification – recognizing that qualifying out is as important as qualifying in. Strong commercial orientation A very strong networker who has an established senior client contact list in the target base Outstanding consultative sales approach with the ability to form strong working relationships through exceptional gravitas, an engaging personality and business credibility A clear philosophy the solution sales success is highly dependent on understanding a customer deep and wide. That this takes significant research effort to understand THEM and only then does the solutions sales person have the right to talk to the customer about US. A real can do will do attitude. Does not recognize boundaries and thrives in an environment of opportunity, confidence and hunger for growth Sets and achieves very high levels of performance and continually strives for personal improvement in all that they do High levels of energy, thrives on being challenged and will take others on the journey of success Will take accountability for action and takes deals through to closure and ensure a clean transition to the delivery and in-life team An equally strong influencer internally as externally to ensure that the internal organization and strategic partners are brought on the sales journey. High standards of personal presentation

description: About us: Zoho Corporation is a leading technology company with over 9000+ employees worldwide with customers in over 180+ countries. With more than 50 million business users around the globe, Zoho is excited to be driving innovation in every aspect of business software and is now looking for the right candidate to join our team. If you are interested to be associated with a global leader in cloud and business solutions, please read on.  Job Description: We are looking for a Regional Sales Director who would be responsible for all sales in the region. The regional role includes a broader ASEAN region including all countries from Hong Kong to Sri Lanka.  This role will work in collaboration with the sales, technical team and solution experts to deliver a compelling value proposition that helps win deals.  Responsibilities: Provide regional sales leadership and guidance to help grow revenue (direct and via partners) from new and existing customers. Mentor a regional sales, technical and partner team. Orchestrate internal teams to build collaboratively and present right solutions to customers Help, guide and mentor the team to meet the quarterly sales target set. Close complex sales deals and ensure customer success. Create presentations and proposals and meet with and talk to C-level executives as needed to close deals. Manage sales and partners.  Role Requirements: Proven 12+ years experience in software sales with the knowledge of handling direct and channel sales. You should be familiar with the region. Exceptional team leadership and people-management skills and the ability to work with multiple internal teams to close complex deals. You should have excellent communication skills. Being a thought leader, you will provide the right context and recommendations  to decision makers through extensive business and product knowledge You will have proven experience servicing Singapore and other countries in South East Asia as this is a must for job success. Qualifications: Degree or equivalent experience in relevant area. Years of experience : 12+ years experience in a sales role in software. Ability to write and communicate in fluent English and one local language. Salary includes variable Pay and will be based on experience & outcomes. This role is based out of our office in Singapore and will require you to travel for product  team interactions to our international headquarters in Chennai, India (~ yearly once) when the overall situation is favourable for travel.

description: Exceptional opportunity to join a high growth Analytics & AI firm that focuses on the Energy & commodities market.  Our client is looking for a Sales Director to join their Singapore based APAC sales team, owning a vast part of the region and looking to play a major part in their ambitious growth plans.  In this role, you will proactively develop new relationships with Oil, Gas, Chemicals and Shipping companies and be the first point of contact for incoming sales leads, responsible for generating qualified sales opportunities, moving leads through the pipeline and researching new markets and client segments. You will leverage your existing network of contacts to promote our client's subscription products and solutions in your region.  You will report into the MD for Asia and work closely with the Product, Customer Success and Sales Revenue Operations functions to provide a best-in-class experience for prospective and existing clients.  You must be a driven self-starter that thrives in the face of challenge, with a resourceful and positive approach to problem-solving in a fast-paced and constantly evolving scale-up environment.  Responsibilities: Achieving the yearly sales and revenue targets by identifying, building, and strengthening relationships with prospects, customers, and partners Incoming lead qualification and outreach to target accounts Proactively developing new relationships through phone email and other channels where appropriate to establish meetings with decision makers and influencers at our target accounts Developing a deep knowledge of our clients and prospects; developing supportive and collaborative long-term relationships with them Collaborating daily with the MD of Asia, as well as Product, Customer Success, Marketing and Revenue Operations to research target accounts, map user personas, identify key players, generate interest, and develop target accounts and account plans Utilizing pipeline and CRM tools to ensure information about prospects and clients is recorded and well-maintained Maintaining and continuously developing a robust pipeline of commercial opportunities, including assessments of contract risk and up-sell potential, and detailed records of client interactions within our CRM application to build and manage an appropriate level of pipeline to support quota and sales cycles Driving local partnerships in Asia where needed to better serve our customers  It would be great if you also.. Thrive on working in a fast paced, scale-up environment Are passionate about the energy industry and our customers Have excellent engagement and influencing skills with an ability to establish trusted advisor relationships with business decision makers Have values and mindset that closely match ours Have an entrepreneurial spirit Have exceptional organizational skills and communication skills Have strong business acumen and problem-solving skills Are results orientated with the ability to prioritize multiple objectives Are self-sufficient and able to work without the need for close management Value working in an open and collaborative environment  Skills & Experience... Hunter mentality and track record of new business success in a proactive sales environment 6+ years’ experience within a sales or business development role within the energy commodities industry (SaaS Sales a plus) in a solution sales environment Strong relationship building and relationship management skills Excellent communication skills – verbal and written in English. Mandarin a plus Experience using CRM systems, such as HubSpot and Salesforce The best product in the market with significant technology edge over competitors - and high conversion rate  In return, they offer.. A competitive remuneration package Medical and dental insurance Stock-options in a fast-growing, high-potential business A vibrant and diverse workplace An open, collaborative, and supportive working culture built on merit, which celebrates creative thinking and “getting things done.” The opportunity to work with AI-driven technology in a scale-up environment with commodity trading experts Continuous training and development opportunities  Please feel free to reach out for a confidential discussion.

description: About us:  Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.  In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn's Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don't take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  Objective of the role:  The goal for this position is to drive exponential growth by boosting the lead generation of startups across APAC. You will have full ownership of the outreach strategy in your vertical to become the number one financial operating system for digital businesses in Singapore. The core responsibilities will be to hire/train/manage a Business Development team, develop a robust lead strategy and work closely with the commercial management team to launch new products that fit customers requirements.  As the Head of BD for our card vertical, you will be reporting and working closely with the Head of Sales. Your mission will be to make Aspire the #1 Financial OS for startups in APAC.  Your responsibilities: Growing our card vertical as a standalone business unit with well-defined performance targets in terms of growth Build, manage and train a business development team of overachievers focused on B2B card spenders Keeping a tab on latest developments in the industry and identify growth opportunities for the company Establish, build and nurture relationships with payment gateways/e-commerce associations/travel agencies/marketing agencies in Singapore Identify new sales and marketing opportunities for new products, features and customer acquisition channels Work along with sales teams to ensure that we deliver on the performance targets committed to our investors Track, measure, and report progress and performance to the Head of Sales  We would love to get to know you if you have the following: 7-10 years of experience spanning business development, sales, for a card provider (Amex/Visa/Mastercard) or payment gateway (PayPal/Braintree/Shopify, etc.) Successful track record of hitting ambitious targets and possesses a wide network of digital companies across Singapore Experience in hunting B2B companies in South East Asia and digital companies in particular would be an advantage Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can coach / mentor their sales team while establishing a healthy working culture based on the Aspire principle Exceptional communication and collaboration capabilities Ability to coach and guide teams on successful strategies to employ for success. High-energy, results-oriented, creative leadership approach.

description: Job Title : Head of Sales - APAC Location: Singapore  A Little About The Role: OLIVER Agency requires a Singapore-based Head of Sales. This is a fast-paced but extremely rewarding role that will allow self-development as well as growth of the overall business. Essentially, the success of the sales department will ultimately be the success of the business as a whole.  WHAT YOU WILL YOU BE DOING: Responsible for the entire sales cycle from prospect identification to contract implementation Deliver against quarterly and annual revenue and gross profit targets Creating and designing bespoke agency solutions for clients Selling regional and local in-house content, creative and digital agencies that include a range of services including online and offline end to end creative and design, social and community management media, digital, copywriting, videography, data & analytics etc.  Developing structured sales strategies, sales plans and profit targets as well as short term tactics Developing long-term, profitable relationships with clients Maximising new business development opportunities Come with an established network of Marketing & Procurement connections in medium to large size businesses Establishing, maintaining and expanding the customer base Increasing business opportunities through various routes to market Compiling and analysing sales figures Keeping up to date with products and competitors Representing the business at conferences, trade fairs and networking events  WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO BE GREAT IN THIS ROLE: 8-10 years of experience in a sales role, preferably with advertising experience / knowledge Versatility to manage different stakeholders and industries Fantastic presentation, networking and relationship building abilities Commercially astute – apt at building commercial solutions and forecasting profitability Able to priorities leads and maximize revenue via sales pipeline control Face to face and telephone sales experience including negotiation and pitching Proficient with Salesforce and Microsoft Office Strategic, consultative and solution-based sales approach Excellent document creation / sales deck capabilities Independent and proactive with strong project management skills  A LITTLE BIT ABOUT THE COMPANY:  Established in 2004, we are the first and only company to design, build and run bespoke in-house agencies and ecosystems for brands. Today, we create work that delivers business growth, fame and purpose for over 200 clients in 46 countries and counting. Our unique model moves at the speed of modern business to drive change from the inside out; working smarter to make our clients’ money go further, and helping them build better solutions, systems and brands. Client solutions include Unilever’s U-Studio (a platform used by almost three-quarters of Unilever's brands globally), adidas’ off-shore hub and PepsiCo’s global digital team. In 2020 we were ranked #1 in Adweek’s Fastest Growing list (US) and featured in The Drum’s Honours List of the best businesses that helped shape the year. We are part of the Inside Ideas Group (IIG), which combines specialisms from Adjust Your Set (content and culture), Dare (design, experience and engineering) and Aylesworth Fleming (property marketing). IIG joined the world’s first brandtech™ group You & Mr Jones in January 2019 to give their clients access to the latest marketing technology solutions. The group includes tech-driven marketing companies, 55, Mofilm, Collectively, Gravity Road, Blood and Mobkoi, and holds strategic investments in leading technology businesses including Pinterest, Niantic, AI Foundation, VidMob, Jivox, Zappar, EVRYTHNG, Automat, Blacktag and Beeswax.

After successfully launching in Europe and in the US, they are excited to expand their operations in Asia-Pacific. jobTitle: Regional Channel Sales Director, Global SaaS Company
description: Our client, a global Software as a Service (SaaS) Company listed in Nasdaq is looking for a Regional Channel Sales Director to look after APAC, Middle East, and Africa Regions. This is a newly created role as part of the global expansion.  The Regional Channel Sales Director will be responsible for leading a team of high performing Regional Partner Sales Managers, enabling extensive strategic opportunities with partners, including Value Added Resellers/Distributors, System Integrators, Managed Service Providers and Independent Software Vendors to allow the Company to scale more efficiently and improve their customer success. This is a key and strategic role, where you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop a robust partner strategy.  The Regional Channel Sales Director will be responsible for the implementation against the broader partnership strategy through building relationships, negotiating partnership agreements, and creating a joint go-to-market approach. You will manage a diverse set of stakeholders ranging from Sales, Engineering, Marketing, and other functional teams to ensure alignment with the Company’s ongoing evolution and broader business objectives.  Ideal candidates must have at least 12 years of experience and comes with a proven track record in channel/partner/alliances sales management from the SaaS industry. description: Director of Business Strategy/ Director of Business Development (Biotech/Medical Device) The Director of Business Strategy execute the growth and business strategies of the company. You will work with the company’s Executives Team to identify business opportunities, formulate the strategies and execute go-to-market plans. You will keep abreast of market trends and developments, be fast to adept to changes, as well as being agile to seize new business opportunities quickly.  If you are the one with an entrepreneurial mindset, astute business acumen, great leadership and incisive interpersonal skills. The ideal candidate will also be a creative and resourceful strategist with excellent organisational abilities and execution strengths.  The goal is to build, develop, execute and expand the company’s businesses that will generate revenues and lead to sustainable growth. Responsibilities Identify, develop and implement business strategies, and execute go-to-market plans according to the company’s goals and objectives. Identify emerging opportunities to create profitable business models. Execution of the plans and bring incremental revenue streams to the company. Source for complete and cost-effective solutions for the business plans. This will include working and coordinating with the different functional teams within the company, with its affiliated companies as well as external partners. Act to acquire new customers and business partners. Concurrently, maintain excellent relationships and understand the requirements of existing customers and business partners for greater partnership and expansion of business opportunities. Build and maintain profitable partnerships with key stakeholders. Monitor performance and progress of business activities using key metrics and prepare reports for the Executive Team. Assist in setting financial targets and budget development and monitoring.  Requirements: Proven experience as Director of Business Strategy or other relevant role. Prior experiences in the healthcare/medtech/life science sector preferred. BSc/BA in life science or relevant field desirable; MSc/MA is a plus. Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Professional Degree, Master's Degree, Biology, Business Studies/Administration/Management, Medical Science, BioTechnology, Engineering (Bioengineering/Biomedical) or equivalent. Required skill(s): business strategy and planning, business management, business acumen, business development, channel sales, Communication Skill. Independent, decisive and self-starting, and will pro-actively chase opportunities and develop business execution plans. At least 10 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Senior Managers specializing in Biotechnology, Sales/ Business Development/Business Strategy - Corporate or equivalent. description: Points is looking for a Director of Business Development to join our Points Business Development team in a permanent position based in our Singapore office. Our main Head Office is located in Toronto and we are also closely linked to our offices in London & Dubai.  We’re an industry-leading organization that is continuously reshaping how consumers interact with their loyalty programs. We work with the world’s largest airline, hotel, financial, and retail rewards programs, to tackle complex challenges and come up with innovative e-commerce solutions. If you’d like to be a part of it, we’d love to hear from you.  We have an exciting new opportunity for a Director, Business Development that enjoys building long term business relationships and developing new business opportunities. You will be responsible for sourcing and developing new Partnerships throughout the Asia-Pacific region with strong loyalty programs, focusing on the global travel, financial and virtual currencies sectors. You will have responsibility for negotiating and closing deals with the goal of executing formal Partnership Agreements in a timely manner with attractive revenue and margin potential. You are motivated and comfortable working with a lean entrepreneurial global organization that enables you to have significant influence on the success of the business. You are confident, approachable and a top sales performer in your current role. You must possess a unique blend of business savvy, superior relationship building skills and a genuine passion for the loyalty industry and retail customer loyalty programs.  Reporting to the Regional Director - APAC, you will be responsible for: Researching, analyzing and understanding industry trends to develop and implement sales strategies and plans in key verticals Identifying and establishing key loyalty program partnership opportunities based on previous experience and understanding of players in sectors that use loyalty programs Managing pre-sales activities for discovery and prospecting stages such as competitive reviews, loyalty program evaluation, preparation of sales tools (collateral, sales decks, product demos etc.) Sales sourcing, including both warm and cold outreach to engage business interest and opportunities to add value to partners’ goals Setting up and conducting sales presentations (in person, phone, zoom, webinars) at the executive level Implementing tactics to progress discussions, negotiate/close deals and execute contracts Ensuring partnership deals are material to achieve and surpass revenue/margin targets Detailed pipeline management, preparation of regular status reports and monthly reviews to establish regional opportunity size Working with internal teams to implement new partners and act as an advocate for the new partner Maintaining and fostering industry business relationships and represent Points.com at various events Identifying new opportunities and complementary business models for our business to capitalize on  Qualifications Minimum 10 years proven business development success with experience at the Director or Senior Manager level Excellent negotiation skills with ability to explain value proposition of Points products and services Extensive loyalty industry / reward program experience Self-starter, who is assertive, persistent and resilient, goal oriented and focused on their performance to close on win/win contracts Strategic thinker, highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment, both independently and as a team player Relationship builder with an established network of business contacts Advanced interpersonal, written & verbal communication skills – for both external and internal audiences Ability to work independently with frequent travel Must have a valid passport and ability to travel internationally

description: About This Job  Job Description  Colgate, Milo, Coca-Cola and Johnnie Walker. What do they all have in common?  They are all international brands from companies that partner with NielsenIQ globally to drive their business and grow their portfolios. NielsenIQ works with companies to deliver quality SaaS and thought leadership. Our work helps our clients set growth strategies and determines what products you ultimately see on the shelf. Our team members are experts across various categories and are viewed as trusted partners by our clients.  Founded in 1923 and with over 100 offices and 30,000 employees, NielsenIQ is a globally recognized brand in a truly global business with our headquarters in Chicago and a strong regional presence in our Singapore team  What You’ll Be Doing  This is a key role for NielsenIQs clients based here in Singapore. The manager is expected to proactively build valuable client relationships and grow the business. The role requires an in-depth appreciation of FMCG and NielsenIQ solutions, as well as a solid understanding of the value those solutions bring to your clients. You’ll be responsible for listening to, discovering and understanding client needs to identify sales opportunities by leveraging NielsenIQ’s unique value proposition.  The Skills You’ll Bring  Client Relationship Management Own the client relationship and lead the client engagement for 50 key accounts from local giants to international business and government entities Foster relationships at all levels and functions of the client organization to identify opportunities for incremental product/solution sales Work with cross-functionally to ensure client service standards are delivered Own the joint business plan with the client and engage across functions and teams to deliver revenue growth for the NielsenIQ business Business Development Provide product solutions that challenge client business issues/opportunities Develop a winning sales framework for retaining current clients while expanding your network within the pre-defined clients Evolve and own a strong pipeline of sales through regular engagement with clients Build the company’s positive image through active participation in professional associations and industry conferences/seminars Contribute to the short-term strategies and business plans for the growth of the business unit based on the global and regional direction Financial Management Achieve key financial metrics: revenue, profitability, and cash collection, as well as other related business development objectives Ensure proper pricing and contracts are applied according to company policies and guidelines Use sales technology and digital tools to do work efficiently by recording prospects, forecast pipeline, and convert sales Monitor the actual financial performance against budget/forecast and ensure the implementation of actions that will lead to the achievement of the targets Some Of The Experiences You Will Have  Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. A proven commercial leader, who can build and execute sales strategy and plan, and be accountable to sales operations, such as forecast and pipeline management. A team player, who has the ability to collaborate with peers, and contribute to the management team of NielsenIQ  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in the related field (not necessary) Minimum 8 years experience in Marketing, Business Development, Market Research, or in the consulting agencies & FMCG clients Prior working experience with the Consumer Packaged Goods accounts would be an advantage Has strong analytical skills and business commercial acumen High communication skills (communicating with clients, partners, and thought leadership for both inside and outside the company) Open to learning new digital tools for sales and marketing Additional Information  Why NielsenIQ? 20 days of annual leave a year Yearly bonus payment for your sales 3 volunteer days a year to use as you need A learning environment where you’ll be trained on how to sell A truly global company with posting available across our 30,000 people and +100 offices Casual work environment & a flat organizational structure With circa 180 people in Singapore, lots of room to move in the business A culture of friends inside and outside of work A central office location on Scotts Rd with ping pong and foosball table in the office About NielsenIQ  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.  NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: The Company Our client is a Video Monetization Platform for web and mobile media publishers. The company provides a full ecosystem for managing videos and video advertisements through its patented technology. The platform enables publishers and advertisers to interact without intermediaries and gives publishers the freedom to manage monetization themselves, preventing them from spending resources on inefficient campaigns. Running ads smoothly on any device and offers both publishers and advertisers full security and transparency.  Founded in 2013, the company has its headquarters in Israel and offices in New York, Singapore and India.  The Role We are looking to hire someone who has a strong knowledge of video advertising technology and programmatic ecosystems. The successful candidate will be a strong contributor to the APAC Sales Team and reporting to the Business Development Director.  The Candidate You must have have 5-8 years of experience selling solutions to digital publishers and building relationships with key decision makers. Extensive network of contacts and decision makers in organizations in APAC region including but not limited to publishers, OTT providers, ad networks, aggregators and SSPs.  Responsibilities Create new opportunities across APAC and other regions, involving yourself in the sales cycle wherever additional efforts are needed. Cultivate partnerships, evaluate needs, establish mutually agreeable terms, negotiate and close deals. Manage and develop relationships with key accounts throughout the whole lifecycle – account vetting, onboarding, daily maintenance, and growth opportunities. Identify market trends and understand client business goals to determine ideal solutions and products. Create and execute sales pitches and presentations. Work collaboratively with an international team to drive revenue growth with new and existing customers.  Qualifications Hands on sales and business development from prospecting through to closing deals. Must be able to build and manage own pipeline independent of other internal sales efforts within the organization. Analytical, able to solve problems, articulate solutions and analyze and report upon data. Able to understand digital product development and platforms. High level of initiative and motivation, great at networking, negotiating and closing deals. Customer-focused – with excellent communication, networking and negotiation skills. Able to deliver campaign requirements to deadline and prioritize leads Team-oriented – with the ability to problem-solve proactively and deal with multiple priorities . Excellent communication skills to liaise with internal and external stakeholders.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: We are looking for a Managing Director of Business Development, Asia Pacific to join our fast-growing team.  You are a self-starter with a proven track record who is passionate about joining a booming blockchain/payments startup.  About Roxe  Roxe is an app that powers peer to peer payments, international remittances, and commerce payments on our revolutionary blockchain technology.  Our team's mission is to make money smarter. What does that mean? With Roxe, your money knows how to get from Boston to Bali via the fastest, cheapest route possible. It knows how to get the most cash back while you're shopping. It knows how to put itself to work so that it can grow at a higher interest rate.  Our diverse team hails from the most innovative fintech companies like Venmo, Google X, Bakkt, and BitPay as well as from experienced finance firms such as Bank of America Merrill Lynch. We are excited to be building a product that we believe will usher in the next generation of fintech apps.  The position requires a tech-savvy candidate with a background in business development or sales, and a track record of working with demanding payments / remittances / banking / central banks / merchants / payment gateways companies.  This role is based in Singapore.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Own and grow the relationships with the partner's C-level executives. Drive the business development process by working closely with cross-functional team members, such as Sales Engineering, Client Engagement, Product, Engineering, and Marketing. Develop in-depth knowledge of Roxe's offerings in the payments space to identify profitable business opportunities. Work with marketing to generate demand, including but not limited to: speaking at conferences, hosting webinars, writing thought leadership articles, suggesting other marketing partnerships, etc. Prepare all materials required for requests for proposals (RFPs) from potential partners. Research emerging trends in the payments space and recommend new product offerings to satisfy customers' needs. Develop and manage strategic partnerships to grow the business. Sign new partners to join the Roxe network. Target partners include remittance and payments companies, banks, central banks, SWIFT service bureau partners, Ripple partners, payments aggregators, merchants, and other fintech companies in the payments space.  Qualifications: Demonstrated ability of "hunting" new clients; getting in front of C-level executives, pitching, negotiating and closing deals. Tenacious and aggressive in a good and positive way that leads to results. Excellent communication, presentation, problem solving, and management skills. Diplomacy, tact, and poise under pressure when working with partners and internal colleagues. Prior blockchain experience is a plus. Prior experience working with SWIFT/Ripple partners is a plus. Bilingual English / Mandarin Chinese is strongly preferred. 7+ years Sales or Business Development or equivalent experience, with a successful track record working in the payments/remittances/banking, blockchain or other fintech industries.

description: About Us  Founded in 2010, WeWork is a global platform for work with a mission to create a world where people work to make a life, not just a living. Our pioneering model offers the benefits of a collaborative culture, the flexibility to scale workspace up and down as needed and the power of a worldwide community, all for a lower cost. With 500+ locations in over 111 cities and 29 countries, our 527,000 memberships represent global enterprises across multiple industries, including 38% of the Global Fortune 500.  THE ROLE  An Account Director, SEA will be responsible for selling into and being the primary point of contact for a book of business composed of Accounts which are headquartered in SEA.  You will work closely with your wider SEA Accounts team to help deepen relationships and drive the strategy for your assigned book of business. This position will report to the Head of Accounts, SEA who oversees an assigned book of business.  As a successful Account Director you will be expected to:  Tailor the Accounts strategy to the needs of your book of business and scale accounts Motivate and work alongside your Account team to optimize member experience and membership growth across your BoB Develop sales strategies to help form meaningful relationships with key business leaders to grow existing accounts Oversee the sales process, from qualification to close, in coordination with the Leasing teams Accurately forecast to meet and exceed sales goals on a monthly cadence Partner with the Account Manager/Customer Success Manager to support member relationships Partner with Leasing Sales to maintain view on the available inventory in select markets and to create selling strategies to generate demand and incentivise closing Individually cover an assigned book of business Creatively add value throughout the lifecycle, increase retention and reducing churn Drive post-sales activity for members by strong relationship-building, product knowledge, and game-plan to upsell for member expansion Own the accuracy of your account forecasting to report to the Head of Accounts, SEA Serve as an internal point of contact for any disputes with the your accounts Establish a culture of communication and share best practices  Experience And Requirements  5+ years of experience in advanced B2B sales and/or transactions, preferably commercial real estate 3+ years in customer-facing capacity (e.g. AM, CSM, Relationship Manager) Willingness to travel to interface with members Proven track record of hitting and overachieving retention and growth targets Strong team player who can make decisions and execute in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment Knowledge of the commercial real estate market in which you will be deployed is a plus A thoughtful communicator who can prioritize and project manage short and long term initiatives Problem solver who can independently translate high-level goals into actionable plans Hard-working, self-motivated, dependable, organized and detail-oriented Strong ability to forecast and manage team pipeline using Salesforce or other CRM Prior experience in a startup / high-Emerging company a plus! Ability to break down problems into manageable components and think through optimal solutions Strong generalist - highly competent with the ability to wear many hats Strong internal relationships with REA, Enterprise Services, Legal, Sales/Local leadership is a must  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: CEVA logistics has an open position for a Global Key Account Manager in the Automotive Sector. Strong preference for candidates with extensive background selling Supply Chain and Logistics solutions to clients in the Automotive Industry.  The role can be based in any major city in Asia but preference for Bangkok, Singapore, Shanghai or Hong Kong.   YOUR ROLE  Account Management: Ownership of total CEVA Global business relationship with sector specified customer; aligning all business and financial commitments and company resources to success Customer Growth: Identify, develop, sell, initiate and provide operational oversight to increase CEVA business with assigned accounts Ensure Customer Retention: Retain current business in all geographies Customer Relationships: Expand relationships to the “C” levels with the customer in executive levels, clusters, and different business units worldwide Negotiations: Lead and co-ordinate negotiations with the customer in all major contracts and opportunities   WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?  Account Management Be the senior point of contact for the assigned accounts for any normal and customary business requests. Identify local sales and operations contacts in CEVA for supporting the account and work with BD Sector leaders to ensure they are properly trained on the strategy and status of the account. Maximize consistency of the CEVA experience throughout all contacts with the specific clients around the World. Lead the development and implementation of account plan(s), including relationships building, key people coverage plans, opportunity prioritization, overall account strategy and a budget/target for business growth and development Provide regular reports, briefings and reviews as required within CEVA including to the Executive Board  Retention Develop plans to ensure the retention of current global business levels with specified accounts, preferably to a “no bid” level of confidence Build and strengthen relationships at “C” level with the client. Ensure relationships are developed at all relevant levels and geographies in the client organization by involving the CEVA global team. Responsible to fix and/or escalate issues to CEVA top management when appropriate and/or required  Growth Own and drive account growth: make comprehensive development plan(s) for each aspect of the assigned account and update on regular basis. Get buy-in and approval for the execution of the account plans by working through and with BD Sector leaders and Executive Sponsors Identify and qualify opportunities for additional business. Develop qualified opportunities from ‘contact to contract’, together with the relevant Cluster Business Units (P&L owners). This is multinational effort demanding the ability to match customer needs to CEVA intellectual capital to practical application and development Lead complex negotiations with the customer ensuring the involvement and participation of CEVA in compliance to applicable geographical legal procedure  Manage Profitability Manage P&L’s and accounts receivable from a global to cluster level across business lines to ensure customer obligations are met by both CEVA and the customer to the discipline of the commercial arrangements in place Create input for annual budget cycle from the approved account plans and take responsibility for the delivery of the related targets for CEVA and customer benefit Manage the investment proposal, ICAP preparation and ROI considerations for new ventures and then work through cluster MDs or designates to hold all CEVA accountable to approved levels of commitment  Automotive Sector and Supply Chain Expertise  Demonstrate and provide confidence regarding Automotive expertise, including input to supply chain, business strategy and impeccable execution  WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?  Bachelor's degree Master’s degree advantageous Specific logistics and or multi-national focus The role requires a skilled relationship management professional with proven track record (10+ years) in related experience with half of that being in a senior capacity. 3+ years commercial negotiations Skilled at leading a virtual team and be able to proactively work commercial issues internally as much as in front of the client. Network management experience (5+ years) 5+ years minimum experience in global account leader role 3+ year minimum positive track record in P&L responsibility; multi-national sites Compliance understanding Advanced supply Chain knowledge (or similar flow chain processes) Advanced industry knowledge in global commerce and logistics in Automotive Sector Advanced product knowledge Strong at building and sustaining relationships at the highest level in both CEVA and in customer organizations Advanced negotiation skills Mature judgment and decision-making Advanced analytical skills leading to clearly articulated solutions. Acute cultural and global awareness C-Level training Smart Solution selling experience Emerging market experience Superior communication skills, both written and spoken Advanced presentation skills (concise & convincing) Second & Third language advantageous Diversity and cultural training
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain and Package/Freight Delivery

description: Who We Are  Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Burger King, Delivery Hero, HBO Max, Mercari, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, hundreds of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 3 billion active users through Braze.  Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Forrester Wave™: Cross-Channel Campaign Management (Independent Platforms), Q3 2021, and was named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for the fourth consecutive year. The company has also been selected as one of Fortune’s Best Workplace for Millennials in 2021, and was ranked #20 on Fortune’s Best Medium Sized Workplaces in 2021. Braze is certified as a Great Place to Work in the UK and the U.S. and is recognized as one of the UK's Best Workplaces for Women.  What We're Looking For  This is a SaaS enterprise sales leadership role, managing a team of Enterprise Account Executives for Braze’s market-leading Customer Journey Orchestration platform. We’re looking for someone who is passionate about helping brands communicate more effectively with their customers, building a winning team, and expanding our highly successful customer base.  The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of successful experience leading, and developing a team of enterprise sellers in a high-growth, rapidly evolving, and dynamically competitive market. Your team will focus on the entire lifecycle relationship with their clients, so you should have experience helping them develop and evangelize net-new business, while nurturing and expanding the relationships with their customer base. As a front-line leader whose team addresses the problems of customers across multiple industries, you should have strong business acumen, and help prepare for, and participate directly in, customer-facing engagements. Your leadership will have a direct impact on the success of our customers, the development of your team, and the success of Braze.  What You'll Do Hire, nurture and lead a team of world-class sales talent Set and execute an aggressive customer acquisition and expansion strategy for the region Align go-to-market teams (BDR, marketing, value engineering, SolCon, executive) to execute the FY plan and represent a clear, single vision to customers and the marketplace Coach your team through the overall sales process, participate, where appropriate, in a hands-on manner in deals, and provide detailed and accurate sales forecasting Be the “voice of Braze” in prospect, customer and industry forums Plan and manage at both the strategic and operational levels Be a proactive voice within our enterprise and global sales leadership team What You Have Minimum of 5 years of successful experience leading a team of at least five quota-carrying Enterprise Account Executives A proven ability to recruit, retain, inspire, and develop top talent Proven experience in leading teams through the full-lifecycle of a SaaS customer: prospecting, acquisition, retention and long-term relationship growth Ability to coordinate and work cross-functionally internally with internal constituencies, including Business Development, Marketing, Customer Success, Legal, and Sales Operations Outstanding verbal, written and in-person presentation skills Excellent commercial and legal negotiation skills Strong technical and business acumen; the ability to engage with multiple customer personas across a wide variety of industries and within both technical and marketing functional roles Up-to-date on digital and application trends, especially in the mobile space Prior experience selling Mobile or Marketing Technology is a strong plus Prior experience in a startup technology company a plus What We Offer Competitive compensation that includes equity Generous time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.  If you are located in the EU or UK visit our privacy policy to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Employer Our client is a leading AI & Analytics company that provides SaaS-based solutions to its customers globally.  The Offer Lead a sales team of 6-8 professionals across South East Asia for a fast growing AI/ML startup   The Job This is a key leadership role within the Sales organisation. You will report to the Chief Revenue Officer and manage a team of 3 Sales Managers across South East Asia. Your main responsibilities will include: Driving sales objectives and achieving commercial budgets and targets. Identifying new sales opportunities and building client relationships across multiple sectors ( F&B, Financial Services, etc.) New business generation by meeting potential clients to understand needs and providing relevant solutions. Managing the sales process to close new business opportunities. Conducting weekly, monthly & quarterly sales reviews with Country sales reps. Building a high-performing sales team by providing strong mentorship, coaching, and guidance. Building strong and collaborative relationships with other internal stakeholders   The Profile You are a seasoned sales professional with at least 8 years of experience within Enterprise Sales in SaaS/ IT Services or Analytics industries. You have solid sales experience in a regional role covering South East Asia. You have a strong understanding of complex sales processes and longer sales cycles. You possess excellent interpersonal as well as written and verbal communication skills. You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments You are a strong mentor and coach who can build & lead high-performing remote sales teams.

What You Will Do:  Own and deliver the monthly/quarterly sales plan covering orders and margin, including both new installation and service. Build intimacy and trust with key stakeholders at customer’s organization to position JCI as preferred supplier across all LoBs (Fire & Security, Building Management System and HVAC). Position JCI during design stage by taking a solution approach, to ensure customer needs are translated into a strong value proposition, while growing the opportunity pipeline. Drive proposal competitiveness with engineering and country sales teams, injecting customer and market insights to ensure high win-rate. Lead customer engagement with key decision makers and influencers, to ensure profitable deal closure, while closely partnering with country sales and global account teams. Penetrate current installed base with customers to drive parts & services agreements and retrofits in order to ensure high uptime. Forge Master Service Agreements to drive technical and commercial standardization, across all LoBs and countries. Partner with post-sales teams in project execution, program management and services to ensure customers get right support. Build and maintain account plan with monthly reporting at leadership level; constantly align with regional and global stakeholders.

description: Job Description:  This role involves providing strong sales abilities, business development activities in positioning HCL offerings around Cisco portfolio to target customers/markets in collaboration with APJC + ME HCL and Cisco Sales teams.  Desired Skills and attributes for success  Work with the APJC and Middle East Sales team to identify and qualify business opportunities, to identify key customer technical objections and to develop the strategy to resolve technical impediments to business transactions. Manage Relationship with Cisco Business Teams in the region and drive business together Primarily responsible for researching and identifying business opportunities & generating leads Target identification and classification for CISCO opportunities  Develop and acquire new customers and up sell to existing customers for new revenue opportunities Works across APJC and ME to create a market for defined CISCO offerings and services, and to qualify and develop opportunities within those markets Making technical presentations and demonstrating how HCL offerings along with Cisco products meets client needs Business Development/Sales background that enables to engage at all levels of a customer and partner organization, including CXO-levels of the business and IT Prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan business objective Develop long-term strategic relationships with key companies Maintain an accurate forecast and various business reports Possess the technical ability to explain Cloud Computing, Infrastructure solutions & Internet architectures Responsible to establish and grow business and technical relationships and managing the day-to-day interactions with partners and internal sales teams. Experience with Networks, Security, Unified Communication, PaaS and IaaS technologies on public or hybrid cloud platforms. The candidate should possess both a business/sales background that enables them to engage at the CXO level and field level, as well as strong technical competency focused on the IT landscape and cloud computing. Ability to work in a Matrix Organization.   Large & Complex Deal Exposure   Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills required. Bachelor’s degree required, MBA a plus.
