jobTitle: Head of Sales – Asia, Life & Health
description: Company Description  Verisk Risk Rating, a Verisk Business, has developed a range of solutions designed to assess the level of medical risk presented by pre-existing conditions. With a simple integration of the Black Box underwriting tool into point of sale systems, insurers can transform their processes. Instant results are generated following the completion of a simple, intuitive declaration of a customer’s medical conditions. Black Box solutions are available for Travel, Health, Income Protection and Pet Insurance. To learn more visit https://www.verisk.com/insurance/products/risk-rating/. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!  At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.  But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.  It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.  At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.  Job Description  Main purpose of the job including responsibilities:  Reporting to the Deputy Global Managing Director, LH&T, this pivotal role will facilitate, pursue and close new LH&T business opportunities in the Life and Health Insurance sectors across Asia.  The Head of Sales Asia will play a key role in building and developing LH&T’s product offering and income in the Region, managing our key client relationships, and maintaining relationships with the international sales and marketing teams to provide a world-class service delivery capability. The Head of Sales Asia will deliver against the business plan revenue targets and ensure an appropriate communication flow with colleagues based in the UK and Australasia, and other parts of Verisk as needed, to ensure a cohesive global strategy and collaborative effort. The incumbent will deliver a professional level of customer service at all times and ensure that all contractual obligations are adhered to by both LH&T and the client.  Key Activities/main Duties  Commercial/Account Management & Leadership The role of the Head of Sales Asia will initially be twofold; (i) delivering on new business opportunities and providing leadership to the Asia-based business development team; and (ii) account portfolio management. Longer term, as LHT’s business grows, the role will naturally split with new business wins remaining with the Head of Sales Asia and account management being delegated to a colleague.  Primary Responsibilities Will Include Work with potential new leads to develop and cultivate relationships, using internal expertise and specialists to meet with prospective business leads as needed Research and build relationships with new clients, identify key stakeholders and decision makers, and set up & host meetings/events, as well as networking opportunities. Work with existing clients and senior stakeholders to manage relationships and nurture further business opportunities, in particular looking at cross-selling capabilities for both LH&T and the wider Verisk business where appropriate Liaise on a regular basis with local and international colleagues to create a coordinated approach to selling and promoting LH&T’s multi-product and international capabilities. Remain abreast of market demands and direction, as well as competitor capabilities, to predict future client requirements, business needs and ideas for internal research and product development opportunities. Identify new markets, clients and business sectors with direction from the Deputy Global MD and in liaison with the international sales and marketing team. Plan bespoke ‘go-to-market’ approaches and pitches, adapted to individual client requirements to ensure client objectives are met. With sign-off from the Deputy Global Managing Director, ensure that commercial negotiations are consistent with existing business and internal requirements. Support the Asia based Business Development team to deliver on sales targets, maintain and grow pipelines, and facilitate in the promotion and selling of LH&T products and services. With guidance from the Deputy Global Managing Director ensure that all commercial responsibilities are met in relation to sales processes. Lead contract negotiations with the assistance of Legal and Service Delivery Oversee the training and development of team members through formal training and informal coaching to ensure collective career progression Lead a high performing team with consistent management, mentoring and coaching. Act as a conduit for other Verisk products / introductions as required – represent Verisk’s wider interests as and when clients request other product / service needs Act as a conduit for other Verisk products / introductions as required – represent Verisk’s wider interests as and when clients request other product / service needs Networking - attend relevant Life and Health insurance related events, seminars, conferences, forums, and special interest groups. Look for opportunities to offer specialist knowledge and expertise (case studies), for example as a guest speaker. Be a thought leader in the Life and Health insurance space. Keep up to date with marketing initiatives, in particular digital marketing and selling methods, and look for opportunities to remain ahead of the market by using forward-thinking approaches to promote LH&T’s capabilities. Work closely with APAC’s marketing lead to coordinate efforts and proposed marketing spend Lead regional go-to-market opportunities including marketing and communication plans and represent LH&T at conferences / industry events. Where appropriate, feedback industry findings and developments to internal colleagues/stakeholders e.g. product development team. Reporting Data Ensure that all key reporting data, such as client opportunities, pipeline and sales data and financial forecasts are available to the Deputy Global Managing Director and the Global Managing Director on a regular basis. This will require the Head of Sales Asia to utilise LH&T’s instance of Salesforce. Requirements  Qualifications  We are looking for a personable, confident, credible individual with the following skills / qualities or expertise: Commercially aware with proven success in the life and/or health insurance industry - with sales and/or account management experience. Passionate about their work and contribution to the Company. Good business and financial knowledge – experience in contract negotiations and the setting of commercial terms The ability to work well independently whilst also effectively leading a remotely based team retaining active communication with colleagues on progress, status and plans An agile approach to work and adaptable to change. Experience of working in a growing and developing business. Excellent persuasion and negotiation skills. Experience interacting with senior executives and other senior individuals of prospective clients Calm, diplomatic and self-aware. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent PC skills with good knowledge of Microsoft packages. Self-sufficient with a high level of organisational ability. A high degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Confident and capable of presenting factual data to a wide audience, with the ability to tailor presentation data and style to suit different audiences Well-connected in the Life and/or Health insurance space, with contacts in key decision-making roles. Ability to translate technical information into tangible business benefits that can be easily explained to, and understood by, clients. Motivated and driven by building business through the provision of cutting-edge solutions that facilitate market change. Travel / Availability  The job holder will be based in Verisk’s Singapore office, but will be expected to travel on a regular basis to meet with clients and prospective business leads across Asia  Additional Information  Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.  All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html  Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.  Consumer Privacy Notice

Setup and implement clear pipeline management guidelines for teams to diligently track qualified prospects on a monthly basis, while taking remedial steps as necessary Take ownership of the sales pipeline for all new prospects and existing clients at every stage of the sales funnel Provide regular sales reports, forecasts and set clear milestones (monthly / quarterly / annual) and be accountable for all sales & key accounts strategy across all your teams Ensure your teams understand the company’s offerings, solve customer pain points, provide the suitable solutions, familiarize and identify up-selling and cross-selling opportunities Build and scale a channel partner network with carefully selected, mutually beneficial, and reliable partners Coordinating and conducting research and analysis, which may include developing models and forecasts, analysing the commercial arrangements and partnerships, identify growth areas for existing and new business model Research new business opportunities and assess viable revenue models to develop and align the "go to market" strategy  Requirements 6+ years of business development, technology sales, additional 3+ years in people management and leading high-performance sales team A proven track record of successful sales development in a technology driven and product focused environment with complex stakeholders (prop-tech or smart home technology is desirable) An established network or previous client base in the relevant sector Demonstrable sales planning-based thinking ability with excellent communication skills (verbal, written) and presentation skills is a must Committed and highly collaborative leader who can coach / mentor their sales team while remaining a healthy working culture Ability to effectively monitor and motivate a team to be always result-driven on the overall sales planning roadmap, pipeline management Should have a deep desire to develop a career in a fast growing tech company

description: We see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset. It acts like a compass for us. We are fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that’s not just words on the walls.  Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It’s an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.  We make software robots, so people don’t have to be robots. Would you like to be part of this journey?  Strategic Account Director  We’re currently in search of a Complex Deal Leader for our Enterprise accounts across APJ. This role drives the next wave of growth through an increased focus on the largest customers across our key geographies. These customers are the most complex and highest potential accounts. Our laser-focus on solving their business problems and delivering a world class experience will continue to generate powerful customer testimonies, elevate UiPath to trusted advisor status, and ultimately win even larger multi-million dollar deals.  You will be specifically responsible for partnering with the Sales VP’s to identify high opportunity accounts, create a plan of engagement to deliver value to the customer, and partner with the customer to meet their desired business outcomes. You will be driving all the critical phases of the Cycle (Discovery, Strategy, Negotiation, and Closure). The ideal candidate will have significant C-Suite connections as well as board level experience, be a proven collaborator across internal and external stakeholders, and have demonstrated success in constructing complex multimillion-dollar deals.  Roles And Responsibilities Act as trusted advisor and thought leader in the development of the strategy and deal; partners in the execution of the sales cycle for strategic, complex, or highly competitive opportunities. Inspire and influence internal stakeholders, experts and other resources not under direct control, helping to remove obstacles in order to achieve desired business outcomes Facilitate alignment and effective UiPath communication within internal and external stakeholders and promptly resolves any challenges Cultivate best practices through analysis and reporting in support of continuous improvement. Build complex deal constructs for various YOY license consumption options, do analysis of pros and cons of each option. Directly engage with business decision makers to drive complex deal negotiations, using value levers build unique differentiators for UiPath. Deliver high impact challenger presentations to CXO’s unlocking business value with unique UiPath offerings. Role model for field teams on how to add value to customers by helping them identify business opportunities and by bringing innovative solutions and industry references to realize value. Drive repeatable assets/IP into the organization to scale and enhance large deal expertise (e.g., developing thought leadership around value selling, negotiation strategies & synthesizing customer experiences into reusable content and methodologies) Corporate executive responsible for leading customer/internal facing activities to drive business requirements from company strategy through demand validation and quantification - mapping and delivering a clear and repeatable process for our largest deals & strategic customer. Works closely with local management teams, solution architects, and partner organizations to evangelize and deliver a proven ‘large deal’ process and methodology to customers Essential Criteria 10+ years of Solution Selling, Management Consulting or Strategy Consulting & Sales experience with large enterprise customers. Proven success in constructing and closing multi-million dollar deals Experience leading sales teams Direct field experience in working with enterprise accounts Proven skills in analysis, storytelling, presentation, demonstration, requirements mapping and collaboration Very strong customer relationship and presentation skills & strong analytical skills to support business decisions and priorities. Proven results driven individual with good business acumen Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent) required, MBA or equivalent degree (preferred) 40% to 60% travel as required for customer engagements (post covid) Additional Requirements  The successful candidate must demonstrate a commitment to achieving overall revenue targets and solution positioning. The successful candidate must also engage with partners in the strategy, solution, proof and closing stages of a given sales cycle. Candidates with the ability to succeed in this role will display the following attributes: Excellent sales, communication, negotiation, problem solving and organizational skills; understanding of UiPath strategic direction; ability to develop successful compete strategies, deliver effective presentations; ability to engage with a wide range of audiences from end user to senior management.  Life at UiPath can sometimes feel like a roller coaster. It comes with changes, healthy challenges, and the opportunity to build solutions from the ground up, have great impact, and learn a great deal.  At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.  UiPath is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the process, please contact us @ TALeaders@uipath.com and let us know how we may assist you.  This notice together with our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use of this website and any other documents we mention here are meant to inform you on what personal data about you we collect, use, disclose, share or otherwise process when you are applying for a job at UiPath or when UiPath contacts you for recruitment purposes. Please read this policy carefully to understand our views and practices on how we protect your personal data.

The HQ company has developed an app that is running standard neurological tests using a standard smart phone, thus allowing virtual neurological examination to be conducted anytime, anywhere. By applying an inclusive and personal monitor we make the treatment of neurological disorders more efficient, and personalized for each patient.  Role and Responsibilities Identifying opportunities for new business development through following up on leads and conducting research on target clients New business generation by meeting potential clients to understand needs and providing relevant solutions Supporting the sales process to close new business opportunities Responsible to build good working relationships with the existing portfolio of clients and new contact Responsible to manage the marketing and sales force Participate in weekly / daily communications for updates and sharing of information (conference calls, meetings, reviews, etc.) as designated by the HQ company Qualifications Have a relevant academic degree in economics, business or comparable programs; MBA is a plus The role will be based in Singapore with occasional business travel if required Must be fluent in English; proficiency in other languages is a plus The candidate must have more than 10 years of relevant experience in the IT industry especially in product experience Self-motivated, well-organised and strategic in decision-making ability Resourceful, hands-on, and committed to deliver results, able to prioritize and respond well to changing circumstances and tight timelines Have strong leadership and inter-personal communication skill that can interact at senior management level and deep technical level Strong strategic thinking & planning, team leadership, interpersonal, presentation, negotiation and communication skills Able to work independently and effectively within a team Remunerations Basic salary of $8,000 to $9,000 per month for a full-time employment package Probation period of 3 months Company may offer additional performance incentive based on actual deliverables after confirmation

Application instructions: Interested applicants please apply at https://grnh.se/e27420252us  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it’s built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it’s a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We’re proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That’s why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why Business Insider named us an ‘enterprise startup to bet your career on”! #WeAreBlushing  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley’s fastest growing startups Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave Responsibilities  We are looking for an exceptional Director, Sales (Commercial) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be involved in building and managing a high-performing team to drive new logo acquisition and be responsible for creating and implementing Go-To-Market strategies and initiatives for our Commercial Team. You will also be responsible to: Develop and execute a strategic sales and Go-To-Market plan which delivers revenue and margin growth through the acquisition of new logo clients Reporting on sales activity and revenue forecast. Coach and empower your team to proactively prospect, qualify, and build sales pipeline Enable the team to win business and to navigate complex organizations and negotiations. Provide senior deal support when needed to win as a team Proactively recruit talented sellers for your team based on Workato’s hiring criteria Onboard and ramp new Account Executives and accelerate their ability to be productive Accurately forecast and represent your business to the executive team Develop and execute initiatives with cross-functional stakeholders in the wider Workato org, including Sales, Marketing, Solutions Consulting, Product, and Business Development Have a strong understanding of the Workato platform to provide guidance to your Commercial Sales team Evangelize Workato’s sales playbook and drive adoption and domain expertise within your team Develop and enable the next generation of sales leaders Share learnings and best practices across the entire company Be a company builder Requirements  Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills 5+ years experience of quota-carrying experience technology sales in a competitive market and 3+ years experience building and managing highly successful/talented software sales teams Demonstrate experience with a successful track record in managing accounts, building partnership relationships, driving revenue, hitting and overachievement of sales targets. Understanding of the business issues impacting commercial organizations with ability to educate/evangelize and generate opportunities out of this knowledge Experienced at managing an outbound sales team in all areas of the sales cycle Soft Skills / Personal Characteristics Passionate about coaching, mentorship and team management Demonstrates understanding of the Workato iPaaS & Automation Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time in high-pressure situations, and work in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Capability to build great relationships with highly technical customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Possess strong critical thinking and analytical skills with an entrepreneurial mindset Motivated by helping people grow with a desire to continue learning A self-starter with the ability to work in a high-growth, rapidly changing marketplace Have the ability to learn quickly and establish credibility. description: Teads are looking for a Sales Director, SEA to promote the Teads Global Media Platform and strategic accounts into agencies and advertisers across the Singapore and South East Asia, whilst also managing a team 10+ salespeople  As the right arm of the Managing Director, your mission will be to: Define and implement the sales strategy for the region Proactively develop business on all Teads products Manage a top-performing sales team, train and guide them to drive growth Meet quarterly and annual revenue targets Develop strong, mutually beneficial relationships with high level clients Represent Teads and be a brand ambassador in the online advertising marketplace Work closely with internal teams such as Customer Experience and Publishing to ensure client campaign expectations are clear, on time, and on budget Ensure a high level of client satisfaction to generate renewals and increase incremental revenue at all times Qualifications 8+ years of digital media sales experience Excellent knowledge of the online advertising industry required Deep relationships with senior contacts at top-tier agencies and advertisers Strong people management skills Previous technology platform experience is a huge plus Desire to work in a changing, fast-paced company Outstanding communication and presentation skills Driven, passionate, and an ultimate team player Knowledge of regional markets a big plus ===== ABOUT TEADS ======  Teads, The Global Media Platform, is the single access point for advertisers to connect to the world’s best publishers and reach an audience of over 1.9 billion people every month.  Teads’ made-for-mobile ad experiences deliver the best combination of mass reach and brand safety in the market. Teads’ end-to-end platform provides a sustainable advertising ecosystem that respectfully connects brands to consumers. Teads demand-side, sell-side and creative technology delivers effective and engaging advertising experiences for consumers, guaranteed outcomes for brands, and ultimately powers publishers with better monetization solutions to fund quality journalism.  Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 850+ people in 29 countries.  We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.

description: Summary  The Head of Region APAC is responsible for proposing and executing the HT Trading plan in the APAC Region by: As a member of the Management Team, ensuring adequate processes and resources are deployed; Developing and Managing a network of internal and external business partners; Managing a team of traders; Ensuring strategic alignment with Holcim Group entities; Managing risk and compliance for trading in his/her region Maximizing volume and ROIC with third party customers Main Activities / Responsibilities  Strategy  The Head Of Region Is Responsible For The Following Contribution to the elaboration of the overall global trading strategy. He/she is responsible for ensuring its execution in his/her Zone for all product lines (Cement, clinker, cementitious, gypsum, ARM and any other products, which the Group may allocate from time to time) A key contributor to “read” the worldwide international cementitious market, to identify opportunities and risks and to anticipate them. Proposes and is involved in specific strategic development projects related to seaborne import/export of all products traded in the zone. Helps import/export Group companies in the definition and implementation of their own strategy and optimization of their footprint when related to international seaborne flows. She/he provides expertise on investment alternatives. In charge of developing and maintaining a network of decision makers (usually company CEOs) in the global cement industry, in particular in countries where the Group does not have a presence. Responsible for the global strategy and coordination of the following product lines: gypsum, OWC, white cement and aggregates. Business objectives  He/she Is Accountable For Defining The Trading Roadmap In Line With The Overall Trading Strategy For The Regions  The Head of Region APAC is accountable for his/her trading P&L. Satisfaction of export/import requirements of Group companies at market prices Maximize third party volumes and ROIC by leveraging on pooling of volumes, optimizing and arbitraging flows and qualities, as well as taking positions. Definition and implementation of the trading development plan; priority countries and target customers, value propositions, trading resource allocation… Manage extreme situations (e.g. sudden shortage of cement / clinker in one country), Leverage Group assets by maximizing their utilization, and capture value for the Group from imbalances. Manage key customers/suppliers/partners through regular visits and Customer Satisfaction Survey animation Foster innovation through the development of service offer, new product offer, as part of the targeted model. Integrate and animate of the worldwide management cycle for Trading. Implement the set objectives received/agreed with the Trading Excom : define and seek approval on the yearly budget including transfer Prices, arbitrage across sources,… Validate resource allocation to ensure resources (people and financial) are used optimally vs target set Ensure performance tracking on a monthly basis as per KPI dashboard People development  As a member of HT management Team, the Head of Region APAC contributes to the overall safety performance of HT Trading. He/she is directly responsible for the Health and Safety of direct and N-2 reports.  The zonal trading team reports directly or indirectly to their corresponding Head of Region.  The Head of Region APAC is responsible for ensuring adequate staffing of the zonal trading team in line with HT overall ambition. He/she also ensures the personal development of each trader in line with the respective competency profiles.  The Head of Region APAC also plays a key role to ensure effective team work at the interfaces between his/her Trading team, Operations and the support functions (Business Intelligence, Finance, Shipping, Legal…), as well as with the Trading teams of other zones and Corporate Procurement.  The trader’s job being a Group development position, the Head of Region APAC plays a key role in coaching and developing identified Group talents and to prepare them for future general management or senior commercial positions.  Risk management  Due to the nature of international seaborne trading, risk management is a key responsibility of the Head of Region APAC: Adherence of Trading team to the Holcim Code of Business Conduct and all other applicable Group policies Monitoring of the enforcement of the Holcim Trading and Shipping Policies in the zone; Protection of the Holcim Group reputation and brand value for relevant seaborne trading activities. Approval of trades and execution of contracts as authorized by CEO of LH Trading within the framework of the Group and LH Trading delegation of authority Supervision of trades and early identification and resolution of potential risks Arbitration on Group sources / destinations in order to optimize overall costs whilst balancing country and customer risks; Direct intervention on material risk prevention Crisis management A posteriori controls on key risks to ensure respect of corporate governance Proposes, approves and monitors as per DOA model open position taking/closing. Profile Required  Educational Background / Qualifications: Higher technical/commercial education, ideally business degree (MBA)  Experience required: min. 15 years of management positions in building materials / cement businesses. Sales, Marketing and Strategy experience is a must, ideally completed by exposure to maritime logistics.  Competency Profile Technical competencies / job knowledge: in depth understanding of cement values, properties and usages for various types of customers (IP, GS, distributors, construction sites…). Expertise in international seaborne trading and maritime regulations and logistics. Managerial and Interpersonal competencies / communication; agility to adjust management style and interpersonal skills to a broad variety of country and company cultures whilst consistently promoting Group / trading values and principles. Politically savvy and diplomacy in particular to manage intra-Group tensions. Cultural and language Skills; Bilingual English, mastery of at least 1 additional internationally representative languages. Posted experience in at least 2 different countries. Strong appetite and curiosity for geo-political topics and multinational cultures. Mobility requirements: Time spent travelling internationally, nationally etc. is very high (more than 50% of the time)  Position is based in Singapore

description: Looking for an expert in selling software to CPG & Retail Individual contributor role at the start  About Our Client  Our client is a listed global player in selling software & services to various sectors including but not limited to Retail, CPG, FSI and Public Sector. In the last six months, they have made significant investments in the South & South East Asia regions with a view to take more market share across these verticals. In line with these growth plans, they've already hired Sales Directors to lead FSI, Insurance and Public Sector verticals and are now looking to hire a Sales Director, ASEAN for their Retail & CPG vertical.  Job Description  Reporting directly to the Regional Head, this role is tasked to hunt for new enterprise sales business in the region. In addition, the role will indirectly be responsible for managing delivery and implementation teams.  The Success Of This Role Will Be Measured On Shaping and implementing business development plans and strategies across Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam etc. Becoming the key point of contact for existing retail & CPG clients, understanding their pain points, and providing relevant solutions Hunting for new business across enterprise clients in the retail & CPG verticals In the next two years, hire and train a lean team of sales and account management professionals Being 100% accountable for the top-line across these verticals in ASEAN Consult internal product and marketing teams to align solutions to client needs and represent the firm at major industry events  The Successful Applicant  The Applicant Needs To Meet The Following Criteria To Be Considered  This is a highly visible role within the business, being the second in command to the Regional Director. MBA or Masters' in a relevant discipline Proven track record in positively driving solution sales across SaaS, IaaS or PaaS within the CPG and Retail verticals Have existing contacts with the major enterprise retail and CPG clients in ASEAN Minimum twelve years in enterprise sales and at five in the ASEAN region, in a hunting role Ability to work independently Excellent communication and relationship development skills Strong business ethics and values to align to the corporate culture  What's On Offer  experience and performance. They are looking for someone who is seeking a long-term career in a growth focused firm while recognizing the potential challenges as an outcome of covid-19. As part of their planning for 2022, they are looking to hire an inspirational Sales Director, ASEAN - Retail & CPG Software. The OTE for the role will be in the range of SGD 350,000 - 450,000 (50-50).  Contact: Anurag Garg (Lic No: R1215997)  Quote job ref: 4219791

description: About This Job  Job Description  This position will be responsible for maintaining/enhancing customer relationships with an aim to improve client satisfaction, via increasing client ROI & driving the adoption of new capabilities. This role will lead a delivery team to ensure prompt delivery of service, ensure the quality of the data insight with actionable business recommendations, based on a deep understanding of client business and expertise across NielsenIQ solutions.  Responsibilities  Client Engagement Model Leads the Joint Business Plan process via identifying and aligning client business priorities to define the strategic service delivery elements with clear execution timeline and SMART objectives Leads QBO and Client review process, focusing on service quality and ROI elements to refine the JBP and alignment with clients on a regular basis. Responsible for regularly updating client health internal tracker, ability to anticipate issues before they occur, bringing all CS functions and key partners together to act on/resolve issues. Accountable for Net Promoter Score (Client satisfaction survey) process & result, ensuring service quality meets client expectation, timely addressing client escalations. Client Servicing and Value Creation Responsible for collecting Voice of Client on their experience & servicing quality, sending to country/cub-region Managing Director to feed into product or strategy team Accountable for managing client relationship, consulting Analytic Insight and Customer Service team throughout process on analytics, client experience, or service model Leads client relationship management throughout issue escalation in collaboration with internal stakeholders to ensure quality response to client Discovering and Proposing Work with Commercial team to include Service Model elements in contract renewal with clients from the planning stage Responsible for identifying opportunities through day to day engagement and handling off to Commercial teams for further stages. People Management Establish high standards of performance and hold associates firmly accountable for meeting with those standards Provide support, recognition and feedback to assist associates towards achieving the performance expectations and standards Act as coach, guide and mentor to employees and contribute to succession plan for the team Establish a strong team environment focused on exceeding internal and external client requirements About You  You will lead a delivery team to ensure prompt delivery of service, ensure the quality of the data insight with actionable business recommendations, based on a deep understanding of client business and expertise across NielsenIQ solutions.  Qualifications Min. Bachelor Degree any major; min GPA 3.25 5+ years of experience in related field (research agency, marketing consultant) A broad understanding of client sales and marketing issues Knowledge of research techniques and methodologies would be an advantage Min. 3 years in managerial level Strong ability to influence and lead through change Process mindset, focus on simplification and efficiency Ability to build and retain a high performing team Excellent analytical skills Excellent communication skills and presentation skills An ability to work independently and in a team Good interpersonal skills Fluent in English both written and verbal About NielsenIQ  Additional Information  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.  NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting a Director, Strategic Account Management to join our team in Singapore.  About Aon  Headquartered in London, Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.  Responsibilities: Retain and grow Aon’s business, cultivating relationships with C-suite and executive client decision-makers in the client organisation. Facilitate critical relationships between clients, Aon colleagues and carriers. Actively prospect and develop new multi-national clients for Aon, focusing on Technology & Digital Economies, by effectively communicating the value Aon delivers to prospects across the pillars of Risk, Health, Reinsurance, Retirement and Data & Analytics. Ensure a strong Sales Plan and/or Client Promise Plan is created, as part of the Client Value Creation Model (CVCM), that will align Aon to bring value that significantly contributes to clients achieving their goals and objectives. Develop and manage the implementation of CVCM for each client and prospect, including a specific client plan to deliver year on year revenue growth. Ensure client service team understanding of client needs, service delivery methods, and the economic framework relevant to services delivered. Project manage all Aon and industry-related resources to achieve client objectives. Lead stewardship planning and service delivery in line with CVCM, Client Promise and Aon values. Ensure overall account profitability with a value-based approach for the scope of service and costs associated with the Client Promise Plan. Negotiate Aon compensation for services, whether fee or commission-based, in line with Aon Asia protocols. Ensure that the full value of involved Aon specialists and practice groups is promoted and articulated to clients and prospects. Understand and work in alignment with the Aon Impact Model and its pillars of Client Value, Develop Teams, Enable Innovation and Business Results. Establish clear roles, responsibilities and performance expectations for client service teams that deliver Aon products and services to each client. Ensure that team members meet their responsibilities and influence team composition as appropriate. Educate clients in risk management, risk transfer, market issues and relevant trends (across risk & health) including appropriate data & analytics. Drive the renewal process, assembling the appropriate team to develop and implement the client-specific renewal strategy. Coordinate with Brokers in the development and delivery of renewal strategies. Possess strong influence across the Aon organisation to align resources across geographic (including international), functional and business unit boundaries to best serve clients. Deliver interdependent responses to opportunities to grow the business. Ensure that account data supports the integrity of company accounting and tracking systems. Manage expenses. Ensure operational excellence, including adherence to service management requirements and internal best practice. Serve as a champion of best practice. Position and maintain your social media profile as a thought leader by leveraging Aon thought leadership and collateral on platforms such as LinkedIn. Perform other related duties as assigned. Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, with Risk and Insurance Management/Business related curriculum preferred Relevant Broker License Knowledge of the scope of insurance products and services (across risk and health) 10+ years of appropriate insurance experience, coupled with project and account team management experience Excellent influencing, communication and negotiation skill In-depth working knowledge of the insurance business and the clients’ needs as well as all major lines of business Well-developed problem solving, communication, presentation, influencing and negotiation skills Strong leadership qualities and an ability to influence and motivate staff in the achievement of objectives Strong relationship development skills, in dealings with both internal and external customers and stakeholders Demonstrated ability to implement and manage operational, service and broking metrics and satisfy client KPIs Demonstrated ability to deliver new clients by following a well-planned and structured sales process Ability to execute plans into positive business actions with measurable results How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.  2496375
industries: Insurance and Financial Services

description: TOGETHER, WE SAVE LIVES  After a long delay do to the worldwide COVID Pandemic, we are in the process of expanding the SAFARILAND footprint more strategically in the Asian Pacific Region. We are open to locations that include: Singapore, Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and Australia. If you have a passion for protecting Law Enforcement & Military professionals, then you need to seriously entertain our role.  Overview  Responsible for meeting sales revenue and business development targets within the assigned market. Identifies and successfully secures business development and sales opportunities in the designated market, regions or territories Will develop strategies to penetrate new markets and validate pipeline opportunities. Will regularly monitor team progress against targets. Participate in business development activities. Liaises with internal teams to link emerging requirements with capabilities. Supports business development and market research activities. Interacts with company representatives, corporate business partners and end-user agencies regarding company products and services.  Responsibilities Develops a detailed understanding of productions, sales objective and growth strategies, pricing and delivery policies and practices Understands the prospects’ and customer’s critical issues and initiatives and linking solutions to ensure achievement Assists in the development of sales, pursuit and capture of strategies to generate revenues for company products within the assigned geographic territory Conducts briefings, capability presentations and training demonstrations for products and services within sales territory Develops and maintains customer contacts and initiates and establishes new contacts with the military, embassies, Federal Law Enforcement and other government agencies Establishes, maintains and grows high-level, executive level relationships with key decision makers and market drivers Qualifies prospects according to capabilities and applicability. Managing the execution of the sales process and leveraging appropriate resources to secure sales Assumes leadership and ownership of presentation, proposals and other documents including RFP and FRI responses Provides accurate sales forecasts based on realistic close timelines Communicating product improvements and recommendations that originate in the field. Utilizes automated forecasting tools to track all opportunities and prospect/customer related information Manages partners and key users of network and ensures they are current on product line and working effectively on our behalf Provides functional and technical guidance and leadership to Partners Manages resources to achieve results within the assigned territory Monitors revenue achievement against targets and adjusts sales plans/territory strategies according. Qualifications Bachelors’ degree in International Business and/or Marketing, Management or related fields. Prefer MBA in International Business or related field Aggressive, highly motivated hunter with solid track record of project leadership to completion Motivated, self-starting leader with significant experience in the market Previous experience working in International Contracts and standard practices and protocols Previous experience in Business Development/Sales with Military/Law Enforcement/Public Safety/Security markets Experience managing a team of technical support, sales and marketing resources Consultative, value-proposition/business case driven sales methodology experience. We pride ourselves on hiring and developing the best people, without regard to age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic characteristics, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage, citizenship, disability, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or any other legally-recognized protected basis prohibited by applicable law.  For those applicants with disabilities, if you require reasonable accommodation in searching for a job opening or submitting an application, please contact us by calling 888-469-6455. description: A Regional Business Development Director job has just become available at a leading provider of product and consulting services to some of the world’s largest finance, technology and energy institution. You will be responsible for cultivating and closing deals with financial services clients across the ASEAN and South Asia markets.  About The Regional Business Development Director Role  As the Regional Business Development Director based in Singapore, you are primarily responsible for cultivating and closing deals with financial services clients across the ASEAN and South Asia markets. The target verticals are across the entire financial spectrum from Regulators, Exchanges, Sell Side to Buy Side large and small institutions. Covering the front, middle and back office functions of a traditional financial institution with an understanding of all asset classes. In this role, you will work cross-functionally with technical sales, solution teams, consulting, professional services, project management, delivery, support, corporate marketing, to build and deliver revenue growth  Key Responsibilities Achieve and consistently surpass stated revenue goals Maintain an accurate forecast at all times and to build and grow a strong set of opportunities to ensure there is sufficient pipeline to meet sales targets Use value-based selling to effectively manage all aspects of a complex sales cycle C-suite access: have an extensive rolodex to extend the footprint through thought leadership and a proven track record working at the C-suite level. Cold calling: outbound sales calls to develop new business opportunities Close new business opportunities presented via lead generation team. Prospect new contacts at leading institutions across the capital markets vertical Mine existing accounts for up-selling and cross-selling of new opportunities Take ownership of the bid process in responding to client RFI/RFPs to a high-quality optimising sale value and chances of client acceptance whilst ensuring compliance with company policies and standards Report detailed activities to senior level management within the company Engage in project deliveries (including support) to achieve high customer satisfaction, to resolve customer issues in a timely, efficient and profitable manner Contribute to the software product strategies to enhance the product opportunity and marketability Work with other functions to deliver high customer satisfaction. Develop a deep understanding of the business, technology and solutions To succeed in this role, you should be a self-starter who has an extensive and proven sales track record of selling multi-million dollar solutions with access to senior C-suite executives and is motivated to build a new business.  Key Requirements At least 10 years of software sales experience within the capital markets Proven sales track record by consistently overachieving multimillion sales targets Self-starter, passionate, articulate professional with experience of working in Asia Experience selling complex solutions across the complete financial spectrum of Exchanges, Regulators, Buy and Sell Side institutions in Asia A competent understanding of the financial markets across all asset classes; from front to mid and back office and an appreciation of the transactional life cycle Good understanding of existing and emerging innovative technologies such as Blockchain; Machine Learning; Cloud services; Data Science techniques Development of a deep understanding of business, technology and solutions Presentation skills: proven ability to succinctly articulate the value proposition and differentiators to set solutions and products apart from the competition Experience in presenting and gathering requirements at the all levels across an organisation with the ability to engage, persuade and influence the VP and C-suite levels An appreciation of working across multiple cultural divides and proven track record of working in a collaborative and respectful manner Outstanding written and verbal communication skills The organisation is a leading provider of IT product and consulting services to some of the world’s largest finance, technology and energy institutions. Their product and software business unit is embarking on an aggressive expansion program to further extend client footprint across capital markets and other regional industry sectors. Over the last seven years, their Asia region has seen phenomenal growth.  If you are a seasoned professional who enjoys winning and has access to C-suite executive contacts within the financial services sector, this Regional Business Development role based in Singapore will be a good fit for you.  Do apply to this exciting opportunity today.  Robert Walters (Singapore) Pte Ltd  ROC No.: 199706961E | EA Licence No.: 03C5451  EA Registration No.: R1874494 Claire Teo

description: Founded in Singapore in 2013, Castlery is an online furniture brand that creates its own distinctive, quality furniture designs and offers them at accessible prices via a seamless, fuss-free experience for the modern furniture shopper. Since then, we have grown into overseas markets like the United States and Australia.  As an e-commerce tech start-up, we move decisively on insightful data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that is as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. It is a place where all ideas are listened to; where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark.  If you are eager to make an impact at a fast-growing technology company and you have a passion for moving the needle, come join us!  Job Responsibilities  Our Sales Team seats central in providing a seamless online-to-offline strategy for our Singapore Market – situated in our Showroom at Jit Poh Building, they are responsible for providing a great shopping experience in store as well as helping potential customers choose the right products for their dream home. As our Head of Sales, you will be taking on a leaderships position and overseeing the current Sales Team, as well as executing various strategic initiatives to scale the business. Your job responsibilities are as per below. Responsible to articulate and implement organisation’s strategy for selling products and to develop forecasts and strategies to achieve sales. Lead the team to motivate and ensure effective performance of Relationships Managers and Sales Consultants. Manage sales team individual performance – sales targets, leads conversion and customer engagement. Develop and maintain sales training program to train and retrain sales full timers and part-timers. Focusing on sales techniques, product knowledge, customer services and personal grooming. Set sales strategy, align sales structure with the strategy and manage staff to implement sales processes. Work closely with marketing in launching new collections to ensure best showroom exposure. Constantly seeking to increase average order value. Store operational excellence by ensuring general store maintenance, visual merchandising and monthly stocktake. Monitor closely in business intelligent (BI) to drive performance from various main categories to SKU level. Assist and influence the HQ team to provide insight to the wider team. Work closely with marketing and purchasing team to influence forecast demand and ensure consistent supply amidst seasonal trends. Work closely with marketing and demand team to execute exit strategies for unproductive inventory. Build staff hiring plan to fully execute business vision. Organise effective regular sales meeting with team and cross departments. Engage regularly with Castlery management and department heads to ensure continued alignment between brands and functions. Keeps abreast of Castlery’s product range, product applications, technical services, market conditions, competitive activities, advertising and promotional trends by consulting with various departments. Requirements Strong track record in retail operations management and driving strategic growth. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Prior leadership/people management experience, taking care of a team of more than 5 sales representatives. Preferred university qualifications or professional equivalent. At least 8 to 10 Years' of experience in a similar role, with a minimum of 5 years in a Managerial & Leadership level role. Be able to perform under volume workload and stress during peak season. A professional, pro-active and ‘can do’ attitude with good attention to detail and a passion for providing outstanding customer service. Familiar with Freshworks or similar software is preferred.
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: The sales team responsible for our APAC central government customers is driven by our mission to make the world a safer place by tracking and investigating activities that involve cryptocurrency like human trafficking, terrorist financing, and money-laundering. We’re experts on the “why” and the “how” with deep relationships and knowledge of navigating government sales processes.  Sales Directors are servant leaders dedicated to enabling their team and yet still enjoy the thrill creating a calculated account plan and then closing a deal. Charged with leading a team of high-performing sales reps and hiring as needed to meet increasing market demand, you know how to attract exceptional talent, evaluate sales skills, and run a hiring process that is lean and leaves a positive impression on every candidate. We measure your success by your ability to accurately forecast revenue and hit (read: exceed) quotas and the engagement of your team.  In one year you’ll know you were successful if… You’ve developed a winning team who are exceeding their quota and objectives. You’ve upskilled the team’s ability to drive sales wins by participating in and leading client and prospect meetings. Stakeholders across the sales teams and rest of the company trust you and are eager to support and provide resources to your team. You’ve built transparent and valuable relationships with your team and have developed an effective and efficient strategy for recruiting, hiring, and training new Account Executives on the sales motion at Chainalysis. Your team has a reliable cadence for rhythm for forecast meetings and each team member’s forecast is accurate and documented in Salesforce. Your team’s closure rates have increased and customer churn has decreased because of your direct coaching and mentorship. Senior sales management can trust and rely on your forecasts and sales activity to inform the overall sales strategy across the business. You know the intricacies of your teams’ sales activity and track the results to inform your forecasts and individual development plans. A Background Like This Helps Recent experience managing and closing complex software sales within EMEA Central Government customers. Experience managing the sales cycle from mission/program manager to agency leadership Strong relationships in the System Integrator and Defense community Key industry knowledge and ability to effectively articulate the Chainalysis value proposition Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Ability to negotiate pricing, terms and conditions and other concessions in complex, multi-year sales agreements. History of scaling and coaching high-performing and diverse sales teams Experience with Financial Intelligence, Blockchain, Cyber Security, and/or Cryptocurrency technologies At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.  You belong here.  At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Juneteenth, Harvey Milk Day, and International Migrant’s Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Candidate GDPR Notice.  By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.  Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - USA Employees are not required to attend in-person meetings at this time. All in-person, Chainalysis attendees must be vaccinated* prior to the in-person event/meeting You must follow cleaning protocols. This includes washing your hands before and after meetings or using a disinfectant or alcohol solution with at least 70% alcohol If a worker or visitor was in close or proximate contact with others at the office location and tests positive for COVID-19, they must immediately notify the People team *A USA employee is considered fully vaccinated if they meet any of the following criteria: It has been 2 weeks since their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines, or It has been 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen vaccine, or A person has recovered from a COVID-19 infection and was treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma and are within 90 days of the treatment. Please note that once 90 days has passed after the monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma treatment, an employee will not be permitted to meet in-person or go to a customer meeting until they meet the above criteria of being fully vaccinated Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - EMEA  As an employer, Chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. This means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities. To help support a safe work environment, we encourage all employees in EMEA to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting. Employees in the EU and the UK are allowed to travel internationally for internal meetings to any country deemed “green or amber” by the EU and the UK authorities. All attendees for Chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines: International travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and Executive Leader You must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or event You must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law If you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for COVID-19, you must immediately notify the People Team and avoid contact with others for 10 days Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - APAC  With circumstances changing on a regular basis and parts of our APAC team going in and out of mandatory lockdown, APAC will continue to follow country legislation and guidelines.

description: Position Summary This individual is a senior level sales manager who is expected to affect the timely and profitable sale of relocation and moving services to major corporate employers across the Asia region. Acts as subject matter expert and coach within the organization drawing upon their depth of experience and actions with complex sales pursuits Meet on a regular basis with the SVP of Sales and Account Management to set a specific strategy on each new account to maximize our potential revenue opportunity Responsible for managing new pursuit strategies, pricing strategies and managing the RFP process Responsible for managing new pursuit profitability to include client margin, product conversion, SLA performance, and in-depth knowledge of pricing. The Regional Corporate Manager is responsible for executing multi-key stakeholder sales, all key prospects within his/her territory, surfacing viable opportunities for sales, organizing the internal committee that will sell to the prospect committee, crafting a complex financial sales strategy for each account and orchestrating the activities of the team and the prospect organization toward a close and implementation.  The Regional Corporate Manager is expected to hold approximately 15 face-to-face meetings per month with the team and 25% of these should be first meetings with new prospects and 75% follow-up and closure meetings.The Regional Corporate Manager can expect to spend approximately 30% of his/her work time traveling to attend client meetings.  The Regional Corporate Manager works with team members to exemplify the company’s breadth of resources, depth of experience and commitment to teamwork.Responsible for producing results, meeting their team goals and keeping management informed.  Functions And Responsibilities  Percentage  Function  15 % Acts as subject matter expert within the organization drawing upon their depth of experience and actions with complex sales pursuits. Meet on a regular basis with team members and the SVP Sales and Account Management to set a specific strategy on each account to maximize our current and potential revenue opportunity Managing pursuit upsell and profitability to include client margin, product conversion, SLA performance, and understanding of costs of delivery 10 % Holding prospect meetings, Lead generation & development - Networking for referrals, Phone & Web research, Pre-qualifying prospects for meetings 50 % Preparing for meetings with teams, strategizing with team members, management, preparing formal proposals, following-up with prospects 10 % Preparing reports to/for management 5 % Training 5 % Sales Dept Meetings Qualifications And Preferred Skills At least 5 years of professional selling in a business to business environment with a track record of meeting or exceeding team goals Extensive experience in the Global Mobility Industry required Ability to evaluate clients utilizing all known information in the public domain and develop advanced sales strategy Ability to interface with multiple stakeholders, i.e., finance, human resources, procurement, shared services Prior experience of managing complex sales pursuits Ability to provide evidence of a consistent record of goal attainment and several favourable references from past or current clients, managers and direct reports Candidates selling complex supply chain solutions or utilizing total cost of ownership methodology would be highly desirable Candidates should be able to provide evidence of a consistent record of goal attainment and several favorable references from past or current clients, managers and direct reports Strong interpersonal skills Strong working use of statistics and analytics Strong analytical skills Strong presentation skills Strong oral and written communication skills Background with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Powerpoint) Education And Certification Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above

Reporting to the Vice President of Worldwide Sales and Marketing, the Sales and Business Development Director for APAC works with customers (internal and external) to sustain and develop new business for Guavus within the region of APAC.  Responsibilities Formulate a strategy/plan to develop and manage the lifecycle of AI /Analytics projects with key stake holders, partners and accounts within the assigned territory. Entertain CXOs and working level conversations across different organizations, building trust and leading to new leads /opportunity identification. Plan and develop catered service offering for APAC region, develop a Go-To-Market strategy and a sales enablement plan to ensure business growth with multiple stake holders within the assigned territory. Work closely with the different Guavus teams internally (Field-CTO, Customer Success, Partnership management, etc…) to qualify and create new leads within the assigned territory. Drive cross functional resources such as data scientists, data engineers, cloud architects, customer success, multiple business stakeholders to ensure project smooth progress internal and external challenges, drive the resource towards successful delivery and results. Manage and create new business relationship (internal and external) that will help Guavus sustain and increase its business within the assigned territory. Sustain and upsell on existing business opportunities with existing MNOs or other Internal/external customers in different verticals (Government, Transport) Achieving or exceeding sales targets within the assigned territory Working from opportunity identification, to formulating use cases resolving complex client’s issues with advanced analytics. Closing and successfully delivering new business within assigned territory Maintaining and reporting an accurate sales forecast and update on sales opportunities/leads Requirements 7 -15 years of experience in Sales and Business development to CSPs and potentially other vertical segments within the APAC region ideally in the field of AI/Analytics field. Bachelor’s degree / Master’s in Computer Science or equivalent Knowledge of APAC Telco market and ideally other vertical markets (Gov, Transport) Knowledge of advanced analytics, AI based platform and Cloud transformation domains is an asset Track record in Sales/Business development

description: Job Description  Lazada’s Regional Marketing Solutions is a strategic function that spearheads the adoption, optimisation and growth of Lazada's sponsored solution suite, an A.I powered marketing tool for our brands and sellers. This team is responsible for the regional management of global strategic brands and agency relationships. It is also responsible for developing and driving effective sales enablement, championing strategic projects to support our local stakeholders in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam, and Thailand.  We are looking for talents who are passionate about E-commerce ecosystem, brands commerce marketing and data-driven solutions. Possessing strong experience in ad tech, performance marketing, global brands media management, strategic-planning and consultative sales is a major plus.  The Regional Strategic Account Management role is responsible for owning and driving strategic relationship and growth of our global accounts, together with our local teams, empowering their store success in LazMall with Lazada’s sponsored solution suites.  The job scope includes: - Account and relationship management to drive client satisfaction, business results and investment growth; - Working closely with our local countries in leading the full sales cycle from pitching to closing for new strategic accounts and grow existing accounts through effective strategies including budgeting, optimisation and solutions adoptions; - Developing innovative and strategic regional sales initiatives based on identified account opportunities, category trends and brands’ needs; - Partnering with solution strategist and data experts to build and provide insightful performance analysis, recommendations and business proposals;  Requirements: - At least 6 years or more experience working in highly analytical and fast-paced environments such as top agencies, management consulting or digital/ecommerce companies. Ad-tech/performance advertising is a plus; - Relevant experience in managing global brands in south-east asia markets as account lead; - A strong track record in delivering impactful business outcomes as a digital marketing expert, partnership builder and growth driver; - Ability to connect the dots, perform complex analysis and communicate findings and solutions in a strategic, concise way for senior management; - Highly skilled and persuasive in creating marketing/sales strategy materials; - Proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects while paying extreme attention to detail; - Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience; - Excellent persuasive written, verbal communication, and presentation skills.
