description: To support our ambitious growth plan, we are seeking for a heavy-hitter sales individual who has a steady track-record of selling profitable new mid-large accounts to join our Asia Pacific team. If you're ready for an exciting and challenging new endeavour with one of the world's most respected Travel Management Companies, then read on!   Sales Director, Asia Pacific   (This is an individual contributor role)   Your responsibilities:    Achieve and exceed defined monthly, quarterly and annual sales targets of profitable new mid-large accounts  Develop and execute a sales prospecting plan to target and develop key accounts within Asia Pacific  Create value-driven proposals and presentations to maximise win-rate  Deliver winning sales presentations that clearly articulate the BCD brand, service and value proposition  Works closely with and senior regional and national leadership teams and global stakeholders when appropriate to win customers  Effective use of Salesforce to manage sales activity and measure results  Deliver regular reports and analysis such as daily call reports, weekly work plans, and monthly and annual territory analysis  Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, etc  Be a team coach / player-- increasing team competencies by mentoring and supporting less experienced team members through the sales process to win targeted accounts    We're looking for you if your profile matches the following:    Minimum of five (5) years of sales and marketing experience, preferably in the travel, meetings and incentives, or technology industries and in international arena  A degree holder  Solid track-record of selling profitable new mid-large accounts and developing prospects within the APAC region and in the travel industry  Good command of spoken and written English  Excellent prospecting, negotiation and presentation skills  Confident, proactive and independent   If you have a solid understanding of the business travel industry and a track record of winning new business, we want to talk to you!   How to apply: Create a profile and upload your CV and cover letter via our website or use the 'Apply on company website' button on LinkedIn. Do not send your application via e-mail.   What we offer you:   This is an exciting job within a global company. You'll be working with a great international team of colleagues. And, we offer you a competitive package, training, career development, flexible hours and a dynamic work environment.   Get to know us   BCD Travel helps companies make the most of what they spend on travel. For travellers, this means keeping them safe and productive, and equipping them to make good choices on the road. For travel and procurement managers, it means advising them on how to grow the value of their travel program. In short, we help our clients travel smart and achieve more. We make this happen in 109 countries with more than 13,800 creative, committed and experienced people. And it's how we maintain an industry leading client-retention rate of 95%, with 2019 sales of US$27.5billion. For more information, visit www.bcdtravel.com.   This position is not open to third-party recruiting agencies.   Due to Covid-19, we seek your understanding that only applicants who are legally authorized to work in Singapore without need for company sponsorship will be considered.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Financial Services, and Leisure, Travel & Tourism

description: CaseWare is a remote first company with opportunities in Canada, the United States and a few other countries across the globe. Since the global pandemic we have adapted an Agile Work Strategy, which aims to give people the option to work from home or work from a CaseWare office. Feel free to ask us questions about our approach at any point in the interview process.  CaseWare is a global technology company, and our solutions enable business-critical work for users in 130 countries and in 16 spoken languages. We are a product-driven company, supporting accounting firms, corporations, and governments. With innovation, efficiency, quality and value in mind, we build market software solutions for auditors that push the technological boundaries in the industry. We have a track record of success building great products and teams by always putting our customers first, and have over 30 years of deep expertise in the space. CaseWare is now in our next growth phase and needs incredible talent- like you.  CW Asia, located in Singapore, is CaseWare’s office for the ASEAN region servicing both the region and the Singapore market. In CaseWare’s global strategy the ASEAN region is a key growth market.  We are building great products to support customers we care deeply about. To do that, we need incredible talent. Interested? Read more below on how you can be a part of the CaseWare journey.  A bit about the role & team | the opportunity:  The Head of Business Development drives the expansion in the ASEAN region by exploring new regional markets (countries) and different verticals (corporates, government) by building up relationships with new and potential clients and partners and initiating customer events. Opportunities will be prioritized by chance of success, potential, matureness of the new markets and investment needed in product localization/development. For product localization, the Europe & Middle East team collaborates closely with CW Asia.  For the local Singapore market activities include further expansion of CaseWare’s brand awareness, driving new sales and securing renewals through excellent customer support and pro-active client communication on releases and updates. A key activity will be managing the introduction of Cloud Apps in Singapore.  Who You Will Work With  CaseWare Asia  Wenqian Chua, Ken Chan, Andre Ong, Carolyn Yau  Head of Business Development Europe & Middle East  Jaap de Waard  CaseWare Europe & Middle East  Andre Sunkel  Highlight of your responsibilities Responsible for the overall strategic direction of the region and managing the day to day operations with the CaseWare Asia team. Proposes improvements to all needed operational aspects of the team needed to achieve the goals set for the ASEAN region, including people, products and processes. Strategy & management Define and execute strategy per market in the ASEAN region. Set goals for the CaseWare Asia team to deliver localized versions of international products. Innovate the business model as appropriate, incorporating best practices from other territories. Effectively manage and further extend the CaseWare Asia team to keep pace with growth in markets, products and customers. Analyze sales, marketing, finance and other reports to gain insights to improve performance and maximize growth. Partnerships Maintain and extend relationships with current partners. Identify and create new partnerships, including local resellers and local content partners. Sales & Coverage Build up brand awareness by word of mouth, maintaining and further nurturing relationships with existing clients. Organize and attend events or trade shows, communicating the benefits of CaseWare software. Manage the sales team to create and identify new prospects in the ASEAN region and leveraging of existing global arrangements. Regionally: Asian countries East of India, Hong Kong, Taiwan, South Korea and Japan. Not including mainland China. Expected travel 30-50% (in non COVID times). We are looking for someone who Is entrepreneurial, has a hands-on mindset in growing the business. Has proven experience in defining and building new markets and generating new sales across multiple channels. Has proven experience in managing a growing team in a dynamic environment. Has excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to demonstrate to large audiences. Is a strategic thinker, yet also detail-focused, executes with excellence and takes ownership. Has strong problem-solving skills with the ability to innovate and analyze alternative solutions. About CaseWare  With a head office in Toronto, CaseWare is one of Canada's original Fintech companies, having led the industry for over 30 years, with more than 500,000 users across 130 countries and available in 16 different languages.  While you might not have heard of us (yet) over 36,000 accounting and audit professionals list CaseWare as a skill on their LinkedIn profiles!  CaseWare's cutting-edge software products are meticulously designed for accounting firms, corporations and governments. Our teams are continually collaborating, innovating and building upon our existing suite of products. With a customer focused mindset we are building technology that is shaping what the future of audits, financial reporting and financial data analytics will look like.  With a recent strategic investment from Hg Capital in 2020, CaseWare is now in its next major growth phase as we double down on the people and products that have made CaseWare so successful to date.  One of CaseWare's core values is that we believe Our People Make Us Great and with that in mind, we're dedicated to building teams as diverse as our customers in an equitable and inclusive way. We welcome and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Should you require accommodations or have any questions at any point during the application or interview process, please e-mail our People Operations team at careers@caseware.com.  Any candidates successful in obtaining an offer for a position will need to successfully complete a background check through Certn.co which typically includes an Identity Verification and Criminal Record Check. Executives and Senior Managers will undergo a Soft Credit Check as well.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Description  Come be a part of redefining the Entertainment industry, but don’t just take our word for it:  “100 Million views and counting: Cocomelon is absolutely dominating Netflix and You Tube”  Forbes 2021  “Moonbug Entertainmet’s rocketing success is disrupting the kids pre-school space”  Licensing.Biz 2021  “Old dogs like Nickolodean is out, Moonbug is in”  The Verge 2021  Moonbug Entertainment is an award-winning global entertainment company behind some of the most popular kids’ titles in the world. Our line-up includes the global sensations CoComelon, Blippi, Little Baby Bum, My Magic Pet Morphle, Supa Strikas, Go Buster, Playtime with Twinkle, Gecko’s Garage, ARPO and many more which are available in 27 languages.  In just three years, we have become a kids programming powerhouse with a library of more than 550 hours of content, which is distributed on more than 100 platforms globally, including YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, Sky, Tencent, Youku and Roku.  In May of 2020, Tubular Labs named Moonbug one of the leading digital kids’ entertainment companies in the world based on the total number of minutes watched worldwide.  The Role  Moonbug is seeking a Brand Partnership Director in Singapore to scale its Brand Partnership business in the Asia market. At Moonbug, you will be working with some of the biggest brands in family entertainment including the global blockbuster titles CoComelon and Blippi. This is an exciting role and opportunity for somebody who enjoys building businesses from the ground up and working with a passionate and ambitious team.  The successful candidate will be responsible for building long term partnerships with the top agencies and brands across APAC (especially SEA and India) and execute innovative commercial deals  Requirements Scale revenue through video media sales in the region Establish and manage client relationships with brands and advertisers Provide clients with the highest level of sales and customer service Establish and manage client relationships with brands and advertisers Collaborate with internal teams globally across product, marketing and legal Plan and build compelling storylines and data-driven presentations that are customized to clients’ business and objectives Liaise with partners and other internal marketing departments to execute marketing campaigns Analyze the performance of ongoing and past marketing campaigns so as to provide insight into how campaigns can be improved Serve as an external product consultant Campaign Planning and Management Qualifications And Experience Experience in video ad sales marketing Relationships with ad agencies in SEA and India Comfort in working independently in an entrepreneurial environment Understanding of the kids content space and familiarity with kids and family brands in Asia (e.g. toys, FMCGs, etc.) Demonstrated understanding of digital media platforms Demonstrated experience in working with cross-functional teams Excellent verbal and written English communication skills, with one additional Asian language (ideally Hindi or a SEA language) Experience with analyzing data and delivering insights Self-starter, fast learner with a can-do spirit A Bachelor Degree, preferably in Business Administration, Media, Digital, Marketing or related fields

description: We are seeking an experienced Regional Sales Director (RSD) based in the Asia/ME region:  Position Summary This individual is a senior level sales manager who is expected to affect the timely and profitable sale of relocation and moving services to major corporate employers across the Asia region. Acts as subject matter expert and coach within the organization drawing upon their depth of experience and actions with complex sales pursuits Meet on a regular basis with the SVP of Sales and Account Management to set a specific strategy on each new account to maximize our potential revenue opportunity Responsible for managing new pursuit strategies, pricing strategies and managing the RFP process Responsible for managing new pursuit profitability to include client margin, product conversion, SLA performance, and in-depth knowledge of pricing. The Regional Sales Director is responsible for executing multi-key stakeholder sales, all key prospects within his/her territory, surfacing viable opportunities for sales, organizing the internal committee that will sell to the prospect committee, crafting a complex financial sales strategy for each account and orchestrating the activities of the team and the prospect organization toward a close and implementation.  The RSD is expected to hold approximately 15 face-to-face meetings per month with the team and 25% of these should be first meetings with new prospects and 75% follow-up and closure meetings. The RSD can expect to spend approximately 30% of his/her work time traveling to attend client meetings.  The RSD works with team members to exemplify the company’s breadth of resources, depth of experience and commitment to teamwork. Responsible for producing results, meeting their team goals and keeping management informed.  Functions And Responsibilities  Percentage  Function  15 % Acts as subject matter expert within the organization drawing upon their depth of experience and actions with complex sales pursuits. Meet on a regular basis with team members and the SVP Sales and Account Management to set a specific strategy on each account to maximize our current and potential revenue opportunity Managing pursuit upsell and profitability to include client margin, product conversion, SLA performance, and understanding of costs of delivery 10 % Holding prospect meetings, Lead generation & development - Networking for referrals, Phone & Web research, Pre-qualifying prospects for meetings 50 % Preparing for meetings with teams, strategizing with team members, management, preparing formal proposals, following-up with prospects 10 % Preparing reports to/for management 5 % Training 5 % Sales Dept Meetings Qualifications And Preferred Skills At least 5 years of professional selling in a business to business environment with a track record of meeting or exceeding team goals Ability to evaluate clients utilizing all known information in the public domain and develop advanced sales strategy Ability to interface with multiple stakeholders, i.e., finance, human resources, procurement, shared services Prior experience of managing complex sales pursuits Ability to provide evidence of a consistent record of goal attainment and several favourable references from past or current clients, managers and direct reports Candidates selling complex supply chain solutions or utilizing total cost of ownership methodology would be highly desirable Candidates should be able to provide evidence of a consistent record of goal attainment and several favourable references from past or current clients, managers and direct reports Strong interpersonal skills Strong working use of statistics and analytics Strong analytical skills Strong presentation skills Strong oral and written communication skills Background with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) Education and Certification Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above SIRVA Worldwide Relocation and Moving is a global leader in moving and relocation services, offering solutions for mobility programs to companies of every size. With 75 owned locations and more than 1,000 franchised and agent locations in 177 countries, we offer unmatched global breadth supported by localized attention and innovative technology that strikes the right balance of self service and human support. From relocation and household goods to commercial moving and storage, our portfolio of Brands (SIRVA, Team Relocations, Allied, northAmerican, & SMARTBOX) provides the only integrated moving/relocation solution in the industry. By leveraging our global network, we deliver a superior experience that only a “one-stop shop” can provide. We’re a team that works globally to provide the best service locally — a company that is everything you need, everywhere you need it. For more information please visit www.sirva.com .  SIRVA brings together strong, collaborative people in a dynamic culture of mutual respect, support, and passion for the brand and product. We believe innovation drives winning performance, and we constantly challenge ourselves to be the very best we can in every aspect of our business. You will be surrounded by some of the brightest and most driven people in the industry. At SIRVA, you will be in great company!  At SIRVA, we're committed to cultivating a workplace that reflects the diversity of the global organizations that we serve. We recognize that building an inclusive, engaged company culture results in empowered employees that reflect a wide range of approaches and perspectives. Those perspectives lead to new ideas. New ideas lead to innovation and excellence. Our approach to diversity, equality and inclusion is driven by a commitment to these values and a belief that diversity makes our company stronger.  SIRVA is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military status, genetic information or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local laws. SIRVA also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability of any part of the employment process, please send an email to Human Resources at HRSIRVA@SIRVA.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. description: Tech in Asia Studios  Tech in Asia Studios is the multi-media production arm of Tech in Asia. We help Tech in Asia’s editorial team produce visual content, organize events and help connect brands with Asia’s tech community through compelling storytelling.  Our clients include tech MNCs like Google, Amazon, TikTok and Alibaba, regional tech disruptors like Sea Group (Shopee), Grab, Traveloka and Tokopedia, premier investors and venture capitalists like Sequoia Capital, GGV Capital and Qiming Ventures and government agencies like Singapore’s IMDA and Malaysia’s MDEC.  Account Director  As the Account Director, you will be a player-coach and the most senior person on the Tech in Asia Studios account management team. Reporting to the group COO, you bring deep expertise in customer servicing, retention and up-selling and the drive to go deep with strategically important partners like the ones listed above.  Representing the undisputed voice of tech and entrepreneurship in Asia, you’ll be building relationships directly with the CMO’s office, corp comms and PR teams at the most innovative and exciting companies across Asia.  The ideal candidate will understand publishing and content marketing and quickly anticipate and meet client needs. You will work effectively with internal stakeholders such as the creative and marketing teams. We are looking for someone inspiring and results-driven who is not afraid to move quickly and get their hands dirty.  Why You Should Be Excited You’ll be in a leadership role at one of the leading publications covering startups in Asia You’ll play in critical role in helping millions of Tech in Asia readers understand the innovators driving Asia’s tech ecosystem forward You’ll build on and deepen existing relationships with the hottest tech companies and investors in the region You’ll have a huge amount of autonomy to drive customer success and team strategy You’ll have the opportunity to manage, mentor and grow a team of talented account managers Responsibilities Responsible for driving Studios client renewals and revenue, increasing retention and reducing churn Manage a small team of account managers, ensuring they have the training, resources and support needed to be successful Work directly with strategic clients, personally overseeing key projects and deliverables Lead strategic account planning and forecasting in partnership with Tech in Asia’s leadership team Ensure that client success is measured correctly and that key metrics, such as NPS and revenue, are positive and growing Develop and optimize team process, especially with cross-functional teams in Creative and Marketing Qualifications 6+ years experience in customer success, account management, account planning, marketing, communications and/or PR 2+ years leading customer success or account management teams, preferably in the media space Excellent written English Demonstrated ability to retain and grow strategic accounts Ability to inspire and lead a team in a fast-moving startup environment Ability to excel in a hands on player-coach role Currently located in Singapore

jobTitle: Country Head, Google Customer Solutions Sales - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Country Head, Google Customer Solutions Sales - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Responsibilities Provide thought leadership and be a recognized industry expert externally. Lead engagement for key clients and agencies, together with your team. Manage execution of key growth-driving initiatives, securing support from internal stakeholders at regional and local levels, and leading strategy setting and execution across other functions. Ensure team readiness to deliver complex advertising solutions and create a culture of business innovation and advertiser success on the team. Build team structure, recognize leadership potential, and support career development through enhancing capabilities within the team. Drive advertising business growth in Malaysia and the Philippines. Build and execute on business, marketing, and operational strategies. Minimum Qualifications 10 years of experience in media, marketing, brand management, or advertising sales. Experience leading a sales team, including coaching, mentoring, and team development. Preferred Qualifications 15 years of combined experience in technology, advertising, management, and consulting. Experience building relationships with C-level executives. Ability to grow and lead a sales team with a track record of success in sales, and in driving Sales and Operations teams. Experience with Online Media. Knowledge of the advertising and digital ecosystem in Malaysia and/or the Philippines. Ability to act as a key spokesperson for Google in Southeast Asia communicating a commercial strategy tailored to the market while implementing Google's corporate vision. Forward-looking vision to drive business growth to meet Google's business objectives.

Additionally, the Sales Director will work with underpenetrated accounts that have the opportunity to scale. To build and maintain strong relationships, you will communicate regularly with senior agency contacts, key clients, and internal customers. Ideal candidates are self-motivated with a proven track record in Linear TV, Advanced TV, CTV/OTT, and Demand Side Platforms within Amobee’s target markets. They will have knowledge of ad industry technologies, including auction-based ad exchanges, ad serving, behavioral targeting, performance optimization, and analytics. They will have knowledge of data management platforms, industry landscape, and business uses. quarterly and annual revenue targets Identify and quantify customer needs and opportunities for enterprise targets Develop a pipeline with viable opportunities and be able to forecast accurately Show accountability for prospecting, forecasting, presenting, negotiations, and closing new deals Work with internal teams to ensure they are aligned with your business objectives and strategies and effectively coordinate team members to work through deals Serve as the key external-facing senior sales lead working closely with senior internal stakeholders to grow key partnerships Develop new senior-level relationships within agencies and brand direct advertisers Develop and maintain strong relationships with all major accounts, their agencies (media and creative) Present solutions to key decision-makers within agencies and brand direct clients Develop proactive product, category, and seasonal sales packages to increase revenue Contribute as part of the Sales management team to the development and implementation of team business strategies and objectives across all products Attend industry events and stay up to date with current industry trends Develop strategies to address industry/client issues and challenges across products Understand major account competitors and their current media strategies Provide weekly updates of current revenue forecasts, initiatives, and opportunities across all products Handle multiple deliverables with tight timelines Become proficient in Amobee’s suite of products, services, and offerings Ad hoc projects as required Qualifications Extensive enterprise sales experience (5+ years) with a proven track record of closing complex, long term deals with advertisers Established relationships with media agencies and brand direct clients Superior client management skills with a strong customer focus Enterprise Sales & account management skills Highly developed communication, negotiation, and presentation skills (both written and oral) Effective problem solver and decision-maker Strong analytical skills and knowledge of display and video advertising exchanges, behavioral targeting, and performance-based optimization is strongly preferred Process-driven and knowledge of data management platforms (DMPs) Experience in Programmatic and specifically buy-side platforms is required Experience in forecasting and budgeting Ability to think strategically Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and manage time effectively Self-starter capable of thriving in a fast-paced, constantly evolving startup environment Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business or related discipline Amobee's Platform organization provides best-in class partnership to marketers and agencies who are deploying Amobee's self-serve, omnichannel advertising platform. Utilizing a highly consultative engagement model, we help clients understand how to use Amobee's product suite across the convergence of TV, Digital and Social media to develop strategic audience and media planning insights, optimize media efficiency across all four screens (TV, Connected TV, Mobile and Desktop), and drive measurable business outcomes for best-in-class return on advertising spend.

Cloud Kinetics (also known as CK) is a leading Cloud Transformation Solutions and Managed Services Provider headquartered in Singapore, offering a plethora of services across all major Public Cloud Operators. Cloud Kinetics is a Portfolio Company of I Squared Capital. I Squared Capital (ISQ) is a private equity firm focusing on global infrastructure investments. We are looking for a highly motivated individual reporting to the Chief Revenue Office to take on this exciting opportunity of driving sales growth and executing sales and go-to-market strategy in Singapore.  As an Alliance Director, you will be responsible for developing the alliance strategy, launch, business and marketing plans, joint offering, and enabling other regional alliance peers. You will be responsible for developing and implementing Cloud Kinetics (CK) channel and marketing strategies by working closely with focus vendors and partners – including marketing programs, demand/lead generation programs, the development of management of channel and vendors program.    We are looking for a highly motivated team player (based in Singapore) to join the Alliances and team to design, launch and support aggressive plans to strategically drive adoption and growth of Cloud business in the Asia. This is a cross functional role that will require orchestration of internal functions and workstreams to ensure success for our alliances and channels partners and overall Indirect business.  The ideal candidate will blend strategic thinking, outstanding partner relationship management skills, and an entrepreneurial mindset. In addition, an ability to effectively collaborate with multiple cross-functional stakeholders, including sales, alliances, marketing, legal, partner programs, and operations is critical. You should be an eager self-starter who is comfortable working in a rapidly growing company with a fast-paced working environment in Singapore.  Responsibilities: ·       Facilitate effective and self-sustained joint field engagements between the partner and Cloud Kinetics’s Sales organizations to drive license growth. This role will become “embedded” within the sales force, supporting account management, regional business development, pipeline, strategic deals, QBR’s and forecast reviews.  ·       Demand generation and pipeline management: With internal and external marketing organizations, ensure the creation and execution of a joint demand generation plan, including joint business and account plans, opportunity engagements, co-marketing and thought leadership.    ·       Competency development – internal:  Manage enablement sessions, promote the alliance “brand” value, establish support for use of alliance’s Customer Centers where applicable.  ·       Competency development - external: Facilitate understanding of Cloud Kinetics’ s portfolio of solutions and impact on asset optimization, digital transformation, and value creation.  Working with Cloud Kinetics Customer Success and SIA teams:  Ensure that partners build and maintain required competency levels, leverage Cloud Kinetics service delivery methodologies and our existing sub-contractor ecosystem. ·       Proven leadership skills and experience in building relationships with stakeholders inside and outside the organization, working within challenging circumstances where change and ambition are high, to drive outcomes that benefit our clients.    ·       Actively listen to client needs, and translate this feedback back to solutions consulting, Services, global alliance teams and product management. ·       Governance: Identify and align critical functions, tasks and accountabilities required from key stakeholders to execute against alliance strategy and business plans; hold all parties accountable for performance.  Develop and track the full “balance sheet” / scorecard of partner activities.  Maintain peer-peer relationship mapping, and quarterly business reviews.  Identify and resolve issues, escalate where appropriate. Become the go-to person and “trusted advisor” for business line executives and managers.   Requirements ·       Demonstrated ability to drive significant revenue through Channel partnerships ·       Experience with creating and building differentiated relationships with partners in the channel’s community especially in Singapore Government ·       Sound business acumen skills; thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment ·       Strategic thinker with who is able to blend consulting and business strategy to develop compelling plans for new partner initiatives ·       Demonstrated ability to pick up and understand product/tech concepts ·       History of successfully developing and leading multiple strategic partnerships ·       Good knowledge of cloud native solutions and technology with proven experience of establishing growth through channels in Enterprise accounts ·       Must be comfortable with complexity, and thinking on multiple levels of abstraction; demonstrates use of critical thinking techniques ·       Excellent spoken and written communication, interpersonal, relationship building skills ·       Ability to work both independently and with a team ·       Experience as an Alliance/Channel manager influencing and building bench strength in business focused SI/Channel organizations ·       Comfortable working with multiple internal teams, from individual contributors to senior executives, as well as building/maintaining relationships with clients, partners, etc. ·       Track record of exceeding sales quota ·       Willing and able to travel Nice To Have ·       Broad-based business and technology expertise with 10+ years of consulting, management, or business leadership experience with a track record of driving business development ·       Business, or Engineering Bachelor's degree (MBA degree is preferred) ·       Experience of working with SI consulting organizations in multiple cities/verticals ·       Experience working with multiple Sales teams driving and building the partner ecosystem ·       Highly motivated and independent contributor ·       High energy, enthusiasm, and passion for the business.

description: Have solid experience with establishing and growing the Ecommerce business in emerging markets?  Join us as the APAC Ecommerce Director and help us grow our business in future growth markets!   Core Responsibilities   Lead APAC LEGO.com commercial sales performance and P&L Own the APAC LEGO.com strategy, budget and forecast Manage a growing direct and indirect APAC team across trading, merchandising, marketing, and operations (current direct team of 2) Partner with many functions to deliver the commercial results, market expansion and shopper improvements – Global Ecommerce, broader LEGO Retail, Finance, Supply Chain, Distribution, Consumer Services and Technology Team member of the Global Ecommerce and APAC regional leadership teams and influence Global and local strategies Responsible for maximising data to identify key strategies, trading activities and partner communications to accelerate an already strong and growing ecommerce business Ensure a comprehensive thinking to building brand engagement, sales momentum and profitability Translate and support rollout of global e-comm and brand strategies into the region (e.g. sustainability, VIP, new site features)   Play your part in our team succeeding  LEGO Retail is responsible for our direct-to-consumer business through LEGO brand owned channels including online (LEGO.com in 31+ countries), 620+ LEGO stores in 8+ countries as well as travel retail. Global eCommerce, part of LEGO Retail, is responsible for growing LEGO.com and plays a pivotal role in the Group Commercial Strategy. The LEGO.com teams are globally distributed and cover all proficiencies to operate our global digital flagship. The teams are located in London, Billund, Singapore, Sydney, Seoul, Munich and Enfield offices.  This role will lead the commercial growth of LEGO.com across the region. Today we operate in Australia, New Zealand, South Korea and Japan, and we have ambitious plans for expansion in the region to reach more LEGO consumers.  Do you have what it takes?   BA or equivalent in Business or related field a nice to have 6+ years of experience in direct-to-consumer Ecommerce across multiple countries and regions Track record of driving commercial growth in the APAC region with focus on sales, shopper NPS and profitability Comprehensive understanding of all the ecommerce trading levers with ability to interpret the insights and agility to drive commercial growth Broad approach about the end-to-end shopper omnichannel experience, brand building, commercial momentum and P&L impact Understand ecommerce landscape and regional specificities Demonstrated leadership and can handle situations with confidence, tact, and resourcefulness Ability to lead in pressure situations and strong interpersonal and collaboration skills Approach all situations with kindness Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience presenting to and engaging partners at all levels Strong partner management and ability to communicate openly and collaboratively across cultures and time zones within a large matrixed multinational corporation Experience managing, developing and coaching a globally distributed team An enthusiastic, positive approach and determination to overcome obstacles Results orientation with a focus on quality, efficiency and operational excellence; attitude of continuous improvement Shopper-centric and data driven decision making Ability to cut through clutter and complexity to create clarity and simplicity Self-starter and highly motivated and organized; capable of working independently, yet collaboratively Problem solving with a "roll-up-your-sleeves", "get it done" mentality and collaborative attitude Experience launching ecommerce sites in new markets Understanding of the broader ecommerce landscape in APAC across major ecommerce platforms and marketplaces   Join the global LEGO® family  Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued, and they belong.  The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”  The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.  Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.  Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

description: The database market is massive (IDC estimates it to be $119B by 2025!) and MongoDB is leading its disruption. The MongoDB community is transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to go public in 20 years. Join MongoDB and see what kind of impact you can make on the company and on the world.  About The Role  We’re looking for a talented, driven leader with great energy, passion and initiative to lead a highly talented leadership team, who drive awareness and new business acquisition for the fastest growing data platform on the planet throughout the ASEAN region.  The ASEAN leadership team concentrates on formulating and executing a sales development and growth strategy within assigned countries in the ASEAN region, resulting in revenue growth, new customer acquisition and career development for all.  As the Senior Director with a focus on Recruitment, Development and Execution for the ASEAN team, you will drive revenue and assure the continued successful trajectory of one of the highest growth regions in the company.  About The Sales Culture  MongoDB is always developing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to “Think Big and Go Far.” As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.  What You Will Be Doing Coach the regional leadership team to close business to exceed monthly, quarterly and annual bookings objectives Enable the team to proactively prospect, identify, qualify and develop sales pipeline Proactively recruit first line Sales Managers and Sales Executives across both SMB and Enterprise territories Foster strong and effective relationships with partners, resulting in growth opportunities Work closely with Professional Services team to achieve customer satisfaction and with Marketing to conduct seminars, trade shows and other marketing related events Be an example of MongoDB culture and values; live them, and inspire others  What You Will Bring To The Table 10+ years of technology sales experience and 5+ years in a leadership capacity where you have built and/or scaled a team of 50+ Ability to articulate the business value of complex enterprise software technology Ability to attract and recruit excellent employees Ability to train and develop individuals to ensure they accomplish organizational goals; actively build capability in employees through coaching and experience to provide a continuous flow of talent in the future (put the right people in the right place at the right time) Excellent leadership and influencing skills; ability to build strong business and stakeholder partnerships both outside and within the organization Skilled at business planning and diligent at measuring and communicating progress towards the plan, identifying roadblocks, and coming up with appropriate solutions Skilled in managing time and resources; sound approach to qualifying opportunities Holds managers and individuals accountable to achieve broad-based success Experience finding creative and innovative ways to open up new markets and opportunities  Things we love Passionate about growing your career in the largest market in software (database) Previous experience using a proven Sales Methodology (e.g. MEDDICC, SPIN, Challenger Sales) Familiarity with databases, develops and open source technology a plus Passionate about creating open sales cultures with a belief in regular 2 way feedback  Why join now MongoDB invests 8x the industry average in development of each of our new hires & continuous career development Focus on Sales Excellence through use of MEDDICC and Command of the Message, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamps and development programs New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Generous and competitive benefits (parental leave, fertility & wellbeing support) Friendly and inclusive workplace culture - Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB,  MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.  MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

description: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!  We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.  We are looking for an Individual Contributor to be responsible for the entire sales process from prospecting to closing business. The Sales Executive is assigned a geographic territory to manage, develop and market Kyriba’s solutions in order to secure new subscription business in our Software-as-a-Service business model. In this case, the territory is SEA. Working in collaboration with sales leadership and the sales operations team, the Sales Director engages with VP, Sr. VP and C-level contacts within prospective customers developing relationships and closing business at or above expected and assigned levels per period.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Build, nurture and execute pipeline in collaboration with Marketing, Partners and Business Development Representatives (BDRs) to drive bookings within your territory Own entire sales process from prospecting to closing business Coordinate and lead responses to RFIs/RFPs, Requests for Information and pricing requests Present Kyriba’s proposals in a professional manner to prospects Provide feedback to management and Marketing team on prospects reactions and questions about Kyriba’s solutions Collaborate with other Kyriba teams including pre-sales, product, operations, and legal. Travel throughout sales territory Ensures opportunities are accurately reflected and maintained in Salesforce, providing weekly updates, monthly projections and quarterly committed forecasts of sales activity and volume to Kyriba NA Sales management team Attend conferences and industry related events within assigned territory and as requested Prepare for meetings and tailor communications to address business needs of potential clients as part of the pre-sales process Experience, Education And Skills Results driven individual with a minimum 5+ years of successful experience in selling software and SaaS solutions required Consistently among the top 10% of peers in every role held Strong background in Treasury or experience selling to the CFO buying center required Knowledgeable about the industry, understands basic treasury concepts, and proactively updates on industry trends for personal and organizational knowledge Ability to understand financial data relationships and how that data can be used to solve business problems Must possess superior written, verbal and strong interpersonal skills and be able to communicate technical information professionally in written responses to emails, RFPs, and verbally when presenting to prospects or internally Understand the buying process in large corporations and how to navigate the decision maker network to close business Strength in strategic, conceptual, and consultative selling Ability to understand financial data relationships and how that data can be used to solve business problems Experience using CRM sales applications, such as Salesforce.com Possess excellent negotiating and professional networking skills Willingness to travel up to 50 percent of the time depending on assigned territory Bachelor’s degree in Business, Administration, Economics, IT, Finance or MBA preferred

description: Brief Profile  The Head – Business Development will be responsible for developing key growth sales plans, tactics and action plans for successful execution of strategies required to achieve the organizations financial targets.  Job Description   Understanding the supply demand dynamics of the services we provide globally, network with key industry players, and major customers in particular.   Aware of major infrastructure projects in the world (construction of port terminals, jetty, other major marine infrastructure) that are currently at the planning and bidding stage, that requires movement of aggregates via barges/dry bulk vessels, etc..   Maintain close relationship with the key decision makers and next in-line of major infrastructure companies (Cement companies, building material companies, Infrastructure companies) to achieve closure of sale.   Developing proficiency in all areas of shipping sales, industry concepts, theories and maritime case studies/ news.   Search, research, discover and meet new prospects as well as generate more business from existing clients across all business lines and group companies.   Attend industry events, conferences, seminars/ webinars to keep self-up to date on industry/ market news and client/  customer/ decision maker specific news and updates.   Build strong network with key decision makers, existing and retired senior people across all shipping companies around the world based on operational requirement.   Update all meeting minutes, visiting cards (client contact details) into the sales reports (word files, spreadsheets and  CRMs) as well as plan, strategize and define next action points.   Set up meetings, create/ demonstrate client presentations, proposals, negotiate best rates/ contracts and other routine sales modalities.   Organize regular/ periodic and situation specific sales meetings with seniors and management.   Maintain, track and regularly update sales pipeline dashboards.   Innovate new techniques and methods to increase sales, revenue and profit margins.   Train, direct and supervise a sales team, if assigned by Management.   Coordinate the operations of the sales department across the globe by establishing goals and monitoring the volume of sales.   Prepare and review progress reports, which will help determine sales potential, customer needs, and the pricing of products or services.  Qualification, Experience & Competencies   MBA in Marketing and Bachelor’s Degree in any discipline   Minimum 10 Years Work Relevant Work Experience   Exemplary leader with excellent time and team management skills, multi-tasker, consultative thought process and analytical mind-set.   Proficient in using latest systems, computers/ technologies, desktop/ laptops, peripherals, mobiles, software’s and  applications.   Existing connections, strong network and associations in shipping/ maritime industry globally.   Fully aware of key players, competition, local and global companies in Maritime Security, Tug & Barge Ops, UTG, Underwater Services, Offshore, Chartering and Dry Docking among other technical services.   Go-getter, multitasker, flexible and adapts quickly to new and challenging environment of fact paced growing organization.  KPI’s  Revenue growth 60%  Revenue per client, increase by 10% per quarter  Opportunity-to-Win Ratio: Number of wins / closed deals per quarter  Pricing Against Competitors / Market Intelligence: Aware of their pricing to create a competitive strategy – 100% accuracy  New clients and Client retention rate 20%  Existing Client Engagement 0 oversight  Maintain good rapport with customers after the sale is complete 0 lapse  MIS for Customer satisfaction survey: Every quarter  New client engagement rate 20% increase per quarter  Social Media Management 10%  Generate leads by constant display/ promotion of our services & updates on social media for brand interaction.  People Management, self and team development 10%  Self: Attend seminars / webinars 1 every 6 months for industry trends, networking and insights  Network within the industry for exposure and client reach  Team Training and development: Each team member to complete minimum 1 per year seminars, courses applicable to line of work.  100% of appraisals completed for the team  Team retention rate – 80%

description: Who Are We Looking For  We are looking for a Head of Business Development who is a strategic thinker with exceptional relationship building skills and a high level of energy. You require a unique blend of strategic and analytical thinking, business acumen and operational skills. You have excellent sales instincts and the ability to successfully navigate the sales process, including negotiations and contracts. You will oversee sales operations including lead generation with a team of business development representatives. You will be responsible for owning the entire revenue generation process and meeting or exceeding company revenue targets for the APAC Region. Above all, you have the desire to be part of a game-changing technology start-up intent on revolutionising the building and construction industry.  What Hubble Will Give You  Hubble is built by a team of talented, driven, and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. We do not let history and traditions dictate and limit our dreams to shape the world. We adopt the same mindset with our hiring. We are looking for the best and we want to bet on you. If your mindset is right, we promise you the ride of your life.  Who Will You Be Working With  If you connect with any of the description below, please apply immediately: Purpose driven Hungry, ambitions, and self-motivated Meritocratic, results/performance > age/bureaucracy Resourceful, independent, chart our own destiny Determined, perseverance, and hard working Creative, innovative, out of the box Yes, the above is everyone of us at Hubble.  What You Will Be Doing  To succeed in this role you will need to be determined, strategic and capable of establishing relationships with the key decision makers within the building and construction industry. You will be expected to have knowledge of contracting, negotiating and change management. You will lead by example, acquiring and managing key accounts, while developing, managing and supporting a team of passionate sales professionals.  Responsibilities Own the entire revenue generation process for the APAC Region, accountable for developing new revenue opportunities and leading key client account strategy and planning, alongside scaling the channel ecosystem. Direct and coordinate company sales functions. Developing, executing, coordinating and maintaining a sales selling cycle and methodology. Establish and develop a number of key Business Partner relationships in target areas. Build, lead, manage & motivate the sales development team. Take charge of client acquisition and create new business opportunities to maintain the company’s relevance and competitive edge. Directly manage major and critical developing client accounts, and coordinate the management of all other accounts. Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of sales, methods, costs and results. Direct the planning and development of marketing and communications materials. Create a standardized outreach process for current and future clients and coordinate its implementation across lines of business, client management, and marketing and communications. Develop annual forecasts based on market analysis and the plan/strategies to achieve company objectives. Lead the Sales team and work with the Marketing team to deliver attainment of annual sales and profit budgets. Maintain an in-depth understanding of the firm’s business and capabilities in order to demonstrate value to potential clients. Achieve quarterly sales objectives and forecast sales activity accurately. Recruit, interview, train, and evaluate sales team members. Build a high performance, accountable, sales-driven culture with a focus on customer execution and hypergrowth. Maintain a strong regional and team culture that is consistent with Hubble values and best practices Performing all duties with integrity and in compliance with all company policies. Any other duties as assigned. What We Need From You Singaporeans/PR preferred Bachelor's degree with good academic results 8-10 years experience in building, managing and mentoring business development teams Relevant and direct experience with all major markets in APAC (MY, HK, ID, VN, JP, AUS) Knowledge of structuring sales quota goals and revenue expectations. A global view, with deep experience within key markets in the APAC region Deep knowledge of international go-to-market and business localisation best practices Expert with CRM tools such as Hubspot and Profit Well Experience working in a fast-paced and highly cross-functional organization. Ability to generate leads and identify strategic areas for growth Ability to develop business cases that articulate strategy, value propositions, required investments and financial returns Highly organised, strong attention to detail, forward-thinking and the ability to work autonomously with a 'can do' attitude Strong presentation, verbal and written skills as well as proven ability to develop well-written documents and presentations. Ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations. Exceptional reporting skills & the ability to present to the board, key stakeholders and trade events Enjoy solving complex problems with technology Strong business acumen, team player, results-oriented An effective leader who has strong management, mentoring and motivational skills About Hubble  Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on the construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man, Machine, Material, Money) resources.  Our solutions help digitise all your work processes, and connect all key project stakeholders - developers, consultants, fabricators, contractors, and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform.  Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come.  Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

description: About Us  Fairmart is an early-stage community commerce company with a mission to help local stores thrive in the digital age. It is our belief that local stores should have access to the same capabilities that larger businesses have, but built for their scale. To achieve this, we take a multidisciplinary approach to building solutions that are simple to use, yet powerful in their impact.  We're based in the JTC Launchpad - a heart of Singapore's startup community.  We are a diverse team of technologists and builders who love to see the direct impact of our work on the lives of our customers. Those who are successful at Fairmart are intensely curious and bring a fierce passion to their work. You should be results-oriented, but also be people-oriented and understand the broader context of each problem you solve. Our culture is our competitive advantage, and you will have a unique opportunity to nurture its evolution and growth.  Our founders bring a combined 25 years of experience from industry giants such as Shopback, Redmart, and DJI. The company is supported by prominent VCs such as Entrepreneur First, HAX, and SOSV.  What You'll Be Doing Spearhead Fairmart's sales and partner development program to unlock digital commerce for physical stores Develop and execute sales and partner acquisition strategies in response to company objectives Passionately represent Fairmart to customers, partners, and industry stakeholders Lead a team of 2-3 BDAs, including their training and career development Collaborate with product, marketing, and customer success teams to ensure our users realize the full potential of Fairmart's technology Skills & Experience You’ll Need Ambitious, goal-oriented mind set with a strong passion for growth Strong track-record in owning and delivering against a sales pipeline Passion for supporting small businesses to realize the benefits of technology Experience in training, organizing, and managing a sales, business development, or partnerships team Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve company objectives Perks And Benefits Performance based incentive scheme. Open, respectful and creative company culture. Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution. Work with people who love what they do every day. Qualifications Diploma in Business, communication, or related field. At least 3 - 5 years' of relevant work experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Mandarin. Ability to work independently, multi-task, organize and prioritize work. Check out our website: https://fairmart.app/

and verbal communication skills, presenting to large and small audiences and comfortable presenting to c-level executives You have a university degree or an equivalent qualification You are fluent in English. (Additional language skills would be an asset!) And, you are willing to travel as the economy reopens to global travel  What We Offer: 20 days of vacation International health insurance Competitive base salary and opportunity for bonus Internal growth and development programs Company events such as social activities 1 volunteering day per year  About us:  Talkwalker was named a Leader among the top 10 social listening platforms in The Forrester Wave™: Social Listening Platforms, Q4 2020. This recognition validates everything that we are striving for – happy customers, a powerful and easy-to-use product, groundbreaking AI technology (from visual recognition to Conversation Clusters), and an abundance of clean and accurate social data.  Our colleagues come from 50+ different countries around the world, with a total headcount of over 400 employees. Being a rapidly-growing organization, our goal is to be 500+ employees by the end of 2021.   For more information, please visit our website, or our social media accounts.

description: Media.Monks is a digital-first marketing and advertising services company connecting the dots across content, data & digital media and technology services. Inspired by the connectivity and flexibility of technology APIs, Media.Monks’ single-P&L model offers brands seamless access to a nearly 6,000-strong team of digital talent organized across 57 talent hubs in 33 countries.  With us, you'll find a diverse group of colleagues with different backgrounds and perspectives. We believe everyone has something of value to offer, and that sustaining a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace begins with fostering an environment where people can be themselves, authentically, every day. We want to build something with the potential to change the heart of our industry, and we’d love to include your unique perspective.  The Opportunity  We are looking for a highly talented Regional Head of Growth to help accelerate growth in our Singapore office, which oversees our SEA hubs.  About The Team  This role reports directly to the MD of Singapore with a dotted line to the Chief Growth Officer, APAC  About The Role  The Regional Growth Lead is responsible for creating net new opportunities using a multi-channel growth approach. The primary measurement of success for this role is defined by achieving growth targets as set forth by the Chief Growth Officer as well as one’s ability to out-pitch, out-position, out-play and out-procure the competition.  Responsibilities Include  Lead, manage and drive the team to develop and execute sales strategies to profitably grow revenues and expand the account base in target markets. Coach, and mentor senior Growth Directors & Managers, with a hands-on, team-oriented approach. Drive effective, accurate, and timely forecasting and pipeline reporting. Team with marketing, pre-sales, partner management and professional services to maximize opportunities and foster cohesive sales strategies. Pipeline development and customer acquisition activities, including direct sales, co-selling with growth team leadership, managing directors, marketing teams, partnership leads and partner growth leads. Identifying areas of new opportunities within current client relationships (white space) under the guidance of client leads. Designing strategies with Regional Head of Clients and market leadership to expand within client relationships. Build executive level relationships for new prospects and with present clients. Work closely with S4 cross functional teams on prospective deals to ensure accurate bids, compelling value propositions and a frictionless deal environment. Identify, develop and prospect cold leads.  Preferred Experience & Qualifications  Preferred years of experience: 10 years of full cycle sales experience; demonstrated career progression and strong performance as a senior leader, ideally in digital content, platform sales or related business. A minimum of 5 years leading a sales or partnership development organization. Proven track record of successfully negotiating deals at senior levels of major brands; ideally brings deep relationships from the media and agency landscape. Experience working alongside producers, creatives & engineers. Knowledge of technology; well-developed product sensibility and experience leading creative discussions regarding potentially innovative, unique and engaging context and product offerings Track-record of collaboration and influencing across a large organization to deliver to expectations. Management of a team across countries in a client-facing environment. Proven ability to use measurement and analytics to position performance data to illustrate impact. As an ideal candidate, you should have demonstrated success in a measured and commission driven compensation model, with a history of achieving lead conversation and revenue targets. Strong business development skills with experience prospecting and bringing in new business Proven ability to cultivate and maintain strong relationships with C level and Executive decision makers at the enterprise businesses/organisations Ability to build and deliver exceptional presentations to your customers Develop strategic and tactical account planning/execution and implement client strategy. Foster and develop key relationships. Act as the primary contact for campaign performance and review, troubleshooting, client training, new products and policy, and implementation questions. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Strong presentation skills both remote and in-person Ability to articulate and educate Clients and team members on Digital strategy, trends, challenges.  Traits  Competitive - you want to win and you effectively solve obstacles in the way of your goals. Organized - you use and create systems to stay on top of your responsibilities. Closer - you know how to seal the deal and get people over the finish line! You are passionate and a have a deep, holistic knowledge and passion for creative, technology and digital Skilled at working with cross-functional teams to successfully execute new product initiatives and develop partnerships. Thrives in fast-paced environment, and can embrace rapid change and innovation Willing to travel as necessary  About Media.Monks  At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.  We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

As they are growing in APAC, we are looking for a Regional Sales Director in Singapore who will be responsible for growing the business in the region. As part of the succession planning, this role has the potential to grow into a Regional Managing Director position.  Qualifications Experience with condition monitoring. description: We are shaping the future of the audio industry to create unique sound experiences for customers around the globe. To achieve this, the Sennheiser Team around the world offers far more than just innovative, groundbreaking technology. Our dedicated staff knows their customers, understands their needs and requirements, and provides them with comprehensive, local support. They round off our technically exceptional solutions with a portfolio of services that is delivered with both personal commitment and the highest possible quality of service    Job responsibilities:  You will be responsible for providing overall direction, sales strategy, and team management to meet and exceed profitable sales targets for the AV/IT market in South East Asia region. You will work closely with the Vice President of Sales for APAC to implement sales strategies to increase sales and our brand position within the markets we serve. You will work closely with your sales team to analyze sales activities against goals and ensure sales goals are met and/or exceeded.  Develops and executes strategic plans to achieve sales revenue to meet and/or exceed assigned targets.  Monitor performance metrics and key performance indicators for the Team in South East Asia region.   Provides leadership and coaching to the sales team with organizational skills, account strategies/planning, territory planning, and administrative responsibilities to ensure achievement of sales revenue targets and high levels of customer satisfaction.   Establishes and ensure effective/clear communication/coordination between the team to maintain a common, corporate message and share best practices.   Ensures Customer Relationship Management system (CRM) usage and sales processes are being followed.   Builds strong relationships with principals, designers, and other influencers and end customers.   Assists Sales VP with developing and maintaining high-level relationships with channel strategic important Business Unit contacts in the region and key account principals.   Stays current with competitive activity and organize sales response to market changes.   Works closely with our HQ to anticipate product inventories to meet customer sales requirements.   Develops new business opportunities including new points of distribution and new applications for existing products.   Provides market feedback on trends, opportunities, competitive products and sales developments in the form of monthly reports.   Provides accurate forecasts of projected sales and growth covering weekly, monthly, quarterly, and yearly numbers.   Fosters an environment and culture that drives outstanding customer service with flawless execution.

description: Are You The One  MatchMove is looking for Business Development Director who are excited to generate new business prospects in the local market by cultivating their existing networks and/or building new ones.  Come join our dynamic team !  Responsibilities Plan, identify and implement business development opportunities and strategies. Generate leads through personal network and contact research to expand pipeline through new connections. Prepare and conduct sales pitch, deal negotiations and closures. Lead business relationship between the company and potential partners (e.g. Financial services institutions, Fintech and corporates, etc). Responsible for growing volumes and revenues through effective pitch, marketing, research and product definitions. Provide feedback and inputs to HQ to modify or develop new guidelines, pricing or product enhancements to cater to market needs. Monitor competition activities and recommend appropriate action. Manage incoming projects and coordinate with HQ on project requirements. Update and maintain clients’ records in a CRM tool. Assume the role of a product specialist and attend to client inquiries. Qualifications Minimum 7 to 10 years of sales/business development experience in the ePayment/Fintech industry. Proven B2B sales track record in acquiring new clients and possess wide business network of financial services/lending and corporate clients. Strong communication and interpersonal skills in English. Strong knowledge of payments, networks and/or the prepaid/payments product. Effective in the matrix structure and able to use informal networks within to achieve results. Strong in communication, self-driven and ability to work in an agile environment. MatchMove Culture To work in a fast-moving growing start-up, fun and yet professional environment that recognizes and rewards individual contributions and team success. To work with highly motivated and diverse people who are totally focused on winning by combining great teamwork, rapid execution and an uncompromising approach to quality and customer satisfaction. We strongly encourage Innovation, Collaboration, Creativity, and Initiative. Personal Data Protection Act  By submitting your application for this job, you are authorizing MatchMove to: collect and use your personal data, and to disclose such data to any third party with whom MatchMove or any of its related corporation has service arrangements, in each case for all purposes in connection with your job application, and employment with MatchMove; and retain your personal data for one year for consideration of future job opportunities (where applicable).
