description: Clearco is a company built by founders for founders, and we're laser-focused on our mission to help entrepreneurs succeed. In order to do so at scale, we need to build a world class strategic partner ecosystem. The Director of Platform Partnerships, APAC will be responsible for building, maintaining and evolving Clearco's network of platform/technology partners – e-commerce store builders, ad platforms, fintech platforms, ecosystem apps, etc. They will define and execute the regional platform partnership strategy, help support local and global initiatives in-region, understand partner needs, influence product development, contribute to marketing initiatives, and coordinate with the go-to-market team on business opportunities. The ideal candidate is a master at building relationships and influencing internal and external stakeholders; brings a structured, data-driven approach to developing a market penetration strategy; and works in lock step with key stakeholders to execute complicated, strategic partnership agreements.  Location: Singapore OR Australia  Application Deadline: October 22, 2021  Please be advised that someone from the recruitment team will be in touch shortly after the application deadline.  What your day-to-day will look like: Develop the strategy for platform partnerships in APAC Build and lead a team to execute on the regional strategy and support global relationships/initiatives Regularly review market landscape and identify commercial deal opportunities to promote Clearco Execute on new partnerships deals and communicate updates to senior leadership Work with cross functional teams including Finance, Legal, Product, Sales, and Marketing to ensure deal implementations are on track and delivering against plan Take the lead in solving the problems that arise during the execution of programs with partners Develop and execute customized and scaled partner strategies, objectives, and plans to increase revenue and market Lead the development, negotiation, and signing of deal proposals in the region by working with various internal stakeholders Report and interact with senior management to indicate the status and progress of the partnership deals Foster in-depth and productive relationships at all levels with the client and Clearco Proactively educate Clearco on market developments and partner opportunities  You will thrive if you have: 10+ years in e-commerce, payments or related technology industry, operating in a matrix and in APAC Knowledge and experience of financial technology, platform business models and marketplaces, venture capital, private equity, or digital sectors that have relevant parallels to Clearco A data-driven, analytical and strategic mindset with proven ability to both create and execute successful market penetration strategies A track record of planning, managing, and closing complex, competitive partnership deals Experience growing a business or a function from inception to fruition, developing market share, brand, and profitable growth Demonstrated the ability to be an inspiring leader who can build a high-performing and diverse team Thought-leadership and influencing skills - you can communicate Clearco's strategy for Platform Partnerships in Europe and across the industry while captivating internal and external audiences Strong interpersonal skills - you have the ability to build relationships at all levels within the organisation and partner with clients The ability to be commercially focused and pragmatic - you are able to identify opportunities and define solutions A self-starter mindset - you are proactive and a commercially driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment A strategic and analytical mindset - you consistently challenge the status quo and the team to aim higher, an agent for changes Strong problem-solver skills - you are creative and resourceful when it comes to overcoming barriers and unexpected roadblocks Flexibility to adjust quickly to new demands, assimilate information and shape priorities A sense of urgency, assertiveness, and directness - you have the ability to think longer-term coupled with fast execution of short-term priorities The ability to be an ambassador for talent internally and externally  Application Deadline:  Clearco is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives to apply. At Clearco, we're committed to developing and upholding an inclusive, transparent, and comfortable environment for all. We create a space where every voice, perspective, and idea is heard and acknowledged. We embrace differences, and know that our diverse team is our strength and what drives our innovation.  Clearco is committed to developing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. If you require any accommodation, please email us at accommodations@clear.co and we'll work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

description: The Market Development Director, Asia is responsible for the growth and development of Dematic’s market position in assigned vertical markets. The role partners with the internal sales and solution development leaders to increase sales opportunities by bringing expert knowledge in the sector, thereby maximize revenue for the organization. Key Responsibilities (Problem Solving, Critical Thinking): - Serves as the internal Dematic expert for the assigned vertical market(s), including understanding industry trends, pain points, challenges, and gaps. - Generates a strategic direction for the assigned vertical market(s). The strategic direction is formulated by identifying needs, collecting internal and external data, performing strategic analyses, identifying opportunities, and developing implementation plans. - Aligns vertical-based activities across solution development, marketing, communications, business development and sales teams. - Develops sales strategies and account penetration strategies for top line new business growth within an assigned vertical market. - Analyze market data and report results to senior leadership on a regular cadence. - Leverages voice of customer data to understand customer challenges and pain points, in addition to understanding a customer’s buying criteria for supply chain solutions. - Monitors performance of assigned vertical market(s) and develops both near-term and long-term strategies to drive performance of assigned vertical market(s). - Provides market intelligence for the assigned geographies (Asia super-region including China and APAC). - Work with a cross functional pre-contract solution team for the creation of best in class logistics solutions to solve industry pain points. - Work with the Business Development team build industry knowledge with other global regions and to apply solutions globally. - Ability to drill into customer operations, understand logistics strategies, identify operational pain points within the distribution center and the supply chain around the distribution operation. - Willing to participate in industry associations and maintain a full understanding of the vertical markets they are responsible for. Including white paper creation from time to time. - Ability to communicate internally as well as externally as an industry expert and trusted advisor. - Provide competitive insights, benchmarking competitor solution sets to ensure our product and solution management stays ahead of the competition. - Partners with global cross-functional partners to develop a global perspective of assigned vertical market(s).What we offer:  Career Development  We are here to support you for the entirety of your Dematic career. From a fast start of learning Dematic’s history and foundational training to succeed in your role to leadership development programs, technical training and certifications, and Career Navigator to identify challenging new opportunities, our goal is to help you grow beyond your borders.  Competitive Compensation And Benefits  Our attractive and market competitive total rewards packages are designed to reward high performance and to assist in managing your personal and family needs. Dematic offers robust packages based on employment status and national requirements.  Pay Transparency  Dematic is committed to pay transparency. As such, Dematic will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.  However, Dematic will still maintain confidentiality of your pay information. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.  Global Opportunities  As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. We offer international assignments for qualified employees and wherever possible, we offer flexible working hours and modern workspace design.  Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/  Education  Tasks and Qualifications:  Typically Bachelor's Degree or advanced degree.  Knowledge / Qualifications 10+ years of experience in the material handling industry in a similar role Great customer rapport Strong speaker / presenter - confident in front of a large audience public speaking Demonstrated presentation skills, ability to build presentations effectively Business knowledge - P&L knowledge of logistics operations Ability to formulate sales strategy Market sector knowledge including a broad background and understanding of distribution center metrics used to measure performance, the ability to understand market pain points and translate solutions into customer ROI and a broad understanding of WMS, WCS, and ERP systems as applied to distribution and logistics operations. Innovator / concepter Ability to communicate to customers the difference between a manual, semi automated, and fully automated distribution system and how they are applied into an operation. Cross of practical and theoretical application knowledge Data conscience Customer contacts a plus
industries: Machinery

description: Job summary As the Group Client Growth Director function is the cornerstone of sustainable profitability for both Client and DKSH with a specific focus on DKSH Key Regional Clients. You ensures solid business foundation, delivers superior client Experience, carves out strategic partnerships and drives DKSH Client Management eco-system in collaboration with our local LBUM. You will manages a group of circa 16 clients that have business in 3 or more markets for a revenue exceeding CHF 8M. You will also drives, energizes, trains, and aligns on regular basis the Client Growth Managers (ex-Client Manager). Moreover, enhances and dare to challenge the process and way of working in place to accelerate DKSH business transformation. Key tasks: Manage DKSH’ interests with each client ensuring sound and improving financial results for the total business and for each country. Work in close collaboration with DKSH local LBUM. Support each market DKSH team for these clients through reviewing individual market growth plans to identify to identify gaps and opportunities. Gatekeeper of the potential interdependencies. Establish high standard relationships with each of an assigned list of key regional clients, positioning as the Group go-to POC. Aim at delivering outstanding Client’s experience. Develop a category-based hypothesis for growth of the client’s brands in the region, aligned with the client, adjusted for local market dynamics and driven by the local client and DKSH teams. Agree and follow a clear schedule of engagement centering around business reviews, annual planning, re-contracting periods… Ensure that our business foundation is rock solid, identify improvements that can be made in service levels with each client covering areas such as capability, process, systems, reporting and insights. Lead key business partners regionally and within countries (if necessary) to understand the client need and develop the total DKSH response (within acceptable levels of DKSH financial  Gather and playback genuine challenges in working with the client at market level, seeking improvement or resolution of key issues. Be available to client region level contacts to receive feedback and suggestions for improvement. Build and drive a strong eco-system with the local Client Growth Team for each managed regional client, coaching and supporting as they build the business in their respective markets. Understand client global and regional business strategy to be able to identify potential expansion points for DKSH. Leverage and deliver these in conjunction with BD team. Ensure wins and achievements with each client are celebrated and good performance of individuals within DKSH are raised up.  Requirements:  Demonstrate an affinity for industry best practice in the areas of: Client business planning, MT customer development, RTM, channel strategy, commercial planning, S&OP, trade marketing including trade spend optimization, POP Activation Have strong awareness of logistics and distribution fundamentals for FMCG Strong analytic skills Ideally an affinity for FMCG consumer marketing also Demonstrated cultural sensitivity and ability to work with teams from various countries and language backgrounds Business Degree or Equivalent and MBA (optional) More than 10 years’ experience in FMCG sales and/or Trade Marketing and experience working for or with distributors, Deep knowledge of Asia is a strong plus Hands on experience managing MT retailers, GT sales teams and in developing commercial growth plans for brands in Asian markets Experience managing a P&L, being responsible for financial results for a given market, brand or channel within supplier organization in FMCG industry   www.dksh.com Delivering Growth – in Asia and Beyond.

description: About us 500 Global is a venture capital firm with more than $1.8 billion in assets under management that invests early in founders building fast-growing technology companies. We focus on markets where technology, innovation, and capital can unlock long-term value and drive economic growth. We invest far and wide, across sectors and geographies. Our portfolio includes 33 companies valued at $1B+ and 120 companies valued at more than $100 million. 500 Southeast Asia is an early investor in Grab, Bukalapak, Carousell, Carsome, Prenetics and Finaccel, with 15 more of our portfolio companies worth in excess of USD $100 million each. We have made investments in 250 companies, which have gone on to raise a total of USD $20 billion. This is just the beginning - we are aggressively growing our team to serve even more founders and be even more impactful to entrepreneurship and the region.  About the Role We are looking for someone to join the Capital Formation Team at 500 Southeast Asia in Singapore. We have sovereign wealth funds, financial institutions, pensions, multi-nationals, ultra high net worth individuals, family offices and more entrusting us with their capital. You are a magnet for that. You strategize, organize, and execute the increase in assets under management. This means you'll pick up that phone, take the meetings, wine, dine (over Zoom as well), and convey our fund proposition to the right people. You'll work directly with the General Partners.  Responsibilities Actively source, outreach, contact and build relationships with potential leads and future investors (funds, financial institutions, pensions, multi-nationals, ultra high net worth individuals, family offices and more) Producing and updating collaterals including decks, pitchbooks, investor updates and reports Manage the relationships with our fund investors, including through organising events, scheduling meetings, managing and updating our investors Drive projects related to lead generation, sales pipeline organising fundraising roadshows Track and monitor the investor lifecycle and ensure that all investor queries are addressed in a timely manner Work with potential investors through their diligence, subscription and onboarding process.  Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or other related field Required 3+ years of prior fundraising experience in investment banking, private banking, private equity, or venture capital High attention to detail, thorough, organized and self-motivated Strong understanding of financial reporting and ability to analyze fund performance Proficient in G Suite tools as well as excel and powerpoint. Excellent deck design and data visualisation skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to multitask between projects and deliverables and maintain a high level of accountability Comfortable with working in an unstructured, cross-culture, global environment with high expectations Ambitious, curious, passionate about startup culture, venture capital and technology Flexibility with international travel at short notice Sales-driven personality.

Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.  Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.  Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest obstacles.  As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.  We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.  Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth.  About The Role  We are looking for a Partner Business Manager to join our Partnerships team and scale business growth. This individual is responsible for sourcing and building partner relationships, educating and training partner sales teams, and developing sales strategies to meet revenue and profit goals. Responsibilities will include:  Impact You’ll Own Support channel strategy based on Planet’s definitive target markets. Help the Channel evolve by introducing creative ideas about programs, sales strategies, and incentives to extend to partners to drive growth. Manage the business relationships with the partners in the region, such as commercial relationship, sales and technical enablement, exclusivities, etc. Responsible for ensuring that partners are conducting business up to Planet’s company standards. Manage the right coverage and mix of partners within the region (resellers, VARs, solution providers, app dev, integrators). Define partner-specific business plans with quantifiable goals and sign new partners as needed. Follow process, criteria, and controls for selection, management and performance of channel partners. Summarize partner pipeline and revenue per partner for the region. Actively manage partner enablement to sell and service our full range of products. Ensure partners, sales and management are working together in the sales process, lead generation, registering opportunities, accurately forecasting revenue, and tracking to required revenue goals established by their discount tier. Drive regional sales through partners and execute go-to-market strategies. Implement strategic sales account plans for all customers and identify business growth opportunities in the assigned customer base. Participate in sales cadence of Sales Kickoff, Quarter Business Reviews and weekly Forecast calls. What You Bring Minimum 5+ years of sales experience including 3+ years of channel sales Demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets Ability to work both collaboratively and independently in a high-growth, start-up culture Excellent communicator with strong presentation, speaking, and writing skills Excellent market research and prospecting skills The ability to coach partner sales teams on a solution selling sales methodology Excellent organizational and time management skills Ability to travel as needed A strong understanding of home working and the motivation to stay on track What Makes You Stand Out Experience working with geospatial imagery and/or GIS software Degree or equivalent business experience A desire to win and a focus on customer satisfaction Benefits While Working At Planet Comprehensive Health Plan Wellness program and onsite massages in specific offices Flexible Time Off Recognition Programs Commuter Benefits Learning and Tuition Reimbursement Parental Leave Offsites and Happy Hours Volunteering Benefits Some Press About Us  Our CEO, Will Marshall featured on TED and featured in a Planet Blog  “Planet: Bringing Space Back Down to Earth”  Tiny, privately owned satellites are changing how we view the Earth features in NBC News  “Planet And Rocket Lab Create Mission Patch To Honor Women In Aerospace” —Planet Blog  Why We Care So Much About Belonging.  We’re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That’s why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you’re thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don’t just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people’s careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you’re excited to come along for the ride.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: What You'll Be Doing  You'll lead our Commercial team in Singapore, motivating and developing a diverse team of Account Managers, Sales Representatives and Strategists. This is a rare opportunity to become a critical member of a rapidly growing, well-funded startup.  Your Role Will Include The Following  As a leader in the business you will also be responsible for growing the team and growing Deliveroo across Singapore. Lead our Commercial Strategy in Singapore Managing a team of 40 people across Business Development, Account Management and Restaurant Operations Implement strategies to drive revenue and ultimately business growth Oversee the sales, account management and corporate functions, working with the leads to enable them to run their teams in a very structured and methodical manner achieving commercial objectives Facilitate and lead meetings with high profile F&B groups Motivate the commercial team to hit aggressive targets Interpreting market trends and adapting to industry changes Handling a variety of secondary projects for the business What We'd Like To See In You  You’ll be tenacious, collaborative and have the following skill set: Demonstrable work experience in national commercial functions Excellent communication skills to enable you to navigate complex relationships Recent experience leading a large, successful team Analytical skills: you’ll have the ability to spot opportunities and trends to lead commercial conversations internally and externally Entrepreneurial skills and a natural ability to spot opportunities for revenue generation History of exceeding revenue targets Exhibit the ability to self-motivate and to motivate teams Relevant restaurant industry experience and in depth knowledge of market is a plus Experience in a high-growth business environment or start-up a plus Fluent in English Why Deliveroo?  When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us.  We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We’re a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride.  Benefits Become one of the key employees of a fast-growing, exciting startup changing the food delivery landscape Open, respectful and fun company culture Group insurance Dependent insurance Growing family support Free Deliveroo plus One day of paid leave per year to volunteer with a registered charity Excellent learning and development opportunities, and access to LinkedIn Learning Access to Headspace, a meditation and wellbeing app and service Daily breakfast and healthy snacks and fruit in the office Regular social events A continuously evolving benefits offering We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups around.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Food & Beverages, and Internet

description: About Pinnacle Pinnacle, the learning arm of the Golden Equator Group, is looking for a sales executive to help the expansion of a fast growing area of the business. Since starting the learning journey in 2019, our community has seen us running programmes in Singapore, Brunei and Korea. We are now looking to take the next step to expand Pinnacle into new markets and new verticals. The Pinnacle learning business currently has three core focus areas: Entrepreneurship: Running bootcamps and startup programmes Executive Education: Upskilling and training C-suite executives and employees on new trends and management skills NextGen: Creating in-depth programmes for the next generation of business leaders The role would suit someone with great contacts in the corporate learning space who is looking for a role that will create constant challenges, and is constantly evolving. With new potential programmes being created every year, you will be expected to be a fast-mover and an even faster learner. Aside from sales targets, your responsibilities will include helping to not only scout opportunities, but build relationships, pitch and help to advise the teams on client requirements and needs. Sales Executive Job Responsibilities: To build business for Pinnacle by identifying, cold-calling and selling corporate learning programmes to potential prospects Creating target lists for business development Maintaining relationships with clients to ensure repeat business Assisting in the creation of potential programme presentations and pitching Maintaining competitor and market awareness Developing and presenting ideas for new opportunities Required Qualifications / Skills: Ability to devise target lists and cold call Ability to create client presentations and proposals Excellent pitching and presentation skills Track record in building client relationships with corporate HR departments Experience in helping to devise, market and sell programmes in the corporate learning space Motivated self-starter who can work alone or as part of a team Degree in marketing, promotions, advertising sales, or business/administration preferred At least five years of sales experience in the education or corporate learning space Application link: https://app.briohr.com/public/boards/goldenequator-22ys5bwttk/details/60a4ed38a808950008d98dae We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Financial Services

description: What’s up? We’re VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it . VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH  Our amazing client partnership team is looking forward to collaborating with a “people first” Account Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Client Partnerships APAC.  Here’s your first brief -- Big thinker yet hands-on in execution. Exemplary track record of experience in the Singapore market. Natural entrepreneurial spirit and love for social media. Overall leader who runs the day to day, keeping the wheels moving and your client and team motivated. Tech-focused and geek everything technology; Gaming, e-sports, new technologies. Gatekeeper of the brand equity and quality control of work prior to it leaving the building. Manages overall client’s business, ensuring that we are delivering for the client’s business everyday. Navigate a portfolio of brands within a larger conglomerate or business group, and be deeply informed on the client’s business, including all campaign performance, any competitive, as well as product cycle Deep and more proactive understanding of the client’s business outside of our campaigns or the marketing context. Proactively identify needs of the client and business to sell-through incremental campaign opportunities to clients, that help them achieve the most efficient returns & results on their overall marketing dollars, while delivering best in class work that help grow client business Strong foundational and working knowledge of creative and media across major digital and social channels. Well versed in common marketing and media principles with a strong understanding of the social media platforms and their ecosystems. Your Experience 6+ years of relevant work experience in the media or advertising field, including an account management experience in the APAC advertising landscape. Competencies: Business strategy, digital asset management, digital media planning and buying. Proficiency in written, verbal and presentation skills. Strategic sales planning, pipeline management, relationship building, digital market knowledge, negotiation skills, presentation skills, analytical skills. People management Worked with teams in complex, multi-geography, multi-cultural environments. What You Should Know About VaynerMedia  Think “lab” and not “agency”. We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We’re willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It’s fun!  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Description:   In your role as the Head of Sales Excellence, you will be responsible to further optimize Study Group’s “Growth driven” agenda as one of the 4 pillars of success based on the guiding principles of performance and data driven organization. This will involve designing, developing and implementing effective processes, tools and programs regarding:  1. Best in class agent planning/management  2. Portfolio & Territory Management  3. Activity & Pipeline management  4. Individual & Team Performance management  5. Rewards & Recognition management (incentives, competitions etc)   This will include ongoing enforcement to understand the optimal way of working within efficient standardised Global Sales Process and the effective CRM usage (Salesforce.com) to enable:  Performance benchmarking by ranking sales to improve overall average Guidelines on size of portfolio, individual & agent activities, success measures for healthy pipeline etc  Identify best practices to standardize sales practices as part of global sales process Communicate timely performance status to leadership team for awareness and necessary actions Initiatives to support more than 80% of sales achieve targets  Tasks:   Develop & implement performance benchmarking by ranking sales across different levels to improve overall average Develop & implement guidelines on size of portfolio, individual & agent activities, success measures for healthy pipeline etc to provide standard operating procedures for sales to follow as part of Global Sales Process Continuously identify best practices to standardize sales practices as part of global sales process Develop & Communicate timely performance status to leadership team for awareness and necessary actions Establish measurement and develop initiatives to support more than 80% of sales achieve targets Develop & implement programs to motivate sales through short term/ annual competitions based on business requirement to focus on specific products or areas, Identify and reduce/eliminate non-value added and non-selling time for sales maximize efforts on business development Implementation of sales process, practices and reporting on salesforce.com as single version of the truth Monitoring and reinforcing progress and adoption of sales processes, salesforce.com and best practices across all sales teams Collaborating with the leadership team and Training & Development manager to ensure processes, tools, and programs are embedded in ongoing sales management practices inclusive of standard measurements.  Motivate, coach and enable team leaders/ SMT to implement and sustain core programmes as part of daily sales activities, whilst creating an environment that generates a high level of motivation and team spirit. Provide effective consultancy and advisory support to SMT and team leaders to assess current gaps and identify development needs to enhance performance. Skills Required:  Strong proven sales background – performance & skills – either within Study Group or external (frontline sales: min 5 yrs/: sales management: min 2 yrs) Strong understanding and experience with Salesforce reporting Strong experience around pipeline and forecast reviews, tools and procedures Good analytical and operational execution skills Experience in developing/implementing sales process and CRM(salesforce.com) for a large sales team Ability to define success criteria’s and measure them, identify constant issues to resolve underlying factors for improving performance Proven track record in structure problem solving: problem identification & analysis, solution development & implementation Results oriented, self-organized and able to propose/ make decisions Strong interpersonal (win trust, build rapport with various stakeholders) and communication skills (presentations etc.) Leadership and strong desire in developing people Willingness to travel  (up to 50%/ month) when border opens  Preferred:  People development Cross border thinking Business acumen Project management experience Constructive challenge Note: Please include your resume and Cover letter    We appreciate every application we receive however due to the volume of applications, in the event you have not heard from us within 3 weeks, unfortunately, we will not be taking your application forward on this occasion.  We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of our students, and expect all staff and volunteers to share the same commitment.  About Study Group  We are a global pathway provider in International Education, working collaboratively with a number of Top Tier Universities. Voted as the 2017, 2018 and 2020 Global Pathway Provider of the year, our people are united with the shared ambition of providing a world-class UK education to talented students from across the globe.      Organisational Compliance  Study Group is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students, and expects all staff and volunteers to share the same dedication. Applicants will be required to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the role, including checks with past employers, an Enhanced Check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and overseas criminal records if appropriate.  Study Group processes your information in line with data protection regulations. Please see our Privacy Policy
industries: Education Management, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: Global Director, BizDev & Investor Relations    Okay, we want a superstar sales executive!    Live and Work Anywhere – 100% remote. Potential equity and profit sharing.   Hit target and make $150K or more in the first year. However, there is no cap on commission, so makes as much as you are able.     Dragon’s Vault (DV) and its portfolio companies are looking to transform the global financial landscape, we want to make everyone wealthier. We want to disrupt the traditional centralized way and provide decentralized financial freedom. We have big dreams and big ambitions, and we realize we can only do this as a team.    As a result, we are looking for a solid, performance driven sales executive to fill the role of Global Director of Business Development and Investor Relations.    First and foremost, call the position whatever you want, we need a superstar sales executive, and if that is you, you can write your own ticket. No caps on commissions. If you can close it, you have earned it. We believe performance-based incentives, as such our philosophy in this role, should be the highest paid position in the organization, and we are doing all we can to properly incentives to that end.   Additionally, depending on the experience and capacity, or investment appetite, the right candidate will be considered for a partnership/ equity role within DV, or within one of its portfolio companies.    About The Role & Responsibilities  We will be asking a lot, so we will expect to compensate a lot.   This role is perfect for you if you have strong entrepreneurial and startup moxie, you are an excellent sales hunter, excellent relationship building, strong closer, account management, in software, technology, particularly in DeFi, Venture Capital, Investments, Digital Assets, Mergers and Acquisitions, and especially in FinTech within the Crypto and Blockchain markets.    Compensation considerations  On Target 1st year total compensation: $150K  This role should make more money than anyone else within the organizations. We compensate in cryptocurrencies, including our own, which creates a bonus to any success.   Targeted sales –   Closing LPs (raising money for DV) 10% commission - Target $500K  Cryptium sales - Target $500K commission 10% (7% crypto/ 3% Cryptium)   Liquidity Pools Providers - $500K commission 10%    Required Qualifications   Degrees are overrated, just have the experience and the abilities with the below:   Crypto, Blockchain, DeFi, and FinTech Enthusiast with basic understanding and/or willingness to learn.   International Sales experience    Managing a Sales Pipeline  Prospect your own leads  Financial product sales  Legal Understanding of Public Markets  An excellent storyteller  No BS, just results, does not have to be high pressure selling, just selling with results  Excel proficiency and exceptional organizational skills  Strong attention to details, go-getter attitude, and ambition   Comfortable communicating with senior-level executives and external investors  Willingness to work flexible hours (We are a global team from Singapore, India, Canada, US and growing)  Work from a home office  Ability to work in a startup environment  Not Required Qualifications:   Raising capital and working with Limited Partners for investment funds   Prior experience in crypto currency/digital assets and/or strong interest in blockchain/DEFI and crypto currency  A working understanding of centralized exchanges, decentralized exchanges, lending, staking, and derivatives    If interested, please send CVC/ Resume and cover letter to: Careers@AuDeFi.finance subject line: Sales   If we do not check all your boxes. Do not sweat it. We are passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you have what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment—apply anyway. While we have a fairly good idea of what we need, we are ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.   About Dragon’s Vault:   As a Singapore holding company and open-ended investment fund, DV is on a mission to safeguard humanity’s financial well-being by bridging access for the masses to venture capital, blockchain and fintech markets.   In June of 2020, DV began trading assets and has finished its first year of operations with a circa 240% ROI.   Why join us?  Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like Dragon’s Vault and portfolio companies.   One of the most innovating and ambitious portfolios of companies in venture capital, blockchain and fintech. We are working on some of the coolest and cutting-edge financial technologies, such as Decentralized Pension Plans, Combining Game Play with NFTs and Cryptos, revolutionary staking platforms, and of course, the first of its kind crypto annuity for business cash flows to name a few.   The forefront of a revolution. We fundamentally believe blockchain is a next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more profitable future. You can be a part of building the digital economy of tomorrow and radically transforming our society for the better.  A dynamic startup environment with deep roots. We are all seasoned and experienced entrepreneurs and leaders in our respective professions.   Deep technical challenges. Blockchain technology is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. We are building the tools, infrastructure and applications that are pushing technology forward.  Continuous learning and improvements. You will be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers and as you work on different projects — challenging you to stay at the top of your game.   Resources:   https://www.dragonsvault.co/  https://www.audefi.finance/  https://www.cryptium.finance/

Purpose Statement  The Sales Division is responsible for sourcing new name sales contract commitments and major contracts from existing customers. The Business Manager will be responsible for the development and implementation of Sales /Marketing strategies across the country. The purpose of the role is to sell the annual sales quota for the country with the right mix of licence, services IP and maintenance to deliver on the annual revenue and EBIT budget.  Key Responsibility Areas (KRAs) Financial Performance Meet or exceed sales quota by region and revenue streams Increasing market share in existing markets and maximise new business development opportunities Meet or exceed cost management and operational performance as agreed in Sales budget through monitoring and controlling the Sales Team performance, taking responsibility for profit and loss including cost management of investment in Presales and Solutions to budget Deliver Sales revenue and profit forecasts that are accurate and on time Identify and implement actions to address any variances to budget Communicate regularly with Head of Sales for Sales and Delivery Singapore on revenue performance Ensure the desired balance between licence sales and services sales is maintained and Develop and implement sales strategies that ensure that balance align with business strategies Organisational Development Proactively participate and contribute to organisational development Work with peers to ensure sales and delivery teams work effectively together Deliver operational improvement plans that ensure delivery of strategy Build a consistent sales & marketing framework across all geographies, products and service offerings. Exploit the true value of a combined approach to brand building, lead generation and sales conversion Develop & execute Marketing Strategy to support & underpin annual business goals Set annual sales strategy in line with business goals Identify potential improvement areas in internal performance or solution offerings to market and where appropriate, recommend and manage the implementation strategy Identification and exploitation of target sectors Develop innovative approaches to support lead generation To work closely with the consulting business to ensure smooth delivery to customers and customer satisfaction Leadership Support Consulting Manager in the sales/uplift of general services that are delivered by consulting Implement a strong culture of discipline through effective hands-on operational management including half yearly performance reviews. Provide coaching, mentoring & training to direct reports to guide them with career planning & development Promote a professional environment of timely and open communication to ensure team members are aware of news & changes through regular information sharing meetings Demonstrate and uphold company values External relationships Deliver sales by creating long term partnerships which engender ongoing business relationships Work collaboratively within the NTTD Group to maximise opportunities Manage relationship with business partners and principal partners across the country Key Performance Measures (KPM) Customer Retention Customer Satisfaction Sales Quota EBIT Number of Leads Conversion Ratio Critical Knowledge, Skills & Experience Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Information Technology or related field of study 4 – 7 years’ sales experience Effective Pipeline Management Maximizing customer value and customer satisfaction Track sales record of Analytics Solutions and SAP Enterprise and Cloud solution Track sales record of SAP Enterprise and Cloud solutions, Managed Services Must have knowledge of IT Services Proven track record of driving profitable revenue growth in applications sales Deep technology industry experience Excellent people and communication skills Developed & managed a geographically diverse team Developed & implemented internal processes & procedures Developed & maintained alliances & partnerships Previous senior leadership experience Sales & marketing skills Negotiation skills

description: Department: Sales  Employment Type: Permanent  Job Description  Apex Fund Services (Singapore) Pte Ltd is seeking to hire a Senior Business Development professional to join its established APAC team. To be based in Singapore, the role is to support the origination of high quality client relationships in a manner consistent with the businesses objectives.  The key focus of this role is to drive new business in South East Asia, increase revenue for our corporate services, funds and financial businesses while enhancing our profile in the region. The successful candidate is expected to have a strong background in Corporate Services and have an established business development track record.  An attractive salary and commission scheme is offered to the successful candidate.  Role & Key Responsibilities Drive new client acquisitions and increase revenue in Singapore and APAC. Achieve business targets by implementing new business development initiatives. Grow the business brand and reputation across the region. Develop and manage a strong network of clients and intermediaries. Build, manage and progress a pipeline of new business opportunities. Collaborate with colleagues globally to achieve business objectives. Lead sales process from end to end, including management of deal teams. Ensure robust knowledge of Apex’s offering and value proposition. Champion cross-sell initiatives across services lines and geographies to drive news sales into our existing client base. Work closely with and build strong collaborative relationship with sales, marketing, client on-boarding, operations and other functions Advise on strategic initiatives such as product development. Act a key relationship manager to ensure that clients’ needs are understood and communicated through the organization. Coach, develop and motivate of sales and support professionals to drive for sales performance and achieve sales goals Follow internal sales and non-sales process and compliance requirements. Includes management reporting, salesforce maintenance, attendance at internal meetings, assistance with onboarding as required, ensure agreed project deliverables are met. 5+ years of experience in corporate and fund solutions. 5+ year’s business development experience, ideally in Singapore A strong existing network of fund managers, investors and third party influencers. Knowledge of corporate services, financial markets and asset management. Strong self-confidence, strategic mind to lead and/or contribute to discussion with all type of stakeholders at various seniority levels. Able to sell complex solutions to clients, and handle clients’ requests/objections in an appropriate manner. Demonstrated sales skills and ability to deliver on targets. Proven experience working with senior figures in the development of client relationships Strong verbal and written skills are essential. Experience with CRM systems and internal stakeholders. Possess a strong work ethic, as well as uncompromising integrity. Educated to degree level, relevant professional qualifications beneficial. Candidate with lesser experience will be considered for a more junior position. An attractive compensation scheme directly related to performance A strategic role in the development of our business in APAC Ability to originate and manage large and complex sales opportunities Excellent exposure to multiple segments of financial services industry and it’s participants Tailored pathway and training to professional development Be part of a dynamic and fast-paced team that makes a genuine impact on revenue and sales pipeline. Exposure to all aspects of the business, cross-jurisdiction and to working with senior management directly. The ability to contribute strategy and to drive innovation and have a tangible impact on the business We are an equal opportunity employer and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, gender identity, marital status, race, colour, nationality, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, socio-economic, responsibilities for dependants, physical or mental disability. Any hiring decision are made on the basis of skills, qualifications and experiences.  We measure our success as a business, not only by delivering great products and services and continually increasing our assets under administration and market share, but also by how we positively impact people, society and the planet.  For more information on our commitment to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) please visit our CSR policy page .  If you are looking to take that next step in your career and are ready to work for a high performing organisation, alongside talented people who take pride in delivering great results, please submit your application (with your CV, cover letter and salary’s expectations) to our dedicated email address: [email protected]
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Accounting

description: Job Highlights $84,000-$132,000 per annum on-target earnings Massive sales opportunities and Attractive Commissions scheme Experience in recruitment in 1 or more industries  Job Description With strong growth plans from 2021Q3, we are seeking achievement-focused individuals to lead our recruitment teams as Recruitment Sales Team Managers. As we are expanding, you will be charged with engaging new and existing clients, partnering them to shape their staffing strategy, developing recommendations to close deals, along with ensuring delivery with a dynamic team of recruitment consultants. To be successful, you should have recruitment experience in 1 or more industries, and be passionate about driving sales strategy and achieving targets. As the leader of a team, you need strong leadership capability to develop your team’s strengths, and motivate them to achieve and exceed targets every quarter.    Job Responsibilities Lead a team of recruitment consultants in achieving sales targets Develop new business and serve existing clientele Mentor and motivate a team of consultants Maintain orderly day-to-day operations in line with company protocol Keep abreast of market trends and provide insights to clients Manage the end-to-end recruitment process with a team of consultants  Job Requirements Diploma/Degree in any discipline Proven track record of success in recruitment sales Leadership capability in motivating the team to achieve sales targets Good exposure in at least 1 key industry for 5-8 years Experience in the recruitment industry is required Ability to plan and strategise Strong motivator and results driven   Company Overview ACHIEVE Group is a longstanding Talent Acquisition agency, powered with a mission to help Clients, Candidates and Consultants achieve success and realise aspirations. Having placed more than 40,000 people in positions across industry in our 30-over years as a trusted brand, we are now embarking on an extraordinary expansionary program, with multi-prong services and international alliances. In building our organisation to take the great leap ahead, we are looking out for exceptional individuals to strengthen our business. Come, join us in this opportunity of a lifetime!

description: The SaaS Sales Director will have full ownership and responsibility for managing sales activities and ensuring the achievement of significant new revenue growth targets. As a Sales Director, you will manage and grow a distributed team responsible for direct sales in Singapore and ASEAN region.  The SaaS Sales Director is responsible for leading the team to drive SaaS sales, including account penetration, prospect qualification, supervision of sales activity, sales process planning, and closing all sales opportunities in the industry and/or sector that he/she is in.  Beyond managing the SaaS sales, he/she also act as trusted advisor to sell 3D solutions and services according to the business needs of clients.  Responsibilities Develop and execute plans to build a scalable pipeline in Singapore and the ASEAN market Grow the assigned regions as per given sales and profitability Consistently manage the sales to achieve corporate assigned objectives Cultivate new, develop and manage clients relationships Identify new markets to expand and increase business opportunities Nurture relationships with highly qualified opportunities in Singapore Public Sector Collaborate closely with the marketing and technology departments to evolve our sales strategy when new features and products are introduced Build your Sales Team and be involved in the recruitment, selection and hiring, including their onboarding, training, and management Qualifications Minimum 6 years of sales business-to-business experience, with 3 years of sales management experience. Must be from a high-growth SaaS/Cloud industry background Senior Sales Managers who are confident to move towards their next stage of their career path with the drive and passion are welcome to apply A strong track record in delivering profitable growth to the organization The ability to demonstrate responsibility of strategically positioning this region to align with the goals and direction of management Strong analytical skills to identify trends and patterns Ability to negotiate and creatively problem solve; Strong communication skills in both written and verbal

description: Could your current situation be better?  Want a role where you are properly utilised? You can join us on an exciting journey where you can use your skills to lead a team, identify new businesses and build up our brand in the marketplace. This would be more than just hitting your KPIs, but playing an important role to lead the sales team to greater heights, build up relationships and establish our name in the marketplace. Sounds like your cup of tea? Read on!  What you'll be doing Leading, supporting, challenging and monitoring performance of sales force within defined field of responsibility Own sales activities Develop and implement sales strategy to generate new businesses and service existing clients better Close collaboration with cross functions and borders to achieve a seamless delivery of our services Minimum Qualifications Minimum Bachelor's Degree 10 years in similar industry and of which 5 years in leadership role Sound knowledge in air. sea, contract logistics and road Deep knowledge in freight forwarding and supply chain Proven sales record Able to work across geographical boundaries About you Business acumen Good negotiation skills Sales and results oriented strong interpersonal & communication skills self driven, dynamic & optimistic  Company Introduction  cargo-partner is a privately owned full-range info-logistics provider offering a comprehensive portfolio of air, sea, land transport and warehousing services, with special expertise in information technology and supply chain optimization. The company operates over 130 offices in 40 countries around the world to create fast and efficient solutions for a wide range of industries. description: We’re looking for a talented, driven leader with great energy, passion and initiative to lead a highly talented leadership team, who drive awareness and new business acquisition for the fastest growing data platform on the planet throughout the ASEAN region.  The ASEAN leadership team concentrates on formulating and executing a sales development and growth strategy within assigned countries in the ASEAN region, resulting in revenue growth, new customer acquisition and career development for all.  As the Senior Director with a focus on Recruitment, Development and Execution for the ASEAN team, you will drive revenue and assure the continued successful trajectory of one of the highest growth regions in the company.  10+ years of technology sales experience and 5+ years in a leadership capacity where you have built and/or scaled a team of 50+

Collinson is a global leader in customer benefits and loyalty. We deliver exceptional travel, assistance and insurance products that differentiate value propositions, and loyalty solutions that win deeper, more valuable customer relationships.   Our customer benefits products include the world’s leading airport experiences programme, Priority Pass, as well as travel insurance, identity assistance, flight delay, international health and travel risk management solutions. Our loyalty expertise uniquely combines strategy, award-winning technology and programme management to create greater engagement and experiences for our clients’ customers.   For over 30 years, we’ve been chosen by the world’s leading payment networks, 1,400+ banks, 90+ airlines and 20+ hotel groups to craft customer experiences that win competitive edge. This enables them to acquire, engage and retain the most profitable, but most demanding customers. Our client experience includes CBA, American Express, Virgin Australia, Singapore Airlines, Cathay Pacific, Mastercard, UnionPay and Visa.       PURPOSE OF THE JOB   The Business Development Director, Singapore will be responsible to target, sell and contract Collinson solutions within Singapore. The individual will be expected to personally identify sales prospects, create the right client engagement and manage these, ultimately closing the sale. By the very nature of our clients’ requirements, the incumbent will be skilled in leveraging the wider organisation and external strategic partners to create winning sales propositions & bid teams.      KEY RESPONSIBILITIES   Lead Business Development activities in Singapore with a primary focus on the Financial Services and Travel sectors but with specific opportunities in other select industries.  To own a territory Business Development Target and achieve Pipeline, Sales Revenue and Gross Margin metrics  Identify target key decision makers and influencers among qualified prospects and build commercially viable relationships via Networking and proactive dialogue/engagement  To develop deep and wide relationships within B2B targets where decision makers and influencers can be extensive.  To deeply understand prospect business needs and challenges  To design and articulate complex business solutions into saleable solutions for both new and existing clients that meet the needs of targets.  Nurture and optimize Strategic partnerships to support commercial goals  Project manage client opportunities in conjunction with Business Solutions and Country teams  Deliver on administration and reporting processes to support efficient working, including Salesforce updates, Bid Qualification processes, commercial, legal and operational sign off.  Represent Collinson at Key industry events     KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED   Demonstrable self-starter who can close out solutions contracts of significant scale  7+ years in loyalty or Customer engagement selling  Track record of Consultative, solution selling with strong customer centric mindset  Evidence of building pipelines and converting large scale deals  Gravitas to effectively engage at C level in large organizations     PERSON SPECIFICATION   The DNA of a solutions sales person who craves to understand the customer in depth, their business environment, and their business needs deeply before even starting to talk about Collinson.    A natural hunter with the inherent drive to find new opportunities and 'close’ new business  A proven track record of winning new loyalty or customer engagement solutions deals.  A high level of discipline in opportunity qualification – recognizing that qualifying out is as important as qualifying in.  Strong commercial orientation  A very strong networker who has an established senior client contact list in the target base  Outstanding consultative sales approach with the ability to form strong working relationships through exceptional gravitas, an engaging personality and business credibility  A clear philosophy the solution sales success is highly dependent on understanding a customer deep and wide.  That this takes significant research effort to understand THEM and only then does the solutions sales person have the right to talk to the customer about US.  A real can do will do attitude. Does not recognize boundaries and thrives in an environment of opportunity, confidence and hunger for growth  Sets and achieves very high levels of performance and continually strives for personal improvement in all that they do  High levels of energy, thrives on being challenged and will take others on the journey of success  Will take accountability for action and takes deals through to closure and ensure a clean transition to the delivery and in-life team  An equally strong influencer internally as externally to ensure that the internal organization and strategic partners are brought on the sales journey.  High standards of personal presentation
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Our client, Global leader in Customer Experience, Management, is looking for their Regional Strategic Partner Director (E-Commerce) based in Singapore.  Reporting to the CCO, the Strategic Partner Director has direct responsibility for fostering a strong relationship with their assigned client to deliver regional and global farming opportunities and growth in market share through all its solutions that are offered. Will serve as a trusted advisor to the client and bring an incessant desire to add value. A “Passion for People" is key. In addition, the SPD is accountable for the financial performance of their portfolio. As a leader, you will collaborate with other members of the Executive, Global and Site level leadership teams to develop the overarching client relationship and vision and offer targeted solutions to help improve their overall business.   Main Responsibilities:  We are looking for a Strategic Partner Director that has deep vertical knowledge in e-commerce and BPO.  Provide strategic direction and executive leadership oversight for client/ relationships regionally and/or globally. Develop and implement strategic plans to drive revenue opportunities that align to clients’ strategy. Ideates and solutions to ID new LOBs. Cultivates client relationships at VP/SVP/CXO level and with all relevant client stakeholder to maximize the reputation and growth of its business with each client account. Ability to understand the full scope of its capabilities and ability to research the client landscape to uncover targeted areas of opportunity. Ensures retention of the client’s business, developing broad and deep relationships across the client accounts Attend internal weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews, building a cohesive client relationship. Act as escalation point for client issues that have not been resolved by normal channels Strong understanding or willingness to learn Transformation in BPO landscape and beyond. Provide strategic, transformative solutions to add value back into the client’s business. Assume accountability for the delivery of transformative, value-added client solutions services in support of multiple account managers, contact center agents, technology professionals, and project managers. Demonstrate an awareness of the range of services provided and match them the overall client strategy for program level enhancement. Lead process-improvement initiatives that deliver financial targets. Ensure account management teams are monitoring and calibrating customer service quality, and recommending product and process improvement ideas to clients. Create an environment, which delivers excellent service to clients; ensure account managers are driving operations to consistently meet or exceed all financial and non-financial KPIs. Oversee and support where needed all aspects of implementation of new clients as needed, ensuring management, compliance and reporting for all contact center operations including call volume forecasting and staffing, client service commitments, budget, forecasted hours versus actual hours, payroll, etc. Facilitate client visits, audits and tours while demonstrating knowledge and awareness of its business and the ability to present this to suit client needs  These tasks are not limitative. Industry Vertical experience preferred in management of operational functions and large account management while interfacing with complex client organizations. Without industry experience, ability to upskill and learn will be essential and required. Extensive expertise in building and managing long-term relationships with business partners and clients. Consultative sales background critical, hunting and/or farming with proven track record to meet sales targets. Extensive background in project management and project implementation. Strong leadership ability in orchestrate directing a team consisting of multiple disciplines, multiple organizations/support functions, and/or upper management team members. Proven ability to manage global client relationships. Demonstrated strong track record in driving continuous improvement. description: About ByteDance  Responsibilities  Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.  Join the Innovative BytePlus Team  As part of BytePlus, you'll help enterprise customers build what's next for their business. Leveraging Bytedance's cutting-edge technologies, we are devoted to developing innovative products and solutions to shape the future. We help our clients to focus on what truly matters. Centering on innovation and excellence, we create gamechanging solutions that help businesses to unleash their potential. You can help us to achieve our mission.  The BytePlus APAC Regional head is a senior leader with a passion and experience for growing high-performance teams and successfully delivering innovative solutions to enterprise customers, helping them solve some of their current biggest business challenges. The BytePlus APAC Regional head will be leading a team of sales/presales/customer success managers and marketing managers responsible to deliver the mission of BytePlus in the region and growing our business and footprint in APAC.  Responsibilities Lead BytePlus APAC field organization to meet BytePlus regional targets and expand BytePlus business across APAC. Maintain key customer relationships and develop and implement strategies for expanding the company’s customer base (driving new logo adoption) in APAC. Work with BytePlus global team in developing, defining and executing the marketing and sales strategy in APAC. Build and manage a team of 10+ individuals composed of Sellers (SDR, AE, Solution Specialist), Presales, Customer Success Managers, Marketing. Accurate reporting on sales and business activities and forecasting to senior management team. Own the end-to-end sales process and customer journey : Actively lead and monitor demand generation activities Lead initiatives to drive customer awareness and engagement Develop and execute successful sales campaigns and coach team for best-in-class sales pursuits. Ensure smooth customer onboarding. Drive customer's full adoption and usage of our solutions, ensuring customer satisfaction. Create a stimulating environment where everyone keeps a learning mindset and is energized by new growth opportunities, open to try new things, fail and make progress. Inspire people to do their best on a day-to-day basis and provide a diverse and inclusive work environment for your team to thrive in. Ongoing mentoring and development of sales, CSM, presales team which includes hiring, training and coaching duties. Qualifications Strong demonstrated and proven enterprise software and/or SaaS - PaaS technology sales and sales management experience with strong track records of quota and revenue overachievement. Minimum 5 years of experience in regional leadership/managing director roles in the tech industry leading different roles and business functions (sales, technical presales, CSM, marketing, partnership). Minimum 8 years in people management with team size of 10+ individuals, with strong track record of recruiting, developing and retaining a high performing enterprise sales organization. Proven track record of building satisfied, loyal and reference able customers. Experience working in an early-stage start-up environment and ability to lead teams through ambiguous environment.

description: Payoneer’s mission is to empower businesses to go beyond – beyond borders, limits and expectations. In today’s digital world, Payoneer enables any business of any size from anywhere to access new economic opportunities by making it possible to transact as easily globally as they do locally.  Payoneer’s digital platform streamlines global commerce for millions of small businesses, marketplaces and enterprises from 200 countries and territories. Leveraging its robust technology, compliance, operations and banking infrastructure, Payoneer delivers a suite of services that includes cross-border payments, working capital, tax solutions and risk management. Powering growth for customers ranging from aspiring entrepreneurs in emerging markets to the world’s leading digital brands like Airbnb, Amazon, Google and Upwork, Payoneer makes global commerce easy and secure. Founded in 2005, Payoneer is profitable and has a team based all around the world.  Payoneer - one world, one platform, unlimited opportunities  https://www.payoneer.com/  Your Career Choice at Payoneer  Director of Partnerships, Southeast Asia  Build Your Career | Have Fun | Make a Difference  If you’re the kind of person that loves to get things done, collaborate with colleagues all over the world and is interested in joining a fast-growing global company that is trusted by the world’s top digital brands and truly cares for its customers, join us at Payoneer!  Are you customer focused, analytical, strategic and yet execution focused? Are you passionate about bringing in transformation in your customers business? Do you have the leadership traits to be an entrepreneur with a strong work ethic? Is this you?  We’re looking for  Payoneer is looking for a seasoned, energetic and ambitious Director of Partnership for Southeast Asia, who takes ownership to the highest level, is able to learn quickly in a fast-paced environment and to grow new and existing partner accounts through effective executive engagement. You will drive the engagement of new potential partners, manage an existing portfolio and handle the end-to-end partner management. Working in a dynamic business environment, you will be responsible for identifying and collaborating with the potential partners to drive acquisition and to create an ecosystem to support millions of SMBs who use Payoneer’s services.  In addition to being adept at both business development and account management, the ideal candidate should possess strong analytical skills in order to create programs and processes to enable the channel partnerships function to grow at scale. This role provides an opportunity for the right candidate to display their leadership skills and take ownership of the entire channel partnerships function.  The ideal candidate will be comfortable in a fast-paced, multi-tasked, high energy and global environment, with an ability to deal with ambiguity. Candidate should also have experience in developing and nurturing relationships at senior levels, as well as experience in managing teams and working in a global, cross-functional role and in a multicultural environment. He/she should also be a self-starter with eye for detail, strong analytics, with creative solutions, and in general share our drive to grow the business in the region. This role requires some travel (Post Pandemic).  Roles & Responsibilities Build and grow a strong network of partners and affiliates. Take on and grow existing portfolio of partners and onboard new ones. Build partnerships and relationships that drive acquisition of customers across multiple product offerings. Continue to develop a strong pipeline of API-integration opportunities that create value for Payoneer’s SMB and Partner ecosystem in the region. Take the lead in scaling our channel partnerships function by creating new programs and processes to support continued growth of the partnerships team. Coach and continue to build a team of high bar performers around the region. Contribute to strategic initiatives that will drive new vertical and market development activities in the region. Have you accomplished these kinds of qualifications? Undergraduate degree from a top-tier university. 10+ years of experience in business development, channel sales or account management. Extensive experience in deal making, partnerships, managing relationships and creating new opportunities. Proven track record of exceptional ownership, ability to deal with ambiguity and meeting & exceeding targets. Strategic thinking coupled with ability to drive business end-to-end. Ability to make decisions in a changing environment, anticipate needs and drive results. Proven ability to work with multiple internal and external stake holders globally including at the most senior levels. Able to lead, define and manage long term strategy as well as day-to-day activities of teams across multiple countries. Strong written and oral communication skills. Excellent quantitative skills to quickly and accurately analyze complex information / data to draw conclusions and insights in clear written and oral communication. Business development experience in multiple countries in Southeast Asia. Experience in fintech, payments, ecommerce ecosystems and other related industries. Ever wondered whether that perfect combination really exists? You know, the job we always dream where we develop professionally and enjoy a fun workplace surrounded by passionate people, at a company that is really changing the world? Check us out!
