description: The Market Development Director, Asia is responsible for the growth and development of Dematic’s market position in assigned vertical markets. The role partners with the internal sales and solution development leaders to increase sales opportunities by bringing expert knowledge in the sector, thereby maximize revenue for the organization. Key Responsibilities (Problem Solving, Critical Thinking): - Serves as the internal Dematic expert for the assigned vertical market(s), including understanding industry trends, pain points, challenges, and gaps. - Generates a strategic direction for the assigned vertical market(s). The strategic direction is formulated by identifying needs, collecting internal and external data, performing strategic analyses, identifying opportunities, and developing implementation plans. - Aligns vertical-based activities across solution development, marketing, communications, business development and sales teams. - Develops sales strategies and account penetration strategies for top line new business growth within an assigned vertical market. - Analyze market data and report results to senior leadership on a regular cadence. - Leverages voice of customer data to understand customer challenges and pain points, in addition to understanding a customer’s buying criteria for supply chain solutions. - Monitors performance of assigned vertical market(s) and develops both near-term and long-term strategies to drive performance of assigned vertical market(s). - Provides market intelligence for the assigned geographies (Asia super-region including China and APAC). - Work with a cross functional pre-contract solution team for the creation of best in class logistics solutions to solve industry pain points. - Work with the Business Development team build industry knowledge with other global regions and to apply solutions globally. - Ability to drill into customer operations, understand logistics strategies, identify operational pain points within the distribution center and the supply chain around the distribution operation. - Willing to participate in industry associations and maintain a full understanding of the vertical markets they are responsible for. Including white paper creation from time to time. - Ability to communicate internally as well as externally as an industry expert and trusted advisor. - Provide competitive insights, benchmarking competitor solution sets to ensure our product and solution management stays ahead of the competition. - Partners with global cross-functional partners to develop a global perspective of assigned vertical market(s).What we offer:  Career Development  We are here to support you for the entirety of your Dematic career. From a fast start of learning Dematic’s history and foundational training to succeed in your role to leadership development programs, technical training and certifications, and Career Navigator to identify challenging new opportunities, our goal is to help you grow beyond your borders.  Competitive Compensation And Benefits  Our attractive and market competitive total rewards packages are designed to reward high performance and to assist in managing your personal and family needs. Dematic offers robust packages based on employment status and national requirements.  Pay Transparency  Dematic is committed to pay transparency. As such, Dematic will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.  However, Dematic will still maintain confidentiality of your pay information. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.  Global Opportunities  As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. We offer international assignments for qualified employees and wherever possible, we offer flexible working hours and modern workspace design.  Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/  Education  Tasks and Qualifications:  Typically Bachelor's Degree or advanced degree.  Knowledge / Qualifications 10+ years of experience in the material handling industry in a similar role Great customer rapport Strong speaker / presenter - confident in front of a large audience public speaking Demonstrated presentation skills, ability to build presentations effectively Business knowledge - P&L knowledge of logistics operations Ability to formulate sales strategy Market sector knowledge including a broad background and understanding of distribution center metrics used to measure performance, the ability to understand market pain points and translate solutions into customer ROI and a broad understanding of WMS, WCS, and ERP systems as applied to distribution and logistics operations. Innovator / concepter Ability to communicate to customers the difference between a manual, semi automated, and fully automated distribution system and how they are applied into an operation. Cross of practical and theoretical application knowledge Data conscience Customer contacts a plus
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: Description  Job Summary Responsible for channel development of Blackline’s MidMarket and Emerging Market segment with regional channel partners Responsible for channel strategy in assigned geo (North Am, EMEA or APAC), working in alignment with Geo sales leadership and Field Alliances Responsibilities include profiling, targeting, recruiting, contract negotiations and enablement of high-quality channel Ensure and continuously assess that all recruited Channel/Solution Providers are committed to driving revenue, and that they have quality resources to generate pipeline, demonstrate the product, sell, implement and deliver customer success services Create and monitor yearly business plans, including measurable metrics, with channel partners in the Responsible for the development of key relationships with the channel partners and facilitating relationships between partner and Blackline leadership Maintain accurate dashboard results of channel partners for assigned geo and communicate to key stakeholders the effectiveness of the channel programs & Ensure partner compliance with channel agreements and channel rules of engagement, including working with Field Alliances to manage potential channel Ensure partner is fully enabled and has required capabilities to act as customer success managers, with high rate of upsell, and high customer satisfaction Role requires ability to work cross-functionally including: Liaise with Field Alliances to ensure partners are driving demand generation & executing on pipeline building efforts. Collaborate with Partner Enablement team to ensure partners have all required self-service training and certifications across all customer lifecycle from acquisition to on-going customer Additionally, work closely with Partner Enablement teams on tailoring enablement strategies, offerings, and assets to the Channel needs Coordinate with BlackLine’s partner marketing group to develop a channel marketing strategy and plans, tailoring marketing tactics for each channel partner and monitor their effectiveness Provide input to Blackline channel operations to develop the required infrastructure and operational processes to scale channel partners to significant growth over the next few years Ensure effective and timely communications on relevant announcements, programs, and performance – with both internal and external partner  Actively promote Blackline‘s channel value proposition within BlackLine and Partner Function as a strong advocate for the partnerships. Clarify & communicate highest impact metrics (growth, customer success, etc.)  Required Qualifications Years of Experience in Related Field: 5+Education: Bachelor’s degree, Masters preferred Willingness to travel on as-needed basis Preferred Qualifications Experience in Partner / Alliance Management, managing channel partners including VARS, SI’s, boutique and regional system integrators in the ERP or adjacent 5+ years’ experience in finance/accounting related business experience preferred Understanding of service offering creation, marketing, lead generation processes and key performance indicators/value drivers for large professional services / SI Track record of delivering measurable results, regularly meeting or exceeding Exceptional analytical, organizational, and project management skills. Ability to quickly analyze and apply relevant information to make timely and critical decisions that affect cross-functional teams to increase program ROI and Strong tolerance for ambiguity; ability to focus and execute in a rapidly changing environment, take charge and make things happen. Self-starter, with strong work ethic and personal drive and character qualities that match with company core values and inspires others to follow and act Understanding of service offering creation, marketing, lead generation processes and key performance indicators/value drivers for technology partnerships. Practical experience in supporting definition and delivery of solutions with partner leads/P&L owners.  Strong executive presence & exceptional communication skills (verbal, written). Ability to rapidly engage a diverse audience of internal / external stakeholders and build consensus.  Demonstrated ability to build, lead and execute strategy in a collaborative environment.  Superior ability to build and maintain positive working relationships.   Equal Employment Opportunity   BlackLine believes that our diversity is one of our greatest strengths, and we do not tolerate discrimination. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals, as well as administer any and all personnel actions, without regard to sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), race, natural hair, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), color, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), national origin (including language use restrictions and possession of a driver's license issued under Vehicle Code section 12801.9), ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, including HIV and AIDS, genetic information, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, sexual orientation, military and veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law or ordinance or regulation.   We’re proud to continue to stand by this policy and will grow our company with attention to this instrumental belief in our hiring and promotion practices.   We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will reasonably accommodate applicants’ needs in accordance with applicable law throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to [email protected]

description: About Tessaract.io  A fast-growing B2B ERP SaaS company serving the professional firms started in 2014. Currently accredited by a number of authorities across legal, accounting and consulting segments in the industry.  Headquartered in Singapore, expanding across the region through reseller and implementation partnerships.  Cloud-native structure of business allows for growth in the mid-large SME range of the market  Targeting the digitising opportunity of the professional firms and their clients in the ASIAN market.  Leader in the legal segment in Singapore for cloud solutions in terms of comprehensiveness of technology and growth. Able to implement across multiple firms and provide robust support from Singapore.  Hyper-growth and One To Hundred stage of a startup (for those who have read Zero to One).  ALWAYS BE CLOSING! In charge of PnL, to make sure strategic sales targets are reached and closed.  Process-oriented thinking  Be structured in thoughts and have those thoughts translate into tangible strategies that lead to positive results. Understand what fast growing companies require and continue to develop change management within the team to deliver results.  Problem-solver  As part of a fast growing company you must be able to identify what is core to the business and how we should grow to leverage on opportunities that present themselves to us by being resourceful and careful in planning. Grow revenue streams and ARR through various go-to-market strategies. Be able to evaluate various strategies and determine what is the next best way to grow the business to ultimately be a global SaaS player.  Client Facer and Client Oriented  Understand business processes clearly, workflows, accounting concepts to team management and business operations. Be able to communicate and work with our external partners to deliver excellent SaaS onboarding, training, client success and drive renewals and referrals for the business.  Able to mitigate issues and resolve them  Resourceful in thinking about solutions for the business, understanding various business structures and how global competitors have grown. Be absolutely passionate about business issues and how they can be mitigated through strategic internal or external growth. To be able to discuss issues with the management team and bring about more effective and efficient ways to grow the company without compromising in values and people.  Able to pre-empt next steps, plans and communicate clearly to team  Anticipating problems, communicating a clear vision, understanding what’s going to be asked next and how to get out of trouble when things go wrong.  Understanding SaaS business Metrics and work with CEO, CFO, COO to set and deliver goals and structures to achieve them  Work with the C-suite to make sure business metrics are achieved, aligned, realigned, and grow-oriented. Be crazy about processes that will set the stage for the company's next phase growth and be a people enabler to grow internal and external partners to achieve high returns on investment of structures put in place.  Growing the team together as per what is required for the times  Be able to lead and inspire the team, be consistently delivering value for the operations side of the business in order to grow the business into a scalable and functional profitable SaaS model that is in line with the founder's vision. Be absolutely loyal and totally enjoy the ride being on the hyper growth side of a startup, embracing the need for changes, implement change and taking ownership of it.  Develop Proposals for new business lines, revenue streams and carry them through execution and completion  Target new business opportunities in various verticals and form tight partnerships with the relevant parties to implement solutions throughout the extended communities.  Keen eye for details  If you're noticing that this seriously different Job Description might have spelling or punctuation errors and want to improve it, you're probably right. But you will also need to have to heart and passion to get your hands dirty and to change it.  Desired Background And Abilities Bachelors in Business/Accounting or MBA preferred Have successfully managed a team of 35 or more in previous roles PASSIONATE about details in technology Able to COMMUNICATE at length about business processes, change management experience or consulting background preferred Great attitude to learn, unlearn and relearn Ability to get respect from team and clients Legal background or experience is a plus 20 years experience working in businesses and operations Super comfortable with documenting and reporting in charts and tables Team player, love to be part of a dynamic diverse team committed to growth, growth and growth! Core Expectations And Values Professionalism, understand that we deal with many lawyers and accountants, there's a high level of confidentiality. We do not even name our clients, it is like working at a hospital Outcome-driven and CRAZY about operations (you think about how to improve operations even when you step into a cafe for coffee.) Timeline-conscious (with regular self-initiated updates to management team) Clear and tactful communications to all stakeholders (including clients, prospects, tech team, project team, business team, partners, interns, and the like) Systematic (use PM tools instead of random/manual processes, ability to convince team to also do so) Responsive (especially during work hours, and within reasonable timings in accordance with project timelines) Resourceful (always try to search for the solution or come up with a possible resolution before running through with the team)

description: “Make every logistics journey your best one yet” - Quincus  The Company  At Quincus, our technology is designed to ease shipping issues—wherever in the world they may be. We commit ourselves in designing the most effective total end to end supply chain solutions through a dedicated technology ecosystem. This offers our users a personalized experience that bypasses traditional and expensive logistics options. By combining advanced technology, data analytics, and hands-on experience, we eliminate traditional and expensive logistics options.  The Opportunity  We are looking for a driven, motivated, and unconventional Partnership Director to identify and develop commercial and strategic relationships with reselling partners according to our companies overarching objectives, strategic goals, and strategy.  As a Regional Partnership Director, you operate at the heart of Quincus’s Technology ecosystem; you are responsible for shaping deals around client needs and enabling clients to source products and services through Quincus as a resale or embedded solution.  The candidate should enjoy working in a competitive environment with an understanding of technology-enabled Logistics. You are leveraging your enterprise connections and can communicate at all levels. People management and a KPI-driven mindset are essential to support growth through our partnership model in specific markets. Ideally, you connect the logistics and Transportation Industry with a sound understanding of the transportation market, airline, and eCommerce trends through your network.  Your day to day Identify Enterprise Resell-Partners with large customer base and manage revenue growth. Direct qualified sales opportunities from proposal, through negotiations and closure. Understand client buying processes, patterns and behaviours for target clients. Represent the Ecosystem within your geography, client group, and/or accounts acting as a conduit for ecosystem information and relationships to support Quincus’ growth and innovation at our clients. Manage, grow existing and new Partnership accounts by accelerating Partners to close new clients and drive agreed KPI’s. Establishing critical paths for success in the business expansion of existing clients. Deliver a great customer experience and champion our brand to our partners –while being the champion of their needs within Quincus. Who you are 10+ years of professional experience years in senior positions of increasing responsibility partnership experience preferably in a SaaS/Enterprise organization. Minimum 5+ years of partnership development experience, in enterprise companies with a technology focus. Proven track record of partnering with senior executives at major technology companies such as Microsoft, IBM, Google, Oracle, etc. Experience in supply chain/logistics/ transportation/E-Commerce and Express/ Courier (preferred). Process-driven, close attention to detail, with an analytical mindset. Energetic, highly motivated, can-do attitude individual who enjoys networking and establishing relationships. Good command of the English language is essential. What’s in it for you  People: Work with passionate, smart, and entrepreneurial go-getters.  World-Class technology: A highly valued solution, used by some of the most critical businesses in the logistics industry.  Growth: Opportunities to develop yourself and your career are limited only by how far you are ready to push yourself.  QUINCUS is not obligated to accept candidate profiles from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless QUINCUS has fully executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals/introductions. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged and/or employed by QUINCUS.

description: Primary Role  As a Sales Director, you need to blend the challenges of your time allocation between Revenue Production and Management.  Your Primary Role is to manage your team and their efforts across our core market sectors and leading them through a successful year ahead.  Success in this Role  This is measured in two core responsibilities; Personally and team generated revenue / Sales Growth of your business annual basis in terms of New clients, Profits, Headcount Vision for your business; You must be able to articulate and deliver a clear strategic plan to your staff for the coming months and years, broken down to relevant sectors and deliverables for them and for you to meet the growth objectives of the board. Outline Service Offering for the business directly to Clients across the region, supporting the growth and championing standards expected for all staff levels. Delivery of the Vision to the internal and external markets Formally review performance against objectives on a quarterly basis and report to the board for each region and team. Develop implementation strategy to individual businesses with regional Directors for monthly objectives and execute required remedial actions as decided by the Board. Spearheading Client development methodology including management of CDM and brand awareness globally by planned personal client visits. Outline and ensure exceptional global standards of client and candidate care. Team leading; Ensure a clear and concise game plan for expansion across your remit Ongoing efforts to monitor attrition and its meaning for the business Personal development and retention strategies for staff including assessing competitor strategies and activity Threats on staff in terms of poaching and other career paths. Individual hiring strategies for each office utilising HR and the market. Candidate sourcing strategies (including tracking). Communication; You will communicate regularly with the Board of Directors, any Operational or Finance teams, to any key stakeholders (future leaders) and to the MD You will have the responsibility for wider employee understanding of the Vision and growth potential in the business Feedback on Client drivers and feedback to fully understand the external market and business impact Management of Direct Reports; Assess appropriate targets and billing (and training) in order to appraise and review their results and compensation Include a breakdown of how/when/what will be communicated with all staff levels, clients and rest of the external market for each business line Improving information flow and communication to everyone Financials; Monthly Board meeting to ensure Sales are on target and Costs are under control. Budget/Target setting and ensure business is achieving goals. Investments are seeing return; Assessment ROI i.e. advertising spends (tracking sources), branding, database improvement, CRM investments, etc… Regular financial reviews – monthly with the board and quarterly with the MD. Processes; Assess current internal staffing processes and identify key areas to increase efficiency, including training, retasking, releasing and improving the current team. Data is integral so you must understand and champion the need for proper tracking systems and data processes. Marketing/PR/Branding Strategies Expansion, opportunities, efficiencies and future proofing the business Diversification of service offering/international expansion Acquisition of new talent and business lines Longer term progression for current staff Identify the need for exponential over linear growth for business (balance organic and innovative hiring) Market trend analysis – network of other recruiters to a) headhunt from or b) source information/gain support from

description: Blockchain Founders Fund - Director of Growth  Blockchain Founder’s Fund (BFF) is a seed, and early-stage venture capital and venture builder. Our HQ is in Singapore but our team works from around worldwide, just like our amazing portfolio companies. We take our work seriously, but not so much ourselves. We dislike hierarchies and love initiative. If you love start-ups as much as we do, we think you will like working with us.  The Role Will Have Two Core Focuses  The Director of Growth is an executive position and will be reporting directly to other executives. The successful candidate will lead BFF growth efforts. Building investment pipeline and growth strategy Working with portfolio companies to fast-track growth potential. The individual we are looking for is a “Founder-First” that thrives in ambiguous environments and is driven to explore untapped new frontiers in innovation. This individual is keen on supporting the next generation of breakthrough founders and companies in a fast paced innovative industry. We're looking for someone who has experience in both management consulting and hands-on experience working within a venture-backed tech startup.  Key Responsibilities  You will have the opportunity to advise management on emerging industry trends and key business decisions, optimize key processes, and orchestrate key initiatives. Your work will be important to our business growth and sustainability, and cover a broad spectrutopics. Deliver insights that help drive key decisions - You will make recommendations on critical decisions, such as investment direction and new investment opportunities in an industry that is evolving at record speed. Hacking the Venture process. Getting creative in discovering early stage entrepreneurs and sourcing high-quality deals. Work closely with portfolio companies and provide strategic leadership especially with user growth via growth hacking, strategic partnerships and sales. You will have full visibility of the portfolio. Identify strategic growth opportunities for portfolio companies across the network of founders, executives and other external partners. Drives and fosters organization-wide performance standards, expectations, and practices to support ongoing team member and process development; Support each portfolio company in its pursuit of product-market-fit and scaled commercialization. What We Expect From You  You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. Successful candidates will play an impactful role in a highly collaborative, dynamic, and entrepreneurial firm. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments and have a proven ability to implement innovations from ideation to execution. You have extensive knowledge on the complexities of selling into or partnering with enterprises and developing long-term relationships at senior leadership levels (B2B) and extensive knowledge of customer acquisition, engagement and retention via digital marketing strategy, growth hacking, performance optimization and guerilla tactics (B2C). You have a strong understanding of industry landscape, ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends and can leverage it from a portfolio company and investment perspective. You have a desire to take initiative, are comfortable with ambiguity, and have a bias towards action You have the intellectual horsepower to think through and address various different business problems in parallel You are detail oriented, flexible and have the ability to interact with and influence a diverse set of internal and external stakeholders You have superb organizational and strategic management skills, including strategic vision, executive/marketing communications, planning/forecasting and excellent analytical and problem solving skills You are a leader in establishing clear directions and objectives in support of business needs Experience Have experience scaling a venture-backed tech startup or being in a leadership position in a high-growth tech startup through multiple funding rounds. Have a postgraduate degree in business or MBA from a leading and global academic institution 12+ years experience of related work experience in startups, VC or PE funds Familiarity, high degree of interest and experience with blockchain, cryptocurrency, NFTs, DeFi What’s In It For You Be at the forefront of blockchain, cryptocurrency, NFT and DeFi innovation Play an impactful role in a highly collaborative, dynamic, and entrepreneurial firm. A friendly and open culture that is merit based. Highly competitive compensation package including base, carry and full benefits Apply Now  To start the application process, please complete the application questionnaire. Please reference the job title in the appropriate section. It only takes a few minutes. If we like your profile, we will reach out to schedule an interview. https://www.rockstar.blockchainff.com/

The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways — from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.  The RoleThe Director, Sales for the Pharma Industry in APJ is responsible for meeting revenue goals within assigned accounts in the vertical and region. This person is responsible for driving growth from creating customer awareness, defining sales strategies, and executing sales to deal closure. This exciting new role will be responsible for building the Pharma Sales team in the region and then directly leading and managing a team of 5 Sales Account Managers. This role reports to the Director, Global Sales for Pharma, and works based in the Singapore AspenTech office.Your Impact Meet ambitious license revenue and service sales targets each fiscal quarter and fiscal year Hire and manage a group of experienced Sales Account Managers who are geographically dispersed. This includes: Attract the best talent and retain key talent Lead, engage, inspire, motivate & develop your team to drive high performance Proactive performance management Mentor and coach the Sales Account Managers in all aspects of the sales process and sales methodology, account management, company resource coordination, and administration Provide accurate and timely sales forecasts to executive management Gain customer senior level sponsorship and sell high with value propositions to the budget holders Maintain sales expenses within allocated budget Coordinate globally to ensure proper account coordination and penetration in assigned accounts and sales quota achievement on a team basis Coordinate with business unit management and teams to ensure development of attractive marketing solutions and campaigns for the region Work with Marketing and Pharma business unit to design and execute appropriate business development opportunities to provide multipliers of pipeline to required quota on a 5 quarterly rolling basis. Manage opportunities with partners as required – build partner relationships Key metrics you will be measured on: % of License quota by quarter and year, Growth in Annual Sales and Total Booking Value by year and management qualitative objectives What You'll Need Bachelor’s Degree in relevant subject – and/or relevant experience Minimum 10 years’ experience selling enterprise software and solutions Experience working in a Solution Sales organization selling to the Pharma Industry is preferable Demonstrated success as a direct Account Executive interacting and selling at the C-Level Ability to lead, motivate and manage sales account managers across the region Executive presence and demeanor with consultative and relationship building selling skills is a must

description: Job Description  What You Will Do:  The Account Director role is a key leadership and strategic role within the Account Management team working on top tiered, high revenue generating accounts. In this high visibility role, you will work with senior leadership and stakeholders for both the agency and client partners to bring strategic insight and knowledge to help clients achieve their marketing goals. You will use your strategic skills to develop, present and execute against an 18-month strategic roadmap for assigned accounts. Leverage your experience in project and people management to continue to drive success on the team. If you are self-motivated and passionate about the digital ad tech echo system, this could be the role for you!  Responsibilities Will Include Manage full ownership of assigned accounts inclusive of cultivating client partnerships and leading digital strategy recommendations Identify key relationship targets from client or agency teams and work to build healthy professional relationships Identify areas of revenue growth opportunities on assigned accounts and work with sales and strategy team members on pitch development and execution Implementation, optimisation, and regular enforcement of process workflow(s)/ SLA’s for internal and external teams Lead internal and external communications to effectively and proactively manage expectations Lead strategy workshop sessions with prospective clients or existing clients in developing an integrated digital marketing strategy utilising Flashtalking (by Mediaocean) technology Oversee and mentor Senior Account Manager as your direct report assigned to your team's business Delegate and prioritise accounts and assignments according to the business needs for your assigned accounts Who You Are 6+ years of professional experience in digital media required. Areas of work can include account management, project management, sales or ad operations. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience leading meetings and public speaking. Demonstrated ability to know your audience and communicate properly; effectively translating technical ideas to non-technical people and vice versa. Experience tracking tight SLA’s with lots of moving parts for all the various external and internal parties involved. Ability to effectively pull together resources, set and manage expectations and possess a calm demeanor while having fun along the way. Well versed on the technical/product side with an ability to take this knowledge and effectively translate it into an integrated digital strategy. Proven ability to lead strategic conversations and provide helpful insights to arm marketing clients when presenting to their internal teams. Comprehensive understanding of MSOffice (specifically Excel and PowerPoint) and Sharepoint Why Flashtalking by Mediaocean? Join a team that has a “work hard, play hard” mindset, with great comradery Healthy work/life balance within this role and team The Sydney office culture speaks for itself – when we can join together at the office again, there will be social gatherings like Friday breakfast, a monthly lunch, and other events in between as we celebrate cultural occasions and drive Diversity, Equity & Inclusion events Opportunity for an autonomous role so you can really grow and develop at your pace, but also are provided strong support from management looking to help you develop Professional development opportunities within our Learning & Development programs Belong@Mediaocean affinity based groups of colleagues to create community All of these benefits/perks are effective on the date of hire We would hate to miss out on your application because you do not meet every requirement – transferrable skills and education will also be considered, so please do not hesitate to apply!  Mediaocean recognizes our true strength and value shine when all our team members feel there is space in the conversation for their voices, thoughts, ideas, perspectives, and concerns. Mediaocean is committed to being an equal opportunity employer, and we consider all applicants regardless of their age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

description: The Finacle Consulting Group (FCG) is the business and digital consulting arm of Infosys Finacle, the leading global banking solution provider. Finacle leads the analyst’s quadrant as the leader in banking transformation solutions with a history of 25+ years serving the leading global banks. We have a global footprint with 250+ clients across 100 countries    We are looking for consulting business leaders who can play anchor roles in our sector industry practices and manage practice goals. She/he should have experience in leading and motivating a high performing team of consultants through many strategic large transformational consulting projects independently. Smart, self-driven, highly focused & self-motivated, high energy people with top notch communication skills, intellectual curiosity and passion for the banking & financial services industry practice. Our consultants will have a blend of in-depth domain expertise in banking, financial services, strong business consulting skills, strong analytical mindset and excellent soft skills.  What do we require?      The candidate is expected to manage, drive and own relationship with some of our biggest clients and the business for a portfolio of services. The individual will be responsible for working with onshore/offshore engagement teams and supporting programs across the globe. The successful candidate shall possess: Overall experience of 13-16 years, with at-least 10+ years of top-tier consulting experience in Banking / Financial Services. Hands-on industry experience working with banks on transformation projects Past experience in Management consulting firm and/or other leading global Technology Consulting equivalent firms Experience in leading Technology enabled Transformation consulting projects and also advisory projects for banking clients e.g. Business strategy, operational excellence, performance benchmarking & improvement, customer experience and Omni channel design, IT transformation, Cost optimization, Digital strategy, Change Management . Experience of developing and growing consulting practice through business development, thought leadership, excellent client delivery and firm building initiatives around IPs and talent development A local resident of the hiring location with proficiency in local spoken language/s and majority of consulting experience in the same country PMP./ Certified Scrum Project Owner / Agile coach certified with full PMP experience with competency in designing, mobilizing, managing and driving delivery execution of programme activities owning critical client relationships with a view to achieving client satisfaction, revenue and profitability targets.  Operated as a Value Realization professional which involves performing current state analysis of business processes, building to be Target Operation Models and business case creation thru ROI analysis of the proposed solutions aligned to complexity, cost and business criticality. Expert in supporting multiple and complex programmes across work-streams, setting priorities, managing and monitoring schedules, developing relevant tools and templates, communication frameworks and in engaging key internal, external stakeholders and subject matter experts. Expert in driving service delivery using best in class practices and methodologies, with various operating models, systems, processes and policies and experience of working on Agile and SDLC frameworks. Experience in agile methodologies , have led product owner and Scrum owner role, SAFe projects and helping build Agile Ways of working transformation programs for client IT organizations . Should have sound experience in promoting new and existing products and services to actively identify opportunities for growth and work closely with different stakeholders in a highly demanding and result oriented environment. Proficient in Microsoft Project, Power-point, Excel and PM Tools like Jira, Clarizen, Clarity, Change-point, Planview etc. and PMP/ACP/CSM certified. Have excellent consulting, communication, stakeholder management skills and strong thought leadership in the emerging technology space, preferably in digital channels Experience working with multinational clients, working across organizational levels and processes and exposure to global best practices, and trends desired. Flexible and comfortable with global delivery model which involve working with multiple teams in different geographies. Experience of working on on-site/ off-site delivery model needing constant conversation on daily basis to drive project milestones and should be able to hold interactions with product, technical and functional teams Established CXO connects with large clients - strong ability to build and manage client relations with large focus on driving sales Banking: Digital Banking, Retail banking, Corporate banking, Wealth Management , Payments, Trade Finance, Treasury , CRM & Loyalty, Channels, Treasury , Credit Risk and AML & Fraud analytics . Should have sound experience in identifying and promoting new and existing products and services and in actively mining opportunities for growth and work closely with different stakeholders in a highly demanding and result oriented environment. Have excellent consulting, communication, stakeholder management skills and strong thought leadership in the emerging technology space, preferably in digital channels across Banking & Financial Services verticals. Experience working with multinational clients, working across organizational levels and processes and exposure to global best practices and trends desired.  What will you do?  We are looking for leaders for our practice. At Finacle Consulting Group, you will:  Be responsible for leading large complex transformation engagements for large-medium-small sized companies across the globe in one or more of the following sectors: Banking / Financial Services with a large team of consulting and execution team on a global delivery model to excellent client value and satisfaction ratings . Ensure deep process , product and value realization focus on the Finacle enabled transformation programs Lead Go to Market strategy, sales pursuits, incubate differentiated consulting offerings and internal initiatives. Build and deepen client relationships - Lead design thinking client workshops to collaborate with clients, discover problem areas to address, innovate / co-create next generation industry solutions working with the Infosys digital practices Execute or lead consulting engagements: analyze problems, and structure complex business analyses, perform business process improvement using various business consulting tools and methodologies, work with cross functional client teams to perform gap analysis and identify improvement options. Create detailed action plans that include organizational change management, resource planning, competitive strategies, and alliances to embark on a new strategic direction and to enable successful deployment of solutions. Incubate and anchor a variety of Firm building activities including building team capabilities, differentiated market offerings and accelerators, thought leadership on “Future of Industry with future of technology” Drive the cultural customer centric mindset with digital transformation opportunities through an innovative journey, from ideation to commercialization. Help business innovate on the future of industry to become more profitable and improve their performance, solve complex industry and market related challenges. Mentoring a team of high performing consultants. Participate in a variety of Firm building events and the consultant referral program Contributing to the profile and reputation of Finacle Consulting Group through firm building, new capability and offering development initiatives, thought leadership, whitepapers and conference speeches Mentoring a team of high performing consultants Drive next generation banking thought leadership, contribute to building business strategy/ value led propositions, accelerated solution design capabilities for banking transformation engagements to deliver faster projects. Proactively work with the product innovation teams to build the next generations banking capabilities on the Finacle platform.

description: The Director of Business Operations is a global role and expected to drive phenomenal UX/CX for Razer Support as well as monitor budgets & key metrics in accordance to Razer guidelines and policies. The Director of Business Operations is responsible for improving the quality and efficiency of contact interactions and case resolutions, as well as identifying the root causes of and designing the common or high impact end-to-end customer engagement. This role will create and track digital journeys and define self-service and in-product support and purchase experience. Data analytics will be part of his/her scope. Fluent Mandarin speaking skill a strong plus Strong analytical, problem solving skills & business acumen Strong project management skills including conceptualization, planning, scheduling, prioritization, action items tracking, and project communication Ability to work with global teams across multiple cultures Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and ability to prioritize work and focus on generating business results Ability to formulate data-driven decisions with sound business judgement Attention to detail with excellent organizational capabilities Ability to prioritize with superior time management skills Ability to communicate corporate objectives ensuring understanding and action in order to achieve goals Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Inspire team members toward a culture of customer centricity and continuous improvement Focused on generating measurable results Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple activities at the same time APPLY NOW

The Sales Operations Director will act as a Chief of Staff to the SVP Sales, allowing you to focus on business growth and customer-facing activities. where appropriate Work with Regional SVP and VP Global Sales Operations to localize and execute sales strategy, plans and execution within the framework of global standards Oversight of Regional/BU Weekly Bookings Forecast Represent Region/BU in compensation planning discussions, compensation strategy and resolution Responsible for the overall process and implementation of quota allocation, dispute resolution, and territory alignment, in collaboration with the SVP Sales Lead regional sales planning efforts in coordination with Finance Work with finance, sales leaders and HR to optimize resources to achieve bookings results (AE capacity, forward-looking resource needs, optimize OPEX/discretionary spending) Participate in regular meetings with HR, Finance, Sales Ops, Legal and various other teams to assist in addressing issues, building plans and delivering programs Drive CRM accuracy, pipeline analytics, forecasting and ad hoc regional reporting requirements Work with SVP and sub-regional/territory leaders to define business requirements for reports/dashboards, and provide regional representation globally Coordinate sales enablement and development initiatives in the region Ensure efficient deal velocity, via deal management processes, process improvement initiatives in consultation with finance re deal approvals, booking processes etc. Lead in collaboration with can scale quickly You’ve been there and done this… 15+ years' executive-level experience (the preferred candidate should have experience in sales operations and another function such as finance and have experience working in a multi-national, matrixed organisation) Impeccable managerial and interpersonal skills Proven track record of effectively interacting with senior management Ability to work strategically and collaboratively across departments Strong analytical skills and adept at using key data, CRM and reporting tools Effective, versatile and action-oriented Excellent communication skills Degree in Business Administration or related field a plus Be collaborative, innovative and a team player Covid-19  Safety for our employees and our communities is a key priority for Genesys. In this role, you will be responsible for creating and implementing Go-To-Market strategies and initiatives for our Commercial Team. description: Life is different at N3. We are driven by our passions and propelled by our quest to innovate, thrive and learn. We are the tastemakers of technology, transforming the way the world works and shaping the future of business. We work hard. We play hard. We make moves. Here, success is no accident. It’s ours to grow.  N3, Part of Accenture, is a sales and marketing solutions firm dedicated to working with software and technology solutions providers. Our client base includes a range from small start-up companies to market leaders such as Microsoft, Cisco, Google, and more as well as their partner networks. N3 has sustained rapid growth since its founding in 2004.  We are a performance-based organization that rewards creativity, hard work, and success. N3 is not your typical corporate environment. Our business casual atmosphere and fast-paced workday make N3 a unique place to work.  N3, now part of Accenture, is seeking a Senior Director of Sales to join us in our growth. The role is responsible for driving Google Digital Inside Sales (DIS) revenue goals set by the executive team within Asia Pacific and leads the sales process. This Senior Director of Sales works with multiple departments to ensure sales proposals meet N3’s as well as Accenture’s financial and service standards.  About You  You’re able to highlight goals, attainment and comfort with hitting/exceeding KPI's. This is a sales role.  You’re passionate. We can teach you what to sell and when to sell it but we can't teach you passion. We want to see that in you.  You’re super comfortable with the uncomfortable. Sales is an ever-changing environment. We are a high growth sales engine which means that we want you to not just survive but thrive in this environment.  You have Intellect and finesse. We’re looking for creative and focused individuals who thrive on meeting client's needs and have the finesse to deliver that message to all levels in an organization.  Primary Responsibilities Close new sales and renewals for Google focused Digital Inside Sales (DIS) with Asia Pacific Cultivate strong client relationships Lead the sales process for Google DIS programs working with multiple internal departments to fully develop sales proposals Set priorities and goals for the year aligned with the long-term strategy of the organization As a leader, inspires employees to continue improving performance in the best interests of N3/DIS/Accenture and the customer Establish and maintain a work environment and culture conducive to successful sales Forecast revenue and potential sales for executives Qualifications Availability to travel (when it’s safe to do so) Excellent written and verbal communications skills including annunciation of words on a phone and use of professional business language Must be self-motivated and have a strong work ethic Demonstrated ability to be successful in a leadership capacity Understanding of the IT industry and partner/channel business models. Ability to learn quickly and retain knowledge about complex IT systems and products for marketing purposes Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of integrity Daily time management and the ability to work independently Positive attitude and ‘get it done’ mentality toward clients and coworkers Required Education/ Experience Bachelor’s degree is required; master’s degree preferred 10+ years of experience working in IT services sales or sales outsourcing environment Proven experience driving business results with aggressive targets Specific languages may be required Experience with Google either as a vendor or Google hire strongly preferred Experience with Ad Sales industry is major plus. Ideal Profile  The ideal candidate is a former Senior level consultant at a top 10 consultancy (Accenture, Bain, BCG, McKinsey) working within the firm’s technology practice or a senior sales leader in an digital ad sales environment. The Candidate currently has responsibility for both managing delivery of sold business, and for selling in additional projects at the same client. The Candidate desires a more entrepreneurial environment where he/she can drive longer term impact vs. short term consulting services. The Candidate is financially driven and is equally comfortable managing people or being an individual contributor. The Candidate wants to be in sales and is not concerned that a sales role minimizes his/her strategic value. The Candidate has a “start-up” mindset and is willing to roll up his / her sleeves to support a fast growing, fast paced company with a very bright future.  Data Protection Requirement Adhere to all N3 Data Protection policies, standards, and procedures per your role. Take required continuing education courses in Data Protection at N3 for your role. Equal Employment Opportunity  N3 recruits, hires, and promotes for all positions without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, handicap or veteran's status. All terms and conditions of employment such as compensation, benefits, work assignment, availability of facilities and privileges of employment are administered on the same basis of equality.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: We see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset. It acts like a compass for us. We are fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that’s not just words on the walls.  Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It’s an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.  We make software robots, so people don’t have to be robots. Would you like to be part of this journey?  UiPath is searching for dynamic Account Management Leaders to execute its sales & account strategy in Singapore  As an Account Leader, you will drive deals and account growth for our Public Sectors. The Account Leader is UiPath’s primary leader and sponsor for the customer, responsible for overall account growth and customer satisfaction by managing key relationships and ensuring the customer achieves value.  We have a high growth culture which means you’ll have a lot of autonomy and flexibility to help build the company. By helping our clients maximize value from our product, you will not only be helping to improve, but also to transform how our clients perform in digitized era. You will play an integral role in ensuring product engagement and building strong working relationships through exceptional client service to help grow UiPath business.  As an Account Leader, you will represent the voice of our existing clients and liaise with internal cross functional teams to shape the future of UiPath’s product development strategy.  This Is What You'll Do At UiPath Identify new opportunities within large clients; engage meaningfully with C level and Executive decision makers at the enterprise levels. Develop and maintain multi-year strategic account plan for Key Accounts to meet or exceed customer objectives and share of wallet. Forecast and manage sales pipeline to meet revenue targets and company goals. Operate as the lead point of contact for all matters specific to the key accounts. Collaborate with internal teams to improve customer satisfaction, remove and report blockers, and create a seamless customer experience. Lead a culture of sales excellence; drive consistent implementation and adoption of sales processes, pipeline management, measurement, or success KPI’s and sales performance. Develop network of strong relationships with key industry influencers, customers and partners thereby enhancing UiPath’s industry mindshare; maintain a high-level understanding of the industry and trends affecting or influencing the marketplace Conduct regular business reviews with the team to ensure alignment to the plan and coach the team to elevate strategic account plans. Create a monthly & quarterly business review cadence with Key Account Sponsors to track progress on stated objectives, successfully establish the Key Account as a positive Reference Account. Drive industry leading initiatives that influence the position of UiPath in the industry, solidifying our position as a market leader. This Is What You'll Bring To Our Team Degree / MBA, 20+ years of Sales and Account Management experience with high-growth tech start-ups or large software vendor or Consulting Firms The ideal candidate is expected to have 20+ years of software or software solution sales experience 10+ years selling and account relationship management experience with public sector/education. In-depth technical understanding of the Automation/Digital transformation market. Successful track record of consultative strategic sales with C-level prospects, strong background in large account planning and expansion. Proven track record of exceptional performance measured against revenue, customer satisfaction, and organizational health metrics in recent years. Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills, ability to scale across all levels of an organization. Ability to handle confidential/sensitive information and exercise exceptional judgement. Highly dependable, self-starter, high energy, positive attitude and the ability to establish trust and credibility with prospects and customers. Ability to lead, collaborate and influence geographically dispersed team. Life at UiPath can sometimes feel like a roller coaster. It comes with changes, healthy challenges, and the opportunity to build solutions from the ground up, have great impact, and learn a great deal.  At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.  UiPath is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the process, please contact us @ TALeaders@uipath.com and let us know how we may assist you.  This notice together with our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use of this website and any other documents we mention here are meant to inform you on what personal data about you we collect, use, disclose, share or otherwise process when you are applying for a job at UiPath or when UiPath contacts you for recruitment purposes. Please read this policy carefully to understand our views and practices on how we protect your personal data.

jobTitle: Head of Strategic Business Consulting, Asia Pacific
description: We are a global and diverse group of thought leaders, strategic thinkers, and industry experts from across the globe with vast knowledge on Customer and Employee Experience, Cloud, Business Operations, Insights and Analytics.  Our mission is to make customers successful in their Experience as a Service journey. Together with our customers, we co-create dynamic experience strategies with agile actionable plans and provide strategic advice on specific subject matter areas.  As The Head Of Strategic Business Consulting APAC, You Will Own The Local Direction, Team Management And Business Outcomes For Customers And Genesys’ Go To Customer Strategy Including Influence - Nurturing relationships with C-Level and senior stakeholders to influence strategic decisions Growth - Establishing Experience as Service as a practice to drive innovation and business growth Leadership - Driving thought leadership with the customer- and market-facing presence Collaboration - Building extended networks across the OneGenesys community and sharing outcome Operations - Ensuring team engagement & execution by appropriately localizing global SBC operations  The successful Head of Strategic Business Consulting APAC will naturally become a trusted partner for our customers and sales teams, setting local priorities, elevating our business conversations, and expanding our Go to Customer approach.  What You’ll Do In this role, the primary responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): Leading - Building, enabling, and guiding the regional team & their engagements Inspiring - Cultivating an outstanding team culture & elevating Genesys as a thought leader Prioritizing - Setting direction for the team given target outcomes, resources and constraints Solving - Ideating resolutions to challenges faced by the team and ensuring plan execution Consulting - Contributing to engagements as a member, as well as a leader, of the team Developing - Directing the team & coaching team members to keep current, relevant & aligned to the company Networking - Building relationships and connecting teams for awareness, efficiency & effectiveness Scaling - Amplifying best practices, industry trends, etc. to maximize impact and influence Tracking - Measuring and reporting team progress and communicating successes & needs to stakeholders Representing - Being a brand ambassador in internal & external events to gain credibility & team recognition Ad-hoc duties as directed by Management  You’ve been there and done this… You are an inspirational, motivated, independent, and confident personality with a can-do attitude and a strong sense of ownership over engagements. You are an enthusiastic collaborator, willing to do the heavy lifting to get to a better result, more quickly.  Specifically, You Are An exceptionally qualified people manager who has 5+ years experience in business transformation as part of a global matrixed organization. Demonstrated expertise in and contribution to the customer and/or employee experience engagements Skillful at creating “art of the possible” outcomes across a diverse set of technology platforms. Customer/Service design-driven. Familiarity with emerging technologies and/or Genesys solutions strongly preferred A leader with Executive presence demonstrated by excellent and energetic public speaking skills across scenarios (e.g., customer 1-on-1, 1-to-Many Events, executive briefings, etc.) Recognized in the brand and/or Industry relationships. Participation in relevant associations is a strong positive Proven at talent acquisition, team motivation and overall performance, especially in complex enterprise sales, SaaS/Cloud sales, management consulting, industry team management and/or other similar fields Experienced in managing diverse & remote teams with international and multi-cultural members Able to navigate a fast-paced environment and to manage through ambiguous scenarios as needed Recognized at building and retaining strong customer relationships, with CXO engagement skills Able to travel for business priorities, estimated 50%   Please note that Genesys will not accept resumes from agencies at this time. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Singapore.  Covid-19 Safety for our employees and our communities is a key priority for Genesys. We continue to experience rapid growth during the Covid-19 pandemic and are conducting remote hiring and onboarding processes. All hiring and onboarding processes are being conducted remotely at this time. We utilize Zoom video meetings and phone calls during the interview process. We will be working remotely through at least December 31, 2021, in most locations, and we are re-evaluating the opening date of all the Genesys offices on an ongoing basis.  About Genesys Every year, Genesys® orchestrates more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. Through the power of our cloud, digital and AI technologies, organizations can realize Experience as a Service℠, our vision for empathetic customer experiences at scale. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper-personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com. description: Apply Here For Expedited Consideration If You Are Being Directed to a Third Party Site: https://matterport.com/careers/  Matterport is leading the digital transformation of the built world. Our groundbreaking spatial computing platform turns buildings into data making every space more valuable and accessible. Millions of buildings in more than 150 countries have been transformed into immersive Matterport digital twins to improve every part of the building lifecycle from planning, construction, and operations to documentation, appraisal, and marketing.  We’re excited to announce that Matterport is now publicly listed on NASDAQ as MTTR. It’s an exciting time to join us!  Visit our Matterport Comparably Profile to learn more about working at Matterport and the awards we have won for being a Great Place to Work!  Matterport is seeking a talented Enterprise Sales Director to support fast growing demand for our revolutionary products in our larger customer base. This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious, high-energy new business sales leader to be on the front line with a high tech startup identifying, winning and growing key target customers. The Enterprise Sales Director will report directly to the APAC Managing Director and be responsible for a regional team of Enterprise Sales and Sales Development Representatives. This team sells our products and services to large customers across the APAC Region.  Responsibility Develop an Enterprise Account Plan for strategic accounts within a given territory, then drive the execution of that plan to success Position the team to grow successfully beyond its current targets, increasing the bookings and revenue of the team year on year. This role will be leading teams across industries and customers in commercial through to enterprise size. Operating in a high-growth, fast paced environment, this will likely be achieved by: defining a clear and compelling annual plan, effective prioritisation and translating business objectives into specific goals for the given area Manage and develop the growing Enterprise Sales team including the Sales Development function Accurately forecast sales revenue and pipeline on a weekly/monthly/quarterly basis Effectively implement net new business acquisition sales strategies and tactics to maximize efforts to penetrate new accounts and achieve sales quota objectives Manage the entire sales process from prospect to close Follow the company sales process and give progress updates accordingly Develop and manage relationships with prospects and existing customers through a combination of out-bound calling and in-person meetings Maintain Salesforce.com CRM and ensure a strong flowing lead pipeline in order to exceed sales quota objectives Qualifications 10+ years of experience in SaaS with solid track record in managing an enterprise sales team with evidence of achieving sales quotas across the APAC region Experience in hypergrowth, prop-tech or associated industries is preferred Expertise in managing multi-stakeholder sales cycles and closing large deals Proven track record in prospecting and closing in greenfield accounts Experience in accurately for forecasting sales revenue Excellent communications and presentation skills You will be able to demonstrate from previous experience knowledge and evidence of account planning and building large scale enterprise customers Ability to identify strategic client pains and develop unique and compelling value propositions that focus on delivering business value to the client Great at building relationships and working within a team-selling environment Ability to travel across APAC as required Matterport is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.  For more information regarding how Matterport collects and uses personal information, please review our Privacy Policies. https://matterport.com/privacy-policy

description: Newly created role to lead cloud sales and solutions Excellent company culture, brand and network  About Our Client  Our client is a leading consulting firm looking to expand their presence in the market aligned with an increasing market demand and opportunity in cloud transformation. There is now a strategic requirement to hire a regional sales and business development director to take this business to its next stage of growth.  Job Description  This role will take a leading role in the sales and market development function regionally for Southeast Asia. You will oversee the planning and execution of the company sales strategy, aimed at driving revenue growth, enabling the company to scale and grow in relation to providing an end-to-end solution to their clients. You will drive the strategy for customer acquisition and ensure a good process is in place for strong customer relationship management. You will also have a key responsibility to foster good relationship with the cloud partners, channel organisations and key accounts. You will also work cross-functionally with fellow members of the leadership team to foster collaboration.  The Successful Applicant  The Ideal Candidates We Are Looking For Should Have A qualified degree/MBA with recent years of experience in a regional sales leadership role Experience in providing cloud services/solutions would be highly advantageous, especially in the area of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and AWS Demonstrated track record in deal origination and solution selling Ability to understand and articulate complex solution sets and value propositions Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the gravitas to influence and work with all stakeholders Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and possess an entrepreneurial mindset and capability You are resourceful and have gained some experience working in a matrix and large organisation  What's On Offer  Great career progression opportunity and compensation package.  Contact: Diana Low (Lic No: R1106207)  Quote job ref: 4216023

description: Our Customer Success team is insatiably curious and adept at problem-solving. We use data and domain expertise to navigate the customer-journey, helping each stakeholder define and achieve success. We’re also extremely collaborative and work cross-functionally to share the insights we learn from our customers.  We are looking to bring a leader that will help grow the team and support our customer base in APAC. You will support the mission of your customers every day by leading a team that manages the adoption and successful implementation of our solutions and services.  The Director of Customer Success in Singapore is passionate about the customer’s mission and ensuring their success in all things post-sales. We measure ourselves by things like user adoption, retention, and overall satisfaction.  In one year you’ll know you were successful if… You have identified a hiring plan for the APAC market to ensure proper bandwidth for all team members to help grow the region according to forecast You’ve created a plan for developing strong relationships with the largest customers in the region and identified all key players and their missions. You’ve also created a reference document so that this information is easily scalable and can be disseminated across your team. You’ve worked closely with sales, professional services, training and other internal teams to ensure proper collaboration cross-departmentally to retain and grow our APAC business and further define the roles and responsibilities of each function. You are the voice of our customers and have built internal credibility to push forward customer feedback and product initiatives. Helped design account plans and contributed to successful strategy meetings to define goals and track regular progress on how we are pacing towards those goals. You have furthered the efficiency and scalability of the team by automating, simplifying, and improving daily workflows. You have contributed to the success of the overall global Customer Success team by working closely with other CS leaders to continue to improve the way we work with our customers A Background Like This Helps Experience managing and scaling a team of Customer Success Managers, technical account managers or similar in a high-growth SaaS business Comfort working in a fast-paced, evolving, ambiguous environment A solid understanding of the different markets in APAC Emotional intelligence and an empathetic propensity to read between the lines and understand what the customer is saying (and what they mean) Additional languages a plus Knowledge of or a desire to learn more about cryptocurrency At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.  You belong here.  At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Juneteenth, Harvey Milk Day, and International Migrant’s Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Candidate GDPR Notice.  By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.  Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - USA Employees are not required to attend in-person meetings at this time. All in-person, Chainalysis attendees must be vaccinated* prior to the in-person event/meeting You must follow cleaning protocols. This includes washing your hands before and after meetings or using a disinfectant or alcohol solution with at least 70% alcohol If a worker or visitor was in close or proximate contact with others at the office location and tests positive for COVID-19, they must immediately notify the People team *A USA employee is considered fully vaccinated if they meet any of the following criteria: It has been 2 weeks since their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines, or It has been 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen vaccine, or A person has recovered from a COVID-19 infection and was treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma and are within 90 days of the treatment. Please note that once 90 days has passed after the monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma treatment, an employee will not be permitted to meet in-person or go to a customer meeting until they meet the above criteria of being fully vaccinated Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - EMEA  As an employer, Chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. This means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities. To help support a safe work environment, we encourage all employees in EMEA to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting. Employees in the EU and the UK are allowed to travel internationally for internal meetings to any country deemed “green or amber” by the EU and the UK authorities. All attendees for Chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines: International travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and Executive Leader You must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or event You must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law If you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for COVID-19, you must immediately notify the People Team and avoid contact with others for 10 days Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - APAC  With circumstances changing on a regular basis and parts of our APAC team going in and out of mandatory lockdown, APAC will continue to follow country legislation and guidelines.
