description: Why project44?  Our mission is to usher in a new era of trust and predictability to transportation and logistics, but there’s still a lot of work to be done. The industry is massive, as is the opportunity. We’re looking for bright, ambitious individuals to join our growing global team and help us enable a more productive and successful world.  We’re changing the way the world ships, and we’re looking for you to help us get there!  Partners are the backbone of project44’s growth and success. In an industry built on deep relationships and trust, the Director of Partnerships and Alliances will be responsible for managing and growing project44’s financial, product, and satisfaction levels with its channel partners.  Key Accountabilities  Manage a portfolio of 30+ project44 channel partners to: Integrate and upsell additional project44 products (measured by ARR upsell) Interact and sign new partners Act as internal p44 advocate to ensure channel partner needs are met (measured by NPS) Articulate the project44 value prop in a way that is compelling to its channel partners Manage complex, multi-month pipeline sales and integrations Listen and understand customer challenges and then develop and execute action plan to resolve (with help from support, engineering, product, and onboarding) Establish yourself as trusted advisor to channel partners Navigate across different functional groups and contacts at a customer to influence decision makers and achieve desired goals Advocate for the partner: understanding unique differences between partners and their strategic goals, all while optimizing implementation timetables, revenue (MRR), and technical support requirements for each partner Collaborate with internal sales team on lead and opportunity management obtained through partners Requirements And Preferred Skills 5+ years of experience managing supply chain technology partners in a management or director role. Demonstrated success in developing partners and increasing revenue Experience dealing with channel conflict and resolution is preferred Relevant TMS or WMS technology experience Organization, planning, timeliness, follow-through on commitments Strong social and presentation skills with ability to influence Ability to follow-through on commitments and communicate relevant information to internal and external stakeholders Proven success through previous quota attainment Fluent in English and an additional Language Ability to travel up to 50% on short notice Diversity & Inclusion  We're designing the future of how the world moves and is connected through trade and global supply chains. We can only deliver a truly world-class product and experience if our teams are as diverse and unique communities we are building for. So it's up to us to create a company where anyone can bring their authentic self to work everyday. We're constantly working to improve, and we accept our responsibility to elevate the voices left in the margins. It's on every one of us.  Our focus on inclusion manifests in the way we hire, the customers we serve, and the regions we prioritize. We're building a company that every one of us at project44 is proud to work for: a company that celebrates you for being you.  We pride ourselves on celebrating everyone — project44 is an equal opportunity employer actively working on creating a diverse and inclusive work environment where underrepresented groups can thrive. If you share our values and our passion for helping the way the world moves, we’d love to review your application!  For any needed accommodations during the hiring process, please email recruiting@project44.com. Even if you don’t meet 100% of the above qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying. Studies show that you can still be considered for a role if you meet just 50% of the role’s requirements.  More About Project44  Since 2014, project44 has been transforming the way one of the largest, most important global industries does business. As transportation and logistics continues to evolve and customer expectations around delivery become more demanding, industry technology must rise to the occasion. In just a few short years, we’ve created a digital infrastructure that eliminates the inefficiencies caused by dated technology and manual processes. Our Advanced Visibility Platform is used by the world’s leading brands to track shipments, collaborate with supply chain partners, drive operational efficiencies, and create outstanding customer experiences.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Head of Client Success, TikTok Creator Marketplace
description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video and our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.   The TikTok Creator Marketplace is the official platform for brand and creator collaborations on TikTok. We are committed to growing a balanced supply of Brands and Creators on the marketplace to foster a healthy ecosystem.   As the Head of Client Success, you will lead and develop a high-performing team of Client Success Managers across the APAC region. You will also work closely with regional sales and product marketing teams to define and execute strategies and innovative approaches that drive client activations, product utilization, and growth.  The TikTok Creator Marketplace is the official platform for brand and creator collaborations on TikTok. The Client Success team is essential in enabling key brands and agencies in leveraging the marketplace effectively in a self-serve capacity across all their creator activations. This role is critical to the overall success of the platform in terms of product adoption.  Responsibilities Lead and develop a regional Client Success team by setting the vision, strategy, objectives & key results (OKRs), and mentoring team members. Architect the Client Success team organization to drive key account expansion by onboarding clients onto the TikTok Creator Marketplace platform, ensuring they are fully enabled to activate creator marketing campaigns in a self-serve fashion. Unlock client value by defining the customer journey and lifecycle, and deploying programs and initiatives to drive client and agency onboarding, enablement, activation, and engagement. Partner with cross-functional leaders, including Sales, Product Marketing, and Marketing to drive strategic alignment and operationalize activities that unlock client growth opportunities. Be the voice of the client and partner closely with Product Managers to keep building innovative solutions for both clients and creators.  Qualifications 10+ years of experience in a client success or account management role in a SaaS, social media, or start-up environment. 3+ years of people management experience, with a passion for mentoring and developing talent. Proven experience in a fast-paced, results-driven company with knowledge of the digital advertising landscape is preferred; influencer marketing and P&L ownership experience preferred. Track record of success in unlocking growth and client value across the customer journey and lifecycle. Extensive experience in cross-functional leadership and collaboration, resource coordination and project delivery. Data-driven decision maker with excellent communication and presentation skills. High EQ and empathy for clients who may be new to the discipline of creator marketing Passion for client success and the creator economy. Highly analytical with strong interpersonal skills, this is a role that will interface internally, cross-functionally, and externally with creators. Highly motivated, results-oriented self-starter with great attention to detail.
industries: Internet

description: Job Description  About the Consumer Insight Team  Consumer Insight is an important part of the Customized Intelligence business unit; we are focused and innovative with a growth mindset that enables us to delight clients with specialized methodologies and drives critical revenue for the company. Standing at the forefront of research and technology, we adapt to changes in real-time and discover new verticals and opportunities to drive sales.  We understand that good products and marketing start with understanding the “why” behind the “what”; and with the right technology investment and by switching to 100% contactless we will be conducting research guided by expertise, experience, and empathy to make headway in existing and untapped markets to explore new business opportunities.  We execute our short and long-term strategy built on People, Products, Position, and Profit to elevate our team spirit, industry reputation, and business now and in the future.  About The Job  The purpose of the role is to develop the Customer Experience Product Strategy globally for NielsenIQ Consumer Insights (CI) and position us as the leader, particularly in TTAF Vertical (Telecom, Technology, Auto and Finance) complementing our other two practices, Brand/Consumer and Shopper.  Role  Customer Experience Practice is expected to grow significantly in the upcoming few years and the main focus for the role will be to Develop further NielsenIQ Experiences; a consultative engagement framework combining best-practice expertise on the brand promise, journey mapping redesign, measurement that ultimately helps companies optimize experiences for positive business impact Design and launch new and differentiated products, in partnership with existing and new 3d party partners. Given our geographical strength, focus markets have been identified in Asia and the Middle East with a goal to scale globally.  Responsibilities Strategic thinking and foresight: Develop a strategic understanding of industry trends, competition, and opportunities of NielsenIQ in the space of Customer Experience and enrich the vision for NielsenIQ CI in the product development cycle. Evolve the product strategy having a clear positioning of current products as well as new products for TTAF (Telecom, Technology, Auto and Finance) first, followed by Public and Extended Verticals. Work in close collaboration with the Technology and Product Development teams to create relevant requirements for future developments. Ability to deliver internal client solutions that address key business questions and create impact within the organization. Interact with major clients to better understand their needs and create a vision on what are our philosophy and positioning is, what we can do or should not do Own the commercial strategy for our new and differentiated products (including the underway reinvention of Mystery Shopper)- which client needs are key today, and which product can help solve their business issues, what should be our product story, how do we differentiate from the competition. Work with Product Marketing and Sales Enablement on the Commercialization approach of our solutions (incl. brand architecture positioning and persona-based credentials and positioning). Create a community of Customer Experience Experts across the globe and ensure Commercial teams are trained to handle client requirements when it comes to CX. Create Thought Leadership content on different topics, lead external webinars and presentations (key conferences on changing dynamics and key emerging trends), including some T2T client engagements. Maintain & update Customer Experience Resources Provide consultancy on key very large client pitches PEER ENGAGEMENT Build collaborative relationships across functions, businesses & geographies relentlessly pursuing the productization of CI agenda while maintaining a client-centric mindset. Influence key commercial leaders, gaining buy-in and leading through change with new solutions Be the voice of the business in technology discussions Remove structural barriers and silos to simplify work processes About You  You possess a balance of general business knowledge, the ability to work with a diverse product portfolio, and has analytical acumen. You have a deep knowledge of Customer Experience Research with the ability to adopt a creative approach, generates new ideas that are not constrained by precedent or conventional approaches. You are a self-starter and inquisitive; passionate product development enthusiast and thrives in collaborative team-oriented environments.  Qualifications 15+ years of relevant experience. Preference is given to candidates with experience in the Customer Experience Space (ideally at a Client and/or for a Market Research Company) CX Certifications Required Asia & China - Travel will be required (post Covid-19 pandemic; - approx. 15-20% of time) Be able to work flexible hours to accommodate a Global Clock (Manager base in EU) Persuasive with excellent verbal, writing, and presentation skills Cross country/functional leadership and influence. If you have multi-country and international experience is an additional advantage Strategic and Commercial Thinking: Ability to understand the bigger picture beyond the facts and figures and make business decisions to improve profitability/financial acumen Transformation through change with a passion for product/technology. Ability to build consensus with others through understanding their perspective and focusing on shared goals Commercial/ Client-Centric mindset with a good understanding of client needs per persona type and how to elevate insights and drive client outcomes. Ability to lead Webinars and T2T level engagement on CX Strong Business English knowledge, Experience working in a global, culturally diverse, digitally-enabled environment Decision Making: Ability to evaluate the viability and effectiveness of various options to identify the best solution Strong Project management skills and operational excellence i.e. ability to follow through unplanned but urgent assignments without compromising work standards About NielsenIQ  Additional Information  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.  NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Overall Job Objectives  The Business Manager is responsible for overall sales revenue while managing costs and operating budget for multiple brands of multiple outlets. He/she creates and maintains Standard Operations Procedures (SOP) for the F&B business, including F&B administration and food safety and hygiene practices.  He/She further ensures brand standards are maintained and drive the brand concept and strategy with senior management. This includes managing day-to-day operations, maintaining the quality, standards and meeting the expectations of the customers on a daily basis.  Critical & Core Work Tasks Oversee the overall operations of the outlets/restaurants Is responsible for achieving the sales target of the outlets/restaurants Manage brand operations team to ensure motivation and high productivity levels Maintain effective cost control in all areas of outlets/restaurants Observe QC levels and ensure standards are maintained Ensure all promotions are executed effectively and efficiently Ensure proper and efficient manpower planning Set up system to ensure that all team members have the necessary training on the brand and the product Manage and resolve employee issues at outlet level; provide counselling, conflict Management and grievance handling Job Requirement Minimum 5 years of experience in F&B industry Minimum 3 years of experience managing staff Leader to make strategic decisions effectively in the interest of the organisation Excellent organizational and planning skills Strong analytical skills Strong leadership skills with the ability to work well with people at all levels Efficient administration along with excellent communication skills Good listening skills with a patience to develop solutions to the problems faced by the subordinates Open to welcome changes and work as a team
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

Current Structure The role will report to the Head of Banking Software. Currently they have presence in South Asia, South East Asia - India, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Africa, Middle East and Africa and small presence in Europe and US. Job Scope And Requirements They are looking to increase their presence now in the APAC - Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Thailand as region focus. Need someone who will setup APAC presence – Largely comes from Banking software Sales background (Treasury, trade finance, supply chain, core banking, AML, broad management etc) and has good connections in banking industry country wise. This role is all about building new clients rather than maintenance of the existing clientele. This role would be required to build and manage the team of 3 to 4 country managers and also be a individual contributor. Location:  Singapore

description: Sales Director is responsible to generate sales for the defined strategic FSI account to maintain a strong positive relationship with the prospects. He/She is responsible to generate, maintain and further develop sales forecasts for allocated prospects/customer accounts. The role is responsible to develop, manage and maintain strong account relationships with prospects/customers in the Public Sector.  The candidate is required to have an understanding of Financial banking knowledge Analytics/ application & cloud modernization Application managed services Responsibilities Manage accounts including the entire sales process from business development, prospecting and qualifications through negotiations and signing the deal Develop and execute the client account strategy that clearly defines how the company will help the client grow and differentiate itself Participate and coordinate the appropriate pre-sales, professional services and resources to successfully close the deal with clients, at the same time conforming to mandatory company processes Responsible for ensuring profit and client satisfaction for accounts Negotiate and close terms and conditions of agreements to deliver win-win solution for both clients and company Represent the clients to communicate their needs to relevant departments in the organization Ensure client readiness for products and services and successful solution installation Drive the closure of deals through demonstration, presentation and sales of value proposition Oversee the process from sourcing and proposing to closing of business deals. You would have a keen eye on upcoming new tech with your market knowledge and exposure to events. Network and be involved in professional organizations to keep updated in the financial market. Essential Requirements Degree in Computer Engineering or Information Technology or Marketing or related disciplines At least 10 years’ sales experience in IT solutions and services Strong network in local and Global banks Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly present solutions and services information at one to one or group presentation Resulted oriented with the ability to work independently Outgoing and pleasant personality Comfortable to work with all levels of the customer organization up to Senior Management and C Level Key abilities in relationship building and consultative approach to business Creative and entrepreneurial Good listening Skills / humility Culture Sensitivities / local experience Good communication and presentation skills Personal Attributes Positive can-do attitude Relentless Collaborative and a team player Independent Demonstrates good consulting hygiene Systematic and focused approach to working Confident and comfortable with client’s interactions Analytical and possess the ability to solve problems permanently

description: Purpose of Role  Lead the branch operations, business expansion and development of NEC India’s portfolio in the ASEAN and ANZ regions. Build a strong governance system for business and delivery processes to ensure discipline and consistency across various groups/centers and to maintain business growth, profitability and execution in line with the organizational objectives and strategies.  Key Duties and Responsibilities Responsible for overall P&L, annual budget planning for branch operations and driving monthly forecast planning to own the plan/ operating profit against the budget. Setting annual target for various operational metrics – Productivity, Price realization, Utilization; tracking, cost optimization and reporting the same to the Management team. Responsible for overall Sales and Revenue growth by developing new business models, roadmaps and capabilities by partnering with the senior executives; work collaboratively with business teams to understand customer requirements and translate strategies into products, solution and services. Build and maintain strong relationships with NEC country affiliate companies’ management and leadership teams in the region. Ability to navigate client organizations to identify and engage with decision makers at CXO level. Seek and build healthy relationships with key accounts’ decision-making teams and be the primary interface between the client and NEC India key stakeholders. Responsible for overall workforce planning and management, maintaining skill database, processes, policies team KPIs and dashboards – ensuring there is no revenue leakage and utilization of deployable resources is as per plan. Leading entire gamut of functions such as Go-To-Market support, Pre-Sales and Consultative sales to expand the business for NEC Country Affiliates riding on NEC India’s competencies. The role would also involve closely working with Business Heads and Global Account Managers in business development, competency building and complete responsibility (client proposal creation and overall bid management) and ownership for Delivery excellence in the respective practice area. Establish best practices for long term sustainability and consistency with the ability to scale as per business environment and potential. Competition analysis by keeping abreast of market trends and achieving market share metrics. Lead employee value proposition (EVP) initiative to continuously enhance overall employee engagement, be the brand ambassador of NEC Code of Values and demonstrate strong leadership effectiveness to create brand NEC as ‘THE’ employer of choice. Partner with people leaders to proactively structure teams that are geared for success and enable team members to achieve their maximum potential.

jobTitle: Regional Marketing Manager - APAC Brand & Experiences Lead
description: Location: Singapore  We’re looking for a curious, creative, and thoughtful marketing leader to help us build the Stripe brand in APAC and deliver differentiated experiences for our users and prospects. Someone who geeks out about both product features and brand storytelling. Someone who gets as excited about the tiny, minute details as they do about the craziest, biggest ideas. Someone driven by leading projects that aren’t easy or obvious, but are high impact and essential to the business. Someone who wants to help build and evolve the Stripe brand in unconventional and unexpected ways.  As the ideal candidate, you’re a leader and a doer - someone who can function as a big picture thinker, as well as roll up your sleeves to execute. You take a creative approach to challenges and initiatives and never settle for good enough. You’re team-oriented with a strong bias to action, and you care about doing what’s best for our users, for Stripe, and your team. You’ll have relevant experience with and a passion for brand marketing and measurement, user insights, customer stories, and high-touch experiences (incl. EBCs, industry sponsorships, and first-party physical and virtual events). You’ll not only import and localise global marketing campaigns to APAC, but also export APAC-first campaigns to the rest of the world.  You’ll partner with Field Marketing, Sales, and Communications to: Bring the Stripe brand to life – in both big and small ways. Sometimes you’ll ship scrappy experimental projects—things we can launch, iterate and learn from quickly. Sometimes you’ll lead bigger, more complex projects—ones that involve research, briefs, concepting, creative development, media plans, and measurement (and generally longer timelines). The fun is in flexing between both. Grow awareness of the Stripe brand across a number of different audiences by developing campaigns across earned, owned, and paid channels and coming up with creative ideas to help people better understand Stripe. Measure brand awareness and perception. You’ll help us collect and act on data and feedback to evaluate brand work and inform future initiatives, and you’ll own the collection of market and customer insights to inform our Marketing strategy and messaging. Deliver high-quality executive engagements (e.g. EBCs and Executive Sponsorship programs) that bring Stripe’s story and value to life. You’ll execute differentiated first-party events (webinars, roundtables, etc.) and industry sponsorships. Establish our customer marketing program in APAC. You’ll help define what “customer marketing” means in the region and shape the customer marketing program for impact and scale. Make customer stories come to life, identifying and developing content for customer stories ranging from case studies, external slides, ROI reports, and filmed narratives. You’ll nurture relationships with a select set of high-priority customers to identify and execute strategic co-marketing opportunities. We’re Looking For Someone With Extensive experience (10+ years) managing and measuring integrated, multi-market, cross-functional brand marketing campaigns from scratch. Experience working closely with Sales teams to build engaging executive programs that accelerate pipeline and customer lifetime value. Strong collaboration skills and the ability to effectively partner with and influence stakeholders. Must be a team player and ideally passionate about learning and coaching. Remarkable written and verbal communication skills, including being able to convey complex topics with simplicity. Superb organisation and project management skills and the capacity to manage multiple complex projects at once across time zones and languages. Excellent analytical skills and the ability to craft actionable insights from complex data. Experience—and genuine love for—working with creative teams. Design and creative expression matter a lot to us. It’s not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas-we’re looking for candidates that are particularly strong in at least one area, and have some interest and capabilities in the others.
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Internet

jobTitle: Head of Channel Partnerships, Google Customer Solutions - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Head of Channel Partnerships, Google Customer Solutions - Singapore  Additional Role Description  As the Head of Channel Partnerships for Southeast Asia, you will drive product-enabling partnerships and growth generation across the region in close conjunction with Technical and Product teams. You will be a key connector across a complex network of regional and global stakeholders across Channel Partner teams and GCS cross-functional counterparts, translating global strategy into local planning. You will lead your team in activating strong partner stakeholder management, defining joint-value strategies, and identifying product solutions to unlock business growth.  Working with C-levels across our external partners and executive internal stakeholders, you will lead the team acting as a global strategy consultant, advising and influencing others with local market expertise. You are an excellent problem solver, and lead with thought leadership to build upon innovative strategies.  You will cultivate new and existing relationships to ensure Google's partners can take full advantage of our growing suite of offerings, while delivering impact to the partner through direct and indirect business growth. This will include leveraging strong product and technical acumen to effectively assess performance levers and product market fit, continuously sharing feedback with Product teams and scaling best practices where relevant. You will build customer-centric relationships and find opportunities with partners in order to best represent our users, products, and programs.  Responsibilities Define partnership opportunities and plans for Southeast Asia and provide input to regional and global strategies. Build and deliver on go-to-market/partner engagement plans. Lead a high-performing team in charge of driving partner strategy and effectiveness, offering relevant coaching and development to individuals where applicable. Work with global Product teams to partner-enable incubations/launches of products, features, and user experiences across markets, surfaces, and industries. Scale products and features through increased market coverage, content acquisition, ecosystem enablement, and regional/industry insights. Lead internal cross-functional relationships and collaborate with global, regional, and country teams (e.g. Product Management and Engineering, Partnership Solutions, Legal, Finance, Technical, Development Relations, Marketing, Public Relations/Communications, and Sales Country leadership). Drive executive leadership to collaborate externally with C-level executives, boards of directors, with potential interaction with the press and industry analysts. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 15 years of experience in business development, partnerships, product management, general management, or sales. 5 years of experience in people management. Preferred Qualifications Experience managing complex product integrations with third parties. Experience in technology and emerging/early stage products. Experience in operations and a large/global organization. Ability to have strong stakeholder management across internal and external executives. Ability to be a thought leader and innovative. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and developed business judgment. Good communication skills.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Position Summary  Our high performing Client Development team is looking for a Client Director. Focusing predominantly on insurance and reinsurance sector clients, the team consults at C-Level to solution sell complex packages which bring value to our clients. New models and the recent release of Risk Intelligence will drive significant activities for the Client Director, amongst both existing and new clients. Additionally, with the move of Risk Intelligence to the cloud, sales growth will increasingly come from encouraging clients to expand the use of systems in breadth and depth across their organization.  As an Client Director, you will have the opportunity to be entrepreneurial and map market drivers to customer needs in order to create a compelling buying vision. This strategic consultative role will involve driving sales of new products to clients, as well as selling to new clients in the insurance market plus managing your immediate client’s contract renewals with. You will need to be able to liaise at the C-level to develop long-term and trusted relationships with all our clients.  Essential Job Functions Accountable for impact and revenue growth from client portfolio Develop and nurture relationships with client decision makers and key influencers Understanding all data, modelling, software, and service solutions to drive holistic client engagement Developing detailed client-centric plans to help clients achieve their strategic imperatives Working closely with Solution Practice to introduce customers to new solutions or develop custom solutions for specific needs Owning the internal reporting for assigned clients, including maintaining an accurate account of opportunities in Salesforce Working closely with Solutions and Client Success to provide end-to end customer service and meet on-going client needs Engaging internal stakeholders such as product & technical experts to support clients in achieving their strategic imperatives Qualifications Proven YOY revenue increases selling high value complex software, SaaS, analytics or related technology into financial services (or a deep understanding of Moody's business and products if not a sales person previously); Proven success in building complex solutions sales, with either a computer software, risk or analytical product, leading and closing individual deals; Must have proven experience of closing deals larger than $500k and a track record of producing consistent annual revenues of $5M and above; Proven ability to forecast and close business to plan on a quarterly cycle; Ability to defend price by demonstrating value; must have strong ability to understand, negotiate and sell value; Commercial success in exploring and evaluating key client issues from a broad perspective; Experience of communicating with gravitas at C-Level and articulating value propositions; Confidence in networking in large groups; Customer relationship management and leadership, ability to develop relationship with senior influencers; Over 8 years' of experience working as an (re)insurer, broker, specialty claims advocate. Experience working for multinational insurance company and or broking houses. Experience working on a global portfolio of business including an established global network of (re)inurers, brokers and third party experts such as lawyers, surveyors and adjusters. Existing relationship with C-Suite insurance managers preferred. Demonstratable experience managing a successful P/L and NOI with experience budget planning and forecasting. Experience in driving change to top tier insurance companies, with banking advisory sales also advantage. Good understanding of insurance products, processes and technologies (i.e insurtech/ fintech) Cross class insurance product knowledge across multiple specialty lines (i.e Marine, Property, Casualty, Renewables, Energy, Power) London insurance market experience preferable with working knowledge of Lloyd’s of London. Experience launching a digital product offering within an insurance role desirable. Knowledge of Alternative Risk Transfer Products including Parametric Underwriting Solutions preferred. Deep knowledge of (re)insurer’s climate risk use cases and market trends. Working knowledge of reinsurance and retrocession market. Good knowledge of ESG, Climate & Sustainability Solutions products and Services. Must have fluent English language skills, both written and spoken.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Director Open Banking, Asia Pacific  Overview  Open Banking is a worldwide phenomenon, gathering pace over the recent years and set to transform many aspects of retail financial services (as well as many adjacent industries). There are a number of markets already live with various forms of open banking offerings (e.g. EEA markets thanks to PSD2, or US owing to long-standing market driven initiatives). In most other markets, open banking is at earlier stages of development, yet already seeing plenty of attention from established players as well as new entrants.  Mastercard have built an initial suite of Open Banking Solutions and are now in the process of bringing them to market, commercialising and enhancing them, predominantly to date in Europe. See www.mastercard.com/openbanking. Over the last few years we have established a large, cross-functional team that is focusing on product design and delivery. Most recently, we also completed acquisition of Finicity – a leading US open banking data aggregation and analytics company.  This new role is pivotal in enabling Mastercard to establish open banking presence globally. Key aspects of the role: designing and executing the appropriate strategy for deploying selected global Mastercard Open Banking Solutions in key markets. internal and external thought leadership  In the process, the individual will work closely with, and where appropriate influence/persuade: Technical experts focusing on scoping the technology aspect of the open banking rollout IMK business development function, to build understanding of the needs of local key customers (banks as well as fintechs, merchants and others), as well as to commence early stage deployment conversations Corporate Development and Procurement personnel if the local deployment requires use of external supplier(s) Data & Strategy leads, to jointly drive the data requirements behind local products and services Technology teams that will drive product localisation, as well as Customer Delivery and Legal on setting up new relevant onboarding processes and contracts  The individual will be an expert on the relevant features, benefits, and the needs of current and future customers. The individual will also be a key member of the Mastercard Open Banking Global Product team responsible for defining and executing the product strategy for the overall product portfolio.  Role  You Will Design optimal strategy for product deployment and localisation across the key markets within the region, factoring in the current and projected future state of the relevant markets, competitors, regulatory pressures etc. Accompanying that, you will develop and maintain cost forecasts behind connectivity build, as well as costs, revenue and sales forecasts behind localised Open Banking Solutions with Sales, O&T and Finance that stand the test of time. Work with third party companies throughout the sourcing, contracting and deployment phase to drive regional execution of our strategy Actively engage potential customers and partners within the region, and drive the process of reflecting their needs in the local deployment of the relevant open banking products Be an internal expert on open banking as a whole, staying engaged with key ongoing market developments, regulatory interventions, competitor activity, events and conferences etc. Act as a contributor and/or lead through the development life-cycle working as an integrated part of the delivery team utilizing agile development techniques. In some circumstances it will be in the context of Mastercard internal teams, in others with third party suppliers / partner. You will actively translate specifics of the local market (e.g. data protection, data privacy, on-soil requirements etc.) to product requirements, feed them into relevant product localisation planning  While the role commences as a ‘individual contributor’, the individual is expected to over time be involved in growing the regional product footprint of open banking resources, with significant potential for moving to a position of managing other people within ~6-12 months. In this regard, the role will be responsible also for training and up-skilling any new team members.  All About You  Skills and experience required for this role are: Experience of banking, payments or FinTech sectors. Successful B2B product development and/or management experience Experience of engaging with external customers (in a sales or relationship management role) Experience of engaging across the organisation with internal colleagues and third party suppliers (e.g. IT, Operations, finance and marketing) Strong analytical skills and financial literacy Self-starter with strong ability to work remotely, without hands-on local direction Ability to plan and organise effectively and deliver to deadlines. An attention to detail, a ‘right first time’ approach. Able to build new relationships on one’s own, and communicate at all levels within the business, clearly and concisely The ability to work in a cross-functional team and in a matrix organisation  Desirable Skills And Experience Working Knowledge of APIs and applications that deploy them Product Management experience of a business or consumer facing application or technology service Good Knowledge of Open Banking  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

jobTitle: Head of Merchandising (Interim Position) - Sales Market SG MY VN
description: As the Head of Merchandising, you will be responsible to drive the selling of your market and its profitable net growth, and you will work cross-functionally to create the best customer offer. As a leader, you will be responsible to develop, motivate and inspire your team members and you will lead by example, always driven by our values and the ambition to make our people and business grow.  Key Areas Of Responsibility Include Commercial planning including Sales and Reduction planning Commercial execution & Customer experience in store Stock Management & Inventory optimization Buying Strategyy Key Responsibilities  Drive profitable and sustainable growth in your market Build a commercial plan that maximizes profitable selling - align it with the financial and buying plan. Identify quantitative selling opportunities, set a strategy and initiate actions to drive them together with the Sales Team. Draw up short and long term commercial focuses for your market. Create commitment for them within the Area Teams, support functions and stores in order to set the right priorities for short and long term growth. Maximize the selling per square meter in existing and new stores by optimizing concept mix in cooperation with Store Development, Expansion, Visual and Area teams. Identify best practices and drive these in the commercial plan for next year. Overall responsible for setting the allocation and replenishment strategy, including new stores, rebuilds and relocations. Secure profitability, optimal stock levels and composition by setting reduction strategies in line with the financial and commercial plan. Affect supply chain setup and communicate with the logistics department to make sure that their activity supports the selling and stock goals in the country. Create the best customer offer Know your market: macro-economic factors, retail situation, price positioning. Know your competition and set up strategies to secure H&M’s business idea. Drive the buying strategy, in alignment with controlling, and in collaboration with the Demand Planner and the Regional Supply & Demand unit. Collaborate with Global Sales to provide relevant & actionable feedback to Assortment office. Be a leader Set and follow up SMART goals and drive your team towards them. Create commitment within the country organization for Merchandising and your goals. Develop team members by sharing knowledge, providing training opportunities and delegating responsibility. Motivate and inspire your team and other functions in your market. Compose your team strategically, building on individual strengths. Create a good succession plan to support our company’s growth. Attract, recruit and develop future Merchandising potentials. Qualifications 4+ years minimum in total from OL/Store merchandising/Demand Supply Planning and/or Business Controlling. Assortment Office and/or Logistics experience is meriting. High strategic and analytical skills. Strong commercial understanding & demonstrated experience. Deep understanding buying, stock management, allocation, inventory optimization and logistics operations. Great communication skills with proven experience. Leadership experience as well as experience in building relationships across functions. YOUR LEADERSHIP You are a values ambassador and you believe in the power of teamwork. You lead with vision and you make relevant decisions to achieve long-term results, by setting priorities and following up your results. You are a driver, you take the ownership to set challenging goals for the business, others and yourself and you are motivated from the achievements. Having the feedback culture in mind, you develop others by coaching and delegating effectively and you recognize other team members great contribution. You have great communication skills to be able to build relationships across functions.
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Sales Director (Singapore & Malaysia)  Why You'll Love Hitachi Vantara  Hitachi Vantara, a wholly owned subsidiary of Hitachi, Ltd, guides our customers from what’s now to what’s next by solving their digital challenges. Working alongside each customer, we apply our unmatched industrial and digital capabilities to their data and applications to benefit both business and society. More than 80% of the Fortune 100 trust Hitachi Vantara to help them develop new revenue streams, unlock competitive advantages, lower costs, enhance customer experiences, and deliver social and environmental value. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired.  Meet our Team  Our people are our greatest asset. We are a diverse team with deep experience in Healthcare, Public Sector, Manufacturing and Financial Services. We support our employees and want them to thrive through exposure in our accounts in different industries. We seek to upskill our employees in the latest technologies to ensure relevance and to meet our customers’ evolving technology and solution needs. Our focus on our customer’s success ensures that our employees can share in their success as well.  The Digital Solutions Business Unit (DSBU) was created in January 2020 to support digital transformation via industry-specific solutions, software and services. As part of the investment to grow the business, Hitachi Vantara is seeking to recruit an experienced sales director to develop and lead the sales organization in Singapore and Malaysia. This high-profile role will take the lead on sales across the DSBU including Digital Modernization, Application Development and migration to the cloud, Consulting and Outsourcing.  The Sales Leader will be based in the Singapore and will be part of the DSBU Leadership team.  Responsibilities To develop and execute a strategic sales plan which delivers revenue and margin growth through the acquisition of new logo clients and the expansion of Hitachi’s relationships with existing customers Supporting the growth of Hitachi Vantara by ensuring the sales team have a balanced pipeline that delivers services and solutions business Partner will counterparts across Hitachi Vantara to identify opportunities for collaboration and joint go to markets Acting as a Sales Leader, including creating a goal orientated culture of success across a geographically dispersed team whilst recruiting and developing members of the sales team which will include identifying the next generation of sales leadership Taking an evidence-based approach to sales planning with a forward-looking plan that connects sales to delivery As a member of the DSBU Leadership team, supporting senior colleagues in the delivery function to ensure client projects are fulfilled successfully Ensuring that a partnership approach is taken to working with other Hitachi group companies to drive opportunities for maximum customer value and revenue growth Developing a sophisticated key account strategy that drives additional revenue by expanding the portfolio of services Hitachi is providing Market and competitor analysis Qualifications  We hire professionals, passionate about the benefits technology can bring to business. It is likely that most people who meet our criteria will come from a large-scale consulting or technology firm.  A Sales Leader Will Typically Have Sales Management with a 15+ year career leading a large regional or global sales organization selling digital services to help customers realize their digital transformation goals and journey to the cloud. Adept strategist on Digital Solutions with international sales and business management experience. Experienced and recognized for GTM Strategy, Digital Sales Leadership, business growth, providing strategic vision and forging strong & profitable relationships. Led Sales organization with yearly targets of $20M+ and has personally carried significant targets in the past Experienced Sales Leader skilled in transitioning companies through periods of change, including large-scale growth and industry-first market launches on a global scale. Has experience and proven track record in global sales, is adept at directing multicultural, multinational, diverse sales teams, cultivating strong relationships at all levels. Has deep understanding and experience in selling “Consulting Services” in atleast 2 areas - ERP (SAP, Oracle), Application Modernization (Open Stack, DevOps), Cloud Migration, Big Data Analytics, Datalakes etc., Has Industry experience (in at least 2 apart from FSI) – Public Sector, Financial Services, Consumer Goods & Industrial Manufacturing. Has experience working with Partners like SAP, any of the Public Cloud providers like AWS, Microsoft or Google. Resilient and coachable with demonstrated ability to adapt to various work styles and cultures. Successful leader focused on talent development & build winning sales team. Exceptional abilities to problem solve and propose solutions A deep understanding of the enterprise software sales landscape and the markets in which Hitachi Vantara operates Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills including the ability to quickly build rapport and trust Gravitas with the ability to influence and lead others and drive behaviors to achieve results A practical and pragmatic approach which places the client at the centre of everything Inclusion and Diversity  Hitachi Vantara is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  Our Values  Research tells us that some applicants, especially those from underrepresented groups, can be put off from applying for roles if they need flexibility or feel they don’t meet all of the set criteria. We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and part-time arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.  With Japanese Roots Going Back Over 100 Years, Our Culture Is Founded On The Values Of Our Parent Company Expressed As The Hitachi Spirit  We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  Wa – Harmony, Trust, Respect  Makoto – Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity  Kaitakusha-Seishin – Pioneering Spirit, Challenge
industries: Information Technology and Services, Human Resources, and Management Consulting

description: EclecticIQ is expanding its business, and subsequently, its Sales team. Therefore raises the opportunity for the right candidate to join a fast growing scale-up, a market leader in Cyber Threat Intelligence. We are seeking a Sales Director to join our Global Central Government sales team. You will be developing new customers overall in the Central Government domain. Your focus territory will be Asia-Pacific. This is a very hands-on position, combining strategic market development with operational execution. You report to the VP Government Sector and work closely with the Marketing, Sales and Customer Success teams. Our Government customers and prospects are based in Europe, Middle-East, SE-Asia and Canada.  Responsibilities  As Sales Director Central Government, your focus will be to: Execute on Government Sector go to market plan: Create and execute on the Asia-Pacific go to market plan Expand current customer base in Central Government by means of a solution-sales approach Provide input to Marketing on Government/Asia-Pacific specific marketing tactics Provide input to Product Management on Government/Asia-Pacific specific market needs Develop new contacts / network: Create and own high level relationships at selected accounts. Develop introductions and footprint within the Central Government domain and within the eco-system of influencers Develop and execute on marketing lead generation activities like e.g. mailings, webinars Plan for and participate in national government conferences on cyber security Drive RFI/RFP and Public Tender processes. Close deals: Collaborate with partners/consortiums on tender response or complex RFP’s Lead deal teams (including a/o pre-sales, solution architects, legal, finance) and establish win strategies. Close deals. Drive Proof of Value workshops as part of the commercial process Drive Government Sector opportunities to successful deal closure Ensure customer satisfaction for long-lasting relations: Manage key stakeholders within the accounts before and after deal closure Active influencer during solution deployment phase Ensure creation of public reference/case studies/testimonials Identify and drive upsell opportunities  Requirements  You are an ambitious, result driven professional and recognize yourself in the following: You are a self-starter You are a team-player who also likes to work independently You combine strategic thinking with a drive for execution Able to think ‘out-of-the-box’, you go the ‘extra mile’ You like to work in a fast-paced environment Well organized, you like to keep things in strict order Organizational/Political sensitive, understanding the dynamics of large government agencies Cultural affinity in working in Asia-Pacific; Ideally you bring a network of relevant contacts across the Asia Pacific region Skills and experience Bachelor degree or above (Commercial/Business degree) Track record of closing large size deals in Central Government Experience with building and executing on strategic market development plans Proven track record in successfully developing business internationally, preferably in Asia Pacific. 5+ years’ experience in a similar role in Government Sector, strongly preferred in Cyber Security domain Good all round knowledge of the cyber security- and preferably threat intelligence market, channel, partners and customers Experienced working in a technology environment and collaborating with technology & channel partners/ System Integrators. Experienced working with complex software offerings and complex/long sales cycles. Experience in data management/analytics domain is a plus Experienced and comfortable working in an international environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Additional languages are a plus Ability to travel is required  Benefits  We offer a full-time position with a market conform salary and outstanding learning opportunities and a healthy work-life balance. Collaborating with our EclecticIQ teams, you can work with (and build) the latest technology. Our teams are humble, effective, transparent, and lifelong learners - while we love experiments and research, we are not afraid to make decisions. We are backed by international investors to build the future together!  About EclecticIQ  EclecticIQ is a global threat intelligence, hunting and response technology provider. Its clients are some of the most targeted organizations, globally. To build tomorrow’s defences today, they have to understand the threats against them – and align their efforts and investments to mitigate their risks. EclecticIQ helps governments, large enterprises and service providers manage threat intelligence, create situational awareness and adopt an intelligence-led cybersecurity approach. EclecticIQ extended its focus towards hunting and response with the acquisition of Polylogyx’s endpoint technology in 2020. Founded in 2014, EclecticIQ operates globally with offices across Europe, North America, and via value-add partners.  More info: www.eclecticiq.com  In case of any questions or queries, please reach out to our Talent Management Partner at brenda@eclecticiq.com.  The selection process may include security screening and/or background checks.
industries: Computer Software

Building relationships with and for the shareholders Recommending strategic decisions which have long term financial impact for the firm, initiating financing solutions for the company Technical skills are a given; Mergers & Acquisitions, valuation, due diligence, corporate funding / financing, corporate restructuring Dual mission to identify and develop optimal revenue models, sales and distribution channels, pricing and new product development strategies and to develop future leaders Work along the senior management, C-suite, and lead/ develop high-performing project teams. description: Purpose: Responsible for revenue growth in APAC by managing new opportunities with net new accounts and new projects with new contacts in existing clients including regional expansion  DRIVING BUSINESS GROWTH FOR MOI  As the Growth Director, you are responsible for engaging with and delivering new logos and driving incremental revenue from existing strategic accounts. The ideal candidate is someone who comes from agency, consulting services and/or SaaS solutions company selling to Heads of Marketing. Experience with B2B marketing, B2B consulting and/or marketing technologies is a must. The ideal candidate is comfortable selling to C-Suite, CMO, VP, and Director levels and must be able to adapt their selling approach to different size organizations. This person needs to be an expert at positioning business value, identifying marketing solutions, managing a complex sales process, and building relationships with different stakeholders that will influence a purchase. This Growth Director will report to the SVP of APAC and work closely with the SVP of Growth, internal marketing and account leadership teams.  SUCCESS FACTORS  Strong Leadership and Accountability Take ownership and accountability for all revenue targets and sales projections with accounts that align to the company’s Ideal Customer Profile Build a business development plan capable of exceeding revenue targets and projections Adhere to margin requirements and position value-based outcomes to ensure project profitability is achieved Proven ability to sell marketing solutions that address major business challenges and might require major transformation and change from the client to produce an effective result Self-starter with the ability to adapt to shifting priorities and work within an entrepreneurial culture Driving Targeted Engagement In partnership with the SVP APAC and SVP Growth, define where we should play within targeted industries, how we go to market (including marketing & demand gen strategy), how we will win, and that your time is allocated to capture the best results Define the best methods for connecting with prospects in net new and existing accounts – with the understanding that social selling will play a key role Understand market and B2B marketing trends to help determine overall growth strategy and market positioning Create a Growing and Predictable Sales Engine Proven approach to prospecting and growing pipeline through new customer acquisition Proven social selling acumen and methodology Proven ability to provide value to clients while achieving a consistent and accurate forecast Demonstrated experience running a complex sales cycle that will involve multiple client stakeholders and require MOI resources to contribute throughout the selling process Willing to follow a sales process methodology to execute a repeatable approach to client development Collaborate Effectively with Stakeholders Report regularly to SVP Growth and SVP APAC Work well with other groups to deliver a great customer experience. Internal functions include: growth team, strategy/account leadership, implementation and executive teams. Experience  QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE Strong track record of growing an organization through new customer acquisition efforts Worked for a consulting and/or SaaS company focused on delivering solutions to the CMO and/or marketing and sales leaders B2B marketing experience and background Worked in a smaller and more entrepreneurial environment Knowledge of and ability to contribute to MOI’s own marketing and demand generation strategy in region Strong preference for experience with account-based marketing, demand generation & digital marketing solutions and services Competencies and attributes of an MOI team member Curious and fearless, with a strong desire to achieve Resourceful self-starter with a solution-driven attitude Combines disciplined execution that delivers a predictable engine Learn-it-all vs. know-it-all with a strong intellectual curiosity to embrace new practices and support a learning culture Excellent communication skills, evidenced by successful executive interactions, outstanding presentation skills, negotiation, an influencing skills High level of personal and professional integrity Building deep relationships with team and client Maintaining an open and supportive culture About Moi  When today’s always-on world means your buyers can research, reject, or shortlist your brand without even talking to you, we’ll get you into the conversation. MOI Global is a B2B creative agency connecting you with a new breed of buyer. Re-engineering your marketing eco-system to target the places they hang out and the people they listen to.  With offices in London, New York and Singapore, we help our clients deliver head turning campaigns that target international and local markets. Our services cover all aspects of a buyer's omni-channel world, including digital, social media, events, direct mail and telemarketing. Clients include Oracle, Google Cloud, Facebook, Fuji Xerox, Grab and Red Hat.  For more information, please visit www.moi-global.com

description: Big 3 Media is a Video Agency that specializes in creative storytelling. Holding true to our Big 3 core values of being Creative, Empathetic and Better, we never stop seeking improvement, experience, and knowledge in the creative process, constantly pushing ourselves so that we will see the bigger picture. If you've ever wondered how the magic on screen is created, there is no limit to what we can achieve together!  Sales Director The role will report to the Managing Director. The successful candidate will be responsible for seeking out and developing new business, with a consultative approach to selling and managing.  Key Responsibilities Hunt for new leads and business opportunities Build solid relationships with customers, vendors and distributors, as well as sales and marketing teams. Develop a growth strategy focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction in the Media Industry. Develop in-depth knowledge of company offerings to identify profitable business opportunities. Develop short and long term business strategies to improve the Group’s businesses. Direct marketing efforts by presenting market research to marketing directors and suggesting strategies to expand market research. Assess marketing and sales as well as supplier and vendor operations and recommend improvements as needed. Prepare all documentation required for requests for proposals (RFPs). Research emerging trends and recommend new company offerings to satisfy customers’ needs in the media market. Manage and lead a team effectively to attain desired results. Develop and manage external strategic partnerships to grow business. Present business and marketing opportunities to company executives and management. Build, train and manage a sales team of “Hunters” to bring in new businesses Key Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, or related field; 5-7 Years of working experience in Business Development Proven track record of business development, sales, or marketing in the Media Industry would be highly advantageous Motivated by hunting for new leads and bringing in new businesses Proficient in all Microsoft Office and CRM Softwares Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills Experience in customer support Exceptional leadership and management skills Effective communication and negotiation skills Strong business acumen Detail-oriented and persuasive Ability to build rapport with stakeholders and clients Positive and can-do attitude

description: Enterprise Services: Regional Director  About The Role  The Enterprise Services Regional Leader will be responsible for representing Enterprise Services in their region, possibly with the help of a handful of Project Executives. The Regional Leader will work with their manager (the Head of International or Head of Americas) to identify the best way to direct incoming demand and execute on global processes on a regional level.  The Enterprise Services Global Accounts Project Executive operates as the primary facilitator between our clients, our Enterprise Sales team and our delivery team and is responsible for ensuring the voice of the customer is not lost throughout the sales, project scoping, deal structuring, space delivery, and move-in to the space. The ideal candidate will be experienced in the architecture, construction and/or the real estate industries, have direct client engagement experience and a keen understanding of the enterprise real estate sales process. This role will be specifically assigned to WeWork's top global accounts; this list will change from time to time but is intended to be the top 25 - 50 accounts based on historical transactions, lifetime value, future pipeline, executive relationships, etc. Examples of these include, but are not limited to Amazon, Google, Salesforce, HSBC, etc.  Responsibilities  Responsible for ensuring all incoming Top Accounts demand in the region is handled appropriately by ES and/or product team, serving as regional point of contact for Sales partners, Global ES partners, and Product Responsible for working with Regional Sales to develop top accounts headquartered in region and liaising with other Regional Leaders and Pod Directors to export business to other regions Advise on incoming deals from a sales strategy perspective, joining calls with clients to serve as technical expert and taking the lead on client communication for high profile deals Lead Enterprise Services strategy, best practices, and processes in your region, liaising with Enterprise Services Global leadership and Cross-Functional Regional Leadership to ensure consistency across regions Serve as the dedicated technical expert in CRE and in WeWork product standards in region Ensure reports are following best practices in project status reporting, QA/QC, weekly member check ins and reporting Ensure operational excellence in the day-to-day management of the business, including forecasting, pipeline development, training, hiring, performance management, and team collaboration Develop and implement best practices to maximize pipeline creation, conversion rates, forecasting accuracy, and cross-functional collaboration  Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree required 7-10+ years experience in a related field, ie. real estate, design and/or construction Experience working with senior stakeholders and executives Proven success scaling out a team and establishing effective relationships with key decision-makers Direct experience managing reports with full teams of their own across multiple different regions Demonstrated ability to continuously increase the effectiveness of the team, recognizing opportunities for creating new systems, structures and processes Thorough understanding of the construction industry and the various phases that occur within the life-cycle of a project Ability to work well under pressure and prioritize tasks in a compressed time frame, maintaining order and efficiency at all times Experience managing people and workload across a multitude of projects or tasks Proven track record working in a high-growth, fast paced environment Strong executive presence - experience and comfort level working with C-level and other senior executives Flexibility to travel up to 25% of the time

description: The position As a global leader in our space, we are on a journey to transform from a traditional enterprise software company into a technology enabled services business, while sustaining our experience double-digit and profitable growth. Building an ecosystem of complementary third-party solutions is an important lever to unlock additional value for our customers and a cornerstone in our ambition to become the technology platform of choice for the world's largest investment companies. We are now creating a new visible Director level position to accelerate the commercial success of our growing set of commercial partnerships with creative fintech's that enhance our offering and provide value-adding optionality for customers. Reporting to the Head of Open Innovation, the Global Partner Success Director will have a real impact to the next phase of the commercial optionality partnership program of proving out the business proposition. You will be part of an yet still small intrapreneurial endeavor. You need to act without having all the answers and do what's required rather than be limited by the job description. We're also part of a larger transformation from traditional "lumpy" software sales to a more service selling approach. Partnerships are part of these services and with the volume we aim for it helps having both a lean startup mindset but also an eye for ensuring scale early. Your responsibilities Establish new partner success management practice: Create focus on "partner experience" by adopting customer experience best practice for use with partners as another category of customer Create operational processes for go-to-market planning and sales execution jointly with partner and SimCorp functions Ensure growing set of optionality partners to succeed with marquee reference case sales Be primary contact for partners upon execution of partnership Manage internal and external stakeholders to ensure successful joint delivery to joint customer Help improve visibility of the partnership program Be the "Chief Revenue Officer" for Open Platform partnership program: Help close new partnership deals on commercially favorable yet straightforward terms Assist partners and SimCorp organization with deal construction when needed (know what the contract says and how to put together an attractive proposition) Work with SimCorp organization to systematize or automate reporting and billing processes Report on commercial outcomes of partnership program Your qualifications 10+ years of experience from regulated industry, e.g. enterprise FinTech Minimum 5 years of successful track record from a commercial role such as partnership, essential account, customer success, business development, product manager or similar Previous exposure to institutional investment management Previous exposure to FinTech startups/scaleups Senior project leader and stakeholder orchestrator Excellent deal and commercial structuring skills Fluency in English both written and verbal Motivated, with and execution skills Maneuver a global matrix organization and form trusting relationships at all levels About us SimCorp is a provider of investment management solutions to the world's largest asset managers, fund managers, asset servicers, pension and insurance funds, wealth managers, banks and sovereign wealth funds. Here you will work with experienced and supportive colleagues. We are more than 1900 employees from 50+ nationalities dedicated to supporting our 200+ clients across the globe. We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, together we're building a culture where difference is valued. You will be part of a success story and a company that continues to grow, offering a lot of interesting opportunities. Visit our career pages to learn why other people choose to work at SimCorp: www.simcorp.com/career Are you interested ? Please send your CV & Cover Letter no later than 17 October 2021 . For further information about the role, please get in contact with Sharmini Deb, Senior Global Talent Acquisition Partner We look forward to your application.
