description: We see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset. It acts like a compass for us. We are fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that’s not just words on the walls.  Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It’s an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.  We make software robots, so people don’t have to be robots. Would you like to be part of this journey?  UiPath is searching for dynamic Account Management Leaders to execute its sales & account strategy in Singapore  As an Account Leader, you will drive deals and account growth for our FSI Sectors. The Account Leader is UiPath’s primary leader and sponsor for the customer, responsible for overall account growth and customer satisfaction by managing key relationships and ensuring the customer achieves value.  We have a high growth culture which means you’ll have a lot of autonomy and flexibility to help build the company. By helping our clients maximize value from our product, you will not only be helping to improve, but also to transform how our clients perform in digitized era. You will play an integral role in ensuring product engagement and building strong working relationships through exceptional client service to help grow UiPath business.  As an Account Leader, you will represent the voice of our existing clients and liaise with internal cross functional teams to shape the future of UiPath’s product development strategy.  This Is What You'll Do At UiPath Identify new opportunities within large clients; engage meaningfully with C level and Executive decision makers at the enterprise levels. Develop and maintain multi-year strategic account plan for Key Accounts to meet or exceed customer objectives and share of wallet. Forecast and manage sales pipeline to meet revenue targets and company goals. Operate as the lead point of contact for all matters specific to the key accounts. Collaborate with internal teams to improve customer satisfaction, remove and report blockers, and create a seamless customer experience. Lead a culture of sales excellence; drive consistent implementation and adoption of sales processes, pipeline management, measurement, or success KPI’s and sales performance. Develop network of strong relationships with key industry influencers, customers and partners thereby enhancing UiPath’s industry mindshare; maintain a high-level understanding of the industry and trends affecting or influencing the marketplace Conduct regular business reviews with the team to ensure alignment to the plan and coach the team to elevate strategic account plans. Create a monthly & quarterly business review cadence with Key Account Sponsors to track progress on stated objectives, successfully establish the Key Account as a positive Reference Account. Drive industry leading initiatives that influence the position of UiPath in the industry, solidifying our position as a market leader. This Is What You'll Bring To Our Team Degree / MBA, 20+ years of Sales and Account Management experience with high-growth tech start-ups or large software vendor or Consulting Firms The ideal candidate is expected to have 20+ years of software or software solution sales experience 10+ years selling and account relationship management experience with FSI sectors. In-depth technical understanding of the Automation/Digital transformation market. Successful track record of consultative strategic sales with C-level prospects, strong background in large account planning and expansion. Proven track record of exceptional performance measured against revenue, customer satisfaction, and organizational health metrics in recent years. Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills, ability to scale across all levels of an organization. Ability to handle confidential/sensitive information and exercise exceptional judgement. Highly dependable, self-starter, high energy, positive attitude and the ability to establish trust and credibility with prospects and customers. Ability to lead, collaborate and influence geographically dispersed team. Life at UiPath can sometimes feel like a roller coaster. It comes with changes, healthy challenges, and the opportunity to build solutions from the ground up, have great impact, and learn a great deal.  At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.  UiPath is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the process, please contact us @ TALeaders@uipath.com and let us know how we may assist you.  This notice together with our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use of this website and any other documents we mention here are meant to inform you on what personal data about you we collect, use, disclose, share or otherwise process when you are applying for a job at UiPath or when UiPath contacts you for recruitment purposes. Please read this policy carefully to understand our views and practices on how we protect your personal data.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: LivePerson is a transformational force in how brands and consumers communicate. With over 18,000 brands, including HSBC, Disney, Verizon, and Home Depot, we are on a mission to make life easier for people and brands everywhere through trusted Conversational AI. We believe in a future where conversations are the norm for getting your intentions fulfilled - whatever they are.  We are an innovative, intent-driven company that believes in building the future and we are looking for growth minded, unconventional thinkers, developers and builders to join the team.  You Will Thrive Here If  You can operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment  You can build partnerships that move our business forward  You build code that is simple, understandable, and clean  You see feedback or failure as motivation to learn and to grow  You believe data-driven decision making is the norm  You relate to our core principles (link) and want to work with Conversational AI experts  You’re a hands-on leader, mentor and motivator of your team, supporting them on sales deals, and with our customers. This is not a desk manager position – we want you to be out there with your team, with our customers rolling your sleeves up when needed. The ideal profile for this role will be someone with a proven track record in building, recruiting, developing and growing high performing diverse enterprise field sales teams within software sales organisations. Knowledge of the AI, Machine learning, SaaS, Voice and Messaging market would be advantageous. You lead by example and are all about operational excellence. You have an excellent work ethic, yet you also understand the importance of work/life balance. You’re open, collaborative, passionate about what you, and are customer focused.  What You’ll Be Doing Managing a Sales (New Logo) Team tasked with selling into target accounts in South East Asia, Hong Kong & Taiwan to achieve or exceed assigned quota Establishing short and long term financial targets and quotas that are in line with overall corporate objectives Knowledgeable of LivePerson’s entire product suite so that you and your team can bring a vision for conversational commerce to large brands, from use cases through ROI Spending a significant amount of time, in the field, directly interacting with clients and coaching a Sales Team focused on new logo acquisition Coordinating account resources with representatives from marketing, pre-sales engineering, customer success, deployment as well as other subject matter experts Familiarity and comfort with regularly managing forecast/pipeline Directly responsible for ensuring that our sales process is followed consistently to ensure predictable results across all individual contributors Continually monitoring and adjusting to competitive activities within SEA, HK & Taiwan and maintaining an active pulse on the general business climate Who You Are You’re a recruiter! We are company builders and in this role, you’ll be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring on board to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world. A true team player – You’re a supportive leader, and nurturer of talent. You understand the importance of fostering a collaborative team environment in order to deliver the best results. Energy and Creativity – Energy and enthusiasm are your trademarks. You think out-of-the-box and impress people with your interesting angles and quality work. You’re not afraid to challenge in order to improve efficiency and success Experienced – You have a proven track record in managing, building, and developing teams of experienced enterprise sales professionals, within a matrixed, software sales organisation. You know what good looks like. You have a track record in consistently exceeding your quotas and still have that ‘hunter’ mentality. You have a strong background in selling solutions across large enterprise customers. Excellent Communicator – You know what to say and, more importantly, how to say it. Your inter-personal skills also make you an excellent networker, and you’re able to use this to your advantage to bring the right people together to get things done. Passion and Conviction - You can inspire passion in others. You’re a true motivator Customer Focused - You deliver customer service like you expect to receive it; with excellence. Why You’ll Love Working Here  LivePerson was named to FastCompany’s World’s most innovative companies of 2020 list for the Artificial Intelligence category. We offer top tier tech & data science colleagues, along with opportunities to push your own limits. We embrace invention and experimentation. Most importantly, you’ll have an ability to make an impact at work and at brands across the globe as we build the future with trusted Conversational AI together.  At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to do their best work and be their authentic selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Responsibilities Reporting to the APAC Head of Insights in the Business Marketing team in TikTok, you will be focused on providing valuable insights to our industry partners across APAC. You will be responsible for driving insights which will help industry partners build their brands and extend their reach on TikTok.  - Identify business goals and challenges to define research objectives and project scope, be the subject matter expert for marketing insights and intelligence to the sales and marketing teams - Lead research projects using different solutions and methodologies that can help scale quality insights across multiple categories (e.g. beauty and personal care, electronics, ecommerce, etc), geographies (e.g. SEA, North Asia, Pacific), target audience (e.g. B2C, B2B, etc) - Connect the dots to deliver clear, actionable client-friendly narratives by leveraging on various sources of data and information, translate data and insights into relevant stories - Collaborate on thought leadership research within the community, proactively share interesting and thought provoking insights to business leaders and industry partners  Qualifications - 8+ years' experience in consumer insights, with at least 3 years' experience in a regional role - Robust quantitative analytical skills to complement strong business acumen and data storytelling - Strong collaborator across cross-functional teams with a track record of delivering projects - Experience in client side (brand) and/or agency side experience (e.g. Research, insights, media agencies, consulting firms etc) will be an advantage
industries: Internet

description: The Business Director role will be responsible for the growth and development of 3-4 key accounts and driving key new business opportunities with the Growth Director and Account Directors. Developing strong relationships with existing C-Level contacts within each account, as well as identifying, targeting and onboarding net new contacts from other areas of their business Strong marketing leadership: knowledge of their business and competitors, technology, b2b industry trends etc to add strategic, proactive value Identifying new opportunities/growth areas for Client & MOI through account collaboration, consolidation & growth Understanding of MOI’s 4 centres of excellence and services [digital, experiential, creative and ABM] to upsell / cross-sell across the account-base Strong, collaborative and effective internal relationships, working closely with Account Directors/Project Director as well as creative resources – championing great work with the ability to sell in ideas strategically & deliver on time/within budget Working closely with Growth Director and Account Directors to drive key new business opportunities including overseeing proposals, strategies and budgeting for conversion Working closely with the Growth team to develop key sales and marketing initiatives to target your key accounts, with responsibility for producing hyper-relevant marketing content for these clients i.e. quarterly newsletters Working alongside Planning & Strategy, including Creative Strategy to understand our clients’ business problem to collectively come up with Turning Head solutions that yield results Review and build on learnings from activity/results to date & have clear/measurable objectives Commitment to ensure MOI’s Turning Heads Process is followed on every programme Supporting Client Services Director with the development of account targets and goals for FY22 Responsibility for achieving (& exceeding) monthly/annual financial targets, forecasting and tracking, supporting AD and team with accurate project scoping/reconciliations and involvement in fee negotiations Working with AD and teams to support accurate monthly reporting on billing, revenue recognition, team utilisation and account profitability Leadership, account resourcing/team structure, support & mentorship of account team (at all levels) Continue to elevate your position within the market through thought leadership, content, attending and speaking at events etc About Moi  When today’s always-on world means your buyers can research, reject, or shortlist your brand without even talking to you, we’ll get you into the conversation. MOI Global is a B2B creative agency connecting you with a new breed of buyer. Re-engineering your marketing eco-system to target the places they hang out and the people they listen to.  With offices in London, New York and Singapore, we help our clients deliver head turning campaigns that target international and local markets. Our services cover all aspects of a buyer's omni-channel world, including digital, social media, events, direct mail and telemarketing. Clients include Oracle, Google Cloud, Facebook, Fuji Xerox, Grab and Red Hat.  For more information, please visit www.moi-global.com
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Online Media

jobTitle: Regional Head of Customer Service - Region South Asia
description: Customer Service is one of the largest customer touch points within the company and the customer wants us to engage with them in their own and personal way – a need that we want and need to meet! As the Regional Head of Customer Service, in a culture of creativity, collaboration and growth, and together with the Regional Management Team, you are responsible for developing and driving a localized CS offer that is relevant and competitive in the region. Guided by data, insights, goals and KPIs, you will implement global strategies, while adding the regional perspectives, and you will be one of the key stakeholders in developing our customer service.  Teamwork is key! Using your proven leadership and communication skill, you initiate and contribute to strategically wise cross functional omni collaborations and partnerships. Working alongside other functions in the region, as well as establishing a clear structure for how to partner with the Central CS Function, to truly build a seamless customer service experience.  Key Responsibilities Build a locally relevant CS offer together with the region, based on our customer needs, market competition and overall customer experience vision. Create and establish CS goals together with the region. Securing an understanding of the goals and KPI’s and how to drive them together. Collaborate regionally and globally with relevant functions to constantly adapt and challenge the plan based on changing customer behaviors and patterns. Focus on vision for the region and sales markets, delivering both long and short-term activities and results. You are responsible for the digital CS and with an omni mindset you drive and contribute to collaborations, partnerships and new ways of working together with other functions to deliver an omni CS experience. Qualifications You have strong commercial focus and an insights driven approach to business growth, where you take responsibility and accountability with a proven ability to work towards goals and delivering results. You are an experienced manager, senior leader and have a proven track record of driving processes cross functionally and create business results. You bring your CS colleagues onboard on the region’s vision through an inspiring, clear and including communication, and can provide a 360 view of the customer journey to all stakeholders.
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: About Us:  Epicor Software is a global technology leader dedicated to helping businesses drive growth for more than 45 years. Our modern, industry-specific software helps customers boost efficiency and productivity by simplifying and automating everyday processes. We have a stellar team of nearly 4,000 worldwide employees who are passionate about building exceptional products and solutions through teamwork, constant innovation, and integrity. We strive to hire and reward star players who inspire one another and drive results for the business and our customers.  About the Role:  As a Channel Director with Epicor you be responsible for increasing revenue by developing a world class software sales channel in Asia. This key position will report directly to our Regional Vice President, Asia.  What You’ll Do: Liaise with other departments to source potential new VARs and Distributors Profile and select such partners to ensure the selection criteria is met and maintained Successfully conclude the signing of partners Work closely with Channel Enablement and resources such as ‘Epicor University’ to drive certification Negotiate margin, training and contracts with partners, and to develop joint annual business plan together with the review of quarterly business plans Manage the ongoing relationship with partners to ensure revenue targets are met Be able to position Epicor solutions to potential partners Conduct presentations at Board level Assist in the conclusion of end user sales with partners Review of partner sales forecast with country sales managers for each territory of Asia region Meet annual channel revenue quota as defined in the annual sales commission plan Manage the partners’ leads and opportunity process with partner operation person Work closely with a team of Channel inclusive of sales, marketing, enablement and operations Regional traveling is expected in Asia Working closely with Asia regional VP to formulate the channel program and ecosystem by leveraging the international partner framework and local perspectives What you need to succeed: 10+ years’ experience of growing a channel sales network within Enterprise Software, ideally with ERP vendors such as SAP, Oracle, Microsoft, Infor, Sage, QAD or IFS. Less no. of years in experience will be considered as channel manager for SE Asia region Evidence of over achievement within channel sales Evidence of entrepreneurial ability Strong verbal communication, presentation and project management skills Experience in manufacturing industry would be an advantage Experience with the overall partner management and life cycle is much preferred Why should you apply:  Epicor software recognized as a visionary in the latest magic quadrant. It has a strong focus on cloud and a good vision for, and understanding of, the direction of the cloud technology. This focus comes through recent acquisitions of small business software. We have large and loyal customer base and an active user’s group- both of which contribute to the success.  In this role at Epicor it will provide the right candidate with the opportunity to drive revenue growth and have a direct impact on the overall business growth within the region. As a key member of the team you will play a major role in our success. Additionally, your growth potential at Epicor is limitless. After spending time in the role, you’ll have the tools and support you need to move onto different opportunities and roles utilizing our structured Epicor career pathway.  jobs.epicor.com  Primary location: Novena Central Singapore Singapore
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Description  FULLY REMOTE: Blue Prism is seeking a confident and highly motivated End User Sales representative to be a part of the Sales team. You will work closely with our partners, your peers and the wider team to increase our market share in the geographical region by maintaining and generating new accounts.  Requirements Aptitude to sell at senior level, managing complex transformational deals Superb relationship building skills are a must – a range of influencers are involved in successful RPA sales – within the target accounts themselves, influencing partners and of course internal Blue Prism resources needed to support client activities Strong background in new business sales with a demonstrable track record of success Background in a consultative sales environment with an excellent understanding of complex solution sales cycles and proven experience in successful solution selling Experience of or ability to sell to the business, as well as the IT influencers Inquisitive and tenacious with the ability to find new opportunities and extend the value of accounts Credible at both executive and operational levels, with the ability to develop long-term relationships Will be used to carrying a number, have strong organizational skills and excellent relationship skills Will have a ruthless focus on results – pipeline generation, revenue and profit, with the ability to lead and inspire others in your ecosystem Excellent communicator, both written and verbally Your Responsibilities Selling both directly and engaging closely with alliance and channel partners, to develop new business Understand the makeup of potential prospects and identify the key decision-makers Selling RPA into large enterprises, BPOs and Shared Services operations, to manage complex sales campaigns from introduction to closure Work alongside the senior relationship holders in key alliance partners in joint selling campaigns Work with existing sales process and collateral and help develop the materials to suit specific and local markets Self-generate new pipeline Close new business from end user clients Work alongside alliance partners in joint selling campaigns Work with new channel partners to help them become independent Work with the technical team to provide sales feedback and help identify areas for improvement Forecast Accuracy so that Management can properly plan for growth Maintaining a very clean view into current quarter and future quarter opportunities and forecast The ability to travel roughly 50-60% of the time is a requirement Benefits  Blue Prism is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Blue Prism is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Our client, a fast-growing technology firm that provides Automation, Document Management, AI & ML technology solutions to the banking & financial services, corporates, telecom, property, manufacturing, related industry and looking to hire experienced Partnerships & Alliances Director to help grow their ASEAN business.  You will take a lead role in developing and maintaining a network of partners in the Singapore/ ASEAN region and collaborating with them to generate revenue. There is a high demand for enterprise banking solutions in the region and this position will offer an entrepreneurial professional the opportunity to scale a profitable and fast-growing business.  You Will Be Involved In Activities Such As Develop and maintain business relationships with channel & alliances partners (SI, Consulting, Local partners - ideally RPA, Automation, AI firms) Work closely with our partner management to design policies/schemes which allow partnerships to thrive in developing our business channel Identify and develop an in-depth understanding of each channel sales prospect, their buying and organisation influences, and decision-making process Strengthen existing relationships and collaborations You Will Possess 10+ years of recent experience in Partnership & Alliances Management and Enterprise Software sales Strong knowledge or domain understanding of Automation, RPA, AI, ML, Data Analytics, Document Management, or Processing solutions Excellent knowledge and demonstration of the process to engage, motivate and work with partners Charismatic and a natural networker If you have the relevant experience please get in touch on puvirasan@datasearchconsulting.com or call +65 9784 2266 for a confidential discussion.  Datasearch Consulting Pte Ltd | Licence No. 17S8525 | Reg No. R1871070
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: Job Responsibilities Be responsible for all sales and marketing activities within the organisation. Drive sales, managing sales and marketing activities in the organisation with the objective of ensuring that there are sufficient activities to close sales, managing resources to ensure that sales objectives are met. Ensure that the team is able to articulate the unique selling points and the value proposition of the product or service that they are selling. Understand and map out the customer buying process with the objective that effective sales processes are implemented within the organisation to increase sales effectiveness. Implement a continuous learning / cross learning culture within the team so that product and industry knowledge within the team is comprehensiv. Conduct sales activities (with assistance for proposal preparation) and close sales for select strategic / high importance opportunities. Determine in conjunction with the CEO on a periodic basis products that require additional marketing and promotion campaigns taking into consideration the product market potential. Plan for and orchestrate online and physical marketing campaigns for identified products. Implement systems to measure marketing effectiveness. Ensure that activities between the marketing team and the sales team are well coordinated and aligned. Ensure that marketing leads are effectively converted to sales opportunities which are in turn effectively converted to sales orders. Assist in evaluating new products which can be potentially distributed by organization, as well as evaluate the product value in conjunction with the CEO. Plan and execute go-to-market strategies for new products. Work with and advise the officers in the company and associates responsibly for regulatory compliance Liaison with the shareholders and partners Job Requirements Preferably a degree in Engineering or a Medical related degree or Business degree Must have an interest in medical technology (especially rehabilitative equipment) and a passion for how such technology can improve health (as well as professional sports) outcomes. Must have had a track record of success as a sales person, preferably to clinical organisations. Must have led and managed a team of sales persons, and have had success coaching and improving the capabilities of the team. Must be energetic, hands-on and effective in communications Have worked closely with marketing professionals, and have had experience on how marketing activities are to be coordinated with sales efforts. Preferably plugged into an existing network of clinicians or hospital administrators within the public and private health sector. Preferably familiar and conversant how technologies in applied into therapies , patient cares and also diagnostics . Preferably familiar with all the regulatory requirements and import requirements for medical products in Southeast Asia Only shortlisted candidate will be notified.  To apply, please visit to www.gmprecruit.com and search for Job Reference: 19000  To find out more about this opportunity, please contact Jaremy Ong at Jaremy.Ong@gmprecruit.com.  GMP Recruitment Services (S) Pte Ltd | EA Licence: 09C3051 | EA Personnel: Jaremy Ong | Registration No: R1876766
industries: Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: As part of SBF GlobalConnect initiative to help companies venture overseas, in particular to Southeast Asia (SEA); Frontier and Emerging Markets; as well as Belt and Road Initiative (BRI), we are hiring dynamic individuals to cover SEA markets.  Reporting to the Director and working with other team members, the candidate should be resourceful, results-driven, self-starter, an individual contributor as well as a team player, who would carry out the following job duties in his/her assigned markets. These positions are based in Singapore and candidate will need to travel regularly to the assigned markets.  Job Responsibilities The main contact person from SBF to cover the assigned SEA market/s portfolio and oversee end-to-end process of identifying companies, account development, business development, project facilitation, deal origination, and stakeholders management (foreign governments, trade offices, Singapore government); Cultivate strategic relationships and build trust with key company executives Engage Singapore companies and develop deep understanding of company’s needs and operations for internationalisation projects, with the objective of helping the company to secure overseas sales and/or investments (“Market-push”). Identify, negotiate, and structure overseas project opportunities (through “Market-pull” opportunities and platform projects) to secure “win-win” outcomes for Singapore companies. Build sound understanding of regional markets/ global industry and business trends, and its implications to the Singapore companies. Provide Market Research and Intelligence inputs on assigned market/region to SBF and highlight the implications (Opportunities/Challenges) to Singapore companies. Job Requirements A strong interest and passion in facilitating Singapore companies to internationalise. Able to work with a wide spectrum of Singapore companies (large and SMEs) At least 7 to 10 years for Country Head, preferably in a business industry, and/or in sales, business development, managing key accounts and driving successful projects and internationalisation outcomes. Actual Working, Residence and / or Business / Travel experiences in your assigned market will be a useful advantage. A strong understanding of local and international business environment, as well as economic and political trends that impact doing business in your assigned market Enthusiasm and able to travel to your assigned market Familiarity with the business landscape of SEA countries, particularly Cambodia, Laos and Myanmar. Ability to analyse in-depth different complex issues and put forth actionable solutions Keen sense of business acumen and experience in project management Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and spoken; including ability and experience in engaging stakeholders Fluency in your assigned market’s language will be a bonus but not critical Ability to handle cross cultural challenges Self-motivated and positive attitude, excellent work ethic and a team player Interested applicants are invited to submit your application with a detailed resume, stating your notice period, current and expected salary.  Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Coordinate efforts with business partners across the region and global to deliver customer excellence, coordinate selling activities, reduce redundancy, to achieve customer goals and drive growth. Leverage technology to optimize efficiency, planning and coordination of efforts. Establish and execute a comprehensive business plan for the business unit which aligns to company, franchise, brand and portfolio strategy with current market conditions, to drive business results. Identify and coordinate resources, monitor operating expenses, and maintain key relationships essential to achieving growth and profitability targets, regardless of market conditions. description: Board of Innovation is an independently owned business design and innovation strategy firm. We have a hybrid work policy that allows us to attract the best talent. Our hubs are located in Antwerp, Amsterdam, New York, and Singapore but our talent is globally distributed. This diversity allows our business designers to uniquely help the world's largest organizations navigate fundamental shifts. And we do this by developing growth strategies, innovation capabilities, and new businesses with many of the world's largest organizations (have a look at our cases here).  Over the past 10 years, Board of Innovation has worked with large corporates and Fortune 500s, both B2B and B2C (like Roche, Novartis, Johnson & Johnson, AB Inbev, Adidas, Philips, Danone, ING, Unicef, Toyota, Almarai and many more) to navigate transformational shifts.  Our team in APAC is looking to bring a commercial director on board to support the further growth in the region.  About The Team & Culture  Board of Innovation was founded in 2009 in Antwerp (Belgium). While we mainly work remotely these days we are a closely-knit team and we're looking for someone who thrives in our culture. If the following statements resonate with you please keep on reading! Be entrepreneurial - We take ownership and get things done. Raise the bar - We aim to set the standard by working smarter, not harder. Help each other - We genuinely help others to shine and be amazing. No ego. Make it matter - We focus on what will have the biggest impact. No theatre.  In the role of commercial director, you will be working closely together with our Managing Director in APAC (William) and our Principal Consultant (Carolina) as well as some of our Senior Innovation Consultants like Darren.  As a Commercial Director, you will: Own the relationship with (3-5) of our most promising clients. (Typically Fortune 500) Create and manage a predictable account growth pipeline, through active (online or offline) networking. Build ambitious account strategies with the principal consultants and Managing Director Collaborate daily with Principal Consultants to understand the client needs and ensure strong client relationship management Grow our ongoing projects into large long term partnerships (typical deal size +100K - 1M SGD) Be responsible for account growth targets Ensure a consistent inflow of large opportunities at key clients (i.e. RFPs) and ensure conversion that leads into continued growth with our key clients. Create & present compelling proposals with team members. Drive the creation of account growth materials/tools to drive & scale APAC  Requirements  We would need you to have: A proven track record of achieving (+1 M SGD) account sales in strategy / innovation consulting / professional services in APAC (no product sales!) Experience in managing and growing key accounts Native English - other languages are a bonus! A strong interest in growth strategies and business design for Fortune 500 companies A deep understanding of the concerns a business executive may have, and you can navigate easily through corporate structures Prior experience in innovation consulting You have what it takes to thrive in our team: an authentic, humble personality, a no-nonsense approach, a relentless drive to learn, an open mindset, an entrepreneurial attitude, a true team spirit (no ego!) and you share our ‘make it matter’ mentality  It would be nice if you have: Innovation Consultancy experience(!) Healthcare and/or CPG consulting experience  Benefits You enjoy being part of a global innovation consultancy working for some of the biggest brands in the world (like J&J, AB Inbev, United Health Group, Nestlé, General Mills, Philips, Danone, Unicef, Toyota and many more). You look for a place where you can be your whole self, and become part of a highly talented, ambitious, international, and diverse team (+30 different nationalities and counting!) You are eager to build a global professional network through our offices and clients worldwide (New York, Singapore, Antwerp, Amsterdam) You will get a very interesting remuneration package with a nice bonus on top if you achieve your targets Every year, we gather our colleagues from around the world for a week of team bonding, workshops, strategy sessions, and unwinding - we call it ‘Summer Office’.  Where You'll Be We are a distributed workforce with Hubs in Belgium (Antwerp), the United States (New York) and Singapore. Where in the world? For this role, it can be anywhere from where it’s comfortable to work within Singapore Standard Time. Contract or payroll? We’re open to discuss both options. In countries where we don’t have a legal entity we can provide compliant payroll and contracts through our global EOR partner.  Board of Innovation recognizes the positive value of diversity, promotes equality and challenges discrimination. We welcome and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. Interested? Read more about our culture, mission and values!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Management Consulting

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Director, Product Development Provides designs specifications for and develops new products and services or their components. Defines functional and technical requirements. Researches new technologies and competitive products to develop additional product ideas and enhancements. Performs launch-related activities associated with new or highly customized product implementations, including marketing/communication and collateral. Defines business and technical requirements and manages the relationships of technical resources and the Global Technology Organization to maintain and build out platforms  Major Accountabilities Identify business-building opportunities in products and services that will result in increased revenues Develop new products and product enhancements to anticipate and/or respond to customers’ needs, market trends and competitive threats Generate ideas to enhance MasterCard’s suite of product offerings and create competitive advantage based on feedback from Product Management and customer account teams Utilize market research and conduct opportunity assessments to validate new ideas and concepts Develop and present business cases supporting new product concepts or product enhancements Comply with the New Product Development/Go-To-Market (NPD/GTM) Process from concept through launch Develop product designs and specifications with input from client facing teams, internal development teams and other stakeholders Interface with technical developers to translate product requirements into technical specifications ensuring mutual understanding and minimizing time to market Participate in the planning, development and design of product marketing strategy and in the execution of advertising, promotional, and sales programs Educate Product Management, Product Sales and Account Management teams on features, benefits and technical aspects of product offerings  Education Bachelor's degree in business or equivalent experience. Advanced degree desirable. Knowledge / Experience: 8 years related business experience in product conceptualization, design and development, preferably in financial services or the bankcard industry Solid knowledge of the payments business coupled with the ability to translate customers’ needs into revenue generating product designs Product development operations experience desirable Significant experience building sound business cases, designing payments products relevant to the market, and delivering results within budget Experience in developing products for international markets 3-5 years of management experience desirable  Skills/ Abilities Expertise in applying product development concepts and practices across the product development life cycle Ability to develop, define and execute a business strategy to solve an existing business problem and/or open a new business opportunity Business acumen with the ability to create solutions that produce positive results for the customer and MasterCard Excellent verbal and written communication skills plus the ability to deliver compelling presentations Outstanding negotiation and project management skills Ability to work collaboratively as a team player in a highly matrixed environment across functions and regions Ability to interact effectively at all levels and influence internal and external business partners Proven ability to manage budgets and produce significant financial results  domestic/international travel required  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: The Role Plan, identify and implement business development opportunities and strategies. Build partnerships and relationships that drive acquisition of customers across multiple product offerings. Take on and grow existing portfolio of partners and onboard new ones. Lead business relationship between the company and potential partners (e.g. Financial services institutions, Fintech and corporates, etc). Responsible for growing volumes and revenues through effective pitch, marketing, research and product definitions. Monitor competition activities and recommend appropriate action. Build and grow a strong network of partners and affiliates. Take ownership of getting the Company fundraising as needed, based on the growth of the business Actively source, outreach, contact and build relationships with potential leads and future investors (funds, financial institutions, pensions, multi-nationals, ultra-high net worth individuals, family offices and more) Producing and updating collaterals including decks, pitchbooks, investor updates and reports. Manage the relationships with our fund investors, including through organizing events, scheduling meetings, managing and updating our investors Drive projects related to lead generation, sales pipeline organizing fundraising roadshows Ideal Profile  You are highly passionate about the crypto industry and will drive the engagement of new potential partners, manage an existing portfolio and handle the end-to-end partner management. Working in a dynamic business environment, you will be responsible for identifying and collaborating with the potential partners to drive acquisition and to create an ecosystem. Bachelor's degree/professional degree in related field Minimum 7 to 10 years of business development experience in fintech payments, ecommerce ecosystems, partner management experience and other related industries. Extensive experience in deal making, partnerships, managing relationships and creating new opportunities. Ability to work with multiple internal and external stake holders globally including at the most senior levels. Prior fundraising experience in investment banking, private banking, private equity, or venture capital Proven track record of exceptional ownership, ability to deal with ambiguity and meeting & exceeding targets. Proven B2B track record in acquiring new clients and possess wide business network of financial services and corporate clients. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Superior communication and presentation skills – able to develop and tell a compelling, data-based story that influences others. Proficient in developing professional and aesthetic presentations. Self-driven, highly organised and ability to work in an agile environment. Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, and the ability to speak in Mandarin is a plus to communicate with internal stakeholders. What's on Offer? Regional Role A role that offers a breadth of learning opportunities Fantastic work culture Opportunity to make a positive impact About Us  We are BitDATA Exchange, also known as BitEx.  Proudly founded in Singapore, BitDATA Exchange (BitEx) is built to provide an institutional-grade experience for our clients to trade crypto assets, including Bitcoin, Ethereum & Litecoin. BitEx’s purpose is to be a portal that brings together the world of crypto assets and finance for investors, traders, and crypto-enthusiasts. The BitEx trading platform is backed by cutting-edge technology to facilitate efficient high trading volume. We pay special attention to our clients by providing a user-centric portal with state-of-the-art security and a streamlined user experience.  Led by Ken, the founder and CEO, BitEx has a talented pioneer management team formed by a group of professionals with diverse career backgrounds, including investment banking, private banking, automated trading systems, cybersecurity, and marketing from leading MNCs.  We are granted an exemption from holding a license under the Payment Services Act ("PS Act") for providing digital payment token service by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS).  Ref: MG0BSLS4QB  Apply to this role by submitting your CV and completing your profile at https://bitex.snaphunt.com/job/MG0BSLS4QB

description: Roles And Responsibilities Create strong relationships with key client stakeholders at both senior and mid-management levels. Work closely with colleagues on cross-territory opportunities and other internal teams on marketing materials and cause studies. Understand the competitive landscape and market trends. Understand and effectively communicate the company's value prop, tech, process, and current partnerships. Determine annual unit and gross-profit plans by implementing marketing strategies; analyzing trends and results. Establish sales objectives by forecasting and developing annual sales quotas for regions and territories; projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new products. Maintain sales volume, product mix, and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators, and competitors. Establish and adjust selling prices by monitoring costs, competition, and supply and demand. Completes national sales operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees; following up on work results. Maintain sales staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees as well as counseling and disciplining employees; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results. Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Competent with Microsoft Office Suite, Salesforce.com and ComScore. Desire to own projects and exceed expectations, with the ability to find solutions and deliver results within a rapidly changing, entrepreneurial, technology-driven culture. Ability to identify and solve client issues strategically. Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with management and cross-functional teams, for both technical and non-technical audiences; work with the Sales, Account Management and Operations, teams to implement targeted sales strategy. Generate and maintain accurate Account and Opportunity plans. Work with internal teams on behalf of clients to ensure the highest level of customer service. Interface with technical support internally to resolve issues that directly impact partners. Manage and implement the sales forecasting, planning, and buyer-driven sales and marketing processes, establishing high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency for the sales and marketing organization. Work collaboratively with the sales and marketing teams and fosters a culture of continuous process improvement. Drive the successful implementation and adoption of the sales and marketing automation platforms, reporting, and analytics. Ensure reports and other internal intelligence and insight are provided to the sales and marketing organization. Analyze pipeline and lead data, deliver periodic reporting to the sales and marketing teams providing key business insights: typical reporting relates to Demand Generation, Pipeline Forecast and Trends, Conversion Rates, Target Account, Market Segmentation, Win/Loss, Age. Report on key KPIs related to the lead and the opportunity waterfall in order to implement a consistent closed-loop between marketing and sales. Through reporting and analytics, validate the quality of the lead and pipeline data and provide guidance to improve the overall data quality. Database management. Define contact and account quality standards in the database, defining processes and data acquisition strategies. Monitor the quality of marketing and sales information and define data improvement programs. Requirements Ability to understand the impact of operational initiatives from a sales or marketing person's perspective. Ability to prepare reports and use the appropriate mode of communication. Must be proficient at analyzing data, building reporting, and making strategic recommendations based on data and trends. Ability to manage multiple projects and work to tight deadlines. Proven success working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. Keen business sense, with the ability to find creative business-oriented solutions to problems.

description: POSITION: Digital/E-Commerce Leader  Territory: China/APAC Department: Marketing Reporting Line: Global Commercial Execution Leader  We are creating a new entrepreneurial model to shape the future of our Business, and we are looking for an Entrepreneur for the role of Digital/E-commerce Leader for China/APAC. The role will be leading the creation and development of new digital business models for Stoli Group, where we will be focusing on execution of compelling & differentiated Brand strategies, engaging with consumer groups, particularly about recruitment of new/younger consumers. We are aiming to take the biggest portion of the total growing digital market by creating, developing and implementing new ways of selling our products, our experiences and connecting with consumers putting technology and innovation at the core of the value creation equation. Top priority being.  It is a new position and you will work with internal agile teams from different areas that will adjust and rotate depending of the needs of the businesses you are developing. You will report to the team that seats in the intersection of Marketing, Sales and Customer Marketing, and you will be a key member of the Stoli Group Digital Leadership team in charge of shaping the future of our business through technology and innovation.  You are an entrepreneur at heart, hungry for growth and disruption bringing your passion and drive to act like an owner of all the amazing ventures you will develop while at STOLI. You will drive incremental growth for STOLI from a massive range of opportunities in the market as Digital and e-commerce keep growing.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES   You will create new digital revenue stream. You will lead A&P intensive projects which have big & accelerated growth bets behind. You will create, develop, launch and grow new digital business models that help solve different pain points across the company while driving growth and strategic benefits for the company. You are responsible of the whole process from the pitch down to the execution, measurement and beating expected results. You will seek for constant innovation and disruption by leading different and several workstreams of new digital business opportunities, bringing the entrepreneurial spirit to the way we embark in innovation and new business development. You are expected to use a wide range of innovation and problem solving tools and resources that will shake and inspire the rest of the organization. You will work with several cross-functional areas, feeling comfortable having remote and agile teams of people across the organization working for different projects, while also developing entrepreneurial capabilities in them that will bring a new environment, better ways of working and new methodologies to the whole company. As every entrepreneur does, you will commit and deliver results from your new digital ventures. You will be responsible for reaching growth targets and objectives, being resourceful and ruthless to win, grow and scale day by day. You will design agile ways for measurement and evaluation that will allow you to pivot when needed to keep the positive growth trend. You will be the general manager for every project you take to market, holding responsible for all different aspects within your ventures. You are responsible for sharing and inspiring key stakeholders that could be benefited from your new business models. Be clients, brand teams, channel leaders or consumer planning, the rest of the company is expecting you to bring insight, ideas and guidance on how to navigate current and future opportunities from different angles based on the rapid learning and experimentation you run in your projects.  CAPABILITIES:  You have a strong track record creating and growing digital businesses, delivering results and navigating the entrepreneurial environment. You come from a startup, have your own business or have experience working in an entrepreneurial-like context. Either you failed in the past or successfully grew a business yourself, what we value is your obsession with growth and your passion about creating businesses from scratch.  QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:   8+ years of business development experience, with at least 2 years in a startup or entrepreneurial-like environment, with a proven record of driving value and scaling businesses in the digital world CPG exposure is mandatory; wine & spirits industry is preferred Strong interest in the digital / technology arena. From digital marketing to logistics and data tools, you feel comfortable running a digital business yourself Experience driving innovation and disruption at a fast paced environment  Fluent in English and Mandarin     Preferred Qualifications/Experience:  Master Degree / MBA / Innovation or Entrepreneurial Graduate Programs Experience opening / starting the digital business in CPG or similar companies Experience working at or with startups  Disclaimer: Stoli Group is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity. By embedding diversity into all aspects of our culture, we maximize the opportunity to achieve sustainable business success. The duties and responsibilities described in the role profile might not be a comprehensive list.
jobFunction: Business Development, Project Management, and Sales

description: About Xfers  Xfers as a part of Fazz Financial Group portfolio — a holding company of over 10 FinTech startups dedicated to enabling financial access for everyone — is on a mission to provide financial access to millions of underserved communities in Southeast Asia through building a financial ecosystem that anyone can participate in safely. Our range of last-mile financial rails power businesses across Southeast Asia - from startups to family businesses. By removing the pain of setting up and managing digital payments, more business owners can focus on growing their business, in turn encouraging fairer and healthier competition, and fostering stronger, more vibrant economies. For more information, visit: www.xfers.com  But there is much more to do. We know how important our mission is to the improving the livelihoods of millions of people in Southeast Asia, and that's why we're looking for passionate and driven people to join us to accelerate financial access for everyone.  Your Role  As Director of Business Development at Xfers, you will play an instrumental role in fuelling Xfers' growth in Southeast Asia. You will be part of the Regional Payments team and reporting to the Head of Regional Payments - as part of the core team to deliver sales goals for Xfers as a Payments Infrastructure for Southeast Asia.  Our team is looking for a highly self-motivated team leader to build up the sales team and work alongside other functions to achieve our sales goals and increase market share.  What you would drive Ownership of the revenue and market share goals for as a domestic payment gateway (PG) for Singapore market as well as regional PG for Southeast Asia. Together with aligning with the BU lead, to own (develop and execute) a strategic plan to gain market share for target customer base and achieve sales targets To setup and own the Sales Enablement needed for the Business Development team to excel To manage day-to-day sales operations from lead generation, qualifying to closing, with a focus on performance against key sales metrics Coach and guide the business development team in developing consultative and solution-based sales skills through all facets of the sales cycle. Play a personal and direct role in building and maintaining enduring relationships with key customer accounts and channel partner Inspire, motivate and enable personal and career development of team members, both to promote career growth and to increase impact for Xfers Participate in industry events to help support positive market awareness of Xfers as a regional Payment Gateway We are looking for you 7+ years of sales execution experience and 5+ years of sales leadership experience Must be able to converse and build relationships with eCommerce players, banks, lenders, FinTech’s, and clients who live and breathe payments every day Experience leading sales and operations in a high-growth technology environment covering the SMEs and enterprise customer segment. Ability to hire, train and coach a high-performance sales team. Must be able to converse and build relationships with eCommerce players, banks, lenders, FinTech’s, and clients who live and breathe payments every day Ability to understand and articulate technical concepts, and translate them into industry- or business-relevant terms. You are outspoken and have the ability to communicate/escalate concerns and facilitate the right stakeholders in a discussion before they become issues. You are comfortable working in a tech environment with the ability to coordinate across several functions (Product, Engineering, Operations, Compliance, Marketing, Design, Business Development) You have good written and verbal communication skills. Nice to have 3+ years understanding of the Payments and FinTech industry Experience in understanding API documentation and integration We love reviewing all the applications we receive, but unfortunately, we may not be able to get back to everyone individually. If we’d like to move forward with your application, we’ll definitely be in touch!  Xfers is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Xfers will be considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.  By submitting your application, you agree that Xfers may collect your personal data for recruiting, regional organization planning, and related purposes.

description: As an Alliance Director, you will be responsible for developing the alliance strategy, launch, business and marketing plans, joint offering, and enabling other regional alliance peers. You will be responsible for developing and implementing Cloud Kinetics (CK) channel and marketing strategies by working closely with focus vendors and partners – including marketing programs, demand/lead generation programs, the development of management of channel and vendors program.    We are looking for a highly motivated team player (based in Singapore) to join the Alliances and team to design, launch and support aggressive plans to strategically drive adoption and growth of Cloud business in the Asia. This is a cross functional role that will require orchestration of internal functions and workstreams to ensure success for our alliances and channels partners and overall Indirect business.  The ideal candidate will blend strategic thinking, outstanding partner relationship management skills, and an entrepreneurial mindset. In addition, an ability to effectively collaborate with multiple cross-functional stakeholders, including sales, alliances, marketing, legal, partner programs, and operations is critical. You should be an eager self-starter who is comfortable working in a rapidly growing company with a fast-paced working environment in Singapore.  Responsibilities:  ·       Facilitate effective and self-sustained joint field engagements between the partner and Cloud Kinetics’s Sales organizations to drive license growth. This role will become “embedded” within the sales force, supporting account management, regional business development, pipeline, strategic deals, QBR’s and forecast reviews.  ·       Demand generation and pipeline management: With internal and external marketing organizations, ensure the creation and execution of a joint demand generation plan, including joint business and account plans, opportunity engagements, co-marketing and thought leadership.    ·       Competency development – internal:  Manage enablement sessions, promote the alliance “brand” value, establish support for use of alliance’s Customer Centers where applicable.  ·       Competency development - external: Facilitate understanding of Cloud Kinetics’ s portfolio of solutions and impact on asset optimization, digital transformation, and value creation.  Working with Cloud Kinetics Customer Success and SIA teams:  Ensure that partners build and maintain required competency levels, leverage Cloud Kinetics service delivery methodologies and our existing sub-contractor ecosystem. ·       Proven leadership skills and experience in building relationships with stakeholders inside and outside the organization, working within challenging circumstances where change and ambition are high, to drive outcomes that benefit our clients.    ·       Actively listen to client needs, and translate this feedback back to solutions consulting, Services, global alliance teams and product management. ·       Governance: Identify and align critical functions, tasks and accountabilities required from key stakeholders to execute against alliance strategy and business plans; hold all parties accountable for performance.  Develop and track the full “balance sheet” / scorecard of partner activities.  Maintain peer-peer relationship mapping, and quarterly business reviews.  Identify and resolve issues, escalate where appropriate. Become the go-to person and “trusted advisor” for business line executives and managers.   Requirements ·       Demonstrated ability to drive significant revenue through Channel partnerships ·       Experience with creating and building differentiated relationships with partners in the channel’s community especially in Singapore Government ·       Sound business acumen skills; thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment ·       Strategic thinker with who is able to blend consulting and business strategy to develop compelling plans for new partner initiatives ·       Demonstrated ability to pick up and understand product/tech concepts ·       History of successfully developing and leading multiple strategic partnerships ·       Good knowledge of cloud native solutions and technology with proven experience of establishing growth through channels in Enterprise accounts ·       Must be comfortable with complexity, and thinking on multiple levels of abstraction; demonstrates use of critical thinking techniques ·       Excellent spoken and written communication, interpersonal, relationship building skills ·       Ability to work both independently and with a team ·       Experience as an Alliance/Channel manager influencing and building bench strength in business focused SI/Channel organizations ·       Comfortable working with multiple internal teams, from individual contributors to senior executives, as well as building/maintaining relationships with clients, partners, etc. ·       Track record of exceeding sales quota ·       Willing and able to travel Nice To Have ·       Broad-based business and technology expertise with 10+ years of consulting, management, or business leadership experience with a track record of driving business development ·       Business, or Engineering Bachelor's degree (MBA degree is preferred) ·       Experience of working with SI consulting organizations in multiple cities/verticals ·       Experience working with multiple Sales teams driving and building the partner ecosystem ·       Highly motivated and independent contributor ·       High energy, enthusiasm, and passion for the business.

Establish effective goals, sales target, and policies that will benefit the organization and increase revenue Work with respective department heads to outline procedures that will meet growth objectives Oversee the organization’s financial and budgetary activities Oversee the organization’s marketing, lead generation, and branding strategies Provide recommendations for improvement and see where the company is failing and succeeding in terms of revenue, cash flow and marketing strategy Discover or discontinue product offerings and opportunities to allow company to stay relevant in the industry Works with other Directors to ensure the company stays streamlined and efficient

jobTitle: Associate / Director, New Product & Market Access
description: Company Description  Guardant Health AMEA is a leading precision oncology company focused on helping conquer cancer through use of its proprietary blood tests, vast data sets and advanced analytics. Its Guardant Health Oncology Platform is designed to leverage its capabilities in technology, clinical development, regulatory and reimbursement to drive commercial adoption, improve patient clinical outcomes and lower healthcare costs.  Job Description  Position Summary:  In this role, you’ll be responsible for the successful growth and adoption of New Product Introductions (NPI) across AMEA’s business. You’ll help drive strategic NPI conversations across core customers and work with the product development teams to ensure optimal product-market fit.  The NPI is focused on three activities: driving uptake of NPIs across the customer base, gathering NPI needs and representing these needs to the product development team, as well as, tracking the competitive landscape.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities You will hire a small team to develop and execute new product launch plans, will oversee Market Access for new products, and create workflows for client services. You’ll meet with potential customers, sharing AMEA’s NPIs and helping to educate and build strategic relationships for their development and adoption. You will also oversee the gathering and tracking of competitive intelligence for NPIs and marketing activities. As well as being externally focused on customers and competition, you will represent NPI needs within the Senior Management Team and to the commercial team, providing the voice of customer and customer needs to shape NPI design inputs. Collaboration is a key success factor. You’ll partner extensively with the commercial team, problem solve with colleagues across functions internally and interact with senior customer stakeholders across disciplines. Qualifications  Qualifications: Tertiary degree in a scientific field of study (Pharm.D., Ph.D., M.D. or Master’s Level). (MD, PhD preferred). Clinical expertise or related experience in relevant specialties is highly desirable (Oncology experience preferred). Minimum of 10+ years of healthcare experience in the diagnostic, pharmaceutical, or biotech industry (Oncology experience preferred). Existing broad network of clinical relationships in oncology (lung, colon, GI cancers) within the country. You must have experience shaping strategic collaborations, be an excellent communicator and able to influence/shape opinions, as well as help teams reach decisions to close deals. Results oriented, self-starter with superior interpersonal communication and presentation skills, excellent sales skills including listening, negotiating, and closing. Open and flexible, eager to work in a team, enthusiastic and interested in sharing experiences and thoughts to achieve the company’s goals. You’ve developed and closed successful strategic collaborations and brought in repeat business from multiple customers. Extensive travel in country to visit client sites and business meetings, training and other company and customer events in the international region. Additional Information  Guardant Health AMEA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Please visit our career page at: https://www.guardanthealthamea.com/  If You Think You Are Drive for results Dealing with Ambiguity Customer focus Informing Peer Relationships Intellectual horsepower Functional/Technical Please apply to this position!
industries: Biotechnology, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Job ID: 121642  Required Travel : Minimal  Managerial - Yes  Location: Singapore- Singapore (Amdocs Site)  Who are we?  Every day, billions of transactions, calls and messages that hold the world’s communications fabric together run on systems that Amdocs has helped create.  Because we work with some of the largest and most innovative companies on the planet, our work makes an impact. Over the past four decades, we have continually reinvented ourselves, and as we keep moving into exciting new areas such as media, gaming, IoT, 5G, cloud services and more, there are always opportunities for us to grow and develop. We will nurture your entrepreneurial instincts with open doors and promote your ability to seize the day. Our company comprises amazing people, a supportive atmosphere and a culture built on mutual support, respect and a “feel good factor” that can only happen in a workplace built by the kind of people Amdocs employs.  Make your career journey with us.  In one sentence  Responsible for growing the business in new domains and/or existing accounts, territories, or domain levels. Partner with third parties and alliance teams to expand business opportunities.  What will your job look like? You will initiate engagement with targeted accounts and buying centers, and lead the opportunity development process. You will have to establish strong partnerships with key purchasing decision makers, executive sponsors, coaches, and influencers; and develop relationships with third parties to extend the reach of Amdocs beyond the core markets, solutions, and buying centers. You will manage the sales cycles in the different Amdocs domains, and will take the lead role in positioning and selling Amdocs Products and Services. You will be encouraged to exercise the Amdocs business solution approach: focusing on the customer’s needs and pain points rather than on what Amdocs has to offer. You will develop opportunities from the first lead until closure. You will lead resources and matrix manage the designated project team. You will be required to align appropriate sales opportunities to meet business and financial objectives and will be expected to know our customers’ business needs. All you need is... Bachelor’s Degree/ MA in business/marketing or related fields is an advantage. 10+ years of sales leadership experience: A minimum of 7 years professional sales, sales management and/or account management experience in software, technology solutions or system integration sales to the telecom industry. Strong knowledge in Telecom and Network, with knowledge in products and services. Proven experience in sales to the Communications sector - sales record in Software-As-A-Service Experience in communication/presenting at the executive level is required. Proven and established relationships with Executives (VP, C Level), or working experience for/or with enterprise companies. You should be a “hunter” with proven experience running long, complex B2B sales cycle processes for large companies and a proven track record of closing large, complex deals. Why You Will Love This Job This is a unique opportunity for you to take a leading role in positioning and selling Amdocs Products and Services and be involved in new and exciting domains. You will have the opportunity to work on large scale deals with leading industry customers, and communicate with C levels and decision makers in those companies. You will join a leading and driven sales force that always delivers and be part of a ‘can do’ company that leads the industry. You will have the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with ever growing opportunities for personal growth and one of the highest scores of employee engagement in the market. Amdocs is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications
