description: Our client, a global fintech vendor that provides software and services to the banking, buy-side and insurance sectors, is looking to hire an experienced pre-sales leader to cover the APAC region.  What You Will Be Doing The Head of Pre-sales will be part of a global and regional team of industry-focused consultants and manage and train a team of 5 to 6 Pre-sales Manager Will rely on your technical know-how and ability to take customers on a journey by delivering an impactful Banking solutions experience You will work in close partnership with cross-functional stakeholders to improve process, policy, systems, tooling, and knowledge. You will play a crucial role in the business development process and will work closely with the sales team in managing work orders and scheduling priorities. Collaborate with the sales team to understand the requirements for each customer opportunity to ensure that support is both effective and timely. Define and maintain quality standards for all intelligence data and customer-provided reports via implementation of KPIs. Build networks and relationships with customers, formalizing the relationships to improve market knowledge. Develop market insights, competitive intelligence, and product licensing demographics as key enablers for the business. What You Bring 20+ years experience with extensive business knowledge in the banking space. Strong domain knowledge in Banking Solutions Strong proven People Management experience. A true Team Leader, Highly motivated, self-starter. Passionate about the ability to deliver technology-based solutions which can drive real business value. Proven track record of establishing senior-level business relationships. Ability to identify new market opportunities both directly and in conjunction with a direct sales force and business partners. Proven pre-sales team development and management experience The Following Are The Competencies Required For The Role Sales skills Product positioning Opportunity pursuit Domain & market knowledge Leadership Innovation Interested candidates can forward their CVs to paul@datasearchconsulting.com for a confidential discussion. description: About Us  Sygnum is the world’s first regulated Digital Asset Bank, founded on Swiss and Singapore dual heritage, operating globally. We make digital assets bankable, secure and convenient, empowering our clients to invest in the digital asset economy with complete trust. For the first time with Sygnum, major currencies and digital assets, including Bitcoin, Ethereum and digital CHF and asset tokens are seamlessly integrated in one account.  We are currently looking for an Director - Institutional Sales & Distributions to join our growing, high impact team in our office in Singapore.  About You Are you passionate about putting customers first in everything you do? Do you have a demonstrable track record of success in the asset management space? Do you have a passion for cutting edge FinTech products and developing new markets? Do you have a curiosity for Digital assets, Cryptocurrencies or Blockchain? If this holds true, we want you on the Sygnum team.  Tasks Lead the sales, marketing and client relationship management functions, with specific responsibilities in alternative investments relating to digital assets, in particular hedge funds and private equity/VC to grow assets under management and our client base Develop and implement business and marketing strategies for our growing suite of asset management products; constantly enhance the competitive edge of the firm and lead execution Maintain, build and expand client and distribution networks with HNWIs, family offices, institutional investors, as well as with our ecosystem of strategic partners, in order to meet business goals Conduct investment seminars, product and market updates to facilitate sales Work closely with the Asset Management and Client Services team to understand market trend for sales opportunities Requirements Deep knowledge and experience in as well as passion for the entire digital asset space including types of assets and instruments, trading, lending, and custody landscape Experience in providing a comprehensive view of the customer, developing corporate and customer strategies at the highest levels of an organization to maximize customer acquisition, retention, and profitability Strong interpersonal and presentation skills capable of interacting with C-suite executives Relevant network and experience in communicating with potential clients including but not limited to digital channels Conceptual thinker with strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability Great communicator, goal and results oriented, able to work with minimal direction. Fluency in Mandarin would be an advantage Bachelor degree or equivalent If this reads like your profile, please send your application with CV. Even if you're not there yet but still think you could be a good fit for our team, please contact us and we'll figure it out. Thank you.

jobTitle: Regional Director, Channel Sales (SEA, India and Korea)
description: Job Number: 31635  Position Title: Director, Field Sales  External Description  Due to current international travel and government restrictions we are currently only considering candidates who hold either Singaporean Permanent Residency or Citizenship.  Informatica is currently looking for a passionate Regional Director, Channel Sales (SEA, India and Korea) in the data space to lead the region into greater success. Based in Singapore, this role requires your proven experience leading a high-performing enterprise partner sales team with direct reports in Singapore and India. Reporting into the MD for AIK (ASEAN, India, Korea), we require a sophisticated sales leader who is focused on achieving strong sales growth through our Strategic Distributors and Channel Partners.  Your role  This role is pivotal in providing sales leadership and direction for your team in the designated markets along with aligning and driving growth through strategic distributors, channel partners and focused account targets.  The Regional Director, will have key management responsibility for the sales operation with a focus on driving incremental net new license revenue for Informatica’s solutions. Key external relationships are the strategic distributors, regional and global SI’s, global ISV partners and enterprise customers / prospects. Internally, you will be expected to work in tandem with the marketing, sales consulting, alliances, professional services and extended APAC support teams to ensure strong pipeline creation, smooth deal management, and collaborative sales initiatives are achieved.  This role currently leads a team of three quota carrying Partner Sales Managers (PSMs) who drive business across three regional Pods, covering SE Asia, India and Korea. The distinct countries to be focused on include Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, India and Korea with a strategic distributor in each country, as well as channel partners who actively promote Informatica solutions.  Areas Of Focus Ensuring quotas are achieved on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis. Deliver forecasting and reporting accuracy of +/-10% based on quarter start date. Leading and motivating the team to deliver their individual and collective quotas. Work with Global System Integrators (GSIs) and Global ISVs (AWS, Microsoft, GCP, Snowflake) to ensure we have the correct relationships in place for the development of pipeline and achievement of quota targets Support relationships at all levels within partners including executive and C level. Driving partner enablement programs, with the wider APAC specialist organization. Tight alignment with marketing on pipeline generation. Managing strategic sales activities to ensure best practice and maximise win ratios. Advocating Informatica’s values and culture of teamwork, customer focus, openness and hard work through strong performance management. Reinforce operational discipline and predictability through accuracy in Salesforce and Clari. Hire and retain “A” players within the sales organisation when required. Functional Focus Analyse and provide market insights and create competitive and innovative strategies to grow the business. Lead, direct and support your team through effective coaching. Develop and implement effective sales campaigns. Ensure team goals are properly set and targets achieved using classic and innovative sales management approaches. Ensure complete adoption of internal administration and systems to ensure data is properly gathered and interpreted. Monitor and review results versus planned performance and take quick, decisive actions where there is clear variance to plan. Work with Corporate Sales Enablement team to ensure all team members are well equipped with knowledge on INFA products and solutions. Your Qualifications A minimum 10 years of successful enterprise software sales management in a related data space Strong, proven track record of management and strategic selling Experience leading a team with an enterprise account and channel sales focus Personal experience closing multi-million dollar and complex deals Minimum 5 years of direct sales experience within enterprise accounts Experience managing a diverse team of quota carrying partner sales managers Strong executive network, experience presenting to C-levels and social media thought leadership skills Professional demeanor, articulate, with good communication and presentation skills Bachelors Degree, MBA a plus City: Parkview Square  State  Seniority Level: Director  Alternative Location(s) :  Community / Marketing Title: Regional Director, Channel Sales (SEA, India and Korea)  Remote LinkedIn Hashtag    Company Profile  Unleash Your Potential  A career with Informatica gives you all the opportunities and benefits that can only come from working for the trusted industry leader. By joining our team, you'll be able to solve real-life problems, make a difference, have a global impact, and join a supportive group of globally diverse teammates. We encourage you to be yourself, grow with us and unleash your potential.  EEO Employer Verbiage  Informatica, the Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader, empowers businesses to realize the transformative power of data. We have pioneered a new category of software, the Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC), powered by AI and a cloud-first, cloud-native, end-to-end data management platform that connects, manages and unifies data across any multi-cloud, hybrid system, empowering enterprises to modernize and advance their data strategies. Customers in more than 100 countries and 85 of the Fortune 100 rely on Informatica to drive data-led digital transformation. For more information, visit us at www.informatica.com, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook.  Conquering the Impossible with data, come join #LifeAtINFA!  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.  Travel Requirement: Limited
industries: Computer Software

description: What's up? We're VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH  Our amazing client partnership team is looking forward to collaborating with a "people first" Business Director to lead the business in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Client Partnerships APAC.  Here's your first brief: Be the business unit owner driving new business, leading existing client partnerships, managing P&L and team development Provide critical support for top-tiered accounts to ensure retention and increased investment. Drive, establish and develop new and existing relationships with brands and client portfolios as well as implement, and execute strategies to reach company objectives. Support VaynerMedia in building its reputation as a 'must-have' partner for top brands and deliver client presentations to a high standard. Be a market expert within our business vertical and deliver market feedback to the organization while developing deep knowledge on top clients that we feedback into the business for future product and service development. Deliver on large scale client partnerships and revenue commitments while you manage and collaborate with our key senior leads at director level and above across brands and corporations. Own and develop our business area (market, patch, etc) and drive growth while actively leading from the front, being seen as a leader and support that drives business excellence and success. Develop, lead and grow the team through strong people management and coaching for high performance while collaborating with other global teams to develop synergies, harmonize the operating model, and improve overall operations.  Your Experience 10+ years of relevant work experience in the media or advertising field, including an account management experience in the APAC advertising landscape. Competencies: Business strategy, digital asset management, digital media planning and buying. Proficiency in written, verbal and presentation skills. Strategic sales planning, pipeline management, relationship building, digital market knowledge, negotiation skills, presentation skills, analytical skills. People management Worked with teams in complex, multi-geography, multi-cultural environments. Self-starter and demonstrates ability to get things done without direct supervision and understand what it means to deliver excellence to clients. Master presenter: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, and ideally at least one other Asian language Natural ability to develop and maintain key relationships with internal stakeholders. Lastly, think logically even under pressure and come up with innovative solutions to problems. Leadership experience in Singapore preferred  What You Should Know About VaynerMedia  Think "lab" and not "agency". We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We're willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It's fun!  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can't wait to meet you.

description: The area: Large Customer Sales (LCS)  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  The role: Head of Agency - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Additional Role Description  This is a customer-facing position that requires a strategic mind, exceptional relationship management skills and an entrepreneurial spirit. As Head of Agency business in Singapore, you have led teams within a major media agency or associated network. You will seek to further develop and maintain Google’s reputation amongst senior strategic agency partners. You will design and implement partnership initiatives and commercials managing a team of agency business managers as well as delivering to the in quarter business plan.  You’ll be responsible for Google Singapore’s agency business growth with some of our largest media and creative agency customers, delivering impact through strategic analysis, business planning, executive client management and flawless execution of key business initiatives. You will lead and coach a high-performing agency team that uses consultative skills to understand our partner’s needs and deliver impactful solutions. You are an innovator, excellent communicator and can drive change and impact in the market.  Responsibilities Lead a team to implement business strategies to accelerate the Google agency business. Identify business development opportunities, and keep strong relationships with agency influencers and decision makers. Manage and oversee the negotiation of complex agency agreements to successful completion working with holding groups. Work with Sales, Marketing, Product and Operations teams to develop agency strategy to build partnerships and maximize growth. Develop and implement programs to improve agency experience and education through training, business reviews and product updates. Interface with key executives in the advertising community and represent Google at industry events. Innovate and problem solve in a constantly changing and growing environment where the process is fluid, creative and unique solutions are desired. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 12 years of experience in sales and digital marketing. Experience in leadership and people management. Preferred Qualifications Experience with effective sales/operations management and strategic planning. Experience leading high performing teams. Deep understanding of the media agency business. Established and recognized profile/relationships in the Singapore market.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Head of Product Sales, Asia Pacific
description: Work Dynamics APAC  Our Account Management Sales teams are driven by one goal – to be the market leading corporate real estate services provider in Asia. They strive to provide our clients with the most innovative and cost-effective solutions in the management of their real estate portfolios.  Our Product Sales teams complement them by helping our clients understand the extensive list of products we have on offer. Not only limited to our existing client base, our Product Sales teams proactively engage with the wider market to introduce our products and grow our client portfolio. They help new and existing clients choose the best combination of tools that will get the most out of their real estate portfolio.  We are now seeking a Head of Product Sales for Asia Pacific to lead a multi-faceted sales team in growing our product revenue and adoption across new and existing clients in Asia. Product focus areas will include but are not limited to Energy & Sustainability, Occupancy Planning, Human Experience, Facilities Management, Engineering, Critical Environments, Portfolio Strategy, Transactions Management, Flex, and Lease Administration. This role sits within our Global Product Sales organization reporting to our Head of Global Product Sales and Enablement. Partnering with Global Operations and Product teams, they will develop sales strategies, support operational team needs, and ensure full alignment between teams.  What This Job Involves-  Sales Leadership & Strategic Direction  Do you see yourself as a strategic thinker? In this role, you will be the driving force behind us achieving our ambitions. Leading a team of dynamic and rewarding client facing sales and business development individuals, you will develop a go-to-market business plan that will define the pursuit strategy for each of your product lines.  This role will lead a team that must deliver supportive and timely sales content, pitch support, product demonstrations, pre-sales support, RFP/RFI response, and pricing and solutioning reviews. You will bring industry leading Product Sales practices to our solutioning process, all while working closely with our pursuits and account teams to improve performance, grow share of wallet and increase speed of Product delivery.  Accountable for delivering growth, you will work across our clients/accounts, as well as the open market, to expand our client footprint. To do this, you’ll need to partner with our business and service line leaders to develop a deep understanding of our capabilities.  Internal Collaborator  What value do you place on business partnerships? They help us understand our competitive positioning, products and solutions, allowing us to provide differentiation and deliver revenue. Thinking this way too, you will foster a team environment that encourages cross functionality across various internal partners and sellers.  As our Head of Product Sales, you will have regional oversight on the sales development for all of JLL’s Work Dynamics products. You’ll need to ensure your team drives coordination with our Product leaders to manage the sales platform and pipeline reporting. Your team will act as liaison with the organisation and the Product teams for continual product improvement, idea sharing, and general collaboration.  Getting it done  In this role, you will have ownership of the strategic sales direction, its operational execution and ongoing management. Intellectually curious by nature, you will always have an eye on the analytics and be a strong advocate of data driven decision making. Your critical thinking skills will come in handy when conducting business and performance analyses to track and review sales results. Results oriented, you will drive and influence a culture of excellence throughout our business.  Inspiring Others  Are you a dynamic leader? Can you galvanise, inspire and drive a diverse group of sales professional in a single direction with a common vision, ensuring both our continued success and future growth? Our leaders drive from the front and have an insatiable thirst for knowledge, encourage partnerships and champion best practice. At JLL, we encourage and infusion of collaborative ideas. You will champion those.  Do you have a ‘talent for talent’? In this role, you’ll act as both a talent magnet and coach, having a variety of career conversations with both internal and external talent. You’ll train and mentor on an individual, functional and regional basis, sharing your personal experiences in a constructive and structured fashion.  Sounds like you? To apply, you need to be-  Seasoned leadership professional  This is not a job for the faint of heart. We think you’ll need to have significant experience from within a fast-paced product sales environment. Transacting and managing across multiple geographies in Asia, you have led a diverse team of sales professionals develop, plan and execute a successful regional sales strategy.  Resilient  JLL is a highly dynamic business. It’s fast-paced and you’ll need to be too. You’ll need a positive mind set and a ‘can do’ attitude when multi-tasking and delivering sales wins. We have a continuous improvement mentality across our business and we’ll be looking for you to have the same.  Visionary  Are you a driven team leader? It’ll help you motivate the team to work cross-functionally with different levels of sellers. You should be skilled in weaving a story around innovation that helps deliver solutions aimed at customer needs. You’ll need excellent communication skills to engage and influence clients and prospects and articulate our value proposition while offering them appropriate solutions.  What We Can Do For You-  At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realise your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.  Apply today!  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

jobTitle: Regional Director, Component Sales to O&G
description: Direct report to Group CEO, highly visible to leadership team P&L role, managing sales and technical support teams  About Our Client  Our client is a leading manufacturer of components for the Oil & Gas, Wind and Offshore sectors and have been in the market for more than 50 years. In this region, they have manufacturing facilities in Malaysia and a sales office operating out of Singapore.  The Regional Director is a replacement role and the key hire to drive new and existing customer & distributor relationships in the region.  Job Description  The Regional Sales Director - O&G is responsible for driving P&L of the Cathodic Protection Division. You will have P&L responsibility for $15-20m, safety and well-being of the team, management and leadership, part of the global leadership team. This will include developing sales and strategic business development plans, commercial negotiations, technical review.  Reporting to the CEO and with a close association to the board, this role is responsible for: Leading sales by bringing new clients to the group Managing existing direct and trading relationships Building a strategic business growth plan Being the market expert on Cathodic Protection - systems in critical industries such as O&G, offshore Having a strong understanding of competitors in the industry and building a competitive edge Driving culture of solution driven sales  The Successful Applicant  Degree in mechanical, electrical or a related technical discipline Eight years or more in selling industrial solutions to the O&G, Offshore and Wind sectors Experience in managing sales and technical support teams, with at least a couple of years in managing manufacturing operations Strong OEM and trading relationships in Asia Experience in leading sales team through a changing market landscape The role requires frequent overseas travel, once travel resumes  What's On Offer  Our client, an industrial component provider has a history of more than 50 years in making and selling parts for the O&G, Offshore and Wind industry. The firm is going through significant change at the moment, and we are looking for a strong P&L leader to steer the ship!  The remuneration for this role and benefits, bonuses will be in line with the market and linked to the top-line and bottom-line growth.  Contact: Anurag Garg (Lic No: R1215997)  Quote job ref: 4212958

description: About Httpool  Httpool, an Aleph company, represents the leading digital media platforms across Europe and Asia. It supports their growth as well as drives business results for traditional and native advertisers across 30 markets. Based on an innovative set of technology and performance solutions, seasoned vertical teams, and extensive market know-how, Httpool enables advertisers to connect with their audiences in the most efficient and effective ways, consistently maximizing their ROIs. Leading media platforms including Facebook, Tik Tok, Twitter, Spotify, LinkedIn, Snapchat and many others appointed Httpool as their exclusive ad sales partner across selected European and Asian markets.  Httpool is headquartered in the UK and has offices in Austria, Switzerland, Russia, India, Hong Kong, Poland, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Croatia, Greece, Hungary, Macedonia, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Norway, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, Indonesia, Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar, Malaysia and Bangladesh. Jointly, IMS and Httpool exclusively represent over 20 media platforms in more than 45 countries worldwide.  Responsibilities  WHY IS THIS A COMPELLING POSITION? This role was created recently to strengthen Httpool’s presence and position within the SMB segment across APAC Markets. This role is critically important for Aleph’s and Httpool’s future growth and planned IPO. It offers an opportunity to truly create and build a high performing sales team from scratch. Httpool provides an unique international experience to its employees within a continuously evolving media landscape. It offers constant challenges and opportunities for continuous learning and growth for individuals that are passionate about digital marketing and advertising technologies.  Coach, develop and lead a high-performing team of Sales Managers and account managers who work directly with multi-vertical clients and/or agencies Develop a people strategy and coach individuals to sustainably find, grow and keep the best current and future talent and provide career progression. Create a strong shared vision in a fast moving environment and foster a sense of belonging and collaboration, extending to cross-functional teams Structure, help negotiate, and manage long-term relationships with partners and ensure clients derive the maximum value from Facebook and other leading media platforms advertising solutions, driving growth across your portfolio. Develop Sales strategy for your team in collaboration with Httpool SMB Global VP, your EMEA and in market counterparts and work with direct reports on short and long-term priorities for executing, measuring and sharing results that help clients grow Provide business analytic strength to help facilitate initiatives critical to ongoing growth at market and regional levels. Represent Httpool with industry organisations and in the press  Minimum Qualifications  8+ years previous experience in customer sales and support, agency account management or consulting Significant experience in building, leading and inspiring sales teams Experience in growing long-term commercial partnership and build sales pipeline at scale, through hands on sales coaching Success in this position requires a passion for leadership, strong analytical skills, a focus on enabling client growth, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. Ability to speak English fluently BA/BS degree from a leading academic institution  #HTTPOOL

description: About the business and the role  Fiserv, Inc. (NASDAQ: FISV) is a leading global technology provider serving the financial services industry, driving innovation in payments, processing services, risk and compliance, customer and channel management, and business insights and optimization.  You can “Find Your Forward" as part of a FORTUNE™ 500 member and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the eighth consecutive year, you will join the industry leader in financial services technology. With more than 44,000 associates around the world, we’re pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in financial services with deep expertise and a dedication to innovation.  It is an excellent time to join Fiserv and take on a rewarding and meaningful role that helps to drive significant change in a rapidly evolving and growing organization. You may not realise, but Fiserv touches your life every day. Whether it's buying dinner with a credit card or ordering a book on-line, Fiserv is one company that can make all these transactions happen conveniently, efficiently, and securely. We could not do it without our number one resource: People.  Exciting Marketing Opportunity as part of our Asia Pacific Marketing, Brand and Communications team based in Singapore.  What does a Fiserv "Marketing Director, Asia Pacific" do?  The individual will offer experience and fresh ideas on driving Fiserv marketing initiatives to the Asia Pacific markets whilst aligning with Fiserv brand positioning and messaging.  This role is responsible for the marketing of solutions and services to specific industry verticals/target markets and ensuring that the solutions and services are positioned to sell based on the needs of the market. The candidate will be focused on deploying successful marketing campaigns from ideation to execution to support primarily the Payments & Fintech business, and where needed to support the Merchant Acquiring business.  Develop marketing strategies and plans and execute on the plan meeting timelines, track and measure success. Working closely with Sales, Product and Technology partners to understand and articulate the value of Fiserv solutions and services developing compelling content to support sales initiatives: client-facing pitch books /brochures, videos, demos etc. Host, maintain and drive usage of content on the global content management platform to ensure that content is up-to-date and is consistent with global standards. Own content on the website, improving and updating with new compelling content. Drive and track traffic to the website.   Support Sales in developing highly customized client pitch material for high profile pitches. Localise global thought leadership and creation of new regionally relevant thought leadership to be repurposed for multi-channel distribution. Leverage all channels as necessary to communicate solution/ thought leadership content and Drive Sales education through training materials and monthly sales update communication. Lead and execute on proprietary and industry events, including preparing SMEs for speaking opportunities, preparing content and event management logistics.  Key Attributes and Skills Desired Minimum 10 - 12 years’ marketing experience in a global organisation, partnering with key business stakeholders in Payment & Fintech or Technology organizations. Strong client partnering skills: ability and finesse to manage multiple stakeholders and influence teams.  Ability to understand complex technology solutions and create compelling client-relevant content. Ability to build, manage and execute on marketing plans and meet deadlines. High level of integrity to hold confidential information for strategic projects. Strong, polished verbal communication skills and excellent writing, editing and presentation creation skills. Adaptable, flexible, intellectually curious, strong attention to detail, willing to take initiative and be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in Mandarin an advantage.  ﻿Our Talent Acquisition colleagues will be in touch with the shortlisted applicants. You have our assurance that all applications will be treated with the highest confidentiality.  Recruitment Agencies: We've got this one, thank you!

description: Application Instructions: Interested applicants please apply here: https://grnh.se/ff26af4a2us  Workato is the operating system for today’s fast-moving business. As a high growth company with over 6000 customers, Workato is revolutionizing the integration and automation market with investments from the top 3 SaaS companies - Salesforce, Workday, ServiceNow. Recognized as a leader by both Gartner and Forrester, it is the only AI-based platform that enables both business and IT to integrate their apps and automate workflows across their enterprise with robust security and governance. Some of the world’s top brands including Slack, Grab, Box, Visa, Broadcom run on Workato.  We are looking for an exceptional Director, Business Development (Singapore Government) to join our growing team. Reporting into the Managing Director of APJ, you will help us set up and develop our business with the Singapore Government.  Workato has a positive, diverse, and collaborative culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, smart, hardworking and work to be a little better every day. Workato has also been recognized amongst the “Top 47 Enterprise Startups to Bet Your Career On in 2020” and the “Hottest 13 Productivity Software Startups to Watch in 2020!” by Business Insider.  Responsibilities Develop a strategic business development plan for Workato serving the Singapore Government, and ensure it is well aligned across Workato. Execute the plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, marketing teams etc) as well as partners. Maintains and nurtures relationships with the Singapore Government, with expansion into ASEAN and APAC in the future Assists in the establishment of our corporate strategies, sales plans, which aligns with government laws, regulations and standards. Analyze government legislative actions and regulatory activities, determine the potential impact on Workato and develop appropriate responses. Represents and protects Workato’s interests, especially in leading discussions on legal terms and conditions with the Singapore Government. Creates sales strategies and specific objectives for Workato’s Public Sector revenue targets. Designs and initiates sales programs for short and long term sales strategies. Recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and increase sales potential. Ensures projects are completed on time and within budget. Requirements  Qualifications and Experience At least 5+ years of SaaS/PaaS sales, channel business development and program management experience. At least 5+ years of experience working with the Singapore Government. Deep knowledge of overall government business functions. Good understanding of the Singapore Government procurement process and contract vehicles Experience in working with customers in the Public Sector including negotiations, opportunity management and relationship building. Experience with the Partner Ecosystem within the Singapore Government Strong communication/interpersonal skills as you are required to work with both internal and external stakeholders independently Skills Demonstrates understanding of the Workato iPaaS & Automation Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time in high-pressure situations, and work in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Capability to build great relationships with highly technical customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Possess strong critical thinking and analytical skills with an entrepreneurial mindset Why Workato? Supportive, collaborative, international team environment that supports remote employees (currently all of us!) Long-term prospects for a professional career in a high growth company Flexible Work culture Be part of a community-oriented organization with a history of giving back Best in class technology tools to empower you to do your best work Support for professional development and continuous learning Wellness programs, including fitness challenges and an occasional company day off to recover from Zoom fatigue Company-sponsored team-bonding activities and team celebrations Employee and Customer referral bonuses

description: About Us  CapitaLand Group (CapitaLand) is one of Asia’s largest diversified real estate groups. Headquartered in Singapore, CapitaLand’s portfolio spans across diversified real estate classes which include integrated developments, retail, office, lodging, residential and new economy sectors such as business parks, industrial, logistics and data centres. With a presence across more than 250 cities in over 30 countries, the Group focuses on Singapore and China as its core markets, while it continues to expand in markets such as India, Vietnam, Australia, Europe and the USA.  The Job  CapitaLand Investment (CLI) is currently seeking an experienced Head of Global Account Management to join and lead the Account Management team for Data Centre (DC) to support current and new customers globally.  The individual will develop strong relationships with top-tier global customers and generate meaningful sales opportunities.  Responsibilities Identify and engage top-tier global customers as key accounts Build and maintain strong relationships with key accounts and customer stakeholders Discover opportunities to serve customers’ expansion plan across multiple markets through understanding customers’ requirements and needs to offer suitable solutions and generate new business. Acquire Data Centre industry insights and identify key activities to keep abreast of the Data Centre landscape Requirements Minimum 20 years of relevant experience in key account management in the DC industry is preferred Degree in Business Administration or related discipline Deep understanding of customer/industry climate and key activities in DC field Knowledgeable in Data Centre co-location services, solutions, and technical acumen Strong analytical and conceptual thinking Ability to lead and coach junior team members in Account Management. Benefits Flexible benefits with comprehensive medical coverage for self and family Training and development opportunities Subsidised rates at Ascott serviced residences Strong advocate of staff volunteerism Wellness programmes Closing Statement  At CapitaLand, we advocate fair employment practices, and recruit talents based on merit and fit with our Corporate values. We provide equal opportunity for all qualified persons and build an inclusive workplace regardless of race, gender, age, religious belief or nationality.  Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The Responsibilities:  Review and schedule client evaluations, POCs and the onboarding of new clients Ensure delivery of contracts and projects Address client requests and support tickets Oversee incident resolution Lead vendor and supplier management Identifying and targeting areas in which a business can improve operations Monitoring revenue margins Researching and implementing new directives for business growth and optimization  Desired Skills and Experience:  Minimum 5 years experience in operations for data-as-a-service or software-as-a-service companies Managing multiple projects and effectively prioritize organization tasks Domain knowledge in location analytics, point-of-interest data, data-as-a-service or SaaS Experience managing relationships between sales, marketing, product, development and clients. description: The Operations Director will oversee the organization's ongoing operations and procedures. This position will be the company's second-in-command and is responsible for ensuring the company has the proper operational controls, administrative and reporting procedures, and people systems in place to grow the organization effectively and to ensure financial strength and operating efficiency. This role is a key member of the senior management team, working alongside the CEO and being his right 'executioner' hand. This role will maintain control of diverse business operations requiring an experienced and efficient leader. People skills, business acumen, prior startup building, and/or incubator experience are a must.  The goal of the Operations Director position is to secure the functionality of the business to drive extensive and sustainable growth.  Roles & Responsibilities: Overseeing day-to-day operations of the company and team Designing, implementing, and ensuring smooth business operations Establishing policies and practices that promote company culture and vision Design and implement business strategies, plans, and procedures Set comprehensive goals for performance and growth Lead employees to encourage maximum performance and dedication, building a diverse, high-performance team Delegate responsibilities and coach employees to ensure team members grow as capable participants Foster a success-oriented, accountable environment within the company Evaluate performance by analyzing and interpreting data and metrics Participate in expansion activities (investments, acquisitions, corporate alliances, etc.) Manage relationships with partners/vendors.  Experience & Qualifications: Proven experience as Ops Director/COO/Startup Founder or relevant role Experience in building prior hardware/deep-tech startup and/or incubator required Experience with various business functions (HR, Finance, Marketing, Operations, Sales, etc.) Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities Excellent interpersonal and team-building skills Demonstrated aptitude in decision-making and problem-solving Demonstrated experience in ethical leadership Outstanding verbal and written skills and experience working with staff on all levels Bachelor's Degree is required, and an MBA is preferred.  Why should you join us: You will become a part of an exciting, fast-growing deep-tech startup, poised to become the leader of the Inspection Industry. You will have a great influence on our product or the processes, and get the chance to work with a highly competent and experienced team. Explore your entrepreneurial knack Be a part of our family; Our team is our family ESOP shares, be a part owner in the company, and grow together Best in class medical insurance.

description: Job purpose  To effectively manage and communicate the key messages to prospective as well as the existing investors with the objective of increasing visibility of the firm’s offerings to institutional investor community globally and AUM of funds on the asset management platform.  Duties And Responsibilities Responsible for effectively communicating the key messages to prospective as well as existing investors in a timely and effective manner Generate monthly, quarterly, and other ad hoc reports to be distributed to external and internal stakeholder Lead and coordinate the RFPs, RFIs and onsite due diligence from investors Identify and target new potential institutional investors as well as explore possibility of organic growth with existing pool of investors Maintain the CRM database with the most update information on investors Prepare marketing and investment related presentation materials across all products Manage the execution of organization’s corporate messaging across different formats like making presentations, press releases, employee meetings, investor meetings etc. Conduct daily, weekly, and monthly meetings with investors, either in person or via phone to address any of their relevant questions or concerns. Where relevant, to be responsible for organizing and monitoring management calls with the investor community and/or clients as well as in developing and preparing PR efforts Determine the organization’s position in the market and to provide the Head of Business Development, AM with a proactive assessment and any other relevant feedback and guidance that is needed by the organization's senior personnel on how to increase the interactions and visibility with the investment community Responsible for updating the Head of Business Development, AM on the priorities and concerns of the shareholders and in representing the voice of the investors Prior Work Experience at least 10+ years of industry experience preferably with at least 7 years of professional experience in asset management firms Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business or Finance Domain Skills Deep knowledge and understanding in investor relations and business development function, and process. understanding in investment strategies, components of various valuation methodologies etc. to be able to effectively articulate to investors and stakeholders. Proficient in managing investor’s due diligence process. Soft Skills Attention to detail Ability to work collaboratively with business partners across the organization to achieve positive results Develop a sense of credibility within the investor community and the organization's management team Strong follow up skills Possess a passion, drive & an ability to be the company's public voice, processing and accurately communicating information with diplomacy & confidence An independent, motivated, strategic thinker with the ability to make quick decisions in a proactive & competent manner Analytical and interpersonal skills and ability to interface at all levels, both internally & externally Strong written & oral communication with experience in delivering communications in written, web, and other mediums to multiple locations Organized person with the ability to problem solve, multitask & meet deadlines

description: About the company: MoneyWiseSmart Pte Ltd.  MoneyWiseSmart is an investment research and education business. Our subscribers are retail investors from all over the world, who aspire to take full control of every aspect of their investing journey. We offer a set of comprehensive investment education programs, which guide our subscribers on their journey towards financial freedom. In our Research Series offering, we publish deep dive research content on businesses which are long term compounders. Our Investing Fundamentals program provides a comprehensive step-by-step framework for identifying, analysing and building a portfolio of high quality businesses. In our Options Series program, we teach strategies for managing risk and enhancing cash returns from long term investment portfolios.  We are a young profitable company and we are very proud of our high caliber global team.  Website: https://moneywisesmart.com YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCd9sDtO2IcgtiDs1K6oIJgg Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/moneywisesmart    Digital Marketing Head/Manager: Job Description The suitable candidate will join us as ‘Head of Marketing’ or ‘Marketing Manager’ depending upon the level of experience of the candidate.  The Digital Marketing Manager is the key person in charge of developing & owning the overall digital marketing strategy for the company. He/she is involved throughout the campaign ideation, planning, implementation, measurement, and optimisation process. It is therefore essential that he/she has hands-on experience using various digital marketing platforms.  The Digital Marketing Manager works closely with the research/content team and/or digital agencies to achieve specific company objectives such as; increasing sales, lead generation, brand engagement, and conversions. The Digital Marketing Manager reports to the Founders of the company. Roles and Responsibilities Full ownership of the overall digital marketing strategy Implement marketing activities across a broad range of digital marketing channels (SEO, SEM, Social Media, Email, Mobile, Display) Manage and maintain the company’s media /SM assets (website, social media assets, email lists etc) Manage the creation (in coordination with the research/content team) of relevant and engaging digital content for publishing onto various digital platforms Manage social media marketing campaigns Manage digital advertising campaigns (SEM, Display, Social, Programmatic) Manage the end to end marketing funnels Set up conversion, pixel, and event tracking on the website and across various digital platforms Conduct research on market trends, brand’s audiences and competitors, and end-to-end consumer journey to drive engagements and conversions Analyze digital marketing analytics reports and share insights with the team to develop optimization plans Stay abreast of emerging digital tools and platforms, digital marketing trends, new technologies, and share insights with the rest of the team Salary Range We offer a competitive salary and an attractive performance based upside.   Job Requirements The candidate needs to be a Singapore citizen/PR.  We are looking for experienced candidates having a proven track record of a successful digital marketing role.  The ideal candidate will be someone who posses a lot of ownership and can function independently Being familiar with the investing field is not a mandatory requirement, but it can definitely be a positive  Get in touch with us on the email id / Whatsapp No. below: Email: rupam@moneywisesmart.com Whatsapp: +65 85224033

Skills Union is a global digital learning company, working with leading employers and universities to equip employees and students for careers in the digital economy, offering courses and workshops in the most sought-after digital skills, including UX design, Design Thinking, Entrepreneurship, Leadership and Digital Marketing.  The Role - Who We Are Looking For  We are looking for a driven Head of Enterprise Sales to lead and implement our B2B sales strategy. Your primary role will be reaching out to leading companies, consulting and selling our digital learning solutions. We look for people who have a deep passion for sharing knowledge and possess significant real-world experience.  Experience in a training or education field is preferred; however we look for people with a great can-do attitude, knowledge and experience of digital skills, and desire to help our corporate clients to succeed. You will be joining a global team, working closely with a team of experienced educators, to provide digital learning solutions to the corporate world.  Duties And Responsibilities Reaching out to potential corporate clients through email and phone to offer enterprise learning solutions Selling our scheduled workshops programme, as well as our custom training offering Managing our Sales CRM in Hubspot Identifying new business opportunities that generate revenue Prospecting, setting up demos and sales pitches Customer on-boarding and ongoing customer relationship management Skills And Qualifications Proven experience and success in enterprise sales. You are a confident communicator with problem-solving and analytical thinking skills. You are proactive, autonomous and resourceful. Significant understanding of digital skills including UX Design, Design Thinking, Agile, Scrum, Digital Marketing, Product Management, Innovation and Software Development. Above all you have a great attitude, a passion for working with people, and a deep love for what you do.

description: Unlock Better with TAIGER  Everything we do at TAIGER is driven by a common belief that work as we know it can be done better. This is why at TAIGER, we develop hybrid artificial intelligence that understands language and logic, helping enterprises unlock better automation, better insights and ultimately better growth and human fulfilment.  Together with our clients and partners, we are solving challenging tasks in various industries. Tasks that involve billions of dollars of man-hours and infrastructure. Tasks that are thought to be impossible to apply cognitive automation and AI. Today, some of the world's leading enterprises and government organisations use our technology for complex and high value work like digital non-client onboarding, fraud detection, customer service and engagement amongst others.  Our game-changing work on emerging technologies like Ontologies and Graphs, and Natural Language Technologies is featured on Gartner's Hype Cycles in 2021. TAIGER is also named as an IDC innovator in AI in 2019, and we are proudly accredited by Singapore's Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA).  TAIGER is looking for a Sales Director, Financial Services to join our award winning team.  Sales Director, Financial Services  We are building a team passionate about cutting-edge AI technology and the potential of TAIGER. You should be motivated by growth opportunities with your responsibilities expanding in scope. You can also look forward to being part of a dynamic start-up environment where your contribution matters.  Responsibilities Close business with new and established accounts: building a strong and sustainable business pipeline Identify key decision makers, approvers, and influencers and develop strategies to increase deal confidence Drive incremental revenue inside named accounts by uncovering new use cases, growing adoption of current opportunities and upselling and cross-selling additional solutions Solution-sell by mapping business challenges with technology solutions Able to sell end to end solutions as part of digital transformation inside organisations Lead generation, qualification and opportunity management to contract closure Partnership with solution, marketing, business development, product, delivery Proven track record FSI sector Forecast and pipeline management using CRM tools (Hubspot)  Requirements Demonstrated sales management with proven track-record of consistently exceeding quotas and performance targets Strong account management successes in Singapore Ability to sell new cutting edge technology solutions to clients: out of the box thinking, visioning, educating, consulting skills, customer success, etc. Effective account management skills in upselling solutions and making sure client implementations are successful Experience developing new sales strategies Ideal candidate will have strong experience of B2B direct and channel software sales, ideally in AI space Consultative solution sales - hungry to drive and close business Ability to articulate complex ideas and strategies Strong collaboration and communication within departments with like-minded goal of achievement Attention to detail Execution excellence in using CRM and managing OKRs/KPIs  You are right for the team if You have a good eye for business and excellent organisational, analytical, and influencing skills as well as strong business ties in our target region. Apart from being a savvy negotiator with competitive drive and determination, you should also be customer centric with good interpersonal and networking skills. You adapt to change well and are able to tackle complex problems using new and innovation solutions. You have a global mindset working in HQ in Singapore You possess effective time management skills.  TAIGERs are different.  With a multinational and multicultural team headed by talents drawn from leading global companies, diversity is our strength. TAIGERs come from all walks of life, bringing to every piece of work varied experiences and expertise. Just as every TAIGER is unique, no two days at TAIGER are the same. Through working on diverse projects across geographies, every day is a new opportunity to master our craft and impact the future of work. Here at TAIGER, we share a common question—what else can we unlock better? TAIGER does not engage any recruitment agencies for recruitment of talents into our company. All job applications should be submitted directly to TAIGER.

description: What’s up? We’re VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH Well, now we’re looking for someone who lives and breathes social media even more than us. Do you know all of the latest trends? Memes? And TikToks? Maybe you’ve dabbled in the world of influencers? Believe in the power of social media and community management to change hearts, minds, and drive sales? Love the hustle of fast-paced, hyper-growth agency life? Thrive in a role where you can bring ideas to life on billions of screens? Cool. Then let’s talk.  This exciting opportunity of a full-time role based in Singapore will allow you to lead a team of strategists and collaborate with a bunch of strat experts across apac. You will lead and drive our strategy expertise and be the “strategic brain” who will guide us for all things APAC.  Are you based in Singapore? Geeking the social media world in APAC digital space for eight plus years now? Are you inspiring with a can-do attitude? Do you wanna deep dive into the world of media and creative advertising agency? If yes, we could be meant to be -----so keep reading!  Here’s where you come in. Our growing strategy team is looking forward to collaborating with a “people first” Strategy Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Strategy and Insights.  You’re a problem solver at heart and insanely curious about people, culture and technology. Most of all, you like to get your hands dirty, are obsessed with researching & finding interesting things that are hidden from sight (even in the seemingly most mundane of places) and adept at translating your findings into compelling creative briefs, enjoy partnering with teams to see your work through from research to execution, and communicate your work with passion and conviction. We like to work with “big thinkers yet hands-on in execution”.  As a team, we’re collaborative and come from diverse backgrounds. We value creativity in research, and an outside-in perspective when it comes to inspiration, strategic frameworks and problem-solving. Technology has fundamentally changed the way we interact with others and the world around us, and we geek out about understanding behaviors in context, instead of probing humans in a petri dish.  You would be leading a team of talented strategists, social listening analysts, and community experts. As such, there are many hats you’d have to wear from day 1. You would need to conduct research, write briefs, guide work, pitch to clients - really anything and everything it takes to get the job done and deliver fantastic, big, bold, beautiful work.  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  Your Experience and the “Nice To Have” 7 plus years experience building integrated programs at a top agency working for Fortune 500 clients -- must have experience understanding the intersection of business strategy, consumer insights, and digital behavior and developing big, purposeful ideas. Experience doing traditional, web, social, syndicated and primary research (incl.: NetBase, MRI, Sysomos, Brandwatch, eMarketer, Mintel, Google Analytics, Omniture; conducting IDIs, digital ethnographies, etc.) Dazzling presentation skills and presence in a room Ability to express complicated concepts in simple and digestible ways (“Explain it to a fifth grader”) Curious and lovely to get along with. Deliver work independently on all tasks and achieve results at pace with energy and drive. Lead collaboration sessions with other teams. Execute a strong sense of priority level and urgency; and knows how to act on the critical difference between the two. Manage the ongoing performance of different tasks or projects, as well as understanding and ownership of internal processes for quality assurance. Administer agreed goals or projects by dealing to challenges in a responsive and constructive way. Strive for zero mistakes or flagged internal process issues on work output. Foster positive internal communication and collaboration with all internal teams. Ensure presented ideas are clear and understood. Highlight new ideas to the team and external stakeholders when appropriate. Provide clear, professional, timely and helpful information to the team or external clients and partners. Thrives in a company of good people Think logically even under pressure and come up with innovative solutions to problems. Lastly, a genuine belief in bringing your full self to what you do everyday, see “work” as a calling and a passion.    What you should know about VaynerMedia Think “lab” and not “agency”. We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We’re willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It’s fun! Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  P.S Portfolio would be nice :)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Media Production

description: In view of the current global pandemic related to COVID-19 and the increased visa and border restrictions, we are unable to extend offers to candidates who are not currently in the physical location where this role will be based. As a result, we will be prioritising applications who are able to start work in Singapore within a set timeframe. We will be reviewing our position constantly and will make the necessary adjustments where appropriate. Thank you for your continued interest in a career at adidas.  Purpose & Overall Relevance For The Organization  Drive planning, integration and execution of key commercial and brand functions to ensure success in APAC’s top cities.  Key Responsibilities Guide city planning for 16+ Key and Focus Cities: set planning templates and standards, lead planning and reporting efforts and ensure best-practice sharing Align with the Global Key Cities team and other global functions to develop planning and reporting standards for APAC cities Define, track and report city level KPI: define metrics, and develop new indicators when needed; build tracking sheets and report templates; deliver status reports to APAC Senior Leadership Team. Drive the development of plans and execution at city level for Brand Activation: bridge global and APAC brand activation planning and best-practice sharing into the cities Support city level MWB planning and tracking: coordinate with country/cluster Brand Directors to plan and track marketing budget spend at city level. Drive planning for “hyper-local” product development and distribution for focus cities, and manage framework for hype product allocation across cities City ecosystem and distribution channel planning: ensure cross-channel coordination (DTC, Wholesale, Digital) to meet city level scale and like-for-like sales growth targets; support BLR roll out in city planning. KPIs Net sales growth and market share (where available) in Key and Focus Cities NPS and NPS gap to Nike in Key and Focus cities (where available) Facilitate / enable execution of brand activation events and goals Key Relationships APAC headquarter brand adidas team / DTC team / WHSE team APAC C/Cs DTC, franchise team Key City team in APAC C/Cs Global Key City Team, Marketplace Management Team Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Strong leadership & management skills Strong communication skills with his/her direct reports, but more importantly, with all the counterparts he/she will have to influence and work with (Brand Marketing, Sales, Retail, Finance) Strong industry knowledge Expert understanding of local country clusters’ consumers, accounts, economic environment and commercial needs Strategy – ability to provide input to and implement strategy Strong analytic ability and understanding of trade zone concept in key cities Requisite Education And Experience / Minimum Qualifications 12+ years of cross functional experience in analytic, retail expansion and marketplace management Bachelor in related field required, MBA preferred Previous experience in managing a global matrix organization required Industry experience required

description: Do you love to work on exciting marketing campaigns with brands like Disney, Unilever, and Grab?  Are you passionate about leading a team of young account managers and executives?  Is talking to clients and influencers second nature to you?  Then this might be the job for you! We are looking for a stellar Client Director APAC, who can strengthen our Influencer & Client Relations (ICR) department.  The ICR department is the link between content creators and clients and helps brands and agencies across APAC deliver spectacular influencer marketing campaigns all over the world!  In this position you will be tasked with leading the ICR department in APAC and run campaigns from start to end, thereby communicating with the brands and agencies.  You will support senior BD members who will take in briefs from clients and conceptualise influencer marketing campaigns by running feasibility checks and giving creative ideas where possible.  Your Main Responsibilities Will Be Manage our largest client accounts in the region. Be the main point of contact for clients and operational teams to ensure smooth campaign execution. Create and standardise protocols for each client based on their internal procedures and business needs. Manage internal and external software to come up with the most efficient solutions for project management of campaigns. Full ownership and responsibility to ensure that campaign targets are met. Prepare creative and detailed onboarding documents for effective influencer marketing campaigns. Champion influencer marketing, digital, content marketing and benefits of social media and native content within these companies. Staying up-to-date with social media and digital technology trends and using these insights for sales strategy in order to secure revenue including but not limited to enterprise software development, and NFTs. Apply Now If You Have great people and relationship building skills Are a process-oriented and goal-driven individual Have a keen eye for detail and highly skilled in project management Have good market and industry knowledge and an interest in digital marketing, especially influencer marketing. Are a self-driven multitasker, who can perform under pressure Have excellent analytical skills Have the ability to balance multiple tasks Have excellent verbal and written communication skills Are great at using both analytical (e.g. Google Sheets, R, Tableau, etc.) and communication/project management tools (Google Slides, Jira, Atlassian Confluence, Asana, etc.) What We Offer A dynamic and friendly start up working environment, where your voice counts Growth opportunities, whereby you learn on the job A market competitive salary An international and multicultural environment with colleagues from all over the world About IndaHash  indaHash is the fastest growing technology platform that connects influencers from all over the world. Currently, indaHash operates in over 113 markets and has offices in Germany, USA, UK, United Arab Emirates, Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Japan, South Africa and Poland. We cooperate with over 1,000,000 influencers and work with the biggest Fortune 500 brands.  Since 2016 indaHash conducted more than 10,000 campaigns for the world’s largest brands (Coca-cola, McDonald`s, L’Oreal, Electrolux and many more). indaHash cooperates parallelly with media houses and advertising agencies across the major groups such as WPP, IPG, OMG, Havas, Hakuhodo, Dentsu, and many more from around the world in order to carry out effective global campaigns on Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Youtube, and many more.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Public Relations and Communications

description: The Great Room seeks an experienced General Manager (GM) in Singapore, who can spearhead sales and growth, provide operational oversight and strategic leadership for our coworking space at Singapore. The GM plays a critical role in driving both sales and operations for The Great Room. As GM, you are the chief brand ambassador who supervises our team in Singapore. You will report directly to the Chief Commercial Officer on all strategic and tactical matters as they relate to sales, budget management, and growth strategy.  This position requires a high level of intellectual rigour and integrity of the highest, and a passion for structure and details. Positive and a can-do attitude is a must. Proven track record in sales, P&L management, and leading a team are key.   What will you do  Spearhead Sales and Business Development Define key sales strategies for the region, budgets required to deliver, and drive successful execution to achieve results  Manage the local sales team and work towards 100% occupancy Own the inbound and outbound sales process in the region: Lead qualification, prospecting, pipeline building and opportunity identification Manage P&L, revenue growth, sales targets, and other KPIs  Direct with Charisma and Lead the Team Hire, manage and motivate the team on the ground. Serve as both a coach and a team player to the finance, marketing, sales, and member relations teams; assist to create and implement robust policy and procedures Be a force of nature that pushes boundaries, possibilities, quality and deadlines by always being warm but demanding in a professional manner. Be optimistic and help other team members and stakeholders do so as well Be the main representative and ambassador for The Great Room in Singapore. Be able to effectively communicate our vision and the rationale behind our business decisions  Build our Brand, Presence, and Growth Embark on pre-sales of our Offices during pre-opening phase Open each new Office within the country at the targeted occupancy, and ensure the Offices are fully occupied thereafter Managing cluster performance – occupancy, revenue, profit, budget, member’s satisfaction & growth etc. Work closely with Marketing to covert leads to business in the local market  Enforce Operational Rigour Implement and monitor systems to ensure smooth daily operations across all locations, working with the corporate Operations team to ensure this Become the brain trust and driver of all things related to your centres including (1) Sales, (2) Operations, (3) Strategy, and (4) Analytics  Be a Guardian Prepare and present sales reports, financials, and operational challenges on a monthly basis Appoint and manage third-party consultants related to sales and operations Be responsible for The Great Room’s compliance with local regulation and practices   Who you are Someone strong at sales and business development with proven management expereience A person ready to get their hands dirty and who understands that devil is in the details Gets excited about working with numerous people across cultures day to day Strong organisational skills, including the ability to prioritise, multi-task, delegate and work effectively with minimal supervision. Impeccable and concise communication and presentation skills, verbal and written Demonstrate integrity, responsibility, and good work ethics Proficient in basic computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Able to work with multiple and tight deadlines Self-directed with a high level of initiative and a ‘can do’ attitude Finds it easy to bridge corporate and start-up culture  What you’ll receive Competitive remuneration 5 days work week (though there may be occasions where you will be required to work on weekends due to Events etc. Annual Leaves & Public Holidays Birthday Leave Monthly Mobile Allowance Reimbursements for business related trips Flexible Benefit (for medical and other approved wellness, healthcare activities etc.)  Does this sound like you Connect with us at singapore.careers@thegreatroom.co with your recent CV.  It’s all work, it’s all play The Great Room provides hospitality-inspired working environments for a community of liked minded high-value entrepreneurs, leading corporates, and ‘grown-up’ start-ups. The Great Room’s vibrant co-working spaces are growing across Asia Pacific, and have presences in Singapore, Bangkok and Hong Kong in 2019.  * Note to our talent acquisition partners: Unfortunately, The Great Room cannot accept candidate submissions from partners who does not have an existing agreement with. We will not be responsible for introduction or placement fees for hiring of candidates whose profile were submitted to The Great Room team members or offices without The Great Room's prior knowledge or permission.
