Dentsu is a modern marketing solutions company. Our mission is to help clients navigate, progress and thrive in a world of change. Businesses rely on our integrated network of agencies and specialized practices to champion meaningful progress through creative, media, commerce, data and technology.We are champions for meaningful progress, and we strive to be a force for good—for our people, for our clients, for the industry and for our society.  We offer exciting challenges and memorable experiences. And provide the opportunity to work on projects that define careers and enable futures. Part of our promise to our people is an environment in which great ideas can come from anyone, anywhere, through ways of working that give everyone the opportunity to flourish.  Merkle, a dentsu company, is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices.  For more than 25 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. The agency’s heritage in data, technology, and analytics forms the foundation for its unmatched skills in understanding consumer insights that drive people-based marketing strategies. When combined with its strength in performance creative and media, Merkle creates customer experiences that drive improved marketing results and shareholder value.  With more than 4,200 employees, Merkle is headquartered in Columbia, Maryland with 17 additional offices in the US and 10 offices in Europe and Asia. In 2016, the agency joined the Dentsu Network.  Role Purpose  We are expanding our loyalty practice in APAC and are looking for key team members to join and lead this growth phase. The Loyalty Strategist is an integral part of the APAC strategy engagement and delivery team. They will be responsible for leading strategy delivery across the region on loyalty engagements, and be measured on quality of delivery and client satisfaction.  The Loyalty Strategist will work closely with the sales and solutioning during the pursuit process and thereafter with other strategists and technical teams on delivery. On the client side they will manage senior client stakeholders’ as well as the client relationship for key accounts.  Key Responsibilities  Sales – support sales and solutioning teams in pursuit of opportunities and scoping of strategy deliverables  Solutioning – work with the solutions lead to define strategy deliverables, localize global best-practice and develop frameworks/deliverables based on market needs  Delivery – lead the delivery of strategy engagements from project kick-off to closure- Manage the delivery team comprising of regional and global stakeholders Present concepts, documents and program information to applicable client stakeholders Ownership of end deliverables and project management, including documentation and client approvals- - Stakeholder interviews and Workshops - Develop insights that form the basis of strategic recommendations - Loyalty program design - Consumer journey creation - Channel and messaging strategy - Development of KPI frameworks Responsible for on-time and on-budget project delivery Work closely with client teams and senior stakeholders, leading strategy engagements Account Management - high visibility across the client organization and projects; ability to build relationships with key stakeholdersPrioritize, communicate, problem-solve and bring positive energy to a focused and proactive team.  Key Skills And Experience 10+ years of experience in marketing preferably at an agency At least 3 years of experience with customer strategy, retention and data-driven marketing with experience in at least two (2) of the following: Loyalty program design and development Consumer journey mapping and experience design Retention marketing and CRM campaign management Marketing analytics and reporting- Channel and messaging strategy across website, social, ecommerce in APAC, including an understanding of various social platforms like WeChat, Line, KaKaoTalk etc. Ability to independently make smart decisions that balance client needs with business priorities Manage business, marketing and technology stakeholders at multiple levels within client organizations to influence decisions Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university; Masters degree preferred. Strong MS PowerPoint skills and ability to present to business and technical audiences, including CXOs Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills A self-starting orientation within a fast-paced environment with an intense desire/drive to “make things happen” Team leadership – ability to manage teams This job description is a summary of the essential functions of the job, not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of all possible job responsibilities, tasks, and duties. The responsibilities, tasks, and duties of the jobholder might differ from those outlined in the job description. Other duties, as assigned by the supervisor, might be part of the job.  Working with us  Joining dentsu international, you’ll join a team of 48,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, memorable experiences and opportunities to shape your future.  Inclusion and Diversity  We’re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won’t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That’s what we care about.  So, whether you’re joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.  Keeping connected  Please visit our website to find out more and connect with us on social.  www.dentsu.com Please attach your updated CV/resume with your application for our review. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: Job Description  Nutanix is looking for a passionate entrepreneurial Global System Integrator Business Development Director to help Nutanix drive our mission of delighting customers with Nutanix powered solutions with the top Global Systems Integrator (GSI) partners.  This results-drive role will lead a group of highly motivated will report into the worldwide Global System Integrator (GSI) organization and closely collaborate with regional Sales and technical, marketing, and product and solutions teams.  Day-to-day Responsibilities Will Include Lead a highly motivated business development team responsible for drive=ing activities and initiatives to achieve revenue goals and pipeline goals to, thru, and with the GSI partners. Build true a partnership with GSI -- act as their champion across Nutanix and evangelize Nutanix within the partner. Develop and execute business plans covering relationship building, joint solution development, go-to-market, enablement, and more. Create, nurture and growth relationships across the two companies including executives, account and proposal teams, solution development and delivery organizations, and more. Drive the roadmap of joint solutions/practices development and go-to-market including launch, enablement, demand generation and business development across the team’s GSI partners. Create strong awareness with in Nutanix and GSI on joint offerings. Drive preference for Nutanix in GSI proposals. Conduct regular sales training and enablement session for GSI partners and Nutanix. Help create and drive the adoption of a GSI partner program with clear objectives and benefits for partners. Create the right commercial constructs and own the business governance for your partners. Persuade Nutanix and partner teams to jointly go-to-market using best practices. Define and track business metrics and conduct regular business reviews with the team and GSI partners. Drive executive briefings with Nutanix and GSI partners at the corporate and regional levels. Experience And Requirements  - Senior level executive demonstrating a strong level of expertise in building a business with and through Global System Integrators or strategic partners. Well organized with track record of managing global teams and developing and consistently executing on focused plans. Excellent written and spoken communication skills. Ability to communicate and build strong relationship with all levels of an organization. Excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills and the ability to inspire others to act without using explicit authority. Knowledgeable about infrastructure and cloud solutions, IT services management, end-user computing, databases, and more. Strategic thinker and problem solver -- ability to plan and play out different scenarios to maximize growth. Hands-on and can-do “does what it takes” attitude to drive success. Does this sound like you? Do you want to join a fast paced, high growth, exciting team? Let’s talk!  About Us  Founded in 2009 and headquartered in San Jose, California, Nutanix is a passionate team of 6000+ employees worldwide. Our people (we call ourselves “Nutants”) are the heartbeat  of #LifeAtNutanix and one of the many things that makes Nutanix a great place to work at. We share an intellectual curiosity, a bias for action, and an obsession for our customers. We are builders and problem solvers with an entrepreneurial spirit. Above all, we celebrate what makes each of us unique.  We are humbled to be recognized as one of Bloomberg’s Top 50 Companies to Watch in 2020 and one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2020.  We’re growing fast and disrupting the computing industry. Join us and make your mark.  About Our Business  Nutanix is a global leader in cloud software and a pioneer in hyperconverged infrastructure solutions, making computing invisible anywhere. Companies around the world use Nutanix software to leverage a single platform to manage any app, at any location, at any scale for their private, hybrid and multi-cloud environments.  We’re an equal opportunity employer  Nutanix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and (in the U.S.) an Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or any other category protected by applicable law. We hire and promote individuals solely on the basis of qualifications for the job to be filled.  We strive to foster an inclusive working environment that enables all our Nutants to be themselves and to do great work in a safe and welcoming environment, free of unlawful discrimination, intimidation or harassment.  As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If you need a reasonable accommodation, please let us know by contacting CandidateAccommodationRequests@nutanix.com.

description: Company Introduction: Matrixport is Asia’ fastest growing one-stop digital asset financial services platform. With $10 billion in assets under management and custody, it provides one-stop crypto financial services with over $5 billion in average monthly trading volumes. The offerings include Cactus Custody™, spot OTC, fixed income, structured products, lending as well as asset management. Headquartered in Singapore, Matrixport’s mission is to make crypto easy for everyone and its motto is “Get More From Your Crypto”. The company has over 220 employees serving both institutions and retail customers in Asia and Europe.  Why Join us: At Matrixport, we believe that teamwork allows us to tackle complex challenges together. Every team player is valued, has a voice that can be heard and a contribution that can be made. You can expect to make a difference and have direct impact towards the success of the company. We seek the passionate and the courageous who can imbue their expertise into the crypto community and build a better product for the next one billion users.  Responsibilities Lead a team of marketing and BD professionals to achieve the goal of Bit.com's user and revenue growth; Set mid-term and short-term global retail user acquisition objectives of the exchange; Plan, implement and manage marketing strategies (including but not limited to social media marketing, influencer marketing, content marketing, educational program, partnership etc.); Design, plan and execute effective marketing campaigns; Work closely with sales team, product team and product operation team to funnel back client feedbacks and continuously improve product feature and user experience.  Requirements Hold leadership roles with financial platforms with a focus on retail user base; More than 7 years experience in the retail CFD, retail FX or any other retail derivative industry; Demonstrated track record to build the user base from scratch or have powered 1-100 growth; Good understanding of financial products such as derivatives (futures and options); Interested in crypto industry; Good command of both Mandarin and English; Good communication and people management skills; Being able to travel

jobTitle: Principal Partner Business Development Specialist, Analytics - ASEAN
description: Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a world class partner and alliance leader to join the Data and Analytics partner team to lead business development efforts System Integrator (SI), Channel, and Consulting Partners. As a Principal Partner Development Specialist (PDS) for Analytics in ASEAN, you will have an exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to accelerate adoption of AWS within Data, Analytics, and Advanced Analytics practices of strategic SIs while mentoring a world-class team of other Partner Development Specialists focused on the same mission. You will help them develop capabilities, AWS powered data, analytics and BI offerings, develop and execute go-to-market and enablement plans, leading to healthy business pipeline, joint customer wins and market success.  Establishing secure and optimized data, analytics, and BI architectures on AWS Cloud is strategically important for our customers. In this role, you will work with partners to help them build growth oriented and strategically focused practices to deliver on these customer and market expectations. In this endeavor, you will collaborate with a number of AWS internal teams including partner managers, solution architects, sales, product, BD, marketing, and solution teams to position and deliver these capabilities internally and to customers. You will be responsible for building Analytics practice plans for each partner and owning the execution of all elements of the plan including but not limited to enablement, GTMs, sales plays, executive alignment, supporting strategic deals, and relationship governance. AWS Data and Analytics organization will look to you as the expert on your managed partners and to drive AWS market success through them. You will also act as a mentor to the regional analytics PDS team, bringing your substantial experience in coaching and guiding the team into delivering customer and partner success.  You should have a multi-faceted background to succeed in this position including a deep understanding of SI/Consulting business, selling software and consulting projects into enterprise customers, and building alliances between technology and consulting organizations. Ideally this expertise would have been acquired in similar positions at other enterprise software companies or working within SI organizations while engaging closely with technology firms. Additionally, you should have a deep understanding of the data, analytics, and BI technology landscape and dynamics, and a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, process, and technical challenges, as well as build and convey compelling business cases and value propositions.  Key Responsibilities Working with cross functional partner and AWS teams, build and drive analytics business plans which serve as blueprints for a partner’s growth Understand SI strategy and help build and drive go to market initiatives to support differentiation, customer wins, and market success Drive partner pipeline and customer wins through focused sales plays, GTMs, and campaigns Work with technical teams on both sides to identify, develop, and launch value add solutions/offerings which showcase SI capabilities and AWS technologies Create and drive enablement plans for SI teams in support of business needs Support SI market expansion in new geographies, vertical segments, and use cases by aligning with respective AWS teams and growth strategies Prepare and deliver business reviews to AWS and partner senior leaders including business metrics, goal achievements, and overall health of business 25% travel expected for partner meetings, supporting GTMs and meeting customers  Basic Qualifications 15+ years of sales, consulting, partner management, or business development in the data, analytics, or BI space Experience in shaping and driving data and analytics consulting alliances. Candidate should understand challenges, dynamics, and mechanisms to structure and drive success through such relationships Understanding of prevailing business and technology trends and solutions in cloud data, analytics & BI space that either inhibit or accelerate enterprise adoption across different analytics use cases. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail with the ability to set clear priorities in a fast paced, dynamic work environment Preferred Qualifications Experience in building data, analytics, and BI business with consulting partners for other technology providers in the analytics market. Experience in mentoring or managing a team focused on partner management. Experience with AWS partners and understanding of AWS partner ecosystem Understanding of cloud infrastructure and AWS data, analytics and BI services Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore Job ID: A1533740

description: About Us  WeWork began in 2010 with a vision to build the first global physical platform designed to bring people together. Today, we offer access to a desk, an office, a headquarters, or an entire building in hundreds of cities around the world; with over a third of the Fortune 500 companies being part of the WeWork community.  Leasing Director / Senior Leasing Director  This Role Has Three Main Areas Of Responsibility  This “player-coach” position will be accountable for sales and top-line revenue in 10-15 WeWork buildings by driving new sales and renewals.  Direct Sales, including: Owning the full sales cycle for new and renewing members in 50p+ offices. This involves pitching, touring, negotiating, and executing contracts Generating new sales pipeline for 50p+ offices (including working with the Broker Development team) Content Expertise, including: Market: knowing the “ins and out” of local market, inclusive of tenants-in-market, pricing and nearby competitors Portfolio: intimate knowledge of the assigned portfolio, including being able to speak to financial performance and areas of opportunity / improvement Product: knowing the “ins and outs” of WeWork’s physical spaces, value prop & platform Community: building and maintaining relationships with brokers, major members / potential new members, and key internal teams (e.g., Community teams, Facilities teams) Deal structure: ability to creatively structure deals to optimize sales outcomes and understanding how different deal structures relate to WeWork’s overall business objectives and building underwritings Overseeing Leasing Manager Sales team, including: Supporting and mentoring the Leasing Manager sales team on direct sales of <50p offices Holding Leasing Manager sales team accountable to direct sales of <50p offices Ensuring the Leasing Manager sales team has expert knowledge of their assigned buildings Ensuring the Leasing Manager sales team has material knowledge in other critical areas (e.g., WeWork value prop and business objectives, cross functional relationships)  Qualifications & Experience  4+ years of full cycle quota carrying direct sales experience or equivalent experience Real Estate experience strongly preferred Local broker relationships strongly preferred Experience managing individual contributors preferred Local market knowledge required; 2+ years residence in market strongly preferred Ability to use WeWork data systems and produce reports market performance preferred Proficiency in Salesforce Strategic thinker and problem solver with strong interpersonal skills and presence Entrepreneurial & resilient mindset  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Your primary responsibility is to lead a team of cloud growth advisors to generate demand in growing the cloud footprint by delivery immediate value to the customer by delivering a well-defined cloud adoption plan. You will work closely with C-suite stakeholders, contributing vision to the customer's cloud strategy, and becoming a trusted business partner by developing the right solutions to meet the business needs.  You will support the customer in leading the organizational change within the cloud journey and drive large, multiple, and/or highly complex business solutions and strategy for targeted customers focused on Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform and hybrid multi-cloud solutions.    Key Responsibilities  Establishing close working relationships, trust, and become an advisor to C suite's in the customer organization. Helping the customer to create the cloud/application strategy and roadmap (which includes single and multi-cloud vs on-prem vs hybrid). The ability to breakdown complex customer pain points and the ability to articulate the cloud value proposition in sales Working with the product development, enterprise architects and product specialist to develop a well define cloud blueprint. The responsibility includes Building technology roadmaps for the customer organization, which support their digitalization of the IT transformation journey. Building high-level target architectures for our customers Supporting CDO / digital initiatives to enable fast application development Evangelizing cloud operating model and act as an IT agility change agent Supporting the creation of compliance and security approach for cloud  Building TCO case studies for cloud adoption and migration Helping organizations to tackle integration strategy/hybrid scenarios Advising on the procurement process, and considerations for new consumption methods (for example contracting, OPEX vs. CAPEX) Creating strategic plans with Delivery Day 1 and Day 2 (Project & Program) Managers, sales colleagues, and senior customer stakeholders to build out the delivery roadmap for cloud    As part of account management and sales responsibility,  Monitor the revenue pipeline and leads of Singtel key accounts, adjusting as necessary to create sustainable growth Develop growth strategies with the executive teams working on strategies around account planning and strategies Develop and implement robust sales management processes - pipeline for cloud managed services, account planning, and proposals. Lead Prospect and manage close relationships with key target clients.   Work closely with Channel/Partner/Product Development -- adding new sales channels and 3rd party resellers and partners. In addition, the role must work closely with Global Products and Cybersecurity Business Units to broaden the cloud portfolio with network and security propositions.  Strengthen our organizational capabilities and talent to support cloud sales across Global Enterprise (GE) Customer Facing Units (CFU)      Education & Qualification  Masters Level / Bachelor in business, computer science, information technology or related field preferred with 15 years of experiences 10 or more years of business consulting in cloud, technical consulting, or sales solutions experience Experience working with the technology industry, explicitly handling significantly sized accounts Experience working with cloud solution/product portfolios Experience in managing customer accounts and experience developing winning sales solutions and proposals through consultative selling Significant implementation experience on the AWS, Microsoft Azure platform, Google Cloud Platform and hybrid cloud environment. Experience with Cloud Management Platforms (CMP's) and automation tools such as Puppet, Chef, Terraform, CloudFormation, SNOW, etc. Experience working with enterprise management systems, ITIL service delivery, and service desk integration Experience working with the business environment, business industry and competitor products and services Working knowledge of large cloud deals based on AWS, Azure and GCP    Technical /Professional Certifications  The following cloud certifications are highly desired: AWS Certified Solution Architect - Professional AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional Microsoft Certified - Azure Solutions Architect Expert Microsoft Certified - Azure DevOps Engineer Expert Microsoft and/or Amazon and/or Google specialist certifications ITIL, CISSP or other relevant certifications are desirable Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries Strong understanding of CloudOps, DevOps is a plus Familiarity with standard enterprise services (Directory Services, Information Assurance, Virtual Desktop, etc.), products (i.e., Oracle, SAP) and frameworks (ITIL, TOGAF, etc.)

jobTitle: VP/SVP – Head of Sales Training, Retail Banking
description: Description  A leading international full bank continues to expand on their retail banking presence and digital footprints across Asia region. They continue to invest in their employees including strengthening the learning and development agenda. They are now looking for a Head of Sales Training for their consumer banking business in Singapore.  Responsibilities  You will be responsible for end to end training of sales enablement for the bank’s consumer banking segment. This is a highly visible role where you will make an impact with strategically developing and implementing the design, framework and methodology of a learning curriculum that is aligned with the bank’s strategic customer agenda, and manage the implementation of learning initiatives and programs for the region. You will work closely with the Service Transformation team to understand human-centric design of customer insights and AI to translate into a fulfilling training for the bank.  Requirements  You have at least a Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 10 -15 years of relevant learning and development experience in a regulated financial institution, ideally with a background of sales or business development. You should have experience designing curriculums from scratch, and implementing it regionally. Prior sales experience will be advantageous. You should be a self-motivated, people-oriented individual with an ability to thrive in fast-moving environments. You are passionate in training and have strong communication skills.  To Apply  Please submit your resume to Emily Tan at et@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number ET21333. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. jobTitle: CIB - Sales & Marketing - Financial Institution Sales - Executive Director
description: As a strategic partner with a long-standing commitment and proven experience, J.P. Morgan takes a consultative approach to working with existing clients and target prospects to assess and address their individual needs.  As an Executive Director in Sales you will be responsible for maintain and development of key investor client relationships, including day-to-day execution of all products we are responsible for distribution. You will be need the ability to be fluent and navigate in these products effectively among a broad range of clients (asset managers, insurance accounts, pension funds, banks, sovereign wealth funds, corporations, hedge funds etc.) along with idea generation and market insight. In addition, you will bring a collaborative approach working with our business partners in both trading, research and syndicate to provide comprehensive client coverage across the platform.  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Bachelor's degree required 7+ years of sales experience in a relevant investment banking / markets sales role Able to understand, transact, price and understand FX and Fixed Income products Has been in a client facing role in the relevant products Developed and established relationships with key investment grade investor clients at both trading and portfolio management levels Critical thinker and driver of trade concepts and themes for investor clients Strong understanding of fundamental product knowledge and market structure Clear, logical thinker with strong qualitative skill set including; effective communication and presentation Strong team player that partners well with principals of the platform including Research and Trading The candidate needs to be able to deal confidently with people at all levels in the organization The individual should be self-motivated, with the drive and skill to seek out new client opportunities and produce thoughtful trade ideas Strong proficiency in Bloomberg, MarketAxess, Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. description: Location: Singapore  Direct Reporting Manager: Head of Operations, APAC and matrix into Head of P&C, APAC  Role Purpose:  The Commercial Operations Manager (APAC) is responsible for policy related support for the P&C + A&H Corporate segments and helping lead the team(s) providing admin services to Underwriters.  Supporting activities, include but are not limited to, the reporting of service metrics, business analysis, roll-out of COG/regional priorities and the development of operational strategy – covering opportunities to improve service and drive operational effectiveness. To embed best practice, this role also has responsibility for training out / championing of relevant systems usage / adoption as well as process / procedural standards - sharing tips & tricks. Drive service excellence within country operations teams who provide admin services to Underwriters around renewals (Underwriting Centers), pre/post-bind support (Underwriting Assistants & Policy Admin) and the inbound handling of quotes (Submission Desks).  Also, to coordinate the delivery of support models to Sales Partners (brokers, agents, etc.) such as Concierge Desk.   Key Responsibilities:  1.    Commercial Segment Support (~20% focus)  Develop and own the operational strategy for P&C + A&C Corporate – covering opportunities to improve / establish service and drive operational effectiveness to help enable business outcomes and address customer needs. Share operational best practice across the region in terms of operating models, process automation/robotics, process re-engineering, digitization, and offshoring.   Provide convenient and value add insights around service and quality metrics and follow up to resolve issues. Produce regular reporting to stakeholders of achievements versus targets.  Diagnose underperformance and implement remediation plans. Provide ad-hoc business analysis and project management to support commercial change efforts / plans. Lead the roll-out of relevant COG/regional priorities within the Commercial operation.   2.    Drive Application Best Practice (~30% focus)  Tools within scope include Work View and Portal plus other internal regional systems used to predominately (or exclusively) serve commercial customers. Understand business activities (non-tech), engage with a diverse range of people and very proactively share user cases / best practice to improve knowledge & consistency of usage.   Own the outcome of application usage and develop strategies to drive adoption and consistency of use.  Provide insights around any usage variation to aid improvement. Minimise variation in handling times and provide confidence that new systems are at least as good as legacy tools in terms of operational effectiveness. Challenge ways of working and queue structures to help embed operational effectiveness. Work to identify training resources and a rolling timeline of training (new joiner + refresher) but develop scalable / repeatable education methods. Support/lead the development and maintenance of standard operating procedures, guides and training collateral. Act as the conduit for change and enhancements– in terms of helping with requirements definition, change readiness, testing and implementation hand holding.   Help review change requests (as needed) to ensure clear cost benefit understanding is provided and join/lead governance forums as needed.   3.    Service Excellence (~50% focus)  Drive service excellence within country operations teams who provide admin support to Underwriters around renewals (Underwriting Centers), pre/post-bind support (Underwriting Assistants & Policy Admin) and the inbound handling of quotes (Submission Desks).  Also, to coordinate the delivery of support models to Sales Partners (brokers, agents, etc.) such as Concierge Desk. Underwriting Centres - build the renewals engine room to drive retention rates, free up Underwriters to focus on new/specialist and bring operational effectiveness to current book.   Underwriting Assistants - build and lead a team of UA’s to complete quasi-underwriting tasks for New Business, Endorsements, Renewals, and Cancellations.   Policy Administration - Lead the teams handling policy fulfilment processing (booking to financial systems, policy document production and delivery, policy admin systems, etc.). Submissions Desk - Support the receipt, registration, and recording of new business submissions in preparation for underwriting – in a market facing manner for flow business. Concierge Desk – build and operate a service/support team to handle and resolve enquiries and issues raised by sales partners using our market-facing systems (e.g. broker portal, ePlacement tools, etc).     Plus, other duties, projects or functions assigned by the Regional Head of Operations, APAC.  As a leader of people, ensure individual team members are coached / developed and that they are equipped with the right skills and resources. Establish an environment that promotes Chubb Values, and builds high levels of motivation, morale and integrity.
industries: Insurance

description: Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”  If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.  What We Do  We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.  Overview  This is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned software sales leader who has solid experience in the FSI domain to join a leading MNC in the analytics space and drive our success to its next level.  You will lead a team of experienced account executives to drive revenue growth of FSI practice in Singapore. This includes formulating and implementing strategic business plans to achieve corporate and team objectives, developing and strengthening client relationship, as well as nurturing a high-performing culture within the team.  3 Best Things About This Job Opportunity to manage top tier banks, plus joint-stock banks / major regional banks headquartered in Singapore. Along with the booming market of AI and Big Data Analytics worldwide, this role could help strategize and unlock considerable opportunities for SAS solutions in the FSI space. This is a critical leadership role in SAS Singapore and there will be a broad array of career advancement opportunities for the successful candidate. Primary Responsibilities Responsible for achievement of total software revenue target and management business objectives (MBOs) Plans and implements growth plans for software, consulting services, and education services. Directs management of sales and sales support activities for staff members to implement growth plans and sales activities. Develop and implement marketing, sales and business development plans to exceed target levels. Generate new business through strategic selling and managing relationships with key customers. Assigns appropriate sales goals and assignments to sales staff; determines optimal utilization of staff and resources to achieve sales goals. Responsible for communication with sales management team to coordinate account strategies. Responsible for hiring, directing and evaluating sales team. Works in conjunction with the Strategic Pricing Group to negotiate contracts and bids. Formulate business plan to support the business development process. Determines equitable sales assignments. Responsible for timely and accurate forecasting (PTG) of software, consulting services, and education services. Ensures team alignment toward BASE sales approach and utilization of Orion, Account Plans and Opportunity Plan development. Additional Responsibilities Analyzes and implements company sales initiatives at the national industry level and develops short and long-term plans to address industry and competitor trends. Participates in large scale negotiations and interfaces with senior management at customer sites using office-to-office selling techniques. Manages large, complex, non-standard implementations. Sought by Customer Executives as a trusted advisor to solve complex business problems. Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Proven ability to manage, negotiate, and close multiple complex sales opportunities that may be international in scope. Demonstrated understanding of strategic sales techniques and principles, specifically in the software industry, as well as selling to Fortune 500 companies and/or large governmental institutions based on knowledge of corporate/government software acquisition cycles and buying influences. Demonstrated capability to effectively allocate regional resources to meet sales objectives. Demonstrated knowledge in the FSI space, preferably banking sector. Excellent people skills; strong learning agility and leadership. Education  Bachelor's degree preferably in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or quantitative field.  Experience Typically requires fifteen years of experience in software sales, including nine years in a leadership role, coordinating and/or supervising technical projects within the technology industry and five years in a formal management role. Demonstrated experience in successfully and consistently achieving sales target. Experience of managing top tier banks highly preferred. Good network with senior executives of major banks advantageous. Why SAS We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference. Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring. To qualify, applicants must be legally authorised to work in Singapore and should not require sponsorship for employment visa status. All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com . SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Management Consulting

description: Description  Position at WorldFirst  Key Responsibilities  Growth planning, strategy development and implementation Working within the parameters of the Global World First Strategy; develop, agree and implement customer acquisition strategies to maximize turnover and revenue opportunities across all channels. Work closely with business leaders to identify effective lead generation channels to support the sales acquisition funnel. Build collaborative relationships with key support functions, locally and at Head Office to ensure success. Analyze customer journey, conversion and related business data to identify problems or opportunities to improve key KPIs, OKRs Managing scale. We need to grow, mine opportunities, upsell new products, identify attrition, understand pricing sensitivities, manage touchpoints, provide customers with relevant information. We have to do this digitally and with scale. Be responsible for a target for growth on key KPI’s: New transacted customers Traits And Skillsets Result-oriented – able to achieve the KPI of delivering numbers (new customers) amid challenges, uncertainties and constraints in resources Proven experience in acquiring Business Customers doing cross-border businesses that are our targeted customers with cross-border payment/receiving needs Innovative – can leverage traditional digital/non-digital channels as well as non-traditional ways to reach our targeted customers Data-driven – Quickly implement initiatives, look at results and adjust/pivot accordingly Work with Sales and other teams to make sure that the leads generated are the right targets and drive them to convert leads into customers Strategic yet hands-on – a senior position that both can decide what to do as well as actually executing on it Requirements Around 5-10 years of marketing, growth experience, ideally in a fast-paced, fast-growing environment Excellent business acumen & highly analytical with a data-driven approach Experience working in e-commerce, payments or technology industry is preferred A problem solver, with a strong sense of ownership, acute analytical skills and capable of identifying key business metrics Results-oriented, extremely proactive & highly responsive with great attention to detail Highly organized, able to prioritize
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About The Company  MilkRun is a crowd-sourcing delivery start-up providing last-mile logistics solutions to SMEs and corporate clients by connecting delivery demand with delivery partner supply in the market.  Get To Know The Role  As a Chief of Staff, you will be actively involved in strategizing and planning for business development and marketing, operational excellence, overseas market expansion and product roadmap planning. You will be responsible for the execution and successful implementation of the various strategies and performance reporting mechanisms.  The Day-to-day Activities Develop and maintain a solid understanding of the products and services MilkRun offers and market MilkRun’s strong value proposition as the leader of choice for merchants and delivery partners Develop and implement demand generation strategy including business opportunity identification, go-to-market planning, partnerships, account management, and execution strategy. Work with Sales and BD team for successful execution. Lead in Marketing planning for driver acquisition through digital levers and work with functional team for execution and go-live of marketing campaigns Design and implement performance reporting for Sales, BD, Marketing and Operation teams and facilitate weekly team review for improvements and further streamlining of current business operations Champion operational excellence to identify opportunities for process improvement, optimize current process to streamline the operations flow and enhance productivity gains Participate in product roadmap prioritization and directly coordinate with Engineering team for product scoping, wireframing, logic, user acceptance testing to ensure robust product go-live. Collect from functional teams and from the platforms users on product improvement feedback via but not limited to conducting focus groups Take an active part in overseas market expansion planning and go-to-market execution, including market analysis on country and city prioritization, planning on financial projection and milestone deliverables against timeline, office and team set-up, product and business go-live The Must Haves Strategic thinking and go-to-market execution experience with technology products Experience with technology start-ups is a plus Excellent interpersonal skills and problem-solving abilities Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English. Proficiency in spoken Mandarin or Dialect is an advantage Proficient in Microsoft Office (MS. Excel, MS. Word and MS. PowerPoint) Self-driven and entrepreneurial; ability to own outcomes and make things happen Passionate about making an impact to the business and stakeholders. Accountable and responsible in discharging duties Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment Ability to work and lead across functional teams to deliver complex and strategic projects
industries: Internet, Consumer Services, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Business Development Director (Strategic Insurance and Healthcare)
description: About NTT Data Singapore  We are a top 6 global IT services company with operations in 50+ countries. We offer an advanced portfolio of application, business process, cloud, and infrastructure services to businesses and governments worldwide.  NTT DATA Singapore PTE Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTT DATA Corp, a part of NTT Group, the world’s 65th Largest Company according to Fortune Magazine. The Singapore entity of NTT DATA is an S10 government-registered supplier and forms the core of NTT DATA’s APAC operations and is positioned as a gateway of our global capabilities in Singapore and the APAC region.  At NTT DATA SINGAPORE, we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunity employer that puts our people and clients first. We welcome different ideas, backgrounds and passionate individuals to join us in our inclusive environment to achieve stronger and better results through teamwork, foresight, and innovation. We pledge to create a harmonious and nurturing culture, where all individuals feel a sense of pride and belonging, regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity.  Responsibilities  The company is growing exponentially and is looking to hire a senior business development executive to lead Insurance and Healthcare sales teams. The right individual will possess the ability to speak to a business audience and articulate clearly our company’s value proposition as well as Insurance and Healthcare solution offerings in client/new business scenarios and also be comfortable to drive deeper into solution conversations and sales opportunities.  Insurance Sector Establish the account plans for strategic Japanese customers in the Insurance sector by working with the Global Headquarter’s (GHQ) account management team in Japan and sales teams in respective entities and countries for our strategic customers, as defined by GHQ. Establish and grow the relationships with our strategic customers by approaching the customer senior management team and agree on mid and long-term investment plans based on the customer’s strategy. Lead and grow pipelines and close deals to achieve business KPIs. Support the delivery teams to complete projects successfully and manage customer expectations. Report and work with both our Global and Regional Headquarters to get appropriate support to extend the business for these strategic customers. Continue to grow the business with the strategic customers and in addition, establish a business plan on an industry basis to expand the business to other such customers. Healthcare sector Establish the account plans for strategic private clinic groups/hospitals by working with the Global Headquarter’s (GHQ) Industry management team in Japan. Establish and grow the relationships with our strategic customers or Japanese trading companies as investor by approaching the customer/investor senior management and agree on mid and long-term investment plans based on the customer’s strategy. Lead and grow pipelines and close deals to achieve business KPIs. Support the delivery teams to complete projects successfully and manage customer expectations. Report and work with both our Global and Regional Headquarters to get appropriate support to extend the business for these strategic customers. Work with the local Healthcare teams to aggregate industry capability. Others To support other banking teams, establish and retain the relationship with several important Japanese customers in banking sector by approaching to the customer senior management. Requirements Master’s degree in related field More than 10 years of experience in account-based IT sales with Japanese customers (BFSI, Enterprise, Healthcare) At least 5-10 years of experience in sales of ERP, HCM, BPR solutions (Workflow, RPA), infra solutions, consulting service, some domain based solution such as EMR. At least 3-5 years of experience in sales to manage several Japanese multinational customers in APAC and to approach Regional Headquarters and its subsidiaries in each country. At least 3-5 years of experience in IT system development and solution development for business process re-engineering (procurement, sales, inventory, administration etc.). Experience in business development to establish healthcare business in APAC. Fundamental understanding of several business process to define As-Is/To-Be of customer’s business process to be proposed in sales phase. Fundamental consulting skills to establish mid-long term IT investment plan to be agreed with customer based on customer’s strategy. Strong customer engagement skills as sales to retain long-term relationship with specific customers. Critical thinking skills to get into the point and focus on impactful initiatives Strong leadership skills to influence and direct stakeholders Communication skills to liaise with multiple stakeholders Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Japanese proficiency in both speaking and writing to act as client branding touch point for Japanese clients in APAC. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Responsibilities Grow the reefer, special cargo and dangerous goods segment ex Asia in line with Hapag-Lloyd 2023 Niche market strategy. Drive performance across the Region to ensure that budget targets are met. Running forecasting process across the Region for all three segments. Create efficient and effective tools and processes that enables the front line sales organization to react quickly to changing market dynamics. Establish marketing plans for each segment together with the country organizations and ensure follow-up. Pricing of Special Cargo ex Asia and issuing pricing guidelines for the Region. Conduct market studies and drive business development for the Region to help assess the potential for each segment ex Asia. Review and optimize operational processes for sales and customer service as well as allocation handling related to the Niche Product segment. Meet customers to ascertain feedback on working procedures to allow direct adjustment and changes to SOP‘s and explore business opportunities. Requirements Degree with minimum 8 years of experience Experience in shipping with knowledge of field operations Proven leadership skills in a team environment Strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize and effectively manage multiple tasks/projects and stakeholders Effective decision making, sound judgment, and initiative. Feeling comfortable working in a high paced environment. Strong analytical and problem solving skills
