jobTitle: Head of Business Development, Apigee, Google Cloud - Singapore
description: The area: Google Cloud  Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.  The role: Head of Business Development, Apigee, Google Cloud - Singapore  Apigee Edge is an advanced API platform that enables enterprises to create, manage, secure and scale APIs. Using Apigee, enterprises can design and deploy API proxies in public and private clouds, secure data in transit with OAuth 2.0, SAML and two-way TLS, protect against traffic spikes by adding dynamic routing, caching and rate-limiting policies to APIs, and measure the success of both API operations and API business with end-to-end analytics.  As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help businesses of all sizes leverage technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.  Additional Role Description  As the Head of Business Development for Apigee in APAC, you will define the strategy for growth across the region, build out a cross-functional team, build key relationships with C-level executives and showcase Google’s innovation and technology solutions to our potential customers.  You'll work closely with Google Cloud sales leaders and be a collaborative thought partner to ensure productive sales engagement across the region. You will also partner with other functional teams across Product, Legal, Compliance, Operations, and Enablement to remove barriers and ensure flawless execution and success of the customer engagement.  Your goal will be to build and lead a team to identify the highest potential customers for Google Cloud Apigee by attracting, negotiating, and generating opportunities, and growing the business.  Responsibilities Establish and develop strategic C-level relationships and develop a Go-to-Market strategy to optimize Google technologies and products to help our customers transform their business through Apigee and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) technologies. Manage and optimize pipeline and other opportunities through innovative solutions that leverage the GCP stack and maximize potential from these strategic customers. Work with customers in developing unique solutions that leverage their unique IT footprint to drive desired customer outcomes. Define measures of success with each customer and use data to analyze success. Predict and manage the evolution of our customer relationships, and build and grow relationships with executives. Work collaboratively with Google Cloud and other Google teams in delivering long-term value through customer partnerships. Define, review, and agree to a clear set of priorities, joint initiatives, and roadmap with our customers. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 15 years of experience in direct sales leadership, business development, and/or channel sales with customer connections in APAC. Experience working in business development related to software as a service, middleware, mobile applications or similar technology solutions. Preferred Qualifications Experience with all aspects of the sales cycle, including qualifying accounts. Experience with exceeding strategic goals and delivering results. Ability to quickly understand products and effectively identify how it can provide value to a prospective customer. Ability to effectively operate within a dynamic and fast-growing company. Ability to adapt to change. Excellent relationship building skills that extend to internal team members in pre- and post-sales.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Position: Director, ASEAN SP Sales  Position Reporting: Directly to Senior Director, ASEAN & Taiwan  Location: Singapore or ASEAN countries  About Juniper Networks:  Juniper Networks was founded on a simple but exceptionally powerful vision for the future of the network: “Connect everything. Empower everyone.” This ideal is the commitment of the company and the mission that drives every Juniper colleague every day. Our high-performance network infrastructure helps service providers, enterprises, and public sector organizations build value and accelerate business success within the new, changing global marketplace. Our products and technology run the world’s largest and most demanding global networks. Juniper Networks [NYSE: JNPR] is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, with nearly 9,000+ dedicated employees and offices in nearly 50 countries. Our customers include the top 100 global service providers, 30,000 enterprises, including 99 of the Global Fortune 100, as well as hundreds of federal, state, and local government agencies and higher education organizations.  Why Juniper?  Our vision is for Juniper Networks to become a multi-generational community that empowers people to accomplish the impossible. This requires a perspective that is multi-generational, thinking beyond the markets and products of today and tomorrow to the values that enable a community to prosper for generations. We value trust, integrity, respect, humility, and excellence. We're looking for people who live the values of our culture and can bring our vision to life.  Who we are:  Juniper Networks brings simplicity to networking with products, solutions, and services that connect the world! Through engineering innovation, we remove the constraints and complexities of networking in the cloud era to solve the toughest challenges our customers and partners face daily. At Juniper Networks we believe that the network is a resource for sharing knowledge and human advancement that changes the world. We are committed to imagining groundbreaking ways to deliver automated, scalable, and secure networks to move at the speed of business!  Juniper Networks is at the heart of transformation with its industry-leading technologies that are ever more software-defined, helping to answer the most challenging issues in connectivity. Digital transformation is everywhere, with technologies such as Multi-Cloud, Cybersecurity, Automation, IoT, AI, Machine Learning, and 5G driving the next waves of innovation.  Director – ASEAN Service Provider Sales  Position Overview: Preferably based in Singapore, the Director will lead a team of account managers across Southeast Asia countries to drive incremental growth in Service Provider segment for ASEAN. She/he will be responsible for the assigned product sales achievement plus services across the ASEAN region. The position reports to the Senior Director, ASEAN & Taiwan. The Director is a key member of ASEAN & Taiwan leadership team.  Key Responsibilities: Developing the regional sales strategy and direction for driving incremental growth in ASEAN Service Provider segment and making sure the growth aligned with the global service provider sales strategy and regional customers’ demand. Applying both tactical and strategic go-to-market models aimed at growing the customer base both in the short and long terms to drive healthy revenues, customer growth and customer satisfaction and retention. Developing new and incremental business including penetrating in strategic new logos, selling transformation technology in existing accounts, striking large and complex deals in partnership with area leaders, sales, engineers and services. Influencing, engaging, and enabling appropriate partners and channels in support of our service provider go-to-market strategy. Aligning with the product divisions, marketing, channels, customer services and operations to ensure service provider business needs in ASEAN to be met. Enabling service provider sales in the field by providing guide, advice, training and cadenced communication. Driving performance, team development and talent acquisition. Challenge status quo and continuously identify processes and approaches to be improved or enhanced. Develop and execute the ASEAN service provider plan to drive growth and share of wallet.  Ideal Experience : At least 20 years of direct sales and leadership experience. Experience selling complex solutions to service provider customers required. Able to work and achieve the desired result in a complex and matrix organization. Deep understanding of ASEAN culture and service provider segment. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong business relationships with internal and external stakeholders at senior levels. Strong business acumen coupled with the ability to adapt to changing business conditions to offer our clients & stakeholders an exceptional level of service and meeting our business objectives. Strong leadership with the ability to inspire members in direct and extended teams. Executive presence with excellent written and oral communication skills. Demonstrated ability to clearly communicate complex topics. Demonstrable track record of building and growing new and high achieving sales teams for long term success.
industries: Computer & Network Security, Computer Networking, and Telecommunications

description: Description In this senior individual contributor position, you will be responsible for providing Oracle’s strategic customers with the guidance and support needed to ensure successful, and effective use of Oracle’s products and services. The Strategic Technical Account Management (TAM) will drive a high degree of satisfaction, reference ability and protect/enhance revenue streams with their assigned customers. He or she will advocate for the customer and become a trusted advisor aligning with customer stakeholders up to and including C-Level. They will coordinate activities with the Strategic Client Director and other Oracle stakeholders to support implementation of Oracle’s account strategy for the customer.  Responsibilities Build significant long-term relationships with key customer contacts Have a thorough understanding of the customer’s Oracle landscape and work collaboratively with the Strategic Client Director, Sales, Oracle Support, Oracle Development and Cloud Operations to ensure the best solutions and outcomes for the customer Ensure that customer and Oracle are aligned and prepared to manage reactive situations such as incidents and escalated problems Drive Support Services recommendation implementation across the customer’s Oracle landscape by working with customer stakeholders to ensure appropriate level of sponsorship and prioritization Participate in periodic Account Planning and Account Reviews, track and communicate status on complex projects including risk identification and mitigation recommendations Maintain detailed knowledge and demonstrated execution of Oracle support services and cloud operations Work is non-routine and complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization  Skills Understand the customer’s industry, as well as its technical and infrastructure environment, and translate it into Oracle solutions Subject Matter expertise in industry or key Oracle product(s) Excellent communication and presentation skills; able to communicate and present at Exec C-Level Strong business acumen – entrepreneurial approach Strong networking and relationship building Ability to lead & influence a geographically dispersed team without direct reporting lines at times Expected travel 25 -50% of time  Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required, Master’s degree preferred; ITIL, PMP, Prince2 or equivalent certification preferred Minimum 10 years' experience in senior positions in areas of professional Enterprise Implementation, IT Service Management, Program Management or Account Management Demonstrated strong competency of interpersonal skills, team leadership, business acumen, relationship building and conflict management Demonstrated expertise in large (multi-site or international) transformation projects Experience working Globally with delivery and customer teams is preferred
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Position Summary  SomaLogic is seeking a dynamic, client-focused Regional Director for our pharma, biotech, academic, and government sales channels. This role will be a leader in Asia-Pacific (APAC) in building out and managing the team of sales representatives, developing and executing sales plans for SomaLogic’s innovative platform at all levels of client organizations - from initiation through relationship management. The substrate will be all of SomaLogic’s product suite: currently, the focus is on use of the SomaScan platform as a discovery tool as a service; we are growing the business of putting SomaScan into kits for deployment in client labs; small-plex offerings, virtual and discrete, custom and fixed; and our SomaSignal Tests to monitor and characterize patients during clinical trials and commercialization of pharmaceuticals.  Key Job Responsibilities   Document a strategic plan for the territory, and follow with a detailed tactical plan including details such as team growth, market development and prioritized geographic targets.   Hire and manage sales staff, oversee their day-to-day activities, supporting them to their success.   Introduce SomaLogic's technology to relevant accounts, must be able to evangelize a relatively unknown technology to result in adoption by pharma at all levels of the client organization   Must be able to communicate technical data and information, both to and from accounts   Guide customers through the deal process, from initial contact through value delivery including agreements that require data sharing resulting in content generation for SomaLogic   Manage accounts that are already engaged with SomaLogic, maximizing value from and for them   Manage multiple accounts in a relatively large territory at various stages of the cycle from prospecting through value delivery   Assist with preparation of sales materials and collateral  Qualifications  Education  Bachelor’s Degree required in the life sciences or related field; MBA, MS or PhD is a plus  Skills And Experience   Must have experience hiring and managing sales staff   A demonstrated successful track record in pitching and completing deals with pharma, academia and government   Experience doing deals focused on a technology, preferably a platform technology, with multiple applications in pharma and other life sciences settings   Deep knowledge of the pharmaceutical life cycle - from drug discovery through drug development, and understanding of pain points such that they can be addressed with an applicable technology   Must have demonstrated ability to manage client engagements, at all levels, to ensure delivery of value, and to proliferate use of a technology deeply and broadly throughout accounts   Experience managing negotiations and communications on multiple contracts simultaneously or interfacing with highly-matrixed multi-disciplinary teams to complete contract terms   Ability to work independently in a rapidly evolving environment   Must be within a 1-hour drive of a major metropolitan airport   Preference will be given to candidates located in Singapore, Australia or China  Work Environment   This is a home-based position   Up to 50% travel to forge and maintain alliances; occasional international travel may be required
industries: Computer Software, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Description  Come be a part of redefining the Entertainment industry, but don’t just take our word for it:  “100 Million views and counting: Cocomelon is absolutely dominating Netflix and You Tube”  Forbes 2021  “Moonbug Entertainmet’s rocketing success is disrupting the kids pre-school space”  Licensing.Biz 2021  “Old dogs like Nickolodean is out, Moonbug is in”  The Verge 2021  Moonbug Entertainment is an award-winning global entertainment company behind some of the most popular kids’ titles in the world. Our line-up includes the global sensations CoComelon, Blippi, Little Baby Bum, My Magic Pet Morphle, Supa Strikas, Go Buster, Playtime with Twinkle, Gecko’s Garage, ARPO and many more which are available in 27 languages.  In just three years, we have become a kids programming powerhouse with a library of more than 550 hours of content, which is distributed on more than 100 platforms globally, including YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, Sky, Tencent, Youku and Roku.  In May of 2020, Tubular Labs named Moonbug one of the leading digital kids’ entertainment companies in the world based on the total number of minutes watched worldwide.  The Role:  Moonbug is looking to grow it’s distribution capability by bringing in a a sales executive who will have the ability to leverage the company’s IP across all platforms, whether digital or linear. The Director of Distribution' core responsibility will be to maximise revenues through leveraging intellectual property across SEA (and potentially other regions from time to time). This individual will handle sales to linear & digital platforms, including distribution to free-to-air, cable, and satellite channels and platforms as well as subscription (SVOD), transactional (EST/TVOD), and ad-funded (AVOD) digital businesses. S/He will distribute Moonbug’s existing content as well as initiate, develop and close creative, programming, co-production, format, and content deals that drive brand awareness and revenues from local and regional linear and digital players. S/He will work with potential partners to identify ways to drive a compelling consumer experience that surpasses competitors and also provides optimal revenue opportunities across all screens.  Requirements Initiate, negotiate, and close distribution deals for rights to original, digital, children’s IP with Cable, Satellite, Internet and Mobile platforms as well as broadcasters throughout a variety of business models, including PPV, VOD, SVOD, AVOD and Electronic Sell-Through. Develop and expand Moonbug’s relationships with the European creative community in order to identify co-development and co-production opportunities with international producers, broadcasters, and platforms whether they are one-off opportunities or long-term strategic investments. Will push the expansion of the digital footprint beyond YouTube and that goes from stand-alone OTT services to a cross-platform footprint, including web, mobile & tablets, applications, game consoles and connected TV, as a key driver for a long-term customer strategy. Identify new opportunities for sales as a result of new entrants, changing technology and/or delivery systems, etc. and develop sales strategies targeted specifically to address these specialised needs. Serve to establish and enhance relationships with international broadcasters, producers, telco’s, advertisers, and digital partners, with intention of maximising potential sales of the company’s product. Set targets, strategy, pricing, and windows; review promotions/bundles, title selections, and marketing efforts; and track performance. Conceive, develop and implement product-packaging strategies that include everything from individual programme sales, to branded blocks, to linear channels, all with an eye to maximising revenue opportunities. In necessary markets, identify, manage and lead agents that have the best opportunity to represent the IP. Coordinate pricing and packaging strategies with other sales executives, finance, and other executives within Moonbug EMEA, CEE, Americas & APAC. Work closely with other senior management in other areas of the company to analyse and anticipate the financial and strategic ramifications of major deals and transactions. Achieve the annual and monthly sales forecasts in conjunction with the Head of EMEA, including monthly and quarterly variance analysis. Ensure the division has an overall knowledge of commercial terms paid in European markets across a wide range of product types and ensure that Moonbug is achieving the best commercial terms for its properties. Develop strong relationships with key executives and administrators internally as well as others related to the company’s interests and operations on an international basis. Monitor the marketplace for changes that affect sales activities, both directly and indirectly. Inform customers of upcoming Moonbug events, product programs and services. Follow up with clients on requests and co-ordinate solutions to contract/distribution issues where required. Create and maintain a strong working relationship with clients and other related parties. Follow up with clients to maximise product placement, ratings and promotional opportunities. Utilise research effectively and provide creative and marketing input, as required, in order to establish the best possible sales strategies. Remain abreast of trends in programming across national boundaries. Attend pertinent industry functions and markets to ensure the company’s interests and objectives are properly represented. Follow market developments and use this depth knowledge in commercial projects
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Entertainment

description: About SATS – Feed And Connect Communities  SATS is Asia's leading provider of food solutions and gateway services. Using innovative food technologies and resilient supply chains, we create tasty, quality food in sustainable ways for airlines, foodservice chains, retailers and institutions. With heartfelt service and advanced technology, we connect people, businesses and communities seamlessly through our comprehensive gateway services for customers such as airlines, cruise lines, freight forwarders, postal services and eCommerce companies.  Fulfilling our purpose to feed and connect communities, SATS delights customers in over 55 locations and 14 countries across the Asia Pacific, UK, and the Middle East. SATS has been listed on the Singapore Exchange since May 2000. For more information, please visit www.sats.com.sg  About The Role  Sales & Marketing, Category Management and Trading are key growth engines for Country Foods and across the SATS Group. Developing Sales strategy and constantly exploring to refresh product offerings to position Country Foods at the forefront of innovative foods solutions. Leveraging our core strengths in supply chain & food innovation to anchor Go-to-market approach for our partners, becoming the Partner of Choice. Building deep relationships with customers, anchoring Country Foods’ leading position in food industry in Singapore and expansion overseas.  Key Responsibilities  You will be responsible for building and leading a team of sales & marketing and product/category specialists professionals and accountable for driving business growth and profitability, harnessing combined strengths of existing product offerings and new products introduction. You will be accountable for developing sales channel strategy & product marketing strategy to increase market share in Singapore and constantly seeking new growth opportunities overseas with trading partners. As the Deputy GM, you will be responsible for a variety of leadership and strategic tasks, including: Leading and building a team of high performing sales, marketing and trading professionals to meet company-wide growth targets Setting strategic direction and priorities for the team in close consultation with the GM (Country Foods) and Business Development/Sales owners in other SATS business units Developing a robust sales pipeline (local and overseas) across product categories and ensuring adequate focus is deployed across initiatives to maximize value and achieve highest level of revenue growth and profitability Leading the formulation and execution of channel strategy, product strategy and marketing strategy Spearheading the constant pursuit of innovative product offerings to increase market share locally and overseas Having direct responsibility on business growth, profitability and market share Driving strategic leadership through talent management and succession planning Developing and implementing departmental plans & budget, including long term and short-term priorities jointly with the GM (Country Foods) Fostering a culture that thrives on innovation, where the environment is safe to challenge new ideas whilst actively balancing risks and opportunities Key Requirements  You must thrive in a fast paced, fast changing and dynamic environment and be a true team player with strong analytical abilities and communication skills. The ideal candidate would look like below: Bachelor degree in any discipline and minimum 10+ years working experience. Familiarity with Foods business, other business cost drivers and supply chain landscapes Track record of driving business growth & increasing market share Excellent commercial, channel/trade marketing knowledge and negotiations skills Past team leadership experience in a commercial environment and able to deliver strong results Top performer who excels in executing under pressure and delivering high quality products both individually and via the team Understands stakeholder management excellence and can build rapport even in challenging situations across a wide variety of roles Ambitious, self-driven with entrepreneurial spirit and independent decision-making ability Demonstrates strong business acumen, negotiation & interpersonal skills
industries: Market Research, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

description: The Head of Brand Marketing Singapore will have overall responsibility of communication development and building deep consumer understanding for the region. This role comes with the accountability of managing marketing investments on the brand side, managing partnerships with key accounts as well as partnering with the agency/publisher ecosystem. This is a leadership role with 2-3 marketing specialists reporting into the candidate.  This highly empowered role demands innovative thinking, juggling multiple priorities and a creative and energetic approach to leadership.  Responsibilities Drive consumer insights, competitive analysis, new launches and marketing strategy. Ensure consistent messaging across all platforms (in sync with the brand). Translate business goals and market insights into effective marketing strategies and campaigns that deliver measurable impact on both brand (Awareness/Consideration scores) and business objectives (grow top of the funnel, i.e. visitors/walk-ins etc). Partner and work closely with key accounts like IKEA on marketing collaborations Work with partners like creative agency, media agency, social agency, and research agency for implementation of marketing plans Work closely with Sales to create city marketing plans thereby enabling growth  Key Functional Competencies Strategic Thinking and Planning - Should have the ability to ‘think deep and think wide’ Customer First thinking Experience in crafting marketing campaigns that drive awareness and build consideration for the brand Excellent understanding of digital/social media Good understanding of retail/trade and in-store is preferred  Key Behavioral Competencies Leadership/Mentorship Stakeholder Management Set the Agenda Great Team Player who is able to garner respect of team and peers Execution Excellence and Bias for Action  Who you are MBA from Tier 1 institute 8-12 years of work experience working in a Brand/ Marcomm role Experience of working in an internet company is prefered Strong understanding of P&L for a region, city, etc. Hustler You have a structured thought process and strong analytical ability. You have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. People management skills (direct team reporting in past roles a must)  About Livspace  Livspace is the world’s leading interior design and renovation platform that connects interior designers, vendors, and homeowners. For homeowners, Livspace is their one-stop destination for end-to-end home interiors. Livspace currently serves Singapore and nine metro areas in India and boasts a community of over 20,000+ happy customers and 2000+ interior designers. The interior design space is a multi-billion dollar industry in India, expected to exceed $23 Bn by 2022. Singapore, similarly, is a highly attractive market for Livspace with a US$5 billion home-design industry that is growing at 10% year-on-year. Livspace’s expansion into Singapore marks the first phase of its APAC expansion. The founders—Anuj Srivastava and Ramakant Sharma—are former Google and Myntra (one of the top e-comm companies in India) executives, who are seasoned entrepreneurs and successful angel investors. Livspace’s leadership team combines world-class talent and entrepreneurial experience gathered at some of the best companies in the world. The company is well-funded by marquee investors like TPG Growth, Goldman Sachs, Jungle, Bessemer.  Working at Livspace  Livspace believes in an open, intellectually honest culture where everyone is given the autonomy to contribute and do their life’s best work. Livspace currently employs over 3000 talented, passionate individuals across India and Singapore, who all espouse the brand’s philosophy of good design for all. As a part of this dynamic team, you will have a chance to learn new things, build your managerial competence, be at the helm of an innovative tech startup, and problem-solve on how to enable employees and partners to innovate and deliver differentiated experiences. If you enjoy a good challenge and believe in getting things done, this is the right place for you.
industries: Internet and Marketing and Advertising

description: One of the world’s largest and most successful industrial conglomerates is currently seeking a Marketing Director to join the expanding team. With a team of in country marketers reporting to this individual in this job, you will drive the overall marketing and expansion strategy on behalf of the firm.  About The Marketing Director Role  In this role, you will drive overall in market action plans and continuous profit improvement initiatives.  Key Responsibilities Manage an existing in-country marketing team across SEA to drive overall value proposition for the firm’s customers Manage and develop market access plans and identify market development opportunities to grow overall market share Oversee and develop the overall marketing plan and digital transformation strategy aligned with customer experience and retention Conduct and examine market analysis to identify new customers Work alongside sales and solutions teams to ensure overall growth plans are aligned Develop and drive marketing metrics and performance indicators The successful candidate should have strong marketing experience in the area of digital, market strategy and customer experience. Experience with managing digital transformation is a huge plus.  Key Requirements Degree in business/marketing At least 10 years of work experience preferably in a leadership marketing role Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Strong stakeholder engagement skills coupled with the ability to manage a remote team Highly motivated, analytical self-starter who is results-oriented and comfortable working across all levels of an organisation This individual is in the position to drive the overall profitability and market share of the firm. The right candidate would also be given the opportunity to grow within the organisation, both laterally and vertically.  Candidates who enjoy a strategic and autonomous role would find this Marketing Director role a good fit.  Apply today or contact me to discuss further.  Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.  Robert Walters (Singapore) Pte Ltd  ROC No.: 199706961E | EA Licence No.: 03C5451  EA Registration No.: R1109068 LingXiang Lee
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: ABOUT ROTHMAN&ROMAN  Rothman & Roman (rothmanroman.com) is a strategic communications and public relations consultancy, launching its activity in ASEAN. Through our office in Singapore we support the communication of European companies in Southeast Asia and help the marketing and communication efforts of Southeast Asian companies in Europe. A boutique agency with its own offices in four European capitals, we deliver online and offline marketing and PR activities throughout the continent thanks to our highly qualified senior consultants and multimedia production team. We are members of the Eurocom network, which covers 75 countries worldwide. Our European affiliate has won some of the most prestigious global awards in communications, including the European Excellence Awards, the Effies, the WARC, the IPRA and the Sabre Awards.   DESCRIPTION OF ROLE  We are looking for a trustworthy and visionary partner, a Public Relations Account Director with a strong entrepreneurial mindset to help us in our market entry to Singapore and Southeast Asia. Your role is twofold: to help us serve our growing number of local clients and to define and execute an effective sales strategy to grow our local client base (by working together with the two founders of the company, who are locally present).    RESPONSIBILITIES  Develop and execute effective PR and media relations activity plans for local and international clients Develop a growth strategy in order to establish a stable clientele within one year that would allow the further growth of the agency Map prospective clients, who would be interested in the service portfolio. Optionally propose new angles and services, and highlight all possible market opportunities that might arise. Participate actively in the recruitment and training of future employees to support clients     REQUIREMENTS  Proven work experience in communications/PR role, understanding of the local media, corporate and brand communications landscape Large and active network of communication directors and decision makers in local and regional high growth companies (who are potential clients) – tech sector is an advantage Knowledge and understanding of the local communication agency landscape (to be able to position our agency vs. other local service providers) Proficiency in English, fluent Mandarin is a plus Active, excellent media relations To be able to work independently if necessary Communication and negotiation skills Ability to build relationships Time management and planning skills Minimum of BSc/BA

The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media-buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers — and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency.  So if you’re talented, driven, creative, and hungry to bring something entirely new and wildly ambitious into the world (and have some fun doing it), then we want to talk.  What We Do  The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media-buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers — and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency.  So if you’re talented, driven, creative, and hungry to bring something entirely new and wildly ambitious into the world (and have some fun doing it), then we want to talk.  What You’ll Do  Lead Inventory Partnerships in Southeast Asia and help develop a healthy ecosystem with our partners Brainstorm, implement, and deliver key inventories initiatives in Southeast Asia Become an expert on The Trade Desk’s Publisher Management Platform Manage and expand our relationships across publishers, SSPs, and adtech partners Work closely with the Senior Director, Inventory Partnerships to activate new partnerships and integrations and project manage a pipeline of inventory initiatives Support day to day partner management functions across inventory partnerships Maintain and document knowledge of each supplier offering, from technical specs to future plans and roadmaps Escalate, track, and resolve technical and operational problems related to supplier integrations Interface directly with publishers and SSP partners for troubleshooting and activation across all new partnerships Understand and communicate The Trade Desk’s value proposition and technology; evangelize The Trade Desk to partners  Who You Are  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent with at least 12 years of online advertising experience required Highly resourceful and excellent problem solving skills. An expert in strategic partner management and consultative selling Expert relationship management with senior stakeholders Strong network within the Premium Publishers space across Southeast Asia. Strong ability to work cross functionally with many teams in the organization including product, engineering, sales and account management Experience in working with DSPs, ad exchanges, ad servers, openrtb protocol, publisher monetisation know-how a plus Solid experience in Excel and MS Office, including pivot tables, chart-making, and manipulation of large data sets Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a fast-paced start-up environment Effective time management skills – ability to prioritize and meet deadlines  The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. description: The Brand Director works closely with the brand founder/CEO to devise brand and category strategy and plays the critical role of a brand custodian. He/she leads the brand marketing team in executing all campaign/marketing plans and ensuring that the brand guidelines are adhered to. He/she also works closely with the respective market leaders in ensuring that all aspects of the brand are well managed throughout all consumer touchpoints. He/she is also responsible for the global marketing budget including marketing inventory control to achieve company marketing, sales and profit objectives. Responsibilities include leadership and formation of OGSM framework, franchise strategy and website development strategy.  Detailed Job Description:  ·      Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Regional Country Managers & Regional Brand Director, Product Development and Sales & Marketing Teams to devise a superior brand strategy ·      Conduct competitor benchmarking and ensure that Skin Inc’s strategies are differentiated and in line with the brand positioning for the longer-term brand success ·      Conduct market research to ensure true understanding & how to best reach Skin Inc’s desired demographic; ·      Evaluate new product opportunities, analyzing potential in terms of sales, profit, and ideal fit against other products; ·      Analyze the potential of new products, making recommendations based on sales and profit analysis; ·      Manage brand Advertising & Marketing budgets; ·      Launch new products by forming and leading cross-functional work teams in conjunction with the Marketing Manager, ensuring that the launch activities are carried out “on time and in full” across all departments; ·      Lead campaign/marketing plans for products launch ·      Make recommendations for range rationalization and planogram planning; ·      Brief the Merchandising Department on POS requirements, and follow-up as required in order to meet timelines and budgets; ·      Develop media strategy recommendations throughout the year with performance marketing agency. ·      Responsible for developing and delivering Creative Brief, building a strong community PR, content & creative strategy, marketing budget and ROI & implementation, customer experience & O2O experience. ·      Manages the ongoing activities day to day in the areas of advertising development and production; ·      Lead category/promotion via ongoing analysis: consumer insights, category dynamics and competitive knowledge; ·      Managing the brand presence within key accounts through strong relationship building ·      Ultimately the role is to build brand equity, drive sales and collaborate with key internal stakeholders to maximise performance through the development of strong brand offerings, powerful communication tools and outstanding activation plans so as to achieve the company’s brand and business objectives  The Successful Applicant:  ·      Bachelor’s degree Marketing, Business or a related business field ·      8-10 years of experience in digital marketing, e-commerce start up or prestige beauty domain is preferred ·      Proven track record of successful branding campaign ·      Strong experience in executing regional campaign ·      Strong beauty domain (especially skincare) experience ·      Great interpersonal experience ·      Desire to grow with a fast growing brand which sets its sight on global expansion ·      High level of perseverance ·      A team player
industries: Cosmetics and Retail

description: Our Company  Hitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation. We guide customers from what’s now to what’s next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.  Our people are our biggest asset, they drive our innovation advantage and we strive to offer a flexible and collaborative workplace where they can thrive. Diversity of thought is welcomed and our employee base is represented by several active Employee Resource Group communities. We offer industry leading benefits packages (flexible working, generous pension and private healthcare) and promote a creative and inclusive culture. If driving real change gives you a sense of pride and you are passionate about powering social good, we’d love to hear from you.  Job Description  This role will be focused around Enterprise Accounts which would be defined by large local and global enterprises in any vertical including Government Institutes.  The sales territory Hitachi Vantara (“Hitachi”) installed based and focused accounts, as well as selected acquisition accounts where Hitachi is not an incumbent and will require an investment focus.  Responsibilities   Enterprise account management and account planning. Build and maintain relationships with assigned accounts   Must have HUNTER mentality / approach to sales   Generate revenue by selling, managing, and developing client relationships   Maintain pipeline and forecast accuracy   Live in salesforce.com for all lead management and sales forecasting   A proven and successful track record in sourcing, building, growing and managing enterprise accounts   Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles using solution selling techniques   Demonstrated sales and account management experience with a track record of consistent sales quota over-achievement   Domain knowledge of large corporate IT environments including understanding of infrastructure, storage and cloud computing   You understand the importance of a sales engineer and know when and how to leverage this function in your deal cycle and close process  Qualifications   Minimum of 10+ years’ experience and proven track record in a sales capacity, to organizations that utilize Information Technology, Software, Hardware, Solutions and associated Services, as a major component of their business model   At least 5 years successful proven track record selling into large Enterprise organizations   Has a strong Network of Customers and Partners   Experience in the management of business relationships with customers in a customer-facing role;   An understanding of the nuances of Pathways to market as well as Direct Sales.   A relevant Degree OR equivalent work experience   Proven track records in selling within a complex selling environment and an average sales cycle of at least 6 months.  Competencies   Exceptional management, interpersonal, written and presentation skills   Ability to effectively present to a technical audience, influence individuals and groups at all levels   Strong executive presence and polish   Outstanding organization and time management skills   Possess solid business acumen and the ability to present and negotiate as well as build rapport with customers and partners.   Strong business acumen on tactical and strategic level.   An outgoing, personable and organized person with a strong will to succeed.   Ability to thrive in a fast moving environment. An ability to relate business issues to IT initiatives   Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, customers, prospective customers and partners.   Knowledge of current IT trends and sales practices in the Information Technology industry.   Strong work ethic and commitment to integrity.  Our Values  We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and flexible arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.  With Japanese Roots Going Back Over 100 Years, Our Culture Is Founded On The Values Of Our Parent Company Expressed As The Hitachi Spirit  We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  Wa – Harmony, Trust, Respect  Makoto – Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity  Kaitakusha-Seishin – Pioneering Spirit, Challenge
industries: Information Technology and Services, Human Resources, and Management Consulting

description: The Director Ad Sales will be responsible for identifying and implementing revenue growth opportunities and developing partnership opportunities for A+E Network across South East Asia.  Reporting to the Head Marketing & Sales Development, SEA, you will be responsible for delivering Advertising Sales revenue, build A+E’s presence and increase the Company’s brand affinity within the industry that enhance our brand offerings, generating new revenue streams, adding value to the A+E’s audience experience.   You will be tasked with driving traditional and non-traditional revenues in and across all content categories and platforms, including on AETN’s linear television channels, Digital Studio properties, owned and operated digital sites and pages, and brand integrated on-ground experiences.   You are a strategic thinker capable of developing new methodologies and possess strong knowledge of advertising industry trends, competitive research, media strategy and ad pricing and are able to justify business requirements with key criteria and ROI assumptions. Most importantly, you will recommend optimal yield monetization guidelines for the business and then establish rate cards and business policies for various scenarios.   Responsibilities:   Manage and optimize the ad sales on owned and operated platforms to drive revenue growth Identify new opportunities to benefit ad sales revenue Monitor the marketplace to identify new clients, evaluate new partnerships, and strike deals that meet portfolio-wide revenue, operational and strategic priorities Develop a sales strategy for Southeast Asia clients in conjunction with the Managing Director, Asia and execute on such strategy to achieve the ad sales target for the business. Strengthen the Company’s relationship and standing with its clients and agencies across the media landscape in the region. Work with the Production and Content Development Team on providing creative and original solutions for presentation to potential clients – to support revenue growth and deepen consumer affinity to our brands and content.  Lead partnerships and alliances, to drive revenue through management of partners in key digital business areas like online, mobile and OTT chat apps to develop and continually innovate on our Ad Sales opportunities  Approach revenue generation from a holistic perspective seeking opportunities that bring about A+E Network’s channel brand awareness and unique monetization partnerships that are both traditional and non-traditional. Identify, develop and maintain digital-media relationships to expand the Company’s advertising touch-points and find meaningful revenue growth in non-traditional and innovative formats. Produce intelligent and creative pitches and client solutions across platforms to meet advertiser needs, reflect AETN’s brand values, and enhance the overall audience experience. Deeply engage with and understand the advertising community to stay ahead of trends and report key client and competitor movements and strategies. Manage local ad sales relationships in Singapore to motivate and secure opportunities and revenue. Communicate regularly with the global AETN sales teams to support, generate and secure global and/or multi-regional deals. Lead the Ad Sales and Client Services team – providing mentorship and guidance on growth and development and achieving team objectives.  Work with the Client Services Team, ensuring contractual obligations are met on event campaigns and broadcast sponsorships Work closely with the Programming and Marketing teams to help support Ad Sales initiatives, ensuring trade marketing and PR are optimal Partner with the finance team on all reporting, sales tracking, and commission targets as needed, and ensure timely and accurate sales reporting from the broader sales and client services teams. Manage other projects and activities as requested by the Managing Director from time to time.  YOUR STORY:   10 years of experience in advertising sales, with experience across a variety of media platforms such as linear television, streaming television, digital content, websites/ social media platform  Experience working with regional or local advertisers and agencies in Southeast Asia  Strong team player with a successful track record for growing sales revenue, market share and activate account base in a competitive market. Demonstrated ability to execute against a sales strategy and revenue targets Ambitious, confident self-starter with a passion for developing relationships and business partnerships
industries: Entertainment

jobTitle: Business Development Director - Marketing & Consumer Insights (AD)
description: For over 80 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of ~9,000 employees.  Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!  Skills Required  Job Description Anticipate client needs through intimate familiarity with their business and proactively engage to help create a sense of collaboration and to generate business opportunity. Entrepreneurial mindset with hands-on approach. This position relies on a person's deep understanding of customized research, the skills and capabilities required in sales as well as experience in providing innovative sales enablement solutions. Provide overall program leadership and supervision of execution, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery, while designing and consulting on innovative, insightful research programs to our key growth clients. Needs to be able to lead teams but also to dip into the every day to help out teams with client deliveries. Passionate about data-driven approach and can think strategically to draw out big picture correlations, predictions, and recommendations. Excellent communication, analytical, and presentation skills Typical Education And Work Experience Required University degree 10+ years in business development and/or commercial management in market/ related research companies Supplemented by relevant industry experience, ideally in Technology, Media, Retail and/or E-Commerce Market Research Agency Background / Business Development Excellent program and project management skills Track record of managing a team We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.  Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!
industries: Market Research, Information Technology and Services, and Retail

description: EdCast is the AI-Powered Knowledge Cloud solution for unified discovery, personalized learning and knowledge management across the enterprise. Its award-winning platform is used internationally by Global 2000 companies and large government organizations, including NASSCOM and World Economic Forum, to solve the discovery and curation problems across all external and internal knowledge sources. EdCast's offerings include its Learning Experience Platform (LXP) and MyGuide's in-app guides, intelligence, and automation for business software.  External Title: Director/ Assistant Vice President - Enterprise Solutions  Location: Singapore/Malaysia  Year of experience: 8 - 12 years  As a Dir/AVP- Enterprise solutions you are responsible for growing our client base with a focus on Global 2000 clients. You would play a critical role in building relationships with key clients across the region.  To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you close the deal.  You are committed to win and taking advantage of the untapped customer base that could benefit from EdCast product offering. You should have a proven track record of developing and executing key growth sales strategies, tactics and action plans; hitting annual targets, building relationships and understanding customer trends. This position is virtual and open for relocation.  Requirements:  Key Result Areas include:  Create and drive revenue within a specified region. Owning and hitting/exceeding annual sales targets Develop and execute business plan to achieve sales targets and expand our customer base Develop account plans for new relationships, building, maintaining and nurturing strong, long-lasting customer relationships Develop a strong understanding of customers' specific decision-making and purchasing process, understanding their business needs and objectives Navigate an enterprise organization to connect multiple buyers and influencers Generate leads from trade shows and networking events Develop and manage pipeline activity and monitor sales activity against assigned quotas Acquire and integrate industry knowledge related to general trends, emerging technologies, and competitors Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations  You are ...  A proven sales hunter and closer + Challenger profile Able to absorb information quickly and deliver at pace Creative and able to build a vision with prospects Metrics driven and have an appreciation of sales data A combination of self-starter, leader, collaborative internal partner Forever curious about the status quo Open to travel 25-50% of the time  What you would need:  8+ years of enterprise software sales (SaaS) experience MBA from a premier school a must Proven track record selling enterprise software into large/complex accounts Excellent communication and presentations skills with top-notch customer service approach Exceptional professional presence and business acumen Experience selling at the "C" level and navigating large enterprise organizations. Well versed with leading sales methodology Must work well in a team selling environment, able to keep an open communication particularly when working remotely Have an understanding of learning, technology & human capital Strong preference for human capital technology or solutions experience  Benefits:  An opportunity to get ahead in your career by building a great and exciting portfolio that helps others get ahead in theirs. You will be joining a truly passionate and multicultural team willing to make a difference and positively disrupt the way learning is done within organizations.  We believe in lifelong learning. We believe we can create abundant opportunities for workforce learning and up-skilling within the organization ecosystems. We have the spark, the ambition, the drive and the passion of making an impact in the world.
industries: E-Learning

jobTitle: Senior Solution Sales Expert (Business Support System, BSS)
description: The role is part of the Digital BSS Unit within the Amdocs Technology Business Group. The Solution Sales Engineer is responsible for leading the technical sales process to align Amdocs solutions with the customers technical and business requirements. They must be able to present complex solution explanations and demonstrations to both business and technical customer groups.  Key Responsibilities  Utilizing a deep technical understanding of the customer's current and future enterprise architecture, formulate solutions based on client technical and business requirements. Maintain a detailed knowledge of Amdocs solutions and present them to our customers. Orchestrate the variety of Amdocs products and/ or services that are involved in the proposed solution. Gain insight into customers' environment, challenges, and opportunities in order to propose areas where Amdocs products and solutions can bring value. Ensure that the proposed solution reflects the Amdocs value proposition and our competitive advantages. Get into the details of how the system will function and will be integrated into the client environment, and how open and easy it will be to maintain post-production. Maintain a comprehensive awareness of industry trends, standards, and competition in order to identify business opportunities based on domain market dynamics (Sales Engineer being more focused on functional and technical knowledge). Maintain a broader knowledge of architecture and integration between products/ services and various elements within products/ services. Share and communicate end-to-end solutions orally and in writing to executives, business sponsors, and technical resources in clear, concise language that is in the vernacular of each group. Identify, liaise with, and advise Amdocs technical resources needed for the sales process. Oversee the solution design. Identify the customer need (sales opportunities) early in the buying cycle, and determine how the need can be addressed by Amdocs. Analyze and quantify the business value that the proposed solution would offer to the customer. Design solutions and formulate response to RFx, create POC/demos, and presents solutions to customers. Utilize deep technical knowledge of products and services to align appropriate solutions based on client need. Conduct thought leadership sessions. Support sales from presales to scoping handover. Provide ongoing feedback to Amdocs Technology product management. Present Amdocs architecture blueprint and Amdocs roadmap.  We would like if you have...  Min 7+ years experience in the communications industry. Min 5+ years solutions architecture/sales engineering experience. Technical background and a solid understanding of BSS (Bussiness Support System) - preferably in Digital landscape, Cloud Native solutions, Order management, customer management domains Experience in communication/presentations at the executive level. Proven experience in presale/sales engineering for Telco and/or cable operators (middle and high management levels). Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline or equivalent work experience. Graduate degree preferred.
industries: Telecommunications

description: Innovid is the only independent omni-channel advertising and analytics platform built for television, bridging the gap between linear and connected TV while integrating the customer experience across video, display, social, audio, and DOOH. Our global teams — spread across the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific — work closely together to enable the world’s largest brands to connect with audiences across the entire advertising ecosystem through a single integrated platform. Joining our team means having countless opportunities to make an impact in the high-growth omni-channel advertising space while being part of an award-winning culture that values you for being you.  The Client Success Director will join our ambitious team in Singapore and will be focused on initiating and structuring relationships between Innovid and new and existing partners and clients in the region. The Client Success Director will be responsible for new revenue generation and the creation of new brand relationships, leading a successful sales process from qualification to contract. This senior individual contributor will have an in-depth understanding of the marketing and advertising technologies space and experience in closing multi-year technology platform contracts.  The Director must be a highly motivated, intelligent self-starter who shares Innovid’s passion and vision, be able to demonstrate significant accomplishments and past successes in sales, relationship building and operations and be comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced, creative company. The Director of Client Success’ responsibilities will be both strategic and tactical in nature, and the perfect candidate should have the ability to see the bigger picture while managing details.  You Will Lead the end-to-end sales process directly with top brands Lead meaningful partnerships, review and execute agreements and contracts Support local and global client contacts in APAC and solidify relationships in the region Meet quarterly sales goals and accurately forecast based on your sales pipeline Evangelize Innovid’s products and services to senior executives in the Singapore market Share trends, insights, and Innovid product updates with global brands and agency partners Formulate a detailed understanding of the competitive landscape and provide detailed feedback to product and operations teams on feature and functionality development needed to capture additional market share Attend industry events, entertain, network, and be fully immersed in the local marketing and advertising technology space What You Bring To The Table At least 4-6 years of proven success in relevant sales/business development/partnership management roles Knowledge of the advertising and marketing ecosystem’s tech players Solid network of existing relationships with local brands, media agencies, business development, product contacts – preferably in the video space Bilingual in local languages and English (proficiency level in English should be high) Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills to relate to and build authentic relationships with partners Results-driven individual with an ability to navigate ambiguity and an ever-changing, fast-paced marketplace Quick learner of new technologies Ability to work collaboratively and positively in a team environment B.A./B.Sc. degree What We Offer High visibility role with a tremendous amount of personal growth potential Supportive, collaborative team culture Competitive compensation package Offices in major cities around the world and a cross-company collaboration unlike anywhere else. There is no such thing as the perfect resume, or someone that checks every box. At Innovid, we are generous with our time and knowledge, and always ready to teach. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day and add to Innovid.  Equal Opportunity Employer: Innovid is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We consider all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply. We are actively working to be an anti-racist organization. We're committing to creating an inclusive and equitable workplace for all of our employees. You can read more about our commitment to DEI here.  If you are located within the EEA and subject to GDPR or are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Innovid processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

description: Key responsibilities Leads the growth and profitability of the APAC business, by providing strategic leadership and establishing long-range goals and strategies. Extensive business development experience in the region, including substantial CEO-level relationship, sales and/or business development/consulting. Acquire, build, and cultivate relationships with high-profile clients in the Asia Pacific as well as e-commerce platform partnerships within the region. Work collectively with clients and with the delivery team, digital marketing team to cultivate and grow accounts. Focus on continual growth opportunities for each customer account by selling and managing retainers as well as cross-selling/upselling our portfolio of services. Participate in product/platform road map based on client needs with senior leadership, product, & engineering. Take lead in responding to RFP opportunities, including qualification & win strategy. Coordinate global account discussions with counterparts in Asia Pacific regions. Demonstrated ability to lead and manage multiple complex projects with a broad range of internal and external constituents simultaneously. Work closely with product, marketing and revenue teams to constantly optimize efforts relating to company-wide goals. Using knowledge of the market and competitors, identify and develop the company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators. Mentor and manage sales team with account responsibility. Experience at different B2C and B2B e-commerce platforms: Shopify Plus, Adobe, Big Commerce, SaaS platforms and services, their adoption, integration and ongoing use. Strong knowledge in performance marketing; track record of previously managing $3m+ performance marketing budget, with samples and results of past campaigns Strong knowledge of social media, email marketing, CRM, HTML/CSS and marketing automation tools Strong communication skills with the ability to speak with C-level clients Existing relationships with decision-makers with brands or independent agencies. Experience in project coordination or management; able to track and manage the moving parts of multiple projects Previous management experience required Strong presentation skills and negotiations ability Proven track record of exceeding revenue expectations MBA or Master degree is prefered

SailPoint is seeking an experienced, highly motivated Sales Professional due to expansion, preferably specialising in Government agencies.The Sales Executive will sell our marketing leading Identity Management solutions , support both end users and channel partners and also develop and maintain trusted relationships with senior level decision makers and other key buyers within the named accounts and partners.They will have a thorough understanding of the client's business and the industry in which they compete, the corresponding IT initiatives, identifying needs which the company can help resolve, developing compelling business value proposals for our solutions and ultimately closing business.  Responsibilities:  Follow-up on all leads supplied and develop business plans that align to the assigned geographic and business needs. Demonstrate the ability to address each customer's and partner's unique inquiry, while providing them with the proper information and appropriate solution based on the customer's specific needs and interests. Engage and work with business partners like Marketing and Technical Sales where appropriate. Marshal and lead the appropriate technical resources to demonstrate SailPoints’ advantages to the customer. Follow-up with clients and work with Sailpoint post-sale account managers to ensure consistent and ongoing coverage of account including new sales opportunities. Understand and work in all aspects of the sales cycle, including qualifying, presentations, demonstrations, RFP responses, negotiations and the closing process. Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the territory including the customers, the prospects, the partners, the influencer's, and the competitors. Understand and communicate all product and technological strategies employed by competitive and complimentary organizations in the SailPoint market space. Maintain the highest level of customer and partner satisfaction within the accounts in your territory. Maintain a positive, professional 'total customer service' attitude and demonstrate the company's Core Values. Demonstrate the ability to create and manage conversations at all business and technical levels of a client's organization from their CEO to a Systems Administrator. Utilize all channel management and reporting tools. Exceed revenue quota goals on a monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis.  Skills:  Customer Focus: Act in ways that demonstrate customer focus and satisfaction by building effective relationships with customers, identifying, meeting and exceeding customer expectations, and by treating customers with dignity and respect. Partner Focus: Act in ways that demonstrate partner focus and satisfaction by building effective relationships with partners, identifying, meeting and exceeding partner expectations, and by treating partners with dignity and respect. Territory Management: Manage territory, considering each and all accounts collectively; establish accurate plans and forecasts; prioritize efforts; generate short term results while holding a long-term perspective to maximize overall territory viability. Effective Communication: Deliver oral and written communications that are impactful and persuasive with their intended audience. Industry Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of given industry and relevant marketplace; can speak with authority, e.g., on industry trends, best practices, competitive practices, regulatory issues, etc. Effective Selling: Utilize solutions-oriented, systematic approach to selling, leverage mastery of sales best practices and SailPoint’s sales methodology. Business Acumen: Understand key aspects of business, e.g., business models and competitive positioning; also understand how business operates, including role of structure, systems, and processes; can speak in business language when applying professional expertise. Financial Acumen: Use financial analysis to make decisions, evaluate opportunities and choices; know how financial decisions impact business success Experience Requirements:  7 years of Business to Business sales experience, with 3 years in the Identity Management or Security Industries Bachelor's degree or global equivalent in an IT, business or sales related field. Proven results in a quota-oriented sales environment and an understanding of technology and technological innovations Excellent negotiation and presentation skills; ability to persuade and influence decision makers and C level Executives are required.  Professionalism, personal integrity, a high internal commitment to achieve success, the ability to build and maintain a vast network of professional relationships over a long period of time, strong oral and written communication skills Business travel of approximately 50 percent yearly is expected for this position. SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
