description: Company Description  Wood Mackenzie is the global leader in data, analysis and consulting across the energy, chemicals, metals, mining, power and renewables sectors.  Founded in 1973, our success has always been underpinned by the simple principle of providing trusted research and advice that makes a difference to our customers. Today we have over 2,000 customers ranging from the largest global energy companies and financial institutions to governments as well as smaller market specialists.  Our teams are located around the world. This enables us to stay closely connected with customers and the markets and sectors we cover. Collectively this allows us to offer a compelling combination of global commodity analysis with detailed local market knowledge.  We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We are committed to creating a workplace that works for you and encourage everyone to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join.  Hear what our team has to say about working with us:  https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/  We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!  At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.  But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.  It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.  At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.  Job Description  The Customer Focus team is accountable for growing and nurturing our user base within the customer organisation to enhance retention and growth of our business. We are one of the most external facing teams in the organisation, requiring team members to demonstrate curiosity, empathy and a customer first mindset to ensure that they extract maximum value from their Wood Mackenzie products. A genuine curiosity about our customers, their challenges and how Wood Mackenzie can help them work better is the Customer Focus approach. We are currently in the midst of a transformation into a Customer Success team with investments in technology and training to scale and adapt our team to our future in Lens.  About The Role  The Director leads a regional Customer Focus team of 13 individuals across 7 countries in APAC, with accountability for active user and net dollar retention growth in Wood Mackenzie’s National Oil Company (NOC), Major and Midmarket energy and commodity customers in APAC.  The person in this role is a key stakeholder on the Global Customer Focus Leadership Team as well as the APAC Sales Leadership Team, driving growth in our existing customer base through a focus on accelerating our customers’ time to value.  Role Focus Leads a team of individual contributors and managers to deliver CF objectives of active user growth and commercial growth of existing NOC, Major, and Midmarket customers in the APAC region, creating a strategy and team structure to deliver the objectives Creates a culture of customer centricity and outcomes-focused delivery, implementing change management within the team but also influencing senior stakeholders outside Customer Focus Develops both individual contributors and managers' career pathways, identifying potential and growth areas and creating an atmosphere in which we celebrate both individual and team successes Drives the development of CF as a function by driving innovation and evolution, being comfortable with risk taking and data-led decision making, and balancing company priorities with the team’s Creates a climate in which people want to do their best Responsibilities  Managing a team of both Engagement and Solutions professionals, this role will be responsible for delivering the APAC Customer Focus active user, net dollar retention and Lens adoption targets and creating a cohesive, high performing APAC CF team. The incumbent will be inheriting a team in the midst of change with Customer Success upskilling and technology investment, and will be expected to lead the team through this transformation.  To Be Successful In The Role, You Will Demonstrate  People Leadership Expertise Effective remote team management across various geographies in APAC demonstrating inclusiveness and an appreciation of the diversity of the region Experience leading through change and transitions with empathy and resolve as we evolve and scale into a true Customer Success team Excellent process and operational management ability with a keen eye to continuously improve existing ways of working, drive strategic functional initiatives that span across multiple functions, departments, processes and stakeholders Exhibit strong leadership in a fast-paced, quick turnaround solutions environment and ability to work well in a team in pressured situations. Commercial And Operational Skills And Behaviors Goal-getting orientation, focused on results and encouraging managed risk taking/ course corrections with an eye on the big picture Influencing and agenda setting both within the team and with senior stakeholders Strong commercial acumen including comfort in drawing relevant and actionable conclusions from large data sets Advanced decision-making, in particular in situations with dynamic or incomplete information Ability to evaluate multiple competing priorities and demands on the team’s time and allocate resources effectively, balancing the team’s objectives and stakeholders needs Customer Success/B2B SaaS practical knowledge Advanced knowledge and application of Customer Success best practice in the service of meeting and exceeding Net Dollar Retention, account health and churn reduction targets Familiarity with Customer Success platforms such as Strikedeck and after-sales touchpoints (onboarding, product training) to maximise Account Health and accelerate customer time to value Advanced ability to translate the “voice of the customer” into actionable guidance for the team and represent the customer internally with other stakeholders including Sales and Product Industry/customer knowledge Whilst deep energy/commodity expertise is not required to be successful in this role, a strong candidate will have exposure to and interest in the energy transition and our customers’ challenges in navigating this transition, and a belief in the value of Wood Mackenzie’s products that support our customers decisions Qualifications  Commercial and Operational Skills and Behaviors Goal-getting orientation, focused on results and encouraging managed risk taking/ course corrections with an eye on the big picture Strong commercial acumen including comfort in drawing relevant and actionable conclusions from large data sets Advanced decision-making, in particular in situations with dynamic or incomplete information Ability to evaluate multiple competing priorities and demands on the team’s time and allocate resources effectively, balancing the team’s objectives and stakeholders needs Customer Success/B2B SaaS practical knowledge Familiarity with Customer Success platforms such as Strikedeck and after-sales touchpoints (onboarding, product training) to maximise Account Health and accelerate customer time to value Advanced ability to translate the “voice of the customer” into actionable guidance for the team and represent the customer internally with other stakeholders Industry/customer knowledge Whilst deep energy/commodity expertise is not required to be successful in this role, a strong candidate will have exposure to and interest in the energy transition and our customers’ challenges in navigating this transition, and a belief in the value of Wood Mackenzie’s products that support our customers decisions Additional Information  Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.  All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html  Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.  Consumer Privacy Notice

description: The role: Lazada Logistics is seeking a Senior Vice President to lead our 3PL Strategy & Procurement Team, which will directly contribute to shaping the Logistics landscape in South East Asia.  This position will be based in Singapore, reporting to the regional Head of 3PL Management. You will be part of a team responsible for the Transport budget (and driving all cost saving initiatives), for defining LAZADA’s Logistic Portfolio strategy, and rolling out complex end-to-end logistics transformation initiatives with process & technology as backbone across Lazada’s ventures across South East Asia.  Key Responsibilities (but not limited to): As lead of 3PL Portfolio Strategy & Procurement you are the gatekeeper to 3PL relationship. You will be responsible for ensuring that we work with the right partners across ventures and that we have a clear strategy with each of them in order to deliver on the overall LAZADA logistic strategy. You will have to ongoingly make sure that we have the right governance & control, that we have a clear strategy on how to balance cost & performance, with the aim of always providing the best seller & customer experience.  You will be a key owner of the transport budget and responsible for monitoring all financial indicators for the transport team - including Cost initiatives, Invoice reconciliation, COD reconciliation and claims.  Your role will be focusing on 3 main pillars: 3PL Portfolio Strategy, 3PL Procurement, 3PL Governance. 3PL portfolio Strategy: You will be responsible for designing a 3PL specific roadmap & cost reduction target in order to support the overall logistic strategy. You will ensure that each 3PL has a clear growth strategy and that they operate at the right level of quality & cost. You will be responsible to drive market research & GAP assessments, in order to fully master the 3PL landscape and understand areas of optimizations (ie. New 3PLs, opening of new sorts for existing 3PLs, etc) 3PL Procurement: You will be the main driver of the yearly contract renegotiations. You will need to upgrade our 3PL contract to reflect evolution in our operations, as well as to better serve LAZADA’s strategic focus. You will need to define the overall governance strategy, as well as to support country teams to define a clear negotiation strategy per 3PL, as well as clear cost negotiation target. You will also be directly owning the negotiation with our major regional strategic 3PLs           3PL Governance: Set up a strong 3PL governance, with clear milestones throughout the year (ie QBR, Contract Update, etc) to exchange on performance and making that strategies are aligned. You will also continuously work on developing new tech solutions (via 3PL Portal) to facilitate exchange, reconciliation and performance transparency between Laz and 3PLs.  Qualifications & Skills You have a Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Supply Chain Management or relevant disciplines You have 10+ years of professional experience, ideally most of which is spent in procurement, sales or retail You have strong project management skills, with experience in managing cross functional (Ops to Finance) and complex multi-stakeholder projects You are a critical thinker and leader, with strong communication and negotiation skills. You have a track record of strong influencing skills, ability to drive change, meet deadlines, and inspire confidence among senior leadership Strong analytical skills, familiarity with contracts and highly proficient in Excel Proficiency in Bahasa and/or Mandarin are bonus.

Monitor and report all sales activities weekly and monthly to the management adding improve plans. Monitor and analyze the market trends in terms of products, design and sales. description: Discover a world of opportunities. #HumanChemistry  See what chemistry can do for your career: careers.evonik.com  Exploring opportunities. Growing together.  VACANCY REFERENCE NUMBER 146429  SEA Technical Business Director  Location: Singapore : Singapore  Function: Marketing & Sales  Career Level: Senior professionals (> 5 years)  Legal Entity: Evonik Oil Additives Asia Pacific Pte. Ltd.  Business Line: Oil Additives  What We Offer  You will work on exciting and challenging topics together with a team in an ultra-modern, innovative and creative environment. Intensive on-the-job training with expert colleagues guarantees you will quickly become familiar with your duties and perform them independently. Performance related pay and the opportunity for personal and professional development are of course part of the package. Click here to learn more about Evonik from our employees  Responsibilities  Assists in the development and implementation of the overall profitable, sustainable global/regional BL Strategy in the region Driving the business growth above industry average by ensuring Customer Relations initiate, execute and drive Initiatives and Projects with customers. Defining and forecasting sales volume and contribution margins to be used as the basis in the business planning and analysis by the business line. Providing the Management as well as relevant business unit community with information concerning the markets, customers, competitive analysis, etc. through reporting by various means. Monthly reporting of regional activity status and results to the Regional Customer Relations Manager. Managing agents and/or distributors performance, while providing them with required support and assistance. Liaising with the Global Key Account Managers (GKAMs) to ensure the integrity of business line services for the selected accounts. Lead / Coordinate regional activities for selected Global Key Account. (GKA Regional Coordinator) Support to Customer Service Department for order processing, account receivables and customer credit administration. Maintenance and optimization of local logistic operations where applicable. Possesses detailed application expertise on lubricant additives for individual market segments, and an awareness of development projects and initiatives with OEM (that impact on existing/market base). Provide technical support to customers, including best choice of products and proposal for adequate sampling. Possesses full technical responsibility for formulation modification projects and to translate technical performance of the product into a value-based solution for the customer Responsible to conduct technical training for external distributors/agent on bi-annual basis or as required. Educate customers and market on Oil Additives technologies for area of applications. Drives initiatives and projects including the commercialization of new product/services. Represents the company technical competency at conferences with technical presentations, papers, and publications etc. Perform proper internal documentation of formulation studies for customers and support the buildup of a proper formulation database and detailed insights on a formulation know-how in order to continually strengthen company technical competency. Liase with customer service team on a cross functional Evonik approach to target customers/regions. Ensure service offered are aligned with customer segmentation approach of the company. Supports manufacturing for quality issues that impact product specifications/performance, raw material substitutions, customer requested changes etc. Works with Product Management on product related customer complaint.  Requirements  Degree in Chemistry or relevant discipline with at least 5 years experience of sales/marketing/Channel management/technical service in specialty chemical industry, preferably lubricant industry. Highly self-motivated and has a sales-driven personality. Exhibits technical understanding of lubricant formulation and modern additive technologies. Strong network in lubricant additives industry is highly preferred. Experienced in distributor management Thorough knowledge of the markets and key manufacturers in lubricant additives, base oils and finished lubes. Excellent oral and written communication skills; adept at customer presentations Cross cultural adaptability. Knowledge of at least one Asian language is advantageous Willingness to travel regionally. Travelling of at least 2 weeks per month is expected  Your Application  To ensure the fastest process of your application and to protect the environment, please apply online via our careers portal at https://careers.evonik.com .  Please direct your application to VACANCY REFERENCE NUMBER 146429  Please note that Evonik will not accept any unsolicited application documents sent by staffing firms. Evonik works in conjunction with preferred service providers and will not pay any fee to staffing firms in the absence of an appropriate framework agreement. Should Evonik receive a candidate profile from a staffing firm with which it has no framework agreement, and should this candidate subsequently be considered in the recruitment process or offered employment, no claims from the staffing firm will be entertained in this regard.

description: About VERITAS  Veritas solves what no one else can. With an industry-leading product portfolio, we offer proven, modern, and integrated technology that brings together availability, protection, and insights. Our Veritas Enterprise Data Services Platform addresses current and future data issues end-to-end – keeping mission-critical workloads highly available, protecting data everywhere, and providing insights to optimize costs and maintain regulatory readiness.  Veritas supports 500+ data sources, 150+ storage targets, 50+ clouds, and any deployment model imaginable. We serve 99% of the Fortune 100, 90% of the Fortune 500, and are the market leader in Software-defined Storage, Data Protection, and Archiving.  Veritas’ Worldwide Field Operations (WFO) propels company growth by driving all aspects of new business and channel sales and includes global sales operations and global sales enablement for all new business and renewal sales.  Responsibilities The Account Director is distinguished by their deep knowledge of the IT industry and Veritas’ Enterprise Data Services Platform portfolio. This industry expert will be assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, named accounts in the Banking and FSI verticals. Responsible for expanding Veritas’ footprint in the assigned accounts and verticals by selling Veritas’ entire Enterprise Data Services Platform portfolio (backup/recovery, high availability, clustering, archiving, eDiscovery, etc.). Cultivate and maintain executive level relationships in IT and various Lines of Business (LOB), focusing on the strategic nature of the relationship and ensuring ongoing customer satisfaction. Understands customer’s business objectives, situation and needs, and able to translate them into proposals. Leads detailed account planning process across the accounts and prioritize selling activity to generate maximum revenue. Accuracy in business forecast. Meets and/or exceeds sales quota. Leverages and collaborates with entire network of internal specialists, channel and partner organizations to maximize revenue and drive demand in the accounts, but also able to work independently to accomplish required tasks. Requirements Results-oriented with good business sense Customer and relationship oriented with strong interpersonal skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Preferred Has foundational business knowledge and can understand basic financial statements; able to reference financial information when conducting customer/partner discussions Strong, documented track record of achievement against quota. Current contacts/relationships and working business knowledge of assigned customers in the Banking and FSI verticals. Strong business and executive level sales acumen. Tangible examples required. Excellent time management, presentation, written and oral skills. Experience with building and executing Account Planning Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 5+ years of sales and/or account management experience in IT software/hardware sales. At Veritas, we care about the causes close to your heart and enable you to volunteer, donate, and do good. We also value uniqueness and know that a more diverse and inclusive workforce makes a winning team, so come as you are! Interested? Then apply and find out more about #TeamVTAS!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Cialfo is a leading platform connecting students, higher education institutions and counselors through technology driven solutions. Launched in 2017 with a mission to make education accessible to 100 million students, Cialfo provides a range of mobile and web solutions to students, K-12 institutions and higher education institutions. We’re one of the fastest-growing edtech startups in the region, consistently charting new heights!  With our fingers always on the pulse on the latest developments and technologies in education, the Growth team works to develop strong partnerships with K-12 schools and personalise solutions to support them. We’re an international team specialising in our own regions but united by our common goal of making education accessible to 100 million students worldwide. If you are passionate about making a positive impact in the education sector and are a driven self-starter with a knack for networking, join our K-12 partnerships team to be an advocate for Cialfo!  Job Description  As the Associate Director of Enterprise Partnerships, you must be able to complete the end-to-end enterprise sales cycle for K-12 school groups as well as leading strategic initiatives to generate revenue and support the company’s growth. Define and execute appropriate sales strategies; business development, marketing, technical, operations, and sales support programs to maximise sales and profitability. You’ll be solving business problems, collaborating across teams (product, customer success, marketing), and you are passionate about having a huge impact on growing teams. You will report directly to the VP of Sales.  We want you to earn trust, build lasting relationships, and wow people - making Cialfo the essential partner for every school. At Cialfo, we work independently. We balance ownership and initiative with flexibility, trusting you to ship on time. While Cialfo is a fast-paced environment, we also believe decisions made quickly should be made thoughtfully.  Responsibilities Understand the customer's goals and challenges before offering solutions. Demonstrate a high level of business acumen and a thorough understanding of the customer's business, organization, strategy, and financial position. Drive strategic and tactical planning for enterprise deals, specifically large K12 school groups and networks. Drive and project manages complex deals across regions with multiple stakeholders involved, including senior leadership, head of IT, finance directors of education institutions, etc. Coordinate and attend conferences and events to represent Cialfo. Cultivate and establish networks and relationships with companies, corporate partners, and other relevant institutions. Contributing to creating a cohesive regional/global team where team collaboration and personal accountability are equally important. Critical thinking abilities to draw sound conclusions from information and various data sources while taking a long-term perspective.  Requirements Has 7+ years of experience in a sales position within a fast-paced environment. Experience working with remote teams. We live, breathe, and type from all around the world. Experience working in growth stage B2B SaaS companies. Experience with selling and building partnerships with education institutions, in particular international and local high schools. Strong stakeholder management skills and are comfortable managing expectations and keeping teams on track. Meaningful experience with CRM strategy and management, with a strong interest in how it works “under the hood”. Experience with Salesforce would be preferred. Strategic mindset, with the ability to make difficult decisions. Creative, methodical problem-solving skills with a focus on efficient execution while balancing big-picture thinking. Excels in maintaining good relationships with partners and clients in the target market. description: Job Description Business Manager, Blood Screening, Roche Diagnostics Asia Pacific  Role Purpose As the Business Manager, Blood Screening, you will be responsible for Responsible for marketing and product management of the Blood Screening portfolio in the APAC Region Support the Molecular Lab team as well as a network of affiliate Molecular Lab teams through the Asia Pacific network Align with the Global and Regional Stakeholders Implement strategies and initiatives across the APAC region to drive the overall Blood Screening diagnostic business Monitor business performance in the APAC region by combining solutions within the current (digital) ecosystem Provide support to other projects as required  In this role, you will Responsible for marketing and product management of Blood Screening, including organization of marketing activities like internal and customer workshops, congresses/events, and training and support to affiliates Leverage, drive and support product launches through implementation of the Launch Powerhouse (LPH) framework, which provides a structured way of commercialization assessment and product launch preparation Maintain a comprehensive understanding of scientific/clinical data and literature related to the relevant product, competitor products, and disease areas. Work with other function and affiliates to drive Roche product acceptance Provide support to business analysis, KPI tracking, and other projects as required Report to the APAC Business Lead, Molecular Lab, Lab & C-Suite Value Stream  Who you are Experience in laboratory discipline based required. Proven ability to execute strategies, and track and measure results Experience in teamwork and project management in matrix organization, preferably a regional structure Sales, marketing, product management and business development experience Familiarity with the technological trends and their relevance to the healthcare industry  Qualification and Experience Bachelor degree or equivalent in the related field. Advanced degree (Masters, MBA, Medical Degree, PhD) in the related field desired. MBA is an advantage At least 5 years of work experience in related field Proven knowledge and expertise in area of focus and in the Asia Pacific region Solid commercial acumen which can be demonstrated by previous success in bringing the benefits of sales, marketing or operational experience to bear to solve business issues or capitalize on market opportunities Ability to achieve goals with minimal to moderate supervision and guidance Good aptitude for working with diverse cultural groups Excellent written and oral communication skills  Location Preferred location will be Singapore, however other locations within Asia Pacific may also be considered.  APAC This is a diverse region culturally and with respect to business maturity. APAC Spirit is an embodiment of the organisation we in the APAC region aspire to be. As a member in this region, you will strive to deeply understand, live and encourage those around you to embrace the APAC Spirit principles. As this position is a regional role, international business travel will be required depending upon the business location of the successful candidate and ongoing business project activities. Roche is strongly committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strive to build teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Embracing diversity enables us to create a great place to work and to innovate for patients

jobTitle: Senior Sales Director: Financial Services Institutions - APAC
description: As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Senior Sales Director with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions (preferably financial crime, risk or compliance) to Financial Institutions? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The Impact You Will Have  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the APAC region. As a Senior Sales Director you will become an expert in Elliptic’s value proposition, helping our prospective customers navigate and enter the cryptocurrency market with your knowledge and understanding of our product and compliance and regulatory environments.  You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What You’ll Do Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle Prospect and generate high quality leads Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota Requirements  You will be a great fit here if you: Can understand the customer’s business model, and how digital assets fit into their strategy Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities Our Ideal Candidate Has 7-10 years full sales cycle experience selling Enterprise SaaS solutions to Financial Institutions. Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy Bonus Points For Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Borderline obsession with emerging technology Benefits Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: The Brand Director works closely with the brand founder/CEO to devise brand and category strategy and plays the critical role of a brand custodian. He/she leads the brand marketing team in executing all campaign/marketing plans and ensuring that the brand guidelines are adhered to. He/she also works closely with the respective market leaders in ensuring that all aspects of the brand are well managed throughout all consumer touchpoints. He/she is also responsible for the global marketing budget including marketing inventory control to achieve company marketing, sales and profit objectives. Responsibilities include leadership and formation of OGSM framework, franchise strategy and website development strategy.  Detailed Job Description Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Regional Country Managers & Regional Brand Director, Product Development and Sales & Marketing Teams to devise a superior brand strategy Conduct competitor benchmarking and ensure that Skin Inc’s strategies are differentiated and in line with the brand positioning for the longer-term brand success Conduct market research to ensure true understanding & how to best reach Skin Inc’s desired demographic; Evaluate new product opportunities, analyzing potential in terms of sales, profit, and ideal fit against other products; Analyze the potential of new products, making recommendations based on sales and profit analysis; Manage brand Advertising & Marketing budgets; Launch new products by forming and leading cross-functional work teams in conjunction with the Marketing Manager, ensuring that the launch activities are carried out “on time and in full” across all departments; Lead campaign/marketing plans for products launch Make recommendations for range rationalization and planogram planning; Brief the Merchandising Department on POS requirements, and follow-up as required in order to meet timelines and budgets; Develop media strategy recommendations throughout the year with performance marketing agency. Responsible for developing and delivering Creative Brief, building a strong community PR, content & creative strategy, marketing budget and ROI & implementation, customer experience & O2O experience. Manages the ongoing activities day to day in the areas of advertising development and production; Lead category/promotion via ongoing analysis: consumer insights, category dynamics and competitive knowledge; Managing the brand presence within key accounts through strong relationship building Ultimately the role is to build brand equity, drive sales and collaborate with key internal stakeholders to maximise performance through the development of strong brand offerings, powerful communication tools and outstanding activation plans so as to achieve the company’s brand and business objectives The Successful Applicant Bachelor’s degree Marketing, Business or a related business field 8-10 years of experience in digital marketing, e-commerce start up or prestige beauty domain is preferred Proven track record of successful branding campaign Strong experience in executing regional campaign Strong beauty domain (especially skincare) experience Great interpersonal experience Desire to grow with a fast growing brand which sets its sight on global expansion High level of perseverance A team player
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Consumer Goods

description: PURPOSE OF THE JOB  The Business Solutions Director is responsible for providing both strategic and tactical leadership across multi-million dollar client engagements (Forbes 500 companies from various industries) while still keeping on top of day-to-day project activities with a focus on meeting client requirements, assuring overall quality of final deliverables and ensuring overall customer satisfaction.  You will partner with Client, country leadership and internal cross-functional teams of subject matter experts to understand, define and build effective solutions that generate measurable results.  We’re looking for an enthusiastic problem solver that thrives on being engaged at all levels of the assigned project. As a key point of contact for both the Client and internal teams, you will be a pivotal role in the success of every engagement.  Key Responsibilities Logically, confidently and consistently define engagement information needs, identify the relevant information sources, critical contents gaps and build a relevant and compelling fact-based response consistent with the Client objectives Lead the development of robust final Client solution deliverable, implementation scenarios and other strategic work for one or more clients simultaneously Leverage capabilities of cross-functional teams to push the thinking to create superior, actionable client solutions that meet both clients’ needs and Collinson’s commercial and functional business goals Possess and demonstrate a full understanding of the client’s business/issues (and industry) and be viewed as the expert advisor both internally and externally Actively take part in new business pitch development and presentation delivery, accountable for the winning of additional business Own the delivery of documented process mapping, due diligence reporting and detailed solutions design and concepts proposals Ensure complete solution design information is delivered to change management to allow effective and timely mobilization of project and programme resources Lead senior level client relationships and client workshop sessions as an articulate and effective host/presenter, further developing your ‘trusted advisor status’ Develop and drive project and action plans and ensure all deliverables are completed in the accurate and timely manner with regular progress communication Be seen by the client as a key Collinson reference point, holding accountability to the client for the quality of our work for assigned projects Set the parameters to be achieved by the project team, providing clear direction, guidance and support to client project team members in order for the team to effectively deliver Lead the development of Collinson methodologies and intellectual capabilities, championing internally continuous improvement in how we do things Demonstrate ability to matrix manage multiple stakeholders globally and cross region. Operating within political internal and external environments Assist as the trusted advisor for the Marketing and Business Development teams in the development of new business proposals, presenting new business pitches; writing new business proposals and calculating the project budget and timings Identify, re-work and lead process- and system improvement initiatives in close collaboration with internal key stakeholders Ability to work with and coordinate cross functional teams including Product, Operations, Technoloy and Commercial Finance to ensure that solutions proposed are deliverable and commercially viable. Knowledge, Skills And Experience Required Has strong experience working in a similar consulting / project management type role or function (sales, supply chain, business management, solutions), with a number of those having been based in and working with clients in Asia Has experience in (ideally qualification in) PMP or similar project management methodology Has developed expertise in one or more industries (FMCG, pharma, travel, technology, financial and professional services etc.) Knowledge of diverse business matters such as Marketing, Procurement, Supply Chain, Category Management etc. Demonstrate technical/IT solutions awareness and ability to identify new technology and tools Familiarity with a wide selection of business management software (ERP, CRM, etc.) and databases Depth of knowledge in Loyalty or Customer Engagement/CRM solutions. Has the ability to identify key business problems and develop a thorough understanding of the clients business, competitors, end users, etc. Possess the ability to think conceptually; to logically define information needs, drive fact to findings/insights, understand the client organization & issues, lead strategic thinking and create actionable solutions Expertise in data collection and analysis necessary to complete engagement deliverables, including defining the information needs Able to effectively manage a number of clients across multiple offerings Commercial experience in budgeting, cost forecasting, value reporting, pricing Demonstrate advanced verbal and written communication skills Excellent English language skills is essential PERSON SPECIFICATION The DNA of a solutions person who craves to understand the customer in depth, their business environment, their industry and their business needs deeply before even starting to talk about Collinson. A naturally self driven individual who thrives in environments that require engagement with multiple internal and external team members A proven track record of winning supporting loyalty or customer engagement/CRM solutions deals. A high level of discipline in opportunity qualification – recognizing that qualifying out is as important as qualifying in. Strong commercial orientation A very strong networker Outstanding consultative approach with the ability to form strong working relationships through exceptional gravitas, an engaging personality and business credibility A clear philosophy the solutions success is highly dependent on understanding a customer deep and wide. That this takes significant research effort to understand THEM and only then do they have the right to talk to the customer about US (Collinson). A real can do will do attitude. Thrives in an environment of opportunity, confidence and hunger for growth Sets and achieves very high levels of performance and continually strives for personal improvement in all that they do High levels of energy, thrives on being challenged and will take others on the journey of success An equally strong influencer internally as externally to ensure that the internal organization and strategic partners are brought on the journey. High standards of personal presentation

description: About Us  Build the Smarter Way to Shop!  ShopBack , the #1 rewards and discovery platform in Asia-Pacific, enables shoppers across the region to shop "The Smarter Way”. It is a one-stop rewards and discovery platform for users to earn cashback, while delivering performance-based marketing to merchants. First launched in Singapore in 2014, ShopBack has since expanded its reach to Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, Thailand, Taiwan, Australia, and more recently, Vietnam and Korea. In Singapore, the company has also extended its service offering with ShopBack GO, an app-based rewards platform for in-store shopping, dining, and entertainment. We are a passionate team that wants to drive innovation and build a product that we love and are all proud of!  ShopBack partners with over 5,000 merchants including Taobao, Expedia, Shopee, ZALORA to reward its users with cashback across a wide range of categories including general merchandise, travel bookings, fashion, health and beauty, groceries, and food delivery. To date, US$200m in cashback has been awarded to our over 30 million users.  We have global ambitions and are up against international incumbents in a rapidly emerging field! We are expanding our existing team and are looking for passionate talent across APAC to be part of this exciting journey. If you are inspired to take up new challenges and leave a mark on the e-commerce landscape, then come and be part of our growing ShopBack Family!  You will join as the Regional Head of Merchant Solutions. Your team is responsible for improving and developing new value propositions that bring incremental value to both merchants and users. You will act as a subject matter expert in AdTech, directly engaging with our merchants or advertising agencies and provide guidance to our product and technical teams in order to build and scale new solutions. You will be counted on to provide thought leadership in terms of the market landscape, merchant requirements, opportunity sizing, proof of concept testing, and the launch of these solutions in different countries.  You will partner with our technology and management teams to shape the product roadmap that will help us accelerate ShopBack’s growth through new solutions. You will also be a key partner to General Managers across all our operating markets to understand the requirements of local markets and ensure the applicability of new solutions to specific markets.  Who We’re Looking For  You are organised, structured, and meticulous. You are a seasoned practitioner in AdTech and understand the evolving needs of advertisers. You are an expert in managing complex multi-threaded initiatives with a lean team. You have high standards and expect speed and accuracy from your teams.  You are also curious and collaborative. You do not shy away from rolling up your sleeves when solving problems. You communicate well and drive action and progress at a high pace. You possess a strong desire to out-innovate ourselves and our competition. You are tech-savvy and impact-oriented.  Responsibilities Work with the sales team to understand merchant requirements Represent the full capabilities of ShopBack’s advertising solutions to merchants and partners Project management - drive end-to-end solution ideation, development, testing, troubleshooting processes efficiently and accurately Work with the sales team to market and scale new solutions to merchants effectively Continuously optimise new and existing solutions to improve its effectiveness to merchants Become a trusted and recognised AdTech and solutions expert within ShopBack and with our merchants Partner with product and technology teams to enhance the advertising solutions roadmap  Requirements At least 7-10 years of experience within digital marketing domain in a fast-paced technology company Ideally comes with experience from digital marketing companies and/or e-commerce space across APAC markets Demonstrated experience leading the development of new advertising solutions The job does not imply writing or designing software applications, but literacy/familiarity with digital marketing fundamentals (eg: cookies, pixels, MMPs, APIs) is required Excellent customer-facing verbal and written technical communication skills are required, so is the ability to translate technical jargon into clear business benefit Comfortable working with diverse teams across multiple locations Ability to influence without relying on direct authority through strong interpersonal skills Strong problem-solving skills - able to exhaustively and comprehensively break down problems in a structured manner

description: About Wells Fargo  Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 20 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Market Job Description Lead the APAC FX sales team to drive and grow the regional institutional sales franchise Direct, oversee and supervise all FX sales activities of the APAC FX sales team Develop a credible strategic plan to grow the APAC FX business in medium and long term Identify opportunities for the current platform and proactively drive the platform buildout for growth Deliver financial results and market share of our client franchise Develop and grow the current client base, develop strong partnership with our clients Provide senior coverage to our strategic and core clients Develop and maintain strong working relationships with multiple internal partners, including Regional Management, Risk, Compliance, Products, and the Global Macro Sales and trading team. Work with the support partners to lead the APAC FX sales team to operate under a sound risk and control framework Provide feedback on customer demand and make recommendations to drive product innovation Market Skills and Certifications University Degree or advanced qualifications and equivalent experience Extensive proven experience with Securities and investment banking experience at leadership level. Experience in an Institutional Sales role or a client servicing role, preferably in FX. Strong sense of urgency and commitment as well as a strong business sense with a strategic and tactical orientation. Extensive knowledge of FX products and solutions In depth understanding of technological, risk and regulatory trends impacting FX business Technical expertise in regulatory, compliance, and risk management issues. Successful track record of industry thought leadership and developing senior level relationships. Strong experience in developing and execution of business strategies. Ability to analyze data and use for decision-making and managing initiatives. Successful track record in systematically executing initiatives using project management disciplines. Highest level of integrity and good judgement and ability to maintain confidentiality. Strong stakeholder skills and ability to work and lead across functions. Strong commercial judgement, excellent communication and influencing skills. Comfortable working in a matrix organizational environment and partnership skills. Leadership Expectations at Wells Fargo  Specifically You Will  As a Team Member manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them. Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks. We Value Diversity  At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. 67119  Reference Number  67119BR

description: We are AMS. AMS is a global total workforce solutions firm founded in 1996. We enable organizations to thrive in an age of constant change by building, reshaping, and optimizing workforces. We do this through talent acquisition and contingent workforce management, internal mobility and skills development, and talent and technology advisory services. Our solutions are delivered by our 4500+ experts who live our passionate, bold, and authentic values. The ultimate aim is to help clients around the world, including 100+ blue-chip companies, create workforces that are fluid, resilient, diverse, and differentiated. We call this true workforce dexterity—and we’re here to help you achieve it.  Client Director/SVP Talent Acquisition - APAC  It took some special qualities to make AMS the world’s leading provider of talent management solutions.  Truly deep sector knowledge, real breadth of experience and a talent for innovation that adds value to the bottom line.  And it’s no coincidence that they’re precisely the same ones that you’ll need to join us as a Client Director based in Singapore.  This is a big opportunity that offers challenges on the same scale.  You’ll be in a strategic leadership role and take full accountability for a portfolio of accounts, where you'll be responsible for driving growth and expansion.  Building on our strong working relationships with key stakeholders and enhancing our credibility as a premier Talent Solutions provider, you’ll also have a passion for innovation and will play a key part in introducing the latest solutions to accounts aligned to the APAC region.  Thus, further cementing our reputation as a forward-thinking Talent Solutions provider and partner of choice.  This is a great opportunity for an experienced leader to join a fast-changing region with huge scope for future innovation.  The Role This is a big opportunity that offers challenges on the same scale. You’ll be in a strategic leadership role and take full accountability for a portfolio of accounts, where you'll be responsible for driving growth and expansion. Building on our strong working relationships with key stakeholders and enhancing our credibility as a premier Talent Solutions provider, you’ll also have a passion for innovation and will play a key part in introducing the latest solutions to accounts aligned to the APAC region. The Client Director will report into either a Client Services MD or Regional MD and will also own and deliver agreed elements of part of the overall Regional Strategy for which they work in. description: Make A Real Difference At PropertyGuru. Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.   At PropertyGuru Group, we believe that every person – no matter what their circumstance – should have a place to call home. That’s why we’ve been on a mission to transform how people find, finance, and own home across Southeast Asia over the last 13 years.    Voted by property seekers as “Asia’s Most Influential Brand for Online Property Search”, PropertyGuru enables real-world aspirations through digital transformation and constant innovation. Every day, the work that we do has a real and positive impact on thousands of lives.   As an employee, you’ll be empowered by our community work culture, where everyone has the autonomy, support, and resources to do the best work of their careers. As we evolve our journey to help people make confident property decisions, we stay true to our core values to guide the way we work and the decisions we make every step of the way: we own it and deliver it, we have fun and celebrate success, we respect and care for each other, we push beyond good, and we create what’s next.   For a full listing of our jobs, visit https://careers.propertygurugroup.com.   The Role This role is responsible for leading the agency sales business unit, creating new business opportunities and sales of online property media to property agencies and agents.  Responsibilities Manage a team of Sales Managers/Team Leaders who in turn supervise sales teams organised to handle agent accounts in key real estate agencies. Conduct and/or attend key meetings/presentations/training sessions with sales team members. Provide guidance to the business unit, giving them strategies and clear direction hence motivating them to achieve and exceed sales targets. Counsel team members whenever necessary and support them on problem-solving. In consultation with Sales Managers/Team Leaders, set KPIs and review performance. To lead and to develop the people. Build relationships with key decision-makers (C-suite) and agency divisional directors; Being able to collect and share market information for the company including intel on competitors. Work closely with internal stakeholders such as customer service, product, trade marketing, finance, and order management teams to ensure smooth sales operations. Take the initiative to suggest, recommend and offer new product ideas generated from listening to your customers keenly. Identify key areas of improvement in the sales processes Requirements Minimum Diploma or Degree holders Minimum 7 years sales experience especially in digital media or e-commerce background and have successfully managed sales teams in a fast-paced environment Strong leadership skills and ability to inspire team members Possess real estate sales experience is an added advantage Great sense of ownership and willingness to go the extra mile to deliver results. Outstanding communication skills demonstrating respect and care of others. Someone who is always curious to learn, proactive, highly energetic, tenacious, and independent. Someone who is not content with just good and wants to push beyond good. Most importantly, someone who likes to have fun at work and celebrate success with the team and company.

description: KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES  Client's trusted advisor  Be the senior point of contact for multiple clients across the region and build highly effective interpersonal relationships. Expectation is that you will spend considerable face to face time with clients to foster a partnership mentality, not delivery mentality.  Become the client's trusted advisor within the business, proactively addressing issues on both the client and dentsu sides to improve business performance. The ability to have difficult conversations with clients is an imperative.  Manage annual client development roadmap to monitor client satisfaction and proactively introduce dentsu solutions where relevant to increase client product diversity.  Work collaboratively with teams from other dentsu service lines to deliver our single P&L philosophy, ensuring clients receive a seamless service.  Attend and represent the team at important external and internal client meetings, including senior management status meetings, briefing sessions, campaign reviews, QBRs etc.    Client strategy development  Fully understand client business objectives / communication objectives and ensure these are translated into meaningful, solution focused digital strategies.  Heading up the SG hub which includes Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, South Korea and Thailand.  Work closely with account leads in other markets (incl. INDO, MY, KR and Thailand) to develop world-class media strategies & plan.  Work closely with the global team and provide markets insights as well as cascade global directions / processes to markets.  Proactively position dentsu as the media centre of excellence for your client. Take the lead on all internal and external media conversations.  Work closely with global client team on HQ requests & initiatives, such as cost modules exercise, people-based marketing initiatives and brand safety    Team & workload management  Effective management of client expectations is essential; support your teams to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of work, identifying improvements to ways of working where required.  Be responsible for the development of managers within your team, including the setting of personal objectives and performance reviews.    Client profitability and finance  Be responsible for the delivery of revenue across the clients your teams and pursue all potential cross sell / up sell opportunities.  Ensure your teams and the central billing teams are completing billing and reconciliation of campaign spend / income in a timely and accurate manner so suppliers are paid on time, and clients are invoiced on time.    Product development & new business  Remain abreast of developments in media and contribute towards internal PR targets.  Work closely with the Client Partner/ Head of Media on client development and with the New Business Lead to deliver new business RFPs and pitches as required.  Leverage relationships with media partners to identify innovative solutions to client challenges, with the focus on creating case studies and award entries.    Key Experiences  Minimum 10 years' agency side experience in a digital strategy and/or execution role  Experience managing a team to deliver best-in-class client campaigns  Experience managing senior client relationships independently    Professional Skills  Articulate presenter, with the ability to present to senior clients and internal agency teams, comfortable with showing what data means and how we can take action based upon it  Passionate about and engaged with the fast changing world of digital media  Good understanding of planning integrated campaigns across the various mechanisms, channels and buying models  Strongly numerate and comfortable manipulating data sets  Highly literate with a good understanding of how language is used to communicate to different audiences.  Commitment to deliver first class work every time, and never leave a quality issue unchecked  Highly commercial - selling value, negotiation, client relationship management skills, how to be a trusted business advisor  Excellent planning, analytical and organisational skills alongside high attention to detail      OBJECTIVES AND MEASURES OF SUCCESS  What Success in this role looks like  Have built strong relationships with client and dentsu stakeholders, meeting regularly to review business challenges  Have worked with dentsu stakeholders to implement innovative media solutions to meet client objectives, with case studies created  Have identified and delivered new business / cross sell / up sell opportunities in partnership with the Client Partner/ Head of Media and dentsu stakeholders  Have instilled a strong attention to detail within your direct reports, following all processes defined by finance ops & operations teams      DENTSU VALUES  Will live the dentsu 8 Ways at all times: We Dream Loud, We Inspire Change, We Team Without Limits, We All Lead, We Make It Real, We Climb High, We Choose Excitement, We Are A Force For Good    INCLUSION & DIVERSITY  We're proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won't define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That's what we care about.    So, whether you're joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.    WORKING WITH US  Joining dentsu international, you'll join a team of 48,000 people. It's an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you'll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, memorable experiences and opportunities to shape your future.    KEEPING CONNECTED  Please visit our website to find out more and connect with us on social.  www.dentsu.com      *Please include an updated CV in your application.  **We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

jobTitle: Independent Software Vendor (ISV) Regional Sales Representative
description: Sales Representative  Location: Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Thailand  Increasing proliferation of cloud technology is driving customers and Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) to leverage the cloud as a default delivery model and also encouraging them to move from their previously on-prem solution via cloud. This is creating an exciting opportunity for organizations such as Oracle which are able to provide a comprehensive support ecosystem to our customers and ISVs. Oracle helps them accelerate their revenues while providing enterprise grade scalable and secure cloud infrastructure at a competitive price-performance. Oracle JAPAC solution team is an established team with new generated investment which is poised for hyper-growth over next coming years. We are competing with AWS and Azure and seeking talented and motivated sales professionals who want to carve out a dynamic, fast growth career for themselves and a growth trajectory for Oracle JAPAC solution business. We have the finest cloud infrastructure in market and are ready to help our customer and SaaS providers operate and innovate on our cloud platform. Oracle JAPAC solution team is seeking an experienced Cloud Sales Rep to lead and expand the business with our hottest customers and ISVs. Brief Description Cloud Sales Rep will sell to, with and through nominated accounts in your allocated territory to achieve and exceed sales targets. You will also build, negotiate, and deliver cloud solution business plans to your customers with the autonomy to creative solutions by bringing together various Oracle resources to close large complex deals Detailed Description •       Ability to evolve and develop the overall Oracle sales strategy and model for cloud services in the SEA market. •       Deliver a weekly forecasting cadence that provide visibility to Oracles leadership of sales pipeline status and plan to achieve target bookings and usage, as well as upside and risks to      achieving targets Build, Develop and maintain relationships with selected customers and ISVs, to bring application(s) to Oracle cloud platform (OCI) •       Create, drive and own account plans for the selected ISVs in collaboration with our customers and or other teams. •       Position Oracle Cloud’s commercial, business and technical benefits •       Evangelize all Oracle Cloud IaaS and PaaS services across the territory with the help and support from solution engineering teams. •       Identify the correct contractual models to enable more business for our ISV partners and Oracle •       Actively keep track of cloud consumption levels, and identify opportunities and challenges by working together with partner success managers •       Establish trusted relationships with development, sales, technical operations, procurement teams at the ISV partner organizations. Identify and maintain the ISV's organization structure. •       Create communication channels within the ISVs and leverage them in a timely fashion to seize opportunities and tackle challenges. •       Establish trusted relationships with CXO at customers and ISVs. Job Requirements •       At least 5 years of quota-carrying sales experience in cloud technology and/or platform sales. •       Ideally, 3 years must be in channel sales (SIs, ISVs) driving solution cloud sales activity and managing relationships with partners •       Have a broad understanding of cloud tech trends and competitor landscape •       Accurate quarterly forecasting using Oracle's CRM tools. •       Effective negotiator with excellent communication and presentation skills •       Bachelors or Masters degree in Technology is preferred Work/Life Harmony We are aware that Covid has changed professional and personal lives and therefore our team encourages work-life balance, because health comes first.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: This is an exciting leadership position within the NICE – Value Realization Services (VRS) Organization that is focused on the growth, development and excellence in execution of our consulting and advisory services business. The ideal candidate brings a strong mix of sales, consulting and operations experience to be positioned strongly to lead customers through Contact Center/CCaaS transformations.  As a services leader in a technology company such as NICE, one must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy to lead the team to deliver bottom line business impact via our software solutions. Candidates should be well experienced to lead and develop a team of high caliber consulting professionals responsible for development of the VRS business and delivery of the services. This is a hands-on leadership position where you are willing to personally involve yourself in direct consulting delivery of strategic advisory engagements and lead by example. This leader will work with multiple broad groups within NICE and must have proven ability to influence cross-functional teams with or without formal “direct-line” authority and be effective in driving strategy in a matrixed organization.  This is a unique opportunity for excellent leadership to take a high-profile function like VRS and make it a competitive differentiator for NICE. A leadership position that provides tremendous opportunities for Innovation & Creativity along with strong operational excellence.  Functional Areas of Ownership VRS New Business Development VRS Subscription Renewals VRS Sales Enablement VRS P&L & operational management VRS Advisory Consulting Delivery  Leadership Responsibilities Strategically and Effectively manage all Business KPIs including VRS Revenue, Bookings, Profitability, Margins, Billability In charge of VRS delivery and excellence in execution of all our consulting services for all domains, ensuring high CSAT In charge of running an effective Global VRS subscription renewals program at an executive level – with a keen focus on increasing renewal conversions Responsible for growth of new VRS business - Proactively Developing Advisory & Transformation Consulting business with large customers Responsible for growth of VRS business within existing customer base – with focus on managed services, strategic advisory consulting services and data analytics services Proactively develop and maintain relationships with Account Executives & Services Sales Executives to promote VRS in their deals, and support in sales cycles as needed and provide help with crafting of associated deals Responsible for VRS sales enablement & education – collaboration with Sales Leaders Ensure high team utilization via direct or matrixed assignments Monitor and provide feedback to consultants on billability and associated improvements.  Performance KPIs VRS Booking $$ VRS Renewal Rate % VRS Revenue $$ VRS Relational CSAT VRS Quality Deliverables Adheranc  Qualifications Minimum 10 years experience in a contact center environment, including leadership & management of call center operations or transformation projects Proven business development experience and driving renewals of consulting services Deep experience of having delivered consulting services personally and managing teams of business consultants Proven track record of effectively handling C-Level executive sponsors at large enterprise customers Able to define/create effective consulting processes for enterprise software Owned/managed a consulting services practice or business a plus Combination of Sales & Consulting experience in a contact center space Expertise with more than one domain a plus (example – workforce management/performance mgt/quality/speech analytics etc.) Demonstrated experience with leading organizational change, creating governance teams and center of excellence processes Excellent communication and presentation skills Digital CCaaS Transformation experience a Plus Enterprise software knowledge, direct experience with NICE solutions a Plus Coaching, developing & managing consultants & business development teams Excellent problem-solving ability in high pressure situations Strong attention to detail and sense of urgency to meet deadlines BS or BA degree, or higher Must be willing to travel up to 50%
