description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting an Associate Director to join our Affinity team in Singapore.  About Aon Headquartered in London, Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.   Responsibilities: Manage, co-ordinate and develop new Affinity led business across the region Analyze and develop the existing Asia Affinity portfolio to determine and review what is successfully working and what needs to be discontinued and or modified to be successful Develop and own annual business plans focused upon Affinity led Local Market Planning (LMP) delivering growth, efficiency with effective solutions Lead Affinity business development commercial efforts to launch new Affinity programs, including but not limited to: Establishing contacts with prospective business partners in the region Developing and writing business proposals (including financial projections and profitability studies) for prospects Developing and managing relationships with insurance companies (in cooperation/coordination with the broking teams as applicable) and vendors Lead high level relationship management of existing Affinity clients Oversee the implementation; roll out, project management of current Affinity projects including the overseeing of new Affinity opportunities: Assist and guide country specific Affinity staff in these areas including market insurer negotiations Develop and manage product & solutions as required to support identified new business opportunities Work closely and directly with all Aon colleagues, local client segments, Specialty teams as well as other resources including Sales & Marketing, Bid Management, IT and the Regional Office, Legal and Contracts departments.  Ensure financial responsibilities within the reporting line, including but not limited to developing marketing budgets, developing marketing campaign assumptions, managing programs to comply with financial budgets.  Requirements: Degree or post graduate degree in a business-related discipline Certificate in General Insurance (CGI) or equivalent Associate, Diploma related certificate Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in Broking, General Insurance or related industry Practical experience in Affinity or Financial Institutions Programme Development and Management including the business process flow between relevant parties Strong relationship building, customer focus and management skills Strong skills in negotiation, underwriting, risk evaluation and decision making An analytical mindset and a talent for data interpretation Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence others Excellent written and oral communication skills Strategic selling and presentation skills Self-starter that possesses initiative and takes on accountability Practical understanding of Regulatory requirements concerning basic Affinity program structures across Asia Strong awareness of Industry emerging trends or disrupters  How to Apply Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.

description: Responsibilities  Drive Customer Success Outcomes Increase renewal rates and reduce churn. Influence future lifetime value through higher product adoption, customer satisfaction and overall health scores Drive new business growth through greater advocacy and reference ability Shape the organizational objectives and success metrics Drive measurable customer success outcomes. Define and Optimise Customer Lifecycle Develop a data-driven customer success strategy for applying effective tech-touch, low touch, and high touch engagement models across our customer segments. Develop listening points in journey. Standardise interventions for each point in journey. Define segmentation of customer base and varying strategies. Identify opportunities for continuous improvement. Learn from best practices in industry. Manage Customer Success Activities Onboarding Training Customer Support Customer Success Management Renewals Advocacy Escalations Measure Effectiveness of Customer Success Define operational metrics for team. Establish system for tracking metrics. Create cadence for review within team. Present strategy, insights, financial/non-financial achievements, and quarterly progress updates to senior stakeholders in a compelling manner. Create a teaming model for partnering with support, sales, services, and channel partners on a cohesive approach to key account success. Monitor and streamline critical business frameworks and operational processes to create a highly effective Customer Success discipline and organisation. Lead World-class Customer Success Team Hire, mentor, and shape the capability of the Asia Pacific customer success organization, with an eye to developing leaders and attracting top talent. Define and implement a strategy to improve customer experience and engagement, scale the team, develop talent, balance cost, lower churn, all towards the net result of greater customer product adoption. Create rapid onboarding process for new team members. Foster collaboration within team and across customer lifecycle. Encourage continuous learning within team. Enhance Effectiveness and Efficiency Through Technology Support business systems Marketing automation systems Reference and advocacy solutions Customer Success Management platform Inspire Customer Success Across Company Create company-wide culture of Customer Success. Partner with marketing, analytics, and product teams to continuously evolve the engagement models for onboarding, adoption, expansion, and retention. Align with Sales around cross-sell and up-sell and focus on selling with a retention focus. Align with Finance around measurement and forecasting. Align with Executive Team around key metrics and objectives. Drive company-wide definition of ideal customer.

Job Description Summary AKA (ASEAN, Korea and ANZ) is a key growth region for GE Healthcare with an aspiration to reach >$1B in sales over next 3 years by broadening channel reach and enhancing customer experience. Given AKA region’s growth ambitions, this newly created leadership position will carry responsibility to design and implement Omnichannel strategy across AKA region. The position holder will lead design and development of specific capabilities (e.g. digital or eCommerce) and their integration with existing GTM capabilities to reach new customers and achieve seamless customer experience throughout the customer’s lifecycle enabling customer loyalty. The position holder will accomplish these objective by partnering with traditional channels (direct sales and channel managers) and enabling functions (IT, finance, and operations). The position holder will establish relationships with Product/Service business units and Marketing to deploy omni-channel strategy/capabilities, champion their adoption, and co-design campaigns that enables business reach new customers and enhances overall customer experience. The position holder will have accountability for delivering execution excellence and driving incremental business outcomes (incremental orders and margin) for the partner business units.On a day-to-day basis, the role holder will report directly to Chief Marketing & Strategy Officer for AKA region. This individual will have strong business acumen, understands process solution, has expertise in digital and non-digital channels and thrives in fast-moving, highly matrixed environment with demonstrated capability of leading change management with “can do” positive attitude.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Job Responsibilities:  Develop AKA region omnichannel customer engagement strategy to expand coverage, increase reach, and improve customer retention in close partnership with Marketing, Digital Technologies/IT, Channel, Product, and Services teams. Develop an understanding of current state and aspirational customer expectations about customer experience, channels, and touchpoints. From insights, develop cross-functional strategies to optimize the customers' omnichannel experience via new or modified infrastructure, processes, and/or engagement mechanisms. Lead development of the business requirements (capabilities, marketing assets and technology stack) needed to create compelling experiences for customers and align with IT on technical architecture and integration and with marketing/commercial on marketing campaign execution and GTM Activate Omnichannel customer engagement across the organization Rollout (with Digital/IT) new tools/capabilities that enable omnichannel customer engagement, e.g. Website, Virtual Tradeshow/Webinar/customer education platform, Web Chat, eCommerce platform, Inside Sales, Remote Demo Drive enhancements of existing offline capabilities/GTM/customer engagement modes, roll out changes in partnership with IT/channel excellence/commercial leadership across region in phased manner Integrate newly developed capabilities with enhanced traditional capabilities for seamless customer experience. Build appropriate governance, process, training and monitoring framework for optimal integration. Closely partner with Commercial Excellence and DT to establish right data, metrics and dashboard views to track performance of omnichannel model Be an internal advocate/champion to drive adoption, maximize usage of omnichannel capabilities/tools by different businesses in their marketing/NPI activation plans and customer loyalty programs, provide guidance and training where necessary Provide thought leadership on digital and non-digital channels, campaign planning, and best ways to leverage Omnichannel capabilities to achieve business outcomes Partner with training teams to develop content to reinforce Omnichannel customer engagement model and mindset as well as toolkits to support key new product introductions and customer loyalty programs Partner with product managers, services growth leaders and marketers to devise & execute omnichannel campaigns that drive business results Monitor and evaluate campaigns through metrics that matter and make recommendations to optimize performance where appropriate, e.g. increase reach, win-rate, pricing and so on. Positively engage, educate and inspire members of marketing and commercial function, share best practices, accolades, saying and showing what "good" looks like to help others learn and improve. Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging tools and tactics to support innovation and omnichannel activation and be the champion of an ever-evolving omnichannel roadmap. Manage the Omni-channel strategy design, deployment and activation budget and ensure that it stays within allocated funds and delivers in a predictable fashion Manage results of the Omni-channel customer engagement at aggregate AKA region against KPI/targets (e.g., expansion of coverage/visibility, retention of high potential customers, order growth, optimization of customer acquisition & retention costs), report results and recommendations for course correction to senior AKA leadership.  Required Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or field related to the essential duties of the job. 10+ years demonstrated experience in a marketing/commercial leadership role, with accountability in recent roles to understanding and managing omnichannel experiences. Demonstrated ability to apply strong business acumen in marketing, sales driving efficient expansion of visibility/coverage and customer loyalty programs, tools, and processes. Strong analytics and planning competency: A hands-on, detail-oriented professional with excellent technical, analytical, planning, evaluation and implementation skills. Demonstrated capability of delivering complex initiatives on time and within budget.   Ability to think strategically, make data-driven decisions, and capable of driving agreement of senior leadership with the strategy Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams in developing strategies and designing appropriate activation plans, skilled at organizational change management. Influence, collaborate, and partner effectively with multiple stakeholders at all levels across the marketing function and commercial organization, both virtually and in-person, to align on operational objectives and provide consistent leadership, guidance and inspiration. Clear and effective communication and presentation skills on process optimization initiatives and outcomes to all levels of the organization.  Preferred Qualifications:  MBA or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field 15+ years of marketing or commercial leadership experience Past experience of having developed digital and non-digital channels from design, deployment and activation in B2B industry Experience working closely with sales and products/Services teams to influence process and organizational improvements. Ability to travel and willingness to work flexible hours  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

More than 10 years' experience in management position Ability to align with corporate principles and work towards deliverables Strong drive to develop business and open overseas markets Commercially astute and capable of strategizing for profitability and growth Strong leadership qualities and ability to build and manage a strong team The Responsibilities Include The ability to drive strategize and drive sales & marketing activities as a profit centre Tendering, pricing and securing of new businesses and handling contractual matters Spearhead Operations excellence through establishment and/or improvement of policies and procedures, process to increase performance and customer service satisfaction Developing and managing System Integrators & Channel partners, OEM business as well as logistics. description: Job Purpose Summary  Responsibility to develop new business for the funds services department of Trident Trust, Singapore (TTS).  Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities/Duties Develop and maintain a business development action plan, including a clear and focused visitation programme for potential introducers of business and clients. Liaise with marketing and other business development staff within TTS in relation to business development activity. Ensure that you input and keep up to date our internal business development tracking system. Identify prime target markets and be aware of and report on competitors, products, geographic areas of interest. Prepare and deliver external sales presentations as required. Negotiate fee arrangements with new clients and ensure clients are informed of due diligence and other new client acceptance requirements. Ensure all onboarding papers are accurate and complete before attending and presenting to the New Business Committee. Ensure smooth handover of new business to relevant administration teams and involve the respective team in the take on in a timely manner. Ensure service standards and policies and procedures in respect of new business are adhered to. Meet new business sales targets. Assist with debt collection as required in relation to business introduced. To meet TTS’s regulatory requirements. Exhibit a professional, business-like appearance and demeanour To observe and comply with TTS’s internal policies and procedures. To act with the highest standards of ethics, integrity and professionalism. To participate in training and tests provided by TTS pursuant to TTS’s regulatory obligations to train and test its employees and to demonstrate competency in the topics tested. Anything else reasonably required by TTS in its business development; and the maintenance of TTS companies’ licences and regulatory compliance. Skills Required Understanding and competency in marketing strategies and methods, and relevant regulations. A proven and verifiable track record in fund services sales. Min 10 years experience in a similar role with a similar company. High degree of professional ethics and integrity Ability to communicate well and effectively, verbally and in writing, to a diverse audience Build and maintain close and effective working relationships at all levels both within TTS and with external intermediaries Good interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with tact and confidence in dealing with people at all levels, both internally and externally A deep understanding of the funds industry including hedge funds and private equity funds.

description: About The Company  Our client is an independent Fund Administration business with offices globally. It has successfully positioned itself as a leading player in its space after growing year on year alongside a strong tech angled approach to its business units.  About The Job  Reporting to the Regional Managing Director, your role will includce, but not limited to: The overall responsibility for selling our clients private market products and services in APAC. Developing a measurable pipeline of potential clients in the closed-ended new launch and conversion fund space with a focus on sales activity, revenue forecasting and profitability. Identifing and winning new businesses in APAC cross the infrastructure, hard assets, renewables, private equity, private debt, real estate, venture capital and funds of funds space. Growing and building a network and pipeline in the Limited Partners (LP) space to position the firm's portfolio administration service offering. Leading the sales process and commercial negotiations in line with internally agreed parameters. Develop and manage the feeder network. Participate in the private markets team thought leadership initiatives by writing topical articles pertinent to the industry. Skills And Experience Required Proven track record generating new revenue in the closed-ended fund arena of outsourced fund administration and accounting services The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, a quick learner and will be expected to establish and maintain relationships with key influencers in the industry Self-motivated and driven to deliver strong sales results Deep relationships within the APAC region, (LPs, GPs, feeder network such as law firms, consultants etc.) and track record of building new relationships. To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Ignatius D'Cruz at 6510 6516.  (EA: 94C3609/ R1762883)

description: Role Purpose As the Business Manager, you will report to the Digital Insights Business Lead. You will work with affiliates and other VS to identify opportunities, build go-to-market plans and business frameworks, design business models, and execute digital sales processes across all disease areas/ markets to enable revenue-generating digital insights business. This role will build up relationships with a wide range of stakeholders within the laboratory, hospital, payors etc. in order to develop potential markets for the affiliates.  In this role, you will Synchronize digital product portfolio across all customer areas of Core Lab, Molecular, Tissue Diagnostics and Point of Care as products become available Generate and consolidate the relevant market information, in new disease areas/ markets. Identify opportunities, and barriers & develop strategies to experiment with moving the opportunities further for digital solutions, in partnership with the affiliates & other Value Streams. Develop business plans, the associated business models and go-to-market strategies to enable digital insights business, in collaboration with the affiliates & other VS. Implement projects to experiment and identify the value proposition of the digital solutions and how they strengthen Roche Diagnostics leadership in the core business areas. Determine the market launch framework to determine the priority markets for new product launches, Act as a coach for local affiliates to scale products, harvest new business growth opportunities and develop business cases to support them Engage with the global/regional hubs for the different business areas, along with local and regional sales operations, market development, solution delivery teams to establish the full commercial operations for the selling of digital solutions Accountable for actively monitoring, assessing, creating and executing cross-functional strategic and tactical plans to achieve market development objectives, and building up productive relationships with a wide range of stakeholders e.g. Healthcare IT, policy makers, KOLs. Liaise with the Global Business Development / Partnering team as appropriate to enhance our holistic digital solutions portfolio. International travel of up to 50% is expected for this role  Who you are Minimum qualifications Bachelors or Masters in IT, Business, Healthcare, Finance; Previous 8-10 years similar experience; Demonstrated ability to be pro-active in supporting local sales & marketing teams to execute the GTM plans e.g. direct project management of pilots  Qualification and Experience Preferred qualifications Experience in driving adoption of SaaS products is desired Experience in the diagnostics industry is preferred Strategic mindset and experience of innovative market access strategy in commercial success Demonstrated courage, vision and drive to be at the forefront of innovative change and challenge the status quo Demonstrate the ability to prioritize in an ambiguous environment in accordance to a clear understanding of the business, target markets and trends Strong relationship building, networking, diplomacy, influencing and collaboration skills with demonstrated history of working with a broad range of stakeholders Self-starter with the ability to work autonomously or as part of a cross-functional team, including associates from public affairs, medical/scientific affairs, and commercial operations Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, including demonstrated ability to develop strong relationships  Location Preferred location will be Singapore, however other locations within Asia Pacific may also be considered.  APAC This is a diverse region culturally and with respect to business maturity. APAC Spirit is an embodiment of the organisation we in the APAC region aspire to be. As a member in this region, you will strive to deeply understand, live and encourage those around you to embrace the APAC Spirit principles. As this position is a regional role, international business travel will be required depending upon the business location of the successful candidate and ongoing business project activities. Roche is strongly committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strive to build teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Embracing diversity enables us to create a great place to work and to innovate for patients
industries: Pharmaceuticals, Biotechnology, and Medical Devices

jobTitle: Vice President Solutions -APMEA Banking Solutions Pre-Sales
description: Head of Presales (VP / Senior Director Level) – Payments and Core Banking, APMEA  ASIA PACIFIC MIDDLE EAST AFRICA PRE-SALES HEAD - SOLUTIONS MANAGEMENT – PAYMENTS AND CORE BANKING SOLUTIONS – TEAM LEADERSHIP - SINGAPORE OR KEY LOCATIONS IN ASIA – HIGH QUALITY TEAM – GLOBAL LEADER - TOP $$$  DEEP DEMONSTRATED TEAM LEADERSHIP and PRESALES EXPERIENCE IN PAYMENTS SOFTWARE AND / OR CORE BANKING ARE MANDATORY – APMEA MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE  Head of Presales for Asia Pacific, Middle East, and Africa will be part of a global and regional teams of industry focused consultants and manage a team of 30 members with 5 to 6 direct reports which will work across our client’s customer and prospect base to leverage the capabilities of Our Client and its partners to deliver transformational business outcomes to their customers in APMEA.  You are expected to have a deep understanding of the business processes of financial institutions and be able to position the value of Our Client's Payments (both Retail and Enterprise Payments) and Core Banking offerings (software and services) to help address those needs. As such this role requires this individual to lead external engagement and work collaboratively and closely with the sales, marketing, solutions management, and services teams to be successful.  Our client, your new company, will rely on your technical know-how and ability to take customers on a journey by delivering impactful product demos, POCs, or compelling storytelling backed up by in-depth knowledge of Payments and Core Banking solutions.  Sales engagement – critical to sales success, is often a key differentiator in winning deals combining technical market knowledge with customer influencing skills. Key advisor/leader of strategic deals. Positions combined Our Client products as differentiated proposition.  Go to Market (GTM) campaigns – creates regional specific campaigns and tailors global campaigns. Drives value proposition & execution.  Demonstrations – internal trainer in Our Client demo approach. Evangelistic across Our Client for using the approach.  Situational analysis – used as a key point of reference by product management and by sales leaders in understanding market trends and product requirements.  Competitive positioning – creates new competitive strategies and leads their adoption across the organization.  Solution positioning – able to position alternative approaches to customer using alternative approaches/3rd party solutions which enable Our Client IP to be installed/extended.  Experience & knowledge Deep experience and knowledge 0f Payment Solutions (Retail Payments experience strongly preferred) and Complex Banking Software APMEA Complex Banking Solutions Sales/presales experience (at minimum APAC) 20+ years’ proven experience with business knowledge in the banking space will be a minimum, ideally the candidate would have a mix of direct business exposure within a financial institution and experience either in a consultancy, or technology vendor positioning and selling solutions to those institutions. description: Position Summary  The Regional Operations Director (Asia-Pacific) in F&B will actively provide operational support to achieve effective and efficient service in compliance with policies, procedures and regulatory requirements. The Director will be responsible for the overall operational performance and support products, team skills for owned and managed Group business expansion across the region. The Regional Operations Director will also create and implement new process/ policies and procedures in alignment with key performance indicators. He/She will monitor and audit systems and processes regularly to ensure appropriate standards are met.  Job Responsibilities Involve in daily planning, organising, directing, staffing, and controlling. Oversee the operation of company restaurant(s) and central kitchen in Singapore, Hong Kong & China. Develop, implement, review, improve on processes, standard operating procedures, business process and general operations. Reduce, manage, analyze, and report operating budget and expenses. Work together with management team with the preparation of annual budgets and full year projections. Recommend solutions and implements appropriate corrective action for major or complex maintenance, operational or service delivery issues. Coordinate with the Executive Chefs in product development, food quality and cost control. Ensure all the staff are following the standard operation procedures in the area of hygiene, food preparation, service delivery, daily purchasing and stock management, etc. Track and monitor the shops performance and recommend for action plans to capture additional / seasonal sales opportunities. Develop, liaise and maintain excellent relations with internal departments, property developers, landlords and external contractors. Responsible for the analysis and development of existing and new business, preparation of business plans. Involve in exploring new and potential locations across the Asia-Pacific region. Identify market trend and opportunities to increase Group sales and profitability. Fully in-charge new central kitchen in Singapore and ensure its well functional and integrated with wholesale/trading business (meat/seafood/sauce pack) across the Asia-Pacific. Build up business network with other potential business partner to accelerate wholesales business across the region. Requirements University degree holder. More than 10 years related experience in managing F&B operational teams and minimum 5 years at Management level. Excellent communications, collaboration, and relationship management skills. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English and Chinese. Knowledge of Cantonese and Japanese will have added advantage in order to liaise with business associates. Critical thinking – demonstrated ability to analyse information, develop strategy, tactically direct the execution of the strategy, finetune, revise strategy and fix process. Knowledge and experience in managing diverse portfolios across a range of geographic locations. Highly organized, self-motivated and proficient in MS Office Suite. Front and back of restaurant operational hands-on experience. Occasional business trip.

description: The Travel Corporation (TTC) is a highly successful international travel group that creates enriching experiences for travelers by combining an unbeatable mix of exceptional service and quality at great value. At the heart of everything we do is our passion to provide industry leading service and quality so that our guests can focus on the most important thing; the transformative and immersive travel experiences we offer around the world.  With 40 offices around the world, more than 10,000 staff and 1.9 million guests annually, the company’s business is spilt between a multi-award-winning portfolio ranging from luxury hotels and boutique river cruises, to independent holiday package companies and a variety of guided travel experiences. These include AAT Kings, Contiki Holidays, Costsaver, Trafalgar, Insight Vacations, Luxury Gold, Uniworld Boutique River Cruise Collection, Inspiring Journeys and Red Carnation Boutique Hotel Collection.  Our philosophy is simple. Through our sustainability efforts and vision to Make Travel Matter, taking care of our people and guests and constantly innovating on new ways to Make Travel Personal, we exist to create life-changing moments for every guest who travels with any of our 40 award-winning brands.  The Marketing Communications Director, Asia is responsible for all Marketing and PR activities for the various TTC global brands in the region. Working closely with the CEO for Asia, this role will play a key function in growing the business and be responsible for driving both short and long-term growth goals, with an emphasis on the digital arena.  The role is based in Singapore and responsibilities include:  Lead the marketing team and external agencies for Best-in-Class execution.  Develop and execute regional marketing and PR campaigns with full ownership of budgets and return of investment. Drive consumer and trade-related initiatives to increase demand in both digital and traditional media platforms. Drive on-line conversions via the various brand websites. Conceptualise physical and virtual events or platforms for sales-generating activities. Identify and report key trends in the industry across the region and incorporate them into global and local marketing plans. Conduct market intelligence and research in association with competition analysis and monitor consumer trends. Initiate and execute impactful strategic marketing with trade partners. Work collaboratively with the worldwide marketing teams on global campaigns and the localization of assets, websites and collaterals. Agency and Brand management Develop an understanding of the various digital media channels (Paid Media) and the potential ROI in the marketing activity. Develop and understand the target audiences’ attitudes, behaviour and perceptions, using a variety of market information and research data. Campaign performance management and data analysis. Engage consumers in the world of digital communications by demonstrating its direct response, creative and brand-building abilities. Maintain working relationships with the media and act as the company's point-of-contact Co-ordinate all PR campaigns with various agencies across Asia Conduct media positioning and landscaping in the region, taking into account an integrated paid, owned, earned relationship with different media partners Emergency and Crisis Response responsibilities  Requirements: Minimum 5 years proven experience in leading marketing teams in an agency, media or consumer-facing industry. Tertiary qualification in Marketing or relevant disciplines. Strong analytical skills and experience in end-to-end campaign management Solid understanding of digital media ecosystem and technology Strong experience in executing paid media campaigns across multiple channels  Proficiency in Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, Google Analytics and other Mobile Measurement tools a must (e.g. Appsflyer) An eye for detail and effective communication skills Ability to handle multiple projects Strong experience of MS Word, PowerPoint and Outlook Proven presentation and PowerPoint skills High level communication (written and verbal) skills  A career in travel is one of the most exciting, fun and fulfilling paths – we are dream makers and create opportunities to experience new destinations, different cultures and lifelong memories. Bring your ambition to make a difference and we’ll bring a world of opportunities. For more information about TTC, visit www.ttc.com.

description: Market leaders in the Translation & Localisation industry Sales-driven role with exciting incentive package  About Our Client  Our client is an exciting Translation & Localisation business. They aim to combine human empathy and machine intelligence in providing the most accurate translation & localisation services. They have been in the industry for 20+ years and currently work with some of the world's biggest brands. They are now looking to hire for an Enterprise Sales Director to generate business with new logos.  Job Description  The core focus for this role is generating business from new logos. The Enterprise Sales Director is responsible for achieving assigned sales targets, maintaining profitable growth within a territory and executing on overarching sales and corporate objectives. They will manage the entire sales process including lead generation, qualification, discovery, solution development / presentation, negotiation and close. The target customers are companies larger than $1 Billion in revenue within an assigned geographic territory.Responsibilities include: Achieve prospecting goals by generating new leads and opportunities from personal activity (cold calling), trade shows, internal & external conferences, regional organisations, etc. Work to qualify / close leads (MQLs) sourced by marketing Manage opportunities to closure Develop a deep understanding of your prospects business goals, competition, growth plans and obstacles Communicate strategic information such as market intelligence, key customer data, competitive analysis and pricing information to internal constituencies  The Successful Applicant  The Ideal Candidate Must Have The Following Proven experience in an Enterprise Sales role within the Translation & Localisation industry, or a related industry Ability to win new logos by doing new business pitching and managing the entire sales process to closure Be able to work independently and be sales-motivated in winning new businesses  What's On Offer  This is an amazing opportunity to join an market leader as part of its expansion. We are looking for a motivated individual who has the ability to help win new businesses.  Contact: Ryan Ong  Quote job ref: JN-092021-3578321

Because we fundamentally believe every colleague brings unique value to our whole. Services Engagement Director  APAC, Singapore  Here at Anaplan, we have reinvented how companies see, plan, and run their businesses. Our platform allows our customers to uncover new insights, connect their strategy to their plans, and work in ways they had not previously thought possible. We’re growing fast, constantly innovating, and couldn’t be prouder to help our customers move forward with confidence in a sophisticated and changing world. Because we fundamentally believe every colleague brings unique value to our whole. We are a workplace where each person feels seen, heard, and valued, and can contribute their unique talent to our collective effort. We believe that for ourselves and for our customers.  We want you to think big and act bold through expressing your authentic best self! Anaplan is looking for a tenacious Services Engagement Director to join our Customer Success Team in Singapore. This is a stellar opportunity to get involved in a highly visible, large scale SaaS cloud company. This role is an immediate full-time position. If you’re ready to roll up your sleeves and tackle unique problems that no one else is solving, keep reading.  Come see for yourself what an exciting place to work for looks like.  Insight on your impact  This Individual Will Be a director level leader who will own the professional services sales strategy in partnership with the Customer Success Directors and Professional Services Director. Be accountable for delivering the professional services bookings target with contributions from the Customer Success Directors and Customer Success Business Partners as well as from third party partners for subcontracted work. Be experienced in delivering / positioning / selling services in a software lifecycle, specifically with strong understanding of architecting multi-dimensional on-line analytical processing solutions and data integrations. Have tight-knit collaboration, leadership, and influencing skills with the ability to own the room with c-level executives down to process stakeholders. Your Qualifications, Your Influence Responsible for new business and existing customer services sales, contract negotiations, and strategic alliance across the APAC region. Partner with internal stakeholders to support them on the services bookings financial forecast with the Professional Services Director, Customer Success Directors and Business Partners. Accountable for services bookings target in concert with the Professional Services Director, Customer Success Directors and Business Partners. Identify services selling opportunities with Customer Success Directors, Business Partners and Sales Account Executives. Engage with customers on the services selling opportunities. Responsible for well scoped statements of work for services delivery. Responsible for relationship management and engagement with third party partners used for delivery. Responsible for the services sales cycle to secure services bookings to meet targets. Define an aligned implementation approach and determine customer presentation materials, including appropriate customer demo and collateral to address customer problem statement and outline the joint approach. Participation in mid to late sales cycle activities assessing technical or business requirements. Preferred Skills And Technical Familiarity 8+ years successful GSI or Consultative Professional Services experience. Success in meeting/exceeding services sales quota (selling large complex services deals to Enterprise accounts). Ability to work with both technical and business stakeholders. Experience with Agile methodology. Strong technical aptitude to learn the Anaplan solution quickly. Strong client facing skills and a successful track record of engagement management. Experience selling into various lines of business, multiple use cases for various industry customers. Strong understanding of solution delivery within a software lifecycle, including architectural multi-dimensional design, requirements collecting, data integration, broad functional understanding of defining process best practices, articulating and positioning the value ascribed with services proposals, and a passion for driving success outcomes for services engagements. Excellent Presentation skills Executive presence Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree preferred Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity, inclusion, and belonging. We believe in maintaining a hiring and working experience in which all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your true self to work every day!  COVID-19  Protecting the health and safety of our communities, including our employees and of those considering a career at Anaplan, is our highest priority. We continue to closely monitor the evolving situation and we appreciate your understanding and flexibility with any related changes to our interviewing process.

jobTitle: Director of Sales and Marketing (Medical Solutions/ SEA Market)
description: Responsibilities Be responsible for all sales and marketing activities within the organisation. Drive sales while ensuring product margins are healthy. Managing sales and marketing activities in the organisation with the objective of ensuring that there are sufficient activities to close sales, managing resources to ensure that sales objectives are met. Driving / coaching / mentoring sales department. Ensure that the team is able to articulate the unique selling points and the value proposition of the product or service that they are selling. Understand and map out the customer buying process with the objective that effective sales processes are implemented within the organisation to increase sales effectiveness. Implement a continuous learning / cross learning culture within the team so that product and industry knowledge within the team is comprehensive, and that sales persons are the best performers that they can be. Conduct sales activities (with assistance for proposal preparation) and close sales for select strategic / high importance opportunities. Be a model of diligence and excellence for sales personnel within the organisation. Determine in conjunction with the CEO on a periodic basis products that require additional marketing and promotion campaigns taking into consideration the product market potential. Plan for and orchestrate online and physical marketing campaigns for identified products. Implement systems to measure marketing effectiveness. Ensure that activities between the marketing team and the sales team are well coordinated and aligned. Ensure that marketing leads are effectively converted to sales opportunities which are in turn effectively converted to sales orders. Assist in evaluating new products which can be potentially distributed by organization, as well as evaluate the product value in conjunction with the CEO. Plan and execute go-to-market strategies for new products. Work with and advise the officers in the company and associates responsibly for regulatory compliance Liaison with the shareholders and partners Requirements Preferably a degree in Engineering or a Medical related degree or Business degree Must have an interest in medical technology (especially rehabilitative equipment) and a passion for how such technology can improve health (as well as professional sports) outcomes. Must have had a track record of success as a sales person, preferably to clinical organisations. Must have led and managed a team of sales persons, and have had success coaching and improving the capabilities of the team. Must be energetic, hands-on and effective in communications Have worked closely with marketing professionals, and have had experience on how marketing activities are to be coordinated with sales efforts. Preferably plugged into an existing network of clinicians or hospital administrators within the public and private health sector. Preferably familiar and conversant how technologies in applied into therapies , patient cares and also diagnostics . Preferably familiar with all the regulatory requirements and import requirements for medical products in Southeast Asia To apply, please visit www.gmprecruit.com and search for Job Reference: 18998. jobTitle: Regional Product Marketing Lead for Glints TalentHub (B2B)
description: About This Role  You will be a strategic leader who drives the demand generation for our TalentHub talent offshoring business (B2B).  This role will lead and execute on product marketing strategy and programs that enable Glints to be the preferred talent recruitment partner of companies across Singapore, Hong Kong and other parts of developed Asia.  This role will also build and lead a strong regional team and work closely with product, sales and marketing stakeholders in acquiring, retaining and increasing the LTV of customers, driving market penetration for Glints!  Why This Role is Awesome Key strategic role and contributor: You will have the chance to be part of the core commercial team, involved in the strategic growth and direction of the company Freedom: You are joining a very young team, there is no baggage to clean up and you will be given lots of freedom and trust to build the product marketing operations from scratch as you deem fit. Growth: We are a fast-growing company that grew six times in revenue in the past year while doubling headcount. You will be part of this growth trajectory and given lots of challenges to grow quickly Impact: Our company's purpose is to contribute to a world where all people and organizations can realize their human potential (check our culture deck here: ). As Product Marketing Lead, you will be directly building the company that fulfills this purpose. Your day-to-day activities Demand generation Drive our inbound lead engine through omni-channel marketing campaigns that includes but not limited to content, event, digital and tele-marketing Enable outbound sales development teams (SDR) with the right audience and messaging ammunitions to meet outbound lead generation productivity goals Collaborate with brand, communications and talent marketing to drive an aligned strategy for brand awareness amongst targeted communities Build customer upsell, retention and advocacy programs such as loyalty, CRM programs for increased LTV and to drive WoM Conversion rate optimization: Monitor conversion funnel across various entry and touch points, and relevant leading and lagging business and marketing indicators Experiment, analyze and optimize activities for best possible outcomes Develop and manage sales promotions, playbook, kits/tools and other sales enabling materials to improve close rates Collaborate with various teams (Business, Sales, Data, and Product) in identifying and delivering on levers needed for increased ROI or enable costs-savings while achieving the top-line growth Go-to-market: Collaborate with Product and Sales teams to: Research for insights on the customer user journey and needs for business, market and/or product/service offerings and development opportunities Receive/research for competitive insights in markets for the development of a product differentiation strategy Define and develop customer segmentations, personas, schemes, messaging and communication strategies to drive product adoption Develop and maintain customer feedback loops in conjunction with Product team for new and existing products Team leadership and management: Front communication and collaboration across stakeholders for alignments and synergy Build and nurture a team of A-player product marketers Delegate, motivate and lead team’s day-to-day operations towards operational excellence and goals achievement Set and monitor key OKRs and KPIs both at the team level, and at individual level  Qualifications (Must Have) 7+ years of relevant working experience, 2+ years of team management experience Experience in omni-channel demand generation marketing for business, with passion in data-driven marketing and enabling growth Uniquely creative, strategic, and operational Proven ability to flex, persist and be resourceful in challenging times, and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment Highly motivated and result-oriented, with a positive outlook and a can-do attitude Enjoys problem solving and challenging the status quo Is authentic, humble and honest, with a flair in communications and stakeholder management to gain buy-ins, support and collaboration from decision-makers and stakeholders  Qualifications (Good To Have) B2B marketing experience, SMB and/or Enterprise, in a start-up/entrepreneurship environment Experience in working with cross-geographical teams in Southeast Asia High-level proficiency in Excel, SQL, and data analytics Experience in optimizing unit economics & LTV for business What this role is NOT: An Individual Contributor role.  There's a lot to do and it’s unlikely that you can do everything yourself. You will need to be/become a strong leader who can lead a strong regional team to achieve goals as a team. jobTitle: Senior Manager or Director - Investor Relations and Corporate Communications
description: Special Project: We are assisting our client – who is a leading global provider of technology services, products and solutions. They have been incorporated more than 20 years ago and listed on the mainboard of SGX.  They are looking for a Senior Manager/ Director – Head of Investor Relations and Corporate Communications to provide strategic leadership in Investors/Shareholders Relations, Corporate Communications and Corporate Branding.  You will be responsible for developing and implementing effective strategies, programs and communications to cultivate and nurture relationships with the investing community, analysts and shareholders through private and group meetings, investor conferences and results briefings, etc.  You will liaise with business leaders to gather information and support the formulation of strategic messaging and outreach initiatives as well as managing the effectiveness of various communications & touchpoints to provide appropriate information.  You will work with CEO, COO and CFO to develop, establish and maintain relationships with both existing and targeted new institutional investors, analysts and shareholders.  You will work closely with Senior Management to prepare press releases, quarterly earnings releases, ad-hoc industry events, specific business development engagements, conference calls, proxy statements, communication scripts, Q&A, annual reports, sustainability reports and SGX filings as well as working closely with Corporate Finance and Corporate Secretarial function to improve corporate governance and disclosure standards.  You will also work closely with business leaders to create and update sales & marketing promotional materials and support Total Customer Satisfaction through communication innovations.  You will develop contents, platforms, activities, tools or surveys to enable effective internal communication to educate and engage their employees striving towards fulfilling its vision and strategies.  You will ensure overall planning and execution of external & internal communications are timely, accurate and effective.  You will establish strategies and execute programs, activities, touchpoints and opinion research to build external brand recognition, favourable Corporate identity and positive relations with business media, regulatory bodies and community, etc.  You will produce, maintain and update website, presentations, factsheet, press releases and other communication materials or media to effectively communicate the company’s message, brand and identity.  Requirements: You possess at least a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Public Relations, Communication or equivalent. A Master Degree in a related discipline or Master in Business Administration from a recognized university is an added advantage.  You have at least 10 years’ experience of progressively increasing responsibility in overall investors, shareholders, corporate communication and corporate brand/identity building in a fast-moving, high-tech environment of listed companies or MNCs, out of which at least 3 years in a leadership role to lead investor relations and corporate communications function.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. Personal data provided will be used for recruitment purposes only.  Please apply with your CV in word document format. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. For other positions related to real estate, please go to http://tri-cap.com.sg/?page_id=15603. jobTitle: Director of Channel Sales, APAC - Enterprise Software Firm
description: Newly created headcount Private, profitable firm, looking for an APAC channel lead  About Our Client  Our client is a privately held, profitable US headquarted enterprise software firm. They provide customers with market leading software that benefits digital transformation and customer experience. Being a 100% self-funded firm, besides developing cutting edge software, they have a strong vision to give back to the community. In line with that, invest a significant part of their profits to support various charitable causes.  APAC has been growing organically for them and most of the business is driven via direct relationships at the moment. In their next stage of international growth, they aim to have a strong global channel strategy and need a Director of Channel Sales, APAC to drive that for the region.  Job Description  Reporting to the Worldwide Vice President for Channels (based in the US) and a dotted line to the P&L lead in APAC, the success of the Director of Channel Sales, APAC will be measured on the following criteria: Identify solutions that address Partner needs and lead efforts to sell such solutions Identify Partners in the APAC region and lead the Partner satisfaction surveys Co-own the channel sales revenue target in the region and work with the RVP, Sales and Channel Account Managers Design a unique Go-To-Market channel strategy for the region Build a high performing channel sales team that consistently delivers annual sales goals Deepen existing relationships with channel partners including consulting firms, GSIs, VARs, ISVs, OEMS and MSPs Provide deal strategy, support and resources to channel partners to drive pipeline and sales  The Successful Applicant  The successful Director of Channel Sales, APAC will need to demonstrate the following skills and attributes: Bachelor's or Master's Degree from a reputable university Ten or more years in channel management, with at least five years at an APAC level Experience in selling SaaS products to a variety of industries including but not limited to manufacturing, automotive, retail and FSI would be highly preferred Strong track record of having created a channel strategy from the ground up in APAC, ideally in a small-mid size firm Expertise in implementing metrics-based business plans, compensation plans and OKRs No obstacle for travelling up to 50% once borders re-open, including travel in APAC and the US  What's On Offer  Our client offers you an opportunity to be in a privately held, profitable enterprise software firm that is on a steady growth path globally and in APAC. They operate with a lean team and their global channel strategy fits well with their ambition to be diversified across sectors and revenue streams. This role would be a great fit for someone who wants to be in a highly visible, positive and collaborative work environment that allows you to dedicate time towards giving back to the community. The OTE for the role would be split 60-40 and the total compensation would be in the 80th percentile of the market for such roles.  Candidates looking for general management roles, large team management roles or aggressive growth cultures won't find this a good fit.  Contact: Anurag Garg (Lic No: R1215997)  Quote job ref: JN-092021-3597024

description: We have a great opportunity for a talented and self-motivated Sales Director to join our Client Service Unit team. At NCS, we seek to nurture talents in creating and developing innovative solutions. If you are passionate about new technologies and new ideas, NCS could be a place for you!  Summary  The Sales Director is responsible for leading the team to drive NCS sales, including account penetration, prospect qualification, supervision of sales activity, sales process planning, and closing all sales opportunities in the industry and/or sector that he/she is in. He/She is expected to build deep and trusted business relationships with the client to seed and grow future opportunities.  Beyond managing his/her own Business Centre’s sales, sold margin and revenue achievements, he/she also act as trusted client advisors to customise and sell NCS solutions and services according to the business needs of clients.  Reporting to the CSU Lead, Communications, Media & Technology (CMT), he/she will work within the CMT Client Service Unit, and across Lines of Businesses (LOBs), NEXT Services. He/she will work with the teams to define the solution offerings & value propositions to maximise NCS’ win probability in each and every opportunity. This is achieved by him/her having a deep understanding of the business needs of the clients and developing sales pipelines.  Key Responsibilities Orchestrate externally and internally to create environment for successful delivery Assess high level conceptual design to ensure that what is sold can be delivered at the right margin Establish responsive business relationship with client including problem reporting and resolving highly complex service delivery issues when escalated Lead and manage the project delivery teams to ensure timely and quality delivery of services to the client in a cost-effective manner Identify, assess and resolve complex business problems/issues and propose alternative solutions Identify and manage issues and risks and act as an escalation point within the account Manage and monitor account level risk dollar and budget; control costs to ensure maximum achievement of revenue and margin Manage risk and impact of change requests and assist with service request of variation order negotiation Work closely with the Lines of Business on project capability gaps Manage sub-contractors and vendor contract escalated matters Act as the Solution Lead to ensure solution consistency and be the custodian of architecture  The Ideal Candidate Should Have Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related discipline PMP certification preferred 15 years or more experience in IT or ICT Consulting industry with 8 years or more in leadership positions Delivered projects relating to the specific domain or industry Process broad business acumen and deep industry knowledge, and to use this knowledge to develop/enhance client relationships Consulting practitioner preferred Proven track record in assuming overall responsibility and managing multi-million dollars projects in key client industry Process ‘hands-on’ knowledge, vast exposure and wealth of experience within vendor and user environment, coupled with a driven and self-motivated personality. Experience in managing measured productivity-driven operations or teams Consulting practitioner Good communication skills Understand and ability to apply social style techniques to manage stakeholders Client focused with strong organizational and project management skills Ability to lead multiple teams  Apply today to be part of the winning team that does great work!  #NCSlife

jobTitle: Head of Customer Service, Asia Pacific
description: Our team in Singapore currently has an opening for a Head of Customer Service, Asia Pacific  <<>>  YOUR ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES  Summary  Responsible for executing the region’s customer service strategies and develop an integrated customer service function for productivity and excellence. He/She is also required to lead customer service transformation efforts by guiding country customer service teams in alignment to the centralized APAC Customer Service governance and framework. Ability to create functional and scalable systems and processes, Competency in continuously improving status quo Eye for details with strong stakeholder management skills, Strong analytical skills, and ability to present analysed information concisely Capable of handling ambiguity Adaptable to rapidly changing business dynamics in a fast-paced environment OUR OFFER  <<>>  INTERESTED?  We look forward receiving your application.  hr.sg@brenntag-asia.com

description: About Dedoco  Dedoco is an API-first, decentralized document platform that seeks to transform the way enterprises manage digital workflows. The solution is built with the aim of improving efficiency and compliance, whilst ensuring document security and enhanced privacy. Ultimately, we aim to provide best-in-class digital solutions that allows enterprises to transform digitally and maintain greater governance, while conducting transactions seamlessly and safely. Dedoco has also an easy-to-use SaaS that can be adopted across all industries.  VP/Head of Marketing  This is an exciting new position for an experienced, hands-on, execution-oriented marketing lead. The core mission will be to conceptualize, execute and develop overall branding and marketing strategies that will accelerate our revenue, adoption and market positioning both regionally and globally. He or she will work closely with the Management, commercial and product teams to plan and execute on the brand and marketing goals.  Responsibilities Develop, support and grow our direct and channel marketing team, while collaborating across the organization to establish workflows and processes that scale Lead the creation and execution of our branding/marketing strategy and go-to market efforts with our agency partners Build our brand guidelines with agency partners Drive qualified prospective customers to the funnel and engage them with the right content. One of the measures of success will be driving leads that engage with Sales. Organize and grow a team that drives results with a data-centric approach Help the company engage with a broader audience and leverage it for awareness and continual engagement Partner with Operations and Commercial heads to create, track, and monitor appropriate metrics Continuously measure and communicate success of B2B marketing approaches and programs Requirements Bachelor's Degree preferred 5-8 years of experience preferably in the technology field and/or in similar capacity Strong communication and presentation skills Strong planning, project and organizational skills Knowledge of enterprise software, SaaS and cloud solutions and strong sense of trends History of developing and leading strategic partnerships Ability to work independently and lead a team to meet goals and objectives Global exposure in his/her career life cycle will be advantageous To apply, please email your CV and resume to careers@dedoco.com

description: Job Purpose: Accountable for a range of operational functions which enable front line Sales, Admissions & Marketing teams to focus on core, value add activities.  Organisational Compliance: Comply with Study Group policies and applicable laws including those in relation, but not limited, to: Workplace Health and Safety; Anti-Discrimination and Harassment, Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption and those specifically relevant to the position and authority of the job holder. Key Responsibilities  SAM Data and Analytics (30%) Develop and deliver a suite of reporting and analytics tools which enable the SAM Exec, functional Leaders and individual staff to enhance productivity at a strategic/tactical and global/local levels, ensuring process efficiency and data quality levels are maintained. Provide data and insights to support decision making at a tactical and strategic level, automating reporting where possible to ensure the availability of real-time information. Provide relevant inputs to support the sales pipeline management, volume estimates for operations resourcing and business forecast processes, highlighting risks, issues and opportunities. Partner with colleagues in IT and Finance to drive changes and improvements to company systems such that reporting is made more efficient and data quality is improved. Provide support to the SAM Exec in the development of the overall business strategic planning process.  Sales, Admissions and Marketing Excellence (20%) Develop, and in conjunction with the Sales Leadership team, drive the adoption of consistent and best practice sales processes across the organisation including the use of Salesforce as the “source of truth” for the business.   Develop, and in conjunction with the Marketing Leadership team, drive the adoption of standard operating procedures including KPI’s and performance management across all verticals of marketing organization Develop, and in conjunction with the Admissions operations and Customer Services Leadership team, drive continuous improvement to achieve Service Level Agreements with highest level of Quality through measures around on time processing, low error rate and faster issue resolution  SAM Programs (10%) In conjunction with SAM Human Resources, co-own and monitor the operation of the various Sales Incentives and other recognition programmes, ensuring that appropriate reporting and governance mechanisms are in place and the programmes achieve the desired outcomes. In conjunction with Global Director, SAM Operations, program management of strategic initiatives across SAM functions and stakeholder management with other functions  SAM Systems, Processes & Quality (20%) Lead and manage ongoing development and optimisation of Global Admissions IT systems and processes. Lead and manage ongoing development and optimization of Salesforce linked to Sales and Marketing processes Enable comprehensive suite of systems and processes for effective business reporting. Ensure that Sales, Admissions and Marketing systems and process changes are effectively implemented and embedded on a timely basis.  Establish and own the Global Admissions BAU quality assurance and compliance processes. Co-own the delivery of a continuous improvement culture across Global Admissions through the identification of opportunities and solutions to improve speed, quality and reliability of processing operations, including the introduction of RPA and automation tools where feasible.    Learning and Development (20%) Partner with the functional Leadership and HR Teams, develop and deliver a programme of sales, marketing and admissions training which equip teams with the critical skills required to drive a high-performance culture. Engage with learning partners to develop content and delivery approach based on the learning journey of each SAM function.  PERSON SPECIFICATION Qualifications & Training               •            Degree preferable •            Project Management qualification preferable  Experience Required:     •            Demonstrable experience in a global business operations environment. •            Experience of working in an international corporate/matrix environment •            Experienced in managing projects that involve multiple stakeholders. •            Experience in the Education sector and / or in delivering transformation projects in the areas of sales and marketing would be highly advantageous •            Team management and working with stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes  Knowledge/Skills:            •            Deep knowledge of the capabilities of Salesforce/CRM & Analytics (Power BI) systems as tools to manage the business. •            Working within Prince2 or similar project management methodology •            Executive level presentations and business engagement •            Experienced user of MS office, especially Excel, PowerPoint.  Personal Attributes:       •            Developed strategic/critical thinking to shape data insights and business implications of these in a meaningful and impactful way. •            Detail oriented and analytical mindset – curious to understand the detail “behind” the numbers •            Confident in developing effective relationships and effectively managing stakeholders at the most senior levels of the organisation.  •            Negotiates effectively with key stakeholders by adopting a range of approaches, maintaining relationships with all parties at all times. •            Applies insight and understanding to situations to resolve competing demands/pressures and holds others to account for delivery. •            Highly organised and self-motivated; able to handle multiple, simultaneous projects in a fast-paced environment while maintaining excellent attention to detail •            Comfortable working in ambiguity and able to develop flexible solutions/analysis to help guide decision making in the business. •            Probes and questions data and assumptions, adding new insights that open up new avenues of exploration or action. •            Excellent written and oral communicator, able to clearly convey complex data or insights in a way which is easily understood.   About Study Group We are a global pathway provider in International Education, working collaboratively with a number of Top Tier Universities. Voted as the 2017, 2018 and 2020 Global Pathway Provider of the year, our people are united with the shared ambition of providing a world-class UK education to talented students from across the globe.   Organisational Compliance Study Group is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students, and expects all staff and volunteers to share the same dedication. Applicants will be required to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the role, including checks with past employers, an Enhanced Check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and overseas criminal records if appropriate. Study Group processes your information in line with data protection regulations. Please see our Privacy Policy

description: As a Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for the technical implementation of all projects assigned to you. You are the primary contact for the customer on all technical matters, and you function as an intermediary between the customer and the different departments within Skyline. The telecom, broadcast and satellite industries will be your playground, where you can apply your affinity for high-tech, software products. We offer state-of-the-art, global leading software solutions in a fast-changing industry. With thousands of drivers, highly advanced features, and a proven track record, DataMiner is the best-of-breed network management solution for the telecom, satellite and broadcast industries. You can become part of this winning team and apply your skills to further expand our success around the globe.  TYPICAL EDUCATION > bachelor, master or doctorate degree in ICT, Software and/or Telecom RESPONSIBILITIES acquire and maintain detailed knowledge of all DataMiner features take ownership of the full technical implementation of your projects become your customers’ primary contact for all technical matters related to your projects fully understand all aspects related to the functional and technical specifications of your projects ensure sufficient documentation of all technical requests to other Skyline departments to guarantee efficient implementation of all technical aspects of your projects troubleshoot all technical issues that affect project delivery perform quality assurance from a functional perspective on all technical features in your projects create and maintain all required project documentation for acceptance, hand-over, and internal presentation procedures identify potential commercial opportunities and notify the appropriate Sales Manager COMPETENCIES you are a fast learner and adapt quickly to new situations you are communicative and have effective interpersonal and organizational skills you think logically, keeping the client first in mind you have natural technical insight and a positive, can-do attitude you can work independently and prioritize tasks you are passionate about the benefits of software technology TECHNICAL SKILLS familiar with software programming experience with HTML, XML, client-server systems and SNMP profound knowledge of HFC broadband, IPTV, broadcast and satellite systems strong affinity with MS Windows operating systems profound knowledge of TCP/IP (firewalls, routers, …), multithreading, Web Services and .Net Remoting knowledge of MySQL and Apache Cassandra is an asset BASIC QUALIFICATIONS FOR CONSIDERATION this position requires that you work from our offices located in Singapore good verbal and written communication skills in English WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? gain experience with a vast array of cutting-edge technologies be part of a team that has a disruptive impact on the global media and broadband industry work in an international company while still enjoying the advantages of a small-company culture an attractive gross salary, depending on your job category and professional experience, with additional fringe benefits a healthy work-life balance: flexible working hours, work-from-home days personal Learning & Development budget: credits you can spend on your personal development, with a wide range of opportunities to choose from time for work and time for fun: get to know your colleagues during all kinds of social activities outside business hours

Position  Director of Business Development  Republic of Korea Liaison Office  The position holder is responsible for driving the business development performance, identifying new opportunities and acting as local liaison in the Republic of Korea.  Roles & Responsibilities Develop winning long-term business growth strategies, negotiate and execute sustainable and sensible business deals to maintain existing business and achieve new business opportunities;
