description: OVERALL ROLE DESCRIPTION  Accountability to develop and execute Chubb Singapore’s distribution strategy & financial plan for our Independent Distribution Partners (Insurance Agents, Financial Advisors & selected independent Brokers). This includes the financial growth of this distribution network, as well as expanding the number of partners producing premium for Chubb. The role leads a team of business development managers who manage the operational engagement with partners. Accountability to drive IDP performance against plan and operational targets through: - Collaborating with Underwriting divisions and departments, to develop and execute joint strategies to achieve Chubb Singapore’s growth and profitability goals - Setting and achieving new producer recruitment and GWP objectives, including existing portfolio transfers - Implementing programs to achieve IDP activation, productivity and profitability objectives - Executing IDP producer management best practices in line with Regional/COG direction - Developing and coaching team members to achieve agreed strategic, financial and development plans.  MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Agency channel business leadership - Exercise strong leadership and vision to deliver the objectives of IDP Distribution, in line with the strategic goals of country and regional agency strategy - Prepare and manage overall IDP channel Profit & Loss plans, including GWP, Losses, Acquisition and Administrative expenses - Development and implementation of annual operational business plan, including marketing, product development, producer recruitment, incentive management and producer training strategies, to deliver annual business plan & objectives - Refine IDP infrastructure in coordination with Underwriting, Operations, IT, and Claims - Develop and launch new partnership opportunities within the IDP channel (Life, Health or other) 2. Implement and monitor agency management best practices: - Sales management: sales management metrics; incentive/recognition and compensation programs to support recruitment and drive desired sales activity and behavior - Administer effective Producer Segmentation program - Identification, selection and recruitment of new Producers - Producer training & development - Producer incentive management - Ensure Producer compliance with required standards and operating principles 3. Development and management of Chubb IDP team, including: - Lead and drive sales activity against metrics to achieve plans - Develop sales management talent to improve recruitment and sales management effectiveness - Identifying training and staff development needs - Effective assignment of staff through planning and incentive management - Resource planning to deliver sustained growth and service requirements 4. Reporting and Compliance - Ensure internal compliance with legal requirements and industry associated guidelines - Ensure Producer compliance with legal requirements and industry associated guidelines - Interaction with regulators & auditors as required - Regular management reporting of key performance items (GWP, recruitment and productivity tracking, account management, profitability and expense ratios. 5. Develop and deepen IDP opportunities for Accident & Health, Property & Casualty and International Personal Lines - Achieve improvement in business mix in line with business plans and targets - Explore and develop new opportunities (new product, new segments, new verticals) to support business plans and targets.

jobTitle: Senior Director/ Director/ Vice President, Institutional Sales
description: Cyberdyne Tech Exchange (CTX) is a digital green exchange licensed and regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore and powered by Nasdaq’s advanced trading and surveillance technologies. Founded in 2018, it provides qualified asset owners and institutional investors with a full-service infrastructure including primary issuance, secondary trading, settlement, and custody of asset-backed tokens. Singapore-based CTX aims to be a global hub for green financing and will be the first exchange to incorporate carbon disclosures for both issuers and investors. Our ideal candidate should have the ability to handle sensitive information confidentially. Desired personal traits include ability to navigate through the emerging space, be a team player, able to work effectively and collaborate with colleagues across the firm. Roles and Responsibilities: Actively approach and pitch existing and potential clients with emerging digital products that meet their investment requirements. Work closely with clients, to enhance working relationships and ensure the client’s needs are met. Work to broaden relationships with institutional investors in Singapore and elsewhere. Work closely with other departments on client related matters and assist in any ad-hoc projects as required. Serve as the primary day to day contact for all relationship activities, including daily ad hoc enquiries and in-depth search of information regarding portfolios and operational related requests. Responding to any enquiries by clients and ensuring the quality and accuracy of both regular and ad hoc reports to be delivered to clients. Liaise and establish strong relationship with other departments for the on-boarding process of clients and ensure client reporting needs are met. Provide proactive support and communication to clients with respect to product performance, attributes and developments. Arrange and coordinate client portfolio meetings to review investment guidelines, objectives and process. Ensure client documentation is updated accordingly and internal monitoring is feasible. Requirements: A university degree or higher with 5-8 years of relevant experience. Proven track record in business development, sales and building a portfolio of clients within the Financial Institution industry. Bilingual, excellent oral and written communication skills. MAS representative license Possess solid experience in buy & sell side environment. Ability to build the trust and confidence of clients, ability to strengthen client relationships through ongoing dialog and interactions, ability to work well with others to accomplish client objectives. Self-starter, resourceful, able to work independently and in a small team environment. Demonstrated history of being results-oriented, able to work under pressure, and organized.

jobTitle: APJC Client Solutions Group Chief of Staff
description: Join us as a Chief of Staff for APJC CSG to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.  What You’ll Achieve  As APJC CSG Chief of Staff, you will be directly reporting to SVP of APJC CSG, and responsible for overseeing planning, sustaining business rhythm, and communicating priorities including executive decision-making, program management, initiative implementation within and across all levels of organizations.  The successful candidate will have the ability to think strategically across the company, partner in business execution, advise on operational issues, and develop key communications that facilitate business execution. This position requires extensive cross-functional coordination at all levels, and excellent communication skills using analytics and insights. We are looking for persuasive, organized, proactive self-starters who excels in ambiguity and superior problem-solving ability with limited oversight.  You Will  Develop, plan and manage the Business Management (BMS) cadence for the Executive's organization, consisting of Staff meetings, Monthly Ops Reviews, Quarterly Business Reviews, semi-annual Leadership Meetings and other ongoing meetings as neededDefine BMS and full year calendar cadence for planning.  Prioritize time for the week ahead, provide relevant context and associated deliverables.  Co-ordinate quarterly planning cadence including cross organization leadership events, external engagement, strategic reviews, quarterly and annual planning process etc.  Manage key projects & initiatives reports-out: Work with cross functional stakeholders to highlight key projects / initiatives, friction points, progress and if decisions are required.  Manage Weekly Staff Meeting Agenda: Identify and prepare presenters, topics & materials which are aligned to strategy & fiscal year priorities.  Represent the priorities of the SVP office with geo leaders, cross functional leaders and Chief of Staff, Finance, HR, CoC, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and the extended stakeholders.Represents APJC CSG in Global CSG initiatives and serve as effective business partner including company climate, project updates, proposals, and planning.  Serve as an extension of the HR to address and resolve all employee concerns and well-being. Support execution of HR activities (e.g. university relations hiring).  Lead Strategy Cascade, Tell Dell Action Planning, Training, Compliance requirements, and Inspire.  Serve as an extension of the Finance team for finance support including management of budget and reallocation of funding (with leadership approval) as needed.  Build and sustain effective communications and strategic executive presentations with global stakeholders and cross-functional teams; Work closely with executive communications (as applicable) to support speaking engagements on behalf of the ExecutiveManage overall leadership communication strategy, roadmap, and approach to ensure effective and impactful outcome.  Central point of readiness management for presentations, collaborating across support functions including geo leaders, cross functional teams, Finance, HR, CoC, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and the extended stakeholders.  Support agenda of executive meetings with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. customer / partner meetings, business reviews & talent / people development sessions).  Prepare executive presentations: Work with related teams to develop presentations to support internal & external meetings and engagements.  Ensure communication have a cohesive story. Work with team to develop story flow, messaging and quality of communication.  Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:  8+ years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree or above.  Proven experience organizing and directing multiple teams and departments  Experience planning and leading strategic initiatives  Ability to work strategically and collaboratively across all departments  Strong sense of self awareness, can relate well, learn quickly, and adapt to changes while remaining calm under pressure  Skilled in translating ideas into clear, high impact communication  Experience collaborating with multiple teams in remote locations to drive initiatives at scale.

jobTitle: Head of Sales - Software Consulting/Professional & Staffing Services
description: Synopsis Of The Role  Primary duties include, generating and submitting RFPs and related sales documents, collaborating with senior team to set revenue goals and company strategy and implementing a sales plan to drive revenue growth and attending key events to generate leads.  The successful candidate will be energetic, persuasive and well organized and able to demonstrate the ability to sell.  Job Description  Role & responsibilities: Own and hit/exceed annual sales targets within the terriotory. Develop and execute strategic plan to achieve sales targets and expand our customer base. Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships. Partner with customers to understand their business needs and objectives. Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations. Maintain up to date knowledge of the marketplace, competitors and trends. Reporting on forces that shift tactical budgets and strategic direction of accounts. Work closely with colleagues on cross-territory opportunities and other internal teams on marketing materials and case studies. Understand and effectively communicate the company's value proposition. Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with management and cross-functional teams. Work with the Product groups and solution delivery teams to implement targeted sales strategy. Report on KPIs related to the lead and the opportunity waterfall. Through reporting and analytics, validate the quality of the lead and pipeline data and provide guidance to improve the overall data quality. Role Requirements Thorough understanding of the software consulting/Professional/staffing services in Information Technology (IT) business. Good exposure and networking with IT team, respective business teams, procurement team and hiring managers. Sail through the vendor and partner registration process with ease based on the business contacts. Good hands-on experience in software consulting/staffing services in respective region. Exposure to onsite & offshore operation methodology. Capable enough to sketch out business plans to reach out to clients for selling software consulting/professional/staffing services. Should be responsible for making business proposals / follow ups of Pre and post sales. Responsible for reaching out to the prospect leads including gate crashing and identify decision makers for selling software consulting/staffing services. Responsible for maintaining and developing relationships with the prospective customers through constant follow up. Generating leads through available sources such as internet and regional networking. Responsible for making presentations on software consulting/professional/staffing services to both new and existing clients. Attending meeting with clients, coordinating with respective internal stake holders for closures. Involve in research & analysis, investigate potential opportunities for new business in software consulting/Professional/staffing services. Ability to manage multiple client relationships and engagements, ensuring client satisfaction. Formulating a business plan and strategy for the growth of IT professional/consulting/staffing services business by working closely with internal stake holders. Competency Prospecting Skills Presentation Skills Client relationships Negotiation skills Creative & Self starter Experience & Qualification 7-10 years of Sales experience in the Software Consulting/Professional/staffing services in Information Technology (IT) business. Proven success working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. Proven track record of meeting Sales goals. Any Graduate with MBA preferred Good Networking in BFSI Domain is Must
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Management Consulting

description: The Director/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.  In addition the Director/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.  As a people manager, the he/she oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.  ~ Analyse data for business insights identification.  ~ Analyse production efficiencies.  ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions.  ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield.  ~ Develop On-the-job training programme.  ~ Develop workplace learning plan.  ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise.  ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans.  ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement.  ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling.  ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance.  ~ Lead change management in the organisation.  ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources.  ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation.  ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks.  ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity.  ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes.  ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer & Network Security, and Management Consulting

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Director, New Payment Flows  We are looking for a Director – Product Management, New Payment Flows, to drive product strategy and go-to-market execution for Mastercard’s Account-to-Account consumer payment solutions (Pay by Account, Bill Pay, Small Business Invoicing). These solutions leverage a combination of Mastercard’s card and account based technologies, to enable mutiple use cases such as personal payments, retail & bill payments and small business payments.  Role Identify account-to-account payment opportunities within the AP region. These are typically markets or payment flows dominated by bank transfers, wallets and other alternative payment methods (i.e. other than cards) Be the product subject matter expert for Pay by Account (account based payment solution for consumer retail payments), Mastercard Bill pay (bill presentment, payment and reconciliation platform connecting billers and consumers for seamless bill payment experience), and small business invoicing (platform for small business owners, gig workers etc to present invoices to their consumers and collect payments) Market and customer segmentation for these products Develop effective customer sales material, train sales teams Develop a go-to-market plan, finalize annual performance metrics, develop executive dashboards for product performance and distribution tracking Participate in new feature development process with global product development team Be the voice of the customer and gather market feedback, and enhance the new feature development cycle Pricing strategy for these products Cross functional coordination with other relevant products / platforms, customer delivery, pricing, legal / compliance & regulatory, franchise Embed Product Management Excellence and consumer insights in all product management activities  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

jobTitle: Cluster Director of Sales & Marketing - InterContinental Singapore Robertson Quay
description: About Us  At InterContinental® Hotels & Resorts our role is to put the glamour into international travel. That’s where you come in. When you’re part of the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand you’re more than just a job title.  At InterContinental Hotels & Resorts we look for people who are charming, confident, and internationally-minded; people who know what it takes to exceed guest expectations.  We’re Looking For Someone Who  Join our team as our Cluster Director of Sales & Marketing in InterContinental Singapore Robertson Quay. You’ll have ambition, talent and obviously, some key skills.  YOUR DAY TO DAY  Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies for 3 Bespoke Hotels to ensure revenue and room night sales goals are achieved, sales and marketing strategies are set, tactical plans are created and implemented, and results are monitored and achieved.  Financial Returns Achieve budgeted revenues and personal/team sales goals and maximise profitability. Participate in the preparation of the annual departmental operating budget, the hotel marketing plan and business plan, and financial plans. Create and implement sales plans that drive measurable incremental occupancy, increase average rates, increase volume, food and beverage and banquet sales. Review monthly reports and sales forecasts to analyse current/potential market and sales trends, coordinate activities to increase revenue and market share and monitor performance to ensure actual sales meet or exceed established revenue plan. Create and develop special events and sales blitzes to showcase the hotel to potential clients. Attend trade shows and major market events locally and nationally to promote new business and increase sales and marketing opportunities for the hotel. People Direct day-to-day sales activities, plan and assign work, and establish performance and development goals for team members. Provide mentoring, coaching and regular feedback to help manage conflict, improve team member performance, and recognise good performance. Educate, train and motivate sales and marketing teams to achieve hotel revenue goals. Ensure staff has the information, market data, tools and equipment to successfully carry out job duties. Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts (example: guests, airliners, wholesalers, travel agencies, ad agencies, local community groups) in order to produce group and/or convention business, to include room sales, food and beverage sales, and catering/banquet services. Guest Experience Provide guests with information (example: loyalty programmes, area attractions, restaurants, facility information) to enhance guest experience. Schedule conventions and/or business group activities at the hotel and coordinate with other hotel-level departments to facilitate services agreed upon by the sales office and prospective clients. Communicate to appropriate departments all pertinent information requirements and special needs for arriving VIP’s, large groups, and other key guests. Lead marketing efforts to upsell guests on hotel services, offerings, and amenities. Responsible Business Identify operational problems that reduce the effectiveness of marketing activities and overall hotel sales performance and work with appropriate department on solutions. Develop awareness and reputation of the hotel and the brand in the local community, may serve as the hotel representative for media related inquiries. Work closely with key business leaders, officials, and representatives of local community groups within the city to ensure constant high profile exposure for the hotel. Effectively communicate and market aspects of the hotel that are sustainable or “green” and use information to gain new business opportunities. Work with advertising agencies, consulting firms, and vendors to maximise advertising investments and ensure ads represent brand identity. Perform other duties as assigned. May also serve as manager on duty. What We Need From You Bachelor’s degree / higher education qualification / equivalent in Hotel Administration, Business Administration 3 years’ guest service/hotel experience with at least two years in a supervisory capacity, or an equivalent combination of education and experience Previous extended stay experience or experience in a hotel of similar size and complexity preferred Must speak fluent English. Other languages preferred What We Offer  In return for your hard work, you can look forward to a highly competitive salary and benefits package – including: 5-days work week Duty Meal Birthday Off Learning and Development Opportunities Medical Benefit Dental/ Optical/ Health Screening Benefit Insurance Coverage Special Employee rate at all IHG Hotels worldwide What’s more, because your career will be as unique as you are, we’ll give you all the tailored support you need to make a great start, be involved and grow.  And because the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand belongs to the IHG® family of brands, you’ll also benefit from all of the opportunities that come from being part of a successful, global hospitality company with over 5900 hotels in over 100 countries around the world.  So whoever you are, whatever you love doing, bring your passion to the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand and IHG and we’ll make sure you’ll have room to be yourself. Find out more about joining us today by going to careers.ihg.com
industries: Restaurants, Food & Beverages, and Hospitality

description: Job Title: Associate Director, Asset Distribution, Asia Pacific Reporting to: Head of Asset Distribution, Asia Pacific  Job Summary  The Asset Distribution division is the global business unit within the NORD/LB Group that is responsible for the distribution of our loan assets to banks and institutional investors, developing and using a broad range of investment formats: outright sale, credit insurance, fund repackaging etc. for the active steering and optimisation of the Bank’s short and medium-term credit book, and for the development of new distribution channels for NORD/LB.  Principle Responsibilities  Responsible for the primary and secondary distribution for selected asset classes and investment formats, primarily within project finance and aviation finance Lead the autonomous execution of the entire transaction process (teaser, Q&A with investors, price negotiation, documentation drafting, investor onboarding, booking, post execution follow up) Establish/Develop and deepen a broad and extensive network of institutional investors (insurers, asset managers, pension funds) and banks across Asia Pacific Keep abreast with latest market intelligence to inject timely and valuable market insights into the Bank’s overall sales and distribution strategy Assess legal / regulatory / reputational risks and ensure proper mitigation efforts are in place in relation to the business performance  Profile/Qualifications  Client Focus with a Commercial Mind-set  Demonstrated negotiation and execution expertise Proven ability to deliver exceptional investor and internal client value at multiple levels Demonstrated track record on ability to think outside of the box and be a self-starter  Team Focus and Stakeholder Management  Proactive and hands-on with the ability to execute multiple transactions simultaneously in an autonomous and yet collaborative manner Proven team player with the ability to drive high performance by communicating efficiently and clearly with internal and external team members and stakeholders Contribute towards an effective team culture by producing value-added content and insights Willingness to step into a hands-on role when necessary  Qualities for Success  Proven track record in the distribution of alternative assets, predominantly project finance (infrastructure and renewable energy) and aviation finance Strong experience within a network of institutional investors and banks Efficient and process-driven Strong conceptual and analytical skills, data numeracy and information processing Curious mindset, with strong willingness to develop knowledge and adapt to new situations Excellent written, interpersonal and communication skills to thrive within a diverse and highly-matrixed organisation Ability to build and maintain a strong personal and team brand, internally and externally Proficiency in IT (Word, Powerpoint, Excel, ideally VBA / Python for process streamlining)

Index Exchange is looking for a Platform Partnerships Director with outstanding ad technology, leadership and sales skills to join our APAC Team. This role is multifaceted and delivers a breadth of work focus that will ensure no one day will be the same.  As the Platform Partnerships Director, APAC, you will be responsible for engaging with and managing strategic regional DSP partnerships, and working closely with the global Index DSP leads to further the success of partnerships within the APAC region. You will draw on your extensive sales experience to actively identify and pursue opportunities to expand our demand footprint across the region by leading business development opportunities with regional DSP players.  You will be an important point of contact for leadership across the company and work alongside Index teams globally. On top of being able to manage client relationships at a high caliber, you will also be expected to thrive in a highly technical environment and have a much higher degree of technical proficiency than would normally be expected. In the future, when business travel is recommenced this role will require travel within the region (Sydney, Tokyo, Singapore, Hong Kong, etc).  Index Exchange is a global technology company that connects the largest publishers and marketers across the globe through programmatic advertising. We ensure publishers are able to secure their bottom line so they can provide content to consumers and bring news and information to society at large. Our mission is to democratize digital advertising, all while helping marketers reach the audiences that matter most to them across digital channels. For over 20 years, Index has been known as the change agents of digital advertising – innovators who help shape how our industry reacts to new challenges and shifts in the market. As a result, we’ve been able to partner with some of the most prominent players in the media industry including Hearst, Disney, and Meredith Corporation among many others.  What We Want Strategic: An expert in strategic account management. We’ll look to you to identify actionable insights and new opportunities for our DSP clients to increase revenue and drive greater marketplace demand. Provided upward feedback to leadership for the purpose of formulating longer term business strategies and plans. Collaborative: In order to provide best-in-class service to our DSP partners, you will work cross-functionally with various operation, service, and analytics teams globally, and become a subject matter expert on the performance and growth of our partners. Communicative: You will be working with a number of clients at any given time and be expected to communicate effectively, and often, both internally and externally. This is a highly visible, client facing role, where building trusted relationships with DSP partners is crucial to success. What You Have 7-10+ years of experience in digital media A deep understanding of the programmatic advertising landscape An excellent business acumen to develop long term strategic visions for partners and the business. A proven track record of relationship building and managing successful partnerships. A proven track record of business development and new business generation. The rare balance of creative problem solver and detail oriented. You’re an organized, self-starter, and are your own “best” critic. Proficiency in English with excellent oral and written communication skills and a strong attention to detail. Business proficiency in Japanese is highly beneficial and other languages are a plus. What You’ll Be Doing You will manage a portfolio of strategic and global DSP partnerships, and act as a consultant and trusted partner for them. You will manage the DSP pipeline in the region and be responsible for closing and onboarding new local DSPs. Execute Index Exchange initiatives through consultative sales approaches. Be an expert on and evangelize the value of the Index offerings with your book of business. Provide expert level customer service to our DSP partners. Work with a global, omnichannel, and revenue driven mindset. Look for ways to optimize DSP relationships to increase ad spend and Index share of voice. Work alongside global counterparts to collaborate on strategy to grow accounts across all Index global markets. Be an expert on your partner’s performance to identify issues. Remain accountable for goals and KPIs. Identify new business opportunities and onboard net new partners to the platform. Collaborate with the Index Product team to assist in future product development and strategic planning that will enhance the business and create additional value to our DSP partners. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY At Index Exchange, we believe that successful products are built by teams just as diverse as the audience who uses them. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunity. We celebrate diversity of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. Additionally, we realize that diversity is deeper than any status or classification - diversity is the human experience. For those who show grit, passion, and humility - IX will welcome you.  ACCESSIBILITY FOR APPLICANTS WITH DISABILITIES Index Exchange is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Index Exchange* will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, please email ix.talent.acquisition@indexexchange.com or call 416.785.5908 ensure to provide your name, the best way to contact you, a detailed description of the nature of any accommodation that you may require (including any materials or processes that can be used to ensure your equal participation). Considering COVID-19, until further notice, everyone is required to Work from Home. When offices re-open, you will be required to follow the mandate of your local office.
industries: Internet

description: Channels & Distribution Leader  Cisco Meraki knows that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us. By simplifying powerful technology, we can free hardworking people to focus on their mission. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality. As part of an ambitious team in this rapidly growing business, you help customize the direction by ensuring our organizational challenges and opportunities are driving towards the best results.  As the Meraki Channels & Distribution Leader for the APJC region, you will directly lead a team of Channel & Distribution Account Managers that are responsible for encouraging and developing partners that will win with Meraki today and tomorrow.  At Meraki, our goal as leaders is to grow and develop forward-thinking teams. The strength of our team is the foundation of our success. For us, the best team is one that is focused, highly trusted, empowered, inclusive and innovative. A great team will build products that reinvent markets and customer relationships that widen the impact we can have on the world. A phenomenal team will also inspire in each of us work that is meaningful and rewarding. You commit to living our leadership principles, build simple paths for people to deliver their best work, and make decisions that will prioritize the long-term health of Cisco Meraki.  What You Will Do Hire, mentor, and develop a hungry and passionate channel sales team for your region Deliver against our sales goals and build strong internal and external relationships in service of an outstanding customer and partner experience Drive the strategy and executive relationship with partners Work together with all Meraki cross-functional teams in the region in support of the APJC Sales Leader and Field Sales Director to build culture and shared vision Work with Cisco teams to ensure Meraki is appropriately prioritized, gaining support for marketing and channel investments, and optimizing our joint GTM approach to drive growth Own management sponsorship and execution with strategic partners and/or distributors Use weekly team check-ins, metrics and data to continually assess both sales performance and talent performance/retention to fully understand underlying drivers and adjust course as necessary  You are Candid. You communicate broadly and often, providing clear purpose, direction, goals, and measures Career Champion. You invest in your team’s growth and development Disagree, Decide, and Commit. You listen to understand different opinions and allow them to influence the direction Results Driven. You are resilient, optimistic, and passionate about our business results while never compromising customer, partner, and team relationships Trustworthy. You commit to earning our team’s trust everyday through your actions and transparency  Minimum Requirements BA/BS or equivalent practical experience 8+ years of sales experience 2+ years of director level sales experience leading teams Proven sales leadership ability in motivating teams, overachieving targets, and successfully working with a broad range of channel partners Exceptional communication skills, both in presenting to partners and stakeholders, but also in reducing complex ideas to simple language and rigorously prioritizing what and how to communicate across the organization to achieve results Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities with the ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines Significant travel required (40 – 60%)  Preferred Requirements A deep understanding and interest in networking technology, software, or IT Fluency in English International work experience a plus  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.
industries: Computer Hardware, Computer Software, and Computer Networking

description: “Join Brown-Forman in this unique role, to help us shape the future of our portfolio and marketing teams in Asia. A unique opportunity to help design the long-term future of Jack Daniel’s Whiskey brand and unlock the Super Premium Whiskey category across the region.” ----VP,Managing Director Asia  Brown-Forman Asia is one of the operational units of the Brown-Forman Emerging International division. Asia presents one of the largest opportunities for Brown-Forman globally and is expected to continue to be one of the most significant growth contributors to the company. With Japan and China as key markets, B-F Asia is composed of 19 countries with 100+ employees distributed across offices in 10 key mega-cities. From a portfolio perspective, Asia is largely led by our flagship Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Whiskey brand, as well as presenting a large opportunity for our Super Premium portfolio of American Whiskeys and Single Malt Scotches.  Meaningful Work From Day One  This role leads the Marketing organization for Brown-Forman in Asia. The brand portfolio includes primarily Jack Daniel’s family of brands and a wide portfolio of Super Premium brands; Benriach, The Glendronach and Glenglassaugh single malt Scotch whiskies, Woodford Reserve and other bourbons, as well as Tequilas El Jimador and Herradura, Finlandia Vodka & Chambord Liqueur  Two key elements of the role are: (1) Growth Planning & Portfolio Development (2) Building Marketing Team capability and talent pipeline:  Growth Planning & Portfolio Development : feeds directly into key focus & resource decisions across brand portfolio to accelerate business growth. This role will leverage consumer & business insights in Asia to determine future growth opportunities both within & outside the current brand portfolio. This includes use of core company trademarks, line extensions, channel development and activations that increase penetration & frequency of purchase & consumption. Continually optimizing brand, pack, price, channel & promotional mix combinations for growth.  Building Marketing Team Capability : leading the Marketing Team & developing talent within the team. Using BF EI & Global resources to establish effective training, development opportunities & continuing to develop marketing capability. This position is a key part of both the Asia leadership team and the BFEI Marketing organization and is expected to be influential at multiple levels.  What You Will Experience  Marketing Leadership -  As a key member of Asia’s Leadership team, provides input and leadership to influence company’s day-to-day operations, strategic development, business and portfolio strategies and special projects as necessary, and reports agreed-upon metrics to the team.  Leads Asia Market & Portfolio Strategy-  Develop business / marketing growth strategies by leveraging consumer & business insights across brands, channels, occasions & evolving consumer behaviours & trends in Asia.  Leads & Develops the Asia Marketing Organization-  Leadership for the Asia Marketing department which consists of Brand Management, Trade Marketing, Integrated Marketing Communications, Category Management, Consumer/Shopper Insights  Brand/Business Building-  Responsible for continuous, sustainable improvement of key consumer metrics and long term brand health  Financial Management-  Pro-actively participates in the resource allocation process in Asia in order to ensure the most optimal long term and sustainable return on investment.  Marketing / Sales Integration-  Can effectively work with sales teams & trade marketing to maximize impact of marketing campaigns & programs at retail.  To thrive in this job, here’s what you should bring ...  10+ years successful track record in consumer marketing management - experience in premium food, beverage or image driven brands and/or luxury products.  Bachelor’s Degree in Business/Marketing or similar  Significant, progressive Marketing experience covering a full marketing mix including demonstrated ability to unlock insights from data and use them to drive material growth. Experience of innovatively deploying integrated platforms to strengthen brand relevance.  Portfolio Development/NPD Management Experience  Distributor/licensee/agency or sales management experience are preferred  Strong Business Acumen, Significant A&P Budget, P&L Experience  Excellent leadership skills, people management and talent development experience  Understanding of Sales and Finance Management  What You Can Add To The Team  Strong knowledge of integrated marketing communications  Fluency in written & verbal business English is a must, Mandarin, Japanese or other languages will be considered a plus PLEASE NOTE: [A more detailed job description is available if selected to advance further in the process.] Brown-Forman Corporation is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. It is the policy of Brown-Forman Corporation to provide full and equal employment opportunities to all employees and potential employees without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, veteran status, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability or any other legally protected status.  Business Area: Emerging International Division  City: Singapore  State  Country: SGP  Req ID: JR-00002615
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Head of Business Unit, Wafer (Consumer Food)
description: The Swiss-based family owned company Bühler is a global, industrial solutions provider for processing foods and manufacturing advanced materials, contributing to food security and high-energy efficiency. Around 65% of the worldwide harvested grain is processed on Bühler mills, around 50% of all car taillamps or headlamps are getting metallized on Bühler machines. Every day, billions of people come into contact with Bühler technologies to cover their basic needs for foods, mobility, or communication.  Bühler Singapore has been operating in Singapore since 1977. We offer the entire range of products and services of Buhler Group, with our main activities being food production and processing for rice, pasta, flour, chocolate and breakfast cereals as well as solutions for die casting, wet grinding and coating technology, with a focus on applications in the automotive industry, optics, electronics, paints, packaging and glass technology. Bühler Singapore is the Regional Headquarter for South East Asia and Oceania and has gained in depth knowledge of our customers’ specific requirements in the region over the past decades.  We are searching for a business unit leader to fill the vacancy of Head of Business Unit, Wafer (Consumer Food), to be based in Singapore Regional Office; the role will be responsible for South East Asia (SEA) & Oceania regional portfolio. This role will report to President, South East Asia & Oceania.  Tasks  As a management team member representing the SEA region in the Business Unit (BU) Wafer, you will drive sales and business development of the wafer business in SEA and strengthen the corporation as well as communication between the BU and the SEA region.  Regional Overall responsible to drive sales in coordination with other Business Area (BA)/ Business Unit (BU) leaders in SEA to ensure that targets are met. Responsible for Orders Released and lead generation for Wafer in SEA. Core interface between BA/ BU HQ and SAS organization. Customer engagement and relationship building. Coordinate marketing activities (exhibitions, seminars, events, workshops etc.) in cooperation with BA/ BU marketing and SAS / Regional Marketing team. Active technical and commercial support of the SAS’ sales team for selling (sales strategy, definition of the project requirements, product/ solutions, quotation, presentations, contract negotiations, closure & order quality etc.) and for canvassing new customers and new projects. Gateway / first contact for the SAS’ sales team regarding project-specific issues (“The voice“ of BU). Define quote specifications and scope of the quote documentation for the projects and ensure price quality. Identify market needs for M2M input and business forecasting of month on month business volumes. Close cooperation with BU Wafer product management and technology specialists with regional market information. Support Project Manager to facilitate his contact to the customer regarding project handling. Ensure the region actively maintain SOM and CRM systems. Strategically Full overview of the market including competitors, thereby developing and implementing successful market strategies and BU Wafer targets in SEA. Define CS strategies jointly with Regional CS Head to grow our spares and service business across the region for BU Wafer. Develop BU Wafer Key Account Management strategy for the region Drive the development of Wafer business in the countries and ensure CS coverage for our key customers. Provide and consolidate price strategy. Prepare budget, business plans and responsible for achieving targets in assigned sales region (equipment & customer service). People Development and Succession Planning Partner with Country Managers in the recruitment and development of local ASMs to expand Wafer sales. Organize, develop and train local Sales network, both internal and distributors. Develop local Sales Engineers to handle sales and quotation phase. Develop a local successor/ and organization that becomes self-sustainable. Required Qualifications  Education & Experience Degree in Mechanical Engineering At least 10 years of leadership function in technical sales or commercial management in capital goods industry Track records of driving growth and building strong customer relationship in technical products Good understanding and experience with Wafer processing plants, Buhler Sales and Fulfilment processes, sales of capital goods and investment projects Preferred Qualifications  Competencies Strong technical background with solution selling High level of independence and competence in managing Wafer business within the frame work of Buhler group directives Ability to lead a matrix team with strong leadership competencies across different cultures Excellent and proven sales track record Results driven and target oriented Good analytical capabilities and solution-oriented Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including good oral and written English Ability to influence across all levels, with a healthy dose of assertiveness to gain collaboration Ability to solve problems with existing resources Knowledge of Buhler IT systems are of advantage Benefits Career and personal development Cross-cultural working environment Attractive insurance coverage Good connections with public transport Coaching Training Employee events Application documents Cover letter, Resume Bühler as an employer  We are working to create sustainable innovations for a better world. Our aim is to transform the world’s most pressing food and mobility challenges into sustainable technologies, process solutions and business models. At Bühler, you are empowered to show initiative and take responsibility. In our family-owned company, personal success goes hand in hand with shared success. We foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where integrity and courage are key drivers of our success. We support your personal development because we want you to make a difference. By joining Bühler, you will be helping us tackle global challenges while at the same time meeting the needs of our customers.  Bühler is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity and inclusion at our company, therefore, it's important that you match us and we match you.

description: Our vision is to transform personal mobility by encouraging people to share and utilize assets better. First & foremost, we are looking for people who can connect with this vision deeply. The ideal candidate for our setup is a self-starter and goal-getter with experience in a successful startup in the sharing space.  At Drive lah we are looking for high-energy people that have a passion for scaling growth in the sharing economy and consider themselves self-starters who take ownership. We need people that are willing to go the extra mile and lead teams to achieve results that are beyond imagination.  About Us And Culture  Drive lah is the biggest peer to peer car sharing platform in Singapore, on a mission to accelerate the trend form car ownership to usership. Continuously improve customer experience is our key task and to be able to do that we are growing our team, in Singapore and beyond. We recently completed our pre-series A fundraising and are on track to realize our mid-term ambitions.  Our people are at the core of what we do and what we want to become. We promise a great opportunity to people who bring with themselves not just experience, but more importantly the right attitude and energy to match the speed of a rapidly growing startup. This is a great opportunity for you to join a scaling startup at an early point and grow and learn alongside us.  Job Title: Head of Customer Success  Location: Singapore  In this role you will be responsible for the Customer Success Team to offer excellent service to our customers in Singapore and beyond. You will lead the team that supports our customers with onboarding, help them to make bookings on our platform, and resolution management.  As Head of Customer Success, it is your task to be the voice of the guest and ensure that the organization does what is needed to improve the experience for the guests on our platform, so that they will become brand advocates.  Moreover, as a resource and support centre for our community of guests, you are (with the marketing team) responsible for crafting content for our social channels, hosting local events ranging from intimate gatherings to large scale productions, and ultimately ensuring that Drivel lah’s community is visible in everything we do.  Responsiblities Achieving growth targets by coaching and managing performance of the team that is responsible for the entire guest experience. Provide first-class support and relationship management to a growing number of Drive lah users including onboarding, nurturing Set up and drive incentive schemes, to improve conversions and maximize LTV Collaborate with marketing team to maintain local content calendar and digital presence across social channels Regularly seek customer feedback to identify ways to create value for our users and channel it to marketing and product teams. Analyze key demand metrics, create action plans per segment and deliver on those. About You You are a people person. You thrive working with others and love building personal connections with customers. You thrive by setting and achieving ambitious growth targets together with the team. You are organized and like to create structure. You're a problem solver and are confident in your decision-making abilities. You are data-driven and are comfortable using numbers to drive your initiatives forward. You have exceptional written, verbal and interpersonal skills. You have 5+ years’ experience leading Customer experience or Sales teams, preferably at Airbnb or similar platforms. You can delight us if you have:: Passion for sharing, collaborative consumption, and tech startups Strong knowledge of digital CRM systems Marketing or event planning skills and experience Experience working with startups Love for cars as much as we do Compensation: Competitive renumeration & an opportunity to work in a high growth company that is changing the way we move around.

The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways — from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.  The RoleAspenTech is seeking an Alliance Director to be the focal for its global alliances operating in APJ, with a primary focus on sales engagement.  For alliances headquartered in APJ, this person will also develop the alliance strategy, launch, business and marketing plans, joint offerings, relationship management, and enabling other regional alliance peers.  The objective of the role is to leverage alliances to create successful outcomes for AspenTech, the Alliance partner and our customers, with particular emphasis on penetrating new verticals outside of our “core” markets in energy, chemicals and life sciences. This individual must exhibit strong leadership, have an entrepreneurial mindset and bias for action, excellent organizational and communication skills, exhibit excellent collaboration and disciplined execution, and have worked well with global partners and distributed internal teams. The ideal candidate will inspire teaming and trust with internal and external stakeholders to align program and execution with all parties.Your Impact Facilitate effective and self-sustained joint field engagements between the partner and AspenTech’s Sales organizations to drive license growth. This role will become “embedded” within the sales force, supporting account management, regional business development, pipeline, strategic deals, QBR’s and forecast reviews. Demand generation and pipeline management: With internal and external marketing organizations, ensure the creation and execution of a joint demand generation plan, including joint business and account plans, opportunity engagements, co-marketing and thought leadership. Competency development – internal: Manage enablement sessions, promote the alliance “brand” value, establish support for use of alliance’s Customer Centers where applicable. Competency development - external: Facilitate understanding of AspenTech’s portfolio of solutions and impact on asset optimization, digital transformation, and value creation. Working with AspenTech Customer Success and SIA teams: Ensure that partners build and maintain required competency levels, leverage AspenTech’s service delivery methodologies and our existing sub-contractor ecosystem. Proven leadership skills and experience in building relationships with stakeholders inside and outside the organization, working within challenging circumstances where change and ambition are high, to drive outcomes that benefit our clients. Actively listen to client needs, and translate this feedback back to solutions consulting, Services, global alliance teams and product management. Governance: Identify and align critical functions, tasks and accountabilities required from key stakeholders to execute against alliance strategy and business plans; hold all parties accountable for performance. Develop and track the full “balance sheet” / scorecard of partner activities. Maintain peer-peer relationship mapping, and quarterly business reviews. Identify and resolve issues, escalate where appropriate. Become the go-to person and “trusted advisor” for business line executives and managers. What You'll Need Proven success managing high growth, regional, technology-driven alliances with typical deals above $250K USD. Credentials in professional alliance management (e.g., ASAP certification) preferred. Entrepreneurial thinker with a bias for action. High energy with a positive disposition. Comfortable in working in fluid, fast paced environments. Self-starter and team player. Strong business acumen and change agent. Adept at identifying improvement growth opportunities, selling the vision while building interlock, and overcoming resistance to change. Executive presence. At ease presenting in small or large group settings, working with executives to GM level. Ability to manage relationships at all levels, both internally and externally. Excellent written and oral communication and collaboration skills. Multi-lingual skills highly valued. 3+ years’ experience in the process or manufacturing industries required. BS/BA or equivalent required; MS/MBA preferred.

description: Are you determined to making in a difference in sustainability? Are you eager to bring your expertise to the renewables sector? At STS, we strive to become the partner of choice of companies seeking quality and sustainability in the renewable energy sector. Our team is composed of people like you who are passionate about quality, and sustainability, who want renewable energy components to be manufactured right and responsibly. STS is today the global leader in solar PV pre-dispatch conformity assessment. Being an accredited inspection body, we believe in conducting inspections in an independent and impartial manner. By going beyond inspection, we create even more value for our clients who develop renewable enrgy projects worldwide. Come and join our talented team right now!  As the Director, Business Development Solar & Storage, Asia Pacific, you will lead the business development team and activity of STS in the territory with a focus on Australia, Vietnam, Malaysia, Taiwan, Japan, South Korea. You will support STS clients in selecting relevant technical solutions, develop and maintain the network of clients in the region, increase sales and retain profitability for the company under the guidance of the Head of Business Development. Responsibilities Formulate and implement STS business development strategy in solar and storage in Asia Pacific. Responsible for clients success (satisfaction, loyalty, development, revenues growth) within the territory. Present STS services and advise clients on selecting the most relevant services from STS. Prepare technico-commercial proposals. Generate leads/opportunities and manage orders life-cycle up to payment collection. Develop STS brand in the territory  Qualifications Education Background：MBA degree. Technical background is a plus. Professional Experience： 8+ years' prior industry related business development experience.  Strong business acumen.  Established connections in the sector.  Strong PV industry industry market and technical knowledge. Professional Skills： Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills (with both internal and external stakeholders) Can work independently, with solid business planning skills. Language skills: Fluent in English. Personal Skills: Strong command of MS Office. ERP/CRM knowledge is a plus. Other requirements: Home-office in Hong Kong, Singapore or other locations in Asia, willing to travel frequently as needed (post Covid-19)

description: Put the World on Vacation  At Wyndham Destinations our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. With a spirit of caring, creativity and fun, our teams help families and friends create memories that last a lifetime. As the world’s largest vacation ownership company and part of Travel + Leisure Co., we’re shaping the future of the travel industry.  IHC Marketing Director – Asia  Position Reports To  Marketing Director Asia Pacific  Area Vice President Sales  Positions Reporting To This Position  Strategic Partnerships Manager – Thailand  Campaign Manager – Thailand  Strategic Partnerships Manager – Indonesia (to be hired)  Campaign Manager – Indonesia (to be hired)  Marketing Manager – Japan (to be hired)  Key Relationships  Internal teams – Marketing, sales, call centres & resorts  External clients / partners and suppliers  LOCATION:  Asia – Indonesia, Thailand, Singapore, other  Primary Objectives  As the IHC Marketing Director, this role will develop and implement strategic marketing and partnership business plans that drive profitability and sustainable growth for the vacation ownership business - Innovative Holiday Club by Club Wyndham.  This opportunity is ideal for an individual with significant experience in marketing, with the added bonus of experience in strategic partnerships, digital marketing and business development. They will be responsible for nurturing and driving their regional marketing teams to deliver on high business targets while maintaining high brand standards and positively contributing to the IHC brand reputation. They will be responsible for the end to end process of all IHC frontline marketing activities including market research, marketing campaigns, lead and tour generation for call centres, and customer communications.  PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES: (Include but not limited to :)  Main Responsibilities Identify, develop and implement new business opportunities and strategies for each Asia region to ensure business targets are met for both marketing campaigns and strategic marketing partnerships. Develop and maintain an active pipeline of marketing activities for short term, mid-term and long term growth. Build and enhance customer relationships through joint business plans, understanding customer business drivers, foreseeing future needs and providing win/win solutions, both with internal and external partners. Monitor and manage the financial performance of area of responsibility. Technical Develop tailor-made and innovative corporate strategies and tactics for identifying, cultivating, soliciting and stewarding a portfolio of corporate partners. Identify, recommend and develop strategies in conjunction with key stakeholders to continuously improve performance in lead generation, tour conversion and new owner conversion. Identify and address potential problems likely to negatively impact market perception of company Establish internal and external customer satisfaction methodology and measurement against benchmark Establish methodology and reporting against KPI’s Utilize information and market insight to develop marketing campaign strategies that will achieve and improve the efficiency, effectiveness and profitability; utilize a variety of marketing channels, targeting audience types with likeliness to convert. Initiate and analyze research initiatives on customer demographics, psychographics and purchasing behavior to identify and forecast emerging opportunities Establish ongoing procedures to collect and review quantitative and qualitative information needed to anticipate, or make decisions on, market behavior. To continually monitor, review and adapt marketing campaigns to ensure all marketing spend is optimized with a high ROI. Develop and maintain management information system, business intelligence and CRM functionality to improve the accuracy and completeness of information to support business objectives Identifying new and maintain marketing lead sources to support the call centres. Attend industry functions as necessary, and provide feedback and information on market trends Innovation & Project Coordination Display innovation through inspiring, creating and improving processes and products. Leadership Display leadership values by ensuring effective communication and respecting your peers and managers. Support others within the team and empower each other wherever possible. Show integrity in all aspects of the position by doing the right thing, taking responsibility and delivering on the promise. Collaborate with various teams both internal and external to ensure the wider business objectives are met, including brand awareness and reputation, new owner growth and customer satisfaction. Work closely with the marketing teams to provide direction, guidance and support to meet regional targets. Motivate and lead the team with enthusiasm and creative solutions. Work collaboratively with peers to achieve cohesion between departments with high standard of communication. Identify and develop talent pool to ensure bench strength and succession, while overseeing professional development of each team member. Communicate and monitor team performance against targets. Ensure the team is compliant with legislation, professional behavior and business ethics. Display a Count On Me! service to all internal and external parties. Adhere to all policies and procedures relating to Workplace Health and Safety ensuring the safety of yourself and all other people who may be effected by your conduct in the workplace. Key Position Criteria A minimum of 5 years marketing related experience with proven expertise in marketing strategy and corporate partnerships management. Must include tertiary qualifications with a minimum graduate or post-graduate qualifications in business related discipline. Technical/Professional Knowledge and Skills – High level of technical and professional skill and knowledge in marketing programs, strategy, campaigns and research; keeps up with current developments and trends in areas of expertise; ability to develop strategies and programs for achievement of results; thorough understanding of the timeshare and holiday ownership business in the Asia region. Experience using a variety of Marketing platforms including Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, basic website html coding, design programs (Adobe / Canva), and Microsoft programs (Word, Excel, Powerpoint). Added bonus if experience using Salesforce or Merlin CRM. Building Strategic Working Relationships – Developing and using collaborative relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals. Building a Successful Team – Builds a successful team using appropriate style and flexible methods to create a cohesive and results driven team. Aligning Performance for Success – Focuses and guides others in accomplishing work objectives. Decision Making – Identifying and understanding issues, problems, and opportunities; comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and probable consequences. Excellent interpersonal skills, including persuasive abilities, effective listening, diplomacy and tact, team-playing with demonstrated success in dealing with corporates. Mature, charismatic personality possessing the style, stature, leadership and diplomacy required to work effectively with senior staff and volunteers. Excellent organizational and communication skills with superb attention to detail. Ability to travel inter/ intra state and internationally when required. A Place for Everyone  Hospitality is at the heart of all we do at Travel + Leisure Co., including how we treat each member of our growing community. Here, you’ll find a team that’s inclusive, values diversity, and is built on a foundational respect for people from all over the world.  We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to mycareer@wyn.com, including the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.

Overview Are you looking for a role where you can build a brand and channel business from the ground up? This position is your opportunity to help drive and accelerate our fast-growing AvePoint Elements partner business through working with distributors, managed services partners, and VARs.  What will you be doing? As a Channel Business Manager, your responsibilities will include: Work closely with distributors to execute on a partner recruitment strategy to grow and optimize channel partner breadth with the right coverage, capacity, and capabilities Helping build and maintain our relationship with our regional distributors who sell the AvePoint Elements product line to partners Build out and execute revenue generating distributor and partner business plans, develop pipeline, accurately forecast Help enable our MSPs and VARs in the field to create go-to-market strategies, close business, and create partner loyalty through partner success best practices Co-sell and drive product promotions with our distribution partners Deliver high level presentations to our MSPs and VARs Uncover new revenue generating opportunities at both the distribution and partner levels Attend events, workshops, and represent AvePoint and the channel team in the field OK, I’m interested… is this the job for me? We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you. If you enjoy the “startup mentality” and creating something from the ground up, this is for you. You are someone who is able to truly build “win/win” partnerships and articulate value prop with ease.  A self-starter with ambition, who loves to get involved and wear multiple hats.  Other qualities you’ll need to be a fit for this role include: 5-7 years in business development, partner management, or B2B enterprise technology sales Understanding of IT industry trends including the shift to Cloud Computing and Digital Transformation, channel transformation, and Public Cloud Marketplaces. Knowledge of Microsoft technology, specifically including Office365 and SharePoint and partner ecosystem Relationships with Microsoft CSPs and Cloud partners is a plus Previous work at a technology distributor, LSP, or managed services provider a bonus, or ISV in a partner facing role Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to take complex situations and simplify them  About AvePoint Check out our careers blog for content on our people, culture, and workplace! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobTitle: Head of regional Enterprise Sales (Asia Leading Logistics/Last mile delivery Tech platform)
description: Head of Regional Enterprise Sales (Logistics/Last mile delivery Tech platform) New position/ headcount, Position can be based in Singapore or Hong Kong Leading a regional team of 4, role comprises of 50% management, 50% hands-on execution Minimum Degree with 6 to 10 years of experience with proven experience in managing strategic account / enterprise sales in a regional basis & ability to identify cross-sell and up-sell opportunities and design new products/services  The Company Our client is redefining logistics in Asia. Asia’s leading logistics technology delivery platform that is dedicated to supporting 20,000+ businesses with same day and next day deliveries. Headquartered in Hong Kong with offices in Taiwan, Singapore and Malaysia. The company connects businesses to a fleet of independent delivery agents including walkers, scooters, vans, trucks to deliver anything, anytime, anywhere at a fraction of the cost. The company comprises of a team of entrepreneurial and passionate builders. Their investors in recent rounds of fundraising include Alibaba, Cyberport, SparkLabs, Swire Properties, the Jardine Matheson group, PChome and more. In addition to their core business of last mile delivery, the company has also launched an e-commerce platform to provide a seamless one-stop solution for merchants to build e-shop, process payments, manage orders and deliveries. Shoppers can enjoy a wide range of consumer products delivered to their doors at their desired time slots.  The Position The Head of Regional Enterprise Sales is responsible to build and grow the logistics tech business in Asia. This role will drive revenue growth for key enterprise accounts with the company’s expanding logistics tech services offerings. This candidate can be based in Hong Kong or Singapore. The right candidate should be comfortable with an “all hands-on deck” and fast paced startup environment. This role will best suit a candidate who possess the passion, innovative and collaborative spirit to build this exciting business  Job Scope: Reporting directly to the COO, you will be the founding team lead to build out the new Regional Enterprise Sales team, covering 4 operating regions and counting. Specific work streams may include: Drive Regional Revenue Growth: Lead the team to onboard and manage regional enterprise merchants to use the company network of logistics service offerings. Drive regional revenue growth of key enterprise accounts, ranging from last mile deliveries to international deliveries, to fulfilment and other value added services. Key Account Management & Partnership: Build and maintain key client relationships to drive logistics projects forward regionally. Be the voice and energy in representing the company to all potential merchants and partnerships. Strategy & Planning and New Products: Work with internal senior management on strategy, planning and driving forward new product lines and services critical to our growth and logistics tech strategy. Cross-functional Project Management: Work with cross-functional teams across Operations, Marketing, Product on strategic projects that add value in acquiring new merchants or engaging existing merchants.  Job Requirement The ideal candidate should possess: Bachelor's degree or above. 6-10 years of relevant work experience in tech startups, sales, account management, logistics & fulfilment, or enterprise B2B sales. Mandatory to have proven experience handling strategic accounts / enterprise sales on a regional basis and the ability to identify cross-sell & up-sell opportunities Ability to drive projects from zero to one, achieving results and revenue targets. Ability to adapt and thrive in a quickly evolving and dynamic work environment. Strong communications in collaborating with internal and external stakeholders. Fluent in written and spoken English and Mandarin is mandatory as position is required to manage Mandarin / Cantonese speaking enterprise clients and stakeholders. Ability to speak Cantonese will be an added advantage, Top-notch problem solving and hustle skills, plus ability to adapt to thrive in a dynamic work environment. Strong analytical thinking and data-driven decision-making mentality. Demonstrated record of positively owning and leading initiatives and projects.  Interested candidates please click "Apply” Kindly attention your CV to Mr Desmond Fung Ming Siew (EA License No.: 19C9647 | CEI Reg No.: R1104604) **We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
