description: Global leader in the AdTech industry Individual Contributing sales role  About Our Client  Our client is a global leader in the AdTech industry, focusing on outcome-based marketing. They work on exciting technologies, and strive to provide marketing solutions that create transparent, provable outcomes for brands. They have presence in over 40 offices around the world, and are looking to hire a Sales Director.  Job Description  The Sales Director will be responsible for hunting new clients in SEA. This individual contributor's role will report directly to the Head of APAC.  Responsibilities Will Include Driving revenue growth by uncovering business needs and identify how to enable clients achieve business goals Coordinating internal resources for the preparation and delivery of objective based solutions for clients Creating and delivering customised sales opportunities that address clients' goals Building relationships with key marketing, merchandising, and media decision makers within client organisations, while understanding the landscape and gaining account penetration Negotiating and closing contracts with clients' key stakeholders  The Successful Applicant  The Ideal Candidate Must Have The Following Proven experience in closing large deals at enterprise levels in the media space for consultative sales and solution selling Pure hunter's mentality - sales-driven in bringing onboard new accounts and growing revenue Strong knowledge of the MarTech/AdTech value chain Solid understanding of data & analytics landscape Diverse client management experience (client side, ad solutions, direct marketing, agency experience, etc.)  What's On Offer  Our client offers an amazing opportunity to join a global leader in the AdTech space. You will get to be a part of a company who has been a market leader in providing consultative marketing solutions for top brands in the world. The ideal candidate is one who is extremely sales-driven, eager in closing new deals. The remuneration package is lucrative, with a competitive base salary and commission structure.  Contact: Ryan Ong  Quote job ref: 4199684

description: (a) Monitoring, compiling and reporting on the financial performance of the Group;  (b) Oversee and ensure the preparation of statutory accounts, co-ordination with the external auditors;  (c) Managing tax affairs and treasury matters of the Group as a whole;  (d) Generating and preparing financial performance reports on the Group, and accounting and reporting to the Board, shareholders, investors and regulators;  (e) Partnering with the Chief Operating Officer, if any, of the Group to achieve favourable financial results with respect to sales, profitability, cash flow, mergers and acquisitions, systems, reporting and controls;  (f) Driving the Group’s financial planning;  (g) Performing risk management by analyzing the Group’s liabilities and investments;  (h) Assisting the Chief Executive Officer or the Board in deciding on investment strategies by considering cash and liquidity risks;  (i) Controlling and evaluating the Group’s fundraising plans and capital structure;  (j) Ensuring that cash flow is appropriate for the Group’s operations;  (k) Supervising, if any, all finance personnel including financial analysts, controllers, treasurers, etc.;  (l) Managing vendor relationships;  (m) Preparing reliable current and forecasting reports;  (n) Overseeing the setting up of the Group’s finance IT system;  (o) Ensuring compliance with applicable laws and the Group’s policies; and  (p) If required by the Board, representing the Group in any and all engagements and liaisons with authorities and regulators (governmental or otherwise) including but not limited to the  Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority, the Monetary Authority of Singapore, the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited, the Securities Industry Council and the Monetary Authority of Singapore  Minimum Years of Experience : 5  Salary : $5500 -$6000 (negotiable)

Posting Date Oct 06, 2021  Job Number 21106497  Job Category Sales & Marketing  Location Singapore Regional Office, 2 Harbourfront Place #06-08, Singapore, Singapore, Singapore VIEW ON MAP  Brand Corporate  Schedule Full-Time  Relocation? N  Position Type Management  Located Remotely? N  Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. We believe a great career is a journey of discovery and exploration. So, we ask, where will your journey take you?  Job Summary  The global distribution landscape in the lodging industry continues to expand and become more complex, and Marriott International recognizes the development and execution of an enhanced future intermediary partner relationship strategy as a key strategic focus. As part of Marriott’s Distribution Strategy team, the Director Wholesale, APAC reports to the Sr. Director, Distribution – APEC/GC.  The Director, Wholesale - APAC is responsible for the execution of Marriott’s global wholesale strategy in APAC with focus on a) transforming and modernizing traditional and offline wholesale and leisure relationships to create efficiencies and improve content controls by taking advantage of new tools and technology, b) managing the day-to-day relationship with assigned account portfolio by building/maintaining strong trusted relationships with account partners and internal Marriott partners that are accountable for delivering against mutually defined account goals and KPIs, c) supporting B2B distribution strategy and develop Continent specific recommendations, and d) providing distribution strategy guidance and education to Continent stakeholders.  This position is accountable for assigned initiatives to support Marriott’s Global Distribution Strategy, including required internal and external relationship and stakeholder management. The position demonstrates advanced knowledge of job-relevant topics, systems and processes.  CANDIDATE PROFILE  Education And Experience 4-year degree from an accredited university in Business Administration, Hotel Management, or related major; 8 years’ experience in similar positions with focus on strategic account management, business development, sales & marketing and/or revenue management. Passion for sales excellence and business development Strong account management, negotiating and influencing skills Ability to manage complex account relationships, develop/execute focused account plans, and manage large scale account implementation projects in cooperation with subject matter experts in HQ and Continents Fluent in oral and written communication in English. Mandarin language capabilities highly preferred. Ability to work well within all levels of the organization, especially internal and external senior management  Job Location Marriott’s Regional office in Singapore  CORE WORK ACTIVITIES  Accelerating Transition From Static To Dynamic Wholesale Model In partnership with immediate supervisor, develop and execute a centralized commercial and contracts strategy with defined wholesale and leisure accounts Identify opportunities and develop a plan that prioritizes accounts to be technology enabled, and establish bi-lateral technology investment and commitments Supports Sr. Directors, Distribution - APEC/GC in developing, contextualizing and implementing the strategy and approach in APAC Works closely with Continent leadership teams to increase compliance of local wholesale contracts and explores options to fast track distribution control through static contracts Cooperates with Directory Connectivity APAC, Senior Director Channel Operations and Support APAC, andCentralized Travel Agent Commission Processing teams to establish framework for operational excellence, KPIs and scalable approach for account specific operational execution (Direct Connect, content, images, payments, commission payments etc.)  Managing the day-to-day relationship with assigned account portfolio Builds/maintains strong trusted relationship with assigned account portfolio Executes contract negotiations as assigned Develops detailed account plans, establishes KPIs and measures success against those KPIs Cooperates very closely with Global Sales and Continent Sales organizations to establish account teams and clear account goals/account team member accountabilities Establishes metrics with each assigned account to actively enhance the visibility of Marriott hotels to drive desired revenue in alignment with the principles of Marriott’s Global Distribution Strategy  Providing distribution strategy guidance and education to Continent stakeholders Provides support to Sr. Directors, Distribution – APEC/GC on key account partner negotiations and business development opportunities Supports execution of Global Distribution Strategy projects as assigned Attends business review meetings as appropriate Delivers account updates to senior management (HQ and Continents) as needed Develops and provides training and educational sessions on distribution as it relates to account specific strategies to Continent teams and hotels as needed  Managing Work, Projects, and Policies Coordinates and implements work and projects as assigned. Generates and provides accurate and timely results in the form of reports, presentations, etc. Analyzes information and evaluates results to choose the best solution and solve problems. Develops specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish work. Sets and tracks goal progress for self and others. Monitors the work of others to ensure it is completed on time and meets expectations. Provides direction and assistance to other organizational units’ policies and procedures, and efficient control and utilization of resources.  Additional Responsibilities Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person in a timely manner. Manages group or interpersonal conflict. Informs and/or updates executives, peers, and subordinates on relevant information in a timely manner. Manages time effectively and conducts activities in an organized manner. Presents ideas, expectations and information in a concise, organized manner. Uses problem solving methodology for decision making and follow up. Performs other reasonable duties as assigned by manager.  MANAGEMENT COMPETENCIES  Leadership Adaptability - Maintains performance level under pressure or when experiencing changes or challenges in the workplace. Communication - Conveys information and ideas to others in a convincing and engaging manner through a variety of methods. Problem Solving and Decision Making - Identifies and understands issues, problems, and opportunities; obtains and compares information from different sources to draw conclusions, develops and evaluates alternatives and solutions, solves problems, and chooses a course of action. Professional Demeanor - Exhibits behavioral styles that convey confidence and command respect from others; makes a good first impression and represents the company in alignment with its values.  Managing Execution Building and Contributing to Teams - Participates as a member of a team to move toward the completion of common goals while fostering cohesion and collaboration among team members. Driving for Results - Sets high standards of performance for self and/or others; assumes responsibility for work objectives; initiates, focuses, and monitors the efforts of self and/or others toward the accomplishment goals; proactively takes action and goes beyond what is required. Planning and Organizing - Gathers information and resources required to set a plan of action for self and/or others; prioritizes and arranges work requirements to accomplish goals and ensure work is completed.  Building Relationships Coworker Relationships - Interacts with others in a way that builds openness, trust, and confidence in the pursuit of organizational goals and lasting relationships. Customer Relationships - Develops and sustains relationships based on an understanding of customer/stakeholder needs and actions consistent with the company’s service standards. Global Mindset - Supports employees and business partners with diverse styles, abilities, motivations, and/or cultural perspectives; utilizes differences to drive innovation, engagement and enhance business results; and ensures employees are given the opportunity to contribute to their full potential.  Generating Talent and Organizational Capability Organizational Capability - Evaluates and adapts the structure of assignments and work processes to best fit the needs and/or support the goals of an organizational unit. Talent Management - Provides guidance and feedback to help individuals develop and strengthen skills and abilities needed to accomplish work objectives.  Learning and Applying Professional Expertise Applied Learning - Seeks and makes the most of learning opportunities to improve performance of self and/or others. Business Acumen - Understands and utilizes business information to manage everyday operations and generate innovative solutions to approach business and administrative challenges. Technical Acumen - Understands and utilizes professional skills and knowledge in a specific functional area to conduct and manage everyday business operations and generate innovative solutions to approach function-specific work challenges as outlined in this job description. Basic Competencies - Fundamental competencies required for accomplishing basic work activities. Basic Computer Skills - Uses advanced computer hardware and software (e.g., personal computers, word, excel, PowerPoint processing software, Internet browsers, etc.). Mathematical Reasoning - Adds, subtracts, multiplies, or divides quickly, correctly, and in a way that allows one to solve work-related issues. Oral Comprehension - Listens to and understands information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Reading Comprehension - Understands written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents. Writing - Communicates effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience. Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.
industries: Hospitality, Leisure, Travel & Tourism, and Food & Beverages

description: Job Description, Low-code Style  As the #1 low-code application development platform, OutSystems provides customers with everything they need to build apps incredibly fast. So, let us cut to the chase: we are looking for a Director, Business Value Consulting ASEAN to be based in Singapore. This role is strategic to the company’s growth and scale and is the accelerant to the company’s overall sales and customer success mission. It will drive a faster and more predictable ramp of revenue, increase productivity of quota carriers, advance customer adoption and success, and will play a key integration role between Product Management, Marketing, and field teams. The ideal candidate will be highly credible and have 8+ years’ successful experience operating within discrete (or non-discrete) quota carrying functions, will be an expert in strategy and business consulting through C-Level connections and engagements and have significant experience shaping and articulating the impact of software on a customer’s change agenda  The Longer Story  One of the fastest growing B2B software companies in the world, OutSystems is on a mission to enable every organization to innovate through the power of software. We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in empowering companies to build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that makes a difference to their business. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help our customers address some of the most strategic challenges in business today, from modernizing their business processes to transforming the customer experience.  OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 435,000 developer community members, 1,500 employees, 350 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 87 countries and across 22 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems is co-headquartered in Boston and Portugal, with offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.  Are you a Business Value Consulting guru that finds your current employer is moving too slow for your taste?  Job Responsibilities And Expectations Build, execute, and embed the Value Consulting function in APAC regions. Establish yourself and the function as genuine Business Partners to the field leadership as critical sales experts providing additive value to the sales motion, customer interactions, adoption, and overall success. Support the Sales and Customer Success motions by directly engaging with field teams and customers to build strategic, compelling, well aligned, and objective business justifications that drive customer success and adoption of the OutSystems platform. This role is predominantly a customer facing role. Drive repeatability and best practice by integrating and embedding value-based expertise, packaged tools and repeatable approaches observed from work in the field into the broader field selling motion. Look for opportunities to build and lead scalable programs and to interlock with other OutSystems functions. Coach Sales teams on expert solution methodologies. Partner with the regional leadership team ensuring continuous improvement in the role-based skills necessary to succeed, including the inspection of and execution of sales opportunities, repeatability of the sales methodology, and the use of value selling solutions and techniques in the customer buying experience and customer success mission. Provide strategic planning and coaching with sales leadership, field sales teams and supporting organizations on the execution of their campaigns and opportunities utilizing supported value-selling methodologies and resources. Coach and develop field leaders by executing with them the best practice techniques and business cadence to ensure each is maximizing and continuously evolving the value they deliver to their assigned field sales teams, prospects, and customers. Drive interlock between sales, technical functions, services, product, and customer success managers to build, increase and accelerate opportunity value while ensuring customer success through solid value realization plans which speed usage and adoption. Innovate within teams and across other key LAER functions to develop new propositions, methods, tools, and advisory workshops that accelerate, improve, and scale the selling motion across all phases while increasing the company’s growth trajectory. Help to integrate value selling and expert functions into messaging, sales plays, demos, and proof events for optimal sales acceleration. Desired Skills And Experience 10 + years' high-tech field experience in sales, sales leadership, and/or consulting in both start-up and maturing, high-growth companies. Strong knowledge of the traditional and modern application development technologies and frameworks, including mobile, agile methods, and devops. Expert in the C-suite and aligning solutions to business and technology needs, driving repeatable positive outcomes for both sales and customer success. Strong executive presence and polish internally and externally. Consistent track record in over-achieving quarterly and annual goals in sales and sales leadership roles as well as in field-supporting roles. Experience selling complex solutions to the Global 2000 or Fortune 500. Must have high ethics, integrity, and humility and be able to work collaboratively with other teams. Demonstrated leadership of cross-functional teams tasked with full lifecycle support for sales through to customer success - must have a demonstrated ability to influence others. Strong sales strategy analysis and a good understanding of how application development teams support the business. Solid business case creation and analysis skills using highly consultative approach. Excellent financial and business acumen in multiple business functional areas. Willing to travel significantly. Fluency in English Working at OutSystems  We do not have many rules, but we have a lot of common sense. Our commitment to our culture is highlighted in The Small Book of the Few Big Rules, written by our Founder and CEO, Paulo Rosado. This commitment to culture has landed us in the top six Forbes Best Cloud Computing Companies and CEOs To Work for three years running. Our culture is based on transparency, teamwork and excellence as promised in our Small Book of the Few Big Rules . We live it every day. We grow, change, and innovate, and give our teams the space to be proactive and creative. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is obvious, and we also encourage lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering new skills. Global colleagues who are as smart, hardworking, and driven as you. Our DNA is disrupting the status quo. It is why our company exists. We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and often uncovers a better, more agile way. https://www.outsystems.com/company/careers/
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: MNC Telco - Carrier Wholesale - Senior Manager/Director
description: Our client is an international telecommunication company, the team head is looking for an experienced Carrier Wholesale Director to join the team in Singapore office. The ideal candidate must have 15+ relevant experience, with exposure on Singapore, South East Asia market, as well as Korean and Japan will be ideal. This is a farming role but require a strong hunting mentality.  Responsibilities:  Ability to grow revenue and drive new sales Ability to engage contacts at executive level and various customer business units (e.g, Digital Transformation, IT, Procurement, etc.) to drive new revenue Core network selling and new selling to new growth product Generate revenues from sell-to and sell-through deals Possess excellent deal management skills and pipeline Aim to understand various products and services with the intent to position us as a strategic partner for the customer’s digital transformation journey Identifying opportunities for large engagements (complex, multi-product solutions) and developing relevant pursuit strategies. Ability to proactively identify problem areas both external and internal and drive resolutions through engagements with product & solutions, commercial, legal teams, etc.   Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree with 10- 15 years of Carrier/Enterprise sales and account management experience Strong SP sales skill (aggressive and strategic selling) Excellent Communication skills and ability to engage executive level conversations are key    In-depth understanding of the Telco industry dynamics and the changing landscape Strong understanding of competitive landscape of SP environments (IPL, IP, VPN, Security, UCC, etc) Strong understanding of OTT’s demands and their ecosystems Strong understanding of SP environment (bilateral discussion of voice, data, mobility, swap arrangement, etc) Strong in HK, Singapore, and Malaysia market Prior, handling markets like Japan, Korea, Vietnam, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand market is a more preferable   If you would like to apply for this role or find out more, please contact Mariza Lai on m.lai@wellesleys.com or apply online with your latest CV in word format and expected salary, quoting the job role "MNC Telco - Carrier Wholesale - Senior Manager/Director". Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: Singapore  As a Barclays Markets Distribution Business Manager - Asia, you will provide critical business support to the various senior leaders of the APAC Distribution business. Additionally, as a trusted partner and representative of the Markets Distribution business, you will be a critical representative and face-off to multiple infrastructure partners on multi-faceted issues. You will be involved in all Global Distribution initiatives and aware of the constantly changing global and regional regulatory agenda.  Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.  What will you be doing? Providing operating leverage to department head in supporting decision making, growth and future strategy of the businesses across relevant markets Working closely with the global business management teams to understand wider priorities and ensure they are reflected in the regional agenda Representing the businesses while liaising with other functions and clusters of the firm on BAU matters and strategic priorities, risk and control initiatives, remediation efforts Collaborating proactively with the global Business Management team and stakeholders across functions Working with counterparts as well as line Functions to implement regulatory and risk and control agenda for respective businesses Providing thought out collaborative engagements with Infrastructure partners to resolve key issues, where diplomatic skills as well as critical analytical skills will be leveraged Being responsible for spot decision-making due to being the representative for the business, understanding of Market’s products, practices and activities is a key asset What We’re Looking For Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to multi-task and manage multiple initiatives concurrently across a diverse book of work Previous track record of project execution with demonstrable expertise in supporting cross functional / front-to-back, business change programmes Analytical/problem solving mind set coupled with desire to get ‘hands on’ into detail Solid project execution experience gained in a Global Markets context and have extensive knowledge of the front-to-back environment Skills That Will Help You In The Role Experience in Business Management experience, preferably in a Markets Sales coverage role Project management background running large cross division projects preferred Experience in programme scoping / initiation, mobilization, and execution coordination Degree in a relevant field or equivalent (i.e. Finance, Management, Economics, Business) Where will you be working?  Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a “city in a garden”. Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you’re just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.
industries: Capital Markets, Banking, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Dedicated Region APAC Specialist, Network, OCI
description: Interested in taking your career to the next level driving the market success of a strategic priority for Oracle in Cloud?  Why this role Dedicated Region Cloud@Customer is Oracle’s strategic offering for a managed private cloud/distributed cloud i.e. OCI commercial region dedicated to a single customer deployed in their datacenter. To drive market success of this offering, we are investing in building a team of highly talented individuals in Asia Pacific.  What You'll Do You will support OCI-Dedicated Region opportunities from inception to close, working closely with the customer to assess current network connectivity, data center operations and develop technical blueprints to support Dedicated Region cloud adoption. Manage all aspects of opportunity lifecycle and orchestrate the alignment of key resources at the relevant stages of the lifecycle in a technical capacity. Support the identification and qualification of distributed cloud opportunities. For qualified opportunities, lead the solution architecture development including network connectivity and data center operation changes identification in support of migration from current to future state. In doing so you will support proposition development and articulation of Oracle Cloud innovation and Dedicated Region value to customers. You will pitch the overall proposition at not only the customer CXO level (CEO, COO etc) but also at operational and technical levels (Architect teams, Infrastructure, network and security teams etc). Your goal will be to ensure that cloud adoption is not a barrier to our customer’s and Oracle success in bringing the Dedicated Region Distributed Cloud to market. Defining a clear network architecture for our customers ensuring a seamless transition to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in the customers data center. Who You'll Work With  Primarily with our customers but working with extended teams internally is vital to the success of this role. You will work extensively with Oracles Insight (Business Value) team, TCE (Technical Cloud Engineering), Industry Architects, Cloud Pursuit & OCI Product management teams. Who You Are If you enjoy taking on challenges in leading cloud technologies, engineered platforms, data center migration, innovative cloud services and growing an untapped market while exploring unchartered territories, this role is for you. To be successful in this role, you will need a strong background in Datacenter transformation/Infrastructure outsourcing/cloud migrations in a pre-sales or an implementer role.  Strong understanding of OCI (Oracle Cloud Infrastructure) or other cloud hyperscalers is a must with a particular focus on both traditional (physical) and software defined networking in large scale environments. You have over 10 years’ of rich experience having worked on software-defined network/data center, managed/implemented large deals or pursuits & become a trusted advisor to customers. You have witnessed the data center evolution from converged infrastructure to hyper converged infrastructure to software defined datacenter. This experience will help pitch the value of OCI platform & software defined infrastructure when deployed in the customers’ datacenter. You have experience migrating traditional data center platforms to public clouds with a speciaisation in datacenter network architecture and software defined equivalents. A key skill will be to clearly develop technical blueprints for networks and related services to ensure a successful deployment of OCI- Dedicated region for large scale environments. You will have experience managing large deals & pitching to C-Level clients. your experience will help you lead & manage the OCI-Dedicated Region opportunity through the sales lifecycle that can span 2-4 quarters. Ideally you will be comfortable in articulating the benefits of the OCI-Dedicated region network architecture and value proposition to both senior executives across multiple industry sectors and technical stakeholders. Your experience in Digital transformation initiatives will help you convince customers of the value delivered by OCI- Dedicated Region as a platform for continued innovation. While desirable and not mandatory, you would have a clear understanding of this terminology having managed responses to multiple RFI/RFPs for large deals in region.  You exude a strong technical aptitude, high motivation to develop new business & a positive attitude that is contagious. You are passionate in pursuit of success & building positive relationships with customers and colleagues. You possess strong technical knowledge to manage objection for OCI- Dedicated region. You are articulate & have phenomenal communication/presentation skills. You thrive in a team environment & have a flair bringing large teams together for a shared purpose. You enjoy sharing ideas and best practices.  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

description: About Us  Real insights, directly from the brightest minds in business, curated to your aspirations.   Tigerhall is a social learning platform that enables professionals, teams and enterprises to reach their goals by learning directly from the most successful business leaders and subject matter experts in industry. Learn sales from the President of Adobe, leadership from the COO of Microsoft, strategy from the President of Mondelez, and much more. Our mission is to replace universities for good and ensure that everyone, regardless of their backgrounds and circumstances, have the opportunity to learn from the very best.   Tigerhall launched in March 2019 and has since raised over US$3M in funding from investors including Sequoia Capital, Taurus Ventures and the XA Network. With 30 tigers on the team we are currently present in Singapore, the US and India.   Job Description · Report to the CEO · Build out product roadmap with input from team, customers, users and management · Ideate new feature ideas and ways to consistently improve the product for users  · Conduct in-depth user interviews  · Plan and prioritize the work for the engineering team based on business needs and revenue impact  · Get input from all relevant stakeholders and align engineering and management with what product is looking to drive in the upcoming sprints  · Proactively communicate to the entire team when a release is scheduled to happen, going through features we're releasing and explains how it impacts the user · Actively support users and reach out to them to ensure they are successful and utilizes the product well · Analyse data that informs your prioritization and planning, reflecting on why certain features are performing and others are not, and uses the input from the data to influence his future decision making of the product roadmap and what to build  · Ensures the team is up to date on what the product can do, what's being released next, what features to look forward to, what sales can start picthing to clients, and how what we released is performing in the app  · Create well thought through product descriptions and flow charts based on UX research and best-in-class practices of mobile products  The Successful Applicant · Prior experience in mobile product management and knowledge of best-in-class user experience practices  · A creative eye and love for coming up with new product ideas and ways to improve the experience for the user · An authentic interest in users and their problems with a keen eye for use cases, ‘the unsaid’ in user interviews, and really going deep to understand their lifestyles and aspirations  · Highly collaborative with strong communication skills; being able to communicate with several teams and being the link between business and engineering  · Exceptional stakeholder management skills and ability to communicate priorities and limitations clearly  · Strong organization and project management skills, being able to drive the workflow between business, engineering and design to reach release deadlines  · Performance driven and results-oriented · Curious and always learning  · Crazy personality is a plus – no one in Tigerhall is vanilla (or llama as we call it)   What’s On Offer  Be the chief of a cool product loved by business professionals across the world. Lots of growth and development opportunities as the business continues to grow rapidly. Work closely with a team of top engineers and senior management. Be part of an open, collaborative and fun Team of Tigers.

Overview Reporting to MD/CEO Oversee the leadership and management of the Stag Match Tuition and Enrichment Centre - Singapore (offsite and onlinesite) Monitor Tuition and Enrichment services by external operator. description: CFB Bots is a technology service provider specializing in Hyperautomation. We partner with large enterprises in their Digital Transformation journey and help them and their employees thrive in the Future of Work. Our mission is to co-create the Digital Workforce of the Future, and our vision is to make work enjoyable. For more information, please visit www.cfb-bots.com.  About The Role  We are looking for an independent and self-motivated go-getter to join us as Head, Business Process Outsourcing. This is a new business unit (BU) within our organization, leveraging on digital technologies like Automation, Artificial Intelligence and Analytics to provide a truly exceptional and differentiated service to our customers.  You will be responsible for the set-up and operations of this BU. This includes identifying and creating new business revenue streams, developing and refining our business strategy, resource planning and allocation, developing and promoting our service offerings, managing the day-to-day operations and managing the P&L.  Specifically, Your Key Responsibilities Will Encompass The Following Work with our Management to formulate vision and execute strategies for the BU; Identify business opportunities and research on industry trends to create business roadmaps; Participate in the development and presentation of proposals for business development; Engage in sales and marketing activities to build pipeline and establish clientele base; Ensure the profitability of the BU’s operations; Generate an execution plan for ensuring the effective and efficient delivery of our business services while ensuring quality; Establish and maintain excellent and professional working relationships with the customers, including C- level executives; Understand customer businesses and develop service offerings that address their needs; Identify and develop partnerships that can drive the growth of the BU; Perform resource planning and allocation so that the business objectives can be met; and Grow and mentor the team Requirements Degree from a reputable university At least 5 to 6 years of experience in BPO, including at least 3 years in a management role Good understanding of Finance & Accounting and HR processes; sound knowledge of process management, business, regulatory and accounting complexities associated with outsourcing Excellent presentation and communications skills Possess a customer-centric mindset and enjoy fostering clientele relationship Self-driven and results-oriented individual with ability to function independently and excel in a dynamic environment

Lead generation: develop new business relationship and maintain existing ones (C-level / end market) Pitching & winning: drive pitching process and deal closing for case work - prepare pitching materials, serve as single point of contact, contract drafting, project staffing, etc Project management (future state): lead a team of consultants to advise client on their climate strategy - from carbon baselining and onsite audits, external benchmark studies, to goal setting and roadmap planning - be the key interface with client during case work, provide project oversight (synthesize recommendations, challenge work in progress, and re-orient analyses as necessary to drive client value), and manage project budgets Pull-though: collaborate with teams across the globe to leverage our expertise and facilitate pull through opportunities for all Schneider Electric lines of businesses (LoBs) Follow Through: Work closely with other SE LoBs and local operations to follow through deployment People development: Coach and inspire junior team members to develop their consulting and client communication skills, creating opportunities for team members to learn and grow Knowledge management: Contribute to Sustainability knowledge management by working closely with Knowledge Management team to identify knowledge gaps and develop new methodologies, tools and assets  What qualifications will make you successful? Bachelor Degree in Engineering / Business or equivalent 10+ years of experience in Sustainability consulting / management consulting and / or a client facing role in sustainability-related services Analytical and Conceptual thinking: able to conceptualize business problems, understand and shape customer's needs, and drive frameworks for analysis that consultants can then follow Client Relationship Management: A solid track record of developing strong client relationships with C-levels of large organizations Engagement Management and Team Leadership: Demonstrated ability to manage engagements, client relationships, provide strategic directions to teams, and ultimately be responsible for the quality of engagements. This individual will supervise junior consultants as engagements are executed, but must have the willingness to get his/her hands dirty and the ability to "do the work" as well Personnel Development: demonstrated ability to guide junior members in their consulting skill sets, motivate them, and build the consulting team's foundation for future growth (both formal and adhoc settings)  What's in it for me? Global family leave Comprehensive medical coverage for employee and dependents Blue sky Friday Worldwide Employee Stock Ownership On-site gym …and more! jobTitle: Cluster Director of Sales & Marketing - InterContinental Singapore Robertson Quay
description: About Us  At InterContinental® Hotels & Resorts our role is to put the glamour into international travel. That’s where you come in. When you’re part of the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand you’re more than just a job title.  At InterContinental Hotels & Resorts we look for people who are charming, confident, and internationally-minded; people who know what it takes to exceed guest expectations.  We’re Looking For Someone Who  Join our team as our Cluster Director of Sales & Marketing in InterContinental Singapore Robertson Quay. You’ll have ambition, talent and obviously, some key skills.  Your day to day  Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies for 3 Bespoke Hotels to ensure revenue and room night sales goals are achieved, sales and marketing strategies are set, tactical plans are created and implemented, and results are monitored and achieved.  Financial Returns Achieve budgeted revenues and personal/team sales goals and maximise profitability. Participate in the preparation of the annual departmental operating budget, the hotel marketing plan and business plan, and financial plans. Create and implement sales plans that drive measurable incremental occupancy, increase average rates, increase volume, food and beverage and banquet sales. Review monthly reports and sales forecasts to analyse current/potential market and sales trends, coordinate activities to increase revenue and market share and monitor performance to ensure actual sales meet or exceed established revenue plan. Create and develop special events and sales blitzes to showcase the hotel to potential clients. Attend trade shows and major market events locally and nationally to promote new business and increase sales and marketing opportunities for the hotel. People Direct day-to-day sales activities, plan and assign work, and establish performance and development goals for team members. Provide mentoring, coaching and regular feedback to help manage conflict, improve team member performance, and recognise good performance. Educate, train and motivate sales and marketing teams to achieve hotel revenue goals. Ensure staff has the information, market data, tools and equipment to successfully carry out job duties. Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts (example: guests, airliners, wholesalers, travel agencies, ad agencies, local community groups) in order to produce group and/or convention business, to include room sales, food and beverage sales, and catering/banquet services. Guest Experience Provide guests with information (example: loyalty programmes, area attractions, restaurants, facility information) to enhance guest experience. Schedule conventions and/or business group activities at the hotel and coordinate with other hotel-level departments to facilitate services agreed upon by the sales office and prospective clients. Communicate to appropriate departments all pertinent information requirements and special needs for arriving VIP’s, large groups, and other key guests. Lead marketing efforts to upsell guests on hotel services, offerings, and amenities. Responsible Business Identify operational problems that reduce the effectiveness of marketing activities and overall hotel sales performance and work with appropriate department on solutions. Develop awareness and reputation of the hotel and the brand in the local community, may serve as the hotel representative for media related inquiries. Work closely with key business leaders, officials, and representatives of local community groups within the city to ensure constant high profile exposure for the hotel. Effectively communicate and market aspects of the hotel that are sustainable or “green” and use information to gain new business opportunities. Work with advertising agencies, consulting firms, and vendors to maximise advertising investments and ensure ads represent brand identity. Perform other duties as assigned. May also serve as manager on duty. What we need from you Bachelor’s degree / higher education qualification / equivalent in Hotel Administration, Business Administration 3 years’ guest service/hotel experience with at least two years in a supervisory capacity, or an equivalent combination of education and experience Previous extended stay experience or experience in a hotel of similar size and complexity preferred Must speak fluent English. Other languages preferred What we offer  In return for your hard work, you can look forward to a highly competitive salary and benefits package – including: 5-days work week Duty Meal Birthday Off Learning and Development Opportunities Medical Benefit Dental/ Optical/ Health Screening Benefit Insurance Coverage Special Employee rate at all IHG Hotels worldwide What’s more, because your career will be as unique as you are, we’ll give you all the tailored support you need to make a great start, be involved and grow.  And because the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand belongs to the IHG® family of brands, you’ll also benefit from all of the opportunities that come from being part of a successful, global hospitality company with over 5900 hotels in over 100 countries around the world.  So whoever you are, whatever you love doing, bring your passion to the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand and IHG and we’ll make sure you’ll have room to be yourself. Find out more about joining us today by going to careers.ihg.com  Apply
industries: Hospitality

description: Virtuozzo is the leading provider of virtualization and cloud infrastructure software that enables service providers, ISVs and enterprises to deliver secure, robust, and hyper-converged virtualized platforms to launch applications and cloud services.   Our global team is committed to building a community where phenomenal people want to work long term by living our values of passion, focus, innovation, execution, collaboration, active learning and giving back, all with a commitment of being positive by choice in all we do. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.   The MSP/CSP Lead will enable selling Virtuozzo's Software and Services of to enable Hybrid Infrastructure deployments. This position is responsible for building a strong region in the assigned geography and achieving a revenue quota target, managing the sales forecasting process, and building a brand around our solutions within the assigned region.   This position consists of individual performance combined with MSP, CSP, and Cloud overlay sales specialist performance that will coordinate and work closely with Virtuozzo's core Sales and Pre-Sales Engineering to achieve success and lead interactions with our existing customers while accelerating new customer adoption.   Deep knowledge of the managed services marketplace, hybrid cloud, IT sales cycles, and the broad.   The responsible region of this position is Asia Pacific.    Responsibilities:   Develop and Execute the strategy for Virtuozzo solutions adoption in the Managed Service Provider and Cloud Service Provider market segments Lead Managed Service Provider and Cloud Service Provider business in APAC Open new strategic markets for Virtuozzo across APAC, with focus on strategic geographies - SEA and ANZ, and drive acquisition of top MSP and CSP prospects across APAC Transform Top 10 APAC Virtuozzo existing managed service provider accounts from transactional business into a strategic multi-year committed relationship with maximum adoption of Virtuozzo product portfolio, and potential replacement of 3rd party competing technologies. Advance adoption of the Virtuozzo Hybrid Cloud strategic initiative in APAC Extend the Virtuozzo portfolio within existing and new account with the entire solution portfolio as it fits customer's strategy: Virtuozzo Storage, Virtuozzo Workspace as a Service, Virtuozzo Hybrid Infrastructure, Virtuozzo Professional Services, Virtuozzo Premium Support. Drive APAC strategic accounts planning both for existing top customers and for new opportunities Analyze trends and explore new opportunities in the MSP and CSP industries, work with Virtuozzo Product Management and Marketing on perfecting existing solutions and building new solutions Ensure revenue growth in designated accounts and prospects in line with your targets Be a trusted advisor for decision-makers in Virtuozzo customers. Build strategic and meaningful executive relationships Assure measurable customer satisfaction growth (NPS and any other metric) Be a customer advocate inside Virtuozzo, assuring right prioritization and visibility of the opportunities in issues with relevant stakeholders in the company Help publish, productize and market jointly with Virtuozzo Marketing success stories and use cases produced by your customers.  Requirements:  Bachelor/ master's degree in business, computer science, communications or equivalent job experience or equivalent combination of education & experience 10+ years of experience with virtualization technology and Cloud business Experience managing complicated supply chain involving managed services component Proven record of developing and landing vertical-based strategy and GTM for Virtualization products Understanding of the Managed and Cloud Service provider business Ability to work with data-driven sales analytics Ability to work under pressure Multi-tasking ability and the ability to set and reset priorities. Excellent communication and presentation skills (verbal and written) Customer first attitude Willing and able to travel abroad regularly   Knowledge and actual experience in any of the following is a plus:   Experience in virtualization (VMware, Xen, Hyper V, KVM or Virtuozzo products) is a plus Experience with Cloud Management Platforms, Cloud orchestration solutions Experience managing a complex supply chain, with deep understanding of roles, scope and responsibilities Experience of Linux and Windows Platforms and an understanding of Networking   Language skills:   Fluent English is the must, any other Asian language ability is a big plus.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: What’s up? We’re VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH  Well, now we’re looking for someone who lives and breathes social media even more than us. Do you know all of the latest trends? Memes? And TikToks? Maybe you’ve dabbled in the world of influencers? Believe in the power of social media and community management to change hearts, minds, and drive sales? Love the hustle of fast-paced, hyper-growth agency life? Thrive in a role where you can bring ideas to life on billions of screens? Cool. Then let’s talk.  This exciting opportunity of a full-time role based in Singapore will allow you to lead a team of strategists and collaborate with a bunch of strat experts across apac. You will lead and drive our strategy expertise and be the “strategic brain” who will guide us for all things APAC.  Are you based in Singapore? Geeking the social media world in APAC digital space for eight plus years now? Are you inspiring with a can-do attitude? Do you wanna deep dive into the world of media and creative advertising agency? If yes, we could be meant to be -----so keep reading!  Here’s where you come in.  Our growing strategy team is looking forward to collaborating with a “people first” Strategy Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Strategy and Insights.  You’re a problem solver at heart and insanely curious about people, culture and technology. Most of all, you like to get your hands dirty, are obsessed with researching & finding interesting things that are hidden from sight (even in the seemingly most mundane of places) and adept at translating your findings into compelling creative briefs, enjoy partnering with teams to see your work through from research to execution, and communicate your work with passion and conviction. We like to work with “big thinkers yet hands-on in execution”.  As a team, we’re collaborative and come from diverse backgrounds. We value creativity in research, and an outside-in perspective when it comes to inspiration, strategic frameworks and problem-solving. Technology has fundamentally changed the way we interact with others and the world around us, and we geek out about understanding behaviors in context, instead of probing humans in a petri dish.  You would be leading a team of talented strategists, social listening analysts, and community experts. As such, there are many hats you’d have to wear from day 1. You would need to conduct research, write briefs, guide work, pitch to clients - really anything and everything it takes to get the job done and deliver fantastic, big, bold, beautiful work.  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  Your Experience And The “Nice To Have” 7 plus years experience building integrated programs at a top agency working for Fortune 500 clients -- must have experience understanding the intersection of business strategy, consumer insights, and digital behavior and developing big, purposeful ideas. Experience doing traditional, web, social, syndicated and primary research (incl.: NetBase, MRI, Sysomos, Brandwatch, eMarketer, Mintel, Google Analytics, Omniture; conducting IDIs, digital ethnographies, etc.) Dazzling presentation skills and presence in a room Ability to express complicated concepts in simple and digestible ways (“Explain it to a fifth grader”) Curious and lovely to get along with. Deliver work independently on all tasks and achieve results at pace with energy and drive. Lead collaboration sessions with other teams. Execute a strong sense of priority level and urgency; and knows how to act on the critical difference between the two. Manage the ongoing performance of different tasks or projects, as well as understanding and ownership of internal processes for quality assurance. Administer agreed goals or projects by dealing to challenges in a responsive and constructive way. Strive for zero mistakes or flagged internal process issues on work output. Foster positive internal communication and collaboration with all internal teams. Ensure presented ideas are clear and understood. Highlight new ideas to the team and external stakeholders when appropriate. Provide clear, professional, timely and helpful information to the team or external clients and partners. Thrives in a company of good people Think logically even under pressure and come up with innovative solutions to problems. Lastly, a genuine belief in bringing your full self to what you do everyday, see “work” as a calling and a passion. What You Should Know About VaynerMedia  Think “lab” and not “agency”. We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We’re willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It’s fun!  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  P.S Portfolio would be nice :)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

What You Get To Do All aspects of global client management including: implementation, day-to-day client service, relationship building, and renewal management. Provide strategic analysis, development, and consulting expertise for clients’ international benefit programs Educate clients on benefit plan management and compliance with country and local laws Consult on multinational pools, captives, global underwriting, and other global financial platforms Advise on global traveler/medical/expatriate programs Manage global client projects to ensure successful outcomes Effectively communicate and work across client organizations (local HR staff, headquarter HR, CEO, CFO) Mentoring and helping junior level staff develop Participate in new client relationship development including the sales process (RFP responses, finalist interviews, etc.) Deliver on our brand of uncompromising client service Qualifications Global client service experience - minimum 5 years Preferred local country employee benefits and global travel plan knowledge Exceptional and strong project management skills with the ability to multitask BS/BA degree required or equivalent Comfortable with public speaking engagements and presentation skills Ability to understand client needs and deliver results under tight deadlines Solutions-oriented team player who takes initiative and is accountable for results Detail and process-oriented thinker with strong analytical skills Excellent communication, organization, and interpersonal skills Ability to self-manage and work remotely with team members and clients Comfortable with unpredictable work schedule (working across time zones) Sequoia’s Culture – Our most important asset Integrity Passion for service Innovative Growth oriented Caring for others Promise-centric Focused on relationship building Compensation & Benefits  Sequoia provides competitive compensation including base salary, performance-based bonus programs, and comprehensive benefits package.

jobTitle: Head of Scaled Customer Onboarding - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Head of Scaled Customer Onboarding - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Additional Role Description  The Customer Onboarding Team is a team within the Acquisition organization that serves newly acquired customers for a period of time to set up new campaigns and drive advertiser digital readiness to success long term.  As the Head of Scaled Customer Onboarding, you will lead Google's APAC scaled business operated by our vendor teams supporting various markets within APAC and segments. In this role, you will lead an internal team of reports remotely across the region.  Responsibilities Be responsible for the overall Scaled Customer Onboarding business matrix in the region working closely with each country and directly with vendor partners. Work with relevant Google teams and vendor partners to build new process to drive coherence across programs. Lead/coach a team of Vendor Managers to drive vendor performance in each site, driving business metrics through coaching on business/product/account management skills, developing trainings, shadowing calls, and operational efficiency. Run weekly reviews, anticipate risks, work on mitigation plans, do quarterly business reviews and reviews along with vendor partners and Google leadership. Partner with internal teams on process improvements, reporting needs, quarterly goal setting, feature rollouts, product adoption, and other initiatives to improve onboarding operations. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. People management experience, managing a team and achieving goals and working with distributed team members. Experience working with vendors (e.g. on market level); outbound sales and/or proactive outreach experience. Preferred Qualifications Project/change management experience. Commitment to continuous improvement, motivated 'can-do' attitude and results-oriented Independent, flexible, with ability to take initiative and operate effectively in a fast paced, constantly evolving team environment. Ability to commit to continuous improvement, motivated, and results-oriented. Strong ability to work with ambiguity. Ability to draft new processes and procedures.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: For the role of E-Commerce Operations Manager (Salary range $4000 - $5000 depending on experience level) with an advancement path towards Country Manager/COO. Should your qualifications fit our requirements, you will be a key person involved with Le Petit Society's various functions. On a day to day basis you will manage a team of operation associates at the fulfilment centre and customer service staff in stores and ensure the smooth and efficient running of our fulfilment centre operations from picking and packing; last mile delivery to overseeing customer requests and customer return processes. On a weekly and monthly basis, you will be responsible for generating reports on sell-through, updating suppliers on monthly sales and ensuring inventory levels are accurate across the warehouse and physical stores. You will play a role in making sure all company sales channels (e-commerce, physical stores etc) are well stocked to maximise sales in collaboration with the sales and marketing team. On a quarterly basis, you are expected to implement work process improvement initiatives across the company to increase the level of productivity and systematically reduce fixed and variable costs over time. This would also involve rolling out technology upgrades to existing backend systems and training and onboarding of new staff to operate efficiently. You will report directly to the Chief Operating Officer (COO) and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and thus be working closely with company leadership to spearhead change and formalise efficient workflow processes across the organisation. The right candidate will have: Demonstrated ability to handle multiple initiatives and ability to constantly follow through and see to completion multiple projects concurrently. A self-starter and ability to perform above and beyond what is necessary to get the job done in the most efficient way possible. Thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment; Highly organised and able to handle budgets, ability to take ownership and negotiate with business enablers such as suppliers, logistics partners and sensitive to the various costs to the business and make suggestions based on actual data to increase company profitability; Have strong emotional intelligence and able to communicate clearly to to internal staff within the operations and integrate well with other internal teams. Able to recognise business risk areas and offer solutions to reduce business impact in the worst case scenarios; Accountability and taking complete ownership is your guiding principles and you always seek to excel in your job. Main responsibilities: Mentor, manage and develop existing operations team. Recognise gaps in the operations/customer service team and work closely with COO to hire the right people to fill the gaps to build a robust and highly efficient operations and customer service team. Begin with a hands on approach and formalise efficient work processes as team expands. Develop and formalise KPIs for fulfilment performance; Document standard operating procedures (SOPs) and implement them for company fulfilment operations from receiving products from suppliers to transfers between stores and warehouses, pick and pack operations, last mile delivery and handling customer requests and customer returns. Manage and drive the implementation of sales strategies in consultation with CEO and COO through other third party e-commerce channels such as Lazada, Amazon etc to increase sales of Le Petit Society branded products to complement company owned channels. Be highly sensitive to all operational costs and report to the CFO to update inventory levels and to help identify inefficiencies and areas to cut unnecessary costs without sacrificing efficiency. Seek further to implement sustainable options in line with company's corporate social responsibility and values. Requirements 4-7 years of relevant professional experience, preferably with focus on managing a high performance team, e-commerce logistics, managing relationships with 3PLs and suppliers. Showed a good track record of managing and building a strong and motivated team. Familiar and have experience with various types of e-commerce backends and managing API implementation with third party providers whilst dealing with external developers. Strong analytical and meticulous mind. Quantitative skills with advanced knowledge of systems whether it be e-commerce backend customer management systems or warehouse management software systems and advanced proficiency in Excel; Worked in a high growth and dynamic environment at the forefront of e-commerce, omni-channel fashion retail experience is a plus. Benefits Full corporate premium medical insurance Staff discounts for Le Petit Society branded products Flat hierarchical culture and non-traditional working environment
industries: Apparel & Fashion

description: Teads is looking for an Industry Director,CPG to join our growing Strategic Accounts team in Singapore.  You will be responsible for forging partnerships and driving incremental revenue growth on key accounts across local markets.  This role offers the opportunity to join an industry pioneer and leader in full funnel advertising solutions, and one that is experiencing rapid Global growth. The Industry Director will be tasked with developing existing and new relationships and partnerships with the largest clients.  The CPG vertical is a critical growth lever and the Industry manager will be tasked with developing existing and new relationships and partnerships with the largest CPG clients.  Our advertising solutions are bought by many of the world’s largest advertisers including P&G, Unilever, Nestle, Danone, Samsung, Apple, LVMH, and many others.  The Industry Director will also work closely with the Agency Sales team to manage senior level agency relationships.  The Industry Director will work closely with the VP Global Industry Director CPG as well as with local Industry Directors in key markets to manage and step change growth and senior level client relationships.  Reporting into the VP, SEA, this person will be a key part of the senior team developing the #advertiserfirst strategy across Singapore.  ==== Key Responsibilities ===== Develop opportunities, build, and grow strategic relationships with major customers and agencies in the CPG vertical. Serve as an industry expert in order to drive vertical and client success by developing thought leadership within the CPG vertical. Drive local revenue growth by partnering with our frontline sales team. Oversee the campaign performance, budget spent, and the revenue recognition Seek, identify and initiate new consultative sales presentations using industry knowledge, market trends, and Teads's video solutions. Drive external and internal market knowledge and insights. Proactive engagement with industry committees and conferences. ==== In addition you will ==== Serve as an industry expert in order to drive vertical and client success by developing thought leadership within your vertical(s) Create and deliver consultative sales presentations using industry knowledge, market trends, and Teads’ full funnel solutions Drive external and internal market knowledge and insights Proactive engagement with industry committees and conference ==== Requirements ===== Extensive advertising experience, marketing, media sales or project management in the CPG vertical. Strong understanding of the CPG industry Ability to build relationships with top marketing/media decision makers Proven experience in collaborative to build long term sustainable partnership growth Excellent communication and presentation skills Knowledge of video space preferred ( including TV buying), and ideally smart use of data Proven leadership ability to influence, develop, and empower colleagues to achieve objectives with a team approach Ability to convert business from other media channels ==== Personal Attributes ==== Passionate – high energy and enthusiasm. A self-starter – creative, resourceful and adaptable, able to find solutions to problems Hands-on approach – will have good examples of personally leading critical negotiations. Digital media expert – able to act as a trusted strategic advisor to advertiser clients on digital media. Strong negotiator Ambitious and hungry – excited and motivated to identify and close deals. Excellent communication skills: listening, verbal and written. ===== ABOUT TEADS ======  Teads, The Global Media Platform, is the single access point for advertisers to connect to the world’s best publishers and reach an audience of over 1.9 billion people every month.  Teads’ made-for-mobile ad experiences deliver the best combination of mass reach and brand safety in the market. Teads’ end-to-end platform provides a sustainable advertising ecosystem that respectfully connects brands to consumers. Teads demand-side, sell-side and creative technology delivers effective and engaging advertising experiences for consumers, guaranteed outcomes for brands, and ultimately powers publishers with better monetization solutions to fund quality journalism.  Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 850 people in 29 countries.  We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: The Head of Network - Singapore will be responsible for developing and implementing negotiation and provider collaboration strategies, and working directly with Singapore (including Malaysia and Indonesia) providers in order to deliver best in class service to Cigna’s providers, customers and clients and act as the Subject Matter Expert regarding the local market’s environment, healthcare delivery practices and pricing. This positions reports to the Head of APAC Network.  Key Responsibilities Leads network functions for providers located in Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia; including strategy, negotiations, expansions, and provider relations. Accountable for driving affordability agenda and network targets. Performs service area analysis and cost analysis to identify network expansion, development and network renegotiation opportunities. Manage team of Negotiators and Provider Relations for Singapore ensuring that the access to care and affordability targets are met. Identifies growth opportunities for expanding the network of providers in the regions and/ or countries you are responsible for. Promotes process improvement initiatives by identifying and successfully positioning service improvement opportunities and strategies within the APAC Network Management department, other CIGNA departments and Alliance partner organizations. Identifies cost containment opportunities and (re)negotiate favorable conditions with Health care providers. Including but not limited to payment integrity improvement opportunities and FWA activities in the region. Manages the relationship with existing and new and Third Party Vendors. Monitor the quality of the services provided by the medical providers and the correct execution of the agreements. Manages the broad healthcare delivery systems specialties, including ancillary, telehealth, and other network/vendor related service providers. Acts as the expert for the providers with regards to the agreements, fees and pricing in the region for which you are responsible. Acts as an expert with regards to the medical landscape in the countries within your region and continuously monitor evolutions in that respect. Key Challenges / Anticipated Changes in Environment. Effectively communicates and interacts with other business units to achieve goals; e.g. Medical Management, CIGNA Service Operations (NA, UK and Antwerp), Sales and Client Management (NA, UK, and Antwerp), and CIGNA Strategy & Operations. Qualifications University degree, Master Degree preferred. 7+ years of relevant experience. Must have deep understanding and experience (and relationship) of local providers, health systems, and key players in the market. Excellent interpersonal, communication and motivational skills, including negotiation and presentation skills. Strong influencing skills and ability to work in a complex, highly matrixed, environment, including balancing priorities of multiple organizations to deliver end results. Strong people management and development skills. Effective problem resolution skills. Analytical and critical thinking. Data mining competency. Proficiency with MS Office programs including: Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Project, and Visio required. Personal Competencies Required Strategic and critical-thinking skills. Strong conflict resolution and people management skills. Ability to take charge and make sound business decisions. Ability to organize and manage complex initiatives. Results-oriented, out-of-the-box, problem solver. Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. English and other Southeast Asian languages a plus. Mature, with the ability to effectively communicate and influence individuals at all levels. Comfortable working in a fast paced environment with shifting priorities. Energetic and enthusiastic. A team player. Ability to flex up to strategic level and down to running everyday business tasks. Willing to travel regularly (up to 15%). About Cigna  Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. When you work with us, or one of our subsidiaries, you’ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people’s lives. What difference will you make?
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: About Vantage Data Centers  Vantage is committed to being a workplace of inclusion, equity, respect and acceptance. We celebrate diversity and intentionally seek out opportunities to learn from one another’s experience.  Vantage Data Centers powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world’s well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across North America, Europe and Asia Pacific, Vantage has evolved data center design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands.  DEVELOPMENT & ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT  The Development & Engineering (D&E) team drives the technology, innovation and new development of data center infrastructure across Vantage’s companywide portfolio. D&E evaluates new sites, drives cost and schedule in line with corporate goals and serve as subject matter experts across the entire project lifecycle from concept through commissioning. The team collaborates with Sales, Operations and management along the way. D&E also work hand in hand with the Construction team to come up with a vertically integrated design and ensures new and existing standards and designs are executed effectively.
