One thing that distinguishes Vantage is that our technical staff is given the responsibility and authority to directly drive tangible results. Our team can align long-term operational sustainability with value engineering and cost metrics to deliver products aligned with corporate goals unlike external resources. This approach empowers each member of the team to drive high-impact decisions and results.  Position Overview  Vantage Data Centers is looking for a proven leader to join the team as Senior Director of New Site Development. In this role, you will provide overall leadership for data center expansion into new and existing APAC markets through the following means: greenfield, brownfield, retrofit or expansion of existing facilities, and M&A opportunities. As a leader, you will be responsible for building/managing multiple teams of both internal and external resources to ensure all sites across expansion markets are in alignment with strategic and corporate objectives. You and your team will focus on the preliminary vetting of sites through to the planning and development stage, with an emphasis on creation of initial budgets, all required project approvals, preliminary design, and schedules to get each project to a shovel ready state. As a final step, you will transition the project to the construction team to implement. Constant communication with sales, marketing, engineering, and other internal subject matter experts is paramount to maintain and enhance Vantage Data Centers product offering.  Essential Job Functions Lead team in development and management of due diligence of sites, inclusive of zoning, city discussions, power utilities, test fits, etc. Build relationships in ecosystems related to planning, site development, local/national utilities and regulatory bodies to leverage them as sites become identified. Lead assessment of new greenfield and/or brownfield sites in strategic markets as well as evaluation of M&A assets from due diligence to site assessment and formalize package for Vantage Investment Committee approval Lead all aspects of shovel ready efforts after closing on assets for design, project approvals, definition of scope, and development of bridging documents for construction DUTIES Lead creation of pro-forma budgets to be used at executive level as the project progresses from site selection through buildout Oversee and manage team efforts for planning and development in the following areas: Due diligence, site assessment, M&A facility audits Planning and coordination with major utilities Entitlements with regulatory agencies at all levels of government as required Create initial project schedules and early release logs Communication with adjacent property owners and neighborhood groups as required Master planning, permitting, design development and construction documents Partner with counterparts to apply compliance and consistency to process for identification and analysis of land acquisitions in existing and new markets Manage team to produce reports and status updates of development projects (risks, schedule, quality and budget) across all development locations Independently supervise development phase of projects, including management of personnel Develop staffing plans to support site selection and development efforts Develop key handoff metrics and development approval gates Manage scope, schedule, and budget decisions through handoff to construction Work with sales and marketing to provide technical support wherever needed Job Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management or equivalent 8+ years of experience in a management role required, 12+ years preferred 10+ years of experience in planning and construction; 5+ within data center industry required In-depth knowledge of datacenter infrastructure and design is highly preferred If no data center experience, complex commercial development experience is required Occasional extended work hours required with ability and willingness to respond to emails after hours in the event of an emergency Strong quantitative skills to create budgets and establish project cost controls Ability to use independent judgement and decision-making to positively impact project schedule Proficiency in MS Office (particularly Excel, Word, Project, Power Point), Google Docs, and Blue Beam. Excellent presentation and communication skills to interface with executive management, internal stakeholders, external resources, and customers Travel to Vantage’s new and existing markets as required to perform above duties We operate with No Ego and No Arrogance. We work to build each other up and support one another, appreciating each other’s strengths and respecting each other’s weaknesses. We find joy in our work and each other, actively seeking opportunities to inject fun into what we do. Our hard and efficient work is rewarded with an above market total compensation package. We offer a comprehensive suite of health and welfare, retirement, and paid leave benefits exceeding local expectations.  Safety and security always matter. During COVID, all positions that can work remotely have been, and appropriate steps have been taken to ensure the safety of employees in any position essential to be on site. Regardless of where you are working, technology to work effectively is provided on or in advance of your first day of employment.  Throughout the year, the advantage of being part of the Vantage team is evident with an array of benefits, recognition, training and development, and the knowledge that your contribution adds value to the company and our community.  Don't meet all the requirements? Please still apply if you think you are the right person for the position. We are always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.  Vantage Data Centers is an Equal Opportunity Employer
industries: Construction, Information Technology and Services, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Director – Client Services & Growth, Specialty Broking – Energy & Mining
description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting a Director - Client Services & Growth, Energy & Mining to join our Specialty Broking team in Singapore.  About Aon  Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.  The Opportunity  Play a key role in assisting the Energy & Mining (E&M) leadership to develop, analyze, agree and implement client service strategies & lead and implement the sales growth strategies across E&M Specialty in Asia (focused on Downstream Energy & Mining) to ensure a clear path to retention and aggressive growth in line with agreed regional Specialty Boking strategy.  Responsibilities: Services and / or support to a portfolio of corporate retail clients in the E&M sector (both operational and construction risks) and all associated day-to-day account management; Responsibility for and / or contributing to ongoing client satisfaction, retention and profitability and the measurement / reporting of these results; Providing advice to clients / prospects and regional colleagues on placement design, available coverage and capacity, likely pricing, potential coverage enhancements within scope of responsibility; Establishing and monitoring pipelines and sales budget; profitable growth of E&M portfolio via new and / or retained and / or expanded business relative to the E&M Specialty in Asia through the provision of technical advisory, tender responses/strategy, placement support when required and/or risk and insurance consulting services; Collaborating with Specialty Broking leadership, Aon network offices and Asia sales and client teams per overall business goals & objectives to deliver our value proposition at all times in an Aon United manner; Developing, maintaining and managing senior relationships with key E&M clients, prospects and markets; Advocating and delivering thought leadership, best practice, and industry technical expertise to clients, prospects and colleagues; Produce quarterly market update for Downstream E&M for internal and external use; Identifying and keeping up to date with sector and market trends relative to E&M clients and prospects; Knowledge sharing, mentoring and training colleagues; Supporting and/or handling claims administration, management and advocacy; Future management of direct reports; You shall comply with the requirements of any regulatory body relevant to your duties, including, but not limited to, Continuing Professional Development and the "Guidelines on Fit and Proper Criteria" prescribed from time to time by the Monetary Authority of Singapore; Requirements Minimum requirement (BCP, PGI, CommGI) for registration with MAS or such similar qualification acceptable to MAS preferred Previous experience in the energy insurance sector and client account management (min 10 years), preferably Downstream Energy Property/Business Interruption Placements preferred Demonstrated sales track record, including executive business decision-maker contacts, C-level sales, advanced negotiation, deal structuring, and sales contract experience preferred Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues, management, and external stakeholders Self-disciplined, organized, with attention to detail and ability to prioritise Good skills on MS systems including Word, Excel, PowerPoint required How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.  2489401
industries: Insurance and Financial Services

description: Purpose  Responsible for all fundraising efforts across the organization and work closely with the Senior Management and Donor Relations team.  Job Responsibilities  Fundraising Strategies & Execution: Lead, develop and execute strategies for all SNM’s fundraising areas which includes but not limited to annual fundraising, major gifts fundraising, planned donations, special events, foundation grants, corporate sponsorships, and campaigns. Design and implement a comprehensive fundraising plan for annual campaign needs. Create innovative strategies for securing new and untapped resources. Collaborate with the Community Engagement team for planning, organization and execution of special events. Seek, develop and track grant proposals. Internal Management Strengthen the culture of philanthropy across the organization, demonstrating how employees can become advocates for SNM in the community. Promote a culture of continuous improvement, ensuring the highest level of internal and external customer service. Work with Senior Management, the Board of Directors, and other stakeholders to proactively enhance, expand, and execute development efforts, building current and new relationships. Serve as liaison to the Board of Directors and its sub-committees in all development-related areas (attend all board & sub-committee meetings, serve as the Secretariat for the Fund-Raising sub-committee). Serve as a close strategic advisor and partner to the CEO & President. Coach, mentor, develop and manage Donor Relations team members. Create and manage clear success metrics, holding others accountable for achieving those goals. Donor Relations & Engagement Provide outstanding customer service and support to donors, volunteers, staff, and other community contacts. Build and cultivate critical relationships with key local organizations and partners. Maintain in-depth knowledge of SNM program offerings and services to articulate its needs and impact to donors. Integrate development and marketing/communications strategies to maximize SNM’s brand exposure and fundraising opportunities. Oversee the design and production of donor recognition, appreciation communications, and solicitations/support materials. Job Requirements Minimum Bachelor’s Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Business Administration/Mass Communication, Marketing, or other related fields. Certificate in Fund Raising Management will be an asset. At least 7 years of professional experience in non-profit fundraising. Possess track record in fundraising, marketing, or sales. Skilled at connecting with people across the community; possesses a high level of emotional intelligence. Knowledge of service sector standards and practices. Possess excellent written, oral presentation skills and proficient in MS Office. Able to work in the evenings and weekends as required
industries: Nonprofit Organization Management, Health, Wellness and Fitness, and Hospital & Health Care

jobTitle: Asia Pacific Head of Distribution, Digital and Marketing Technology
description: Overview Of Role  As the APAC Head of Distribution, Digital and Marketing Technology you will be part of the Senior IT Management team at Schroders and report regionally into the Asia Pacific Head of Technology and Change and globally into the Global Head of Digital, Distribution and Marketing Technology. In addition, you will have matrix reporting into the heads of Distribution/Marketing and Digital technology in London. You will be responsible for the leadership and day-to-day management of the Asia Pacific Digital, Distribution and Marketing technology team and on a day-to-day basis will be partnering with Asia Pacific Distribution and Marketing management teams.  Whilst the role sits in the global technology division, a strong commercial and business acumen is needed as is the ability to work directly with our Distribution & Marketing business development teams to create a regionally focused digital strategy and underlying platform that provides the desired customer experience and client services capability and supports the business in harnessing opportunities brought about by digital technology.  Schroders aims to be a leading asset manager in the use of digital and you will be operating in markets where the innovative use of technology, appropriately applied to business channels, is vital. The role requires partnering with Asia Pacific marketing team to support them in developing web, social media and precision marketing strategies targeted at improving Schroders’ sales impact, creating efficient online service models and boosting our online brand.  Key Responsibilities  General Day to day line management of the Asia Pacific Digital, Distribution & Marketing technology team. Support Distribution and Marketing to establish new Digital routes to market. Distribution responsibilities include Sales/CRM, Client Insights Unit & Client Service. Marketing includes Events Platform, Pardot & Preference Centre/Client Personalization. Day to day line management of the Conversational experience tools such are Schroder Go (client facing Chabot) and associated pipeline of changes. Ensure effective communications across Digital, Distribution, and Marketing IT staff throughout Asia Pacific and into the Global IT operating model. Provide input and direction to Digital, Distribution, and Marketing global IT strategy Work closely with the business owners to ensure the Asia Pacific requirements for the respective regional business functions are fully represented and integrated into global or regional products. Support innovation practice to seamlessly bring digital transformation initiatives into delivery and achieve outcomes set by the business. Collate all relevant business requirements, business outcomes and articulate rationale for regional spend against global business domain budgets such as Distribution and Marketing. Resourcing Facilitate IT technology resourcing on all active programmes, projects and initiatives driven globally, within region or being handled locally to address business demands. Management and liaison with Asia Pacific technology vendors and or business service providers as required to fulfil the delivery and operational duties of the role. Programmes and Project Work Own regionally-lead initiatives and drive delivery of IT change from inception to implementation. Facilitate global project delivery through local team. Manage key regional business stakeholders, support client engagements and co create a Digital client centric approach to business development. Have a comprehensive of project SDLC processes, particularly Agile, standards & best practices. Understand the Global, Regional, and local technology ecosystem that (potentially) impacts the wider Digital Distribution and Marketing operating model. Point of escalation as required to ensure the business needs of Asia Pacific stakeholders are represented. Provide regular management department / delivery stream updates (business and IT) on progress. Design / Technical Skills Track record/experience of using Content Management System/Marketing Automation and CRM platforms (performing platform configuration changes) Mobile application delivery An engineering and architecture background in web technologies, techniques, and solutions Understands how modern digital technology & data science can be applied to create business value. Software As a Service based Apps: Subscription based Apps that can be used directly by clients on their own computers or phones. IT Risk Management Promote awareness and understanding of and adherence to GTC governance/standards, including Information Security engagement, policies, and controls across the co-created citizen-based development model. Ensure that all APAC Digital products, whether developed in business, with internal technology resources, external parties or a hybrid thereof follow the GT lifecycles of IS engagement, Architecture Review and IT Service Integration by working with the product owners of said products and guiding them through the GT stage-gates. The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications You Need At least 7-10 years of digital strategy, enablement, innovation, and client insight experience Excellent stakeholder management to support internal (including at a senior executive level) and external (including at founder/CEO level) relationships. Strong understanding of digital strategy and technical concepts. Excellent ability to quickly understand business strategy and operating context of functions across asset and wealth management. Understanding of the investment management industry and intermediary client relationships Ability to produce and communicate effective and insightful thought leadership Excellent command of the English language, both written and spoken Knowledge and experience of identifying appropriate technology solutions, understanding the difference between in-house-developed bespoke applications and commercially available off-the-shelf solutions. The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications Preferred Experience in working with start-ups, either within a corporate or start up setting. Ideally has an existing network within the innovation ecosystem. Fluency in Mandarin desirable as this role will require a high level of interaction with Chinese firms and our growing Chinese business interests that will be serviced out of APAC. What You Will Be Like Self-directed and comfortable operating with a degree of ambiguity Capable of remaining positive when under pressure. Highly collaborative and consultative approach Personable, enjoys working with people from a variety of backgrounds Mindful of differences across geographies / cultures and the need to adapt business approach and strategy accordingly. Strategic mindset and ability to distil and collate information from various sources to a cohesive output. Comfortable facilitating and communicating using both business and technology terms. Shows initiative and thrives in a fast-paced and time
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About Tigerhall  Tigerhall is a social learning platform that enables professionals, teams and enterprises to reach their goals by learning directly from the most successful business leaders and subject matter experts in the industry. Learn sales from the President of Adobe, leadership from the COO of Microsoft, strategy from the President of Mondelez, and much more. Our mission is to replace universities for good and ensure that everyone, regardless of their backgrounds and circumstances, has the opportunity to learn from the very best.  With Fortune 500 firms as corporate customers and backing from one of the most prominent venture capital funds in the world, we’re growing fast and are looking for a stellar Customer Success Manager to drive success amongst customers. You will champion the execution of the Tigerhall learning solution for our customers, and own the enterprise customer relationship for full-cycle success from onboarding, success planning, value demonstration, retention to upsells.  Your Role Be the trusted advisor our customers seek advice from to improve their learning experience and develop repeatable implementation and onboarding strategies for our customers. Manage the corporate customer journey and experience from onboarding through roll-out, activation and engagement. Ensure a smooth onboarding process of the employees onto the platform. Manage educational activation campaigns to ensure that every employee gets the most out of their Tigerhall experience. Drive engagement campaigns across customer organizations to ensure high ROI and retention of customers. Manage and coordinate customized customer projects, including exclusive livestreams, closed-door workshops, and private dinners. Work and collaborate closely with the Sales, Product, Marketing and cross-functional teams. Identify avenues to upsell additional services and ensure Tigerhall is extended to more teams, offices and markets within the customer organization. Key Success Indicators Retention of corporate customers App engagement on corporate customer accounts Account Expansion: Upsell of additional services and bringing Tigerhall to more teams, offices and markets within the customer organization Customer satisfaction rate (Net Promoter Score) About You 3+ years of experience in Customer Success roles, with medium and enterprise account, preferably in the SaaS industry A love for making sure customers have an amazing experience with you Project management runs in your blood, so you can focus your mind on the rest You are driven by being an expert on the product for your clients Data-driven, knowledge of reporting is a plus but not mandatory Strong consultative abilities and experience in consultative sales Social skills, ability to interact with a wide variety of people at different levels of seniority, and a laser focus on the customer experience Strong commercial acumen with the ability to identify opportunities for upselling Performance driven and results-oriented Curious and always learning Crazy personality is a plus – no one in Tigerhall is vanilla Location: Singapore(HQ) Reporting to: Head of Customer Success
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Public Relations and Communications

description: Head Of Customer Experience  Toku’s mission is to help companies engage with their customers efficiently. We have helped companies move all the voice communications to the cloud and recently embarked on creating products that help companies keep engaging with their customers no matter where their employees are working from.  Toku is currently getting into a scale-up mode. We want to continue creating momentum for our products in the APAC regions and helping customers with their communications needs. As we build the Customer Experience foundation, we are looking for an experienced Head of Customer Experience who can help with tasks related to concurrency, performance optimization and real time processing. Want to be part of our journey?  This role is open to those already based in Singapore or Metro Manila.  What would you be doing?  You would be reporting to the Chief Operating Officer. Being an experienced Customer Experience leader to onboard, enable, and provide delightful post-sale services to Toku’s growing customer base.  You will own the overall relationship with assigned clients, which includes managing on-boarding, implementation, training, increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and high levels of customer satisfaction.  You’ll also be managing a team primarily based in the Philippines, managing inbound support tickets, internal service requests, and strategically interacting with key enterprise clients at the account level across multiple SLA tiers.  You’ll be a key voice for the customer within the business, creating visibility into emerging challenges, continually optimizing our team and processes, and managing a high performing team. Implement and maintain an excellent level of customer service for Toku’s growing clientele in CPaaS, UCaaS, and CCaaS use-cases. Conduct regular account reviews & check-ins with emerging accounts, driving feature usage and helping the customer maximize value from their Toku solutions. Collaborate with marketing to create both people-centric and technology-centric processes for customer engagement. Collaborate with sales to identify areas for account growth (e.g. cross- or up-sell). Take a hands-on role resolving problems for key clients, managing at both the account and final escalation path levels. Indirectly manage a small (<10) person Philippines-based support team. Define, document, and implement processes to improve the team’s efficiency, morale, and SLA fulfilment. Create and maintain regular management KPI reporting and commentary along key support metrics to drive visibility and action across the business. Be a key voice for the customer with Toku’s internal stakeholders. Become a subject matter expert in Toku’s full suite of B2B communication services. Key KPI will include account retention, NPS, feature adoption, SLA metrics. We would love to hear from you if you have: Have taken a leading role in building, developing, and managing a B2B SaaS Customer Experience function which delivered high satisfaction. Have strong leadership, communication, and organisation capabilities. Able to recruit, manage and retain a high-performance support team. Has substantial domain expertise in B2B SaaS and/or B2B telecommunications. Be an excellent communicator, able to persuade & influence at C-Level. Be intimately familiar with best practices in structuring support teams (e.g. triage, escalation paths, monitoring) and supporting technologies (we use FreshService). What would you get? Flexible working locations Training and Development Discretionary Yearly Bonus & Salary Review Healthcare Coverage based on location 20 days Paid Annual Leave (excluding Bank holidays)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security

description: Strong in Business Expansion Strong in leadership East Responsibilities Responsible for achieving company objectives and executing initiatives, programs and procedures to ensure complete compliance and achievement in the areas of retail financial results, customer service, operations, marketing and staff training and development. Responsible for retail marketing initiatives, retail training and development, store identity standardization, retail system process and deployment. Responsible for managing and motivating a team to increase sales and ensure efficiency. Responsible for managing stock levels and making key decisions on Sell Thru and Sell out stocks. Analyzing sales figures and forecasting future sales, interpreting trends to facilitate planning. Using information technology to record sales figures, for data analysis and forward planning. Responding to customer complaints and comments. Organizing special promotions, displays and events. Updating senior management on business performance, new initiatives and other pertinent issues. Responsible to foster close working relationship with respective internal and external stake holders to facilitate the smooth operations of the entire retail function. Conduct market walk regularly, getting feedback from retailers and partners, and identifying or resolving urgent issues; Maintaining awareness of market trends in the retail industry, understanding forthcoming customer initiatives and monitoring what local competitors are doing. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree with at least 5 years above of related experience in retail operations management. At least 3 years or more of experience developing operational plans which align with business and financial goals. Ability to build relationships with internal and external partners Experience presenting and reporting to appropriate stakeholders, executives and senior management Experience in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve issues Experience in identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve issues Experience directly managing people, including hiring, developing, motivating, and directing people as they work Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please email us an updated copy of your resume in Ms word format.  Job code: AAK  Email Address: bs5@persolkelly.com  EA License No.: 01C4394  529254
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About the Role Omnilytics is looking for a Director of Marketing to join, build and lead our fast-growing team. You will be responsible for collaborating with cross-functional leaders to drive awareness, demand, and conversion.  This is an extraordinary opportunity for a strong Marketing leader to lead the company on its goal to become an industry leader in market intelligence by empowering business decisions with data.  You will lead all parts of the Marketing team and report to the CEO. Your responsibilities will be: Define, build and execute go-to marketing strategies that support the commercial objective of the company Lead and own demand generation. Work closely with the sales and BD teams to align key efforts around lead generation and customer/partner enablement Manage and nurture leads and make sure they are programmatically and predictably talked to, qualified, confirmed, and managed Responsible for defining and overseeing marketing budgets, OKRs and reporting Own the corporate brand and messaging, including market differentiation, customer feedback, and market traction Focus on company brand awareness through the web, publications, ads, responses to inquiries from the media, press releases, analyst relations, speaking engagements, notable events and marketing opportunities Disseminate brand, customer, and product feedback across the organization Support sales team with collaterals, webinars, etc. Partner with the customer success team to develop a customer-centric marketing and retention program agenda Build, lead, coach and retain a team of high performing marketing professionals covering content, product marketing, customer marketing, performance marketing and media  You'll be a good fit for this role if you possess the following traits: Creative problem solver. When new projects or goals are presented you figure out the best way to make them happen with the budget and resources at hand.  Broad Marketing experience. You’re a jack of all trades when it comes to marketing and understands the needs of different business functions so you can be hands-on as needed.  Thrives in a fast-paced environment. You have no problem multi-tasking and balancing priorities while adapting to changes.  Excellent communication skills. As an effective communicator, you convey information in a clear, concise and credible manner verbally and in writing.  Requirements 10+ years of marketing experience in B2B SaaS in a startup or SME setting 5+ years of a proven hands-on track record for successful global demand generation programs in B2B SaaS environment with a focus on digital 3+ years direct experience with carrying a commit, managing a marketing budget, including headcount and non-headcount resources P&L and revenue ownership experience Startup and/or agency experience Track record in hiring and managing a marketing team that hits demand gen targets A digital-first marketer with experience in paid media, SEO and performance marketing In-depth experience in marketing automation Excellent project management and organizational skills, with the ability to run, coordinate and track multiple simultaneous projects and deliverables in a highly dynamic and constantly evolving context Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, with the ability to comfortably interface with all levels of management and to communicate cross-functionally in a structured and clear manner to influence the outcome. An inclusive people leader that believes in leading by example An effective collaborator with a growth mindset. Demonstrated leadership skills, with a willingness to collaborate internally and externally Build processes that can be handed off as the team grows  This is your chance to join us in helping businesses around the world make better decisions with data. Apply now!  Disclaimer: Singapore EP sponsorship is not available
industries: Computer Software

description: We are looking for a highly creative and results-oriented mind to lead our new Social Commerce team. The candidate will be responsible to manage the P&L of this business unit, being responsible for sales, content creation and operation.If you are passionate about innovation and willing to change the world of fashion and lifestyle by creating a world-class shopping and inspiration experience, unmatched in the industry, this is the right position for you.  Responsibilities Develop and lead Zalora Social Commerce strategy across all Zalora markets. Manage business unit P&L, from sales, content production, costs and operation. Create a world-class customer experience, unmatched in the industry. Develop and produce creative and engaging content across our live streaming and social feed platforms. Support our product and tech teams on the strategy definition, project management and development of new features. Coordinate with internal teams for all Social Commerce support needed such as commercial, partnership, onsite, CRM, legal, finance, operations, among others. Coordinate with brands and influencers on all aspects of content creation and platform engagement. Manage third-party vendors and as appropriate, lead the selection of new vendors (negotiate, review, and approve partner contracts). Develop and monitor their performance, accuracy and quality of work. Constantly seek out new ways to optimise channel performance as well as exploring innovative solutions and partnership opportunities. Build and lead a high-performance team. Requirements 8+ years of digital marketing, content creation and/or social media experience with at least 4 years in a leadership role. Previous experience with leading social commerce or live streaming channels is a plus. Passion in building creative and engaging content. Limitless and creative mind-set, with no fear of trying. Proven track record of taking ownership and delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Experience with managing P&Ls and devising product pricing to strategically drive user acquisition, engagement and revenue. Proactive mindset with a roll up your sleeves attitude to achieve goals and deliver great experiences for our customers. Strong project and people management skills. Result and analytics oriented. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with good command of English The Zalora Story  ZALORA is Asia’s leading online fashion, beauty and lifestyle destination, part of Global Fashion Group. As one of the region’s pioneer large scale ecommerce platforms, ZALORA has established a strong presence throughout the region, particularly in Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, the Philippines, Hong Kong, and in Taiwan, enjoying over 50 million visits per month.  ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged or employed by ZALORA or Global Fashion Group
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Evalueserve is a fast-growing global professional services firm providing research, analytics, digital products / enablers and data management services to customers across various industries. We are headquartered out of Switzerland with 4,200+ employees across the globe.  We’re driven by mind+machine philosophy – a unique combination of human expertise and best-in-class technologies to deliver knowledge services, drive process efficiencies, digitalize knowledge ecosystems, support collaboration and create knolwedge assets for our clients.  Position: Sale Director, Financial Services APAC  Scope of work: Develop new relationships and grow / strengthen existing relationships with customers across the Financial Services landscape (Investment Banks, Asset & Wealth Management Firms, FinTech, PE Firms, etc.) in APAC with focus on Risk Management and Data Analytics solutions.  Reports to: Head of Sales, Financial Services Europe & APAC  Key Activities Map target customers and key decision makers to identify / close risk management and data analytics engagements in the target markets Keep updated on latest market and regulatory developments to identify lucrative niches and develop attractive propositions Consultative selling including identification of industry challenges, solution design and implementation Execute campaigns to promote Evalueserve's solutions Communicate differentiated offering and help enhance market standing Capitalise on all meetings, leads and RFP's to generate new revenue Collaborate with operations teams, solutions architects and coverage teams to deepen client relationships through upselling and cross-selling solutions Staying actively involved in projects sold with operations team to make certain each project is progressing properly – proactively 'raising the flag' when required to make mid-project adjustments and taking the engagement to higher levels Coordinating on global accounts with counterparts outside of APAC Closely work with Head of Sales, Practice Leaders and Solutions Architects to create future strategies for growing risk management and analytics business Skills Required Rich understanding of either data analytics or risk management usecases in the Financial Services industry. For risk management, experience in specific regulatory change projects such as model risk management, stress testing, remediation and risk reporting will be highly preferred Proven track record of building and growing client relationships and playing an active role in business development – lead pitch meetings and be the “face of the organisation” to clients Experience in consultative selling with keen eye on possible data sources, technology and skillset required to win new business; Experience in closing transactions with long sales cycles by implementing and driving a sophisticated sales process Access to clients in data analytics or risk management with decision power and budget; Network of related contacts, and ability to expand and develop a larger sales network Superior communication, presentation and interpersonal skills with the ability to develop and maintain strong client relationships Professional Competencies MBA or Master's degree in Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering 8-10 years proven track record of selling services in a complex / consultative environment Success winning new logos and penetrating new accounts. Able to work in a team selling environment Work experience demonstrates creativity, integrity, humility, discipline, and solid communication skills Ability to manage senior stakeholders internally and externally Good communication and presentation skills Ability to manage inter-cultural relationships Result orientation, ability to structure and creativity Compensation & Benefits Competitive compensation including attractive OTE commissions Leading edge global work environment Location: Base: Singapore - virtual office environment. Travel: Up to 30% to other key markets (when travelling is possible post COVID)
industries: Management Consulting, Financial Services, and Pharmaceuticals

description: What’s up? We’re VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH  Well, now we’re looking for someone who lives and breathes social media even more than us. Do you know all of the latest trends? Memes? And TikToks? Maybe you’ve dabbled in the world of influencers? Believe in the power of social media and community management to change hearts, minds, and drive sales? Love the hustle of fast-paced, hyper-growth agency life? Thrive in a role where you can bring ideas to life on billions of screens? Cool. Then let’s talk.  This exciting opportunity of a full-time role based in Singapore will allow you to lead a team of strategists and collaborate with a bunch of strat experts across apac. You will lead and drive our strategy expertise and be the “strategic brain” who will guide us for all things APAC.  Are you based in Singapore? Geeking the social media world in APAC digital space for eight plus years now? Are you inspiring with a can-do attitude? Do you wanna deep dive into the world of media and creative advertising agency? If yes, we could be meant to be -----so keep reading!  Here’s where you come in.  Our growing strategy team is looking forward to collaborating with a “people first” Strategy Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Strategy and Insights.  You’re a problem solver at heart and insanely curious about people, culture and technology. Most of all, you like to get your hands dirty, are obsessed with researching & finding interesting things that are hidden from sight (even in the seemingly most mundane of places) and adept at translating your findings into compelling creative briefs, enjoy partnering with teams to see your work through from research to execution, and communicate your work with passion and conviction. We like to work with “big thinkers yet hands-on in execution”.  As a team, we’re collaborative and come from diverse backgrounds. We value creativity in research, and an outside-in perspective when it comes to inspiration, strategic frameworks and problem-solving. Technology has fundamentally changed the way we interact with others and the world around us, and we geek out about understanding behaviors in context, instead of probing humans in a petri dish.  You would be leading a team of talented strategists, social listening analysts, and community experts. As such, there are many hats you’d have to wear from day 1. You would need to conduct research, write briefs, guide work, pitch to clients - really anything and everything it takes to get the job done and deliver fantastic, big, bold, beautiful work.  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  Your Experience And The “Nice To Have” 7 plus years experience building integrated programs at a top agency working for Fortune 500 clients -- must have experience understanding the intersection of business strategy, consumer insights, and digital behavior and developing big, purposeful ideas. Experience doing traditional, web, social, syndicated and primary research (incl.: NetBase, MRI, Sysomos, Brandwatch, eMarketer, Mintel, Google Analytics, Omniture; conducting IDIs, digital ethnographies, etc.) Dazzling presentation skills and presence in a room Ability to express complicated concepts in simple and digestible ways (“Explain it to a fifth grader”) Curious and lovely to get along with. Deliver work independently on all tasks and achieve results at pace with energy and drive. Lead collaboration sessions with other teams. Execute a strong sense of priority level and urgency; and knows how to act on the critical difference between the two. Manage the ongoing performance of different tasks or projects, as well as understanding and ownership of internal processes for quality assurance. Administer agreed goals or projects by dealing to challenges in a responsive and constructive way. Strive for zero mistakes or flagged internal process issues on work output. Foster positive internal communication and collaboration with all internal teams. Ensure presented ideas are clear and understood. Highlight new ideas to the team and external stakeholders when appropriate. Provide clear, professional, timely and helpful information to the team or external clients and partners. Thrives in a company of good people Think logically even under pressure and come up with innovative solutions to problems. Lastly, a genuine belief in bringing your full self to what you do everyday, see “work” as a calling and a passion. What You Should Know About VaynerMedia  Think “lab” and not “agency”. We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We’re willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It’s fun!  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  P.S Portfolio would be nice :)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We represent Hitachi Vantara to enterprise clients across industries, establishing business relationships to understand customer challenges so that we can deliver profitable business for Hitachi products, services and solutions. We collaborate as a team and cross-functionally to ensure the success of our customers; success that is celebrated and shared. Our solutions bring value to every line of business and we need people like you to build those deep relationships and to passionately articulate our value proposition.  Our Company  Hitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation. We guide customers from what’s now to what’s next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.  Our people are our biggest asset, they drive our innovation advantage and we strive to offer a flexible and collaborative workplace where they can thrive. Diversity of thought is welcomed and our employee base is represented by several active Employee Resource Group communities. We offer industry leading benefits packages (flexible working, generous pension and private healthcare) and promote a creative and inclusive culture. If driving real change gives you a sense of pride and you are passionate about powering social good, we’d love to hear from you.  Sales Director is responsible to generate sales for the defined strategic account, such as banking and insurance client and maintain a strong positive relationship with the prospects. He/She is responsible to generate, maintain and further develop sales forecasts for allocated prospects/customer accounts. The role is responsible to develop, manage and maintain strong account relationships with prospects/customers in the Public Sector.  The candidate is required to have an understanding of Financial banking knowledge Analytics/ application & cloud modernization Application managed services Responsibilities Manage accounts including the entire sales process from business development, prospecting and qualifications through negotiations and signing the deal Develop and execute the client account strategy that clearly defines how the company will help the client grow and differentiate itself Participate and coordinate the appropriate pre-sales, professional services and resources to successfully close the deal with clients, at the same time conforming to mandatory company processes Responsible for ensuring profit and client satisfaction for accounts Negotiate and close terms and conditions of agreements to deliver win-win solution for both clients and company Represent the clients to communicate their needs to relevant departments in the organization Ensure client readiness for products and services and successful solution installation Drive the closure of deals through demonstration, presentation and sales of value proposition Oversee the process from sourcing and proposing to closing of business deals. You would have a keen eye on upcoming new tech with your market knowledge and exposure to events. Network and be involved in professional organizations to keep updated in the financial market. Essential Requirements Degree in Computer Engineering or Information Technology or Marketing or related disciplines At least 10 years’ sales experience in IT solutions and services Strong network in SCB(primary)/Mizuho and other banks Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly present solutions and services information at one to one or group presentation Resulted oriented with the ability to work independently Outgoing and pleasant personality Comfortable to work with all levels of the customer organization up to Senior Management and C Level Key abilities in relationship building and consultative approach to business Creative and entrepreneurial Good listening Skills / humility Culture Sensitivities / local experience Good communication and presentation skills Personal Attributes Positive can-do attitude Relentless Collaborative and a team player Independent Demonstrates good consulting hygiene Systematic and focused approach to working Confident and comfortable with client’s interactions Analytical and possess the ability to solve problems permanently Our Values  Research tells us that some applicants, especially those from underrepresented groups, can be put off from applying for roles if they need flexibility or feel they don’t meet all of the set criteria. We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and part-time arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.  With Japanese Roots Going Back Over 100 Years, Our Culture Is Founded On The Values Of Our Parent Company Expressed As The Hitachi Spirit  We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  Wa – Harmony, Trust, Respect  Makoto – Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity  Kaitakusha-Seishin – Pioneering Spirit, Challenge
industries: Information Technology and Services, Human Resources, and Management Consulting

description: Responsibilities Develops network strategy, leads APAC Network team, and is responsible for the output of multiple disciplines within provider contracting, network configurations, provider relations, TPA partnerships, provider collaborations, and network performance and cost management. Manages complex contracting and negotiations for fee for service and value-based reimbursements with hospitals, other provider specialties, and TPAs; whilst benchmark against APAC country market norms and leverage knowledge of medical cost trends. Builds relationships that nurture provider and/or TPA partnerships, and seeks broader value-based business opportunities to support the local and global market strategy. Develops strategic positioning for Cigna network capabilities, including but not limited to the development of alternative network initiatives, value or risk-orientation arrangement with strategic provider partners. Works to guide and meet unit cost targets, while preserving an adequate network to achieve and maintain Cigna’s competitive position. Creates and manages initiatives that improve total medical cost and quality, ensures network performance, and tracks medical cost savings ratio against plan and target. Drives change with external provider partners by assessing clinical informatics, utilization performance, medical economics analytics, and offering consultative expertise to assist with total medical cost initiatives. Initiates and maintains effective channels of communication with matrix partners including but not limited to, Claims Operations, Medical Management, Medical Economics, Compliance, Sales, Client Management, Marketing and Service. Assist in resolving elevated and complex provider service complaints. Researches problems and negotiates with internal/external partner/customers to prevent and resolve escalated issues. Manages key provider relations in APAC region and is accountable for critical interface with providers and business staff. Demonstrates knowledge of providers in APAC geographic region through understanding the interrelationships as well as the competitive landscape. Partners with cross-regional network and payment integrity teams for projects impacting multiple regions and/or markets. May also be responsible for providing policy administration for contracting networks and assuring contractual compliance with government regulations. Contributes to establishing strategic goals across the function. Possesses significant freedom to act in the short term. Makes decisions, often based on limited information, that have a long-term impact across the function. Requirements Bachelor’s degree required; MBA or Master’s degree in Healthcare Administration or a health-related advanced degree is strongly preferred. 10+ years of experience in successful provider contracting (involving complex delivery systems and organizations), additional expertise in health economics preferred. Experience in developing and managing key provider relationships. Experience and expertise in high priority healthcare providers, third party administrators, Cigna competitor capabilities and healthcare systems within major markets across the globe. Knowledge of complex reimbursement methodologies, including incentive based models strongly preferred. Team player with proven ability to develop strong working relationships within a fast-paced matrix organization. Strong influencing skills and proven ability to work collaboratively in a complex, highly matrixed environment, including balancing priorities of multiple organizations to deliver results. Linguistic fluency. Ability to speak, write and read multiple languages Strong interpersonal, networking and negotiations skills is a must Ability to influence without authority About Cigna  Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. When you work with us, or one of our subsidiaries, you’ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people’s lives. What difference will you make?
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Cisco Meraki knows that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us. By simplifying powerful technology, we can free hardworking people to focus on their mission. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality. As part of an ambitious team in this rapidly growing business, you help customize the direction by ensuring our organizational challenges and opportunities are driving towards the best results.  As the Meraki Channels & Distribution Leader for the APJC region, you will directly lead a team of Channel & Distribution Account Managers that are responsible for encouraging and developing partners that will win with Meraki today and tomorrow.  At Meraki, our goal as leaders is to grow and develop forward-thinking teams! The strength of our team is the foundation of our success! For us, the best team is one that is focused, highly trusted, empowered, inclusive and innovative. An extraordinary team will build products that disrupt markets and customer relationships that widen the impact we can have on the world. A great team will also inspire in each of us work that is meaningful and rewarding. Commit to living our leadership principles, build simple paths for people to deliver their best work, and make decisions that will prioritize the long-term health of Cisco Meraki.  What you will do: Hire, mentor, and develop a hungry and passionate channel sales team for your region Deliver against our sales goals and build strong internal and external relationships in service of an outstanding customer and partner experience Drive the strategy and executive relationship with partners Work together with all Meraki cross-functional teams in the region in support of the APJC Sales Leader and Field Sales Director to build culture and shared vision Work with Cisco teams to ensure Meraki is appropriately prioritized, gaining support for marketing and channel investments, and optimizing our joint GTM approach to drive growth Own management sponsorship and execution with strategic partners and/or distributors Use weekly team check-ins, metrics and data to continually assess both sales performance and talent performance/retention to fully understand underlying drivers and adjust course as necessary  You are: Candid. You communicate broadly and often, providing clear purpose, direction, goals, and measures Career Champion. You invest in your team’s growth and development Disagree, Decide, and Commit. You listen to understand different opinions and allow them to influence the direction Results Driven. You are resilient, optimistic, and passionate about our business results while never compromising customer, partner, and team relationships Trustworthy. You commit to earning our team’s trust everyday through your actions and transparency  Minimum Requirements: BA/BS or equivalent practical experience 8+ years sales experience 2+ years of director level sales experience leading teams Proven sales leadership ability in motivating teams, overachieving targets, and successfully working with a broad range of channel partners Exceptional communication skills, both in presenting to partners and stakeholders, but also in reducing complex ideas to simple language and rigorously prioritizing what and how to communicate across the organization to achieve results Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities with the ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines Significant travel required (40 – 60%)  Preferred Requirements: A deep understanding and interest in networking technology, software, or IT Fluency in English International work experience a plus  At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
industries: Computer Networking

Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.  With Japanese Roots Going Back Over 100 Years, Our Culture Is Founded On The Values Of Our Parent Company Expressed As The Hitachi Spirit  We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  Wa – Harmony, Trust, Respect  Makoto – Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity  Kaitakusha-Seishin – Pioneering Spirit, Challenge

description: At Prudential, we understand that success comes from the talent and commitment of our people. Together, we have a shared vision in securing the future of our customers and our communities. We strive to build a business that you can shape, an inclusive workplace where everyone’s ideas are valued and a culture where we can thrive together. Our people stay connected and tuned in to what’s happening around us, keeping us ahead of the curve. While focused on the long-term, we look to the future to bring growth, development and benefit to everyone whose lives we touch.  Job Profile Summary  Overall responsibility is to achieve the P&L targets for investments and group products in conjunction with key stakeholders. This is a key portfolio which requires a team head to lead a team of product managers to drive product development and ongoing review / maintenance of our Investments and Group suite of products.  Job Description Develop and implement new customer investment and group propositions that are market leading, meet customer needs and improve financial performance. Evaluate and manage the value proposition of our Investment and Group product suite to ensure they meet the needs of customers which form our target segment. Ongoing management and review of Investment and Group proposition Work with distribution teams to provide education, support and communication tools to better target new customer and service existing customers. Work with marketing team to develop and execute initiatives to ensure Prudential is position as the leader in insurance savings and investment solutions. Work with investment team to ensure investment proposition for insurance link products are fit for purpose Oversees the BAU activities of the ILP funds business which includes and not limited to corporate actions, model portfolio rebalancing activities, funds’ documentation and website maintenance. Oversee the development of fund information booklets, product highlights sheets, semi-annual and annual-reports of the ILP funds Ensure ILP products and funds are in compliance to regulatory requirements such as MAS 307 Notice with reference to CIS Code and MAS’s portfolio bond regulations, as well as company compliance and risk policies. Responsible for process related implementations on ILP fund launches Worth with sales and finance on ensuring compensation is appropriate to drive the right product mix for the organization. Product solutioning to differentiate PACS in the market and deliver profitable outcomes for the organization Drive, participate and implement initiatives to deliver thought leadership on group and investment solutions in conjunction with investment team. Manage the implementation of short-term product initiatives to improve sales and profitability including product and pricing changes and associated customer and distribution communications in conjunction with Head of Corporate Affairs; Deliver financial and customer KPI’s for investment and group portfolios. Lead the P&L reporting requirements for the group and investment portfolio working with actuarial and finance Lead and manage a team of product managers Who We Are Looking For  Competencies & Personal Traits Technical competencies relevant to the role Personal traits which ft the team and the organization Demonstrate leadership influence and maturity for effective collaboration across departments and divisions. Adaptable and can deal with change and ambiguity Working Experience At least 12 years working experience with about 7 years of experience in a product management role dealing with endowment plans, ILPs and funds. Education Degree in Actuarial Studies (not a must) / Marketing / Finance / Economics / Business Administration or related discipline Language English

Plan strategies and monthly sales forecasts to meet business targets of good profitability and opportunities for growth Responsible for driving annual budgeting, operational sustainability for revenue and productivity gains Maximise performance by increasing sales, improving margins and reducing costs Optimise and improve operations and procedures for customer satisfaction Responsible for recruitment, retainment, training and development, and leading team for for operations excellence Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Merchandising, Marketing, Finance, HR & IT) to achieve business outcomes Responsible for developing and implementing SOPs and operation manual Responsible for Social Media Marketing Franchisee Management - Source for potentials and Negotiate terms & agreements Requirements Candidate must possess at least a Diploma / Degree, with at least 8 year(s) of working experience in retail / convenience store industry Has experience in franchise management and negotiations Possess good knowledge of P&L, management of revenue, overhead, cost of sales How To Apply  By submitting any application or résumé to us, you will be deemed to have agreed and consented to us disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration. description: Responsibilities Provide expert advice and direction to the Group General Manager (GM) to increase guest counts and sales by delivering excellent Guest Service while adhering to all Vision, Values and Culture. Develop guest loyalty through quality of operation, personalized customer attention and staff development; Review and analyzes financial statements with the GGM on a regular basis and develop action plans to improve results and profitability; Systematically diagnoses problems; gathers information and considers all possible solutions before initiating action. Makes recommendations to senior management as necessary; Determine management needs and select quality management candidates in partnership with the HR Manager. Recommend and effect transfers, promotions and terminations for management employees. Provide necessary coaching to GGM to assist him/her in achieving maximum effectiveness; Ensure all assigned outlets meet the delivery of quality food and services through the purchasing and management of food and non-food items. Maintain and audit food and non-food inventory levels at each assigned outlet in accordance with company guidelines; Working closely with Back of House to create menus and catering proposals; Ensuring that menu proposals and quotations are accurately created, organise and makes most efficient use of resources; Ensuring that all projects and events are efficiently and effectively executed, neatly presented, clean with timely delivery and collection; Prepares thoroughly and delivers well organized, dynamic and informative presentations to senior management as needed; Accurately completes all weekly reporting in a timely manner; Work with the assigned HR Manager as appropriate on employee relations issues; Ensure compliance with all local laws/regulations relative to assigned outlets; Perform other projects and duties as assigned; Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems in accordance with Human Resources Policies and Procedures and Vision, Values and Culture. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree is highly preferred and / or minimum five years of prior multi-unit managerial restaurant experience is required; Must have a thorough understanding of operating and management techniques as they apply to the food industry; Strong communication and organizational skills are essential, as well as the ability to effectively train, coach, evaluate, and discipline employees. Must be able to read, write and effectively communicate in the English language; Must possess the ability to maintain confidentiality; ability to demonstrate strong accounting, analytical and organizational skills, as well the ability to define and effectively solve and deal with a variety of changing situations under stress; ability to demonstrate sound decision-making skills; Must possess strong interpersonal skills requiring the ability to resolve conflicting interests with the goal of obtaining cooperation; Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel spreadsheets, Outlook, Word) is required; Uses sound judgment in day-to-day decisions by applying the company’s Vision, Values and Culture.

description: Asia's Leading Fintech Startup Hyper-growth stage Competitive Salary Package and Equity Our client is one of leading global financial exchange platform headquartered in Singapore. Since its establishment in 2018, they have doubled its team and continues to grow rapidly. Their focus on establishing strong foundation in trust and compliance, building reliable and transparent platforms for their users, and recent partnerships has put them on the world map.  With synergy across professionals from investment banking, forex trading, technology firms, and blockchain experts, they are now looking for an experienced Marketing Director to join the team. You will play an instrumental role in scaling the business further by directing and overseeing a highly capable marketing functions such as Digital Marketing, PR & Branding, Content & Creatives and Strategy & Ops, in driving integrated strategies that align with the business goals and objectives.  The Role Develop and implement a cohesive marketing plan to increase brand awareness globally Manage and review the Marketing budget, prepare regular reports and presentations on marketing metrics for the board Participate in the quarterly and annual planning of the company's objectives. Own strategic initiatives and be involved end-to-end in promotional projects Build relationships with media and stakeholders through creative PR strategies. Monitor all marketing campaigns and improve them when necessary. Prioritize marketing projects and allocate resources accordingly and forecast hiring needs Conduct market analysis, track competitors' activities to identify challenges and opportunities for growth. Provide guidance and ideas to organize effective marketing events. The Candidate Proven work experience with 12+ years of experience in a senior Marketing positions Proven record of designing and implementing successful marketing campaigns across the globe Demonstrates experience in using CRM software and digital marketing tools and techniques Track record of successfully managing and delivering large scale global projects Proficient in Chinese in order to liaise with Mandarin-speaking partners Experience in an e-commerce company required Excellent communications skills and leadership skills Strong analytical and project management skills Strategic mindset with ability to make difficult decisions. For more information you can email Celestine Chia in our Singapore office on celestine.chia@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 523444 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest.  http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/BEg3za/global-marketing-director-sales-marketing-singapore-singapore-14436717  Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544  Job Reference: CC523444
