description: Sales Director – Data Centres  Role Purpose  The Sales Director role is responsible for achieving high quality sales outcomes that contribute to a profitable Region by driving revenue growth within the Data Centre industry in individual capacity and support the establishment of the corporate solutions delivery capability.  They will accurately diagnose and resolve the client’s pain points and develop winning and profitable solutions. This will be done by partnering with Research, Marketing and Business Leaders to ensure depth of knowledge within the Data Centre and Critical Systems industry. of each potential client’s industry, driving thought leadership in the future of the industry.  What This Job Involves  Key responsibilities include- In partnership and alignment with CS Geo & Account Sales Leaders help drive growth of the Data Centre business and, as appropriate, act as the face of JLL to the Market. Support the broader Sales teams to offer integrated solutions encompassing JLL’s suite of product offerings and services – across the whole real estate life cycle – demonstrating a sound level of knowledge of all product groups. With a key focus on Project Development / Management, Integrated Facilities Management and Energy & sustainability Services. Manage a collaborative relationship with the firm's Brokerage teams (Markets, Capital Markets etc) as a key component of Sales growth across the firm. Exceed annual revenue quotas while meeting target margins, as well as in-year won & earned revenue targets. Deliver sales growth through prospecting in new market segments/clients and by expanding/scaling existing client relationships. Support the growth of both our Corporate Solutions and our Project & Development Services business lines to deliver common sales goals. Annually identify and develop a deep roster of prospects and a strong pipeline of targets. Develop a thorough understanding of JLL’s broad capabilities to meet client needs, recognizing opportunities to expand the client footprint by partnering with business and service line leaders. Maintain accurate sales reporting information while following our sales and solutions processes. Identify opportunities to demonstrate expertise and leadership within industry organizations to further advance the recognition of JLL as a leader. Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.  Experience Experience selling Real Estate & Project services or products in the Data Centre industry. Sales/sales enablement background from within a global high tech B2B environment. Track record of serving, collaborating with and influencing executive management especially sales leadership. Excellent analytical and program management skills are essential. Skills Expert in outsourcing solutions across a wide array of clients. Promotes ideas and proposals persuasively and in a consultative approach to shape stakeholder opinions and buy-in. Demonstrates confidence in presenting to various audiences – able to think quickly, listen well to others, and understand how to react and modify approach to thrive in front of clients and other key influencers. Demonstrated ability help guide the client’s buying process – ability to “take control”. Willingness and ability to reframe or reshape client’s buying vision – delivers new insights to clients during the sales process and able to earn trusted advisor status. Ability to build trust and relationships. Comfortable with technology and business analytics. What You Can Expect From Us  You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.  Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you ...  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Change the way customers and partners live and do business while helping them grow their top and bottom line with our transformative technology.  Our agreement with employeesDocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team partners with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  Position SummaryAs Director, Solution Provider Channel Resellfor APAC, you will lead a team, drive the Channel Resell route to market, and generate resell revenue for the region. You will recruit, develop, manage and ultimately inspire several direct reports across ANZ and SE Asia regions. You have significant experience working with Solution Provider Channel Resellers and Distributors, understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate partnerships and grow the region. You will work with HQ to develop the regional strategy in connection to the global strategy and execute the plan. You are team player, problem solver, and have a tide rises all ships mentality and will help and support other team members succeed. You are a great communicator and will represent Channel Resell business in the region. In this position, you will collaborate closely with leadership in Sales, Partner Ecosystem, Marketing, Customer Success, Enablement, and Product to drive the strategy while aligned with global strategy.  This is a great opportunity for an experienced Channel Resell or Business Development leader to join a growing channel team and make a significant impact in the region.  This is a people manager position and reports to Senior Director, Global Business Development and Channels in the US. This role is designated as a flex role.  Responsibilities Lead the Channel Resell team in APAC. Recruit, develop, and manage the team. Responsible for resold revenue in APAC. Forecast, report and deliver against quarterly revenue targets. Present and report APAC Channel Resell at regional meetings. Utilize regional experience to enhance regional strategy. Work with cross functional teams – Sales, Sales Ops, Marketing, Customer Success, Support, and Product – to implement and execute strategy. Create APAC annual plans that align to global Channel Resell goals including target setting by country, resource allocation, and coordination with other teams. Leverage existing relationships at partners to help your team to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Forge strong DocuSign-internal relationships with key leaders and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. Represent DocuSign with partners and present at partner events. Basic Qualifications A BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience At least 12 years of relevant experience At least 5 years in Channel Sales or equivalent quota-carrying role. Proven track record of hitting and exceeding quota. At least 5 years of experience leading and managing teams Execution focused but able to think broadly in context of regional strategy Excellent written and communication skills including public speaking Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary, typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Preferred Qualifications MBA or JD from top tier school 10+ years leading partner teams Specific experience in the SaaS & Cloud space Demonstrable experience serving customers in Corporate and SMB Versed in business throughout AP/J, with multi-vendor deal experience spanning the many countries and varying business models across the region About Us  DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing.  DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  AccommodationsDocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.

description: The Role  At Quadrant, we are location data and technology company. Our main product lines include mobile location data-as-a-service, POI-as-a-Service and the Quadrant Consent Management Platform. Your role will be to ensure the smooth operations of the organization to deliver our products and services to clients. You will manage the workflows, ensure no bottle necks, make sure things don’t slip and that our clients continue to enjoy a high level of always on service and delivered on-time projects.  The Responsibilities Review and schedule client evaluations, POCs and the onboarding of new clients Ensure delivery of contracts and projects Address client requests and support tickets Oversee incident resolution Lead vendor and supplier management Identifying and targeting areas in which a business can improve operations Monitoring revenue margins Researching and implementing new directives for business growth and optimization Desired Skills And Experience Minimum 5 years experience in operations for data-as-a-service or software-as-a-service companies Managing multiple projects and effectively prioritize organization tasks Managing multiple Project Managers Domain knowledge in location analytics, point-of-interest data, data-as-a-service or SaaS Experience managing relationships between sales, marketing, product, development and clients. Process driven mentality and sound business judgment through analytical thinking Highly organised and enjoys the details. You don’t drop the ball. Extremely pro-active. Don't need to be told what to do, rather you ensure people are getting what they promised done Working under pressure when required Relational databases (knowledge of SQL scripting and database administration) Passion for data and it’s many interesting applications Strong verbal (presentation) and written communication skills Proven system for ensuring production delivery and project success Benefits Be a part of a global and multicultural environment. Work with an ambitious and growing startup team. Direct interaction with multiple teams and experts. Organised knowledge management and processes usually not found in most startups. Personal learning and development opportunities and support. Everyone works remote.

description: About Our Company  PIF (Pay-It-Forward) Capital is the premier capital resources platform in Asia for entrepreneurs. Our services include business training, advisory, investment and public-listing development. Our business units include:  Entrepreneurs' Community – To lead, guide, mentor, coach and train entrepreneurs in growing their businesses. Community benefits include a multitude of events, courses and advisory services.  Management Consulting – From management consulting to corporate advisory, we work hand-in-hand with entrepreneurs on business transformation and corporate strategy so as to attract investors, business partnerships and talents.  Sell-side Advisory – We support entrepreneurs in investor-matching opportunities from angel investors to institutional funders, venture capitalists and investment bankers.  Buy-side Investment – We focus on investing our resources and expertise in selected businesses. As such, the chosen entrepreneurs are guided, mentored, coached and trained to grow from entrepreneurs to investors. PIF Capital also has an investor club where selected projects are shown to buy-side UHNWs, funds, family offices and others.  About The Role  We are looking to hire a Marketing Director who will be in charge of leading our company's marketing efforts. As a successful hire, you will be responsible for providing guidance to our marketing department by evaluating and developing marketing strategies, planning and coordinating marketing efforts, communicating the marketing plans to those involved, and building awareness and positioning for our company's brands. You will also be working closely with our sales department to develop a pricing strategy that will help us maximize profits and market share. Finally, you will be in charge of organizing company seminars, conferences, trade shows, and major events.  This is a hands-on, execution-focused role, with the ideal candidate given the opportunity to head their own team in the future. Please note that Events, Marcomm and Digital Marketing experience is a must for this role. The ideal candidate needs to be fluent in both Mandarin and English with strong design and copywriting skills.  Marketing Director Responsibilities Overseeing the marketing department. Evaluating and developing our marketing strategy and marketing plans, overseeing GDN, SEO, Social Media, Outbrain and other marketing tools. Skilled in lead generation through marketing funnels, lead generation tools. Planning, directing, and coordinating events, communications, PR, marketing efforts. Working with sales department to develop pricing strategies to maximize profits and market share while balancing customer satisfaction. Understanding and developing budgets and finance, including expenditures, research and development appropriations, return-on-investment and profit-loss projections. Developing and managing advertising campaigns. Building brand awareness and positioning. Supporting sales and lead generation efforts. Organizing company conferences, trade shows, and major events. Overseeing social media marketing strategy and content marketing. Marketing Director Requirements Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, communications, or related field Experience in marketing and running a marketing team, with at least 7+ years for Sr. Marketing Manager and 10+ years for Marketing Director. Strong copywriting skills (both Mandarin and English, additional language is a bonus) Proven ability to manage budgets. Experience with digital marketing forms such as social media, content marketing, SEO, GDN, Facebook Ads (required), Outbrain etc. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Design and copywriting skills in both CN and EN will be looked upon favourably. Experience Events: 5 years (Required) Mandarin: 7 years (Required) Social media marketing: 5 years (Preferred) Team Lead: 5 years (Preferred) Marketing: 7 years (Required) Education Bachelor's or equivalent (Required)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Management Consulting, and Financial Services

description: The Global Package Development (GPD) mission is to be the best packaging organization in the consumer world providing winning packaging solutions at breakthrough speed. GPD is connected globally with more than 130 people around the globe who work to develop packaging of superior value that delights consumer and builds brand equity from the shopper’s first moment of truth to the consumer’s second moment of truth and after. The package development role is ideal for business leaders with passion for shaping strategies, technology development & bringing brand strategy to life with best in class implementation. APAC is the fastest growing region in Global Consumer, with a complete portfolio of franchises & products with world class brands such as Neutrogena, Listerine, Tylenol, Johnsons Baby, Motrin, Aveeno, Daktarin, Band Aid, Stayfree etc. The Global packaging organization operates as an end-to-end organization managing entire spectrum of packaging activities ranging from front-end-innovation to support of marketed products. This is a leadership position reporting into Head of Packaging & Essential Health R&D for APAC and the role has direct and indirect accountability of packaging organizations spread across thirteen different markets within ASIA Pacific. The Associate Director, Global Packaging will drive business objectives through delivery of packaging innovation by collaborating closely across functions, within Supply Chain, regional & in-market commercial teams to drive the business objectives. Ability to work across multiple supply chain functions such as manufacturing, engineering, customer logistics will be crucial towards delivering innovation aligned to design for manufacturing principles. The APAC region consists of four large clusters spanning from India, all the way to the Pacific cluster consisting of ANZ, delivering business with the support of regional & in market teams. Ability to develop large & distributed teams from the regional headquarters in Singapore is critical, and in this respect, experience of managing distributed teams will be taken into consideration. The Global Packaging organization is part of the broader global packaging & global R&D organizations. Driving global collaboration around shared areas such as sustainability and ensure sharing of best practices across regions to ensure the company’s internal & external commitments are met as per schedule. Being connected to the external ecosystem with an intention of future proofing packaging innovation pipeline will be a crucial deliverable. The APAC packaging organization is transitioning to digital workflows, knowledge or prior implementation of continuous improvement through integration of digital workflows such as Computer aided design and modelling & simulation will be an important consideration.  Key Responsibilities: - Directly and indirectly manage a team responsible for effective execution of regional/ global programs in alignment with category strategies driven efficiently through the most efficient technologies using aligned work processes. - Engagement with Regional lead & stakeholders to ensure correct project definition, prioritization, alignment on outcomes & capacity planning. Ability to be on top on critical programs to ensure delivery as per plan. Ensure team is well represented in all discussions & supported to deliver desired outcomes. This will involve interfacing & coordinating with regional & global cross functional partners. - Technical mastery on packaging is a must to interface with the cross functional stakeholders, having excellent communication skills is critical. - Organization management, ensuring that the team has a clear line of sight towards their yearly business goals, organizational deliverables and development plans, through the HR work processes. Given the position is in Singapore, having a good feel of the organization’s pulse and experience on remotely managing organization is a must. - Work with regional / global peers & leaders to ensure that the regional priorities are properly represented, and global functional priorities shaped for maximum impact to the business. - Keep abreast of latest packaging technologies with the intent of identifying implementation opportunities. Manage technical relationships with our packaging suppliers to ensure continuous value to J&J. - As an industry expert, work with the team & internal stake holders on identifying & implementing industry best practices and work processes. Representing J&J in Industry forums from time to time, as required. Interaction: - External: Regular interactions with new & existing technology vendors and service providers. - Internal: Daily interactions with R&D, Supply chain, Sourcing, Engineering, Q&C, Sales/Mktg, Tech Ops, Finance and Planning
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: InCloudCounsel is seeking a Director to join the Sales team of our rapidly growing company. InCloudCounsel is the leading technology and services provider of contract automation and intelligence for many of the world's biggest and most innovative companies. By combining highly experienced corporate lawyers with cloud-based software that unlocks valuable data within contracts, InCloudCounsel offers a scalable, end-to-end solution for negotiating and managing routine legal work.  This is an extraordinary opportunity for the right corporate lawyer to transition into a unique business role that leverages the knowledge, expertise, and network you've acquired practising law.  You will help lead our efforts to add new clients in our core client industries, including asset management, investment banking, and real estate as well as play a key role in determining business development and growth strategies in the APAC region. Your focus will be to leverage the success we've already had in acquiring a large portfolio of marquee clients in the US and Europe to increase market share and propel the company to its next level of growth in the APAC region.  The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of experience working as a corporate lawyer at a leading law firm serving the financial services industry or equivalent experience practising in-house. Finance professionals in investment banking or private equity will also be considered, but must feel comfortable conversing about legal matters.  The role will report to the Managing Director, Sales, with whom you will work to execute our sales strategy. The compensation package includes a competitive base salary, equity, generous commissions, and full benefits. The preferred location for this position is Hong Kong or Singapore.* InCloudCounsel is an employer in Hong Kong as well as Singapore, The United States and The United Kingdom; we currently have offices in London, Los Angeles, New York City, and San Francisco.  Goals: Meet and exceed defined sales targets Acquire new customers in each of the client industry verticals we serve Manage all stages of the sales process, including initial client prospecting, outreach to potential clients, responding to inbound inquiries, pitching, managing a pipeline, and closing deals Assist in overall business development and strategies and new product development  Skills & Requirements: Education: Law degree required Experience: 3-5 years' professional experience in corporate law, asset management (with business development exposure) or investment banking; comfortable conversing about legal issues in the transactional context Language: Professional fluency in English required; Mandarin and/or Cantonese proficiency preferred Travel: Some travel to major financial centres for sales trips and conferences Proactive & entrepreneurial: Desire and ability to work hard, learn new skills quickly, and operate independently with minimal oversight Executive presence: Ability to sell a complex product to demanding, highly sophisticated customers (e.g., senior internal lawyers, investment professionals, and investment bankers) Background in financial services: Knowledge of target industries, an existing network within these industries, and a demonstrated understanding of our clients' businesses, industries, and needs Communication and interpersonal skills: Superior written and verbal communication skills; excellent interpersonal and social skills Organization: Highly organised and process-driven Team player: Positive attitude; excited by the challenge of working in a fast-growing company to build an exceptional business  About the Team: We're all about freedom. InCloudCounsel is on a mission to free companies from outdated legal processes and corporate lawyers from outdated work models. We're a group of former Big Law lawyers, business professionals, and engineers working together to modernise the legal industry. The people behind developing our product, servicing our customers and lawyer partners, and driving our business operations are dynamic individuals who have also achieved the freedom to do what's important to them - they're musicians, dancers, photographers, sailors, surfers, world travelers, home flippers, and animal lovers - and our freedom inspires us to free others.  Benefits Flexible compensation package that allows employees to participate in long term company growth Semi-weekly lunch perk Medical, dental, and vision insurance Pension fund Generous time off policy Annual professional development stipend Remote work flexibility Work from home budget  All persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in Hong Kong and complete required employment eligibility verification upon hire.  NOTE to External Agencies: We are not accepting any blind submissions or resumes from recruitment agencies. Any CVs sent to a member of InCloudCounsel will NOT be accepted or considered as a submission.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Datto, the world’s leading provider of IT solutions delivered through managed service providers, is looking for an Account Executive to join a growing team. Datto is a creative company at its core and is an exciting and dynamic workplace. We're 100% focused on our managed service provider partners and believe that with the right technology, managed service providers can change how businesses around the world operate. Datto provides data protection, business continuity, networking, business management, and file backup and sync products that empower and protect the clients of our 17,000+ partners. We're headquartered in Norwalk, Connecticut and have 22 offices worldwide.  Reporting to the VP of Global Demand Generation, we are looking for a high-energy, results-oriented Marketing Director with a proven track record of hitting aggressive revenue targets in a rapid growth environment. This is a highly visible role within the region, and you will be responsible for developing and delivering a fully integrated demand generation strategy for APAC, and aligning with APAC GTM teams to deliver on quarterly and annual revenue targets. This role will develop regional marketing programs focused on new business acquisition across emerging markets in Asia, and new business, new product acquisition in ANZ. You will collaborate closely with Datto's field sales teams and corporate marketing teams to develop an effective mix of global and regional campaigns to achieve MQL, opportunity and revenue targets.  Does This Describe You  You're a creative problem solver, a highly collaborative and revenue driven marketer, and highly experienced in developing and executing foundational marketing programs and processes that are scalable and predictable for APAC markets.  A Look Inside The Job Lead the strategy and development of a multi-channel, fully integrated demand generation strategy in the APAC region and ensure execution to achieve MQL, pipeline and revenue targets. Partner with APAC Sales, Sales Development, and Business Development teams to create a holistic and coordinated strategy and execution plans for inbound and outbound demand generation. Create repeatable regionalized programs that build off global demand generation activities, while incorporating region-centric messaging and channels. Serve as the voice of the region with respect to regional nuances and differentiators to/from the field to allow for a constant feedback loop with global teams, to iterate and evolve regional demand generation strategy. Collaborate with Marketing and Sales Operations teams to track key demand gen KPIs, progress vs goals, and develop actionable insights from campaign performance and trends. Set up regular touchpoints with key stakeholders in the GTM organization to review funnel health, assess pipeline health, and present learnings and opportunities to GTM leadership in Marketing QBRs. Develop the demand gen investment strategy across channels and programs, and constantly test new demand gen opportunities to drive awareness and demand for Datto in various APAC markets. Co-lead custom programs with regional leaders, build governance and reporting into programs to ensure scalable best practices and program performance adjustments. Deliver on demand generation metrics and OKRs with a laser focus on data, specifically leading to the regional forecasting, measurement and analysis of APAC Marketing strategy’s impact Optimize conversion funnel and lead nurturing programs to ensure that demand gen initiatives are translating into revenue. About You Seven or more years of proven experience with B2B or B2C SaaS marketing. Proven experience with regional (ANZ, Asia) pipeline generation strategy and implementation. Extensive familiarity with Managed Service Provider and Regional Channel Partner markets. Track record of hitting aggressive growth targets leveraging a diverse set of channels and tactics. Excellent communicator and cross-functional team player. Ability to turn vision into strategy and a marketing plan. Self starter with ability to work independently and as part of a team. High aptitude for looking at problems as opportunities, and working cross functionally to develop region-specific solutions. Proven ability to connect the dots between different teams, and ensure everyone is on the same page with regular communication. Experience building and managing marketing budgets at scale. Experience working with local agencies to scale marketing support for demand generation. In-depth understanding of the Managed Services and Reseller market Excellent people management skills and ability to mentor team members in various offices Customer centric, highly effective at leveraging data to improve decision making. Familiarity with systems like Marketo, Salesforce, Outreach Datto - A little more!  Datto offers Unified Continuity, Networking, and Business Management solutions and has created a one-of-a-kind ecosystem of MSP partners. Datto supports our partners 24/7/365. This commitment is a value at the core of every role in every office, always doing the right thing, and putting our customers first.  Benefits  At Datto, we’re committed to cultivating a healthy, positive and growth enabling environment. We are proud of our wide ranging benefits package which is available to all full-time employees, including: “Datto University” virtual on-boarding program EAP (Employee Assistance Program) LinkedIn Learning Headspace App Employee Resource Groups (Datto Culture, Datto Familia, Datto Pride, Women in Tech) Charity match program Education reimbursement Datto is an equal opportunity employer.  By submitting an application, you acknowledge we will process your data in order to consider you for the position you apply for and for other open positions within our company for which you may be suited. We collect and store your data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Practices.  Note: Only candidates who are Singapore Citizens or hold perm residency will be considered.
industries: Computer Networking, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services

description: Why Work at Lenovo  Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology for all, so we spend our time building a society that’s brighter and more inclusive.  And we go big. No, not big—huge.  We’re not just a Fortune 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. We’re in 180 countries, working with 63,000 brilliant colleagues and counting. And we’re known for the world’s most complete portfolio of smart technology, from devices to software to infrastructure.  With our ingenuity, we help millions—not just the select few—experience our version of a smarter future.  The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...  Description And RequirementsPosition Description:  The Lenovo Services Product Development & SMB Director will be responsible for building Support Services and Lifecycle products and offerings for the SMB and Consumer Services business through the management of a team of Product and Project Managers. Additionally, they will be responsible for the SMB overall business, strategy, and transformation. They will need to understand the Support Services & Lifecycle Services market, build a Lenovo point of view of Services needed and creating a strategy in this space. The role will take this strategy and turn it into a product strategy and products with a clear value proposition that can easily be communicated to Lenovo sales teams and customers.  The Lenovo Services business is a rapidly growing business and the candidate should be prepared to work in a fast paced environment. The Lenovo Services Product Development & SMB Director works with Lenovo Services geographies, the SMB and Consumer organization and other internal stake holders worldwide to understand priorities and align on product strategy and roadmaps. They will manage a team of Product and Project Managers to deliver offerings & products on time and within budget.  This manager will have to build a significant portion of this team by hiring talented individuals with the right experience and skillsets that also fit into the team culture. The candidate should have 10+ years of experience in a combination of IT Technology, Services or Product Development. This candidate should have strong leadership skills, ability to communicate verbally and in writing with leadership executives and the ability to independently create a vision and drive results. People management experience preferred, especially experience building a team.  Position Requirements: Be an expert in the Support Services & Lifecycle space with regards to competitive landscape, technology & customer needs Create product & offerings strategy in the Support Services & Lifecycle space Build and launch offers and products to win in the marketplace resulting in increased Services revenue by effectively managing a team Work closely with other development leaders within Lenovo (Hardware, Services, Software, etc) to align strategies and ensure cohesive product portfolio Work closely with geographies and other Services organizations worldwide to understand priorities & turn this into plans for driving results Represent Lenovo Services interests in meetings with partners & internal colleagues  Required Qualifications: Bachelors degree required, Masters degree a plus 10+ years of IT technology and/or PC Services experience 5+ years of product development or similar experience Management experience preferred, especially experience building effective teams Strong executive presence & leadership skills High level of communication & presentation skills Strong business & financial acumen Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment Collaborative approach to meeting business objectives and ability to influence at all levels of matrixed organizations Experience working with global teams and conducting business internationally  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: At Prudential, we understand that success comes from the talent and commitment of our people. Together, we have a shared vision in securing the future of our customers and our communities. We strive to build a business that you can shape, an inclusive workplace where everyone’s ideas are valued and a culture where we can thrive together. Our people stay connected and tuned in to what’s happening around us, keeping us ahead of the curve. While focused on the long-term, we look to the future to bring growth, development and benefit to everyone whose lives we touch.  Job Profile Summary  Reporting to the Head of a Banca Partnership, you are responsible for driving the partnership’s bancassurance sales in the Private, Onshore, Offshore, Business and Commercial Banking segment. You will also assume responsibilities in developing new segments with the bank partner and managing internal and external stakeholders at a senior level on various strategic and operations related matters.  Job Description Lead a team of business development managers in achieving the bancassurance sales targets of the Private, Onshore, Offshore, Business and Commercial Banking segment Develop and work with the bank stakeholders to drive segments within the partnership and in the process devise and execute propositions to raise productivity within these segments Propose, position and execute initiatives of the partnership that will achieve the company’s objectives particularly in the areas High Net Worth and enterprise solutions Drive the formulation of the overall product development, strategy and solutions, including distributor engagement and initiatives to drive sales Who We Are Looking For  Competencies & Personal Traits Exhibit ability to deliver effective communication and excellent interpersonal skills Possess strong leadership qualities and a mind towards excellence Strategic planning and stakeholder management skills Strong analytical, quantitative, problem solving, communication (written and verbal), presentation; with a high degree of tact. Working Experience At least 10 to12 years of relevant experience with successful track records Prior Bancassurance experience or proven track record in life insurance sales management would be preferred Education Degree/Diploma in Finance/Business relevant fields of studies Language English

jobTitle: Head of Digital Solutions & Transformation - ZP Therapeutics
description: About Zuellig Pharma  Zuellig Pharma (ZP) is one of the largest healthcare services groups in Asia and our purpose is to make healthcare more accessible.  For over 90 years, we have been the trusted partner for healthcare companies looking to realize opportunities in Asian markets. With our deep-reaching infrastructure and sole focus on healthcare, we offer our clients unparalleled access to all healthcare channels across 13 countries in the region. Our focus is always about combining our market insight with a thorough understanding of your needs to deliver the best solution that connects you to patients. We believe delivering your products is only the first step to capturing the Asian markets. That is why we have continued to invest in developing innovative solutions that expand across Distribution, Clinical Reach, Sales & Marketing, Patient Centered Services, and Community Pharmacies.  Zuellig Pharma is the leading provider of distribution services to manufacturers in the life science industry in the Asia Pacific region. With operations in 13 countries or territories Zuellig Pharma has strong market positions, critical mass, broad geographic coverage and significant potential for continuing growth.  We are looking for a Head of Digital Solutions & Transformation to Join ZP Therapeutics Division, lead digital strategy, execution and transformation. This position is base in Singapore and support APAC region.  Responsibilities:  Digital Strategy & Execution ·      Develop digital strategy roadmap aligned with corporate strategy for ZP Therapeutics. ·      Drive the execution of the digital strategies and roadmap, implement the various digital initiatives ·      Develop and implement digital policies and governance to support digital efforts ·      Map the wider ZP Therapeutics digital architecture and interface digital platforms to deliver a complete and integrated enterprise-level digital workplace ·      Help business owners derive functional/technical specifications, conduct technology watch of leading-edge digital technologies in the market and source for most cost-effective solutions. ·      Ensure system or product readiness for smooth deployment, adoption and operations. Analyse impact of requested changes and propose improvements to continuously address changing business needs  Digital Project Management: ·      To lead prioritized digital transformation initiatives in region and enhance organizational digital capability ·      Work cross-functionally and across region to provide project management support as an agile coach / scrum master to digital initiatives in the countries. ·      Analyse project requirements and preparing budgets and schedules. ·      Develop detailed designs, plans, and monitor progress as well as writing up reports. ·      Use data analytics to support the proposal and actions. ·      Support the project communication process by providing clear and concise written and verbal communication to all levels including senior executives and stakeholders, and tailoring style to a broad range of audiences and situations. ·      Work under aggressive timelines to support broad and diverse digital transformation projects.  Digital Transformation ·      Lead transformation design for sales force by introducing relevant digital tools.   ·      Lead behavioural and cultural change ,  develop digital adoption plans and implement change management to ensure full digital and transformation adoption. ·      Coordinate and partner countries to drive respective transformation journey and adjust based on local maturity and capability. ·      Conduct research on market trends and relevant digital tools.  Digital Marketing & Commerce ·      Enable Multi-channel engagement capability and technology ·      In partnership with Marketing team, build digital marketing capability ·      Build E-commerce capability and tools  across the sales and trade marketing organization to ensure everyone has the skillset required to activate effective in the channel Skills & Qualifications: ·      A digital advocate and creative thinker ·      Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills ·      Excellent interpersonal skills, have the ability to network and build relationships ·      Positive attitude and result-driven ·      Effective communications – strong presentation skills, able to clearly present information through different channels ·      Project management skills to drive multiple projects and manage technical implementation to deliver outcomes within the approved budget and timelines ·      Good organisation acumen, excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage with C-suite, internal and external stakeholders as well as technology staff ·      Dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence ·      Excellent problem solving and analytical skills as well as oral and written communication skills  Education & Experience: ·      Min 12 years in digital/technological positions with past experience of successfully leading digital transformation projects. ·      BSc in Digital Marketing, Computer Science, or similar. MBA preferred ·      Relevant experience in the pharmaceutical and/or medical device sectors is a strong plus  ·      Experience in a similar role would be advantageous. ·      Experience for working in regional with thorough understanding of local culture.
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: The Role Klaytn is looking for an Enterprise Business Development Leader to work with B2B use cases around the world, with an initial focus on supporting banking, corporate, and government sectors. In this role you will help lead Klaytn’s strategy and build relationships with enterprises. With primary responsibility for securing and managing partnerships with institutions to build and deploy PoCs and use cases on the Klaytn blockchain. Key to success will be close collaboration and coordination with other teams at Klaytn, including, platform management, engineering, marketing, communications, corporate strategy and business operations. You will also be a thought leader at the intersection of digital assets, blockchain technology, and the various enterprise segments, including the future of blockchain in areas like banking, supply chain, government, travel and hospitality, insurance, and media and entertainment. Ideal candidates should have a strong business development or sales background, a track record for closing first-of-a-kind deals, a proven ability to engage with executives and managers within the enterprise environment, and have a far reaching network Key Responsibilities Further develop Klaytn’s strategy for corporate and institutional engagements in partnership with platform management, engineering, operations, and marketing. Own partnerships, proactively managing a target list and pipeline of enterprise projects and driving the deal process from start to finish. Develop business cases, proposals, or pitches for prospective partners Attain a strong working knowledge of the product/platform, to present and demo in partner meetings. In conjunction with the technical team, manage retail projects against a timeline, proactively planning for resource requirements and ensuring a quality experience for all partners. Serve as a conduit for feedback between partners and our platform, engineering, and marketing teams. Develop strong relationships with institutions, corporations and governments and educate them on Klaytn’s capabilities. Stay abreast of the industry landscape and key developments related to enterprise blockchain adoption. Requirements 4+ years in technology sales or business development, with experience working with blockchain start-ups. Global sales experience is strongly preferred. A strong network of enterprise executives and managers across various sectors is a plus. Adept at learning, and quickly developing a strong command of new, complex technology products and systems. Excels at managing the full partner lifecycle, from developing market strategy to managing a pipeline to closing deals and driving successful implementations. A knack for relationship building and influencing externally, in any given market, and internally with key stakeholders on a team. An understanding of how digital assets and distributed ledger technologies work is preferred but not required. Understanding of relevant regulations and how to navigate them is also preferred but not required. Well organized, with a strong attention to detail, and excellent verbal and written communication skills. MBA preferred

jobTitle: Cluster Director of Sales & Marketing - InterContinental Singapore Robertson Quay
description: At InterContinental® Hotels & Resorts our role is to put the glamour into international travel. That’s where you come in. When you’re part of the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand you’re more than just a job title.  At InterContinental Hotels & Resorts we look for people who are charming, confident, and internationally-minded; people who know what it takes to exceed guest expectations.  Join our team as our Cluster Director of Sales & Marketing in InterContinental Singapore Robertson Quay. You’ll have ambition, talent and obviously, some key skills. We’re looking for someone who:  Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies for 3 Bespoke Hotels to ensure revenue and room night sales goals are achieved, sales and marketing strategies are set, tactical plans are created and implemented, and results are monitored and achieved.  FINANCIAL RETURNS: Achieve budgeted revenues and personal/team sales goals and maximise profitability. Participate in the preparation of the annual departmental operating budget, the hotel marketing plan and business plan, and financial plans. Create and implement sales plans that drive measurable incremental occupancy, increase average rates, increase volume, food and beverage and banquet sales. Review monthly reports and sales forecasts to analyse current/potential market and sales trends, coordinate activities to increase revenue and market share and monitor performance to ensure actual sales meet or exceed established revenue plan. Create and develop special events and sales blitzes to showcase the hotel to potential clients. Attend trade shows and major market events locally and nationally to promote new business and increase sales and marketing opportunities for the hotel.  PEOPLE: Direct day-to-day sales activities, plan and assign work, and establish performance and development goals for team members. Provide mentoring, coaching and regular feedback to help manage conflict, improve team member performance, and recognise good performance. Educate, train and motivate sales and marketing teams to achieve hotel revenue goals. Ensure staff has the information, market data, tools and equipment to successfully carry out job duties. Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts (example: guests, airliners, wholesalers, travel agencies, ad agencies, local community groups) in order to produce group and/or convention business, to include room sales, food and beverage sales, and catering/banquet services.  GUEST EXPERIENCE: Provide guests with information (example: loyalty programmes, area attractions, restaurants, facility information) to enhance guest experience. Schedule conventions and/or business group activities at the hotel and coordinate with other hotel-level departments to facilitate services agreed upon by the sales office and prospective clients. Communicate to appropriate departments all pertinent information requirements and special needs for arriving VIP’s, large groups, and other key guests. Lead marketing efforts to upsell guests on hotel services, offerings, and amenities.  RESPONSIBLE BUSINESS: Identify operational problems that reduce the effectiveness of marketing activities and overall hotel sales performance and work with appropriate department on solutions. Develop awareness and reputation of the hotel and the brand in the local community, may serve as the hotel representative for media related inquiries. Work closely with key business leaders, officials, and representatives of local community groups within the city to ensure constant high profile exposure for the hotel. Effectively communicate and market aspects of the hotel that are sustainable or “green” and use information to gain new business opportunities. Work with advertising agencies, consulting firms, and vendors to maximise advertising investments and ensure ads represent brand identity. Perform other duties as assigned. May also serve as manager on duty.  In return for your hard work, you can look forward to a highly competitive salary and benefits package – including: 5-days work week Duty Meal Birthday Off Learning and Development Opportunities Medical Benefit Dental/ Optical/ Health Screening Benefit Insurance Coverage Special Employee rate at all IHG Hotels worldwide  What’s more, because your career will be as unique as you are, we’ll give you all the tailored support you need to make a great start, be involved and grow.  And because the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand belongs to the IHG® family of brands, you’ll also benefit from all of the opportunities that come from being part of a successful, global hospitality company with over 5900 hotels in over 100 countries around the world.  So whoever you are, whatever you love doing, bring your passion to the InterContinental Hotels & Resorts brand and IHG and we’ll make sure you’ll have room to be yourself. Find out more about joining us today by going to careers.ihg.com
industries: Hospitality

description: About AUGUST BERG AUGUST BERG was founded by Danish entrepreneur and retail specialist Anders Peter Juel Sauerberg, and designed by renowned Danish designer Magnus Joergenson. AUGUST BERG mission is to give “the gift of time” through timefulness (internal values) by living a conscious life with passion, purpose and confidence and through education (external values) by providing a better future for children in Asia and Africa. To give “the gift of time” reflects our ethos and makes us different than other watch & jewellery brands. It is uniquely AUGUST BERG and it speaks to what makes our brand so special. Our Mission is a vital part of our brand and our community. We believe that all children in the world should have access to quality education and decent jobs when they graduate. AUGUST BERG has, therefore, partnered with Human Practice Foundation to provide education to children in Asia and Africa. For every watch sold, August Berg will give a child in Asia and Africa 6-months of quality education, and for every 20,000 watches sold, we will build a new school. The first school we are building is Akadeli Primary school on mount Kenya. About The Job AUGUST BERG is currently looking for an Head of Digital & Ecommerce to build, manage and grow the brand’s presence online. As Head of Digital & Ecommerce, you will have the full responsibility for the P&L, commercial results, growth strategy and all technical aspects for AUGUST BERG online globally (own-and-operated Ecommerce sites as well as Marketplaces), meaning that you will be responsible for all aspects of the business system. Marketing, sales, operations, campaign planning, customer service, and continuous innovation are therefore all elements which you need to take care of on a daily basis. Key Responsibility The Head of Ecommerce has overall end-to-end responsibility for the P&L, commercial results, and growth strategy of AUGUST BERG online globally (own-and-operated Ecommerce sites as well as Marketplaces) Ownership and management of the AUGUST BERG brand identity online Technical responsible for all AUGUST BERG own-and-operated Ecommerce sites as well as Marketplaces While managing the confirmed ROI/ROAS, configuring AUGUST BERG’s multi-channel growth tactic and campaign strategy based on local consumer behaviour: SEO, SEM, social paid, eCRM, affiliate marketing, referral marketing, push notifications, traditional, mobile native and web, programmatic display, etc Identifying and implementing new and innovative ways to optimize ROI/ROAS, including drive & optimize traffic to AUGUST BERG websites and marketplaces as well as developing and improving traffic from the channels Work in synergy with the rest of the AUGUST BERG team to identify new growth opportunities and ways in which to improve our online brand reputation and presence Further Responsibilities Manage logistics – order processing. Overall responsible for the customer service via all channels (livechat, email, social platforms) Who are you? You are Independent and experienced ROI & data analytical mindset A flexible and a hands-on strategic thinker, who excels at both execution and strategy You are proactive, relentless, reliable, and have a high sense of urgency which makes it easy for you to excel a dynamic environmentwhere new challenges and opportunities bring about changes to plan frequently A flexible and a hands-on strategic thinker, who excels at both execution and strategy Requirements A proven track record of driving commercial success forward through disciplined execution of growth activities in Ecommerce from consumer brands You have minimum 5-6 years of P&L responsibility A strong grasp on direct-to-consumer fundamental KPIs and how to improve them with growth measures over time A flexible and a hands-on strategic thinker, who excels at both execution and strategy You have Ecommerce experience from SEA, Japan, US and/or UK (both own Ecommerce sites and marketplaces) You have strong knowledge on Shopify You have a good understanding of UI, UX and web development You have experience with working in a fast-paced, high-performance environment
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: With previous investments in tobacco, the company has recent large scale developments in real estate investments, casinos and software engineering in Cambodia.  The Role  NOTE: Requirement that candidate speaks/writes/reads Mandarin to liaise with required stakeholders  This is a full time position in Cambodia  All travel expenses and visa costs/vaccination and others will be covered by the company.  You Will Be Responsible For Liaising with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to maximise stock availability and minimise lead times. Ensuring stock shortfalls are avoided whilst keeping stock levels to a minimum. Analysing forecasted demand versus production & supply capacities and adjusting accordingly. Accurately projecting supply shortfalls and surpluses in a timely manner. Monitoring data accuracy and consistency of forecast adjustments supplied by sales, production, suppliers etc. Conducting root cause analysis of supply & production side issues. Supporting Sales and Operations in developing supply solutions to maintain fulfilment targets. Coaching, motivating and developing team members and ensuring high operational standards. Developing and leading sourcing strategies together with cross-functional teams across the organisation. Negotiating favourable terms on pricing, payment, delivery lead times and other key areas. Performing ongoing supplier evaluation and improvement. Continuous improvement of sourcing activities by identifying and implementing best practices. Delivering world class business and change management consulting to senior management within client organisations. Supporting clients from various industries in the development and implementation of state-of-the art procurement/supply chain strategies. Working in project teams with both colleagues and client staff from a wide variety of business areas to develop innovative procurement and supply chain solutions. Analysing procurement & supply chain processes together with your counterparts and developing optimised concepts for presentation to the client. Monitoring the market for new best practice tools and techniques, expanding your own knowledge and skills and thereby enabling clients to achieve competitive success. Implementing the strategies and concepts presented within the client organisation and ensuring validation of these strategies. Managing a team of 11-50 people. Ideal Profile You have at least 1 year experience ideally as a Planning/ Forecasting, Sourcing or Supply Chain Consulting within Manufacturing, Transport & Logistics and Hospitality. You possess excellent negotiating skills with a strong ability to influence people of all levels. You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments You are a strong mentor and coach who builds high performing teams You are adaptable and thrive in changing environments What's on Offer?
industries: Hospitality, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: Job Summary:   The Regional Director Asia, Secure ITAD is a high-impact leadership role responsible for driving overall growth, strategy, and alignment with and enablement of sales and other commercial teams, customer-facing operations, and general management activities for the Asia Secure ITAD / ITAM business.   The Regional Director owns the Secure ITAD / ITAM P&L and drives the business in conjunction with the Global Secure ITAD / ITAM team as well as in conjunction with the Asia Senior leader and Cluster VPs. The Regional Director is responsible for leading and executing select strategic initiatives that drive revenue growth, increase contribution margins, and deliver increased process efficiency for the business. While the business is driven in conjunction with the existing operational and sales teams, the Regional Director is ultimately responsible for the sales and operational results.     The Regional Director brings relevant ITAD / ITAM and/or similar service business experience. S/he regularly represents the business externally with customers, partners and internally with operations and sales leaders and teams. This requires having a deep understanding of the global service portfolio, value propositions, financial measures and performance, product/service roadmaps, successes, plans, and team members. The role includes direct people management of the Secure ITAD / ITAM SDEs and PMEs.   The Regional Director plays an important role in evaluating performance results, identifying and assessing risk factors, managing action item registers and action trackers for Secure ITAD commitments, tracking industry and market intelligence, and providing perspective and points of view on opportunities, threats, risks and issues to be addressed by Global Team as well as the Asia Regional team.  The successful candidate will be growth-oriented, operationally strong, globally inclined, P&L-experienced, and highly customer facing.    Responsibilities:  Sets overall Secure ITAD / ITAM strategic direction for the Asia Region, including strategy, marketing campaigns, targeted customers, partner relationships, multi-year planning, etc. Owns Secure ITAD / ITAM service line P&L and forecasting processes for Asia Identifies and may lead initiatives that support the achievement of multi-year revenue and contribution targets Plans, organizes, and chairs business reviews to ensure that goals, objectives and overall progress are being measured and reported on Key Go-to-market responsibilities Aligns tightly with Sales, especially at the VP and Director level, to drive Secure ITAD / ITAM focus, grow program roster and billing, and generally remove roadblocks Influence marketing strategy and programs, including demand generation, account-based marketing, verticals, etc.  Owns relationships with industry partners in the Region Develop relationships with key customers in the Region Support the sales team in key customer discussions, negotiations, presentations, relationships Help develop plan on which customers or verticals to target Drive Program Growth through the Program Managers once a customer has been onboarded.   Develops and executes Secure ITAD pricing and revenue management strategies for the Region Maintains matrix accountability for Secure ITAD / ITAM operational performance, including back office / customer care and field operations (to include relationships across Iron Mountain and partner networks) Maintains accountability for driving any service incidents and/or issues to satisfactory completion  Ensure consistency and compliance with standards developed for our Global ITAD / ITAM business, including quality and SLA performance Drives enhancements customer experience, operational, and technology, in conjuncture with the Global ITAD/ITAM team, to enhance revenue, service delivery, and margin Monitors in region vendor performance and compliance, coordinates corrective actions where necessary Drives a strong culture of talent development with consistent standards and approaches to talent assessment.  Develops a pipeline of of talent to ensure we are hiring the best diverse talent to drive the high level of growth expected in this service line   Requirements: Bachelor’s degree is required (or equivalent experience in the ITAD / ITAM industry), preferably in business, marketing, finance or related field, MBA preferred Background/ Experience 3+ years of Director/VP level experience with general business management, sales leadership, corporate strategy, product management, or business unit / general management 5+ years of experience managing complex initiatives and delivering on measurable goals Proven experience motivating and managing direct and indirect reports and organizations Skills  Business and GTM strategy Financial management Sales Management People/talent management Strong communication skills Ability to simplify complex information to communicate to various audiences Flexibility to take on a wide range of initiatives Ability to influence and navigate across the organization
jobFunction: Product Management, Business Development, and Information Technology

description: The Sales Director is responsible for leading the team to drive NCS sales, including account penetration, prospect qualification, supervision of sales activity, sales process planning, and closing all sales opportunities in the industry and/or sector that he/she is in. He/She is expected to build deep and trusted business relationships with the client to seed and grow future opportunities.  Beyond managing his/her own Business Centre’s sales, sold margin and revenue achievements, he/she also act as trusted client advisors to customise and sell NCS solutions and services according to the business needs of clients.  Reporting to the CSU Lead, PS, he/she will work within the PS Client Service Unit, and across Lines of Businesses (LOBs), NEXT Services. He/she will work with the teams to define the solution offerings & value propositions to maximise NCS’ win probability in each and every opportunity. This is achieved by him/her having a deep understanding of the business needs of the clients and developing sales pipelines.  Key Responsibilities Orchestrate externally and internally to create environment for successful delivery Assess high level conceptual design to ensure that what is sold can be delivered at the right margin Establish responsive business relationship with client including problem reporting and resolving highly complex service delivery issues when escalated Lead and manage the project delivery teams to ensure timely and quality delivery of services to the client in a cost-effective manner Identify, assess and resolve complex business problems/issues and propose alternative solutions Identify and manage issues and risks and act as an escalation point within the account Manage and monitor account level risk dollar and budget; control costs to ensure maximum achievement of revenue and margin Manage risk and impact of change requests and assist with service request of variation order negotiation Work closely with the Lines of Business on project capability gaps Manage sub-contractors and vendor contract escalated matters Act as the Solution Lead to ensure solution consistency and be the custodian of architecture  The Ideal Candidate Should Possess Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related discipline. PMP certification preferred More than 15 years experience in IT or ICT Consulting industry with 8 years or more in leadership positions Delivered projects relating to the specific domain or industry Process broad business acumen and deep industry knowledge, and to use this knowledge to develop/enhance client relationships. Consulting practitioner preferred Proven track record in assuming overall responsibility and managing multi-million dollars projects in key client industry Process ‘hands-on’ knowledge, vast exposure and wealth of experience within vendor and user environment, coupled with a driven and self-motivated personality. Experience in managing measured productivity-driven operations or teams Consulting practitioner Good communication skills Understand and ability to apply social style techniques to manage stakeholders Client focused with strong organizational and project management skills Ability to lead multiple teams
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Description  Position at MediaCom  Reporting of the role  This role reports to the Regional Director.  Key Markets  Australia, China, India, Japan  Duties And Responsibilities Proactively identify regional and local client needs. Lead and build strategic platforms (using local market intelligence) and POVs that can be adopted and adapted around the region; leverage global POVs for region where relevant Work with Mediacom local markets to adapt global guidance, and listen to local market pain points on global guidance and help adapt Ensure compliance with Mediacom and client global guidance & collaborate with Mediacom global team Meet with core markets on regular basis, provide regular updates to global and local directors, and escalate issues to global MC leadership (and client leadership) as necessary Help to address critical issues as they arise. Sample issues might be “Sales on the ecommerce site are lower than expected in Japan. Can you help us figure out why?” or “We want to launch a new computer for “PC gaming”, what media approach makes sense for ANZ?” Develop and maintain critical relationships with senior local clients People Responsibilities Collaborative leader - distributed leadership and collaboration, engaging with people of all levels and the ability the lead; coordination across the globe/markets May have small direct team or may need to be an individual contributor Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Responsive - ability to jump in and respond to anything from big picture POVs to supply tactical plans/ideas Nimble - ability to be flexible and apply 80/20, has some self-driven hustle and sense of urgency Embrace ambiguity - deciphers and distills questions and answers Proactive Service mentality with client & across network; and proactive communications Innovation - revisiting/introducing new frameworks, principles, processes on a proactive basis Thoughtful - possess a POV across marketing, media, marcom, creative, messaging, etc. Business Maturity - ability to sit across the table and be a strategic partner/trusted advisor to senior clients Individual Contributor - ability to deliver and high level of accountability Follow through Qualifications And Experience Background - Strategy, digital strategy, communications planning, new business/consulting Form - Experience delivering actionable strategies; good storytelling in verbal and written form Approach - Strong leadership qualities, attention to detail and delivery to deadlines. Flexibility - The job is regional so the candidate must have some flexibility in terms of time and location depending on the task. Regional travels will be required too. Strong experience in B2C needed. Some B2B experience desirable (small business or other). General interest in technology or tech category experience desirable. Asia experience, required and experience operating in more than one country in the region preferred Culture - Be a great example of our company behaviors – know it / push it / share it / do it. Style - Must be confident and approachable, helpful and easy to work with. More About Mediacom  Welcome innovators, initiative takers and instigators.  Founded in 1986 and established in Japan for over 10 years, we have grown to become 8,500 of the world’s leading media communications specialists, in 125 offices, across 100 countries. We are proud to be recognised as the Japan Media Agency of the Year in both 2017 and 2018 with a Silver Award in 2019. With clients including Adidas, Mars, SK-II, Dell, The Coca-Cola Corporation, Cartier, IKEA, Peugeot and Citroen, working at MediaCom is a gateway to working with leading global brand organisations and connecting to people across the planet. But the real secret to our success is simple (and not really a secret). It’s our People First, Better Results philosophy.  Our focus is on providing long term, rewarding careers and we know that when we invest in our people, we’ll deliver better results not only for them, but also for our clients. We also know that talent comes in all shapes, sizes, genders and ethnicities. That’s why our agencies are open environments that celebrate difference and have built in flexibility that reflects the many different ways in which people work and succeed. And its why we actively encourage participation in our Global Mobility programme with opportunities to live and work around the world.  We are super connected and our employees contribute to and shape the working environment, from promoting work-life balance and well-being to organising team events and celebrations. Do you want to work with smart, creative, connected and enthusiastic people in a stable and rewarding environment? So do we.  Welcome to MediaCom.  More About GroupM  GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.  GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: Our client just began hiring this position “Sales & Marketing Director”  Please have a look and drop me a message at j.oishi@fellow-s.com.sg with your latest CV.  Title  Sales &Marketing Director  Conditions  Work Location: Singapore  Estimated Start of work: January 2022  Probational Period: 3 Months  Working hours： 9 am – 6 pm, 1h lunch break  Working Place: WFH (Currently applied)  Annual Salary: SGD 120,000~130,000/Year  Including  Annual Wage Supplement: One Month Basic Salary, Valuable Bonus: Annual Wage Supplement  Medical Benefit: The receipts will be reimbursed by the Company up to a maximum of S$500.00 per year.  Annual Leave: 14 days or prorated for first year and one additional day for every subsequent year, maximum of 20 days  Sick Leave: 14 days  Qualifications And Skills Being able to close sales conversations (Well-experienced) Manage the Singapore team, which consists initially of 2 people, one Evangelist (male) and one admin person(female). Some initial people management skills. Well-connected in the tech, or more specifically in the IoT and agency business Technical skills, understanding of internet technology systems and system integration Great personal skills Good English proficiency Keen to learn and grow with the team and with the company Japanese language and culture knowledge is a plus because the HQ is based in Tokyo. Responsibilities Sales expansion of this company’s product (Software/Application) Co-work with international business development team There will be no budget responsibility in the beginning. However, there might be budget responsibility for the Sales and Marketing division later. This team member will have to act as Sales & Marketing Director in Singapore
