description: Axess Group is seeking an experienced Business Controller who will be responsible for our entities in Asia-Pacific.  Areas of Responsibility Continuous financial follow up of all projects in Operations in APAC: Project budget Project costs Project invoicing Optimization of contribution margin Internal audits Fulfill monthly period closing including accruals for all projects in APAC Close review of projects CMRs monthly Establish revenue estimate for 6 monthly forecasts for APAC. Continuous profit analyses, including segment profitability, product profitability, KPI’s measurement etc. Participate on contractual issues, in connection with major sales processes. Work out yearly budget for Operations together with Operations Management. Super user in ERP/Agresso on behalf of Operations. Participate in further development of our system. Special responsibility for: Invoicing system/routine QA/QC of entered information from accountants Member of Operations Management Team, participate in strategic development and corporate direction. Internal Invoice on a regular basis In charge of preparing and overseeing payroll in Singapore Managing of outstanding invoices to clients both internal and external Monitoring bank account cash flow, coordinating closing with accountants and CFO Monitoring of petty cash and float in Singapore Consolidate contractors’ expenses and approvals for projects Create simple effective procedures for good economic control within the company. Management of taxation across existing APAC entities in full compliance with all applicable laws Lead communication with tax consultants regarding opening of new entities in APAC Other tasks on demand of Operations and CFO. Qualification Requirements Bachelor Degree or higher in Accounting, Economics, or similar 5 + years in relevant accounting or financial controlling role. Good understanding and experience with accounting, including tax, legal issues, accruals, forecasting etc Audit background Outdoor values Structured and target oriented Ability to get an overview of complex issues and prioritize Strong working capacity Availability for occasional travel Preferably Singaporean citizen or PR Flexible and versatile Willing to grow with the company

description: About The Role  As a Client Portfolio Director, you enjoy the challenges and opportunities that come with managing major client accounts and building long term productive relationships.  You will understand the client’s needs and proactively identify new business opportunities, keeping the client up to date with the latest InvestCloud solutions, products & services, while providing thought leadership in the Wealth Management and Insurance domains. Participate in business reviews identifying areas for strategic growth and opportunities across the Wealth Management and Insurance domains.  As the Client Portfolio Director, you will have a portfolio of clients and programs/projects, that you are responsible for from inception through to completion. You will ensure that the best practices and structures for good project governance are in place for our client and InvestCloud teams, ensuring the successful and profitable delivery of the solution.  You will be adaptable and flexible liaising with the client stakeholders, the project and delivery teams. You will provide the leadership, support, mentoring and empowerment of the InvestCloud project & delivery teams to ensure the teams have the best environment possible to be productive.  Key Responsibilities Manage a portfolio of clients and the associated programs & projects of work. Grow the client accounts with the sales team, leveraging their knowledge and relationships. Network build and maintain relationships with clients with a focus on long term productive relationships. Identify up sell opportunities within the existing InvestCloud APAC client base through structured plans and approach to increase product offering in existing client base. Strategy build and create specific client account strategy ensuring its synergy with InvestCloud product roadmap. Drive and deliver a product road map with internal and external stakeholders, regular C-level interaction at top tier banks and insurance companies. Mentoring and guidance to the project & delivery teams to optimise overall productivity, skills and knowledge Stakeholder management both internal and external throughout the client projects. Support the delivery of country and regional level programs using continuous and Agile methodology. Focus on risk management, identify and mitigate risk and issues. Apply best practice project governance and structures and controls. Collaborate with internal teams to shape and define business proposals and statements of work. Work with the client delivery team focused on APAC implementation projects. Requirements Education Degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, Finance or other related fields from a well-recognized University Industry Experiene 10 years + of relevant experience ideally within Wealth Management & Insurance Technical Insight Knowledge of AGILE project/program management methodology and experience of digital delivery. Experienced in identifying opportunities within your portfolio of clients Excellent presentation, verbal and written communications skills. Proactive. Focus on risk management, identify and mitigate risk issues and ensure the team is able to implement and follow solutions designed. Must have a strong sense of work commitment and should be able to handle – in fact, really enjoy! - a fast-paced project environment. About InvestCloud  InvestCloud is a global company specializing in digital platforms that enable the development of financial solutions, pre-integrated into the Cloud. The company offers on-demand client experiences and intuitive operations solutions using an ever-expanding library of modular apps, resulting in powerful products. Headquartered in Los Angeles, InvestCloud has over 20 global offices including New York, London, Geneva, Singapore, Tokyo, and Sydney, supporting trillions in assets across hundreds of diverse clients – from the largest banks in the world to wealth managers, asset managers and asset services companies.  For more information visit www.investcloud.com
industries: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Director Commercial Asia, Titan Aviation Leasing Pte. Ltd.
description: The primary focus of the Director Commercial Asia is to develop and lead the Titan Singapore Aircraft Leasing Pte. Ltd (“Titan Singapore”) sales capability and activities in Asia, increasing their visibility to relevant airlines and freight operators in the region and to originate new business for the group.  Responsibilities  Commercial Development & Regional Leadership: Primary point of contact for relationships with airlines in Asia and originate new business for Titan Singapore within the region. Lead regional short-term and long-term placements of the fleet and coordinate global activities. Contribute to and coordinate a marketing strategy and a dry leasing sales plan, and deliver results based on set objectives. Execute regional external communication and marketing activities in coordination with Titan’s Global Head of Commercial and AAWW Head of Corporate Communication. Coordinate regional market research and customer intelligence to ensure that Titan possesses best-in-class market intelligence of all related business activities (e.g. market development, supply and demand, strategic development, competitor activities etc.) and communicate pro-actively with key stakeholders Develop and maintain a competitor database in order to provide relevant and up to date competitor information. Lead the day-to-day management of Titan’s Customer Relationship Management system Salesforce by coordinating and managing customer development leads and opportunities including customer intelligence. Coordinate the research and execute the development of pricing guidelines for regional dry leasing activities. Partnering with Finance to the development of the annual revenue and cost budget for Titan. Contribute to OEM discussions, alongside development of future aircraft acquisitions. Manage the regional Know-Your-Customer process as part of the company’s compliance policy. Maintain close working relationships with the global sales force and other constituents of the Atlas and Titan teams. Collaborate closely with the Finance team to ensure a well-functioning revenue collections process. Support other AAWW business unit sales efforts as applicable for transactions outside the United States. Qualifications Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Marketing or similar required. MBA or advanced degree highly preferred. 9-11 years prior work experience with an aircraft leasing company, airline, OEM or similar company in the transportation industry is required. At least 3-8 years of airline marketing experience within the Asia or EMEA region. Deep practical knowledge of how to structure lease agreements, ensuring a ‘win-win’ for both clients and Titan Singapore in the long-term. Special Demands Flexibility to work additional hours and travel as required. Skills Proven commercial acumen and an ability to originate new deal flow and an ability to negotiate Letters of Intent (LOIs). Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to interact at all levels of customers and within all AAWW companies. Experiences in working successfully and collaboratively with customers and business partners to deliver value-added and focused processes and solutions. In-depth knowledge of the aircraft market, particularly freighters and freighter conversions. Ability to work across different cultures and work environments. Excellent computer skills including Excel and PowerPoint. Highly organized individual with emphasis on accuracy and timeliness. Strong analytical skills. Executive presence and excellent communication skills. Demonstrated ability to think strategically and execute on agreed strategy. Working Mandarin an advantage.
industries: Airlines/Aviation

jobTitle: Regional Director of App Product (Early Learning)
description: Company  Description  LingoAce is a global leading EdTech (education technology) company, headquartered in Singapore, that currently focuses on providing a quality and immersive Chinese language learning experience to students aged 4 to 15 years old. In addition to its headquarters in Singapore, LingoAce also has a presence in Beijing, Wuhan, Chengdu, Silicon Valley, Bangkok and Jakarta and will continue to expand into other parts of the world to meet the growing demand for language learning.  Founded in 2017, LingoAce leverages its experienced teaching team, AI-powered tools, gamification features and research-backed methodology to provide students with the best learning experience and results.  LingoAce has raised several rounds of venture funding from leading global investors, including Sequoia, Tiger Global and Owl Ventures, to support its vision for revolutionizing learning across the world.  Today, LingoAce has a total registered student base of 300,000 students across 80 countries – coming from families of different nationalities including international expats, Chinese immigrants, and local parents. The company has more than 3,000 teachers and 1,250 employees globally.  Responsibilities Overall P&L owner for Ace Early Learning (English) in South East Asia, responsible for the marketing, distribution, customer support and localization of the business Through product localization, user identification and acquisition, go-to-market & pricing strategies, hiring and organization build out, and a launch roadmap for SEA Collaborate with Content and Product Development teams in Beijing for key features and content development based on local user insights (qualitative and quantitative) and app metrics Remotely lead the local community managers to execute the localization strategy, including originate/implement local marketing campaign, app localization, pilot user group engagement, pricing and go to market implementation Requirements Degree/Master with more than 8 years relevant experience in a SEA capacity. >4 years of go-to-market experience in marketing, sales, growth, product launch in a B2C digital business (I.e. gaming, social, rideshare, fintech, software, media, SaaS etc.) Proven leadership experience of >5 people with P&L responsibilties. Education industry/background will be a plus Product Management experience
industries: E-Learning

description: Strategic Marketing Collaborate closely with cluster ASEAN senior leadership to develop marketing and brand strategy to drive the awareness of the brands in the ASEAN Market Develop annual marketing and brand plans to achieve defiend business goals Define optimal marketing mix to drive targeted market segments through analysis of market data and business environment Cooperate with the ASEAN/Local sales team to align on strategic goals to define clear actions points Manage the overall marketing budget with clear priorities of investment areas and A&P requirements e-Commerce Sales Management & Strategy Strategize and implement e-commerce sales strategy to achieve the ASEAN business objectives Conceptualize pricing strategies to maximize turnover and profitability Develop relationship with key partners to develop the business Analyze market trends, consumer behavior and competitor activities and maintain competitors' benchmarking constantly Consumer Marketing Lead the acceleration of digital marketing which targets the defined audiences Coordinate and excute 360 marketing activities/campaign as per the annual marketing plan Drive brand segmentation to profile the right target audien to create brand differentiation Requirements Bachelor of Business with a Major in Marketing or Communication Minimum of 8-10 Years of experience in Omnichannel Marketing and/or Brand communication At least 3 years of leading a team with minimum of 3 years in a regional role Experience in working/collaboration with e-commerce e.g., D2C or Pure Players 360 Marketing Communication (ATL, BTL and Digital) ASEAN/Local cultural understanding To submit your application for the opportunity, please click on the "Apply Now" button.  Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  Lucas Benjamin WATT  EA Licence No: 11C5502 | EAP Registration No: R1434417

description: The Director, Food & Beverage will be responsible for overseeing existing hotels’ culinary and F&B operational and financial performance as well as service standards in conjunction with the Company's Vision, Purpose and Values. You are also responsible for developing concepts and operating service standards for the restaurants and bars.  Responsibilities Direct, lead and manage the Food & Beverage (F&B) division. Serve as a business consultant and provide strategic direction to all the outlets of F&B and IBU Management on all aspects of operation, promotion and innovation. Plan and direct the functions of administration and strategy of the F&B department to meet daily operational needs. Overall responsibility for all operational components of the F&B division to ensure efficiency and effectiveness of operations. Ensure quality and authenticity of offerings and service across all outlets in order to consistently deliver memorable food and beverage experiences for all guests. Drive high levels of guest satisfaction through the consistent execution of all brand standards, visible operational leadership, active trend analysis and hands-on interaction with guests and associates. Maintain and develop high standards of operations in all restaurants, bars and events by ensuring all SOPs are relevant, up to date, trained effectively and operationally delivered. Responsible for the development and implementation of F&B’s annual business plan and medium-term strategies, as well as establishing key performance objectives and plans to ensure the hotel meets its business targets and drives sustainable, profitable growth. Responsible for the conceptual and operational design of restaurant and bar concepts if required. Be an active participant in the strategic marketing approach to ensure exposure the restaurants and bars including the development and implementation of the department’s annual and monthly promotions calendar. Work with the hotel’s internal Marketing team to develop active strategies that maintain a strong social and traditional media capture. Collaborate with the Corporate Executive Chef and Executive Chef to continually review and refresh menu offerings as required by locality and region, drive and take responsibility for the financial performance of the hotel’s F&B outlets. Create an operational environment of education and empowerment that energizes associates to focus on guest preferences and aspirations. Continuous focus on associate satisfaction and ensure continuous improvement action plans are executed effectively, and as needed, with a focus on a team and succession planning culture. Cultivate a positive culture and formulate strategies to continually improve the guest experience, sharing positive and negative feedback with associates and using this feedback as a platform for OJT. Develop, implement and maintain a review and response programme for all Outlet Managers covering TripAdvisor and blogs relevant to F&B, with results discussed and necessary actions effected in weekly F&B meetings. Conduct hygiene audits in conjunction with the Chief Steward/ Hygiene Officer and Executive Chef in order to ensure levels of cleanliness and hygiene are in accordance with local laws and brand standards. Guide and attend daily operations meetings with the F&B team to plan for immediate operational demands, manage daily and plan for operational challenges, highlight VIP events and follow up on personal tasks and projects. Meet with the team to support, strategize, plan and manage each F&B operation; coach and develop personal aspirations and goals. Daily monitoring of F&B performance and take responsibility for its achievement by reviewing daily operational reports and using the information contained to drive sales. Review annual budgets yearly and forecasts monthly for each outlet with F&B team and Operations Managers. Collate individual outlet budgets and forecasts into annual divisional budget and forecast. Review quarterly competitor set analyses, to ensure hotel F&B offerings are current and competitive, reviewing and amending hotel offerings if required. Manage all outlets’ individual profit and loss statements, clearly outlining both revenue contributions and expenses. Guide monthly profit and loss (P&L) meetings to assess financial performance, identify gaps, assess competitor revenue and develop new strategies to increase revenue where opportunities exist. Review promotions P&L prior to events, and immediately after to identify whether promotion was cost effective and should be continued in the future. Post-mortems to be planned annually in advance. Requirements Over 10 years of leadership experience in the hotel industry, preferably in 5-star international chains with high-volume restaurants, bars, and catering/ banqueting operations. Significant Asian culinary experience/exposure. Proven track record in the ability to conceptualize, promote and deliver innovative promotional events. Proven technology focus and an ability to simplify processes through the use of technology. Diploma or Degree from a recognised hospitality/tertiary institution. Good marketing and promotion experience which includes digital and social media. A change agent, highly innovative and adaptable. A good people manager with ability to motivate a well-established team. High level of both verbal and written communication. Able to develop and/or improve upon SOPs.
industries: Retail, Leisure, Travel & Tourism, and Hospitality

jobTitle: SVP/VP, Team Head, Central Program Office, Consumer Banking Group
description: Business Function  As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you.  Lead the Central Programme Office to strengthen business origination, work with various business partners including Business Analytics, Sales Distribution, Marketing and Products. Support and oversee business planning leveraging on a data-driven model to manage and drive business activities to support investment and insurance business.  Responsibilities Develop clear strategies to generate more sources of business origination to support the growth of Investment and Insurance business Collaborate and co-create strategies/plans with multiple business partners, to drive performance of business origination channels with a focus on online to offline customer acquisition and engagement Support and oversee monthly business planning leveraging on a data driven operating model in collaboration with stakeholders across various functions including distribution channels, marketing and product Oversee the DBS Workplace Banking Programme and develop strategies to build engagement with companies to promote employee financial wellbeing Requirements Bachelor Degree with minimum 8-12 years experiences in Business Analytics, Sales Distribution, and/or Channel management experience will be advantageous Proven leadership skills Strong analytical skills and business acumen Strong interpersonal and communication skills Good organization and project management skills Pro-active, creative and independent Apply Now  We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Change the way customers and partners live and do business while helping them grow their top and bottom line with our transformative technology.  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team partners with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  Position Summary  As Director, Solution Provider Channel Resell for APAC, you will lead a team, drive the Channel Resell route to market, and generate resell revenue for the region. You will recruit, develop, manage and ultimately inspire several direct reports across ANZ and SE Asia regions. You have significant experience working with Solution Provider Channel Resellers and Distributors, understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate partnerships and grow the region. You will work with HQ to develop the regional strategy in connection to the global strategy and execute the plan. You are team player, problem solver, and have a tide rises all ships mentality and will help and support other team members succeed. You are a great communicator and will represent Channel Resell business in the region. In this position, you will collaborate closely with leadership in Sales, Partner Ecosystem, Marketing, Customer Success, Enablement, and Product to drive the strategy while aligned with global strategy.  This is a great opportunity for an experienced Channel Resell or Business Development leader to join a growing channel team and make a significant impact in the region.  This is a people manager position and reports to Senior Director, Global Business Development and Channels in the US. This role is designated as a flex role.  Responsibilities Lead the Channel Resell team in APAC. Recruit, develop, and manage the team. Responsible for resold revenue in APAC. Forecast, report and deliver against quarterly revenue targets. Present and report APAC Channel Resell at regional meetings. Utilize regional experience to enhance regional strategy. Work with cross functional teams – Sales, Sales Ops, Marketing, Customer Success, Support, and Product – to implement and execute strategy. Create APAC annual plans that align to global Channel Resell goals including target setting by country, resource allocation, and coordination with other teams. Leverage existing relationships at partners to help your team to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Forge strong DocuSign-internal relationships with key leaders and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. Represent DocuSign with partners and present at partner events. Basic Qualifications A BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience At least 12 years of relevant experience At least 5 years in Channel Sales or equivalent quota-carrying role. Proven track record of hitting and exceeding quota. At least 5 years of experience leading and managing teams Execution focused but able to think broadly in context of regional strategy Excellent written and communication skills including public speaking Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary, typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Preferred Qualifications MBA or JD from top tier school 10+ years leading partner teams Specific experience in the SaaS & Cloud space Demonstrable experience serving customers in Corporate and SMB Versed in business throughout AP/J, with multi-vendor deal experience spanning the many countries and varying business models across the region About Us  DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing.  DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  Accommodations  DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.
industries: Computer Software

description: A Bit About Epsilon Epsilon is the leader in outcome-based marketing. We enable marketing that’s built on proof, not promises. Through Epsilon PeopleCloud, the marketing platform for personalizing consumer journeys with performance transparency, Epsilon helps marketers anticipate, activate and prove measurable business outcomes. Powered by CORE ID®, the most accurate and stable identity management platform representing 200+ million people, Epsilon’s award-winning data and technology is rooted in privacy by design and underpinned by powerful AI. With more than 50 years of experience in personalization and performance working with the world’s top brands, agencies and publishers, Epsilon is a trusted partner leading CRM, digital media, loyalty and email programs. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with over 8,000 employees in over 40 offices around the world. For more information, visit epsilon.com. Follow us on Twitter at @EpsilonMktg.    What You Will Do  Epsilon is seeking a Digital Solutions Consultant in its Enterprise Software Sales Division who will be responsible for presenting and highlighting the People Cloud Loyalty software product to prospective clients. These activities will include: Successfully demonstrate Epsilon’s solution capabilities to prospective clients within the context of their business and marketing environment Effectively collaborate with sales teams (including cross-functional representatives from sales, client services, product management and custom development) in the pursuit of new business opportunities Serve as a subject matter expert in proposing and presenting Epsilon’s People Cloud Loyalty offerings Advise on best practices utilization of advanced product functionality Analyze and prioritize detailed business and technical requirements Build a comprehensive understanding of People Cloud Loyalty and go to market value proposition and act as an evangelist with key prospects and targets Partner with Product Management to identify market trends, solution benefits and contribute to direction of product roadmap Role will include preparing and delivering on product demonstrations This will be an Individual Contributor role.   What You Will Need Minimum of 11 years’ industry experience Bachelor’s or Advanced Degree preferred Able to configure / customize demo environments (either individually or working with a remote team) Understand and articulate value proposition of software products to help attract, engage and retain prospects/customers across verticals Be conversant in both the business and technical aspects of solution to confidently answer client questions and inquiries, and to facilitate effective decision making Ability to think strategically (outside-the-box) and provide creative solutions Able to lead or co-lead client meetings, with a strong ability to consume, distill and process information in real-time in order to problem solve in the context of the solution Prior Solution Consulting / Sales Engineering experience Ability to tell a compelling story and build customer journeys Strong experience and knowledge within Digital Marketing ecosystem, customer experience and technology Excellent written and verbal communication skills Will require some travel Prefer candidates that are based in Singapore with a Citizenship / PR/ EP.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Department: None Description  Description:  Asia Pacific Business Leader for a $80M Lifecycle/MRO business with a defined “Operational Certainty” strategy with critical customers site across 6 regions.  Job Responsibilities: Develops, executes and advances a multi-tier service strategy for Pressure Management products & solutions with 25 Authorized Service Providers and 2 Tier 3 service centers in Asia Pacific. Develops, executes and advances a suite of Lifecycle capabilities to offer PRM customers a total Lifecycle experience in maintaining and extending its OPEX life span. Develops, executes and advances a series of Lifecycle programs to penetrate proactively critical customer sites to harvest Emerson installed base as well as displacing competitors’ installations. Manages directly a team of AP subject matter experts as well as all Sales & Service channels through PRM Authorized Service Providers program. Manages AP Lifecycle services financial sales and margins growth targets on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis with forward 5-year projections. Understands and owns PRM installed bases and its critical sites to formulate its penetration and growth strategies. Communicates, aligns and proposes PRM Lifecycle services business and its strategies with senior management on a regular basis. Responsible for the department P&L financial objectives.    Job Requirements: Degree in Engineering or related discipline with MBA is highly preferred. Proactively engage and listening to the voice of our customers – understanding Asia Pacific customers’ needs and pain points. Demonstrated abilities in leading and driving Lifecycle initiatives, preferably in the Oil & Gas and process industries. Strategic ability to embrace diversity and translate regional customers’ voice, competition and global directives into the Asia Pacific Lifecycle Services strategies. Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate in both technical and business terms. Strong influencing skills to communicate, synergize and drive those key strategies throughout the World Area and across Business Units.    WHY EMERSON?  Our Commitment to Our People  We invest in our employees to ensure they have the marketplace knowledge, skills and competencies to compete and lead in a global economy. Our training programs focus on end-to-end development from onboarding through senior leadership.  Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer you the right options to meet your individual/family needs  Our success is measured by the positive impact we make on people, our communities and the world in which we live.  Learn more about us! .  Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion  At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place.  Diversity and Inclusion at Emerson is about welcoming, respecting, and valuing the differences each employee possesses. Inclusion is creating a real sense of engagement, belonging and connection for all employees. Learn more about our  Culture & Values  and about  Diversity & Inclusion at Emerson .   If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, you can request help by sending an email to idisability.administrator@emerson.com .       Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore-West Coast  Job Function  Other  Date  Sep 8, 2021, 3:43:52 AM

description: As the Head of Product, you will be responsible for the supply chain financing proposition of Green Link Bank.  Green Link Digi Bank is Singapore's inaugural wholesale Digi bank focusing on supply chain finance, mainly serving MSMEs and aiming to help MSMEs grow and improve digitization.  You’ll Be Formulating business strategy in acquiring and retaining customer, promoting Green Link Bank as customer’s preferred choice in supply chain and trade financing Designing and executing Green Link Bank’s supply chain financing products, including but not limited to: payables, receivables and purchase order financing Monitoring product pipelines, leading product managers to deliver products per Bank strategy Responsible for the full suite of digital trade propositions, including but not limited to: trade document exchange digitalisation, e-Invoicing, e-Bill of Lading, e-Letter of Credit, electronic payment commitment Reporting directly to Chief Digital Officer, joining his/her in relevant Committees to represent product Working closely with customer service, sales, relationship management, legal, operations and IT development to ensure product is timely delivered Joining sales force in customer and partner pitch Assist in review, analysis and recommendation of company policies, procedures, quality, and standard work practices to ensure effective performance of treasury activities and adherence to relevant laws, digital bank’s policies, and rules and regulations established by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) Managing a team of product managers You Should Apply If You Have at least 8 years of work experience at a financial institution(s), of which at least 4 years of experience in senior positions Are a domain expert in supply chain and trade financing and trade digitalisation Have solid people management and customer management skills Have proven ability in driving outcomes where influence and consensus building are key Are great at stakeholder management, able to thoughtfully and tactically challenge status quo Are an excellent communicator, able to communicate clearly in both English and Mandarin is advantageous to liaise with stakeholders in China Are organised, detail oriented and thorough
industries: Banking

description: Together We Can Make A Difference  At Getinge we are dedicated and passionate about helping our customers save lives and ensure excellent care. A career at Getinge provides career opportunities that both inspire and challenge. Here, you can make a difference every day.  Overview  Support the regional management by providing insights on the business in the different countries and release monthly KPI, conduct P&L and Balance-Sheet analysis across the region and ensure compliance with Group policies.  Key Duties And Responsibilities Consolidate the comments of the 5 major markets of the South Asia Pacific region (Australia, India, Thailand, South Korea & SEA) for Net Sales, Orders, Gross Profit, OPEX, EBITA & WCAP for actuals and forecasts. User Power BI to identify quickly deviations and send focus points to the stakeholders so as to get value added comments Analyze the result of our ASP (Average Selling Price) & Service tools for our major countries to help them drive profitability by product and/or customer segment so as to improve the overal profitability of the region Lead the Balance-Sheet reviews, harmonize the audit schedules and contribute to a more robust internal control system guaranteeing full adherence to the Group policies and other Governance (E&C) Consolidate and challenge the tracking files (project pipeline) Provide ad-hoc analysis and perform internal audit upon management request Requirements Effective communication, communication to senior stakeholders, organizational savy Analytical skills, business intelligence and office excel tools knowledge Audit experience Good command of English Business acumen, financial acumen, corporate financial reporting South Asia Pacific knowledge, lead through influence and lead virtually in matrix structure If you share our passion and believe that saving lives is the greatest job in the world, then we look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world's most desired medtech company.
industries: Medical Devices, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Most companies try to meet expectations, dunnhumby exists to defy them. Using big data, deep expertise and AI-driven platforms to decode the 21st century human experience – then redefine it in meaningful and surprising ways that put customers first. Across digital, mobile and retail. For brands like Tesco, Coca-Cola, Procter & Gamble and PepsiCo.  We’re looking for Customer Engagement and Media Consulting Director who expects more from their career to join team.  It’s an opportunity to bring good Media & Customer Engagement experience and expertise, coupled with market knowledge to APAC clients in order to win new business and grow client value for existing clients. Specifically provide support for new and existing clients through delivering consulting engagements and supporting the acquisition of new clients through proposing and delivering relevant and compelling product and/or service solutions.  What We Expect From You Lead key Media & CE pre-sales activities including presenting, crafting the narrative and conduct lead generation activities in coordination with Sales and Client teams and support client teams Work with global/regional partnership teams to build relationships with other martech partnerships to support overall business development/activation needs from various clients Lead of all regional delivery of consulting projects for existing clients and in winning new long term deals; lead team to create and deliver quality deliverables. Craft narratives and approaches in line with global best practices for each client Build key client relationships with respective senior stakeholders/executives in CRM/Media to support growth ambitions Initiate and lead creating a best-in-class Media & CE Solutions team regionally, keeping connected with Media & CE Consulting Teams in other regions to help embed & maintain best practice globally Contribute to the evolution of the Dunnhumby consulting propositions and dh thought leadership through research, keeping up-to-date with market developments and innovation, and writing blogs/articles Build and maintain strong working relationships internally and with client counterparts to ensure the smooth running of every project 10 -15 years of experience in retail marketing strategy, consulting or agency, marketing tech, Grocery retail experience What You Can Expect From Us  We won’t just meet your expectations. We’ll defy them. So you’ll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you’d expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off.  You’ll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.  And we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day – with thriving networks including dh Women’s Network, dh Proud, dh Parent’s & Carer’s, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. Everyone’s invited.  Our approach to Flexible Working  At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.  We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.  For further information about how we collect and use your personal information please see our Privacy Notice which can be found (here)

description: The business unit Rail Services specializing in all areas of the railway sector, offers a comprehensive portfolio of testing, certification and training services for conventional rail vehicles, high-speed trains, subways, light rail vehicles and embedded systems. With our services we support our customers in the areas of rail infrastructure, signalling, communication, E & M, rolling stock and O & M in all project phases (planning / design, production, construction and installation, operation, and maintenance / servicing). The business line Global Rail Projects is focusing on multidisciplinary railway projects.  Key Responsibilities:  Successfully execute TÜV SÜD railway business growth strategy, especially for multidisciplinary railway projects Promote our service portfolio at new and existing customers. Understand the market and map customer needs with Global Rail Project service portfolio Active pipeline development with contact prospects, generate leads, organize customer visits, follow up inquiries and prepare proposals to maximize sales. Networking with customers at top management level Preparing offerings during bidding phase, technically and commercially, together with the respective business lines Proposal delivery, negotiation and deal closing in cooperation with regional and business unit responsible. Keeping up with competitor activities Project management in the field of assessment and audit of railway projects, being responsible for handling the project in cooperation with internal and external stakeholder.  Key Requirements:  Master’s degree qualified (or equivalent) in Engineering (preferred) or related discipline in a relevant railway engineering area of expertise (Civil, Signalling, Energy, Operations) At least 5 years’ experience in Business Development, with strong rail industry experience in an international environment. Experience in TIC (Testing, Inspection, Certification) industry preferred. Experience in project management or knowledge of project lifecycle within the railway sector or railway systems Experience in writing, appraising, and negotiating contracts and commercial agreements and technical proposals. Strong communication ability in English at all levels with demonstrated leadership and managerial skills with good presentation skills. Mobility, flexibility, and readiness for business trips in the region Intermediate German language skills.

description: Responsibilities Develop an overall strategic marketing strategy and vision in order to provide consistency and alignment of all projects and initiatives. Manage the integration of marketing plans across the regions, the business units, and retail marketing to ensure proper coordination and execution of regional marketing initiatives. Lead and drive the implementation and manage the effectiveness of global and local marketing programmes. Provide strong marketing leadership and drive in the planning and execution of all regional marketing plans. This includes advertising, PR, events, branding, customer seminars, direct marketing campaigns, web-based activities, collateral production and internal communication, marketing intelligence and planning. Lead and manage all marketing activities and ensure effective deployment of marketing resources and budget to support the achievement of commercial targets as defined by corporate objectives. Review and appoint local agencies to ensure corporate/regional messages are effectively and consistently communicated around the region. Define, track and measure the impact of retail activities on sales results around the region, drive achievement of key performance metrics which will ensure visibility of tangible value to sales. Maintain the integrity of the Company’s brands and protect or strengthen our brand value by actively managing the brand compliance and adherence of all marketing communication activities, both on and off-line with the regions. Requirements Bachelor degree from a reputable university At least 10-12 years of experience of marketing, marketing communications, internal communication, PR experience preferably in luxury or jewellery industry Strong and proven leadership skills. Previous experience of leading a team preferred. Good knowledge of the retail industry Have a strong understanding of branding and corporate communications; advertising and promotion knowledge required Driven and results-oriented

jobTitle: Dedicated Region APAC Specialist, Cloud Migration, OCI
description: Interested in taking your career to the next level driving the market success of a strategic priority for Oracle in Cloud?  Why this role Dedicated Region Cloud@Customer is Oracle’s strategic offering for a managed private cloud/distributed cloud i.e. OCI commercial region dedicated to a single customer deployed in their datacentre. To drive market success of this offering, we are investing in building a team of highly talented individuals in Asia Pacific.  What You'll Do You will support OCI-Dedicated Region opportunities from inception to close, working closely with the customers to assess current workloads and architectural requirements and develop migration strategy. Manage all aspects of opportunity lifecycle and orchestrate the alignment of key resources at the relevant stages of the lifecycle. Support a team of like minded professional with the pre-sales cycle from identification to qualification of opportunities across the region. For qualified opportunities, lead the migration portfolio discovery to capture and organize infrastructure, application and performance data, conduct initial migration workload assessment and identify application migration pattern, support preparation of TCO models, conduct current state and future state assessment for migration and provide recommendations - Overall proposition development and articulation. You will pitch the proposed cloud adoption strategy as a specialist member of a dynamic team at not only the customer CXO level (CEO, COO etc) but also at operational level (Architects, Application Infrastructure and DevOps teams etc). Your goal will be to ensure that cloud adoption is not a barrier to our customer’s and Oracle success in bringing the Dedicated Region Distributed Cloud to market. Who You'll Work With  Primarily with our customers but working with extended teams internally is vital to the success of this role. You will work extensively with Oracle Insight (Business Value) team, TCE (Technical Cloud Engineering), Industry Architects, Cloud Pursuit & OCI Product management teams. Who You Are  If you enjoy taking on challenges in leading cloud technologies, engineered platforms, application migration, innovative cloud services and growing an untapped market while exploring unchartered territories, this role is for you. To be successful in this role, you will need a strong background in application architecture, platform transformation/Infrastructure outsourcing/5R cloud migrations in a pre-sales, consulting or an implementer capacity. Strong understanding of OCI (Oracle Cloud Infrastructure) or other cloud hyperscalers is a must. You will have over 10 years’ of experience having worked on multiple related technologies, managed/implemented large opportunities or pursuits & become a trusted advisor to customers. You have witnessed the data centre evolution from converged infrastructure to hyper converged infrastructure to software defined datacentre. This experience will help pitch the value of the Dedicated Region platform & software defined infrastructure when deployed in the customers’ datacentre. You have experience migrating workloads to public clouds? This will help engage with customers and identify suitable workloads in the datacentre to migrate to OCI- Dedicated Region. You will have extensive experience managing large deals & pitching to C-Suite. This will help you lead & manage the OCI-Dedicated Region opportunity through the lifecycle that can span 2-4 quarters. Ideally you will be comfortable in articulating the overall OCI-Dedicated region proposition to senior executives across multiple industry sectors. Your experience in Digital transformation initiatives will help you convince customers of the value delivered by OCI- Dedicated Region as a platform for continued innovation. While desirable and not mandatory, you would have a clear understanding of this terminology having managed responses to multiple RFI/RFPs for large deals in region.  The right candidate will exude a strong technical aptitude, a high degree of motivation to develop new business opportunities and a positive attitude that is contagious. You are passionate in pursuit of success & building positive relationships with customers and colleagues. You possess strong business acumen to spot opportunities for OCI- Dedicated Region where others see none. You are articulate & have phenomenal communication/presentation skills. You thrive in a team environment & have a flair bringing large teams together for a shared purpose. You enjoy sharing ideas and best practices.  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.
industries: Information Technology and Services
