JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.
industries: Commercial Real Estate

description: What’s up? We’re VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH  Well, now we’re looking for someone who lives and breathes social media even more than us. Do you know all of the latest trends? Memes? And TikToks? Maybe you’ve dabbled in the world of influencers? Believe in the power of social media and community management to change hearts, minds, and drive sales? Love the hustle of fast-paced, hyper-growth agency life? Thrive in a role where you can bring ideas to life on billions of screens? Cool. Then let’s talk.  This exciting opportunity of a full-time role based in Singapore will allow you to lead a team of strategists and collaborate with a bunch of strat experts across apac. You will lead and drive our strategy expertise and be the “strategic brain” who will guide us for all things APAC.  Are you based in Singapore? Geeking the social media world in APAC digital space for eight plus years now? Are you inspiring with a can-do attitude? Do you wanna deep dive into the world of media and creative advertising agency? If yes, we could be meant to be -----so keep reading!  Here’s where you come in.  Our growing strategy team is looking forward to collaborating with a “people first” Strategy Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Strategy and Insights.  You’re a problem solver at heart and insanely curious about people, culture and technology. Most of all, you like to get your hands dirty, are obsessed with researching & finding interesting things that are hidden from sight (even in the seemingly most mundane of places) and adept at translating your findings into compelling creative briefs, enjoy partnering with teams to see your work through from research to execution, and communicate your work with passion and conviction. We like to work with “big thinkers yet hands-on in execution”.  As a team, we’re collaborative and come from diverse backgrounds. We value creativity in research, and an outside-in perspective when it comes to inspiration, strategic frameworks and problem-solving. Technology has fundamentally changed the way we interact with others and the world around us, and we geek out about understanding behaviors in context, instead of probing humans in a petri dish.  You would be leading a team of talented strategists, social listening analysts, and community experts. As such, there are many hats you’d have to wear from day 1. You would need to conduct research, write briefs, guide work, pitch to clients - really anything and everything it takes to get the job done and deliver fantastic, big, bold, beautiful work.  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  Your Experience And The “Nice To Have” 7 plus years experience building integrated programs at a top agency working for Fortune 500 clients -- must have experience understanding the intersection of business strategy, consumer insights, and digital behavior and developing big, purposeful ideas. Experience doing traditional, web, social, syndicated and primary research (incl.: NetBase, MRI, Sysomos, Brandwatch, eMarketer, Mintel, Google Analytics, Omniture; conducting IDIs, digital ethnographies, etc.) Dazzling presentation skills and presence in a room Ability to express complicated concepts in simple and digestible ways (“Explain it to a fifth grader”) Curious and lovely to get along with. Deliver work independently on all tasks and achieve results at pace with energy and drive. Lead collaboration sessions with other teams. Execute a strong sense of priority level and urgency; and knows how to act on the critical difference between the two. Manage the ongoing performance of different tasks or projects, as well as understanding and ownership of internal processes for quality assurance. Administer agreed goals or projects by dealing to challenges in a responsive and constructive way. Strive for zero mistakes or flagged internal process issues on work output. Foster positive internal communication and collaboration with all internal teams. Ensure presented ideas are clear and understood. Highlight new ideas to the team and external stakeholders when appropriate. Provide clear, professional, timely and helpful information to the team or external clients and partners. Thrives in a company of good people Think logically even under pressure and come up with innovative solutions to problems. Lastly, a genuine belief in bringing your full self to what you do everyday, see “work” as a calling and a passion. What You Should Know About VaynerMedia  Think “lab” and not “agency”. We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We’re willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It’s fun!  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can’t wait to meet you.  P.S Portfolio would be nice :)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: Key Responsibilities Shape and manage Trustana’s product strategy and roadmap to develop a product that services Trustana’s target customer – small and medium-sized enterprises Drive and deliver Trustana’s overall product vision, including market expansion and growth tactics, across Southeast Asia, China, and beyond. Work closely with functions such as engineering, sales and business development, marketing, operations, etc. to develop a deep understanding of the customer and shape the product & technology Drive customer acquisition and customer retention by creating a seamless, efficient, and functional tool for our customers Effectively communicate decision making and strategic direction to team members, other executives, and board members Drive a data-driven, highly-iterative, customer-obsessed culture amongst team members Spearhead design excellence and a strong user experience for our internal and external stakeholders Build, inspire, and lead a world-class product and design team that scales globally Identify new features and functionality opportunities through competitive analysis and keeping up with market trends Promote Trustana’s thought leadership in international trade by participating in industry events, summits, or forums Work with Executive Team to continuously create and adjust Trustana’s overall company strategy, define and drive overall company culture, and be a role model for other team members Ideal Candidate Requirements Is comfortable with ambiguity and relishes the challenge of “path forging” Has previously held senior-level executive roles in product management / product development in the technology industry; experience with SMEs in Asia, B2B marketplaces or physical-operations products strongly preferred Possesses in-depth knowledge and broad understanding of digital product development, user experience and design, and user research Experience building, driving and leading a multi-functional team of product, technical and design professionals across countries Is able to roll up their sleeves to get into the details when needed – has prior product or design experience and a track record of executional excellence Considers leadership and communication a key strength Versatile and passionate about working in a start-up environment, is innately curious, and comfortable with rapid experimentation and change A self-starter who can creatively construct, is hungry to innovate, and can devise new pathways to understand and build for customers
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Our agreement with employees DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position The Director of Solution Engineering is responsible for managing a team of Solution Engineers (individual contributors) who support our Sales team across Asia. Key markets include Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines across all customer segments - from SMB through to Enterprise.  This SE team discovers and understands customer business challenges, complex processes, and architectural landscapes in order to build world-class integrated solutions leveraging DocuSign’s platform and suite of products. Through engaging stories and custom-built demonstrations, SEs illustrate the value and benefits of modernizing a prospect’s System of Agreement through DocuSign’s Agreement Cloud offerings. The Director is accountable for coaching and developing these individual contributors, helping them to drive adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.  This position reports to the Senior Director of Solution Engineering for Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) and is designated flex.  Responsibilities Daily management of the Solution Engineering team Scale team by attracting and mentoring extraordinary solution engineers with various levels of experience and diversity to grow a well-balanced, high performing team Identify and create opportunities for training and professional development of team Provide individual coaching to help develop and refine core technical, selling, and presentation skills to help team grow and excel Drive collaboration with sales team to aid in cultivating and securing net-new business Communicate and prioritize product and business needs from the field to appropriate internal teams including Product Development, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement, Support, Professional Services, and others Ensure team effectively operates in accordance with team policies and procedures Continually assess team operations and make adjustments or policy recommendations to drive team collaboration, efficiency, and effectiveness Maintain and protect DocuSign core values by hiring culturally aligned team members and leading by example  Basic Qualifications 8+ years of experience in a technical pre-sales role 8+ years of experience leading technical pre-sales teams  BS/BA degree or equivalent in relevant work experience  Preferred Qualifications Track record of building, coaching and enabling a rapidly growing Solution Engineering teams Hire and retain top talent in the market, providing career growth opportunities and effective succession planning An inspiring, innovative leader with the ability to deal with high volume transactional business and enterprise sales models Experience selling into customers across Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines Focus on innovation - ensure the team is constantly improving their approach to solution and value based selling Prioritize and qualify where to invest the pre sales resources to get maximum impact of every investment Masterful in delivering software demonstrations, both in-person or remotely Proven experience with cloud software configuration and integration Experience with technical business documentation including process flows, architectural diagrams, proposals, RFPs and RFIs, etc. Proven experience working with employees at all levels of an organization Familiarity with system integration methods such as web services including SOAP & REST APIs Familiarity with HTML, XML, and structured data Familiarity with Enterprise-class software systems such as ERP, CRM, and ECM. Familiarity with electronic signature and/or CLM concepts a plus Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail Embody DocuSign’s values Willingness to travel 25% or more as needed (post pandemic)  About Us DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the business and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  Accommodations DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.
industries: Computer Software

description: Specializations Industrial & Manufacturing Logistics, Shipping and Supply Chain & Procurement Healthcare & Life Sciences Technology & Telecommunication At Unicorn Partners, we emphasize on listening and communication skills. We are searching for individuals who are confident, resourceful, driven and entrepreneurial to join our expanding team. In return, we offer an attractive remuneration package which includes a very competitive commission structure and employee benefits.  Key Responsibilities Identify and develop new business opportunities through various sourcing channels and networking Build trusted relationships with prospective clients Prepare leads, attend client visits for business development and complete search project Provide professional consultation services, understanding and recording client’s recruitment needs and performing full cycle of recruitment activities Source, interviewing and assessing prospective applicants and matching them with vacancies with the clients Help applicants to prepare for interviews Consistently contributing to the achievement of monthly, quarterly and yearly sales targets Qualifications And Experience A Degree/ Diploma in any field At least 10 years’ experience in an executive search or recruitment industry Extensive knowledge in client & candidate relationship with a proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets in one of the above specializations. Excellent interpersonal skills and able to effectively engage with clients and candidates Ability to handle 360 recruitment process from client management to candidate management Ability to deliver desired outcomes under minimal guidance
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Public Relations and Communications, and Logistics and Supply Chain

description: Your role  Are you looking for an exciting role, engaging with Government clients across the ASEAN region, as part of a rapidly growing team? Do you have an interest in key areas, such as Maritime Security & International Trade?  We are looking for an Associate-Director, ASEAN Government Sales, to: Build and evolve relationships across our Government clients and be part of a major growth story in this rapidly evolving territory Develop a strategy and execute against this, utilizing solutions that touch on the key trade, security and growth efforts within the region Ensure our position as the market leader in providing services to our clients continues to expand Lead the creation of topical sales plays and rigorously qualified target lists for those plays Perform White space analysis to identify opportunities in existing and/or new logo accounts Maintain existing relationships and revenue with some of our largest customers in the region. Your team  Working within the wider APAC Maritime & Trade Organisation (with over 200 colleagues in offices across the region, you will be a core part of the APAC Maritime & Trade Sales Team Organisation, reporting to the Executive Director - APAC. This team are based across 9 offices in the region, and are focused on major (>20% growth) and sustained growth.  Your expertise  You have a bachelor's degree Experience of engaging with government entities, or working within the purchasing cycle Fluent in English, and additional languages would be viewed favourably You are An Excellent communicator Tenacious and Curious Well organized A Positive influencer Able to maintain a positive mindset to overcome challenges Excited to hunt for new business Your colleagues  About Us  We are over 14,000 analysts, data scientists and specialists armed with real-time technology and data, working together to uncover deeper sources of information. The unique insights we provide help the industries and markets that drive our economies operate more efficiently, outpace competition and secure long-term success. Our global insights impact nearly every major sector - from aerospace to automotive. We empower our customers by isolating cause and effect, risk and opportunity in new ways so they can make well-informed decisions with greater confidence. This is a force we call The New Intelligence.  Join us  Boundaries belong on maps, not in your work. Start every day at IHS Markit with the excitement of what's next, by working with people from across the globe on interesting, cutting-edge projects and gaining once-in-a-lifetime learning experiences. It is easy to be passionate and invested in your work here, knowing you are causing an effect for some of the world's most influential companies. You'll get to be hands-on with, and see the direct impact, of your work. Career satisfaction just comes with the territory here. Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. For more information on the many ways in which we enthusiastically support inclusion and diversity efforts for both candidates and employees, please access our Inclusion & Diversity Statement here .  We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with IHS Markit and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please contact or call +1 212 849 0399. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are considered on a case-by-case basis. This contact information (email and phone) is intended for application assistance and accommodation requests only. We are unable to accept resumes or provide information about application status through the phone number or email address above. Resumes are only accepted through the online application process, and only qualified candidates will receive consideration and follow-up.  IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.  For Information Please Click On The Following Links  IHS Markit Business Code of Conduct  Right to Work  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Pay Transparency Current Colleagues  If you are currently employed by IHS Markit, please apply internally via the Workday internal careers site.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: Responsibilities: Manage all functions of the F&B operation to achieve optimum departmental profit Manage the operation of outlets and banquet to achieve optimum quality level of food and beverage production and services Set long and short term goals and develops strategies, procedures and policies for the F&B Department Control and analyze, on an on-going basis, the level of sales, costs, quality and presentation of food and beverage products and service standards Develop innovative and profitable dining, beverage and wine promotions Plan and organize with the Executive Chef successful F&B activities in the Club Prepare yearly F&B operations budget and the monthly forecast Determine the minimum and maximum stocks of all food, beverage, material and equipment Set standards of all food, beverage and equipment purchases in accordance with Club guidelines Develop and maintain up-dated operational manuals for all F&B Outlets  Requirements: At least 10 years of Food and Beverage Management experience Ability to understand profit & loss statement Have dealt with a discriminating and demanding clientele in six star properties Experience managing a banquet sales team and a proven track record of achieving banquet sales targets Experience managing multiple outlets and multiple restaurants in different locations Experience in training and developing a team to deliver consistent, friendly and high quality service Hotel, club or multi-unit restaurant backgrounds will be considered
industries: Hospitality and Food & Beverages

description: D2L is a cloud company that is modernizing education and building the Future of Work. The old models of teaching and learning are in the midst of the largest transformation in history, and D2L is at the heart of that fundamental shift.  New models of teaching and learning enable a personalized, student-centric experience – and deliver improved retention, engagement, satisfaction, and results for learners of all ages – in schools, campuses, and companies.  D2L is disrupting the way the world learns, by providing the next generation learning environment and solutions to engage and inspire learners. And most importantly, by giving customers a platform that is easy, flexible, and smart. No other company provides a solution as robust and innovative as D2L.  D2L's has had a singular mission for 20 years and is dedicated to that same mission in the years ahead: to transform the way the world learns – and by doing so, we will help improve human potential globally.  Job Summary:  The Regional Marketing Director, APAC will be based in Singapore. The Regional Marketing Director will demonstrate to be a proven marketer who will be responsible for the growth of D2L's go to market plan in the Asia Pacific Region. The Regional Marketing Director will assist in developing, implementing, and executing strategic marketing plans for the Asia region and will be responsible for pipeline growth and targets. This role requires experience in building successful and measurable international marketing programs and will act as the key connection point between the APAC Region, the International Marketing team and D2L's Corporate office. The ability to work in a fast-paced technology industry, a 'can do' attitude and a natural willingness to collaborate across multiple teams are musts.  Major Responsibilities (How Will I Make an Impact?): Lead the development of the company's APAC Regional Marketing plan in collaboration with the Director, International Marketing Actively work with the regional teams to understand market and customer requirements, carry out market analysis, recommend product positioning and define strategies as required Deliver tactical execution on all aspects of the marketing & sales plan to achieve revenue and related targets Manage the regional marketing team and regional budgets and prepare for future growth Assist the team in all programs including copy, digital/web, PR, advertising, automation and social Work with the International Marketing Director on effective communication with key media on press releases and related materials Work with the greater marketing team to assist in the development/adaptation of companywide marketing programs and materials Partner with cross-functional teams (regional, digital, design, finance, legal) to successfully launch multichannel campaigns and new marketing concepts Partner with the field sales teams to ensure there is a constant flow of information, market intelligence and joint messaging outreach, including but not limited to account-based efforts. Define and manage KPIs to measure and report on program effectiveness, gain insight, and assess against goals Act as a mentor on digital topics and provide best practice, guidance and feedback to regional teams Support channel marketing programs including development of co-marketing plans/campaigns and quarterly business planning Provide regular status updates to the International Marketing Director and to the Regional Leaders.  Competencies (What you'll bring to the role): 5-8 years' + experience in B2B Marketing, experience in SAAS companies a plus Strong knowledge and understanding of the digital and social landscape in Asia Pacific Solid knowledge of marketing technology platforms: Marketo, Salesforce, Wordpress, Demandbase, etc Solid experience & understanding in driving performance marketing Experience working in a cross-functional, multi-cultural, dynamic organization setting Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills in English Strong business acumen and exhibits strong balance of creativity and analytical skills Dynamic team player, with a strong sense of ownership and drive Highly organized with superior attention to detail and ability to manage several projects simultaneously, delivering high quality work while under deadline pressure Languages: Fluent in English (and Mandarin is favourable)  Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Marketing
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The future of work is rapidly increasing the pace of change in business. Our aim is to help our customers understand the trends shaping the future of work and help them transform their workplace so that they can keep up with changing needs of the business.  As the Head of Modern Workplace Solution for Logicalis Asia, you will be responsible for the market success of our Business Collaboration, Digital Workspace & Office Productivity solutions in the region. Reporting directly to CTO, you will drive the business strategy definition and its execution as well as achieve customer acquisition targets within the market. This is a hands-on leadership role with the intention of building and maintaining a high performance presales & project delivery team to achieve performance targets and establish Logicalis as a technology & services leader in Workplace Transformation. As the solution figurehead, you will work cross functionally to foster and deliver an integrated go-to-market with other teams including sales, marketing and services delivery   The work will involve developing effective go to market strategies, cross functional collaboration, planning, executing and driving a culture of accountability to deliver results for our business. You will have overall responsibility to continually enhance and expand on our Modern Workplace solution & services portfolio to keep pace with the changing needs of the customers  You will also be leading the project delivery engineering team for the associated solution ensuring that we plan/design/deploy projects of the highest quality on time for our clients. You shall ensure that the entire delivery organization is enabled, trained and certified to deliver on our core solutions.  Responsibilities:  Drive measurable and sustained growth across Asia’s Modern Workplace Solution Area. Work closely with the sales leadership in each country to deliver the required sales revenue, gross profit, services and growth metrics in the respective technology and service areas Serve as Strategic/Executive Consultant, advising customer leadership on best practices approaches on enabling their workplace & workspace digital transformation through technology. Position Logicalis (and our solutions & services) to lead customers on their technology-driven business transformations and drive positive experiences, increase productivity and closer engagement of their employees Responsible for all stages of the solution delivery cycle, beginning with the conversation of solving the customer’s business problems through understanding business requirements, to translating it into solutions that deliver tangible results, to marketing launch, to lighthouse deal support, to projects delivery. These solutions include Unified Communications, Contact Centres, Collaboration software, digital workspace solutions, office productivity tools Lead the relationship with key strategic partners and the enablement of Logicalis resources (from sales, presales, delivery and support) such that we are being viewed as a key partners for these technology providers. Build innovative digital offerings through these industry leading partners’ products and align the solution roadmaps with customers to drive efficiency, productivity and business impact. These partners include Cisco (Unified Comms, Contact Centre, Webex), Microsoft (Teams, M365) & Vmware (Horizon, Workspace One) Build and lead a team of high-performing presales architects & specialists. This team will have capabilities to architect solutions pertaining to customer’s business requirements, as well as go deep in providing consulting and presales solution/product support for the modern workplace solution we offer: Attract and develop a presales team of talent and foster a high-performance culture. Coach your team to drive the Sales cycle for large opportunities partnering with the technology vendors from initial prospect engagement to closing. Directly engage with key prospects in collaboration with the account teams Lead the Modern Workplace Professional Services (PS) delivery teams to deliver on large scale complex project successfully and seamlessly ensuring profitability, cost effectiveness, high quality standard and customer satisfactions: Adopt industry best practices and ensure that the right tools, techniques, methodologies and systems to deliver the services that meet the commitment of the scope and the expectations of the customers Advise, coach and lead the PS teams on project delivery, solution development and deployment, and revenue generation responsibilities Drive efficient use of all delivery team resources so that team utilization goals are attained while driving, customer satisfaction, and project revenue goals Develop the delivery team’s career plans with goals and objectives so that each team members’ career development, certification & training can be documented, tracked and supported. Identify areas where continuous improvement and automation can be applied and develop and recommend modifications to processes and procedures. Facilitate the transformation the PS Team to respond to new market opportunities as defined by the business and new deals Develop managed services offerings for the associated solution and execute on the go-to-market plan for these services   Qualifications  Min 12 years in ICT technology, in solution consulting in BOTH presales & post sales Min 10 years of relevant experience in at least 3 of the following solutions, with significant depth around crafting, implementing, and leading critical multi-functional integration projects and working with vendor partners: Unified Communications for voice and video, Contact Centres, Collaboration, Office Productivity Solutions, Virtual Desktop Solutions, Workplace Cybersecurity. Able to demonstrate excellent understanding and strong knowledge of how these solutions effect business outcomes for the customers. Extensive experience in a system integration role across multiple platforms and environments is key to this position At least 5 years experience managing a team of more than 8 headcounts Credible C-suite technical advisor with strong customer/partner relationship-building skills. Demonstrated ability to develop strong CIO/CTO relationships and ensure positive Logicalis presence and mindshare with customers Experienced in in running SI project lifecycle from requirements, design, documentation, construction, testing conversion, data migration, implementation, and maintenance An understanding of strategy, industry, and market concepts (e. g. TAM, Competition) as it relates to the wider IT market and specially to the business of Logicalis Singapore and its partners. Demonstrated ability to provide impactful knowledge exchange through mentoring, workshops, partner & customer engagements and official training forums  Successfully lead, developed and coached presales & solution architects Strong people management skills including hiring, developing, motivating and retaining technical sales people and an ability to manage any performance shortfall. Ability to solicit input, analyze data, draw conclusions and provide recommendations. Ability to hold both a 'big-picture' and a detailed view of a business problem when considering solutions.  Strong verbal and written communications skills as well as excellent presentation skills Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field or equivalent experience

description: About Currencycloud  Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution.  We are an open & collaborative Fintech unicorn that lives and breathes our company values:  Be Human, Better Together and Own it.  About The Role...  This role is a key new addition to the team, with the remit to develop propositions with our friends across the ecosystem to further enhance the customer journey. Currencycloud is an open platform, and today we informally partner with many companies to help our customers build best in class solutions. We are now looking to formalise these relationships so that they can scale as the organisation grows.  This is a high-profile role that will work closely with many teams across the organisation to ensure the success of the programme. You will need to be highly collaborative to be successful.  You will be responsible for working with relevant colleagues across the business to develop a network strategy that completes our product offering and makes it easy for customers to work with us. You will then be responsible for identifying prospective network partners and managing the full lifecycle of that partnership: agreeing terms, ongoing relationship management, joint marketing and driving internal and external engagement.  The Details... Responsible for crafting, developing and sustaining the Network Partnership strategy aligned with business objectives Design and implement a network of banks, PSPs and FinTechs/products that enables different levels of partnership that meet the commercial and strategic needs of Currencycloud Work with Go To Market teams, product and strategy to identify customer requirements for different segments and the appropriate strategy to meet those needs… buy, build or partner Identify and engage with network partners to fill product gaps or enhance our proposition Leverage your knowledge of the ecosystem to build a network of relationships for different needs Engage with network partners and agree on the appropriate commercial model, including contractual, financial, proposition, marketing If integration is required, work with the product teams to agree on implementation timelines and ensure sufficient resource is allocated to achieve these goals Continue to nurture the relationship to drive relevant results, in particular, adoption in the customer base Activate the network partnership Work with Partner Marketing to launch the partnership and ensure its success. Marketing channels can include but are not restricted to joint PR, web site, documentation, presentations Train and enable the sales teams to effectively sell the joint proposition Ongoing management of partnerships Drive activation of partnership with new and existing prospects and associated revenue Relationship managementPerformance tracking and governanceIssue remediation Skills Knowledge & Expertise Have at least 5 years of experience in B2B partnership roles in the financial services space across APAC Are highly commercial with a deep understanding of customer needs and how they can be solved Have experience working in regulated financial services, preferably payments Have experience working in a fast-paced, ambitious start-up environment; Structured and detail orientated Are hands-on, with a curious mind and the ability to see opportunity and the drive to execute on it Have strong communication and people management, interpersonal and influencing skills to build strong business relationships, foster stakeholder engagement, create new partnerships and drive a culture of collaboration and innovation Are an excellent people leader, with the ability to hire, develop and inspire great teams who are aligned to Currencycloud’s company values – Be Human, Better Together, Own It Are an analytical thinker, decision-maker with a focus on action and outcomes, driving for results Are a self-starter mentality and an interest in a high-growth environment Why Currencycloud?  We are a remote-first company; whichever location you’re contracted to, we leave it up to you and your manager to agree on how often you come into the office. To make things easier we offer an allowance so you can create your own working space at home because we REALLY mean it when we say remote first.  Your health and well-being are of paramount importance to us, and so our jampacked employee benefits reflect this!  We offer a competitive salary, an individual learning and development budget, a pension or 401K contribution, mental health days and comprehensive health care that includes annual optical and dental allowances, access to mental health support and a monthly allowance that you can spend on anything health or wellness related!  At the moment we are unable to consider applicants living outside of our entities and we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.  We aren’t currently looking for additional Recruiter support on this role and won’t be accepting any unsolicited CVs

description: Job Description Oversee technical operations including project management, engineering, and operations & maintenance for TotalEnergies Asia hub Identify and implement processes and systems necessary to scale technical organization to construct and operate portfolio in a safe, efficient, and cost-effective manner Build and manage a multi-level team of local project delivery professionals (project managers, project engineers, construction supervisors, etc.) Scale the technical organization which maintaining high employee engagement enabling career progression and competency development in the technical organization Oversee engineering team in India to provide seamless engineering services across the DG Solar business line. Provide transparent information to management and JV partners on progress of projects under execution or operation in the hub Ensures high HSE standards at all times and promotes company values to teams, contractors, clients, partners and all stakeholders Identifies and implements procurement strategies to keep pricing highly competitive Supporting sales and business development efforts on technical aspects of customer acquisition Context and environment Keeping competitive pricing and balancing other sales needs while maintaining very high HSE and quality standards Executing projects with tight budget and schedule Maintaining very high HSE standards in regions where many contractors and clients are unaccustomed to doing so Recruiting and retaining a highly capable team in markets with limited existing talent pool available with DG solar experience Candidate profile Extensive experience setting up and running operations with larger numbers of people e.g. >50 people. Bachelor degree in Engineering; Master’s Degree a plus More than 15 years experience in the engineering, project management, program management, or project delivery with at least 5 years in management / leadership position Experience in I&C solar projects a plus - including engineering, construction, project management, and / or operation of projects Working experience in SEA region a plus - including proven project track record and management of local teams Experience in negotiations of EPC contracts; negotiation of regional procurement contracts a plus Offer ID  45884BR  Metier  Project Management, Site Construction/Supervision  Employment type  Regular position  Experience Level Required  Minimum 15 years  Employer Company  TotalEnergies Marketing Asia-Pacific Middle East Pte Ltd  Branch  Gas Renewables And Power  About Us / Company Profile  Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with Total. With over 500-plus professions in 130 countries, we offer high safety and environmental standards, strong ethical values, an innovation culture and wide-ranging career development. Be part of the global team whose mission is already shared by 100,000 employees: to make energy better each and every day.

description: About Accenture  Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Job Summary:  Provide direction, leadership, and support of key sales and pricing excellence programs within an organizational unit or process area Engage directly with sales leadership and teams to develop acumen and drive adoption of performance metrics, tools and processes. Orchestrate S&PP team member activities across all Service Areas to help the organization execute its strategy and achieve its performance targets.  Primary responsibilities include:  Independently operate and deliver outcomes across a diverse and geographically dispersed organization  Responsible for the S&PP team supporting a Market Unit or other organization of similar size/complexity  Interact confidently and build credible relationships with senior leadership  Represent S&PP corporate function to MU leadership  Identify and drive sales performance improvements (e.g. win rate, profitability, origination, portfolio optimization, salesforce education, business predictability) by coordinating the efforts of S&PP team members with different roles and specializations  Demonstrate mastery of the S&PP Service Catalog and service model; match S&PP services to business needs  Identify and drive sales performance improvements by coordinating the efforts of S&PP team members with different roles and specializations  Manage a medium to large team in multiple locations, in-person and/or virtually  Create and execute high complexity workplans  Demonstrate full understanding of how S&PP Business Partners and the entire S&PP Corporate Function fit into the bigger Accenture picture  Contribute to S&PP practice consolidation and development by actively participating in Market and Global initiatives  Knowledge & Skill Requirements:  Sales Life Cycle – EXPERT  Stakeholder Management – EXPERT  Program/Action Development – EXPERT  Sales Excellence Programs - EXPERT  Change Management – ADVANCED  Sales Process and Procedure – EXPERT  Sales Tools - EXPERT  Educational Qualification  Must have:  Undergraduate degree  English language fluency (oral and written)  Nice to have:  Business Management education desirable  Skills & Work Experience  Must have:  A minimum of 12 years of experience, with proven track record in advising leadership and managing teams  Nice to have:  Deep understanding of S&PP processes and tools preferred  Understanding of Finance processes desirable  Other Requirements (please Specify Such As Overtime, Etc.)  Must support/mirror working hours for the supported Market Unit or other business area  Must be flexible with work hours according to shifting business needs  Must have good internet connectivity and distraction-free environment for working at home, in accordance with local guidelines  May be required to travel occasionally  Additional Comments  Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.  You will also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

jobTitle: General Manager (Singapore- Last mile logistics/ Ecommerce startup)
description: General Manager (Singapore – Last mile logistics / ecommerce) Enjoy working in an “all hands-on deck” & fast paced startup environment Degree holder with 8 - 10 years of working experience, with experience in people management, revenue/P&L, business development/ sales / marketing, operations & ecommerce Background in 4PL / last mile logistics / ecommerce preferred but not mandatory.  The Company Our client is redefining logistics in Asia. Asia’s leading logistics technology delivery platform that is dedicated to supporting 20,000+ businesses with same day and next day deliveries. Headquartered in Hong Kong with offices in Taiwan, Singapore and Malaysia. The company connects businesses to a fleet of independent delivery agents including walkers, scooters, vans, trucks to deliver anything, anytime, anywhere at a fraction of the cost. The company comprises of a team of entrepreneurial and passionate builders. Their investors in recent rounds of fundraising include Alibaba, Cyberport, SparkLabs, Swire Properties, the Jardine Matheson group, PChome and more. In addition to their core business of last mile delivery, the company has also launched an e-commerce platform to provide a seamless one-stop solution for merchants to build e-shop, process payments, manage orders and deliveries. Shoppers can enjoy a wide range of consumer products delivered to their doors at their desired time slots.  The Position Reporting directly to the COO, this role will be responsible to lead sales, Business development, marketing, operations and E-commerce functions for the Singapore business (current team size of 15-20) Build, grow and scale the business Responsible for managing all operations in the city Own and manage city’s P&L Develop operational and sales strategies to spearhead the continued growth of the business Implement brand strategies to increase company media exposure Drive the team to hit specific pre-set targets Generate sales/ops progress reports on a weekly/monthly basis as required Generate month-end financial reports to track city’s performance Recruit additional team members to build a team capable of taking company growth to the next level Create and maintain a positive team culture where members are motivated to achieve their full potential Front media queries and be the “face” of the company in the city  Job Requirement The ideal candidate should possess: Degree in any related discipline with 8 to 10 years of working experience with considerable amount of management experience (People management, revenue generation pipeline, efficiency & productivity) Relevant experience in last-mile logistics/ E-commerce/4PL preferred but not essential Having a pool of strong clients network in Singapore will be an added advantage Proven experience in growing and managing large team effectively Great people skills to handle different stakeholders Excellent Organizational, planning, goals & direction setting skills Strong business acumen with a can-do attitude Excellent communicator, ability to speak confidently in media queries or at events that require public speaking Proficiency in Data tools Analytical mindset with an obsession for data-driven decision making Enjoy working in a APAC level start-up environment, contributing ideas to senior management & confident in building a unique brand visibility  Interested candidates please apply via Glints Kindly attention your CV to Mr Desmond Fung Ming Siew (EA License No.: 19C9647 | CEI Reg No.: R1104604) **We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: Vision and Mission Campaign management to address different personas across different offerings while understanding the unique situation of each country/region Build strong relationships with Sales, Services and Customer Success teams. Put in place campaign metrics, be able to analyze campaign execution, follow ambitious targets About The Job You build and execute ambitious marketing plans across the region to optimize and accelerate pipeline generation You build and manage a team of field marketing specialists focusing on their countries You work closely with internal and external key stakeholders (primarily Sales Development and Account Executives) to drive strategy You support the global marketing strategy You help build local messaging to create engaging content fit for the local target audiences You measure performance of your activities and create reports You contribute to the overall global marketing strategy, working closely with the other teams Your Profile You have 3+ years of leadership experience You have 10+ years demand gen experience in a B2B SaaS company You have excellent skills in field marketing, digital marketing, content marketing, communication, analytics You have experience working in a global and diverse environment What We Offer  Fast paced global working environment, a team to build in a high-growth organisation, a huge market potential  About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level. jobTitle: Marketing Director, Asia Pacific Practice Groups
description: Job Title  Marketing Director, Asia Pacific Practice Groups  Job Description Summary  The Marketing Director, Asia Pacific Practice Groups is responsible for developing our go-to-market strategy for the key practice groups identified in the region being Industrial, logistics, e-commerce and supply chain; healthcare and life sciences; and multi-family (with others to potentially be added).  The role will work across the 14 countries in Asia Pacific, across different service lines to establish our brand profile, value proposition, client engagement opportunities and research insights for the target industry sectors. It will also link in with the global practice group infrastructure, connecting client opportunities, marketing campaigns and thought leadership pieces that are developed across the world and bring them to our clients and prospects in this region.  The role will work with the business to support expanding share of wallet with current clients, winning new business opportunities and elevating the reputation of Cushman & Wakefield in the sector. A key part of the role is to drive pan Asia Pacific client campaigns to generate leads and opportunities into the business, for these industry sectors.  This role can be located in Australia or Singapore.  Job Description  Principal Responsibilities In partnership with the practice group leads, develop the go-to-market strategy in Asia Pacific for the three industry sectors to grow and develop our revenue opportunities in each market Drive brand profile in the three industry sectors across the Asia Pacific region to ensure Cushman & Wakefield is in the consideration set for clients and prospects Profile the SMEs within the Cushman & Wakefield business who have been appointed to lead the business strategy in each of the industry sectors Position Cushman & Wakefield as a thought leader in the three industry sectors, taking a lead role in producing content that is relevant to our clients in Asia Pacific Develop and execute marketing activities to create client engagement opportunities including content marketing, sponsorships, PR, client events, digital marketing that show clear ROI Develop internal communications to build the profile of the practice group strategy within the business Ensure the platform is cross-functional incorporating both investor and occupier perspectives in all facets of the activities in each sector Work closely with the Business Development teams across the region to ensure activation in local markets across industry sectors, creating a collaborative environment Performs other related duties as required or requested Skills And Capabilities Strong knowledge and expertise in commercial real estate or the industry sectors we are targeting Experience in growing revenue into new markets, understanding competitive landscapes and developing go-to-market strategy Project management skills and the ability to manage multiple, cross-functional projects with often tight deadlines and many stakeholders Exceptional stakeholder management skills across the Asia Pacific business, as well as global practice groups Influencing skills across Business Development Services team to deliver consistency across APAC Strong communications skills, both written and oral, ideally with experience working across multiple countries Professional Experience 10+ years experience in senior roles in real estate sector (or industry sectors being targeted) preferably in a marketing, research or sales role Minimum Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Communications or Research Experience in marketing, client care, business development, technology, data & insights Experience applying insights to strategy that deliver business outcomes Expertise in formulating, testing and implementing client experiences for specific outcomes in the context of a large, matrixed organisation Digital marketing technology literacy A proven track record in project management Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

description: Our client is a leading payments platform provider. Below are the primary responsibilities of the role  Highlights Solid experience in Financial Technology and IT Project Management is required. At least 3 years of experience in managing a diverse team with at least 10 members is required. Fluent English communication both spoken and written skills is a must. Responsibilities Support the pre-sales and sales activity at the stage of project scope definition. Engage with all partners to ensure appropriate project plan and implementation are in accordance with established timeline and budget. Manage his/her team of project managers, technical product managers and developers to drive the implementation of various projects according to plan. Monitor the activities of the project partner and is responsible for ensuring appropriate resources are allocated and maintained to facilitate the successful completion of the project. Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear manner. Establish regular review of project status. Be responsible for project budget and invoicing. Qualifications 8+ years of experience in managing web-based software development and software deployment processes At least 3 years of experience in managing a diverse team with at least 10 members Strong functional knowledge of financial services, payment gateway and other related applications and products Strong project management skills Solid experience in managing multiple teams simultaneously Strong and proven ability to manage client and partner relationship Strong communication and negotiation skills Our client offers an attractive remuneration package, a fast-paced and exciting working environment, and provide challenging opportunities for life-long learning and career development. Newly created role due to strong growth prospects Opportunities to rotate across commercial and supply chain controlling  About Our Client  This is an opportunity with an industry leader within the Manufacturing sector with strong global footprints. They have experienced strong growth with solid pipeline of projects and is currently looking for a Controller to manage the Supply Chain operations in the region. Due to its strong reputation for internal rotation and mobility, this person can look forward to a rotation in portfolio to the commercial controlling function in the near term.  Job Description  Reporting to the FP&A Director, this individual will play an integral role in driving and executing the strategy of the Supply Chain operations globally in the immediate term. You will partner closely with the Head of Supply Chain and its leadership team in leading the business planning, performance management and reporting process. You will be required to provide business and financial insights and identifying key drivers to optimise supply chain and business operations. You will support the sales & operations planning process and also own the annual business plan. You will build financial models and perform simulations to support business decisions. This individual will also drive continuous improvement projects and participate in automation work. Moving forward, the person can expect to rotate to the business controlling function partnering with commercial stakeholders in driving business performance.  The Successful Applicant  The ideal candidate should be Degree/MBA qualified with more than 8 years of relevant experience in the controlling/FP&A function in a Multinational environment. You are analytical with strong Excel skills and business acumen. You are an excellent communicator and is able to challenge stakeholders on status-quo. You are self-motivated with strong learning agility and demonstrates an open mindset for job rotation in future. Experience from a manufacturing/industrial set-up will be of an advantage.  What's On Offer  You can expect to work with a growing organisation with strong career progression opportunities. Competitive salary package which commensurate with experience and qualification.  Contact: Jessly Chew (Lic No: R1549000)  Quote job ref: 4217091

description: Company Description  At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Job Description  Your primary responsibility is to lead a team of cloud growth advisors to generate demand in growing the cloud footprint by delivery immediate value to the customer by delivering a well-defined cloud adoption plan. You will work closely with C-suite stakeholders, contributing vision to the customer's cloud strategy, and becoming a trusted business partner by developing the right solutions to meet the business needs.  You will support the customer in leading the organizational change within the cloud journey and drive large, multiple, and/or highly complex business solutions and strategy for targeted customers focused on Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform and hybrid multi-cloud solutions.  Key Responsibilities Establishing close working relationships, trust, and become an advisor to C suite's in the customer organization. Helping the customer to create the cloud/application strategy and roadmap (which includes single and multi-cloud vs on-prem vs hybrid). The ability to breakdown complex customer pain points and the ability to articulate the cloud value proposition in sales Working with the product development, enterprise architects and product specialist to develop a well define cloud blueprint. The responsibility includes Building technology roadmaps for the customer organization, which support their digitalization of the IT transformation journey. Building high-level target architectures for our customers Supporting CDO / digital initiatives to enable fast application development Evangelizing cloud operating model and act as an IT agility change agent Supporting the creation of compliance and security approach for cloud Building TCO case studies for cloud adoption and migration Helping organizations to tackle integration strategy/hybrid scenarios Advising on the procurement process, and considerations for new consumption methods (for example contracting, OPEX vs. CAPEX) Creating strategic plans with Delivery Day 1 and Day 2 (Project & Program) Managers, sales colleagues, and senior customer stakeholders to build out the delivery roadmap for cloud As part of account management and sales responsibility, Monitor the revenue pipeline and leads of Singtel key accounts, adjusting as necessary to create sustainable growth Develop growth strategies with the executive teams working on strategies around account planning and strategies Develop and implement robust sales management processes – pipeline for cloud managed services, account planning, and proposals. Lead Prospect and manage close relationships with key target clients. Work closely with Channel/Partner/Product Development -- adding new sales channels and 3rd party resellers and partners. In addition, the role must work closely with Global Products and Cybersecurity Business Units to broaden the cloud portfolio with network and security propositions. Strengthen our organizational capabilities and talent to support cloud sales across Global Enterprise (GE) Customer Facing Units (CFU) Major Challenges Leading transformation across people, process and technology. At Singtel, we will need to build the right team, instil the appropriate culture and have the right technologies to ensure success. Instilling the right process in a client overall transformation across business demand generation, applications development, services operations and IT infrastructure. Leading customer conversations on cloud-related topics to influence and advise thereby selling cloud services with a consulting-led approach with large pull through on typical Singtel service products around cloud. The key to success in Digital Services transformation is ensuring that Singtel internal processes are optimized to accommodate. Ensuring success is dependent upon building the right team to support this role and ensure that this team is integrated into CFU and Product/delivery teams with minimal friction.  Education & Qualification Masters Level / Bachelor in business, computer science, information technology or related field preferred with 15 years of experiences 10 or more years of business consulting in cloud, technical consulting, or sales solutions experience Experience working with the technology industry, explicitly handling significantly sized accounts Experience working with cloud solution/product portfolios Experience in managing customer accounts and experience developing winning sales solutions and proposals through consultative selling Significant implementation experience on the AWS, Microsoft Azure platform, Google Cloud Platform and hybrid cloud environment. Experience with Cloud Management Platforms (CMP's) and automation tools such as Puppet, Chef, Terraform, CloudFormation, SNOW, etc. Experience working with enterprise management systems, ITIL service delivery, and service desk integration Experience working with the business environment, business industry and competitor products and services Working knowledge of large cloud deals based on AWS, Azure and GCP Technical /Professional Certifications The following cloud certifications are highly desired: AWS Certified Solution Architect – Professional AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional Microsoft Certified – Azure Solutions Architect Expert Microsoft Certified – Azure DevOps Engineer Expert Microsoft and/or Amazon and/or Google specialist certifications ITIL, CISSP or other relevant certifications are desirable Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries Strong understanding of CloudOps, DevOps is a plus Familiarity with standard enterprise services (Directory Services, Information Assurance, Virtual Desktop, etc.), products (i.e., Oracle, SAP) and frameworks (ITIL, TOGAF, etc.)

jobTitle: Manager, Product Owner, Digital Sales Enablement APAC
description: Purpose and Passion Comprehensive Benefits Life-Work Integration Community Career Growth  At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.  Boston Scientific APAC is seeking out a highly driven, digitally experienced professional to implement and effectively advance BSC’s data-driven marketing capabilities on Boston Scientific’s Sales Enablement Platform.  About The Role  As Manager, Product Owner, Digital Sales Enablement APAC, you will develop and implement innovative sales enablement strategies for business divisions and support key data integrations (aligned to overarching business and franchise objectives across divisions, in collaboration with Marketing Managers, Product Marketing, Sales Leaders, Sales Operations, Corporate Marketing Automation and other stakeholders). You will be responsible for execution of these strategies in close partnership with IT, securing and managing development resources who will create digital marketing capabilities within Salesforce and other technologies in BSC’s tech stack.  Responsibilities Support Digital Marketing Manager APAC to define customer-centric digital solution strategy and implementation in line with Boston Scientific’s commercial efforts and to digitize our business. With time, lead the execution of cutting-edge digital sales enablement solution capabilities from pilot to execution to drive growth and revenue. Develop protocol/procedures for scaling and complimenting high impact integrated digital solutions across APAC markets in line with Boston Scientific’s commercial priorities that deliver at or above agreed-upon targets for Boston Scientific’s businesses. Partner with 3rd party sales enablement platform provider(s), to enhance existing features and add new features to existing platforms to enhance HCP, sales teams and marketing team experiences which fit with Boston Scientific’s business strategies. Work with design and development agencies and divisional marketing/sales team members to create and curate edetailing content to meet local market requirements. Work with Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Community and Service Cloud teams at country, regional and global label to drive sales enablement platform integration, develop and evolve platform insights dashboards. Act as the product owner on a scrum team consisting of technical leads, developers, and scrum master working within a larger, cross team backlog. Collaborate with marketing and sales team to mine insights and close the marketing/sales loop with in-country teams to refine existing processes. Build relationships with cross functional teams at country, region and globe to define country specific digital sales enablement requirements, stakeholder management and legal compliance reviews and approvals. lead sales enablement roll-out plans and collaborate with change management teams for country specific executions. Influence various functions and levels within the organization with strong interpersonal communication skills and presentation skills. Be main point of contact for on-going vendor relationships. Manage multiple programs at once and effectively prioritize work for both digital strategy and implementation. Play a thought leader role by sharing knowledge and best practices within the organization. Partner with in-house Omni-channel business analyst, Salesforce specialists, Mobile App platform developers, Website platform developers and content and Mixed Reality platform specialists.  Key Skills & Experiences  What we’re looking for in you: Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of studies with 7 + years of overall marketing, communications and/or digital experience, with 2+ years driving customer-centric integrated marketing plans in a B2C or B2B environment. 3+ years of experience with Sales Enablement platform implementation and usage experience (such as Showpad , Veeva, Pitcher) with p roven capability managing and developing a team Experience working with Sales Cloud or Marketing Cloud Experience in building and implementing a new digital plan in medical device, biopharma or healthcare fields. Experience work ing in/with sales teams and marketing teams in APAC region. Digital native, with passion for new technology innovations. Strong digital marketing acumen and a proven track record of developing and selling impactful marketing communication programs that drive business results. Demonstrate a solution-oriented mindset towards complex challenges. Proven success as part of a cross functional team working in/with a multi-cultural work environment. Extensive experience in developing and implementing digital communications programs driving customers through a decision journey. Strong stakeholder management experience from senior country leadership to on the ground sales reps across markets in APAC including Japan, China, Australia and Korea.  Preferred Qualifications Strong understanding of digital platforms, user experience and content strategy is preferred. Experience working with raw data and drawing key recommendations to optimize digital solutions landscape. Experience working with Community Cloud and Service Cloud. Experience in optimizing channels to improve customer experience and sales rep experience based on big data and machine learning. BI tool experience (such as Tableau , power BI, Sales Cloud dashboards)  About Us  As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there’s no better place to make it happen.  Boston Scientific is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Disability, Veteran  Some Of Our Recent Accolades Include  Boston Scientific is proud to be recognized for our innovations that impact patients' lives, our performance as a company, our workplace culture and our contributions to communities around the world. 2021 FORTUNE World’s Most Admired Companies 2021 Top 100 Global Innovators by Clarivate Analytics 2021 Human Rights Campaign Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2020 Forbes Best Employer’s for Diversity  For more information, please visit us at  Visit www.bostonscientific.com to learn more and apply
