description: EVYD Technology is a healthcare AI and Big Data company established with the aim to deliver data-driven solutions to address healthcare issues facing countries in Southeast Asia and beyond.  We are transforming healthcare through Data Intelligence. Our Big Data platform aggregates raw data that reside in disparate information systems and convert them into computable, structured and standardized data so that they could be further processed to derive deep insights and knowledge using natural language processing, machine learning and other AI technologies.  About this position:  We are seeking an experienced marketer to shape and execute a global marketing strategy, and build up the marketing team, to enable EVYD to achieve its ambitions.  Reporting to the CEO, the Marketing Director will have a global remit. The goal is to employ unique and cost-effective marketing strategies to increase awareness and grow EVYD's market share and revenues.  Responsibilities: Develop annual and three-year marketing strategy (including assessment of market potential for EVYD product offerings and development of go-to-market models) to achieve marketing KPIs Leverage insights, market research, voice of customer, voice of field and/or other data to develop global campaigns that strengthen our value position Manage relationships with key external (e.g. healthcare authorities, policymakers, hospitals, researchers etc.) and internal stakeholders (e.g. functions such as Technology, Business Development, Operations and HR etc.) across geographies, to meet marketing objectives (e.g. organisation of events, collaboration on research initiatives etc.) Manage marketing budget and ensure spends are delivering positive ROI Manage creative/PR agency partnerships, where required Develop and oversee development of marketing materials (e.g. decks, brochures, newsletters) Develop content strategy that attracts a qualified audience to our owned properties (e.g. website, webinars etc.) Strengthen our corporate brand and act as brand steward to ensure brand consistency across all customer touch points Establish key performance indicators and utilize analytics to understand how our inbound marketing activity turns into customers, and continually refine the process to convert customers more efficiently Build and manage marketing team  Requirements: 10 years of relevant experience Strong results orientation, with proven track record of success in marketing and sales positions in Healthcare/Technology Project management skills and ability to influence at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to lead and work alongside intercultural, cross-functional team members to achieve business goals Familiar with multi-channel marketing Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to navigate ambiguity and manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment  Good to have: Experience working with cross-functional stakeholders, and influencing senior stakeholders and work across geographies Experience crafting high-impact customer experience plans that conform to local market needs Fundamental clinical knowledge related to hospital environment and clinical practice  Due to limited capacity, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

description: The Cyber, Associate Director will manager and lead a team of cybersecurity consultants and architect to help drive cyber business in NCS. At times, he is expected to lead by example and will participate in bid review, solutioning and proposal creation to meet customers requirements and security challenges.  He is also responsible to drive the competency and training of his team to be align to market changes and trend in cloud and emerging cyber technologies.  He needs to be a people person both internally and externally. He will also act as Subject Matter Expert that understands the security landscape, architectural models and solutions credibly, and possess the ability to discuss and present to C-level stakeholders and technical members.  The Cyber Associate Director needs a depth of knowledge and experience in two or more of the following core domains: Application Security, Database Security, Regulatory Compliance, Anti-Malware, Incident Response and Managed Security Services. The Associate Director should also be able to speak to the breadth of the landscape at an introductory level as well. The candidate will provide subject matter expertise through delivery of workshops, as a leader of pre-sales and consulting engagements, and as a leader on solutions design and deployment projects. The candidate possesses the ability to generate and review high quality artifacts such as requirements artifacts, high level and detailed designs and deployment plans.  Responsibilities Be responsible to lead the architects and presales on the design of complex security solutions that integrate all multi-media (voice & data) ICT (Information Communication Technology) and OT (Operation Technology) components into an effective and efficient network infrastructure design Lead in initial project planning & costing jointly with other LOBs in NCS Undertake cyersecurity level customer requirements gathering and scoping. Deliver customer workshops and presentations as required. Support strategic & mega tenders as Solution Manager as SPOC for cyber security solutions. Responsible for helping the Sales team to identify and close specific sales opportunities; Participate in sales conference calls and prospect visits, guide the team to provide expert-level product demonstrations in person and via WebEx, at the request of the Sales team and/or when strategic or complex opportunities are identified. Participate as a senior-level technical resource at trade shows and conferences Work independently and as a vital member of the sales engineering team Work with the sales team to strategize on sales approaches to develop business Plan and develop the cyber competency of the team to meet new market trends  The Ideal Candidate Should Possess Depth of knowledge in one or more of the core security domains: GRC, Security Operations, Application, Network and Infrastructure security Deep Experience in the design and deployment of technology and solutions in at least two of the core domains: Network and Infrastructure Security, Endpoint Security, Security Consulting, Incident Response, Threat Detection, Mobility Security and Managed Security solutions. An understanding across this breadth of technology domains, understanding the inter-relationships between major components Solid understanding and experience working a structured solution design methodology  General Competencies 5 years of experience working as a security manager leading a presales team. 5 years of experience working in a pre-sales capacity related to two or more of the following technologies: Web Application Firewall, Database Security, Web and/or Mobile Application Security, Anti-Malware Solutions, Managed Security Solutions. Previous experience working on government tenders specifically in cyber security environment and Governance, Risk Management and Compliance is an added advantage Experienced working across diverse teams to facilitate solutions Experienced working with Security practitioners Experienced working with Network, Application or Database operations personnel Knowledgeable in one or more of the following security and compliance/regulatory standards: DISA-STIG, DIACAP, FedRAMP, PCI-DSS, GDPR, UK Data Protection Act, PIPEDA, HK PDPO, EU DPD, or BDSG. Experienced with modern versions of Linux and Windows operating systems Strong communication and presentation skills Comfortable working in a project based / client serving model Help drive pursuits and engage in complex deals, matching outcomes to expectations Ability to work easily with diverse and dynamic teams Ability to work in a matrix management model Ability to mentor/coach Sales Engineers and Security Architects

The successful candidate will play a key role in building and executing marketing strategies, budget management, go-to-market strategy and campaigns, working in cross-functional teams across the region. You will drive breakthrough marketing at scale, build unbreakable alignment with sales as well as regional marketing stakeholders. Define the brand strategy & direction, develop clear positioning, value proposition and messaging, driven by qualitative and quantitative data Create and manage impactful content for each of our customer segments, and an equally powerful content distribution across various channels Execute the strategic planning rhythm to ensure follow-through of the functional deliverables via discussions, updates and action-tracking Plan, forecast, and deliver the full year marketing strategy that supports unlocking our next wave of growth; be responsible for target (OKR) setting and project unfolding Lead and further develop capabilities in the Aimazing Marketing Team across digital, brand, CRM and creative channels Collaborate with Product, Business Development, Operations and Data teams to determine the general long term merchants acquisition, retention, and driver engagement strategies Focus on end to end campaign management and optimization keeping potential customers journey in mind to drive initiatives to increase awareness, engagement, conversion and retention Own the marketing analysis, reporting, and optimization of our marketing activities and channels, and establish best practices and share knowledge Understanding and developing budgets and finance, including expenditures, research and development appropriations, return-on-investment and profit-loss projections. Strategise, plan and drive the execution of digital marketing campaigns to deliver business results  JOB REQUIREMENTS: At least 7 years of experience as a marketing leader with a track record of scaling from an early stage to high growth An expert in growth marketing through brand, performance, content and CRM marketing with a strong business sense Maintain high levels of communication and flexibility with management, cross-functional teams, and business partners internally and externally Strong data analysis skills and ability to use both quantitative and qualitative means to map strategy, decisions, product iterations and roadmap prioritization back to data. A big-picture thinker who is detail-oriented High level of self-motivation, energy and accountability; ability to work both independently and as a team in a fast-paced working environment Have an eye on spotting and attracting top marketing talents, and have a proven track record of building and leading a high performing and cohesive team Passionate about being part of an exciting new team that wants to make a meaningful impact in the region

jobTitle: Head of Global Digital, Tech & Architecture Banking Solution Consulting
description: Oracle Financial Services Global Business Unit (FSGBU) is a world leader in providing IT solutions to the financial services industry. Oracle’s customers include ten of the top ten global banks, ten of the top ten insurance companies, ten of the top ten securities firms, five of the top five mutual fund companies and four of the top five World stock exchanges. With the experience of delivering value-based IT solutions to over 840 financial institutions in over 130 countries, the FSGBU understands the specific challenges that financial institutions face: the need for building customer intimacy and competitive advantage through cost-effective solutions while, simultaneously, adhering to the stringent demands of a dynamic regulatory environment. Our solutions have the world's most comprehensive and contemporary banking applications and provide a technology footprint that addresses their complex IT and business requirements  Description What You’ll Do Brief Description of the Role: If you have a passion for people and for dazzling your customers with great presentations and engaging sessions, then this represents the perfect opportunity to blend your skills with your Digital, Technical & Architecture and business acumen.  For the role of Global Head of Digital, Tech & Architecture for Banking Solution Consulting function, we are searching for a motivated and passionate individual, who can lead a global team supporting wide array of Banking Solutions and striving for excellence. With your drive, and goal-getter attitude, you will play a key role in driving change and raising the bar. The Banking Solution Consulting Global Head for Digital, Tech & Architecture is responsible for leading a team of highly talented and motivated Digital, Technology & Architecture focused Solution Consultants who work closely together with the Sales organization, selling Oracle’s market leading Banking Solutions focused on Retail, Corporate, Institutional and Universal Banking market segment including Oracle FLEXCUBE (please click on FLEXCUBE), Oracle Banking (Please click on OBP) and Oracle Digital Experience (please click on ODBX),  Oracle Corporate & Transaction Banking (Please click on Corporate/Transaction Banking) Products & Solution offerings Your key objectives are:  Create and sustain an environment where your team is inspired, informed, educated, enabled, recognized and rewarded with the goal of sustained success. Be a partner to the business and ensure your team is working on the right things, at the right time and in the right manner. Maximize your teams’ productivity by promoting re-use and use of our Solution Consulting knowledge and collaterals from across the globe. Modernize the way your team engages with customers, using compelling, innovative and creative tools and techniques.  There are four main aspects to the role:  Strategic Sales Partnership - Manage a partnership with your key stakeholders to help develop a strategic / technology / architecture plan for the Oracle Banking business globally and the way you will work together on executing the plan.  Tactical Sales Partnership - Help develop great opportunity and account strategies and engage the appropriate solution consulting technology architects to support them. You will also run and attend deal reviews, dry runs and dress rehearsals. You will act as a sponsor or a lead for certain key deals and accounts. You along with regional solution consulting leaders will also run regular business reviews with sales & solution consulting Exec Management to ensure alignment on priorities and progress on key deals.  Team Management - Create and sustain an environment where your team of technology and digital architects are truly inspired, informed, educated, enabled, recognized and rewarded with the goal of ensuring you have a successful and, above all, a happy team. Typical activities include: Team meetings, 1:1s, Best Practice sharing on Digital /Technology, Architectural Trends, building out-art-of-possible solution assets which will leverage product & solution capabilities. Weekly time card review and approval, expense report review and approval, and weekly time entry and data quality.  Business improvement initiatives - You will also be expected to lead or participate in projects and initiatives across Solution Consulting to help solve problems and improve as a business.    Key Areas of Responsibility and Tasks  GTM & Sales Execution Tasks:  Continuous Engagement with Product / Engineering teams to ensure that there is deep understanding of Product Engineering Development Principles, Methodology, Technology Tool Sets & Architectural standards for the wide array of Banking Products / Solutions within Oracle FSGBU portfolio. Collaborate with sales management and sales account executives to plan and execute on technology/architecture led account strategies through participation in informal and formal account reviews. Demonstrate innovative approaches in demonstrating (particularly technology/architecture aspects of the solution offerings) during sales pursuits and pipeline development activities. Balance the required presales / solution consulting investment with the value of each opportunity, challenging when appropriate Engage the appropriate Presales/SC architects for qualified sales opportunities, including the identification of a presales tech & architecture SC lead Enforce consistent presales processes, dry-runs and discovery sessions, to ensure superior demos, and presentations, resulting in flawless execution of the sales cycle. With select sales cycles, build strategic partnerships with key decision makers in customer organization. Monitor the impact of each presales tech architects throughout each sales cycle in order to manage employee development Maintain high-level knowledge of Oracle’s entire solution suite and key competitors Balance the utilization level of the team, including investment in business development activities, necessary to build the pipeline for the aligned sales teams Qualification of sales opportunities along with Regional SC Leader Team Development Tasks:  Identify areas of development for each team member and work with each to define and execute a tailored learning plan. Foster an atmosphere of continuous learning and improvement. Monitor the development activities towards industry and solution learning goals. Provide feedback and coaching after dry-runs, demos and presentations in order to help them hone their skills. Provide formal oral and written feedback during annual performance management reviews. Drive and encourage your team members toward their group’s revenue target. Help develop the larger presales organization through leadership of a solution- or industry-focused community of practice which provides enablement and a voice of the field to solution engineering management. Be resourceful and creative. Consider how existing solutions might be combined to leverage new sales opportunities. Try innovative approaches and techniques.  Required Skills/Experience What You’ll Bring 15+ years of relevant IT solution support e.g. pre-sales, solution architecture, delivery or professional services experience 5+ years of management experience Technology & Architecture Domain experience and expertise in one or more of the following product/vendors Digital / Core Banking applications like Mambu, Thought Machine, Finxact, 10X, Netsys, FLEXCUBE/Oracle Banking Applications (Oracle), Finacle (Infosys), Intellect, Temenos Transact/Temenos Infinity, Sopra Banking & others Thorough understanding of a microservices architecture, including professional experience in the design, build, and operations of microservices in a production environment at scale. Ability to communicate technical design concepts to business and technical stakeholders Reasonable programming background in Java or JVM based languages. Reasonable Exposure and/or Hands-on experience to Spring Boot based microservices will be very valuable Should possess excellent understanding of design patterns involved in developing applications using microservices architecture Demonstrable experience of DevOps / DevSecOps and CI/CD pipelines. Prefer candidates with cloud experience (Oracle cloud or any of the other big 3 cloud providers - AWS, Azure, GCP). Experience with cloud native technologies is a plus. Have deep appreciation of agile development models (preferably Scrum) Strong Leadership Skills to engage & support field sales teams effectively. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). Excellent presentation skills. Excellent interpersonal relationship building skills. Experience leading regional/industry/architecture teams, appropriate knowledge of methodologies and technology Proven experience building diverse teams, highly inclusive leadership style Proficiency in Oracle solutions, competitors, technology, and business models preferred Fluent English and fluency in any other Regional Languages will be preferred as well. Must be willing to travel (>50% of work hours) when normalcy resumes.    As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).
industries: Information Technology and Services, Information Services, and Computer Software

description: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  The Role Responsibilities  The purpose of this role is to enable the Bank to drive Digital Sales & Marketing through Performance Marketing for Personal segment across all paid, owned and earned channels. The role will be accountable for designing and driving the Performance Marketing agenda working closely with Personal Banking business and execution teams to identify and support execution of Performance marketing initiatives which drive measurable lift on digital sales & marketing goals. It requires proven leadership, outstanding stakeholder management and knowledge of performance marketing across all digital channels, paid media, data and digital analytics tools, content optimisation, onsite optimisation, keyword research and strategy, AdTech and MarTech, campaign management tools and capabilities. Extensive knowledge of marketing performance management, paid media buying processes and tools is a pre-requisite, with hands-on experience with running marketing campaigns.  To achieve this, the role holder will be part of a Global team of Digital Sales & Marketing experts and is required to:  Design and implement a Digital Sales & Marketing measurement framework, setting measurement standards, driving execution of attribution modelling, designing reporting, reviewing and streamlining processes, to create transparency on Digital Sales & Marketing performance and set the basis to Performance Marketing optimisation Co-design and implement a Performance Marketing approach and methodology together with Brand & Marketing and Personal Banking teams, reviewing and streamlining processes, reviewing governance, defining clear roles and responsibilities within the design and execution of performance marketing initiatives Provide guidelines, best practices, and recommendations to execution teams to optimise Paid media budgets, Conversion rates and Performance across digital channels and platforms within the sales funnel and deliver sales uplift, supporting ideation and prioritisation of performance marketing optimisation initiatives. Build and maintain toolkits, tests libraries and trainings to optimise marketing performance and upskill execution teams, keeping up-to-date with global best practices, innovations and tech developments within the performance marketing space in order to continuously innovate and drive superior marketing performance Partner with Data, Technology, Build, MarTech stakeholders in charge of building capabilities (in particular Digital Analytics, Test & Target, DMP tools) to ensure alignment and prioritization of capability building with business needs Partner with Brand & Marketing and Media agencies stakeholders to ensure alignment and prioritization of marketing initiatives and media buy processes with business priorities Digital Sales & Marketing measurement  Collaborate with data analytics and digital stakeholders to ensure comprehensive mapping of touchpoints across digital platforms and channels in order to map granular end-to-end digital sales funnel performance Design dashboards, measurement and reporting tools to track granular performance across all steps of the digital sales funnel, by channel, campaign, ad set, click source Collaborate with Technology, Data and Build teams to identify and leverage all tools to gather insights on digital sales & marketing performance (including analytics, heatmaps, customer journey mapping, etc) Create standard reporting and business insights for measurement and assessment of digital sales & marketing performance Design measurement methodology to support prioritisation of testing initiatives and assessment of outcomes of the tests and campaigns using statistical significance, control groups, etc. Support the design and implementation of page tagging, configuration of testing and targeting campaigns, and report construction Performance Marketing framework  Review and update the framework for Digital Sales & Marketing target setting and tracking with products, segments and countries stakeholders and align stakeholders to ensure consistency in digital implementation within the guidelines Design and implement performance marketing framework and methodology, reviewing and updating playbooks to drive performance marketing across all channels by using MarTech stack and tools available, to be delivered within an agile operating model, including management of Search (SEO/SEM), Display, Social, Aggregators, Affiliates, Partners, KOLs, as well as ongoing management of online conversion rate optimisation Develop and implement clear structures of accountability within performance marketing to ensure team members can perform successfully in their roles and there is clear oversight / supervision / decision making to deliver performance optimization initiatives Evaluate maturity of marketing capabilities and processes and deliver recommendations for continuously streamlining efforts and improving digital sales & marketing performance results Create and disseminate test & learn culture within the organisation to drive performance marketing optimisation Performance Marketing Guidelines, Best practices, Toolkits and Libraries  Design and disseminate guidelines and best practices to identify and execute performance marketing initiatives across channels, including SEO, SEM, Display, Social, Video, Aggregators, Affiliates, Partners, KOLs, etc. Run regular assessment and review of performance of digital sales & marketing actions with execution teams, providing them with advice and recommendations to optimise performance across all digital channels Identify new concepts and innovative technologies to seamlessly acquire and nurture customers, tailoring them to markets and segments and socializing them with key stakeholders in order to execute them Build, maintain and marketing across all performance levers for all channels Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development of execution teams to drive performance marketing Alignment with Data, Technology, Build and MarTech  Be an advocate for investment in transformational initiatives (e.g. building Marketing Technology capabilities, standardizing digital sales measurement) that drive digital sales and marketing volumes and efficiency, collaborating with the Bank's stakeholders to deliver them Collaborate with a range of partners, e.g., MarTech, Data Analytics, Web Management, Online/Mobile platforms, Digital Banking, Brand & Marketing, Marketing agencies, Legal, Compliance, Security, in order to prioritise capability building and ensure access to the right tools and support to deliver execution of Performance Marketing Alignment with Brand & Marketing and Marketing agencies  Collaborate with a Brand & Marketing and Digital partners and agencies to align Performance Marketing actions with overall Brand & Marketing agenda and drive synergies and best practices sharing amongst campaigns and Segments Regulatory & Business Conduct  Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Our Ideal Candidate Graduate degree 10+ years of experience in running digital marketing for large-scale brands, in house or through digital agencies; 5+ years working in a product marketing capacity preferred, i.e., partnered closely with Agile development teams Expert knowledge of Paid Media tools, including DMP, DSP, Ad servers, Bidding tools Expert knowledge in all Paid media channels, including Search, Programmatic Display, Affiliates, Aggregators, Social Media Expert knowledge of digital marketing principles such as funnel optimization UX, SEO & Landing Page optimization & experience in running A/B tests for campaigns and deriving customer insights a major plus Deep experience in planning and buying of display media, building campaigns, implementing bidding strategies. Experience with programmatic buying a plus Knowledge of Onsite optimization and SEO principles and best practices Experience collecting/analysing data and generation actionable insights using analytics and campaign management programs, e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe, DoubleClick Campaign Manager Knowledge of optimization and campaign management systems, e.g., CMS, Tag Management, Atlas, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager Working Knowledge of other analytics and data visualization tools, including Google Analytics, Google Trends, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, Event Tracking and Tagging (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch) Ability to understand the key business objectives and create a Media optimisation and measurement strategy with strong focus on online sales growth by working with SEO, Web, digital and products team. Compelling vision of the future of Marketing and translation into effective strategies and actions  Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages. We welcome conversations on flexible working.

description: Capital.com is on a mission to make the world of finance more accessible, engaging, and useful. We are a Fintech company with a difference, we use innovative technology to develop the most easy-to-use and transparent financial trading platform on the market. We have achieved lots of success and growth in Europe and we are here in Singapore!   We’re currently looking for a Head of Compliance to join our team and help spread our message.  Responsibilities: Setup Asian Legal and Compliance department Build the local Legal and Compliance department as early as possible – +12 vacancies of legal, compliance, risk monitor, research experts with regional work scope Leadership to retain top talent and to set up their operational and business KPI.  Point of contact for Asian Compliance, Legal, AML, and Regulation Setup clear and robust compliance processes and policies for day-to-day operations of the front end teams: Sales, Marketing, and Customer Support   Setup all mid and back-office functions compliant, stable, secure, and robust Expert of different compliance requirements of each available license Make Asian compliance direction to align with global compliance policy and vision Find and decide the best balance between compliance and business in the Asian market Train and educate compliance to all relevant teams and people.  Lead the license application of SG, KR, JP, and more possible countries in Asia (both currency.com and capital.com) and maintain the license Form the tiger team to obtain the target license Set clear and aggressive (also reasonable) timeline Be resourceful from the global compliance department for the best license application Share all progressive information to all relevant teams of regional and global.  Always-on market research Understand regulations surrounding capital.com and currency.com is highly dynamic Be vigilant on regulation updates in the region and understand the implication Share the insight to the global and regional teams on regular basis.  Part of Global Compliance team Understand Asian compliance department is one big team member of the global compliance and legal department Be a team player in a global project, initiative, and assignment.  Requirements: +15 years of intensive work experience in Compliance, AML, and Legal Experience in the capital market in tier-1 countries of SG, AU, KR, or JP in Asia +5 years of people management experience in compliance team in reputable financial service institute Ability to use independent judgment and to manage and impart confidential information in sizable financial institute group level CRCM, CBCO, CRCP, or equivalent certification or proven record professional work experience Experience with due diligence and audits Experience with successful license application records in SG, KR, JP, AU Professional knowledge in AML in Crypto.  Benefits: Be part of a highly motivated and compassionate team building the brand in Singapore Competitive package Full suite of training and ongoing continuous professional developments Free health insurance after successful probation.

About the Role The APAC Services team is hiring a Project Manager. He/she will be joining as Project Manager to implementation of our business, technical and integration projects. He/she will manage all aspects of the projects from initial client engagement to go-live. The scope of such engagements will be projects with external customers located in APAC. This position requires expertise in on-boarding new customers, strong project management skills as well as affinity for the management of technical projects with external clients. The Project Manager will work very closely with the local and global Sales, Pre-Sales, Services and Commercial Support teams. In addition to his/her project management responsibilities the candidate will also be involved in some pre-sales/scoping activities as well as engagement with third-party partners delivering on our projects. The primary objectives for the Project Manager will be:  For Customers - Assist customers to ensure a successful delivery of each project, set and manage customer expectations, broker communication/coordination of project activities between the customer and the other internal stakeholders.  Coordinate ordering activities with the customer to ensure all components required for the successful delivery of the projects are ordered in a timely fashion.  For Internal Stakeholders - Provide pre-sales assistance and coordinate involvement of subject matter experts for more complex projects scoping; improve processes to minimize efforts and reduce lead time to produce proposals.  Ensure all steps (before, during and after implementation) are completed to ensure compliance with processes and quality of delivery.  Monitor & report on projects, review deviations (customer requirements, timelines, cost and quality) and escalate as appropriate to meet both SWIFT & customer's expectations, coordinate corrective actions; improve/automate processes to do so.  What To Expect Define the scope of the project in collaboration with the project team and the client. Create a detailed work plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project; determine the time required to complete the project and develop a schedule for project completion. Review the project schedule with management and all other stakeholders that will be affected by the project activities (including the client); revise the schedule as required. Lead the design, testing, planning, and implementation of multiple complex projects. Determine the objectives and measures upon which the project will be evaluated at its completion. Conduct scheduled project oversight meetings with the client and other stakeholders; constantly monitor and report on progress of the project to all stakeholders. Recognize problems or situations that are new or without clear precedent. Evaluate alternatives and finds solutions using a systematic, multi-step approach. Prioritize own and team’s work. Anticipate consequences of actions, potential problems, or opportunities for change. Ensure open communication with the project team. Address delicate situations and handle conflicts in such a way as to maximize opportunity and minimize exposure to risk. Understand how and when to make a choice; how and when to escalate issues to higher levels. Analyze the risks and future impact of decisions. Provide pre-sales assistance and coordinate involvement of subject matter experts for more complex projects scoping; improve processes to minimize efforts and reduce lead time to produce proposals What will make you successful: 10-15 years' experience in project management, especially from financial services With 3-5 years in a consultation role will be great asset Management of Technical and Integration project experience preferred PMP Project Management certification Knowledge of project management techniques and tools including MS Project Knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of project management Agile methods and tools experience is preferred Proven experience in people and/or project management Strong customer focus with strong networking and interpersonal abilities Previous (technical) knowledge and experience with SWIFT’s Products and Services is an asset Excellent analytical, presentation and customer relationship skills Fluent in English and other Asia Language is a plus Must be willing to travel (domestically and internationally), when travel restriction are uplifted. What we offer  We put you in control of career  We give you a competitive package  We help you perform at your best  We help you make a difference  We give you the freedom to be yourself  We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals – like you – with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone’s voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion, or veteran/military status.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Job Description  Director, Total Rewards – Asia Region  For the builders and protectors, for the makers and explorers, those shaping and reshaping our world through hard work and inspiration. Stanley Black & Decker works to provide innovative solutions to propel people to their goals. We collaborate with one goal in mind: empower people to do better, safer, more significant work. We define success as delivering value to our customers, colleagues, and communities. Our commitment to quality, safety, and sustainability keep us focused on our path to becoming the uniquely human-centered global industrial company that keeps every stakeholder in mind while being “For Those Who Make The World.”  Stanley Black & Decker, a FORTUNE 500 company, is the world’s leading provider of tools and storage, the world’s second-largest commercial electronic security company, and a leading engineered fastening systems provider, with unique growth platforms in the infrastructure. With industry elite brands such as DEWALT, Porter-Cable, Craftsman, Bostitch, Lenox, and more: Stanley Black & Decker provides the tools to build the world.  Being a part of our team means living our core values of courage & innovation agility & performance inclusivity & collaboration integrity & accountability It means thriving in an environment of constant innovation and positive change. It means delivering tools, services, and solutions that the world counts on when it matters. It means maintaining the highest standards in everything you do every day. Key Responsibilities: Reporting to the Vice President, Total Rewards and matrix reporting to Vice President, Human Resources, Asia, the Director of Total Rewards – Asia Region, will lead the total rewards strategy, building on and evolving our current total rewards philosophy and programs across compensation, benefits and well-being in the Asia Region. The successful incumbent will have a proven track record of creating innovative, industry competitive reward strategies and programs that will align to the Asia operating model. You will be comfortable operating in a global, matrixed organization with demonstrated experience in being a trusted partner to HR leaders and key Regional/Country Managers. The ideal candidate will have a depth of experience in designing total reward models across different geographies in Asia, in partnership with global HR Center of Excellence leaders.  Our Asia region is a fast-paced and high-growth environment that changes more than it stays the same and requires a balance of tactical and strategic vision. You must love rolling your sleeves up and being hands-on – you will be a builder. You have a proven track record of being inclusive, and collaborating effectively across diverse teams to solve hard problems. You are an advocate and leader for diversity, equity and inclusion. You are humble yet confident.  What You’ll Work On Partner with human resources leaders and senior managers in the Asia region to ensure that the day-to-day operational support for compensation programs is successfully executed Serve as the Regional Project Manager for large scale compensation & benefits projects such as the implementation of Workday, Job Architecture, and Salary Structures Assess overall compensation health that diagnoses current state of wage/salaries and develop action plans with the business unit (“BU”) HRBP’s to address disparities within market; Evaluate roles against local market data and make recommendations on compensation for new hires, internal moves or promotions; Partner closely with the BUs to develop effective retention strategies aligned to local/regional market dynamics; Manage merit and variable compensation planning and administration within the Asia region; Develop benefits strategies through benchmark competitive data to develop cost effective, progressive, compassionate suite of benefits across the region aligned to local market dynamics leveraging our partnership with Willis Towers Watson and other outside advisors Develop a standardized sales compensation framework that will create a culture of performance and excellence across Asia by leveraging research in local market(s) while leveraging the enterprise framework; Partner with HR Leaders, Finance, Payroll and other key stakeholders to develop a streamlined and automated process that improves audit documentation and delivery of information Be well versed with acquisition due diligence and integration activities to participate in any such activity across the region. Partner with the Operations Total Rewards Leader on hourly associate matters as required; Functional Skills Experience implementing total reward strategies and programs in a fast-paced, high-growth innovative company. Building a Team in Asia Region A brilliant communicator able to quickly convey the key message & lead the path for action You have an enterprise & global mindset and have a demonstrated track record & experience in an organization that has gone through a people & technology evolution; Effectively manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines & execute the total reward strategy and can translate the strategy into local flavor; Strategic problem solver/analytical – leverages data to make recommendations and decisions; Strong project management skills Ability to work with cross-functional teams in highly matrixed organization; Technical Skills Deep understanding of compensation approaches in a diverse Asian market; Translate market data to effectively make pay/benefits recommendations aligned to BU requirements; Advanced Excel, and proficient in Powerpoint, Word and other technologies. Education/Experience 12+ years of demonstrated success in developing total reward strategies in Asia Region 8+ years of management experience instilling trust and credibility within matrixed team(s) while providing guidance and managing strategy & day to day operations; Excellent communication skills with an innate ability to influence and collaborate The ability to adapt and excel when business plans change The position is currently virtual and will be based in one of the Stanley Black & Decker Asia hubs: Bangalore, India; Shanghai, China or Singapore. Experience with Workday or other HR ERP systems a plus All qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.  Requisition Number  83903BR  Business  APAC - Corporate  No. of Positions  1  Function  Human Resources  Featured Category on SBD Careers  Human Resources  Region  Southeast Asia

description: Overview  Mindshare is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. We are currently looking for a Director eCommerce Strategy to join us.  The proliferation of online shopping and commerce landing destinations presents an exciting opportunity for Mindshare. The key opportunity for the Head of E-Commerce is to bring strategic expertise and experience to craft E-Comm solutions as a key offering and differentiator for Mindshare. Develop and execute the vision and strategy to continue to build and grow Commerce for Unilever brands Build, develop and create world class frameworks and systems that embraces innovation and delivers results. Bring new ideas, creativity, and insights across all media (digital, in-store and experiential) Develop reporting and forecasting modules to show positive ROAS which can then be implemented across all brands Be subject matter expert on regional/local marketplaces in APAC in terms of their positioning, audience and marketing capabilities Be the leader for all commerce related strategic work streams as part of client briefs and existing engagements. Active participation in overall commerce product and solutions development to provide full-funnel visibility to brands and media stakeholders Identify trends in the market, and business practices to find ways to capitalize on the constant changing landscape Why You Should be Excited  Just as the industry of ecommerce would demand, this role requires you to simultaneously build the ship while sailing it. This is an opportunity to build the Ecomm practice across the most exciting FMCG brand portfolio in the world. Performance marketing is Mindshare’s key focus area so this role will have the focus and support of leadership teams and business team leads and client stakeholders.  Measures of Success  3 months : Take over, Assess status, Establish actions Learn, learn, learn - the Unilever business has its own language and grammar. Study the brands, their personalities, their purpose, their history and their ambition. Shadow the existing teams in client meetings with the single-minded agenda of understanding deeply the client’s goals and objectives Clients should start seeing you as keen, observant and willing to learn Learn the tools of the trade- Deep dive into the tools on planning, insighting and data mining Start imagining and penning what success looks like by brand - everyone wants a winning story Have an auditor’s hat on - identify areas where the existing tools & processes can improve 6 months : Early Actions You have knowledge of the commerce ambitions, consumers and brand language. You are now ready to reimagine the current commerce offering within the plannin product and suggest improvement to our performance execution, and are prototyping your new thinking on a few brands You are able to fuse commerce data, consumer insights, brand objective and creative that sells into brilliant and simple stories (brilliant consumer commerce experiences) Global marketing and media heads have by now noticed you by your work landing at their desk You are imagining a future view of what commerce media looks like 1-3 years from now and future proofing the business to continue building brilliant commerce experiences All tools and stories created would have a local market landing lens keeping market context in mind You are able to join hands with the execution and content teams to spark new ideas. They are your partners, leverage their domain expertise for fluid and dynamic content creation 9 months : 2021 and Beyond Your work is being entered for awards and is being talked about by the global marketing, media and brand communities Your work has been outcome driven, brands are seeing the impact of your plans on their market metrics You have reimagined and evolved the commerce product and solutions from Mindshare What Your Day Job Looks Like At Mindshare You sit in the client office and visit clients and are constantly engaged with WPP agencies, partners and clients through the data At any given time, you are drawn between brand work for clients or product development or partner meetings. Partners could be from the online, content or measurement world Your peers are best in class, meaningful engagement will bring the best out of them - you are expected to challenge them and be challenged back in return - we want someone to embrace the challenge - daily! Get earphones, you will be working with a lot of cross-country teams - great work happens in markets too - learn and scale - we win as a team Handling senior client relationships on a daily basis other than clients across all work levels What You Will Need  This role requires someone with strong Performance capabilities and an ability to deliver across teams and markets. The ideal candidate will have built and led a breakthrough digital commerce business successfully leveraging new digital sales and marketing tactics, and possess deep knowledge and experience in all strategic, business, operational, and technological functions that make up the digital commerce ecosystem.  This role is heavy in both strategy and execution - this is a defining characteristic of our agency where our leaders do and think in equal measure. This person and role is the very embodiment of our values of Speed, Provocation and Teamwork as this role is required to work across multiple stakeholders, influence and champion the new and to do it with speed and scale.  The job holder will be expected to have:-  Core Skills Minimum 10 years’ experience in digital marketing, most of which in the retail/FMCG industry with prior experience working with market places or multi-brand sites such as Lazada, Shopee, or any other online business partners Proven success leading and inspiring a large cross-functional team of digital commerce business, technology, and operational business units Strong performance marketing experience. Proven ability to work with data to understand and analyze performance, optimize plans, drive decisions, and measure impact to the business Superior analytical skills and the ability to leverage performance data and convert consumer insights and trend data into high impact marketing initiatives Experience in a rigorous testing environment. Must be passionate about presenting a fact-based argument and be results/metrics driven. Can effectively communicate complex digital commerce concepts to all levels of the organization Minimum Qualifications Graduate or Post Grad in Marketing / Economics or related field Worked in a communication planning role 10 + years of work experience Your Team  You will lead the E-commerce strategy and consultancy and operate in a matrix structure where your indirect team will comprise of Search, Social, Programmatic specialists embedded in the client teams and/or GroupM Services  More About Mindshare  We were born in Asia in 1997, a start up with a desire to change the media world. Now we are a global agency with more than 7,000 employees in 116 offices across 86 countries, operating as one team - #teammindshare. We believe that in today’s world, everything begins and ends in media. We aim to be our clients’ lead business partner, to grow their business, and drive profitability through adaptive and inventive marketing. We do this through speed, teamwork and provocation and by operating as a network of networks rather than a rigid hierarchy. We create new things and have fun doing it. Whenever and wherever you join us, you open a door to opportunities in any and of all aspects of media, technology and innovation. We will support you, recognize you and reward you, making Mindshare the place where you do the best work of your career.  Mindshare APAC has won 500 awards in the last year alone, including “Agency Network of the Year 2017” by both the MMA SMARTIES™ and Campaign Asia for the fifth and third consecutive year, respectively. Mindshare is part of GroupM, the media investment management arm of WPP, the world’s leading communications services group. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com and follow us on Twitter @mindshare and facebook.com/mindshareapac and linkedin.com/company/mindshare.  About GroupM  GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.  GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity - it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: The Opportunity The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Bancassurance Performance Manager with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you. Manulife Bancassurance is seeking for a self-motivated professional, who is obsessed with delivering value, is forward-thinking, and drive the company's distribution strategy with the partnership.  What motivates you? You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone  What we are looking for: Leading distribution of insurance through DBS Institutional Banking Drive Distribution strategies for HNW products to meet/exceed the sales objective of the Bancassurance partners To establish relationships with inclusive partners, and engage regularly Stakeholder engagement and management. Provide senior business representation and collaboration with business partners Conduct market analysis, segment and target bancassurance opportunities, implement distribution strategies to onboard partners. To ensure things are done ethically & in accordance to regulatory compliance Review operational processes and control to ensure risk mitigation and compliance with regulatory authorities Conduct product training including mentoring, and training on knowledge & skill Marketing & branding initiatives including internal seminars and event management Active tracking of partner's sales activities and takes accountability for APE & profitability targets Responsible for P&L and monitoring the expenses for resource allocation  Requirements: Diploma / Degree with at least 10 years of relevant experience with successful track record Proven experience in sales distribution segments in bancassurance HNW / FA channel Ability to forge collaborative working relationships with various partnership within Manulife Singapore, as well as external partners Proven leadership, interpersonal and strong communication Results oriented and have good business connections in identifying and developing business opportunities  Our commitment to you    Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better  A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success   A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry   Our best. Every day.    Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.com

description: Job Description & Requirements  Job Location : Orchard  Industry :Retail  Need to work shift, weekends & PH  Morning shift: 9am to 6pm  Afternoon shift : 1230pm to 930pm Conduct audit checks on cash and gift vouchers Issue Petty Cash; facilitate money-change and pack coins for cashiers Update cashiers of any forged currency to prevent loss and assist in resolving all discrepancy from cashiers Prepare daily report for cash, foreign currency, suppliers’ vouchers Check and finalize all sales amounts with over/short report Prepare and check new floats, sales bags, slip bags, float cards for promotions Any other job-related duties assigned by the Company or your superior.

description: Pan Pacific Hotels Group is a young and dynamic company comprising three well-established and trusted brands; Pan Pacific®, PARKROYAL COLLECTION® and PARKROYAL®. We have aggressive expansion plans and as such, we are looking for motivated and energetic people to be part of our growing team. If you have a passion for the industry and are driven by the desire to create Service Excellence Culture, Pan Pacific Hotels Group is able to offer you great opportunities as we continue to strengthen our global footprint.  Based in our Corporate Office in Singapore, we are looking for a passionate and people-oriented individual to join us as a Director, Human Capital Management.  Job Responsibilities The Director, Human Capital Management will be responsible for the development and implementation of talent acquisition and resourcing strategies in support of the Group’s business and in line with the Pan Pacific Hotels Group Vision, Purpose and Values.  The primary responsibility of this role is to drive, manage and coordinate the full-spectrum of the resourcing function which includes recruitment, sourcing, selection and employment for the Pan Pacific Hotel Group. This position will play a key role in providing professional support and advice to management, in identifying and acquiring of talent into the organization, and including the movement of internal talent within the Group.  Other responsibilities include the following:  Policy & Framework Review and update Employment & Recruitment policies and standards of procedures for the group and ensure their communication through to all management and concerned Associates for proper implementation and understanding. Prepare and update job descriptions and talent profiles. Importantly these need to reflect leadership and associate competencies across the group. Development and maintenance of active or KIV (keep in view) candidate database and/or talent bank development to support the growth of the Group and staffing needs. Work closely with the Corporate Learning & Development to train line managers in interviewing techniques and in understanding the psychometric testing, as well as in identifying talent for internal career opportunities. Manpower planning, including annual budgeting of recruitment costs. Administration of all employment requisitions and employment contracts to ensure proper compliance, standards and procedures are met per company policy and guidelines.  Talent Sourcing & Recruitment Manage and participate in resourcing efforts to acquire the most qualified and suitable talent by recommending the most cost-effective recruitment channels, including the management of search firms and recruitment companies. Sourcing and maintenance of recruitment channels/tools, including PPHG career website, on-line website, e-recruitment system and tertiary institutions alumni network. Will pro-actively develop creative talent acquisition solutions if the organization is facing challenges in attracting the appropriate level and quality of talent and associates. In consultation with the Senior Vice President of Human Capital and Development to develop and implement of strategy of attracting and retaining Talent to ensure talent pipelines are continuously being strengthened in order to support its business and current needs, as well as the future growth of the business. Responsible for the recruitment of all levels in the Singapore Corporate Office, Global Sales Offices, Hotel General Managers, and any other key talent or critical roles for both corporate and property level. Manage graduate and intern recruitment in consultation and collaboration with the VP, Learning and Development. Ensure talent profiles are discussed and agreed with the hiring managers prior to any initiation of recruitment.  Employer Branding Effectively markets PPHG as employer of choice, leveraging our brand. Develop and manage relationships with career development teams of tertiary institutions. Manage on-sites visits/talks to visiting students to office. Collaborate with the Corporate Compensation & Benefits to ensure that the new recruits are properly compensated in line with the market and company policy and budget  Any other duties of a comparable nature as may be required.  The Person Minimum Degree with major in Human Resources or Business Administration 8 - 10 years of related working experience in resourcing, staffing and employment. Prior regional experience in sourcing and hiring talent within Asia Pacific with experience in implementing corporate recruitment best practices Experience in working with multiple stakeholders across a variety of functions and business needs Ability to engage, persuade and influence senior line/hiring managers on their recruiting requirements Eloquent communicator who can lead selection interviews and decisions Organized, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and set priorities amongst different objectives Flexible and Adaptable and able to both manage and direct change as a result of the changing nature of recruitment markets. A high energy, results-oriented individual who can make a difference through recruitment function. Ethical and able to make decision based on integrity, and organisations values  Pan Pacific Hotels Group is an equal opportunity employer. Interested applicants are invited to e-mail your resume to us at career@pphg.com. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Hospitality

description: About ByteDance Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.  Join the Innovative BytePlus Team As part of BytePlus, you'll help enterprise customers build what's next for their business. Leveraging Bytedance's cutting-edge technologies, we are devoted to developing innovative products and solutions to shape the future. We help our clients to focus on what truly matters. Centering on innovation and excellence, we create gamechanging solutions that help businesses to unleash their potential. You can help us to achieve our mission.  The Global Head of Marketing is a senior leader with a passion and experience for growing high-performance teams and successfully generate demands among enterprise customers, helping them in their journey of awareness and consideration of enterprise solutions. The role will be leading a team of marketing managers/specialists and regional marketing executives that are responsible to deliver the mission of BytePlus and grow our business and footprint.  Responsibilities Lead BytePlus Marketing organization to effectively support demand generation and capturing across different regions Work with BytePlus global team in developing, defining and executing marketing strategy Build and manage a team of marketing specialists globally Driving sales enablement by driving the marketing content creation for respective products Create a stimulating environment where everyone keeps a learning mindset and is energized by new growth opportunities, open to try new things, fail and make progress. Inspire people to do their best on a day-to-day basis and provide a diverse and inclusive work environment for your team to thrive in. Providing mentorship and development of marketing specialists, includes hiring, training and coaching duties.  Qualifications 5+ years of experience in product marketing within a tech and enterprise business. Minimum 3 years of experience in leading technical marketing in a global software organisation or related field Experience working in an early-stage start-up environment and ability to lead teams through ambiguous environment Fluency in English language
industries: Internet

description: Job Summary The primary job responsibility is to support Marketing and Sales initiatives in the Asia Pacific region.  The person will be responsible for managing Aircraft within the Asia Pacific region and will be the primary point of contact for technical support in the region. Job Responsibilities Assist the Head of Technical with the asset management of the owned and managed aviation portfolio. Manage Aircraft located in the Asia Pacific Region Acts as a point of contact for technical activities to clients and colleagues. Negotiate Letters of Intent and Lease Agreements with Lessees Manage Aircraft transitions Manage onsite consultants Manage third party MROs in the region Supports commercial development by working closely with Commercial and Legal to ensure that technical specifications and exposures are appropriately represented and managed during client negotiations and documentation. Manages technical exposure during the lease and at lease expiry. Liaises with airlines to co-ordinate inspection, maintenance work and maintenance reserves drawings. Handles other projects/tasks as needed. Qualifications 3 years of experience in a Technical management role within an airline, leasing company or as an aircraft leasing consultant. Experience in MRO and lease contract negotiation and management. AA/BA Degree A & P license or Type III or Aircraft Engineering experience a plus Self starter, customer focused and able to work independently with good decision making skills Heavy Travel 50/75% of time.

jobTitle: Head of Business Performance and Insights, Google Cloud - Singapore
description: The area: Google Cloud  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.  The role: Head of Business Performance and Insights, Google Cloud - Singapore  The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  Additional Role Description  We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. Our team of highly creative visionaries thrives in deconstructing and re-creating businesses to meet changing strategic and operational needs, enable, incubate and scale innovation, establish more efficient practices, align functions and stakeholders to help the company continue to achieve its vast potential.  As the Head of Business Performance and Insights, you will be a critical leader on the APAC Google Cloud Go-to-Market Strategy and Operations team. You will be responsible for driving deep forward-looking insights (market, competition, internal) on our business and shaping our business actions and strategies, establishing and driving a consistent business operating rhythm and act as the steward of our data and tools and drive a consistent tools landscape across our teams.  Reporting to the Head of Go-to-Market Strategy and Operations, you will engage with senior global and regional business and cross-functional leaders, drive global thought leadership, and build and scale a business performance management team.  Responsibilities Develop insights on the APAC Google Cloud business performance and present actions, programs, and strategies to improve our performance (business growth, pipeline, productivity, health indicators) for the short and long-term. Support Google Cloud leadership on our regular business performance reviews and drive market and competitive insights within the region to influence our strategies and plans. Establish and drive a consistent business operating rhythm and tools and dashboards to inspect the numbers and drive remedial actions (or scale best practices). Lead, manage, and mentor a business performance management and insights team. Work cross-functionally with other leaders, including Global Strategy and Operations and Finance, to drive a tightly integrated set of strategies and plans. Minimum Qualifications MBA or Master's degree. 12 years of experience in either Finance, Management Consulting, Corporate Strategy, Sales Strategy, and Operations or Sales Analytics, or equivalent relevant experience in sales finance or planning and project management. Experience in developing and scaling teams. Preferred Qualifications Experience in standardizing, streamlining, automating critical business analytics, and reporting. Experience in co-designing/developing robust management information systems. Experience leading cross-functional project teams through outstanding problem-framing and problem-structuring skills, project management skills, and the ability to communicate insights and “so what’s” to highly technical management teams. Demonstrated business acumen and ability to successfully navigate and influence within a complex business environment. Understanding of cloud economics and analyzing a consumption based business model.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About The Company  Our client, one of the fastest growing start-up in the Cybersecurity space. They are expanding globally and in the past 3 years their revenue has tripled YoY due to their innovative products and services. They are now looking for a Sales Director to lead the APAC region.  About The Job  Reporting directly to the Co-founder/CEO based out of Singapore. Your key focus would be to: Manage the full sales cycle from targeted outbound to deal closure and ongoing account management Own the overall regional sales target and allocations Own the relationship with the right Prospect and Customer stakeholders and develop credibility as an industry thought leader and trusted partner Shaping and implementing business development plans and strategies across APAC Driving and being accountable for top line growth Skills And Experience Required  Proven track record in positively driving SaaS/Software/PaaS sales across enterprises  Strong business ethics, values and flexibility to travel 30% across the region  To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Rumi Mohd at 6510 6520  (EA: 94C3609/ R1550851)
