description: About ByteDance  Responsibilities  Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.  Join the Innovative BytePlus Team  As part of BytePlus, you'll help enterprise customers build what's next for their business. Leveraging Bytedance's cutting-edge technologies, we are devoted to developing innovative products and solutions to shape the future. We help our clients to focus on what truly matters. Centering on innovation and excellence, we create gamechanging solutions that help businesses to unleash their potential. You can help us to achieve our mission.  The Global Head of Marketing is a senior leader with a passion and experience for growing high-performance teams and successfully generate demands among enterprise customers, helping them in their journey of awareness and consideration of enterprise solutions. The role will be leading a team of marketing managers/specialists and regional marketing executives, responsible for a marketing budget across BytePlus, and responsible to deliver the mission of BytePlus and grow our business and footprint.  Responsibilities Lead the BytePlus Marketing organization to effectively support demand generation across different regions Work with BytePlus global team in developing, defining and executing a marketing strategy that works for the current stage of start-up business growth Build and manage a team of marketing specialists globally across product marketing, digital marketing, content creation and marketing Support sales enablement initiatives by driving the marketing content creation for respective products that will assist in lead generation and growth Experience in all areas of marketing and the ability to design customized marketing strategies based on business needs Create a stimulating environment where everyone keeps a learning mindset and is energized by new growth opportunities, open to try new things, fail and make progress. Inspire people to do their best on a day-to-day basis and provide a diverse and inclusive work environment for your team to thrive in. Provide mentorship and development of marketing specialists, including hiring, training and coaching team members Qualifications 10+ years of experience in product marketing within a technology and enterprise business. Minimum 5 years of experience in leading technical marketing in a global software organisation or related field Experience working in an early-stage start-up environment and ability to lead teams through an ambiguous environment

This position will generate new business through building a reseller, technology and referral partner network focused on contact centres. This position will be responsible for executing on all aspects of the business relationship with each partner including recruiting, qualifying, onboarding, selling “through the partner” and “to the partner”, pipeline reporting, win/loss reporting. The position will carry a dollar sales target.  You need to be a highly motivated team player with deep expertise working in a contact centres, automation, RPA and a flair for fast paced, cross-functional work environment. You should have the ability to establish broad senior level relationships. You should have a proven track record delivering results and getting things done. You should be able to effectively communicate and build relationships with sales and executive leaders in the partner organization  Key to the position is effective collaboration with multiple cross-functional stakeholders, including product development, product marketing, sales, alliances, marketing, legal, operations. You will need to maintain a deep understanding of Uniphore technology offerings and articulate Uniphore’s propositions to channel partners and corporate enterprise clients.. This is a key and strategic role that requires a balance of strategy with a strong roll-up your sleeves and 'get it done' mentality.  Your Responsibilities Manage the channel partners' go to market relationship, engagement strategy and alignment at all levels of Uniphore Create and execute Go to Market plans that include target accounts/markets, sales strategies, collateral, sales playbooks, sales assets Establish QBR to monitor Success Metrics and KPIs Provide input to target market, territory, account and opportunity plans Work with enablement teams to provide training and enablement for respective channel partners as appropriate Establish and implement processes and guidelines appropriate to exchange information. Coordinate with and help to set priorities for technical pre and post sales resources Work with sales, marketing, and alliance leaders to generate new business in existing accounts and in new markets Your qualification 15 -20 years of selling software/preferably SaaS to Contact Centres with extensive executive relationships Demonstrable track record of success in channels rationalization and strategic planning Strong verbal and written communication skills Experience and ability to forecast sales on a weekly basis B.S. Degree, MBA preferred High calibre, dynamic personality Able to think strategically and to translate into measurable actions Ability to travel frequently Uniphore is the global leader in Conversational Service Automation. The Company’s vision is to disrupt an outdated customer service model by bridging the gap between human and machine using voice, AI and automation to ensure that every voice, on every call, is truly heard. Uniphore enables businesses globally to deliver transformational customer service by providing an automation platform where digital agents take over transactional conversations from humans, coach agents during calls, and accurately predict language, emotion and intent. All in real-time. With Conversational Service Automation, enterprises can now engage their customers to effectively build loyalty, improve customer experience and realize operational efficiencies.  Uniphore is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.  For more information on how Uniphore delivers business value using Conversational Service Automation, please visit www.uniphore.com
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: The Big Picture  Howden is looking for an insightful, influential and commercially astute, senior leader to take on the exciting and challenging role of Finance Director for the APAC region.  As Our Finance Director, You Will Provide leadership, direction and management to the Howden APAC Finance teams. Lead and manage all financial activities for the APAC region (excluding China) which include forecasting and budgets and preparation of financial reporting Provide strategic recommendation to the President APAC and members of the APAC leadership team Support and challenge commercial business decisions in the best interest of Howden. Support and ensure adequate investments to support growth. Support the companies to fulfil their local statutory requirements. This is your opportunity to join a fast growing, innovative, global company that offers attractive remuneration packages, annual bonus, flexible working arrangements and provides a supportive organizational culture.  What needs to be done? Participate in effective strategic, financial and information technology planning by providing financial advice and guidance to the President APAC and Leadership Team to contribute to the achievement of the company growth objectives and maintain a profitable business. Analyse budget patterns and project expenditures and develop and oversee the maintenance of budget monitoring systems. Conduct corporate risk assessments and provide sound advice regarding the future, in advance, to President APAC. Develop the organization and capability of the financial function within the APAC region to ensure a strong finance team, with suitable succession planning. Lead and manage the APAC Finance team to achieve Company’s strategic objectives whilst ensuring staff are motivated, positive, focused and well informed. Review major contracts and authorization requests, to ensure that the Company’s interests are safeguarded, including credit insurance strategies for the division, in accordance with the Global policy. Identify income maximization and cost saving opportunities and recommend and implement changes to achieve continuous improvement. Provide control functions in order to ensure finances are managed according to legislation, policies and procedures and general accepted accounting principles by managing accounting and financial systems and maintain full and accurate accounting records. Ensure that working capital, cash, manufacturing/productivity quality measures and other defined KPI’s are adequately reported and controlled. Ensure a continuous improvement process is in place and is sustainable in the controls environment across the businesses. What do you need to bring?  You possess exceptional leadership skills and experience in developing and building high performing teams through coaching and influencing and you’re comfortable operating at both strategic and operational levels.  Energy, motivation and an enquiring mind, with a passion for excellence and innovation in the pursuit of business growth and success. With your ability to think quickly and work off your own initiative, you’ll welcome and relish the challenges and resistance to change.  You’re a team player, developing good working relationships at all levels. Your experience in influencing and gaining credibility both upwards and downwards and networking internally and externally ensures your ability to secure buy-in from key stakeholders.  Strong communication skills are a must, along with the ability to handle high levels of pressure and critical decision-making in a fast paced business environment. You’ll display high integrity and openness, combined with a commitment to good governance, compliance and a strong attention to detail. Degree in Finance/Commerce or equivalent Must be a qualified CPA or CA Minimum 5+ years’ experience in managing large finance departments, preferably within a multinational organisation in the APAC region or experience from a company similar to Howden Qualified member of an accountancy body or holder of an equivalent qualification Demonstrated experience in analyzing the financial data, past/future results and making sound business decisions Demonstrated experience and results in growth, profitability, working capital management, innovation and lean management/continuous improvement Experience of operating a sound controls environment Experience of US GAAP Possess dynamic, engaging and articulate public speaking skills The Following Would Also Be Very Highly Regarded Project management experience as well as understanding complex original equipment manufacturer (OEM) project sales processes Understanding the complexity of large OEM Power/Mining/Petrochemical, Oil & Gas (PCOG) capital spend projects Experience of implementing, sustaining & improving ERP business systems Experience in mergers and acquisitions Please note this role will be based in our Singapore office and will report to our APAC President.  To express your interest in this exciting opportunity submit your cover letter and CV by no later than Friday 3rd September 2021.  The Advantages Of Working At Howden  Worldwide business – Liaise with our colleagues in 27 countries.  We offer global and local opportunities– 6000 employees and world leading engineers, who create cutting edge developments – You will be a part of over 160 years of innovation and development that continues today with our digital solutions.  At Howden we have a strong corporate identity and purpose – You will be a member of our team, shaping the future of the world and tackling some of the most pressing issues facing the planet.  Our products and organisation are Revolving Around You – Our culture promotes individual development to enhance our most important asset – our people.
industries: Machinery, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Media.Monks is a digital-first marketing and advertising services company connecting the dots across content, data & digital media and technology services. Inspired by the connectivity and flexibility of technology APIs, Media.Monks’ single-P&L model offers brands seamless access to a nearly 6,000-strong team of digital talent organized across 57 talent hubs in 33 countries.  With us, you'll find a diverse group of colleagues with different backgrounds and perspectives. We believe everyone has something of value to offer, and that sustaining a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace begins with fostering an environment where people can be themselves, authentically, every day. We want to build something with the potential to change the heart of our industry, and we’d love to include your unique perspective.  The Opportunity  Brightblue Consulting, a Media.Monks company, is looking for a bright and personable Director at the top of their game in the econometric modeling field to really influence and help drive the company on towards continued double digit growth.  Company Profile  BrightBlue Consulting is an analytical consultancy, specializing in Market Mix Modeling, with the aim of growing the performance of businesses through exceptional predictive modeling. Over the past 5 years we have established ourselves as a key player in the world of marketing analytics, averaging over 40% year on year growth and are pushing the boundaries of analytics to the next level. In particular we are looking to scale up our APAC operations, a key growth market for the company, and are looking for a candidate with the right leadership credentials to help accelerate this.  Key Differentiating Factors Of The Company  Market pioneering approach to marketing evaluation Ambitious growth targets - looking for the talent to match Work with diverse clients within the rapidly growing international network. Build unique market first solutions by using your econometric and latest programming knowledge Heavily supported R&D function to drive change across the industry and create market first tools Personable nature helps embed analytics in our clients’ organization Significant investment in staff wellbeing Entrepreneurial, vibrant and fun atmosphere  We offer a tailored training program to help individuals grow. Progression in the company is not limited to years served, but entirely on merit – everyone is encouraged to progress as quickly as they want.  The Role  Responsibilities Include  Involvement in developing the company as the leading provider of predictive modeling through the following: Lead several clients over a range of industries Sell in of projects to clients, including pitches, with a seven figure per annum target Produce outstanding marketing evaluation projects to our clients Exceptional data analytics Data visualisation Presentation delivery to the client Personally manage the development of a number of consultants and analysts, both in the APAC and colleagues in other markets (especially our London Hub). Lead a team of consultants and analysts to produce outstanding marketing evaluation projects Assist in developing company strategy Helicopter view in developing tools and ideas to grow the business in to new areas using the latest techniques Involvement across the business including project management, revenue growth management, new business, research & development, improving internal processes and tool development  The role reports to the COO of Brightblue Consulting.  Requirements  The role will require the following attributes:  Proven first class deliverer of high value client projects Proven track record of high value project sales to clients across a range of industry sectors 10+ years commercial experience of market mix modeling Ability to explain complex modeling in a very clear and simple manner with proven client presentation skills Excellent people management skills Econometrics/Economics/ Mathematics (with Econometrics) degree Entrepreneurial attitude Must have a physical home address within one of the following locations prior to your first day: Level 5, 66 King Street, Sydney NSW 2000  About Media.Monks  At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.  We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Global Head of Procurement - Consumer Goods/Healthcare
description: Leadership position with a global conglomerate Oversee organisation's direct supplier relationships  About Our Client  A Global leader in the consumer goods and healthcare industries - this organisation has a large global network in APAC, America, and Europe. As their business has grown exponentially over the last two years, the organisation is now looking for an experienced and dynamic Global Procurement Director to be based in Singapore.  Job Description  Create and implement a strategic vision for the purchasing function, ensuring that policies, processes, and procedures are in place to meet business objectives and operational needs Monitor global market, industry trends, new technologies, and economic factors to assess and communicate their potential impact to the business; and develop and implement strategies in response Develop commodity strategies that provide quality supply, world-class technologies, and the best long-term total cost Establish pricing, quality, and delivery targets that will enable the company to function and compete effectively in the market. Seek and partner with reliable vendors and suppliers both domestic and international to develop an overall vendor base which creates and sustains a competitive advantage Monitor the cost, schedule, and performance aspects of supplier agreements Assure the Procurement organization has strategies and plans for cost savings, risk reduction and supplier selection and are on track with their execution Identify supplier needs based on production plans and sales projections to proactively close gaps and maintain uninterrupted production  The Successful Applicant  12+ years of experience within the Procurement function ideally in a leadership role Experience in the medical devices/consumer goods/healthcare industries will be preferred Broad knowledge of supplier management procedures with a good understanding working in a highly matrix environment Provide leadership to the purchasing team to ensure that established procedures are followed  What's On Offer  An opportunity to lead the global procurement function for a market leader  Contact: Tushar Dadhwal  Quote job ref: 4215357
industries: Pharmaceuticals, Mental Health Care, and Medical Devices

description: Line of Service  Internal Firm Services  Industry/Sector  Not Applicable  Specialism  IFS - Clients & Markets  Management Level  Director  About PwC  Job Description & Summary  A career at PwC is more than “just” a job. It’s about being part of a culture that is committed to making a difference for each other, our clients, and our community — by empowering you to be the best version of yourself and investing in your growth. You’ll be able to develop as a leader, be well-connected, work in a great environment, explore our benefits and make a positive contribution.  With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a strong coaching and people-oriented culture, our Flex policies (Flex Space, Flex Dress and Flex Time), innovative learning and development programs (training programs, digital upscaling) as well as our secondment opportunities. If you would like to be involved in activities outside of work, you can join our Sports and Recreational Club, Toastmasters and more!  Firmwide Corporate Services  Our Firmwide Corporate Services unit, spanning Administration, Business Development, Finance, Human Resources, Learning & Development, Legal, Marketing & Communications and Technology, helps build our competitive advantage by providing support to all lines of businesses. Our specialists in each function bring together a diverse set of skill-sets and expertise to best service their internal clients.  How will you value-add? Lead the strategic development of brand identity, marketing of our capabilities, account development and sales management in B2B professional services setting Challenge, align and embed client facing teams with the adoption of client-centricity in everything they do Shift the delivery of capabilities to a fit for purpose model, including use of global, regional and co-source and outsource delivery capabilities Lead and manage transformation of team to embrace new ways of working including use of cloud tools and services, data-led client service philosophy and the use of digital marketing and social media Translate strategic development into execution to achieve intended outcomes, including strong communication and influencing skills to drive outcome Oversee knowledge management to win and serve clients and drive learning and outreach to embed client centric practices and behaviours Lead and manage a team of 30, creating and sustaining a high impact team Develop and drive communication strategy (both internally and externally) that achieves sustainable actions and positive mindshare of clients and staff Note: A working understanding of a cloud based CRM eg Salesforce is a plus About You At least 15 years relevant work experience in the field of marketing, business development, business or organizational science or (business) economics Experience with leading teams in a changing / dynamic environment Extensive experience in the field of Sales and Business Development Experience in career development, coaching / mentoring in an agile team environment Digital skills where you are aware of the latest (digital) trends and developments in the field of Business Development, Marketing & Communications and CRM. Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)  Degrees/Field Of Study Required  Degrees/Field of Study preferred:  Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)  Optional Skills  Required Skills  Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)  Travel Requirements  Not Specified  Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?  Yes  Government Clearance Required?  No  Job Posting End Date

description: Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.  Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.  How do we make work life better? By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!  Ceridian is a global, cloud-based software company specializing in human capital management. We create innovative technology that organizations around the world use to attract, develop, manage and pay their people. Our award winning Dayforce solution helps customers efficiently manage compliance, track time and attendance, make better decisions, build great teams and drive engagement with their employees.  To support our growth in the APJ region, we are looking for a Director, Marketing, Asia who will be responsible for developing marketing strategies, planning and executing tactics. The role requires someone that has experience in driving market awareness and generating demand resulting in qualified lead activity, pipeline and revenue across Asia. This role continuously interacts with sales, the partner organization as well as other marketing functions building strong partnership and ensuring strategies and activities are in alignment with business goals.  The ideal candidate has a passion for technology, an entrepreneurial spirit and a successful track record working across a matrixed organization with multiple stakeholders. The candidate should embrace the opportunity to wear many hats and willing to roll up their sleeves with a hands-on approach to planning and execution.  Location: Singapore preferred  Responsibilities include but not limited to:  Develop and own the strategic marketing plan for the Asia market to drive awareness, generate new contacts, leads and revenue in support of Asia targets. Develop, execute and report on, inbound and outbound demand generation programs including integrated campaigns, digital marketing and events. Actively partner with sales to understand priorities and enable them to meet their objectives with focused demand gen activities and materials to accelerate pipeline to close Work closely with Partner Marketing to execute campaigns and events in the region Manage budget and work with cross functional marketing team members to execute Facilitate marketing campaign prioritization in collaboration with internal stakeholders and develop a consistent planning and campaign management process Build and manage a calendar for demand generation programs in Asia to provide transparency for and create alignment with key stakeholders. Monitor and measure effectiveness of marketing initiatives and adjust strategies as necessary Be recognized as an expert of marketing best practices and trends and participate in regional operating team meetings Think big to deliver new ideas and creative approaches  Qualifications:  Minimum 8-10 years of experience in the B2B software or technology field Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or related field Advanced degree a plus Demonstrated track record in creating and executing integrated marketing campaigns aligned to the customer journey in the APJ market Knowledge of the B2B purchase process and how to create demand and accelerate opportunities Understanding on how to leverage local partners to help scale Experience in the Human Capital technology sector and a working knowledge of contemporary HCM trends would be highly advantageous. Proven business-to-business communication and writing skills Ability to position and promote complex product information relevantly to the market and multiple audiences Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and the ability to prioritize multiple marketing programs High level of self-motivation and the ability to work independently without constant supervision  Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.  We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.  Apply Now
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Human Resources

description: About JLL –  We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.  Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.  Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.  If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!  We are looking for a Regional Occupancy Planning & Management Delivery Director for our Global OPM team  About JLL  We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.  If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!  This role will report to the Global OPM Operations Leader and be located within the APAC region of JLL.  Role Purpose  The Occupancy Planning & Management Delivery Director will play a crucial role in creating and leading a strong OPM team within the geography. The role oversees a regional team with best practices to deliver occupancy planning & management products, solutions and tools for a wide variety of real estate clients.  Key Responsibilities Include- Regional level coordination of multiple resources across global geos to ensure contracted delivery and KPIs are met. Develop and deliver strategies and build alignment across multiple stakeholders. Support transformation activities on optimizing the OPM delivery network and implement a model to manage staffing levels Liaise with Sales and Product teams to ensure that go to market models maximize profitability while meeting client needs Support the development of strong and ongoing analytic capabilities to embed foundational fact-based internal and external data, benchmarks and industry trends that support short and long-term strategies and outcomes with specific goals, deliverables and metrics Optimize OPM processes and people to achieve reductions in cost and increase productivity. Support the development of a communication and connectivity strategy for OPM with internal stakeholders & Accounts. Support the development of account delivery plans to support client retention, cross selling, client satisfaction, and account growth. Partner with regional and local HR teams who are accountable for recruiting, retention and development Governance and oversight of existing OPM accounts to ensure scope and KPIs are met and clients are satisfied. Escalation point for OPM related issues and drive resolution Support OPM Leads on each account and provide ongoing and clear direction in helping the account teams to meet their plan objectives Identify, lead and support efforts to increase the scope of existing account engagements where feasible / applicable Ensure each account team is engaged and empowered to deliver an exceptional quality of service to their Client, as reflected by Client feedback, and work with each account team on continuous improvements. Regular communication and prompt feedback with Team Leads and account staff. Provide resourcing support to each account as required, including assistance with staff replacements, new hires and career path guidance for existing staff. Drive consistent implementation of OPM processes and Best Practices, monitor and integrate cultural sensitivity requirements Support and drive a sense of innovation within each team and across the Regional practice Support work stream integration and delivery with other departments as appropriate Health of Account program adherence Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.  Sound like you? To apply you need to be / have-  Experience Extensive professional experience, leading Region teams engaged in OPM Business and/or strategically led facets of global corporate real estate delivery Experience in developing and implementing best practices in a diverse client base Commercially and financially astute Strong network across Work Dynamics Strong communicator - written and presentation skills- promotes ideas and proposals persuasively Strong influencer – must be experienced in getting results through others, rather than direct control Exceptional stakeholder management skills Proven track record of successfully working with senior executives in the firm Strong organizational skills Process oriented and analytical Skills Leadership Skills- A leader with exceptional communication skills coupled with excellent active listening skills. Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences. Establish and maintain strong relationships on all levels of organization. description: Set and drive the commercial strategy for the Digital Solutions portfolio across the Asia Pacific region in line with regional and enterprise growth objectives. Be an advocate for company's evolving digital capabilities internally and externally, deliver excellence across direct and indirect sales channels and foster collaboration and cooperation with other commercial teams and line of business owners in the region.  We are partnering with our client who is the global leader for storage and information management services. Trusted by more than 220,000 organizations around the world, boasting a real estate network of more than 80 million square feet across more than 1,350 facilities in 45 countries dedicated to protecting and preserving what matters most for its customers. Company's solutions portfolio includes records management, data management, document management, data centers, art storage and logistics, and secure shredding help organizations to lower storage costs, comply with regulations, recover from disaster, and better use their information. Company stores and protects billions of information assets, including critical business documents, electronic information, medical data and cultural and historical artifacts.  Job Responsibilities  Market/Product Strategy Develops the Digital product strategy / roadmap for the Asia-Pacific market. Where necessary, work with the country management team to develop country specific product strategy. Investigates and understands marketplace conditions, competitor stance, market share, economic and social trends as well technological developments in order to modify plans and adopt new strategies to take full advantage of changing market circumstances. Builds on Market Research and competitor analysis to improve sales efficiency, including plans for market share growth by line of business. Be a Market-maker, identify white space segments, partner/channel strategy and lead business development efforts to generate new business potentials for the company. As a member of the company's APAC Digital Leadership Team, define the long term regional strategy that contributes to the financial success of the company. Brand and Product Awareness As a member of the company's APAC Digital Leadership Team, define the long term regional strategy that contributes to the financial success of the company. Participates and speaks in public events to gain industry mindshare. Supports the sales force with professional marketing programs to enhance sales efficiency and effectiveness and to ensure a consistent presentation of the company's brand Sales Leadership Lead and manage a regional matrixed direct sales team to achieve the company's revenue and booking target. To be an advocate of outcome based selling, coaching the wider sales community in the company to be enabled with consultative selling skills. Maintains currency of knowledge of Sales practices and developments including industry practices and company initiatives. Develops a sales culture promoting high performance, collaboration, accountability and customer centricity Develops, implements and manages programs, including training, designed to support sales strategy and customer focus. Talent Development Builds a high-performance culture by ensuring the right recruitment strategy and process is in place to attract the best talent into the sales force. Deploying talent management strategies to ensure retention and development of top talent whilst proactively managing poor performance. Job Requirements Candidates must possess minimum 10 years working experience in solutions sales, business development management Digital and IT Managed services experience Qualification in Business administration, IT background Excellent communication (written/verbal) and interpersonal skills - ability to negotiate resources and lead local and regional teams, comfortable interacting with top executive leadership (regional and globally) Strong background and knowledge of information governance, electronic content management, business process / workflow enablement and outsourcing, document and information capture, etc., strategic account management, sales process and solution selling. Have the ability to influence and negotiate through proven sales skills and needs identification by aligning unique insights to key customer priorities. Encompasses strong interpersonal, planning, analytical skills and business acumen for effective decision-making. Ability to influence without authority and team effectively at all levels of IRM and customer personnel (to include c-level) on a wide range of topics and issues. Strong knowledge of information governance, ECM, workflow and business process automation. Next Step Prepare an updated CV (including your current salary package with full breakdown such as base, incentives, AWS, etc.) and expected package. Apply through this application or drop an email at Zac.lim@adecco.com in MS Word Copy stating the job you are applying for. Lead the online bunkering business of the platform which combines the innovations on business model, technical and financial strengths Prepare and implement comprehensive business plans to facilitate achievement by planning cost-effective operations, sales/business development and marketing activities Develop sales/business development plan to achieve targets; be a platform of choice for the market; registered buyers and sellers, transaction volume, deals and revenue target Expand the partnership and network of suppliers globally to support the bunkering needs from customers Continues improvements of SOPs to ensure smooth delivery of bunker products and customer satisfaction Ensure company policies are communicated all the way from the top down in the company and that they are followed at all times Delegate responsibilities and supervise the work of executives providing guidance and motivation to drive maximum performance Read all submitted reports by executives/managers to reward performance, prevent issues and resolve problems Provide thought leadership and act as the public speaker representative of the company in ways that raise and strengthen company profile Any other tasks as assigned Job Requirement More than 10 years’ experience in the Oil and Gas Sector Preferably had served as a senior manager position Minimum a Degree in Maritime or other relevant discipline; Good Network of ship vessel owners and bunker suppliers is preferred Good negotiation skills and knowledge of bunkering and fuel oil is preferred Knowledgeable and keen interest in E-Commerce is preferred To ensure team achieve all that targets as set forth Interpersonal Skills to focus on solving conflict professionally

description: In a world where trades are happening faster than ever to answer our needs, where sustainability is not just an option anymore, clarity and trust in the information we trade with are a must.  So, say hello to Kpler! We exist to facilitate sustainable and efficient trade to meet the changing needs of our world. To do so we've built a Data-as-a-Service solution that does exactly that across the lifecycle of a trade.  Our solution aggregates data from hundreds of sources including radar and satellite imagery as well as logistics, governmental, shipping databases and more. Intelligently connecting the dots across fragmented information landscapes, we bring to our clients a unique, real-time understanding of the trades happening all over the world, by giving them access to live information about the movement of cargos, the availability of vessels as well as the commodity storage.  To support this endeavor we have teams in more than 7 countries and 7 key locations (Paris, London, Brussels, Dubai, Singapore, Houston and New York). With individuals of various backgrounds, diverse skills, and international experiences, being global & inclusive is in our DNA!  Our values Be humble - Our self-interest does not compromise the collective interest Respect and care for others - We treat everyone as an individual Take responsibility - We take ownership of our actions Act with integrity - We do the right thing, always Be bold - We challenge ourselves and the status quo with action You’ll get to work in a truly global environment, with more than 20 nationalities speaking more than 15 languages.  Kpler’s Research Team  Some Of The Team’s Varied Responsibilities Include  The research team touches all elements of company operations, from the core activity of market analysis to assisting in product development. In doing so, the team works closely with all aspects of the business, as well as building close relationships with all external stakeholders. Generating market-relevant content covering the broad commodities universe encompassed by Kpler’s products, used by corporations and the media to understand market trends Developing the brand equity of Kpler, by contributing to written and broadcast media as well as participating at conferences and seminars Acting at the forefront of the sales cycle, demonstrating our value proposition and helping clients to adopt our solutions Helping to validate and test innovative concepts of technology to be commercially delivered The successful applicant will be joining a dynamic and growing team of industry experts, dedicated to using Kpler’s considerable array of proprietary intelligence to provide insights on the markets.  What you’ll do  As we look to build out the role of research within Kpler we are adding experienced market professionals with solid backgrounds across the worlds of trading, fundamental analytics and consulting. The successful candidate will be responsible for producing market-driven content covering the iron ore and coal markets using Kpler’s data. They will be at ease talking to the media as well as attending and speaking at conferences. They will be happy to work in quite a commercial role where there is a strong connection between research, commercial managers and Kpler’s clients and prospects. Identify, research, and report on interesting developments in the coal and iron ore markets for Kpler’s client base Through such insights, and using Kpler’s proprietary information, work closely with the global sales and marketing teams to demonstrate the value of Kpler’s solutions to the industry Promote research and materials produced within Kpler across all external stakeholders, building relationships with both the mainstream, and specialist media Produce company webinars as well as participate in external webinars and conferences as panelist and speaker Collaborate with the product and technical teams to further develop our portfolio of client offerings You could be a good fit if... You have at least 4 years prior experience in the coal and/or iron ore markets Experience of analysing the dry bulks freight market is beneficial You have experience of producing independent market analysis and insights as well as working collaboratively within a team You are skilled at carrying out complex analysis across multiple datasets using appropriate tools You possess excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience of using SQL, Python, R or Tableau is beneficial Our People Pledge  Kpler is committed to providing a fair, inclusive and diverse work-environment. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer.

description: Oracle Solutions and GTM lead, will lead/ be member of the Oracle Practice Sales team in Singapore with the responsibility to address opportunities in Oracle Applications, focused to grow Oracle Cloud SaaS business. This is the SWAT team for business growth. The right consultant would be having 15 + years of experience in implementing and solutioning Oracle Applications as part of delivery and supporting pre-sales – across Oracle EBS /PeopleSoft / Oracle ERP/ SCM Cloud. We are looking for a potential leader with specialization in Finance, with an academic qualification as CPA/CA or Engineer/ MBA. This is a hybrid role requiring exceptional skills, from customer acquisition to supporting delivery in the initial stages of the project. This role calls for previous experience in consultative selling, with excellent communication, negotiating, and closing skills with prospects and customers.  Role And Responsibilities  As a key member of the Oracle Singapore and GTM team, you would help ensure helping customers in their journey to digital transformation using Oracle Cloud solutions. In partnership with the Vertical sales and account teams, educate customers on the value proposition of Oracle Practice & participate in business and solution and design workshops to address the customer needs. The consultant should have the experience to create and provide integrated solutions, that cut across Oracle ERP/SCM/CX/HCM, integrated with external applications. Take the lead on addressing the customers, at different points of sales cycle, supporting the vertical sales teams in prospecting calls, to RFP responses. Address RFPs, author proposals with solutions, implementation approaches, delivery methodologies, timelines, and costs. He/She should help, pre-qualify the opportunity to convert to a successful IT and consulting services engagement. He/She will also be responsible for enabling demand gen and pipeline creation, working closely with the sales and marketing teams. The leader will also have a network in the Oracle product and sales groups, and a network with the industry customers and thought leaders. The GTM lead should be ready to engage to design and solution and provide delivery oversight as needed, and in some cases lead the initial phases of project – requirements gathering and solution, while the team is ramped up.    Collaborate with the practice leaders and architect solutions on Oracle cloud, that can help guide the customer outcome. Contribute to the creation and delivery of best practices, packaged offering, white papers, workshops, etc. Demonstrated experience building and maintaining strong relationships with a diverse set of internal and external constituencies, including senior level executives, consulting resources, technical teams, and sales representatives.  Soft Skills Ability to think strategically, while staying focused on monitoring the progress of action items and bringing them to conclusion within appropriate time frames. Ability to influence and drive go-to-market campaigns and work with key local and regional stakeholders to launch in local markets. Excellent team player. Effective at sharing and communicating knowledge and supporting teammates in times of increased workload. Highly organized and self-sufficient, successful with limited direction, upbeat and enthusiastic. Strong communication skills to convince, respective client teams through oral, written, and formal presentation mediums. Travel This is a customer facing role. There will be a need to travel as needed.

description: This is an exciting time to join dentsu. In good times and bad we partner with brands to achieve meaningful progress as a force for growth and good. Our teams of optimists, entrepreneurs and first-movers coalesce around the needs of our clients, unlocking unique possibilities for sustainable value and lasting change.  At its core, the role of the Director (digital transformation and performance marketing) is to be the client lead on dentsu’s key accounts. You will manage and oversee a tier 1 client, building highly effective interpersonal relationships in Singapore and beyond to become a key strategic advisor for your clients.  You will be responsible for leading planning, strategy development, client profitability, client organic revenue growth and ensuring the operations team deliver faultless campaign execution across established and new to market media channels and platforms.  You will be, also, head up the SG based hub which includes most SEA countries and work closely with the global team  The successful candidate must demonstrate extensive experience effectively managing demanding clients and leading a team to deliver industry best results.   KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Client's trusted advisor Be the senior point of contact for multiple clients across the region and build highly effective interpersonal relationships. Expectation is that you will spend considerable face to face time with clients to foster a partnership mentality, not delivery mentality. Become the client’s trusted advisor within the business, proactively addressing issues on both the client and dentsu sides to improve business performance. The ability to have difficult conversations with clients is an imperative. Manage annual client development roadmap to monitor client satisfaction and proactively introduce dentsu solutions where relevant to increase client product diversity. Work collaboratively with teams from other dentsu service lines to deliver our single P&L philosophy, ensuring clients receive a seamless service. Attend and represent the team at important external and internal client meetings, including senior management status meetings, briefing sessions, campaign reviews, QBRs etc.  Client strategy development Fully understand client business objectives / communication objectives and ensure these are translated into meaningful, solution focused digital strategies. Heading up the SG hub which includes Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, South Korea and Thailand. Work closely with account leads in other markets (incl.  INDO, MY, KR and Thailand) to develop world-class media strategies & plan. Work closely with the global team and provide markets insights as well as cascade global directions / processes to markets. Proactively position dentsu as the media centre of excellence for your client. Take the lead on all internal and external media conversations. Work closely with global client team on HQ requests & initiatives, such as cost modules exercise, people-based marketing initiatives and brand safety  Team & workload management Effective management of client expectations is essential; support your teams to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of work, identifying improvements to ways of working where required. Be responsible for the development of managers within your team, including the setting of personal objectives and performance reviews.  Client profitability and finance Be responsible for the delivery of revenue across the clients your teams and pursue all potential cross sell / up sell opportunities. Ensure your teams and the central billing teams are completing billing and reconciliation of campaign spend / income in a timely and accurate manner so suppliers are paid on time, and clients are invoiced on time.  Product development & new business Remain abreast of developments in media and contribute towards internal PR targets. Work closely with the Client Partner/ Head of Media on client development and with the New Business Lead to deliver new business RFPs and pitches as required. Leverage relationships with media partners to identify innovative solutions to client challenges, with the focus on creating case studies and award entries.  Key Experiences Minimum 10 years’ agency side experience in a digital strategy and/or execution role Experience managing a team to deliver best-in-class client campaigns Experience managing senior client relationships independently  Professional Skills Articulate presenter, with the ability to present to senior clients and internal agency teams, comfortable with showing what data means and how we can take action based upon it Passionate about and engaged with the fast changing world of digital media Good understanding of planning integrated campaigns across the various mechanisms, channels and buying models Strongly numerate and comfortable manipulating data sets Highly literate with a good understanding of how language is used to communicate to different audiences. Commitment to deliver first class work every time, and never leave a quality issue unchecked Highly commercial - selling value, negotiation, client relationship management skills, how to be a trusted business advisor Excellent planning, analytical and organisational skills alongside high attention to detail   OBJECTIVES AND MEASURES OF SUCCESS What Success in this role looks like Have built strong relationships with client and dentsu stakeholders, meeting regularly to review business challenges Have worked with dentsu stakeholders to implement innovative media solutions to meet client objectives, with case studies created Have identified and delivered new business / cross sell / up sell opportunities in partnership with the Client Partner/ Head of Media and dentsu stakeholders Have instilled a strong attention to detail within your direct reports, following all processes defined by finance ops & operations teams   DENTSU VALUES Will live the dentsu 8 Ways at all times: We Dream Loud, We Inspire Change, We Team Without Limits, We All Lead, We Make It Real, We Climb High, We Choose Excitement, We Are A Force For Good  INCLUSION & DIVERSITY We’re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won’t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That’s what we care about.  So, whether you’re joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.  WORKING WITH US Joining dentsu international, you’ll join a team of 48,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, memorable experiences and opportunities to shape your future.  KEEPING CONNECTED Please visit our website to find out more and connect with us on social. www.dentsu.com   *Please include an updated CV in your application. **We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

description: Key responsibilities:  Shape and manage Company’s product strategy and roadmap to develop a product that services Company’s target customer – small and medium-sized enterprises Drive and deliver Company’s product vision, including market expansion and growth tactics, across Southeast Asia, China, and beyond.   Work closely with functions such as engineering, sales and business development, marketing, operations, etc. to develop a deep understanding of the customer and shape the product & technology Drive customer acquisition and customer retention by creating a seamless, efficient, and functional tool for our customers  Effectively communicate decision making and strategic direction to team members, other executives, and board members Drive a data-driven, highly iterative, customer-obsessed culture amongst team members  Spearhead design excellence and a strong user experience for our internal and external stakeholders Build, inspire, and lead a world-class product and design team that scales globally Identify new features and functionality opportunities through competitive analysis and keeping up with market trends Promote Company’s thought leadership in international trade by participating in industry events, summits, or forums Work with Executive Team to continuously create and adjust Company’s overall company strategy, define, and drive overall company culture, and be a role model for other team members  Ideal Candidate Requirements:  Has previously held senior-level executive roles in product management / product development in the technology industry; experience with SMEs in Asia, B2B marketplaces or physical-operations products strongly preferred Possesses in-depth knowledge and broad understanding of digital product development, user experience and design, and user research  Experience building, driving, and leading a multi-functional team of product, technical and design professionals across countries Can roll up their sleeves to get into the details when needed – has prior product or design experience and a track record of executional excellence Considers leadership and communication a key strength Versatile and passionate about working in a start-up environment, is innately curious, and comfortable with rapid experimentation and change A self-starter who can creatively construct, is hungry to innovate, and can devise new pathways to understand and build for customers

description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Snowflake is experiencing exponential growth and we are expanding our PR team to help us scale. We need a PR Leader to help execute and accelerate Snowflake’s PR Program in the APJ region. As the Head of PR in Asia, you will help implement, run, and drive Snowflake’s PR strategies and build strong relationships with key business and technology media to tell our unique story to the public. You will also live Snowflake’s customer-success centric culture and build lasting relationships with Snowflake customers, while creating strong brand champions eager to share their stories in the press. In this role, you will report to the Head of Global PR, and work closely with our APJ PR agencies, Sales, Product Marketing, Alliances, Field Marketing, and Social Media Marketing teams. If you are a detail-oriented self-starter with a strategic mind, strong relationship-building skills, and a track record of executing successful public relations and strategic communications programs, this is a great opportunity for you!  AS A PR LEADER, YOU WILL: Help develop localized press stories and narratives for the APJ region that align with corporate messaging– help from planning stages through execution, tracking and performance analysis Prepare press materials that are effective and accurate, including press releases, backgrounders, pitches, fact sheets, blogs, bylined articles, and more Manage Snowflake’s APJ PR Calendar Serve as the main contact for our external public relations agencies in APJ managing day-to-day relationship and ensuring that brand guidelines and key messages are consistently followed Work as the liaison between external agencies and internal Snowflake stakeholders to facilitate media opportunities Help scale customer advocacy content by driving new customer videos, case studies, finding customer speakers for speaking/media opportunities, testimonials, webinars, etc. Manage and maintain the communication cycle with existing customer champions while continuously recruiting new customer advocates Analyze performance of APJ PR and social media campaigns  OUR IDEAL HEAD OF PR WILL BE: Highly organized, self-directed and passionate about showcasing Snowflake’s amazing momentum to the public Seasoned project management skills, a strong sense of initiative, attention to detail and the ability to work under pressure, while juggling and meeting multiple deadlines Analytical skills to measure and report on efficacy of PR campaigns and SOV Creative thinker with both short and long-term strategic vision to help reach communication goals A team player with a strong history of execution and a demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally 8 years (or more) of corporate PR or agency experience Experience in media relations, pitching, ghost writing, etc. Comfortable working in a small but VERY rapidly growing company environment Excellent communication skills and very strong writing skills Understanding of social media (Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) BA/BS degree or equivalent experience  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?

description: What's up? We're VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +150, servicing a diverse client all around the region.  The PITCH  Well, now we're looking for someone who lives and breathes social media even more than us. Do you know all of the latest trends? Memes? And TikToks? Maybe you've dabbled in the world of influencers? Believe in the power of social media and community management to change hearts, minds, and drive sales? Love the hustle of fast-paced, hyper-growth agency life? Thrive in a role where you can bring ideas to life on billions of screens? Cool. Then let's talk.  This exciting opportunity of a full-time role based in Singapore will allow you to lead a team of strategists and collaborate with a bunch of strat experts across apac. You will lead and drive our strategy expertise and be the "strategic brain" who will guide us for all things APAC.  Are you based in Singapore? Geeking the social media world in APAC digital space for eight plus years now? Are you inspiring with a can-do attitude? Do you wanna deep dive into the world of media and creative advertising agency? If yes, we could be meant to be -----so keep reading!  Here's where you come in.  Our growing strategy team is looking forward to collaborating with a "people first" Strategy Director to lead multiple exciting accounts in our growing APAC market. This is a full-time role based in Singapore with a reporting role to the Head of Strategy and Insights.  You're a problem solver at heart and insanely curious about people, culture and technology. Most of all, you like to get your hands dirty, are obsessed with researching & finding interesting things that are hidden from sight (even in the seemingly most mundane of places) and adept at translating your findings into compelling creative briefs, enjoy partnering with teams to see your work through from research to execution, and communicate your work with passion and conviction. We like to work with "big thinkers yet hands-on in execution".  As a team, we're collaborative and come from diverse backgrounds. We value creativity in research, and an outside-in perspective when it comes to inspiration, strategic frameworks and problem-solving. Technology has fundamentally changed the way we interact with others and the world around us, and we geek out about understanding behaviors in context, instead of probing humans in a petri dish.  You would be leading a team of talented strategists, social listening analysts, and community experts. As such, there are many hats you'd have to wear from day 1. You would need to conduct research, write briefs, guide work, pitch to clients - really anything and everything it takes to get the job done and deliver fantastic, big, bold, beautiful work.  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can't wait to meet you.  Your Experience and the "Nice To Have" 7 plus years experience building integrated programs at a top agency working for Fortune 500 clients -- must have experience understanding the intersection of business strategy, consumer insights, and digital behavior and developing big, purposeful ideas. Experience doing traditional, web, social, syndicated and primary research (incl.: NetBase, MRI, Sysomos, Brandwatch, eMarketer, Mintel, Google Analytics, Omniture; conducting IDIs, digital ethnographies, etc.) Dazzling presentation skills and presence in a room Ability to express complicated concepts in simple and digestible ways ("Explain it to a fifth grader") Curious and lovely to get along with. Deliver work independently on all tasks and achieve results at pace with energy and drive. Lead collaboration sessions with other teams. Execute a strong sense of priority level and urgency; and knows how to act on the critical difference between the two. Manage the ongoing performance of different tasks or projects, as well as understanding and ownership of internal processes for quality assurance. Administer agreed goals or projects by dealing to challenges in a responsive and constructive way. Strive for zero mistakes or flagged internal process issues on work output. Foster positive internal communication and collaboration with all internal teams. Ensure presented ideas are clear and understood. Highlight new ideas to the team and external stakeholders when appropriate. Provide clear, professional, timely and helpful information to the team or external clients and partners. Thrives in a company of good people Think logically even under pressure and come up with innovative solutions to problems. Lastly, a genuine belief in bringing your full self to what you do everyday, see "work" as a calling and a passion.  What You Should Know About VaynerMedia  Think "lab" and not "agency". We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We're willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It's fun!  Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can't wait to meet you.  P.S Portfolio would be nice :)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Our Client is a leading retail chain for consumer electronics and IT products in the region. The company is seeking a Head of IT to oversee their IT needs and operations in Singapore and Malaysia.  As Head of IT, you will represent Asia business IT goals and requirements from strategic through to operational levels to ensure optimal alignment of IT delivery within the acceptable cost and risk profile. You will lead a team to provide effective delivery and management of IT services & support to the business including Corporate Offices, Stores and warehouses.  What we envision the role to be: Provide management and accountability for IT Operations located in Singapore and Malaysia. Ensuring that all IT infrastructure is managed effectively including lifecycle management, capacity planning, performance management, system availability and reliability Effective delivery of new technology initiatives to the business Building, managing and developing a team of appropriately skilled staff Ensuring appropriate IT risk & security controls are establish and monitored Establish a collaborative relationships with Senior Management and key to actively contribute to IT Strategy development in alignment with business requirements and responsibilities Communicate and provide regular updates to all levels of the business on the IT priorities, project delivery and future plans. Develop a future looking roadmap of projects and initiatives covering value added initiatives, risk reduction and technology refresh. Manage and deliver projects to business expectations of time, cost and quality Provide and review IT operational performance measures, reports and dashboards Drive, deliver and maintain IT Security of Online and Digital environments to ensure Security Standards compliance Champion and support the development of a high-performance culture through training and development and in compliance with internal business policies and initiatives  What we hope to find in you: Tertiary qualification in Information Technology or equivalent Certifications (e.g. ITIL Service Management, PRINCE2, MCSE, MCITP, CCNA, etc) in Information Technology Min 10 years of Information Technology industry experience with at least 3 years in a managerial role Min 2 years of experience managing and supporting distributed infrastructure in multiple countries Experience in Retail solutions (Point of Sales, Supply Chain, ERP, Warehouse, etc.) Experience in managing and supporting SAP environments is preferred Intermediate knowledge of Cyber Security and Risk Management practices Advanced understanding and experience in IT Operations including desktop support, Server support, Network support, etc. Passionate about service and customer focus Advanced analytical and problem solving skills  We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Role and Responsibilities Key KPIs for this role: revenue targets, market share, product profitability and brand value (Proud To Own index). Define the overall IM product/service portfolio strategy including product ranging, feature prioritization and pricing. Lead the strategic marketing of product/service Product and price positioning Competitive differentiation/advantage Project manage product launches and GTM plans Manage product/service lifecycle to grow a customer base Understand key market trends and consumer insights to adopt a market-centric approach in developing compelling value propositions to generate demand Determine demand forecasts jointly with Business Analysis and Supply Chain Management teams Identify new business opportunities and drive strategic partnerships Enable and support sales strategies as well as key account planning Evaluate Telco’s network strategy/technical requirements and determine device strategy to gain Samsung advantage Meet regulatory compliance and telco approvals through product testing and certification Engage external stakeholders eg partners, media for Product Offering Meetings and product presentations Plan, coordinate and manage IM department marketing budgets and sales deduction investments to optimize ROI and balance sell out vs profitability. Collaborate with cross functional departments and improve internal processes. Lead and coach a team of Product Marketing Managers to strengthen functional competencies, build team cohesiveness and embrace a winning mindset.   Skills and Qualifications Degree holder with at least 10 years of relevant working experience in Product Management/Marketing Possess leadership skills with track record in building and managing a high performing team Passion in technology and able to thrive in challenging and fast paced industry Have strong commercial sense and analytical mind Must be a team player and strong influencing skills Good communication and interpersonal skills
