jobTitle: Head of Marketing, Communications and Digital, Asia Pacific
description: We are looking for a Head of Marketing, Communications & Digital for our Asia Pacific business, focused on building and maintaining the Knight Frank brand while also driving engagement with key target clients. We believe the successful candidate has a flair for shaping and producing impactful cross channel brand executions, as well as strong project management and event management skills.  Directly managing a team of 5 and influencing local market teams across 13 countries, your primary responsibility would be to drive the brand, data, channel, digital, communications, content and events strategy in support of the business, as outlined by the regional Managing Director and Service Line Management team, in collaboration with our global Marketing Team. Differentiated by our people-oriented approach, Knight Frank invests in long term client and employee experiences.  Specifically, you would be focused on the following core strategic objectives: Build the profile of Knight Frank and key individual business stakeholders across Asia Pacific, predominantly through organic PR and social media channels. Our objective is to ensure key decision makers at our client organisations know us, understand our service offering and will support appointing Knight Frank ahead of its competitors. Similarly, the role needs to support efforts to develop our employer brand so we can secure talent, now and in the future to build our business. Build the Knight Frank regional client database to extend the brand reach and to support the service line leadership in developing and deepening relationships with APAC decision-makers at client with a view to generating opportunities at a regional level and for local markets As a leader within our Global Marcoms network support global initiatives particularly by helping local markets to leverage global assets for their own local business development Support local markets on their local priorities (particularly on digital, social and web issues where they may not have local expertise on staff) as well as help drive global initiatives in the region. Support, organise and execute both physical and virtual events for report launches, exec visits, client engagement and APAC hosted internal meetings as required; these could range in size from 10 to 1,000 delegates and occur at least once a quarter Develop and help implement an internal communications strategy which helps engage our people so they have a clear understanding of our strategy, how they can support its implementation and feel connected to the organisation. Allied to this will be a communications plan to help embed amplify and strengthen the firm’s Value and Purpose Responsibilities Work with Asia Pacific Regional Head to build the profile of the firm across the region and drive our “business winning” capability at both a local and regional level. Assist the AP Country Heads and Marketing and Communications teams to develop local marketing and communications strategies. Assist Global Marketing in the roll out global initiatives across the AP region Identify the Asia Pacific target audiences by service line, their path to purchase and work with research and sales to create compelling value propositions to nurture those relationships Alongside the business leaders, agree on the target clients by service line and develop account-based engagement strategies for the priority regional accounts Work with the Group and Local market heads to maximise brand assets connected to the Knight Frank Values and Purpose; Support the deployment of the EVP and CVP messaging across all Marcoms teams in the region Lead and develop communications for the regional Managing Director, often in collaboration with other regional service line marketers, regional research and UK based communications leads Support the storyline, scripting, and production of the quarterly APAC update to the business Work with the Regional Head and relevant local country teams on the development and execution of the Asia Pacific regional conference and any complementary digital events supporting that conference Participate in monthly group meetings, specific strategy sessions and lead bi-monthly regional marketing team updates; Contribute to global projects by joining project teams and providing market-related inputs, where applicable. Strengthen our internal network of Marketers across the region so they can share best practice and have a like-minded community to support them. Build regional community through facilitated communications, amplification of success stories and resource sharing to facilitate cross-border collaboration and revenue growth Endeavour to take advantage of technology and digital toolsets available from the Group or champion regional licensing where appropriate to ensure productivity and efficiency (marketing automation, CRM, social advocacy etc) Working with the marketing operations lead to drive the regional utilisation of the global CMS to maintain local websites and to collect, analyse and use data in deciding and advising on the Marcoms strategies we deploy Provide strategic communication advice to senior leaders across the business to help achieve the objectives of their projects and programmes Maintain the Knight Frank presence with key industry association partners such as Britcham, AMCHAM, ANREV, APREA, PERE, ULA and CORENET, ensuring relevant stakeholders are aware of board roles, speaking and thought leadership opportunities Champion a client-centric mindset and brand consistency across all customer touch-points Act as player coach, leading by doing with both direct reports and local market team members where necessary Qualifications And Experience At least 10 years of marketing and communications experience, ideally in real estate or B2B such as professional services Hands on approach, comfortable with both strategy and execution, and maximising organic client and internal employee outreach Excellent communication skills including demonstrated PR, corporate comms, content marketing and / or internal communications experience. Strong interpersonal skills and significant experience in working with senior leadership teams, cross-regional teams, and other key stakeholders Excellent oral and written communication, negotiation, and presentation skills Experience working in a global matrix organisation Personality to lead as a team player and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders, while being independent and proactive at the same time Strong knowledge and abilities to use multiple platforms and channels (including digital) for a range of audiences Ability to build regional and local narratives incremental to global assets Demonstrable experience of partnering with business development and research to run successful demand generation campaigns (mostly organic, not typically support by paid media) Account based marketing experience an advantage Experience working with multiple markets across Asia Pacific and building peer-communities to share experience and resources Ability to build buyer personas and market segmentation Customer-centric mindset A passion for content, tech savvy, creative and an eye for detail We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Management Consulting, and Financial Services

description: Location: Singapore  The Role: This role is responsible for leading the LNG pricing team globally. Based in Singapore, the global head plays an essential role in driving forward our global LNG coverage including the development of new assessments, strengthening existing benchmarks and other pricing coverage, as well as driving excellence in news coverage in collaboration with the global news team. The global head manages a team of people based in Singapore, the UK, and the US. The global head, working closely with the Global Pricing Director, Oil & LNG, provides overall strategy for the group as well as decision-making around key benchmarks. They also engage comprehensively internally and externally with key stakeholders, including through methodology development and other discussions.  The Impact: This is a key role for Platts as it is focused on defending and strengthening Platts reputation in respect of existing LNG benchmarks as well as expanding its profile and footprint within the LNG sector both regionally and globally.  The Career Opportunity: This is an integral role in a challenging environment, with the global head expected to work well in collaboration with other senior leaders, as well as exhibiting strong individual leadership in delivering essential pricing and market coverage. The global head reports to the Global Pricing Director, Oil & LNG.  The Team / The Business: You’ll work with a high profile and highly motivated global leadership team, producing pricing and benchmarks for the world’s commodities markets. You will manage reporters spanning the globe, with the team analyzing market activity and data and reporting on the factors impacting the markets. The team is highly collaborative and engages with the market through various mediums, including commentaries, stories, podcasts, blogs, and videos. It is vital the team works successfully across other content sectors such as Energy Transition, as well as with other business units including Product, Marketing and Sales.  Responsibilities  The candidate will embrace the challenge of supporting and further developing an established commodities sector business and will, among other duties: Direct the global LNG pricing team, develop staff and talent. Build out and execute the pricing content strategy globally for LNG. Drive operational excellence, ensuring pricing and commentary is accurate and aligned with Platts methodologies and encourage further development of best practices. Engage with internal and external stakeholders on methodology issues and to ensure awareness and understanding of Platts LNG assessments. What We’re Looking For: Strong experience in commodity benchmarks and publishing, excellent understanding of Platts methodology. Strong interpersonal skills, with an ability to represent the business at the highest levels with the industry and other relevant stakeholders, in meetings as well as public presentations. Excellent managerial and leadership skills.  Qualifications And Experience Minimum of Bachelor’s degree or similar level university degree. Deep knowledge of global commodity markets – physical, exchange-traded and over-the-counter, as well as detailed knowledge of global LNG markets. International work experience in another major commodities trading hub. At least 10 years of experience in price reporting and management of commodity benchmarks. Track record of successfully developing emerging and established commodity benchmarks in several different commodity markets. Ability to motivate teams, achieve goals, develop and set strategy and translate ideas into targets and clear action plans. Strong background of discussing complex market issues with international external media. Excellent English writing skills. Strong analytical skills. Self-driven, energetic and proactive. Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, team-oriented, global, multi-cultural environment. Ability to speak at least two European languages. About S&P Global Platt  At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.  S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com  To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes.
industries: Computer Software, Oil & Energy, and Financial Services

companyName: Bank of Singapore, Asia's Global Private Bank
description: Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities.  Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Product Specialist!  At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today!  The Managed Investments Advisory & Sales team is looking for an enthusiastic, motivated and forward-thinking individual to join the team. The new team member will be responsible for providing quality advice (including new investment and switch ideas) to RMs and clients on managed investments across both discretionary portfolio mandates (DPM) and mutual funds, alternative funds, ETFs as well as be committed to constantly looking for ways to improve client experience.  In addition, as we evolve into a data-led organisation, the incumbent must also have a strong interest in data, with knowledge of data analytics tools such as Power BI, Tableau or Qlikview. They must have the ability to build data dashboards, to draw insights from data, use these insights to make more informed decisions, and allow the team to be more targeted and pre-emptive in our approach to our client’s needs.  Description  Advisory and Sales To grow AUM and increase the penetration of Managed Investments in client portfolios through marketing and advice to RMs and clients. This involves maintaining strong collaboration with Relationship Managers/Investment Counsellors. Conduct fund and DPM review meetings with clients, and undertake group sales meetings with RMs from designated markets to provide them with focus fund ideas and updates Align the recommendation of funds to the Bank’s overall asset allocation models to achieve outperformance versus appropriate benchmarks Participate in Advisory team meetings with the Due Diligence team to help brainstorm new ideas and funds that should be prioritized for onboarding Demonstrate effective collaboration with other sales and research teams within Product Management Group (PMG), and other Bank of Singapore/OCBC departments. Data Analysis Using data analytics tools, create and maintain data analytics dashboards incorporating a range of data intelligence metrics Identify patterns of behaviour of clients across funds and assist to track client activity, particularly during focus / campaign periods Analyse business data and highlight any observable trends to the business to assist with planning and strategic initiatives Client Experience / Digital With clients becoming increasingly digital in their interactions with the bank, the incumbent will be involved in strategic projects that help to reduce friction between the bank and the client, and deliver improvements in the way that we communicate digitally with our clients The incumbent will improve client experience through increasing the use of targeted messaging, as well as improve contextualization of our communication with our RMs and clients Project Work Participate in other projects relevant to the activities of the Managed Investments team Good, relevant under-graduate degree CFA holder &/or Masters degree in Finance from reputable university is strongly preferred Good command of 2nd language preferred Strong investments background, with solid knowledge of funds and DPM across global equities, fixed income and alternative asset classes. Preferable work experience in an asset management/Private Bank as a product specialist Knowledge and hands on experience with building dashboards using data analysis tools such as Power BI, Tableau and/or Qlikview with the ability to interpret this data and draw conclusions Excellent verbal and written communications skills Required experience in client engagement and customer experience Experience in Python or similar coding language will be looked upon favorably Reporting To  Team Lead, Managed Investments Advisory & Sales  Primary Location  Singapore  Job  Product Specialist  Organization  BOS - Products  Schedule  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  21-May-2021, 1:57:35 AM
industries: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Head of Publisher Partnerships, MoPub, Japan (Based in Singapore)
description: What You'll Do  As Head of Publisher Partnerships, MoPub, Japan, you will act as the face of MoPub in Japan and be tasked with developing and strengthening partnerships with the most prominent mobile app developers in the market. Additionally the role will also be expected to have a strong voice in the overall development of MoPub products particularly to meet the needs of our Japanese customers. You’ll be responsible for developing and executing a regional strategic plan; building a high performing matrixed team, driving improvements and excellence in business development, client services, marketing and associated functions.  This role reports to the Managing Director, MoPub, Asia-Pacific/Japan.  Responsibilities Directly accountable for MoPub’s success in Japan; building MoPub’s presence and awareness with mobile app developers as it related to monetization, mediation, and bidding. Help define and execute on the long term vision and strategy for the team and contribute to the management of day-to-day operations. Attend QBRs, Bootcamps & partner strategy meetings, while fostering C-level Executive relationships and be responsible for all escalations and ensuring we maintain the top level of service to our partners. Set revenue forecasts and team achievement while tracking key metrics to identify trends, ensure we are meeting goals, highlighting potential issues, and act as an escalation point for strategic partners Provide strong leadership by establishing clear direction, fostering a productive culture, nurturing relationships with functional leads and inspiring individuals to reach their full potential. Play a key role in hiring, developing and cultivating a high-performing matrixed team by providing strong leadership, establishing clear direction, fostering a productive culture, nurturing relationships with leadership, and inspiring individuals to reach their full potential. Work collaboratively with Twitter JP leadership team members; and represent MoPub’s interest in Twitter’s cross functional strategy. Provide feedback to Marketing, PMM and Product stakeholders to influence the roadmap and narrative towards Japanese clients Collaborate and communicate effectively across different geographies, cultures with different stakeholders across Sales Engineering, Analytics, Sales Ops, Accounting, Legal and Sales Finance teams. Drive areas for improvement across tools, systems, and processes with the operations and product teams. Who You Are  You’re a strategic thinker and you understand the big picture. You are driven by high achievement revenue growth. You thrive in a fast-paced, high intensity/high impact, and rapidly evolving environment. You have extensive experience in mobile programmatic, ad monetization or mobile gaming and can engage effectively with app developers. You have excellent communication skills. You have experience in managing high performing teams. You are intimately informed about trends in mobile advertising specifically programmatic or ad network space and familiar with the dynamics of marketplace businesses taking into consideration both our publisher and buyer needs. You are a team player with a can-do mentality. You are a self-starter and able to operate effectively in ambiguous settings.  In Addition, You Will Have 5-7 years of commercial experience in the tech space with at least 5 years in mobile advertising related companies such as programmatic exchange, ad network or mobile publisher Track record of attracting, developing, and managing top-performing teams - with a minimum of 3 years management experience required. Proven ability to understand client needs and build ongoing relationships across all levels of organizations Expert negotiation, sale communication and presentation skills Regional experience: Demonstrated history of working effectively and with a deep knowledge of the Japanese advertising market specifically with mobile app developers across the main verticals - games, entertainment, lifestyle and utilities. Capable of problem solving, developing strategy and executing effectively against that. Deep understanding and experience in mobile gaming is a major plus Language skills: Japanese and English is a must to work with regional partners and clients

description: Job Description  Responsible for planning, development and implementation of all of the Organization’s marketing strategies, marketing communications, and public relations activities, both external and internal. Oversees development and implementation of support materials and services for chapters in the area of marketing, communications and public relations. Directs the efforts of the marketing, communications and public relations staff and coordinates at the strategic and tactical levels with the other functions.  Primary Relationships The position reports to the Managing Director. Within the Organization, the position has primary working relationships with other Head of Departments. Outside the agency, the position coordinates, primarily, with agencies and media. Principle Accountabilities  Marketing, Branding, Communications and Public Relations.  Responsible For Creating, Implementing And Measuring The Success Of A comprehensive marketing, communications and public relations program that will enhance the Organization’s image and position within the marketplace and the general public, and facilitate internal and external communications; and, All Organization marketing, communications and public relations activities and materials including publications, media relations, client acquisition and so forth. Ensure articulation of Organization’s desired image and position, assure consistent communication of image and position throughout the Organization, and assure communication of image and position to all constituencies, both internal and external. Responsible for editorial distribution of all Organization publications. Coordinate media interest in the Organization and ensure regular contact with target media and appropriate response to media requests. Act as the Organization’s representative with the media. Coordinate the appearance of all Organization print and electronic materials such as letterhead, use of logo, brochures, etc. Develop, coordinate and oversee programs, technical assistance and resource materials to assist chapters in the marketing, communications and positioning of their activities. Provide counsel to chapters on marketing, communications and public relations. Ensure that the Organization regularly conducts relevant market research and coordinate and oversee this activity. Monitor trends. Stays abreast of search engine strategies and develops effective keywords and descriptions for apps and SEO Leads projects as assigned, such as cause-related marketing and special events. Planning And Budgeting Responsible for the achievement of marketing/communications/public relations mission, goals and financial objectives. Ensure that evaluation systems are in place related to these goals Develop short- and long-term plans and budgets for the marketing/communications/ public relations program and its activities, monitor progress, assure adherence and evaluate performance. Recommend short- and long-term Organization goals and objectives to the Managing Director. Develop, implement and monitor systems and procedures necessary to the smooth operation of the marketing/communications/public relations function. Keep informed of developments in the fields of marketing, communications and public relations, not-for-profit management and governance, [and the specific business of the Organization and use this information to help the Organization operate with initiative and innovation] Organizational Strategy Work with team to develop brand and communication strategies that embraces Organization’s philosophy, mission and vision and ensure they are practiced throughout the organization internal and external stakeholder’s communications Ensure effective management within the marketing, communications and public relations function, with provision for succession. Qualifications Bachelor degree in marketing, communications, public relations preferred. Minimum of 8 years’ experience in marketing, communications or public relations with demonstrated success, preferably in the web & mobile industry. Demonstrated skills, knowledge and experience in the design and execution of marketing, communications and public relations activities. Strong creative, strategic, analytical, organizational and personal sales skills. Experience developing and managing budgets, and hiring, training, developing, supervising and appraising personnel. Demonstrated successful experience writing press releases, making presentations and negotiating with media. Experience overseeing the design and production of print materials and publications. Computer literacy in word processing, data base management and page layout. Commitment to working with shared leadership and in cross-functional teams. Strong oral and written communications skills. Ability to manage multiple projects at a time.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: APJ MidMarket Head of Transformation and Strategic Initiatives
description: PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES  The APJ Midmarket business unit is on a multi-year Transformation journey to change the go-to-market and coverage experience for our business by increasing our territory coverage through more autonomous partner led midmarket sales, increasing digital sales support and tailor the customer engagement across the entire cloud lifecycle to deliver customer outcomes.  Reporting directly to the APJ Head of MidMarket, the Head of MidMarket Transformation and Strategic Initiatives, is responsible for four main areas: (1) Define and govern the APJ MM strategy and transformation 2) Ensure alignment to the overall MM Strategy Vision and Asia NOW Strategy, and secure the required investments to deliver on the aspirations 3) Lead specific APJ and MU MM pilots that will help accelerate the transformation and 4) be a trusted advisor to the APJ MM leadership team on strategic projects.  To support the activities outlined above in (1) and (2), we must continuously communicate and engage with our Midmarket teams on the progress of our Transformation journey, as well as gather feedback directly from the field. To that end, the role will be an ambassador and best-practice champion for the change we seek to deliver as well as Operational Excellence generally. (S)he will be responsible for driving a cohesive communication approach through mixed channels, push & pull communications & roundtable discussions, among other change activities.  To support the activities outlined above in (3), where necessary, (s)he will lead a core team of individual experts dedicated to these MM goals and work with them to influence the direction and outcomes.  Key Responsibilities  Strategic Vision and Roadmap: Draw upon deep understanding of complex market dynamics to lead the development of MM strategic vision, identify the regional and MU priorities to deliver that vision, develop Operating Model and GTM guidance to bring the vision to life. Together with the APJ MM Leadership team and in alignment with the Transformation priorities, co-develop the overall MM Readiness Roadmap / Implementation Plan.  Transformation Leadership: Define and lead key projects across Region & MUs to support the delivery of the MM Transformation priorities. Consolidate best practices into actionable insights and guidance for the field to drive Operational Excellence. Together with other Transformation Leaders, co-own the change engagement plan, including drafting communications relating to the Transformation in various formats (e.g. FAQ, email, powerpoint, newsletters, blog posts, video-logs etc.) as appropriate. Act as leader, coach and/or mentor to members of the Transformation Office and Regional working teams (both internal and external) to ensure we drive to common purposes and goals  Trusted Advisor: Be a trusted advisor for the APJ MM Leadership team, and jointly facilitate alignment across the MM. As needed, help to coordinate preparation of MM-related strategic and business reviews with regional/global leadership teams and/or Executive Board members, propose agenda, develop meeting content, propose topics to be prioritized, ensure thorough documentation and follow-ups, and raise awareness regarding bottlenecks and/or barriers to execution. Where aspects of the business warrant special attention, undertake deep-dive reviews with diagnostic / root cause analysis and propose prioritized actions and mitigations – this may extend to interim leadership of that function or business area for a defined period of time.  CRITICAL COMPETENCIES  Strategic program leadership: Demonstrated ability to structure and manage cross-organisational business initiatives and drive change. Thinks big picture but able to roll up sleeves and deliver. Sets and manages clear expectations by defining concrete objectives, deliverables, and action plans. Employs clear methods for closed-loop management and holds others accountable for delivering on time with quality. Shows appropriate attention to detail with diligent, tenacious follow-through. Flexible and comfortable with ambiguity but strives to bring structure and discipline to ad-hoc work efforts.  Collaboration/EQ: Demonstrates capacity to engender trust and effectively collaborate with SAP colleagues at all levels, from senior executives, account teams, and individual contributors. A diplomatic, natural networker who builds positive, enduring relationships and helps bridge diverse perspectives. Thinks and acts “win-win” when relating to others and demonstrates effectiveness in aligning and orchestrating interests to achieve results. Shows good judgment regarding where and when to compromise.  Industry expertise: Knowledgeable of relevant market, competitive, and technology trends influencing the enterprise solutions industry. Applies well-informed point of view to identify new business opportunities, address ecosystem dynamics, and shape innovative yet pragmatic business GTM’s and plans that drive tangible market impact  Creative problem solving. Adept at diagnosing problems and issues, identifying root causes, and determining creative yet practical ways to address them. Willing and able to consider different points of view and engage directly in the problem-solving process vs delegating to others. Able to make decisions promptly, thoughtfully, and confidently in highly ambiguous situations  Executive Communication: Highly effective written and oral communication skills. Communicates complex topics simply but without losing important nuance and meaning. Focuses on central issues and has a command of specifics without being overly detailed. Understands how to frame messages in a compelling way for a target audience, and articulates these messages credibly, powerfully, and with confidence.  Learning agility: Shows capacity to adapt, master new topics and behaviours, and continuously improve. Committed to learning constantly. Eager to take on new challenges; brings a positive attitude and is resilient to setbacks. Demonstrated ability to take on new assignments in diverse business areas, ramp quickly, and accomplish significant business results.  High-clock speed responsiveness: Operates with a sense of urgency. Brings an awareness of and sensitivity of field concerns and perspectives. Artfully bring “7x24” responsiveness while maintaining personal balance.  Ideal Experience  Min. 5 years leading complex organizational change programs.  At least 5 years leadership in tech and/or Management Consulting  Solid experience in software industry, with work experience in sales, sales support or sales operations as a minimum  Education And Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent Work Experience Required
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Purpose of the role As Regional Head of Cloud, your role is to help potential and existing customers leverage the power of the Public Clouds (AWS, GCP, and Azure) through strong presales and solutions architecture experience. You will help govern a portfolio of accounts and act as a key driver of the delivery lifecycle, bringing executive expertise to remove barriers and successfully deliver customer business outcomes. This role is a key Services role in bringing innovative solutions and market trends to customers and developing strong partnerships with many other roles across the Sales and Delivery landscape.  Key Responsibilities  This role will be responsible for external outreach and engagement with C-Level executives across a diverse geo and to influence strategic solution development and deployment that unifies cloud into unique and differentiated offerings to support APAC Services' revenue growth and adoption/utilization targets.  More specifically, the role will be responsible for engaging with top APAC customers, demonstrating and validating the value of digitized journey services, and identifying necessary deployment and utilization requirements to ensure customer success. The role will help serve as the technology advisor to APAC Services Leadership and will be responsible for detailed engagements across the area to ensure customer requirements and needs are met.  Other than above, this role will be responsible for maintaining relationships with various cloud and technology partners. Coverage is not limited to Singapore, Malaysia, and Hong Kong.  Competencies  Public cloud providers (AWS/ MS Azure/ GCP, etc.) certifications - Professional or equivalent ITIL Certifications Able to Communicate well With Technical and non-Technical C-Suite. Have broad understanding of technology and be able to productize it. Excellent working experience with cloud technology and providers such as MS Azure, GCP, Ali Cloud, Tencent Cloud, etc.  Qualifications & Experience Compulsory Skills  Champion Cloud's technology vision, strategy, and capabilities across Digital Transformation solutions. Serve as the go-to voice of field into for product insights and customer escalations and to scale through others across a diverse geo. Drive strategic wins and deployments by helping customers leverage public cloud services to drive Digital Transformation. Uncover and unlock strategic sales by engaging in technology workshops and executive briefings with strategic customers. Mentor Area and Domain Architects whilst growing the Services Solution Architecture Community. Experience with all pillars of Best Cloud Architecture frameworks – security, cost optimization, performance, operations, reliability Serve as the point of escalation on critical technical solution issues and proactively represent customer requirements in product feedback and planning processes. Participate alongside the team in Opportunity management by establishing a healthy pipeline to drive & win solutions/design in line with Cloud Services strategy. Delivers against a Practice plan, ensuring that predictable and healthy business results are achieved. Customer facing experience including presenting solutions to various audience – business owners, C level, and technical teams. Experience with building a Cloud solutions program. Be able to articulate what worked and what didn’t work. Experience in Cloud Security specifically with SDLC and public\hybrid cloud. Experience building/selling a cloud Managed Services practice. Ability to be well-versed in cloud technologies, modern engineering, software development techniques and methods. Experience with migrating and running production applications in public cloud environments with hands on experience.  Fundamental Requirements  BS\MS degree in Engineering or Computer Science. Expected travel up to 20-30% per month. Must possess strong leadership skills.  Soft Skills  Demonstrated ability in providing technical leadership partnering with internal teams as well as key external business partners. Excellent oral and written communications skills. Strong analytical, problem solving, organizational and planning skills. Exceptional communication skills and ability to influence decision makers. Track record of establishing relationships and exceeding customer expectations. Ability to manage budgets and project costs.

description: The Opportunity The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Head of Alternate Distribution with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.  Manulife Bancassurance is seeking for a self-motivated professional, who is obsessed with delivering value, is forward-thinking, and drive the company's distribution strategy with the partnership.  What motivates you?  You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone  What we are looking for:  Leading distribution of insurance through DBS Institutional Banking Drive Distribution strategies for HNW products to meet/exceed the sales objective of the Bancassurance partners To establish relationships with inclusive partners, and engage regularly Stakeholder engagement and management. Every day.    Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.com

description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting a Director - Rewards Solutions to join our team in Singapore.  About Aon  Headquartered in London, Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.  As a senior position within the human capital solutions practice for Southeast Asia, the main areas of focus would be: Providing leadership to complex advisory projects on broad based compensation, workforce optimization and sales force effectiveness Lead team and capability development on advisory solutions in South East Asia while working with industry and geo leaders across the region Drive uptake of our data products in the client community through client relationship management and showcasing of data capabilities in project delivery Provide leadership to Singapore data products covering general industry End to end management of a business portfolio ensuring client satisfaction, financial process compliance and profitability Contribute towards key decisions on the SEA HCS business and its performance Business development and client relationship management using the Aon United framework of bringing the best of the firm to clients. Requirements 10 + years of experience in a consulting environment focusing on origination and delivery of complex projects. Majority of which should be in the SEA region Deep knowledge of principles of broad based compensation, organization effectiveness, tools and implementation using a data backed approach Prior team leadership experience is a must Ability to deal with ambiguity and energize teams in a high-performance environment Degree in business/management preferred How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.  2493214

description: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  Strategy Drive profitable growth by acquiring, developing and servicing long-term relationships with HNW clients Business Accountable for the performance of individual's own client book. Deliver NNM, AUM and revenue growth targets and key operating metrics (such as tail accounts management, client acquisition, client satisfaction, portfolio mix). Generate healthy pipeline of target market prospects and convert them into clients. Grow client portfolio size by deepening existing customer relationships. Implement an asset allocation in line with the client needs, and model portfolios as benchmarks. Deliver, monitor and review solutions to clients based on client investment profile. Conduct periodic reviews of client accounts in accordance with established procedures. Deliver profitable growth by controlling costs and mitigating operational losses. Deliver positive client performance in line with client investment profiles. Processes Support the continuous improvement of processes to increase operational efficiency and effectiveness. Support the effective management of operational risks across the Business and in compliance with applicable internal policies, and external laws and regulations at a global level. Support the delivery of Business strategy in a safe and well-controlled manner and on an end-to-end basis. Ensure sales management, suitability and onboarding processes are applied appropriately. Risk Management & Governance Do what is right in order to avoid reputational risks and operational losses. Understand the risk and control environment within area of responsibility and drive rectification as required. Handle customer issues, complaints and product enquiries on timely basis in accordance with established procedures. Ensure that Risk Management matters that are brought to attention are subject to direct remedial action and/or ensure adequate reporting to the relevant Risk Committees and/or line management. Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which the Group operates and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role. Ensure adherence with the highest standards of ethics and compliance with relevant polices, processes and regulations forms part of the culture. Participation in Local Client Committee and other relevant committees where applicable. Engage with all audit report findings and ensure feedback is acted upon. Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Support the business to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles, such as Fair Outcomes for Clients; Financial Crime Prevention; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Ideal Candidates Should Possess The Following Demonstrable and relevant experience of 8 - 15 years in the Private Banking industry commensurate with this remit and level of responsibility Strong ability to develop a network of target prospects Proven risk management capabilities Firm in all business guidelines and compliance issues Sound knowledge of financial markets and investment products Outstanding communication and presentation skills Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages .

description: Eigen Energy is a systems integrator for solar energy and electric vehicle charging infrastructure, with technical competencies in engineering and construction, energy management, software engineering and cross platform integration. We are one of the key industry players driving Singapore’s plan to phase out internal combustion engines (ICE) by 2040, and are looking for enthusiastic talents to be part of our team. Product ManagerWe are looking for a leader with experience to lead the development of our inhouse software solutions. As one of the first members of our team, you should be comfortable with wearing many hats, ranging from product management, to design and coordination of solution architecture and software development. Objectives Clearly define and articulate product vision and strategic direction Drive the product and business-planning process across cross-functional teams of the company Analyse consumer needs, current market trends, and potential partnerships Assess current competitor offerings, seeking opportunities for differentiation Analyse product requirements and develop appropriate programs to ensure they are successful achieved Develop, implement, and maintain timelines Appraise new product ideas and strategize appropriate go-to-market plans Coordinate with internal team members, external partners, agencies and vendors Responsibilities Drive the execution of the product lifecycle processes including product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product launch Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for MVP and final product development Create product strategy documents that describe business cases, high-level use cases, technical requirements, revenue, and ROI Analyse market data to develop sales strategies, develop plans for user acquisition and retention, and define product objectives for effective marketing communications plans Collaborate closely with external agencies on the development Develop product positioning, differentiation, and messaging across primary market segments Qualifications Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Business or related. A qualification in Computer Science or equivalent is welcomed. Skills Need to have Effective communication skills Proven experience in product development lifecycle Highly effective cross-functional team management Previous experience delivering finely tuned product marketing strategies Previous experience with information systems product Good to have Demonstrable knowledge in software development Experience working in a company with a product in the development stage While skills and experience are important, we place equal importance on a candidate’s resourcefulness, adaptiveness and the ability to prioritise and find solutions appropriate for a situation. We offer a competitive compensation package with part of the remuneration in equity.

description: Prior experience in Ecommerce or Fashion Retail is highly preferred Diverse skillset across Category Management, Buying & Merchandising Only open to Indonesian candidates About the Company:  Our Client is a leading Ecommerce player in the market that has various product categories and aims to impact the Retail landscape.  Responsibilities Manage the overall P&L for the business Establish processes to drive marketplace sales and profitability Drive sales of international and local brands and private label Design commercial structure/modules to cater to different suppliers and categories Manage acquisition for Indonesia market and work with regional acquisition team to onboard brands Liaise and work with Operations and Logistics teams for issues related to warehouse storage, deliveries, and interaction with third-party logistics Work with local and regional teams to troubleshoot existing problems and to map out development plans Establish SRM management tools to communicate with vendors Drive integration with global brands/retail companies Manage a team across buyers, planners, buying operations Requirements Bachelor in Business, Marketing, Finance or related field At least 7-10 years of experience across both Online & Offline consumer businesses Experience in E-commerce or Fashion Retail is highly preferred Prior experience in Merchandising across categories would be a strong plus Possess excellent communication, interpersonal & negotiating skills Strong analytics skills Able to work in a multicultural and dynamic environment Have prior experience managing sizable teams Call for Action:  If you possess the above requirements and are keen to explore an exciting new challenge, please apply directly or email stephanie.leong@wenetworkasia.com for more information.

description: The proliferation of online shopping and commerce landing destinations presents an exciting opportunity for Mindshare. The key opportunity for the Head of E-Commerce is to bring strategic expertise and experience to craft E-Comm solutions as a key offering and differentiator for Mindshare. Develop and execute the vision and strategy to continue to build and grow Commerce for Unilever brands Build, develop and create world class frameworks and systems that embraces innovation and delivers results. Bring new ideas, creativity, and insights across all media (digital, in-store and experiential) Develop reporting and forecasting modules to show positive ROAS which can then be implemented across all brands Be subject matter expert on regional/local marketplaces in APAC in terms of their positioning, audience and marketing capabilities Be the leader for all commerce related strategic work streams as part of client briefs and existing engagements. Active participation in overall commerce product and solutions development to provide full-funnel visibility to brands and media stakeholders Identify trends in the market, and business practices to find ways to capitalize on the constant changing landscape Reporting of the role  This role reports to the Senior Director, Digital  Why You Should be Excited  Just as the industry of ecommerce would demand, this role requires you to simultaneously build the ship while sailing it. This is an opportunity to build the Ecomm practice across the most exciting FMCG brand portfolio in the world. Performance marketing is Mindshare’s key focus area so this role will have the focus and support of leadership teams and business team leads and client stakeholders.  Measures of Success  3 months : Take over, Assess status, Establish actions Learn, learn, learn - the Unilever business has its own language and grammar. Study the brands, their personalities, their purpose, their history and their ambition. Shadow the existing teams in client meetings with the single-minded agenda of understanding deeply the client’s goals and objectives Clients should start seeing you as keen, observant and willing to learn Learn the tools of the trade- Deep dive into the tools on planning, insighting and data mining Start imagining and penning what success looks like by brand - everyone wants a winning story Have an auditor’s hat on - identify areas where the existing tools & processes can improve 6 months : Early Actions You have knowledge of the commerce ambitions, consumers and brand language. You are now ready to reimagine the current commerce offering within the plannin product and suggest improvement to our performance execution, and are prototyping your new thinking on a few brands You are able to fuse commerce data, consumer insights, brand objective and creative that sells into brilliant and simple stories (brilliant consumer commerce experiences) Global marketing and media heads have by now noticed you by your work landing at their desk You are imagining a future view of what commerce media looks like 1-3 years from now and future proofing the business to continue building brilliant commerce experiences All tools and stories created would have a local market landing lens keeping market context in mind You are able to join hands with the execution and content teams to spark new ideas. They are your partners, leverage their domain expertise for fluid and dynamic content creation 9 months : 2021 and Beyond Your work is being entered for awards and is being talked about by the global marketing, media and brand communities Your work has been outcome driven, brands are seeing the impact of your plans on their market metrics You have reimagined and evolved the commerce product and solutions from Mindshare What Your Day Job Looks Like At Mindshare You sit in the client office and visit clients and are constantly engaged with WPP agencies, partners and clients through the data At any given time, you are drawn between brand work for clients or product development or partner meetings. Partners could be from the online, content or measurement world Your peers are best in class, meaningful engagement will bring the best out of them - you are expected to challenge them and be challenged back in return - we want someone to embrace the challenge - daily! Get earphones, you will be working with a lot of cross-country teams - great work happens in markets too - learn and scale - we win as a team Handling senior client relationships on a daily basis other than clients across all work levels What You Will Need  This role requires someone with strong Performance capabilities and an ability to deliver across teams and markets. The ideal candidate will have built and led a breakthrough digital commerce business successfully leveraging new digital sales and marketing tactics, and possess deep knowledge and experience in all strategic, business, operational, and technological functions that make up the digital commerce ecosystem.  This role is heavy in both strategy and execution - this is a defining characteristic of our agency where our leaders do and think in equal measure. This person and role is the very embodiment of our values of Speed, Provocation and Teamwork as this role is required to work across multiple stakeholders, influence and champion the new and to do it with speed and scale.  The job holder will be expected to have:-  Core Skills Minimum 10 years’ experience in digital marketing, most of which in the retail/FMCG industry with prior experience working with market places or multi-brand sites such as Lazada, Shopee, or any other online business partners Proven success leading and inspiring a large cross-functional team of digital commerce business, technology, and operational business units Strong performance marketing experience. Proven ability to work with data to understand and analyze performance, optimize plans, drive decisions, and measure impact to the business Superior analytical skills and the ability to leverage performance data and convert consumer insights and trend data into high impact marketing initiatives Experience in a rigorous testing environment. Must be passionate about presenting a fact-based argument and be results/metrics driven. Can effectively communicate complex digital commerce concepts to all levels of the organization Minimum Qualifications Graduate or Post Grad in Marketing / Economics or related field Worked in a communication planning role 10 + years of work experience More About Mindshare  We were born in Asia in 1997, a start up with a desire to change the media world. Now we are a global agency with more than 7,000 employees in 116 offices across 86 countries, operating as one team - #teammindshare. We believe that in today’s world, everything begins and ends in media. We aim to be our clients’ lead business partner, to grow their business, and drive profitability through adaptive and inventive marketing. We do this through speed, teamwork and provocation and by operating as a network of networks rather than a rigid hierarchy. We create new things and have fun doing it. Whenever and wherever you join us, you open a door to opportunities in any and of all aspects of media, technology and innovation. We will support you, recognize you and reward you, making Mindshare the place where you do the best work of your career.  Mindshare APAC has won 500 awards in the last year alone, including “Agency Network of the Year 2017” by both the MMA SMARTIES™ and Campaign Asia for the fifth and third consecutive year, respectively. Mindshare is part of GroupM, the media investment management arm of WPP, the world’s leading communications services group. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com and follow us on Twitter @mindshare and facebook.com/mindshareapac and linkedin.com/company/mindshare.  More About GroupM Singapore  GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.  GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity - it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Our client is a leading payments platform provider. Below are the primary responsibilities of the role  Job Scope Responsible for further strengthening 2C2P’s product function, with focus on driving product strategy for our existing products as well as product pipeline. Gather and assess information with regards to regional and global product trends and competitive dynamics, to help inform our product roadmap across different markets. Collaborate with internal key stakeholders such as commercial and technical teams, to strategically assess new product opportunities across our markets. Help translate market opportunities into product improvements and innovations, working closely with our product managers, commercial leads and technical teams. Solid payments product background (payments acceptance and payout) Technical payments knowledge as well as ability to communicate effectively across different functions (commercial, tech, marketing) Excellent communication and leadership skills with an ability to influence at all levels. Ability to work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders. Our client offers an attractive remuneration package, a fast-paced and exciting working environment, and provide challenging opportunities for life-long learning and career development.  Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  Please apply to the role if you think you have the relevant skillset. You can also email us your resume at ceo-office@headhuntingco.com  Nitu Sinha (R1325633)  Headhunting Pte. Ltd.  EA License No: 20S0310

jobTitle: Director - Advertising Account Management (Relocate to Bangkok)
description: Read something interesting online today? There's a good chance it reached you because of our technology.  Taboola is the world's leading content discovery platform, serving 360B recommendations to over 1B unique visitors each month on the web's most innovative publisher sites, including NBC, USA Today, The Weather Channel, Tribune and Fox Sports.  Taboola, the world’s largest content recommendation platform, is hiring a Director, Advertiser Account Management, APAC. Reporting to the VP of APAC, you will lead a team of frontline Managers and individual Account Managers across the APAC region. This team is tasked with driving revenue by ensuring world-class client experiences, leading to increased retention and growth from our mid-market and enterprise level clients.  An experienced leader with deep knowledge of digital advertising, you should be skilled at maintaining and growing account management professionals, meeting and exceeding challenging revenue targets, and have a strategic vision for how account management can help our advertisers grow their business. You will work with the global sales leadership and act as the voice for account management in the region.  What you'll do:  Develop strategies that scale the revenue of our business. Meet and exceed revenue targets for the APAC Media team and help ensure that team members are also meeting and exceeding their targets Ensure we are able to creatively and intelligently hit our clients’ KPI’s and extract as much from each opportunity as possible Recruit, hire, develop and inspire a world-class account management team, from entry-level to experienced managers Attend strategic client meetings to ensure you are leading from the front, and deeply understanding the day to day of AM-client interaction Represent the Account Management region at global and leadership meetings Lead the region review quarterly process, reporting on your team’s revenue #’s, key opportunities and challenges you are facing to present to Taboola’s leadership team Collaborate with Sales Leadership, Product, and Business Operations to make sure we're providing the best service to our clients while adhering to Taboola’s content policies Collect, consolidate and channel customer feedback to appropriate channels; collaborate with product, marketing, sales, professional services and business operations teams Serve as an escalation point for key customer issues and opportunities Contribute and work with the senior leadership team and financial planning team to project annual budget plan for the Account Management team  Who you are: An experienced leader with a minimum 12 years total experience in account management, sales or similar commercial function. You will have previously experience carrying a revenue quota previously and will have a demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding these targets. Minimum 7 years experience managing, and growing large teams (20+ people) including having managed a large, national team consisting of direct and indirect reports in a hyper-growth environment Prior industry experience in the APAC region (3 out of 4 markets) is a prerequisite. The key markets are Japan, Korea, India, ANZ, Thailand, SEA and China. You must have experience as a leader, preferably within tech, and have a comprehensive knowledge of the digital media landscape, including branding and performance Comfortable with analytics platforms, and the ability to use data to tell the story and leverage data to create strategies Strong understanding of clients’ businesses, including current and future objectives Track record of reaching, and overachieving on KPI’s and revenue targets Confident in working to (and beating) revenue targets and clear KPI’s Experience building business cases, working to reach internal consensus, use data strategically Experience building out strategies to engage with clients, win new and grow existing client relationships, and documenting processes to template for future Exceptional at people development, demonstrating the ability to inspire, develop and get the very best out of team members Ability to strategically enhance existing advertisers relationships and build relationships at C-Level on the advertiser side of the business

jobTitle: Director, Asia Pacific Licensing & Exchange Relationships
description: S&P Global Platts  The Role: Director, Asia Pacific Licensing and Exchange Relationships  Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 12  Location: Singapore  The Team / The Business: The Global Licensing and Exchange Relationships Team (Licensing) plays a key role in monetizing Platts' price assessments through commercial arrangements with Exchanges. The team manages the complex relationships with these business partners, which involve both revenue and costs for Platts. With staff in the Americas, London, and Singapore, Licensing has a global remit to drive growth from emerging commodity markets in addition to managing the commercial arrangements for longstanding benchmarks.  As one of the four operating companies under the umbrella of financial information services leader S&P Global, Platts is the gold standard in commodity market news, pricing, and analytics. Platts benchmark price assessments are used to settle tens of millions of dollars of transactions every day, and underpin hundreds of derivatives contracts listed on exchanges. Branching out from its roots in oil, Platts has established a leading presence across commodities including the emerging Energy Transition space.  What we're looking for: The ideal candidate for the Director, Asia Pacific (APAC) Licensing and Exchange Relationships role will be driven and ambitious while disciplined enough to zero in on the highest value opportunities. As Licensing's leader in the APAC region, the candidate will be a confident communicator able to build relationships and manage negotiations with key exchange executives in the region. They will be a self-starter able to manage initiatives and negotiations autonomously while keeping stakeholders in the loop. This role's focus is forging relationships outside of Platts, so the right fit will be outgoing and ready for face-to-face meetings when business travel resumes.  Responsibilities  Develop and implement regional strategy Develop and implement a holistic APAC exchange strategy, identifying and prioritizing key regions, commodities, and exchange partners Work with Commercial and other stakeholders to provide the exchange component of broader China go-to-market strategy Manage inbound and outbound new business opportunities Establish and grow relationships with exchanges in the APAC region Respond to partnership inquiries from exchanges, collaborating with Content and other functions to demonstrate Platts' market-leading offerings Develop and implement new business initiatives with a focus on the licensing of Platts assessments to exchanges Manage negotiations and execute new deals Collaborate with Legal, Finance, and other stakeholders to structure new commercial arrangements in addition to monitoring compliance with existing contracts Lead negotiations with regional exchanges for the use of their data in price assessment process and redistribution Lead Licensing team in APAC region Partner with regional Commercial and Content teams on strategic Greater China business development initiative Have direct responsibility for the management and growth of key exchange relationships in the region. Shepherd regional out-bound license negotiations from term sheet stage to execution stage by coordinating GTS, legal, editorial, and commercial resources globally Monitor and respond to exchange strategy as it relates to pricing mechanisms, new commodities, and interaction with Price Reporting Agencies including but not limited to Platts Maintain active communication with other functions including Content, Sales and Marketing to assure these stakeholders understand Licensing's APAC priorities and vice versa. Manager / Individual Contributor  Individual Contributor.  Functional and Business Knowledge  Knowledge of the exchange ecosystem, futures markets, and hedging and risk management needs in commodities markets. Understanding role of Price Reporting Agencies such as Platts in Exchange Ecosystem. Strong strategy development and financial modeling experience.  Problem Solving  Platts enjoys complex, bi-lateral and mutually beneficial relationships with our exchange partners. In some cases they depend on us as much as we them, and in other cases, we compete directly and indirectly in the index and data businesses. This means our relationships with the exchanges are handled with care and challenges in the relationships need to be dealt with professionally and skillfully. The Director will require the ability to discover root causes of issues and then manage their resolution to everyone's satisfaction.  Interactions  Role requires the ability to communicate with, influence and gain support of S&P Global stakeholders at every level. The global nature of the role requires flexible communication skills and the ability to relate to organizations and people operating across a diverse linguistic and cultural landscape.  Typical Scope & Impact  The scope includes all of Platts' commodities across the entire Asia Pacific region. The role has direct impact on the success of our benchmarks and is key to delivering over $60 Million in direct revenue to Platts.  Minimum And Preferred Education  Undergraduate degree in Economics, Math, Finance, Business or equivalent. Post graduate degree highly desirable.  Minimum And Preferred Experience/Skills 10 plus years of experience in strategy, consulting, finance, or business analysis. Deep knowledge of the functioning of financial markets and the role of Exchanges, Clearinghouses and Price Reporting Agencies (such as Platts) is a critical requirement of the role. Experience leading cross-functional projects Strong English writing and presentation skills including use of PowerPoint Chinese language proficiency strongly preferred but not mandatory S&P Global Platts  At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. We're the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.  S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com .  S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy ("the Policy") that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy's requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.  S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.  If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.  10 - Officials or Managers (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), PDMGDV103.2 - Middle Management Tier II (EEO Job Group), SWP Priority - Ratings - (Strategic Workforce Planning)  Job ID: 266717  Posted On: 2021-10-06  Location: Singapore, Singapore

description: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  Strategy Drive profitable growth by acquiring, developing and servicing long-term relationships with HNW clients Business Accountable for the performance of individual's own client book. Deliver NNM, AUM and revenue growth targets and key operating metrics (such as tail accounts management, client acquisition, client satisfaction, portfolio mix). Generate healthy pipeline of target market prospects and convert them into clients. Grow client portfolio size by deepening existing customer relationships. Implement an asset allocation in line with the client needs, and model portfolios as benchmarks. Deliver, monitor and review solutions to clients based on client investment profile. Conduct periodic reviews of client accounts in accordance with established procedures. Deliver profitable growth by controlling costs and mitigating operational losses. Deliver positive client performance in line with client investment profiles. Processes Support the continuous improvement of processes to increase operational efficiency and effectiveness. Support the effective management of operational risks across the Business and in compliance with applicable internal policies, and external laws and regulations at a global level. Support the delivery of Business strategy in a safe and well-controlled manner and on an end-to-end basis. Ensure sales management, suitability and onboarding processes are applied appropriately. Risk Management & Governance Do what is right in order to avoid reputational risks and operational losses. Understand the risk and control environment within area of responsibility and drive rectification as required. Handle customer issues, complaints and product enquiries on timely basis in accordance with established procedures. Ensure that Risk Management matters that are brought to attention are subject to direct remedial action and/or ensure adequate reporting to the relevant Risk Committees and/or line management. Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which the Group operates and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role. Ensure adherence with the highest standards of ethics and compliance with relevant polices, processes and regulations forms part of the culture. Participation in Local Client Committee and other relevant committees where applicable. Engage with all audit report findings and ensure feedback is acted upon. Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Support the business to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles, such as Fair Outcomes for Clients; Financial Crime Prevention; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Ideal Candidates Should Possess The Following Demonstrable and relevant experience of 8 - 15 years in the Private Banking industry commensurate with this remit and level of responsibility Strong ability to develop a network of target prospects Proven risk management capabilities Firm in all business guidelines and compliance issues Sound knowledge of financial markets and investment products Outstanding communication and presentation skills Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages .
