description: StackAdapt’s Inventory Partnerships team focuses on developing and leading strategic growth initiatives across our suite of programmatic advertising products within key inventory channels. In this role, you are responsible for identifying and spearheading solutions and services expansion opportunities for StackAdapt’s inventory channels and the development of the go-to-market strategies. This is a rare opportunity to impact a fast-growing, high-potential startup, with high visibility into StackAdapt’s Product, Operations, Customer, Engineering, Sales and Analytics teams.  As the Director of Inventory Partnerships, you will develop and grow relationships with supply partners, top-tier publishers, and media owners on a global scale to maximize StackAdapt’s inventory footprint. Our goal is to provide our clients with premium, high-performance programmatic inventory across all channels. You will work with internal and external stakeholders to identify supply opportunities that best suit our clients’ needs.  What You'll Be Doing Manage and grow our SSP/exchange relationships globally; evaluating new partners, integration upgrades and troubleshooting Execute the Inventory Partnerships roadmap to align with the company’s long-term strategy, while complying with industry standards and applicable government regulations Create business requirements, build proposals and work with internal/external teams to ensure successful execution of projects Gather market and customer information from clients and supply partners to provide feedback on programmatic trends and industry initiatives Maintain and document knowledge of key supply and publisher offerings, from technical specs to roadmaps Provide internal training on all things publisher and supply-related We'll Be Reaching Out To Applicants That Have Bachelor’s degree in business, a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience 6+ years of online advertising experience required, ideally working with DSP, SSP, or publishers Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail Proven track record of building partnerships by forging a strong relationship with vendors, understanding their objectives and recommending best practices Track record of successfully managing strategic and operationally complex projects with cross-functional teams Impeccable business judgment, along with an inclination to formulate hypotheses, design tests, and use problem-solving techniques to evaluate solutions StackAdapters Enjoy Competitive salary Work from home reimbursements Coverage and support of personal development initiatives (conferences, courses, etc) An awesome parental leave policy A friendly, welcoming, and supportive culture Our social and team events (virtually!) About StackAdapt  StackAdapt is a self-serve programmatic advertising platform used by the most exceptional digital marketers. This state-of-the-art platform is where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience. Ad buyers plan, execute, and manage data-driven digital advertising campaigns across all devices, inventory, and publisher partners.StackAdapt is a Top 100 Software Product on G2, being the only DSP on the Best Software Products and Highest Satisfaction lists.  We've been recognized for our high performing campaign conversion rates, award-winning customer service, and innovation by numerous industry publications including:  Great Place to Work® named StackAdapt as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces for Start-ups in 2021  A leader in the DSP, Video and Cross-Channel Advertising Categories on G2  A Top Growing Company in Canada based on the Globe and Mail's 2020 Business Report  Named 23rd in Deloitte Canada’s Technology Fast 50™ program  Named in Deloitte Technology's Fast 500 in North America  StackAdapt is a diverse and inclusive team of collaborative, hardworking individuals trying to make a dent in the universe. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are happy to work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process. We welcome and encourage anyone and everyone to apply.

The Impact You Will Have Achieve team Gross & Net Retention targets for platform usage and revenue Grow platform usage, prevent churn, and partner with the sales team in up-selling our accounts Manage customer accounts through a defined maturity model Help resolve customer concerns Develop and oversee team programs Analyze operational processes, escalation procedures and perform training needs assessments for identifying opportunities for service delivery improvements and contribution to the customer/clients Hire and manage Customer Success Engineers to achieve team and our goals Act in a supportive manager capacity, including handling escalations, mentoring team members, building a career path for them. Develop standard operating procedures for efficient team operations Billable Project Management - serve in a billable Project Manager role for strategic customer engagements Improve the customer experience - customer onboarding process improvements, improve adoption and stickiness Improve SFDC process around reporting  What We Look For 5+ years of successful experience managing customer success programs, leading a team, and driving net retention Minimum 5 years individual contributor experience as a CSM or related discipline that will allow you to act in a supportive manager capacity with the CSE's that report to you. Experience with business value consulting; drive renewals and upsells in accounts Experience building and running a team of Customer Success Engineers / Managers across APJ Problem solving ability, especially related to customer escalations Design and implement a project schedule, and able to handle multiple urgent priorities Motivated with a track record of customer engagement Organized and analytical, can work in a team environment Outstanding communication and customer relationship skills Excellent organization skills and ability to multitask in a fast paced startup environment Experience with Big Data technologies, including any of: Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc. Demonstrated obsession with attention to detail, and communication of details Experience with Databricks products and the Spark ecosystem Experience translating customer requirements and converting them into customer training plans Experience using CRM systems (preferably Salesforce) Software engineering experience Bachelor's degree in computer science Some travel required  Benefits Private hospital plan and extras coverage Life, disability and income protection coverage Superannuation Equity awards Paid parental leave Gym reimbursement Annual personal development fund Work headphones reimbursement Business travel insurance  About Databricks  Want to help speed the development of medical breakthroughs? Make the next mode of transportation a reality? Or discover ways to reverse climate change? We're on a mission to help data teams solve the world's toughest problems. The opportunity is huge and Databricks has emerged as a leader. Thousands of enterprises — including Comcast, Virgin Hyperloop and H&M — already rely on us to power their businesses and we're just getting started. Now it's your turn - join us to grow your career and make an impact with some of the brightest minds in the industry.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. description: MiRXES is a Singapore-headquartered molecular diagnostic company with R&D, manufacturing, and clinical lab operations in Singapore, USA, Japan, and China. We specialize in microRNA technologies and the development, manufacturing, and provision of diagnostic test kits and clinical services. Our mission is to enable early disease detection and provide insights for better patient care by harnessing the power of microRNA to augment traditional testing. Our vision is to be the world’s leading developer and provider of accurate, actionable, and affordable microRNA-powered diagnostic tests.  JJob Summary: Product management team of MiRXES acts as the central coordinator in translating customer and market needs to winning products. The product managers are the subject matter expert and CEO of the products responsible. This role will report to VP of Product.  Roles and Responsibilities: Be the champion of the products responsible: genomic sequencing projects. Responsible for product planning and launch, including product lifecycle management, gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining product vision, working closely with R&D team to develop winning products, with manufacturing team in ensuring product transfer from R&D team and with sales team in successful launch of products within timeline. Responsible for product marketing, including product core positioning and message, marketing content generation and refinement. Work closely with sales, marketing and support teams to ensure customer and revenue satisfaction goals are met. Be the subject matter expert of products and projects responsible and competition. Propose overall budget for projects and project plans with checkpoints. Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders in delivering project results on time. Provide timely update to management team on the progress and roadblocks and propose solutions to address issues. Establish and manage a team of product managers under the business unit when need arises.  Desired Skills and Competencies Degree in the field of life/biological/medical sciences. Postgraduate is preferred. 5 years’ experience in the field of genomics. Hands-on experience with NGS and/or TGS is preferred. Demonstrated ability to work with tight timelines. Excellent communication and presentation skills, and ability to connect with people. Proven ability to influence cross-functional team Result oriented and good project management skills

description: Singtel, Asia’s leading communications technology group, provides an extensive range of telecommunications and digital services to millions of consumers and businesses across Asia, Australia, Africa and the USA. With over 140 years of innovation behind us, we continue to push boundaries in our networks and services, to enrich lives and transform businesses.  Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Our diverse business means you will enjoy unique opportunities and rewarding experiences to learn and grow your career in a dynamic industry.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  Singtel Enterprise has embarked on a self-disruptive transformation journey to proactively reinvent how it operates, communicates, coordinates, learns and makes decisions. By embedding transformation change elements within its DNA, it is able to not only be in sync with the rapidly evolving business situation, but also proactively stay a step ahead of the customers, its serves.  The Key Job Responsibilities Includes  This role of Lead Product Owner is a key leadership position focused on providing thought leadership in developing Singtel’s B2B next-generation digital channel for customer engagement across various Singtel products and services. Establishing vision, develop and maintain a prioritized product backlog, and execute on delivering impactful features for our enterprise customers via the product agnostic digital channel Leading execution of the vision working collaboratively with business and tech teams (UI/UX, developer and architect) to define the customer journeys, the digital channel for different enterprise customer segments and the online/mobile/offline journeys for customers Indentifying key enablers and systems to support the digital channel and roadmap for execution Preparing the initial draft product requirement document with impact metrics, and represent viewpoints in prioritization exercises with implementation team Ownership of the product launch for all our customer segments; conducts user acceptance tests, assists in framing and execution of test cases, and communicates post-launch feedback to business and product stakeholders Identify, analyses, and track metrics that inform the success of products features in driving digital sales and self help Collaborate with engineering, design and business owner to align on a digital channel strategy Prioritize use cases and features for development and manage trade-offs between differing business needs in product, sales and operations Re-invent the operating model of the business – products, sales and operations with the new digital channel The Successful Candidate Should Possess The Following Degree in Computer science or related technical field is ideal but not necessary At least 6-8 years of work experience in product management / product design / program management experience Experience in launching or running e-commerce or digital channel is a plus Significant experience with ethnographic research (quantitative and qualitative), divergent exploration, conceptual development and industrial design Cross-disciplinary overview of business functions such as marketing, sales, product and delivery and IT is a plus Basic understanding of SQL / UX design principles is helpful Strong project management skills with proven records of successful end-to-end project implementation Experience acting as product owners with thorough understanding of agile methodology Experience in vendor management and demonstrate ability to resolve disagreements Excellent commercial acumen with strong analytical and critical thinking Ability to build trust and promote collaboration among internal stakeholders Take ownership, resourceful and decisive with excellent influencing and interpersonal skills We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

description: We are looking for an Director of Delivery to join our Singapore Office. This position's core role is to act as an advocate for Happy Marketer in establishing close relationships with some of the largest brands in South-East Asia.  Roles And Responsibilities Establish a solid working relationship with multiple clients. Be the point of contact for all client requests, ensuring that briefs are met with quality and timeliness. Work collaboratively with delivery teams and subject matter experts to evaluate client needs regarding their objectives and goals. Working with the delivery team to be the first line of support in the running of accounts. Support delivery and sales team in cross-sells and upsells Willing to go the extra mile by proactively looking for opportunities that will surprise and delight your client. jobTitle: Senior VP, Head of Business Banking, High Net Worth and Travel Marketing,Personal Financial Services
description: About UOB  United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.  Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.  About The Department  The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.  Personal Financial Services  We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.  Job Responsibilities  Reporting to the Head of Group Retail Marketing, this position is responsible for providing Group High Net Worth segment, Business Banking and Travel Marketing leadership. This includes conceptualizing and driving the go-to-market strategy for the respective business segments’ key campaigns and initiatives and working closely with the business heads to achieve agreed yearly business targets.  The candidate will also oversee the respective in-country Business Banking Marketing leads (Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia and Vietnam) in developing the marketing strategy for the market’s product and portfolio initiatives. Work closely with Business Heads to understand their business strategies and translating them into executable go-to-market strategies and driving these strategies through to the markets Work closely with respective business segments’ Product, Portfolio, Sales, Operations, Compliance and Legal stakeholders to plan and design effective workflows in the implementation of marketing programs that drive customer acquisitions, leads generation and utilization Analyze and work closely with the Analytics and Channels teams for more effective customer targeting and marketing effectiveness metrics. Conceptualize and develop the customer value propositions (CVPs) and messaging for key strategic initiatives and campaigns Provide direction and guidance to creative agencies to develop and articulate CVPs that translate to effective communications, translated into a communication strategy for all customer touchpoints Plan media buying strategies for key strategic initiatives and work closely with media agencies in contract negotiations to ensure optimal media placements and reach Plan and monitor allocated marketing budgets and marketing initiatives to achieve agreed yearly business targets Monitor and track campaign performances and results to aid learnings for future campaigns and for best practice sharing Provide guidance on localisation of regional strategies and its implementation in-market Job Requirements At least 12 years of marketing &/or banking experience, experience in travel will be a bonus Degree in Communications, Marketing or Business Creative and resourceful in finding solutions Strong digital, content marketing background Strong branding/design sense with good business acumen Experienced in managing and working with senior leadership Tenacious and results-oriented with attention-to-details Excellent project and people management skills Good understanding of consumer/SME marketing is advantageous Some experience in a regional capacity will be an advantage Be a part of UOB Family  UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.  Apply now and make a difference.
industries: Banking and Financial Services

description: Next Level SG is a fast growing digital marketing agency that has completed more than 200 social media projects in the last 3 years. We have grown very quickly and are looking to scale up even more in the next 1-2 years. We have grown revenue by 100% - 300% per year for the last few years and we have plans to keep that growth rate for the next 2 years. We have capabilities that range from social media, live streaming and performance marketing on FB, IG and Google. We were 1 of the 3 agencies part of a national COVID initiative by ESG last year to help the retail sector. Role: Run and grow the company profitably and maintain the previous high growth of the company. Create clear, well planned strategies with the founder to grow market share and revenue Do business development at a high level for government or corporate deals. Manage and monitor sales team daily Create a manpower roadmap according to the growth needs of the company Be able to track and measure all staff and fire underperformers quickly to maintain a strong performance culture. Build and scale newer digital marketing departments like SEO, Website UIUX design, E-commerce and EDG consultancy. Rally the team around the direction set after discussion with the founder. Build recurring business revenue alongside high value projects Expected Results: Your ultimate goal will be to grow BOTH the revenue and the profitability of the company. This is the most important metric you will be measured and assessed by. You must be able to generate sales quickly from the time you enter the company by porting over proven strategies from your previous work experience. We are on a very high performance growth path; you must be able to achieve the highest standards of performance and work ethic. Requirements: 5-10 years of experience in leading and building a digital agency and teams. Have an expert level understanding of the agency business and growth strategies Proven track record in developing service offerings with strong unique selling propositions and being able to successfully generate sales consistently with those service offerings Track record with scaling a digital services business to at least $10 Million in annual revenue and running it profitably with high net margins. Very organized Extremely Meticulous Able to handle extremely challenging situations and the pressure of a high-performance culture Have frameworks to scale businesses Have a previous track record with winning deals Have experience with growing business development in a service company Connections to SME networks a big bonus Experience with building and leading a high-performance sales team Attractive remuneration and bonuses will be tied to the performance of the company

description: The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways — from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.  The RoleWe are seeking thought leaders, who have a passion for showing our customers a better way to solve their business challenges. As a Senior Principal Solution Consultant, you will approach customers and opportunities to communicate the cross-product solution offering from AT to pharma [life sciences] with the purpose to identify and develop new business opportunities and bring them to a close. You will partner with AspenTech sales teams during the sales cycle to lead in consultative discovery process with customers, craft a vision and roadmap of a solution that addresses customer requirements, identifying differentiated value capture potential, and an implementation/sustainment program for that solution. This involves maintaining a keen understanding of the AspenTech product strategy, value enablers, professional services and partner execution capabilities, and sales pipeline to drive opportunities where AspenTech solutions can bring significant business value to our customers and to AspenTech.  The Senior Principal Solution Consultant is responsible for delivering high quality solutions and business outcomes based on existing AspenTech products. Demonstrating deep knowledge of the solutions and offerings, capable of contributing to the design of a complete solution across the entire lifecycle of a project - from pre-sales through design and delivery of the solution – the Senior Principal Solution Consultant drives transformational results and realizes business strategy for AspenTech customers.  This is a customer facing role that requires self-motivated individuals with excellent business, industry and technical knowledge along with strong consultative and communication skills to position AspenTech solutions and services with our customers.Your Impact Develop industry and application specific solutions for the customer. This is a very client facing position that will have you leading value discovery customer sessions, assessing customer needs, and developing solutions. Build client specific solutions on the AspenTech platform using all the available tool options. Convincingly communicate AT message and handle discussions relating to this Be accepted as and relied on as trusted advisor for customer Determine and understand prospective client’s critical business issues in order to present and demonstrate AspenTech’s software capabilities as the best possible solution to win the business.Ability to recognize and formulate business opportunities, pain points and value propositions. Develop opportunity to close through consultative selling.Accountable to consult with customers and advise on the relevant AspenTech solutions, services and establish a credible value proposition. Develop robust recommendations, proposals and scope of work documents for AspenTech Consulting engagements while also identifying critical dependencies & gaps. Handle complex customer dialogue (multiple products, multiple business cases contributing to ROI) Handle complex customer engagements within AT by coordinating SC teams, product teams, services and other contributors and stakeholder. Develop & execute sales campaigns and plans together with the sales teams. Work with the Sales team to identify and qualify business opportunities, to identify key customer technical challenges and to develop solutions to meet the business needs. Proactively support pipeline development (e.g. marketing, account planning, awareness sessions, etc.) and sales execution (e.g. strategy for accounts and opportunities, including NCM conversion, deal models and BRP’s) in the assigned accounts and opportunities. Co-own the major accounts in the region with a lead SAM and be responsible for the overall account planning and execution. What You'll Need B.S. in Engineering/Science with 10 years of consultancy, pre-sales, or professional service experience Self-starter with team leadership experience Biomanufacturing industry experience, experience from pharma production, experience from validation (regulatory work) preferred Technical understanding, life science appreciation, consultative mindset and strong communication and collaboration skills. Strong understanding of drug development, commercialization and manufacturing processes, including regulatory challenges, and relevant trends (Digitalization, Data Integrity, Artificial Intelligence, Big data) Strong drive to solve customer problems and rapidly convert pipeline opportunities into closed deals Balance of business and technology acumen, including ability to articulate high-level technical solutions to business problems and the differentiated value those solutions can provide Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills, including ability to create clear observations, analysis and conclusions based on customer interviews and data

jobTitle: Regional Head - Climate & Sustainability, SE Asia
description: Formative Search has been mandated on a new search for a Regional Head of SE Asia, with an established and renowned European Consultancy that is engaged in the Sustainability and Climate Change space across the globe.  Our client has come to us with the goal of bringing someone on board who will expand their account base and ultimately their regional presence across the SE Asia region, based in the vibrant city of Singapore.  What will the Regional Head of Climate & Sustainability be doing? Create new business opportunities to grow the company’s business in South East Asia, and develop compelling proposals together with internal and external experts and consultants. Coordinate the offering process in terms of content and timeline, and provide inputs for the development of new tailor-made solutions.  Negotiate and finalise deals with new and existing clients and further monetize these accounts.  Coordinate deliverables with the implementation team, and meet and exceed clients' expectations.  Represent the company brand in client meetings, at conferences and trade shows, and understand client needs, gather market intelligence, and identify industry trends.  Build new and enhance established client relationships in South-East Asia.   What will the Regional Head of Climate & Sustainability look like? You should have at least a Bachelor’s Degree, ideally in Science or another relevant discipline. Have at least 10 years of proven business development and sales experience, and ideally n the fields of renewable energy, sustainable development and / or climate change.  Someone who can leverage their talents with innovative sustainability solutions and gain access to a broad client portfolio.  Show an entrepreneurial mindset, with a sense of responsibility and willingness to take initiative.  Strong track record in business development and key account management, with excellent communication and presentation skills.  Excellent team spirit, humility, and be able to align with dedicated and enthusiastic people.   This challenging position requires an enthusiastic and dynamic sustainability professional with relevant experience in business development, sales and client relationship management. This opportunity is truly unique as it provides the individual the ability to work in a growing global company with a real commitment to sustainability and fighting climate change. Contact me at adam@formativesearch.com if this is for you.
industries: Renewables & Environment, Oil & Energy, and Utilities

description: About The Company  MoneyWiseSmart Pte Ltd.  MoneyWiseSmart is an investment research and education business. Our subscribers are retail investors from all over the world, who aspire to take full control of every aspect of their investing journey. We offer a set of comprehensive investment education programs, which guide our subscribers on their journey towards financial freedom. In our Research Series offering, we publish deep dive research content on businesses which are long term compounders. Our Investing Fundamentals program provides a comprehensive step-by-step framework for identifying, analysing and building a portfolio of high quality businesses. In our Options Series program, we teach strategies for managing risk and enhancing cash returns from long term investment portfolios.  We are a young profitable company and we are very proud of our high caliber global team.  Website: https://moneywisesmart.com  YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCd9sDtO2IcgtiDs1K6oIJgg  Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/moneywisesmart  Digital Marketing Head/Manager: Job Description  The suitable candidate will join us as ‘Head of Marketing’ or ‘Marketing Manager’ depending upon the level of experience of the candidate.  The Digital Marketing Manager is the key person in charge of developing & owning the overall digital marketing strategy for the company. He/she is involved throughout the campaign ideation, planning, implementation, measurement, and optimisation process. It is therefore essential that he/she has hands-on experience using various digital marketing platforms.  The Digital Marketing Manager works closely with the research/content team and/or digital agencies to achieve specific company objectives such as; increasing sales, lead generation, brand engagement, and conversions. The Digital Marketing Manager reports to the Founders of the company.  Roles And Responsibilities Full ownership of the overall digital marketing strategy Implement marketing activities across a broad range of digital marketing channels (SEO, SEM, Social Media, Email, Mobile, Display) Manage and maintain the company’s media /SM assets (website, social media assets, email lists etc) Manage the creation (in coordination with the research/content team) of relevant and engaging digital content for publishing onto various digital platforms Manage social media marketing campaigns Manage digital advertising campaigns (SEM, Display, Social, Programmatic) Manage the end to end marketing funnels Set up conversion, pixel, and event tracking on the website and across various digital platforms Conduct research on market trends, brand’s audiences and competitors, and end-to-end consumer journey to drive engagements and conversions Analyze digital marketing analytics reports and share insights with the team to develop optimization plans Stay abreast of emerging digital tools and platforms, digital marketing trends, new technologies, and share insights with the rest of the team Salary Range  We offer a competitive salary and an attractive performance based upside.  Job Requirements The candidate needs to be a Singapore citizen/PR. We are looking for experienced candidates having a proven track record of a successful digital marketing role. The ideal candidate will be someone who posses a lot of ownership and can function independently Being familiar with the investing field is not a mandatory requirement, but it can definitely be a positive

description: At NTT we believe that by using innovative technology we can solve global challenges and create a world that is sustainable and secure. We are looking for curious people, from diverse backgrounds, that are keen to work in a fast-paced and agile environment.  At NTT we trust our employees to do the right thing, even when no one is watching, which is why we offer flexibility in the workplace. The majority of our roles are hybrid, meaning we encourage a balance of working from home and our local office. Ask our recruitment team if this is a hybrid role.  Want to be a part of our team?  The Senior Go-to-Market (GTM) Director is responsible for providing leadership, ideation and metric driven strategic direction for commercialisation and go-to-market plans for the assigned portfolio of products, including development of comprehensive launch strategies, campaigns and processes that execute against business goals to effectively reach our target audiences and customer segments.  They collaborate with senior leaders and take responsibility for creating business value for clients through our portfolio and the successful execution of the strategy within their product portfolio or assigned geography.  "Manages sales directly to end-users of the organization’s products or services in a large specified geographic area, or is responsible for a specific industry or product segment on a national or geographic basis. Incumbents at the Director and Senior Director level typically manage other sales managers."  Working at NTT  Key Roles And Responsibilities Leadership and oversight for annual overall strategic Go-To-Market (GTM) plan in the assigned geography and/or portfolio of products. Ensure go-to-market strategies for product launches and marketing programs are consistently implemented across customer segments at national, regional, and local levels. Ensure the implementation and execute the translation of Go-To-Market (GTM) strategies and plans into a detailed marketing plan with clear tactics and accountabilities assigned across the core GTM team within area of responsibility. Drive the translation of consumer needs into product requirements working with product management and development teams. Act as the evangelist and subject matter expert on go-to-market strategy and process in support of product launches, including planning and executing core product and new ventures product launches and merger or acquisition integration. Manage customer expectations and coordinate release and installation of marketing and promotional activities at product launch. Enhance product definition and positioning using competitive information, market and product analysis. Drive the execution of the marketing activities for a portfolio of complex products/services through their full life cycle. Develop and implement a process of go-to-market strategy and tactical execution for product launches, in collaboration with various functional areas. Lead complex projects from start to finish, including timeline development, identification of cross-functional dependencies, identification of key milestones and anticipation of challenges. Develop and deploy a GTM framework that provides a commercial blueprint for propositions launches. Drive and facilitate market research approach, methodology and integration of findings into product marketing department driving organizations go-to-market approach. Ensure the identification of opportunities to ensure customer satisfaction and retention levels are maintained at optimum levels. Lead cross-functional planning and budgeting against strategies to ensure successful achievement of relevant metric driven key performance indicators (KPI’s). Participate in and conduct regular business reviews to ensure compliance and governance in relation to contracted agreements with partners and alliances. Manage presales opportunities and implementation of the identified projects. Develop and manage the implementation of local policies and procedures and operating plans aligned to global strategy that will enable the achievement of the overall GTM strategy. Merge data driven market understanding with customer feedback to prioritize go to market strategies. Manage a team of managers and/or individual contributors and ensure performance goals are constantly reviewed and achieved. Support leadership in developing and executing against our long-term strategic plans. Knowledge, Skills And Attributes Broad knowledge of the business and products Advanced knowledge of strategy development, market planning, scenario planning, and market modeling Strategic agility and critical thinking skills combined with solid business judgment Ability to develop process and implement go to market strategies through results oriented integrated marketing programs and promotions Responsive, professional persona; establishing relationships through demonstrated ability to build trust Ability to lead and build collaborative teams through strong coaching and mentoring skills with a strong sense of accountability Conduct business with a high level of ethical standards and integrity Demonstrated excellence in strategic and organizational planning, time management, and organizational skills Strong drive for results through solution-oriented decision-making and customer focus Ability to manage expectations of customers with resourcefulness and composure A “can do” solution-oriented and professional demeanor that allows you to respond strategically and thoughtfully, while meeting the demands of a fast-paced work environment Patience in driving change and navigating successfully within many functional areas of the business Demonstrated excellence in strategic and organizational planning, time management, and organizational skills Solid executive presence and ability to manage across all levels in the organization Academic Qualifications And Certifications Master’s degree in business or marketing Relevant certifications Experience Required Significant experience with demonstrated achievement in leading go to market strategies and product marketing initiatives to meet goals and objectives Demonstrated relevant experience in a pre-sales/sales role Extensive years direct supervisory/management experience leading a team of individual contributors and managers Demonstrated related corporate, market, and business strategy experience with thorough knowledge of the health industry with emphasis on: Management and broad business experience across functional areas Proven track record in crafting compelling positioning and thought leadership content What will make you a good fit for the role?  Standard Career Level Descriptor For Job Level Directs/controls one or more functional areas through senior managers who are assigned to those areas Develops policies / processes and approves implementation Has in-dept knowledge of organisation / functional area which allows for innovative concepts and ideas Provides operational direction across various areas, groups, and/or operations Seen as influential leader Works with abstract situations / ideas across functional areas Can assess abstract situations / ideas and give direction across major functional areas Mistakes has long-term impact on organisation’s success Negotiates internally and externally at executive level; negotiates on critical matters Influences policy-making Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.  Equal opportunity employer  NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category. jobTitle: Regional Controller, Middle East, and Asia
description: MacGregor shapes the offshore and marine industries by offering world-leading engineering solutions and services with a strong portfolio of MacGregor, Hatlapa, Porsgrunn, Pusnes and Triplex brands. Shipbuilders, owners and operators are able to optimise the lifetime profitability, safety, reliability and environmental sustainability of their operations by working in close cooperation with us.  Purpose of the position  You will serve as Business Partner of Region Vice President driving sales and service operational excellence in the Region, dealing with both the investment (cost and hours) and the outcome (quotation hit rate, sales growth, share of customers’ wallet and profitability). You will also coordinate internal control and risk management activities of the spare parts business in the Singapore Principal Company and any adjacent GSD businesses start-ups (SaaS, EaaS contracts) in close cooperation with the Profit Center Controllers.  Key Tasks And Responsibilities Lead (virtual) team of area controllers in the Region Support region management in: implementation GSD strategy and corporate strategic initiatives according to Hoshin Kanri methodology tactical decision making about market development including planning of account sales, pricing, preparation of business cases and participation in customer negotiations (sales campaigns, package deals, service contracts, etc.) steering performance of sales and service operations by determining financial and non-financial targets and measuring the outcome with regular frequency and investigating root-cause of any deviations Driving cost optimization initiatives in the Region including coordination of cost planning, forecasting and analysis of variances Support Profit Center controllers in forecasting market growth (potential), market share (or gap-to-potential) and profitability by product and customer segments in the Region Monitor quality of and compliance with internal controls and risk management activities in the Region Monitor quality of and compliance with internal controls and risk management activities in the Principal Company, including foreign currency risk management Prepare periodic and ad hoc management reports Support internal development projects including integration of new M&A What You’ll Need To Succeed  Education University degree in Accounting, Finance or equivalent Experience Minimum five years experience in controller role in an international B2B environment, preferably in after-sales Minimum three years experience in leading (small) team of professionals Competencies Customer-focused and result-driven Business acumen and commercial affinity Analytical and problem-solving skills Solid knowledge of finance and control (cost accounting, IFRS and performance management) Knowhow of risk management, internal controls and process compliance Project planning and management skills Communication and presentation skills Ability to build rapport cross-functionally and comfortable to work in “virtual” teams Willingness to travel abroad regularly Fluent in both written and spoken English You Will Be Part Of  We offer you an opportunity to put your skills and experience to work and make an impact in our global organisation. You will work together with great colleagues from various backgrounds inspired by shared, ambitious goals. We value collaboration in our open and inclusive culture. With us, you will have the opportunity to develop yourself professionally. Join us to make a difference - and have fun while doing it.  Interested to join?  If you are excited about this opportunity, click on Apply Now and send us your updated CV and expected salaries  MacGregor is part of Cargotec  MacGregor shapes the offshore and marine industries by offering world-leading engineering solutions and services with a strong portfolio of MacGregor, Hatlapa, Porsgrunn, Pusnes and Triplex brands. Shipbuilders, owners and operators are able to optimise the lifetime profitability, safety, reliability and environmental sustainability of their operations by working in close cooperation with MacGregor.  MacGregor solutions and services for handling marine cargoes, vessel operations, offshore loads,crude/LNG transfer and offshore mooring are all designed to perform with the sea. www.macgregor.com  MacGregor is part of Cargotec. Cargotec's (Nasdaq Helsinki: CGCBV) sales in 2020 totalled approximately EUR 3.3 billion and it employs around 11,500 people. www.cargotec.com

description: CRM Product Owner (2 years local contract)  Looking for a Product Owner to lead a CRM system blueprint definition and delivery. You'll be taking ownership of a portfolio of key systems, and you'll be driving a roadmap in line with strategic goals of the company.  This is a two year contract role, with a salary range of $7000-8000. Only available to Singaporeans at this time.  The Responsibilities Development and implementation of a product strategy in line with company digital transformation initiatives Build and prioritize a product roadmap and backlog Define product requirements and manage partnerships with regional and HQ stakeholders Lead sprint and backlog refinement meetings with development teams Drive implementation of regional marketing and sales use cases Enforce standardization of product across the region in collaboration with central CRM team. Engage in sales process design and challenge the current way of thinking in order to create an optimal customer user journey Qualifications Experience with Product Ownership and driving process improvements Past experience working in a CRM environment, with a particular focus in driving business value Previous experience working with Salesforce Service, Sales and Marketing cloud Know how in implementing automated marketing journeys A bonus if you have past experience in developing an automotive direct sales model blueprint Ability to write effective user stories with clear acceptance criteria focused on business value Please send your resume in WORD format by clicking the apply button below or contact Ronald Cheung on +65 6701 1521 for a confidential discussion. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.CEI Reg. Number R2090722 (Cheung Ronald).  Apply now

description: Company Description  Shopify has redefined commerce, raising the standard for how companies of all sizes sell their products and services online and off. With 1,000,000+ merchants in more than 175 different countries and the best platform on the market, we continue to grow rapidly while constantly looking for new ways to impact and disrupt markets.  Shopify’s mission is to make commerce better for everyone. From building a new product feature for our commerce platform, to helping a merchant troubleshoot an issue over the phone, we want to empower our ecosystem through our work.  Having a unified vision, a north star, is vitally important to ensure that we are all headed in the same direction. No matter the size or experience, we want to power every merchant’s experience. This is why we’re all here.  Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations across where Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere  Job Description  We’re looking for a Director of Product Management to join our channels team within merchant services. Your goal is to drive Shopify’s growth through top marketing and sales channels across social, search and entertainment destinations. This means driving revenue growth for Shopify merchants across these channels by helping them promote and sell their products multi-channel and - most importantly - the value merchants get out of Shopify. You’ll own the strategy and execution, leading product and working closely with marketing, engineering, UX, and commercial teams to build and optimize across channels.  In this role, you will be responsible for setting the product strategy for Shopify channels product across the largest social and entertainment destinations in the world, and executing on it. You will be responsible for leading, inspiring and influencing a team of engineers, UX designers, and product managers to execute on your vision of growth.  We’re looking for a domain expert who is passionate about the future of commerce, and an exceptional leader who can build high-performing teams, set and hold high standards, and invest in their team’s development and success.  Responsibilities Be accountable for building products that drive and optimize growth for Shopify’s Merchants via third party channels Drive the product vision and strategy to help merchants discover the most effective marketing and sales channels to reach new buyers, and grow their business Provide mentorship and leadership to your team as they execute on your vision for partnerships Make it happen, by launching new product features to market, thereby driving value to Shopify’s merchants Hire the best people to grow your team as the needs of the business evolve. Work effectively across internal and external stakeholders, including S/VPs of Product in external partner organisations, to deliver on shared objectives and KPIs Create a culture of high-performance, creativity, and continual learning on your team Collaborate across teams within Shopify to ensure that products are built for the long term Using data to inform your product roadmap You Need Experience 12+ years of experience in product management or allied domains Extensive product management experience and leadership in a fast-paced company where things can change quickly. Technical and have built platforms and foundational products at scale to serve diverse customers, and have owned product life cycle from conception to launch to market fit Comfort diving deep into the data to understand opportunities to increase visibility and value for Shopify’s merchants on partner platforms A highly collaborative approach with excellent stakeholder management skills, capable of building and powering your “trust battery” with the team and fellow leaders. You build great teams, inspire your people, and have a long list of high performers who want to be on your team. The ability to zoom in and zoom out. Leading at Shopify requires the range to be deep in the weeds with your team, while also seeing and communicating the big picture to our exec team and stakeholders. Multi-disciplinary experience - you have the ability to lead and influence designers, developers, marketers, and customers in an agile environment A desire to own and deliver on a number. You are used to being accountable for a target and know how to consistently deliver. Nice to have Demonstrate thought leadership capabilities and a strong ability to think and communicate strategically on the future of commerce SaaS product experience Experience in large global organizations and smaller startups Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

In addition, be able to drive innovation and continuous improvement, be proactive with process and technology change adoption, and execute against business unit goals and objectives.  Requirements At least 12 years of operations experience within the asset management, financial sales or service industry with a preference for private markets. Ability to lead and manage cross-functional teams Strategic mindset with operational experience and expertise Manage multiple and competing priorities, drive to decisions and deliver results consistently Strong technical and business acumen Excellent communication and presentation skills Please send me a copy of your cv in MSWord to phoebe.ling@principle-partners.com for a confidential discussion.

description: Overview Of Job  Mindshare is visionary and a leader in setting best practices in the industry. We aim to keep leading in this space and to demonstrate expertise in this space through one of our key accounts.  This Supply specialist role is critical to achieving that by driving and scaling SPO (Supply Path Optimization) as a practice across markets to deliver value back to the client  This requires the Supply Specialist to the have the following set of skills: evangelizing their products, assessing competition, defining vision, and collaborating with Ad tech partners, operations, and marketing to drive the successful delivery and adoption of their platform. In addition, they would have good understanding of programmatic ads ecosystem from advertisers’ perspective and would have already launched and scaled advertising products for the buyers.  3 Best Things About The Job Dynamic - As part of a team at the forefront of all things digital, you will be directly involved in shaping the future of this business in this fast-changing programmatic industry. Great work culture - You will work with a diverse and collaborative group of co-workers passionate about digital media that know how to have fun at the same time. Flexibility and Empowerment - We appreciate colleagues who are tinkerers and problem solvers, those who think outside the box and contribute to new ways of working. Measures of success -  In Three Months, You Would Have Built up a thorough understanding of Unilever’s programmatic ecosystem and the Supply Path Optimization framework Good understanding of Unilever’s inventory partnerships and how they work Formed an understanding of the client’s marketing strategy across the region. Established working relationships with SSP & DSP partners Become familiar with the processes within Mindshare and within your team including using GroupM admin, media and finance software. In Six Months, You Would Manage initiatives, projects and pilots for deployment across the region Supervising and guiding markets across inventory and supply-related queries, and facilitate training where necessary. Assist with identifying problems and troubleshooting for local markets Working closely with programmatic partners (DSPs, SSPs and Inventory Partners) to build/identify customised solutions for deployment across campaigns. Thorough understanding of Unilever’s inventory partnerships and how they work In 12 Months, You Would Have Conceptualized and recommended initiatives & pilots for deployment across the region Have a clear strategy for inventory and supply partnerships in the region Proposed new ways of working and process improvements across all work streams Proven yourself as a reliable POC for client stakeholders Established a strong level of trust among junior members of the team Responsibilities Of The Role Supply Strategy: Develop a strategy on how to regionally manage supply partners that deliver value while meeting client KPIs. Constantly meet and evaluate new partners as needed. Focus on identifying and growing supply for the client when it comes to video, display, native, etc. Identify and cultivate relationships with supply partners, piloting new initiatives and evaluating the performance of these initiatives. Manage internal stakeholders in line with opportunity to exceed advertiser KPI expectations through use of efficient supply strategies Build best practices across supply management within the region; establish benchmarks and learnings which are measurable Responsible for market roll-out & capability building across local markets. Produce quarterly reports on market, industry and adoption rates for management team measuring the business value of the strategy. Operations: Ensure all technology partners are integrated seamlessly across campaigns Develop a process workflow to streamline operations across multiple parties - trading team, local Mindshare team, technology partners, etc. Build best practices across trading and operations within the region; establish benchmarks and learnings which are measurable Constantly meet with, evaluate, and test new technology partners, data and supply vendors as needed Support, manage and ensure high quality output from local supply leads who are responsible for end-to-end campaign management & governance. Responsible for market roll-out & capability building agenda across local markets. Oversee day to day relationship and communication with client & partners, as well as with local Mindshare teams Platform Strategy & Development - Develop supply pillars for the Trade desk and practically deploy into day-to-day workflows, including but not limited to: Operations - Working with the local markets & regional clients to review, develop and put in place improvements in the operational capabilities, workflows or new technology of the Trade Desk. Efficiency - Working with the trading team to identify and put into practice performance efficiencies in the established working process. Insights - Working with the internal data team to generate regional supply insights and POVs to share at scale across the local markets. What You Will Need 7+ year experience in product management, product strategy, Experience in digital advertising landscape (ad servers, SSPs, RTB, PMP, DSPs, DMPs) Deep understanding of supply side of advertising ecosystem Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently Experience in building and managing products from ideation to launch working with a remote engineering team. Deep knowledge of product development dynamics and go-to-market tactics. Comfortable with agile product development and collaborating with multiple teams to deliver product features that are dependent on other product teams Ability to articulate and influence other product teams to help them see the value of problem we are solving and get necessary buy-in Experience partnering cross-functionally with teams spanning across sales/operations, product, engineering, marketing, customer success. Self-motivated individual with strong communication (written and verbal), leadership, judgment, planning, and decision-making skills. Demonstrated prior success within a startup culture, bringing cross-functional projects to closure About Mindshare  Mindshare, the global media agency network, and part of WPP, the largest marketing communications network in the world, has more than 7,000 employees, in 116 offices across 86 countries.  Each office is dedicated to forging competitive marketing advantage for businesses and their brands based on the values of speed, teamwork and provocation. Mindshare’s network of people are acutely aware of what's happening in their city, and believe all great communication begins and ends in media.  In 2014 Mindshare Asia Pacific was the only media agency to be ranked in the top ten in Campaign Asia’s Most Admired Companies survey, and was also seen as the best agency to work at in the region.  Mindshare APAC has won over 250 awards in the past year - and counting, including the 'Campaign Asia Pacific Agency of the Year, 2013' and the SMARTIES™ APAC ‘Agency Network of the Year 2014’ for the second consecutive year. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com  About GroupM Singapore  GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.  GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity - it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: About The Company  StaffAny’s mission is to shape and empower the future of work. We provide our users with a remedy that streamlines and automates their painful Operations and HR processes. Our users rely on our superpowers to understand their frustrations, and we are here to empower them to make time for what they love.  About The Role  The Head of Marketing, Demand Generation will be a key member of our team, responsible for driving the company’s revenue growth and providing consistently high-quality Leads and SQLs. As one of the key leaders in the marketing department, you will own all aspects of demand generation, working closely with members of the leadership, sales, and marketing teams. This is a great opportunity for candidates who want to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment, make a big impact and win as a team to scale a growing business. You must want to build the best SAAS marketing team in SEA. You will be the first marketing leader in the team. This position directly reports to the CRO.  You are Passionate about demand generation A firm believer in data and a results-driven approach to marketing. Growth mindset with bold ideas, know-how attitude to get things done, and a results-driven approach to work (testing, measuring, iterating). Constantly up to date with Marketing funnel frameworks and tactics. Self-starter with the ability to drive projects from start to ﬁnish, including being a data-driven thinker who uses insights and analysis to guide strategies, experiment, learn and improve. Have excellent skills in deciding how to handle and allocate Marketing budget Demonstrated success and track record in demand generation ROI and revenue targets including demonstrated proﬁciency with multiple formats of demand generation, including but not limited to webinars, email, web, account-based, content, and digital marketing. Proven Marketing track records to bring a company to 5 million ARR 5-8 years of experience in demand generation in a high-growth b2b Saas startup, result-driven, and fast-paced marketing environments 3 years of management experience Experienced in building and managing a marketing team from 1 to 5 Prior experience in sourcing and managing agencies to achieve revenue goals Strong experience in demand generation and understands product marketing. (Bonus) Experience with regional/global markets (Bonus) Experienced in HR/ Productivity solutions for the F&B/Retail/ blue-collar industry. (Bonus) Experience driving enterprise demand for a freemium/free trial SAAS business You will find yourself Demand Generation Build and execute end-to-end campaigns that create demand and accelerate opportunities (Some examples, but not limited to, includes: funnel optimization, content, SEO, paid media, email, events, ABM, customer marketing etc..) Managing SEO and PR agencies to achieve desired SQLs and Revenue goals Strategy Able to devise demand generation campaigns to drive MQLs and SQLs required to achieve the company’s growth goals. This would include Building an entire content marketing strategy, align it with the customer journey and SEO strategy, set KPIs and ways to measure them. Perform industry and competitive analysis to inform the sales process and help to position and messaging Data Reporting Own marketing attribution models and continually analyse the effectiveness of all demand-generating marketing channels to determine which efforts to scale or adjust. Identify opportunities to improve marketing effectiveness through better audience segmentation (industries, roles), marketing techniques, and processes. Lead the management of our marketing automation stack (HubSpot, Google Analytics, Segment etc..). Manage and maintain a base of high quality leads within the CRM In charge of the customer lifecycle Management & Collaboration Managing and nurturing the marketing team to its full potential, driving initiatives and mentoring their growth. Work closely with leadership and sales teams. Build a consistent feedback loop to improve and optimise the lead hand-off process with outbound sales team. Partner product management to take a holistic view of StaffAny’s Freemium/Free trial to paid customer conversion. The offer As the first senior hire in the marketing department, you get to define the processes and culture of the team. Craft and refine a multi-region marketing playbook. Experiment, learn and iterate! A front-row seat at a hypergrowth startup as we scale to 5m in ARR. Work closely with the founders and other senior management as we craft our strategy and forge the future of hourly work. Be part of a fast-paced growth environment that always stretches you and forces you to be slightly uncomfortable. Work with talented, intense and motivated colleagues in a dynamic and vibrant environment. Apply to us here: https://www.staffany.com/careers

description: Singapore  Join our team as a Senior Director, Demand Facilitation Lead - Asia in Singapore.  We’re Magnite (NASDAQ: MGNI), the world’s largest independent sell-side advertising platform. Publishers use our technology to monetize their content across all screens and formats including OTT, CTV, online video, display, and audio. The world's leading agencies and brands trust our platform to access brand-safe, high-quality ad inventory and execute billions of advertising transactions each month. In April 2021, we acquired SpotX to further enhance our CTV business and better help our clients in this rapidly growing market. Anchored in Singapore, Indonesia, Japan, Sydney, Los Angeles, New York City, Denver, London, Magnite has offices across North America, EMEA, LATAM, and APAC.  The Senior Director, Demand Facilitation Lead - Asia, will be responsible for building and leading the Demand Facilitation team in Asia, with a focus on forming strategic demand-side relationships with the leading media agencies, buying/planning/strategy teams, agency trading teams, DSPs and other strategic buyers in Asia.  Here's What You'll Be Doing Build, train, lead and motivate a sales consultative team across the Asia region. Set the strategy and focus for the team to continue to drive accelerated growth and leading customer service. Manage and understand relationships with buyers across video, display, DOOH and audio ecosystem. Partner with the Magnite supply and demand operations teams, marketing, product and partnerships teams. Evolve & Evangelize all buying techniques utilized through our programmatic and managed service infrastructure to ad buyers Help to build out the business by creating workflows and communicating new process to the sales team Create unique and customized partnership offerings for high profile agency ad buyers Creatively market new publisher inventory to ad buyer network Evaluate the rapidly evolving ad tech ecosystem for new ideas/opportunities to guide the company's business strategy and growth for said holding company Forecast monthly, quarterly & annual revenue for management Meet/exceed quarterly & annual revenue quotas Operates effectively within a global company, soliciting feedback on key accounts from other markets and reciprocating appropriately to ensure effective collaboration. Captures product features required to bring on new business, delivering revenue cases that can be used to aid prioritization. Effectively & proactively communicate strategy and solutions to account team and management. Partner with Asia marketing teams to develop out and attract partner involvement within press releases, case studies, thought leadership, business social sharing and custom events. Be an active and positive presence within the Magnite Asia team Act as subject matter expert internally and externally for programmatic buying and selling of online media. Provide input to Management that helps shape team policies and processes. Travel time expected to be 20-30% of time (subject to new business travel norms) Perform other related duties as assigned by management Qualifications & Experience 13+ years of experience in the online digital space working with DSPs, Agency Trading Desks, Agencies and Brands. Intimate familiarity with online video advertising and the video lumascape. Must have a strong ability to present to small and large groups, including industry events. Effectively engage in detailed conversations with clients of all seniority levels. Successful partnership relations within Agencies: including C-suite, Heads of Digital, Trading Directors and Client leads. Senior connections across DSPs, Trading desks and leading regional brands. Ability to understand/present complex products and deal structures. Desire to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth, and technical environment. Proven track record in selling and leading sales teams in Asia. Bachelor’s degree, MBA preferred. Previous experience working within senior agency roles preferred. Based in Singapore, with 6+ years’ experience in APAC. Here's What We Are Looking For Bachelor's Degree (BA) from four-year college or university, or one to two years of related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Superior interpersonal and communications skills (written and spoken) High level of emotional intelligence Strong presentation and negotiating skills Creative problem solving Works well under pressure, in a fast-paced environment and meets deadlines Nimble and adaptable in work ethic Highly collaborative with other internal team members and salespeople Assertive, ambitious and highly driven to succeed type of attitude Growth mindset Professional, ethical and organized Additional Details We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other federal, state or local protected class. Perks/Benefits: Equity and Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Pension and Retirement Savings Plan in Several Countries, Comprehensive Healthcare Benefits for You and Your Family, Generous Time Off, Holiday Breaks and Summer Fridays, Family-Focused Leave Benefits, and Cell Phone Subsidy Invest in You: Performance Management, and Investment in Diversity Initiatives, Bonusly Peer-to-Peer Recognition Program, Turning Recognition into Tangible Perks and Magnite Swag, Community Service Events, Wellness Coach—Meditate and Recharge with an Unlimited User Account for You and a Plus One COVID-19 Precautions: remote interview process, virtual onboarding for ne Posted 25 Days Ago Full time R-1907894  Magnite was born in 2020 when the programmatic ad pioneers at Rubicon Project teamed up with the CTV experts at Telaria. To accelerate our CTV ambitions, we acquired CTV leader SpotX and ad management platform SpringServe in 2021. Now, Magnite is the industry’s largest scaled, independent CTV/video ad platform. Though CTV and video are now as important to Magnite as ever, we remain committed to our roots as an omnichannel SSP. Thousands of publishers around the globe rely on our technology to sell advertising on their terms and across every channel and format—including CTV, desktop, mobile, and audio. Likewise, we help the world’s leading agencies and brands reach millions of consumers efficiently, safely, and while respecting their privacy. The Magnite team is made up of hundreds of people across North America, EMEA, LATAM, and APAC, and our stock is traded on NASDAQ as MGNI.
