jobTitle: Consulting Director - Energy Transition/ Power Renewables
description: Company Description  Wood Mackenzie is the global leader in data, analysis and consulting across the energy, chemicals, metals, mining, power and renewables sectors.  Founded in 1973, our success has always been underpinned by the simple principle of providing trusted research and advice that makes a difference to our customers. Today we have over 2,000 customers ranging from the largest global energy companies and financial institutions to governments as well as smaller market specialists.  Our teams are located around the world. This enables us to stay closely connected with customers and the markets and sectors we cover. Collectively this allows us to offer a compelling combination of global commodity analysis with detailed local market knowledge.  We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We are committed to creating a workplace that works for you and encourage everyone to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join.  Hear what our team has to say about working with us:  https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/  We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!  At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.  But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.  It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.  At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fourth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.  Job Description  Job Description  Role Purpose  The Head of Energy Transition Consulting APAC (Asia Pacific) will lead the growth of the Energy Transition Consulting practice within the APAC region. With a key focus on developing and managing the relationship with key clients, the role requires a combination of solid knowledge of the Power & Renewables space as well as the wider Energy Transition dynamics.  The role requires strong business winning capabilities, project direction on consulting mandates, leadership management as well as wider development of the growing Energy Transition consulting team within the region. The role is high-profile both internally and externally and influential in Wood Mackenzie achieving its goals globally.  Main Responsibilities  Business Development Retain and increase Energy Transition consulting revenues as well as improving the profitability of Wood Mackenzie consulting projects and multi-client studies Develop networks and relationships that lead to a deep understanding of clients’ needs and therefore future consulting requirements Pro-actively maintain a high-level of client interaction across the region, with a specific focus on key clients, to source and develop strong relationships and a solid, repeatable, profitable consulting business Support the targeting, prioritization and engagement of clients in APAC to develop a platform for Energy Transition consulting activities Promote best practice in terms of business development across the Energy Transition consulting group Review all pitches to ensure quality, appropriate pricing, etc. Work with project manager to scope and write pitches People and Thought Leadership Build and maintaining the appropriate internal network (across consulting, research and client management) to deliver the best possible outcome for both Wood Mackenzie and its clients Motivate and develop staff, improving our understanding of the challenges faced by our key clients Generate innovative ideas and approaches to industry issues, both within particular assignments and to the research and consulting practice, focusing on APAC and its role within the global industry Work closely with the global Energy Transition practice group to promote best practice in our existing offerings and take a key role in the future development of the consulting offering Support the engagement of the Energy Transition research teams with our internal sales/marketing teams to make sure the interests of the APAC client base is captured internally Team Management Recruit and manage the growing APAC-based Energy Transition consulting practice (Currently a team of 3) Work closely with research teams and ensure consistent and good working relationships exist, providing a mentoring role for research and sales & account management colleagues who have a different reporting line Work closely with the other regional sector leads to ensure alignment of the consulting practice regarding existing and planned commitments Ensure tight control of project pipeline and proper resource management with strong communication with the research team Ensure development of consulting skills and processes across the team Project Direction Actively participate in client mandates working with team and clients to ensure high quality and insightful results for both Energy Transition research and consulting Improve the operational process for the life cycle of consulting assignments and ensure processes are embedded across broader research and consulting team members Ensure commitments to the client can be met and that pitching activity is aligned with business strategy Manage client expectations Qualifications  Knowledge & Experience  Skills  Candidates who can demonstrate the following skills and abilities will excel in this role  The VP Energy Transition Consulting is highly commercial combining analytical rigor, acute problem solving and the skills to motivate and guide a team of talented Energy Transition consultants. The individual will excel at nurturing client relationships and ensuring quality solutions that endeavour to exceed our client's expectations. A focus on Energy Transition and a thorough understanding of the trends and drivers that are shaping the Energy industry, particularly its commercial aspects An intellectual curiosity and drive to explore and address our client's challenges. A service mind-set and the ability to build relationships with senior decision makers. Superior people management and leadership skills in order to hone and utilise diverse talents within our team. Motivating our team through example is ideal – in terms of intellectual drive and curiosity, service excellence and a focus on work-life balance. Experience within consulting with a strong knowledge of consulting processes is important and a proven track record of growing business within the energy/consulting space is preferable. Core Competencies Client focused Continuous improvement Building and maintaining relationships Providing leadership Additional Information  Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.  All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html  Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.  Consumer Privacy Notice

description: CRM Product Owner (2 years local contract)  Looking for a Product Owner to lead a CRM system blueprint definition and delivery. You'll be taking ownership of a portfolio of key systems, and you'll be driving a roadmap in line with strategic goals of the company.  This is a two year contract role, with a salary range of $7000-8000. Only available to Singaporeans at this time.  The Responsibilities Development and implementation of a product strategy in line with company digital transformation initiatives Build and prioritize a product roadmap and backlog Define product requirements and manage partnerships with regional and HQ stakeholders Lead sprint and backlog refinement meetings with development teams Drive implementation of regional marketing and sales use cases Enforce standardization of product across the region in collaboration with central CRM team. Engage in sales process design and challenge the current way of thinking in order to create an optimal customer user journey Qualifications Experience with Product Ownership and driving process improvements Past experience working in a CRM environment, with a particular focus in driving business value Previous experience working with Salesforce Service, Sales and Marketing cloud Know how in implementing automated marketing journeys A bonus if you have past experience in developing an automotive direct sales model blueprint Ability to write effective user stories with clear acceptance criteria focused on business value Please send your resume in WORD format by clicking the apply button below or contact Ronald Cheung on +65 6701 1521 for a confidential discussion. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.CEI Reg. Number R2090722 (Cheung Ronald).  Apply now

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Your primary responsibility is to lead a team of cloud growth advisors to generate demand in growing the cloud footprint by delivery immediate value to the customer by delivering a well-defined cloud adoption plan. You will work closely with C-suite stakeholders, contributing vision to the customer's cloud strategy, and becoming a trusted business partner by developing the right solutions to meet the business needs.  You will support the customer in leading the organizational change within the cloud journey and drive large, multiple, and/or highly complex business solutions and strategy for targeted customers focused on Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform and hybrid multi-cloud solutions.  Key Responsibilities Establishing close working relationships, trust, and become an advisor to C suite's in the customer organization. Helping the customer to create the cloud/application strategy and roadmap (which includes single and multi-cloud vs on-prem vs hybrid). The ability to breakdown complex customer pain points and the ability to articulate the cloud value proposition in sales Working with the product development, enterprise architects and product specialist to develop a well define cloud blueprint. The responsibility includes Building technology roadmaps for the customer organization, which support their digitalization of the IT transformation journey. Building high-level target architectures for our customers Supporting CDO / digital initiatives to enable fast application development Evangelizing cloud operating model and act as an IT agility change agent Supporting the creation of compliance and security approach for cloud Building TCO case studies for cloud adoption and migration Helping organizations to tackle integration strategy/hybrid scenarios Advising on the procurement process, and considerations for new consumption methods (for example contracting, OPEX vs. CAPEX) Creating strategic plans with Delivery Day 1 and Day 2 (Project & Program) Managers, sales colleagues, and senior customer stakeholders to build out the delivery roadmap for cloud As part of account management and sales responsibility, Monitor the revenue pipeline and leads of Singtel key accounts, adjusting as necessary to create sustainable growth Develop growth strategies with the executive teams working on strategies around account planning and strategies Develop and implement robust sales management processes – pipeline for cloud managed services, account planning, and proposals. Lead Prospect and manage close relationships with key target clients. Work closely with Channel/Partner/Product Development -- adding new sales channels and 3rd party resellers and partners. In addition, the role must work closely with Global Products and Cybersecurity Business Units to broaden the cloud portfolio with network and security propositions. Strengthen our organizational capabilities and talent to support cloud sales across Global Enterprise (GE) Customer Facing Units (CFU) Major Challenges Leading transformation across people, process and technology. At Singtel, we will need to build the right team, instil the appropriate culture and have the right technologies to ensure success. Instilling the right process in a client overall transformation across business demand generation, applications development, services operations and IT infrastructure. Leading customer conversations on cloud-related topics to influence and advise thereby selling cloud services with a consulting-led approach with large pull through on typical Singtel service products around cloud. The key to success in Digital Services transformation is ensuring that Singtel internal processes are optimized to accommodate. Ensuring success is dependent upon building the right team to support this role and ensure that this team is integrated into CFU and Product/delivery teams with minimal friction.  Education & Qualification Masters Level / Bachelor in business, computer science, information technology or related field preferred with 15 years of experiences 10 or more years of business consulting in cloud, technical consulting, or sales solutions experience Experience working with the technology industry, explicitly handling significantly sized accounts Experience working with cloud solution/product portfolios Experience in managing customer accounts and experience developing winning sales solutions and proposals through consultative selling Significant implementation experience on the AWS, Microsoft Azure platform, Google Cloud Platform and hybrid cloud environment. Experience with Cloud Management Platforms (CMP's) and automation tools such as Puppet, Chef, Terraform, CloudFormation, SNOW, etc. Experience working with enterprise management systems, ITIL service delivery, and service desk integration Experience working with the business environment, business industry and competitor products and services Working knowledge of large cloud deals based on AWS, Azure and GCP Technical /Professional Certifications The following cloud certifications are highly desired: AWS Certified Solution Architect – Professional AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional Microsoft Certified – Azure Solutions Architect Expert Microsoft Certified – Azure DevOps Engineer Expert Microsoft and/or Amazon and/or Google specialist certifications ITIL, CISSP or other relevant certifications are desirable Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries Strong understanding of CloudOps, DevOps is a plus Familiarity with standard enterprise services (Directory Services, Information Assurance, Virtual Desktop, etc.), products (i.e., Oracle, SAP) and frameworks (ITIL, TOGAF, etc.)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: Primary Accountability  The primary accountability is responsible and accountable for all restaurants activities, and assumes complete responsibility for the restaurants as necessary, He / she works to ensure that all activities are consistent with and supportive of the restaurant’s business plan, and also ensure all employees (leaders and crew persons) are performing their job responsibilities and meeting expectations in all areas of their job descriptions.  Essential Functions  Effective Business Management Maximizes financial performance and profit. Helps developing and executes the business plan (key responsibilities include: purchases, manpower planning, expense control, store level marketing initiatives) for the restaurant. Achieves results by planning, managing, communicating, delegating and following up. Executes company-wide marketing programs; initiates programs on time, correctly and with minimal direction. Identifies, proposes and develops local restaurant marketing strategies to maximize sales. Total Customer Satisfaction Consistently provides a quality product and customer service experience that delivers total customer satisfaction. He or she creates an environment in which the brand ethos is communicated to customers through food and service standards. Responds positively and quickly to customer concerns. He or she corrects potential problems before they affect customers. Hires high quality people who demonstrate and ensure consistent customer satisfaction. Ensures all employees are trained, motivated and empowered to deliver total customer satisfaction. Evaluates each employee’s ability to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction. Helps to develop and maintain company standards for Quality, Service and Cleanliness (QSC). Training and Development Continuously improves the skills, knowledge and morale of all employees. He or she treats the employees with dignity and respect; creates an environment where the entire team has a consistent level of performance. Designs and maintains operations workflows in accordance to desired positioning of the brand and related standards. He creates a team around him able to maintain and perfect the implemented workflow. Develops training programs for new employee orientation up to and including management training. He / she effectively utilizes all training programs currently available from third party providers. Prepares qualified employees for promotion to the next position. He or she continually develops adequate numbers of shift leaders to meet the objective of the business plan. Evaluates each employee’s performance based on clearly communicated standards and expectations. Appropriate and Fair Business Practices Ensures business and personnel practices are within the law and consistent with policies and procedures. Serves as a role model and sets a positive example for the entire team in all aspects of business and personnel management. Upholds company food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of our customers and employees. Job Requirements College degree is preferred. Advance Diploma or Bachelor of Science degree in hotel/restaurant management is desirable. A combination of practical experience and education will be considered as an alternative. Knowledge of computers (MS Word, Excel). Proficient in the following dimensions of restaurant functions: food planning and preparation, purchasing, sanitation, security, company policies and procedures, personnel management, recordkeeping, and preparation of reports. Self-discipline, initiative, leadership ability and outgoing. Pleasant, polite manner and a neat and clean appearance. Ability to motivate employees to work as a team to ensure that food and service meet appropriate standards. Must be able to handle the pressures of simultaneously coordinating a wide range of activities and recommend appropriate solutions to restaurant problems. Must possess good communication skills for dealing with diverse staff. Ability to coordinate multiple tasks such as food, beverage and labour cost while maintaining required standards of operation in daily restaurant activities. Ability to speak French and or Japanese would be preferred so as to be able to communicate with foreign suppliers and guests.
industries: Restaurants, Food & Beverages, and Hospitality

description: Job Responsibilities: 1. Responsible for the company's overall financial operation and management, and the improvement of the internal control system; participate in the company's major business decisions, provide advice and decision support, and participate in risk assessment, guidance, tracking and control. 2. Coordinate the company's fund settlement and operation, accounting, and submit various management reports and analysis reports in a timely manner to provide the management with a basis for decision-making. 3. Lead the formulation and implementation of annual financial plans and budgets, and be responsible for providing financial data and financial analysis. 4. Responsible for project financing. 5. Tax planning: Responsible for planning local tax burdens and reasonably controlling tax risks. 6. Responsible for the review of the company's important economic contracts and purchase and sales contracts, and supervise the execution of the contracts to ensure that the interests of the company are not harmed. 7. Establish and maintain good cooperative relations with relevant institutions such as industry and commerce, taxation, banks, intermediary agencies, and capital market supervision. 8. Responsible for department team building and staff training, formulate relevant internal financial indicators, do a good job of performance appraisal management; coordinate the relationship between the finance department and other departments. 9. Other tasks assigned by the leader.  Job Requirements: 1. Full-time bachelor degree or above, financial, finance or other economic related majors, intermediate or senior accounting title, CPA is preferred. 2. Possess good financial management experience, keen insight and data perception, familiar with financial management process, financial control ability, strong overall view; more than seven years of financial work experience, and at least three years of financial manager/director Management experience, financial manager or financial director in the same industry is preferred. 3. Possess good professional ethics, rigorous work style and a high degree of professionalism and responsibility, dare to take responsibility, strong execution ability; good organization and coordination ability, good communication, able to adapt to high-intensity work.

Join Trustana and be a part of our mission to democratize access to import & export markets for all. We are working towards facilitating international participation from companies of all sizes, and supporting the evolution and modernization of SMEs globally.  Trustana is a curated B2B trade platform of verifiable, international traders. Designed to empower buyers and suppliers to grow their businesses with confidence, Trustana connects trusted trade partners and supports them through their end-to-end trade journey.  Trustana's goal is to enable buyers to bring the highest quality products to their customers by connecting them with pre-screened, curated international suppliers. It also helps suppliers to expand their customer base by supporting the internationalization of their products and connecting them with reputable buyers. The platform leverages decentralised technology to enable users to have control and ownership over their data.  Founded by Temasek, a global investment company headquartered in Singapore, Trustana is based in Singapore with a hub in China.  Key responsibilities: Shape and manage Trustana's product strategy and roadmap to develop a product that services Trustana's target customer – small and medium-sized enterprises Drive and deliver Trustana's product vision, including market expansion and growth tactics, across Southeast Asia, China, and beyond. Work closely with functions such as engineering, sales and business development, marketing, operations, etc. to develop a deep understanding of the customer and shape the product & technology Drive customer acquisition and customer retention by creating a seamless, efficient, and functional tool for our customers Effectively communicate decision making and strategic direction to team members, other executives, and board members Drive a data-driven, highly-iterative, customer-obsessed culture amongst team members Spearhead design excellence and a strong user experience for our internal and external stakeholders Build, inspire, and lead a world-class product and design team that scales globally Identify new features and functionality opportunities through competitive analysis and keeping up with market trends Promote Trustana's thought leadership in international trade by participating in industry events, summits, or forums Work with Executive Team to continuously create and adjust Trustana's overall company strategy, define and drive overall company culture, and be a role model for other team members  Ideal Candidate Requirements: Is comfortable with ambiguity and relishes the challenge of "path forging" Has previously held senior-level executive roles in product management / product development in the technology industry; experience with SMEs in Asia, B2B marketplaces or physical-operations products strongly preferred Possesses in-depth knowledge and broad understanding of digital product development, user experience and design, and user research Experience building, driving and leading a multi-functional team of product, technical and design professionals across countries Is able to roll up their sleeves to get into the details when needed – has prior product or design experience and a track record of executional excellence Considers leadership and communication a key strength Versatile and passionate about working in a start-up environment, is innately curious, and comfortable with rapid experimentation and change A self-starter who can creatively construct, is hungry to innovate, and can devise new pathways to understand and build for customers  Equal Opportunity Statement  Our company embraces diversity in all of its forms and fosters an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us.  We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

description: Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?  We are looking for APAC-ANZ Sustainability Director to make an impact!  At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  We are now opening a rare and exciting opportunity for a Sustainability Consultancy Director who can drive and support a significant investment growth plan across the Asia-Pacific Zone. This newly created role will lead the sustainability consultation with our customers, evangelizing the vision for a net-zero future and then will lead the execution teams to deliver services across the customer enterprise.  Your deep domain experience across several areas of sustainability including climate, environmental, social and governance (ESG), and general sustainability topics should span several industries. You have familiarity with digital solutions and software for sustainability management as well as experience in leading senior level client relationships and people management experience are integral to success.  This coupled with your knowledge of how to deliver enterprise-based sustainability strategies for customers mean that you can comfortable own the room at the C-Level. Your extensive knowledge of consulting methodologies will achieve these strategies and drive exceptional outcomes.  Primary Deliverables of this role: Develop, maintain, evolve and innovate the APAC Sustainability and Climate Change Advisory services offers with a focus on setting up regional service delivery in line with global standards Engagement with C-Suite and executive leaders of clients is expected in workshop and strategy development type forums; goal is to create long-term, sustaining relationships with clients Assess and convey client requirements to business leadership and ensure that Schneider Electric services remain fresh and aligned with evolving marketplace needs; collaborate with business development, marketing, client management and other peer groups in the sales process for high-profile clients Participate in and lead aspects of high-profile strategy deliveries with a focus on increasing client relationship value (especially at executive levels) and driving thought leading strategies and solutions for a range of client profiles Engagement with C-Suite and executive leaders of clients is expected in workshop and strategy development type forums; goal is to create long-term, sustaining relationships with clients Build a team fostering delivery excellence, high quality service, subject matter expertise for sustainability and the ability to assist in new and recurring sustainability services sales Partner with global sustainability consulting team members in the development of new and thought leading services; package, communicate and position services within the regional organization to accelerate sales of new services Participate as “voice of the client” in discussions with Schneider Electric business and segment teams as it relates to applicability and opportunity for integrating Schneider Electric solutions into client strategies with a focus on refining the associated value proposition and sales approach  Qualifications  Experience and skills we are looking for: Bachelor Degree in Sustainability or Environmental or equivalent 12+ years of experience with 8+ years of experience in the sustainability or energy industry. Proven effectiveness at conducting business conversations in person and with people over the phone at multiple levels of an organization including Senior Leadership (Directors, VPs) and C-Suite. A displayed passion to make a difference for the future of our planet Experience with climate and decarbonization, ESG and broader sustainability work preferably in the consulting industry Strong people management skills and experience with an affinity for client-facing activities; personable and engaging Deep understanding of sustainability industry trends, challenges, opportunities and associated corporate sustainability network (i.e., prospect, clients and industry contacts) Ability to listen and understand prospect/customer sustainability opportunities and challenges and address those by mapping to sustainable solutions  Benefits we offer: Global family leave Comprehensive medical coverage for employee and dependents Blue sky Friday Worldwide Employee Stock Ownership On-site gym …and more!  We are looking forward to welcoming you in our team!  Schedule: Full-time  Req: 00772N
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  The Director of Solution Engineering is responsible for managing a team of Solution Engineers (individual contributors) who support our Sales team across Asia. Key markets include Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines across all customer segments - from SMB through to Enterprise.  This SE team discovers and understands customer business challenges, complex processes, and architectural landscapes in order to build world-class integrated solutions leveraging DocuSign’s platform and suite of products. Through engaging stories and custom-built demonstrations, SEs illustrate the value and benefits of modernizing a prospect’s System of Agreement through DocuSign’s Agreement Cloud offerings. The Director is accountable for coaching and developing these individual contributors, helping them to drive adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.  This position reports to the Senior Director of Solution Engineering for Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) and is designated flex.  Responsibilities Daily management of the Solution Engineering team Scale team by attracting and mentoring extraordinary solution engineers with various levels of experience and diversity to grow a well-balanced, high performing team Identify and create opportunities for training and professional development of team Provide individual coaching to help develop and refine core technical, selling, and presentation skills to help team grow and excel Drive collaboration with sales team to aid in cultivating and securing net-new business Communicate and prioritize product and business needs from the field to appropriate internal teams including Product Development, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement, Support, Professional Services, and others Ensure team effectively operates in accordance with team policies and procedures Continually assess team operations and make adjustments or policy recommendations to drive team collaboration, efficiency, and effectiveness Maintain and protect DocuSign core values by hiring culturally aligned team members and leading by example Basic Qualifications 5-10+ years of experience in a technical pre-sales role 5+ years of experience leading technical pre-sales teams BS/BA degree or equivalent in relevant work experience Preferred Qualifications Track record of building, coaching and enabling a rapidly growing Solution Engineering teams Hire and retain top talent in the market, providing career growth opportunities and effective succession planning An inspiring, innovative leader with the ability to deal with high volume transactional business and enterprise sales models Experience selling into customers across Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines Focus on innovation - ensure the team is constantly improving their approach to solution and value based selling Prioritize and qualify where to invest the pre sales resources to get maximum impact of every investment Masterful in delivering software demonstrations, both in-person or remotely Proven experience with cloud software configuration and integration Experience with technical business documentation including process flows, architectural diagrams, proposals, RFPs and RFIs, etc. Proven experience working with employees at all levels of an organization Familiarity with system integration methods such as web services including SOAP & REST APIs Familiarity with HTML, XML, and structured data Familiarity with Enterprise-class software systems such as ERP, CRM, and ECM. Familiarity with electronic signature and/or CLM concepts a plus Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail Embody DocuSign’s values Willingness to travel 25% or more as needed (post pandemic) About Us  DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the business and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  AccommodationsDocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Summary  The Associate Director will be directly responsible for setting the beverage strategy and leading the implementation in our restaurants of a unique experience for our guests (current and future venues).  This leader will not only focus on our day-to-day operations, but also maximizing commercialization and revenue streams of all beverage products, including cost management and leveraging vendor relations to develop an immersive wine and beverage program.  The Associate Director should be a dynamic individual, who can bring a balance of empathy with clear direction and drive. Most importantly, this is a leadership role in a highly competitive, fast paced industry requiring out of the box, creative thinking while bringing the larger organization along on this journey with you.  Knowledge, Skills And Experience Requirements Proactive influencer and future-focused leader who can drive the business and bring to life the vision of beverage program. Relationship management is key for all stakeholders (internal, external, ownership and COMO Brands) Strong sales and business acumen. The ability to react and adjust to changing business environment and lead the team in ensuring efficient financial management of the business. A wine and beverage expert who is passionate about the training and development of the team and open to sharing their knowledge with the internal team and guests. Exceptional wine and beverage service skills that can be showcased during service and various events. Attention to detail, style and aesthetics of restaurants is critical. Proven Track Record Of Leading a Team Proven sales experience, with a positive outlook and driven to over achieve all targets. Strong knowledge of and experience within the wine industry is a must. WSET level 3 as a minimum complemented with a Management Diploma, Master in Wine or MasterSommelier Certification. Strong communication and presentation skills, someone who thrives meeting new people. Qualifications Fluent in English is compulsory. Mandarin as an asset, but not a must. Experience : at least 8 years experience in the Hospitality industry and 3 years as at operating multiple outlets/venues.
industries: Restaurants, Food & Beverages, and Hospitality

We are seeking an Associate Director, Product Marketing, who is able to drive new product launches, go-to-market (GTM) activities, competitive intelligence and positioning of Razer products. You are user focused and product driven, with a strong understanding of how to orchestrate successful product launches. This role will require you to be creative, strategic, and organized as it will require you to work across multiple cross functional teams including business development/sales, operations, product and engineering.  Reporting to the Head of Sales & Marketing, you will be responsible for commercialization of products, ensure product marketing collaterals and product GTM preparedness are ready for our sales and marketing teams to execute on. At the same time, you will partner closely with marketing communications team on content and PR to generate awareness and ensure strong adoption of Razer products in the region, expansion of market share and successful product launches. Ability to communicate conceptually and tactically – including strategy, planning, data insights and execution details Expert knowledge of hardware and software game industry trends Self-starter with demonstrated ability to manage, collaborate, leverage and thrive in a fast-paced matrix environment

description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.  Job Description  The Opportunity  The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Head of Alternate Distribution with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.  Manulife Bancassurance is seeking for a self-motivated professional, who is obsessed with delivering value, is forward-thinking, and drive the company's distribution strategy with the partnership.  What motivates you? You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone What We Are Looking For Leading distribution of insurance through DBS Institutional Banking Drive Distribution strategies for HNW products to meet/exceed the sales objective of the Bancassurance partners To establish relationships with inclusive partners, and engage regularly Stakeholder engagement and management. Provide senior business representation and collaboration with business partners Conduct market analysis, segment and target bancassurance opportunities, implement distribution strategies to onboard partners. To ensure things are done ethically & in accordance to regulatory compliance Review operational processes and control to ensure risk mitigation and compliance with regulatory authorities Conduct product training including mentoring, and training on knowledge & skill Marketing & branding initiatives including internal seminars and event management Active tracking of partner's sales activities and takes accountability for APE & profitability targets Responsible for P&L and monitoring the expenses for resource allocation Requirements Diploma / Degree with at least 10 years of relevant experience with successful track record Proven experience in sales distribution segments in bancassurance HNW / FA channel Ability to forge collaborative working relationships with various partnership within Manulife Singapore, as well as external partners Proven leadership, interpersonal and strong communication Results oriented and have good business connections in identifying and developing business opportunities Our commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry Our best. Every day. Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.com  If you are ready to unleash your potential, it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.  About Manulife  About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and our global wealth and asset management segment, Manulife Investment Management, serves individuals, institutions and retirement plan members worldwide. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2021, we had CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.3 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer  At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. description: The Director, APAC role is responsible for leading the Global Publisher team across the Asia-Pacific region under our Affiliate Marketing arm, CJ. This role will oversee existing/mature markets and develop go-to-market plans for emerging regions. Will be responsible for identifying & targeting key publishers for the network, onboarding them onto CJ and growing their presence by establishing advertiser relationships.  Develop and maintain the Global team’s business development pipeline strategy. With the goal to diversify the network with productive partnerships through recruitment and new partnership identification.  At a market level, know publisher trends and guide the right target list to capture and sign-up key accounts. Collaborate with internal advertiser and new sales teams to incorporate vertical needs.  Lead strategic conversations with high profile strategic partners and build relationships with key decision makers at top global publishers, ad networks, and solutions providers. Execute partnership agreements as appropriate per market.  Oversee onboarding and revenue activation of new global strategic partners and publishers. Work closely with Onboarding Teams to move publishers through the process and identify efficiencies to improve speed from sign-up to driving revenue in the network.  Build loyalty from mature publisher programs by coordinating with the Enterprise team to develop short and long term strategy plans. Work closely with the advertiser teams to ensure on-going recruitment and optimization of their APAC strategies.  Responsibilities:  Be the Subject Matter Expert internally to educate advertisers and publishers on the vertical and business benefits to partnering with CJ with an eye on the competitive landscape to help keep CJ ahead of the pack from a product and relationship perspective. Innovate or discover unique engagement models with publishers and potential e-commerce partners Elevate CJ’s positioning through thought leadership. Use industry events, conferences, podcasts and client events to advocate/educate on CJ’s capabilities through speaking engagements or one/one meetings. Create publisher advocacy for both CJ & the affiliate channel by establishing partnerships, identifying investment opportunities with CJ advertisers, and providing strategy plans to build their business. Identify, escalate, and guide solutions needed to advance the region. Collaborate with CJ’s Product Team to bring those solutions to completion whether through partnerships or internal product development. Proactively seek out and participate in stakeholder groups. Collaborate with supporting departments, and stakeholders to drive growth with publisher adoption and innovation at a global scale. Coordinate with your team on the best approach to educate publishers on CJ's interface, tools, and data assets in accordance with general business and affiliate marketing best practices to better position clients for success. Lead, manage, train, educate and mentor the Global Team on best practices, team goals, publisher client needs and CJ innovations and how it will benefit their own portfolio of clients. Empower, Enable and Engage with the team on an ongoing basis, nurturing them through their respective career paths. Define SMART goals to support their performance management and career development. Facilitate building their exposure and expertise.  Qualifications  10+ years of Digital Marketing experience (preferably Affiliate Marketing) 7+ years in a Global Marketing role, focused on the APAC region 5+ years’ experience managing direct reports Language requirements: Prefer business level proficiency in a key local language Strong verbal and written communication abilities Communicate effectively across cultures and time zones Effective decision-making skills Excellent organizational and communications skills with a strong attention to detail Ability to work across departments and divisions by building consensus and delivering upon stated objectives

description: Your role  Are you a seasoned solution marketer? Do you enjoy using your skills and experience to drive change and increase revenue?  We’re looking for a customer-centric Financial Services Solutions Marketing Director for our APAC region to help develop and lead the GTM strategy and execution for IHS Markit’s Financial Services portfolio of solutions, which span five key areas; ‘data & analytics’, ‘post trade processing’, ‘risk, compliance and reporting’, ‘financial technology solutions’ and ‘economic & country risk’.  Key Responsibilities Working with key stakeholders across the Financial Services division and marketing & communications team, and using market research, customer feedback and sales priorities, you will develop compelling and content rich value propositions by target audience which will drive the GTM strategy for marketing communications into target segments Implement, plan, develop and measure integrated global marketing programs to align with the ‘Buyers Journey’, including awareness, PR, inbound and outbound demand generation, pipeline building, sales acceleration and localization Help grow and implement new digital inbound marketing strategies to help drive further demand from online activity Develop global sales enablement assets and implement training strategies to instruct sales on understanding target audiences, value propositions, buyer preferences, needs, and challenges Build and maintain key relationships with multiple internal stakeholders, including: Financial Services leadership, Sales, Product Management and other worldwide and/or regional/local teams to define and implement GTM strategies with emphasis on the customer Define target Return on Marketing Investment (ROMI) and track progress against those targets Build awareness and generate qualified, sales-ready leads; partner with Sales to drive conversion of leads to pipeline opportunities and closed deals. Evolve strategic alliance partner marketing relationships to increase visibility and drive end user demand for IHS Markit data/solutions via 3rd party platforms. Provide leadership and support for the design, development and implementation of marketing programs; direct marketing activities, including marketing strategy development, planning, creative design and execution, and media buying. Help shape an effective, results- and metrics-oriented marketing organization; work with internal resources, including sales and product management organizations to develop professional marketing communications Manage timelines, budgets, resources, and staff and maintain effective communications and relationships with internal and external partners. Support executive stakeholders on corporate communications and public relations – in collaboration with the Internal Comms and Media Relations teams. Your team  You will be working in the Global Marketing and Communications team and work closely with the APAC Financial Services team.  Your expertise  You have Proven marketing experience (ideally 10+ years) A strong solutions marketing or strategy related background. Extensive experience within the financial services industry or a financial technology related vendor or a consulting firm with financial services/technology related expertise. Prior management experience and proven leadership competencies with the ability to mobilize, motivate and inspire employees and retain talent is valuable. Digital inbound marketing skills covering a wide range of online channels You are Highly collaborative Able to achieve goals through influencing, partnering and developing productive relationships with senior leaders internally and with 3rd party partners and influencers externally. A strong leader who has experience of managing team members across global locations and time zones Flexible Working  We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.  Return to Work  Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.  Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. For more information on the many ways in which we enthusiastically support inclusion and diversity efforts for both candidates and employees, please access our Inclusion & Diversity Statement here .  We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with IHS Markit and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please contact or call +1 212 849 0399. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are considered on a case-by-case basis. This contact information (email and phone) is intended for application assistance and accommodation requests only. We are unable to accept resumes or provide information about application status through the phone number or email address above. Resumes are only accepted through the online application process, and only qualified candidates will receive consideration and follow-up.  IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.  For Information Please Click On The Following Links  IHS Markit Business Code of Conduct  Right to Work  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Pay Transparency  Current Colleagues  If you are currently employed by IHS Markit, please apply internally via the Workday internal careers site.

description: Description  Would you like to develop AWS migration partners and build their businesses? Would you like to be part of a successful migration team focused on helping partners build and grow their businesses on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform? Do you have business savvy and technical background necessary to help further establish Amazon leadership by supporting and developing field enablement programs for migration and modernisation?  As the APJ Manager of the Partner Migration Specialists, you will own the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver the strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon’s platform within the AWS partner ecosystem. Your responsibilities will include leading an APJ-wide team to identify and build high quality migration practices within our top APN consulting partners. You will own the strategy to address market capability gaps and the regional execution of this partner capability to help AWS customers migrate at scale and speed. You will interface at the leadership level with Solutions Architecture, Specialist Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to build interlocked execution plans for the APJ region.  The ideal candidate will possess both a business background that enables them to engage with partner business teams as well as a technical background that enables them to easily interact with project teams and architects. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the APJ Partner Migration, Partner Development Specialist team as a member of the APJ Partner Core leadership team. Work closely with AWS Specialist Sales and global migrations team members to develop and execute a strategy, plans and process for partner contribution to overall APJ migration revenue. Develop long-term demand planning and proactively identify prospective partners to supply that demand. Own the APJ funnel for Partner Migrations, be accountable for delivery against world-wide expectations. Possess a high-level of commercial acumen and be the first point of approval for APJ Partner Migration deal investment. Be the voice of APJ partners to inform changes and enhancements to AWS programs and processes. Own, prepare, and deliver business reviews to senior management regarding partner revenue influence, customer wins through partners, and overall progress on partner strategy.  Basic Qualifications The right person will be technical and analytical, and possess 10-15 years of partner development, business development, product marketing, or program/product management experience Experience in selling large transformation projects with customers in ANZ. Demonstrated success with managing cross group collaboration and multiple projects in a matrix and high growth organization. A proven leader with previous regional and cross boarder management responsibility. Breadth of expertise in private and public Cloud Computing (i.e. AWS platform), technologies and architectural best practices. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is a key. Strong written communication skills and fluency are paramount; high degree of comfort presenting to technical and senior leadership audiences. Technical degree or equivalent experience required Preferred Qualifications Working experience and knowledge of data center / infrastructure / networking technologies are desired. A knowledge or experience in selling/delivering large consulting engagements with a P&L responsibility. Strong verbal and written communications skills  Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore  Job ID: A1748534
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  The Director of Solution Engineering is responsible for managing a team of Solution Engineers (individual contributors) who support our Sales team across Asia. Key markets include Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines across all customer segments - from SMB through to Enterprise.  This SE team discovers and understands customer business challenges, complex processes, and architectural landscapes in order to build world-class integrated solutions leveraging DocuSign’s platform and suite of products. Through engaging stories and custom-built demonstrations, SEs illustrate the value and benefits of modernizing a prospect’s System of Agreement through DocuSign’s Agreement Cloud offerings. The Director is accountable for coaching and developing these individual contributors, helping them to drive adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.  This position reports to the Senior Director of Solution Engineering for Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) and is designated flex.  Responsibilities Daily management of the Solution Engineering team Scale team by attracting and mentoring extraordinary solution engineers with various levels of experience and diversity to grow a well-balanced, high performing team Identify and create opportunities for training and professional development of team Provide individual coaching to help develop and refine core technical, selling, and presentation skills to help team grow and excel Drive collaboration with sales team to aid in cultivating and securing net-new business Communicate and prioritize product and business needs from the field to appropriate internal teams including Product Development, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement, Support, Professional Services, and others Ensure team effectively operates in accordance with team policies and procedures Continually assess team operations and make adjustments or policy recommendations to drive team collaboration, efficiency, and effectiveness Maintain and protect DocuSign core values by hiring culturally aligned team members and leading by example Basic Qualifications 5-10+ years of experience in a technical pre-sales role 5+ years of experience leading technical pre-sales teams BS/BA degree or equivalent in relevant work experience Preferred Qualifications Track record of building, coaching and enabling a rapidly growing Solution Engineering teams Hire and retain top talent in the market, providing career growth opportunities and effective succession planning An inspiring, innovative leader with the ability to deal with high volume transactional business and enterprise sales models Experience selling into customers across Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines Focus on innovation - ensure the team is constantly improving their approach to solution and value based selling Prioritize and qualify where to invest the pre sales resources to get maximum impact of every investment Masterful in delivering software demonstrations, both in-person or remotely Proven experience with cloud software configuration and integration Experience with technical business documentation including process flows, architectural diagrams, proposals, RFPs and RFIs, etc. Proven experience working with employees at all levels of an organization Familiarity with system integration methods such as web services including SOAP & REST APIs Familiarity with HTML, XML, and structured data Familiarity with Enterprise-class software systems such as ERP, CRM, and ECM. Familiarity with electronic signature and/or CLM concepts a plus Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail Embody DocuSign’s values Willingness to travel 25% or more as needed (post pandemic) About Us  DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the business and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  Accommodations  DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. description: Job Description The Team Manager / Lead would play a critical role in ACHIEVE’s success as a strategic business partner leading a team of recruitment consultants within the Technology desk to achieve sales targets. With strong growth plans from 2021Q3, you are charged with engaging new and existing clients, partnering them in shaping their staffing strategy, developing recommendations to close deals, along with ensuring delivery with a dynamic team. To be successful, you need to possess an entrepreneurial spirit and be passionate about driving sales strategy and achieving targets. At the same time, you need to be attuned to happenings in the Information Technology industry, have good understanding of manpower needs in IT, and have a nose for emerging technology jobs. As the leader of a team, you need strong leadership capability to develop your team’s strengths, and motivate them to achieve and exceed targets every quarter.    Job Responsibilities Lead a team of recruitment consultants in achieving sales targets Develop new business and serve existing clientele Mentor and motivate team of consultants Maintain orderly day-to-day operations in line with company protocol Keep abreast of market trends and provide insights to clients Manage the end-to-end recruitment process with a team of consultants  Job Requirements Diploma/Degree in any discipline Proven track record of success in sales Leadership capability in motivating the team to achieve sales targets Good exposure in the IT industry of at least 5-8 years Experience in the recruitment industry is a plus Ability to plan and strategize Strong motivator and results driven  Company Overview ACHIEVE Group is a longstanding Talent Acquisition agency, powered with a mission to help Clients, Candidates and Consultants achieve success and realise aspirations. Having placed more than 40,000 people in positions across industry in our 30-over years as a trusted brand, we are now embarking on an extraordinary expansionary program, with multi-prong services and international alliances. In building our organisation to take the great leap ahead, we are looking out for exceptional individuals to strengthen our business. Come, join us in this opportunity of a lifetime!

description: Singtel, Asia’s leading communications technology group, provides an extensive range of telecommunications and digital services to millions of consumers and businesses across Asia, Australia, Africa and the USA. With over 140 years of innovation behind us, we continue to push boundaries in our networks and services, to enrich lives and transform businesses.  Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Our diverse business means you will enjoy unique opportunities and rewarding experiences to learn and grow your career in a dynamic industry.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  Key Responsibilities Responsible for product costs and profitability; to manage and monitor the product costs and margins for the existing Fixed lines. Responsible to ensure that the Smart Home & IoT products and services continue to evolve with technology and to maintain product leadership position. Closely monitor market trends, consumer behaviors, and technological developments which open up new business opportunities, in order to conceptualise and develop products needed to deliver the KPI’s on schedule and within the desired cost targets. To improve processes for cost control as well as rationalize products within the said portfolio to ensure competitiveness. To ensure that the product and service offerings will result in the best customer experience in terms of simplicity and ease of use. Segments served include both corporate customers and residential consumers. Build robust relationships with external and internal stakeholders, such as Developers/Vendors, Marketing, Sales, Customer Care, IS, and Network, to ensure strong teamwork in smooth project execution and delivery. To ensure the team led by the Director is highly engaged with the desired engagement score. Provide constructive and timely feedback, set clear direction and targets, and constantly motivate the team to achieve higher performance. Requirements 8-10 years of developing products and services in the telecommunications and multimedia industry. Product development and programme management skills People manager Strong leadership and people oriented Highly motivated and result oriented Flexible to adjust to change in priorities and business direction Strong influencing and selling skills Telecommunications, Internet and multimedia market as well as technology trends in telecommunications services and devices like tablets, UE/UI delivery as well as mobile apps. We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

description: Why work at Entegris?  Lead. Inspire. Innovate. Define Your Future.  Not everyone who works for a global company shares the same background, experiences and perspectives. We leverage the differences of our employees to bring new ideas to the table. Every employee throughout the company is encouraged to share input on projects and initiatives. Our decision making process is truly a collaborative effort as we realize there are leaders at every level of the organization. We put our values at the core of how we operate as an organization — not just when it’s convenient, but in a lasting and meaningful way. We want the time and energy you spend here to have a positive impact on your life inside and outside of the office.  Entegris is a values-driven culture and our employees rally around our core PACE values:  P eople  A ccountability  C reativity  E xcellence  The Role  Entegris is seeking a dynamic leader for the role of Global Logistics Director. This position will enable Entegris’ global supply chain and business objectives to be achieved, while satisfying some of the world’s largest and most demanding semiconductor customers. As the company accelerates its growth organically and through M&A’s, the ideal candidate will have the expertise to shape the logistics strategy and be a change agent in driving supply chain network optimization. This role will be located in Singapore and report to the VP of Global Supply Chain.  In this role you will Oversee Global Logistics, including Distribution Center operations, by performing to service level expectations and operational controls, as well as regulatory and budget requirements. Play a pivotal leadership role in customer centricity, scalability and efficiency strategies to drive a new standard across the organization leveraging Logistics best practices. Collaborate with Divisions, Sales, Customer Service, Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Finance and other functional areas to design and implement strategies and tactics, which reduce total cost while improving network service level. Ensure efficient flow of goods to manufacturing, distribution and customers. Leverage dashboards/analytics to monitor various data sources to identify risks to customer performance and assurance of supply, with proactively defined mitigation strategies in place. Manage relationship with 3PL’s and Logistics global team to meet Entegris customer demands and Division requirements. Partner with 3PL’s on improving performance, with plans to scale and flex to dynamic business conditions. Support rapid integration of Logistics at acquired companies. Traits we believe make a strong candidate Demonstrated leadership in transforming a complex manufacturing supply chain. Leverages market intelligence to inform business planning and optimize decision making. Strategic thinker with in-depth understanding of inbound/outbound logistics strategy and optimization, matched with technical understanding of systems/processes. Pursues alternative solutions, works well in group problem solving situations, presents ideas and information in a compelling way. Solid analytical skills and solution-driven thinking, using intuition and experience to complement data. Strong process orientation and track record of reducing costs, improving profits and streamlining operations in order to achieve financial improvements. Experience working with 3PL partners to accomplish short and long-term business goals. Recognized self-starter who enjoys a fast-paced environment and seeks the challenge of winning in a rapidly changing marketplace. Experience building and managing teams in multiple geographies, communicating and working effectively across different cultures. Willingness and availability to travel internationally as needed to support job scope. Bachelor’s degree at a minimum, with an advanced degree preferred. 10-15 years of experience in Logistics and Supply Chain. Expert knowledge of Logistics industry trends and best practices. Knowledge of semiconductor industry and storage/transport of Dangerous Goods preferred. Continuous Improvement, Six Sigma and Lean experience/certification a plus. What We Offer  Our total rewards package goes above and beyond just a paycheck. Whether you’re looking to build your career, improve your health, or protect your wealth, we offer generous benefits to help you achieve your goals. Very Competitive total compensation plans. A 401(K) plan to help you plan for your future with an impressive employer match that’s all yours- no vesting! Great health, dental and vision insurance packages to fit your needs to ensure you’re happy and healthy. A progressive PTO policy that empowers our employees to take the time they need to recharge! At Entegris we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. Our policy is to recruit, hire, train, and reward employees for their individual abilities, achievements and experience without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, marital or military status.
