description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.  Job Description  The Opportunity  The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Head of Alternate Distribution with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.  Manulife Bancassurance is seeking for a self-motivated professional, who is obsessed with delivering value, is forward-thinking, and drive the company's distribution strategy with the partnership.  What motivates you? You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone What we are looking for: Leading distribution of insurance through DBS Institutional Banking Drive Distribution strategies for HNW products to meet/exceed the sales objective of the Bancassurance partners To establish relationships with inclusive partners, and engage regularly Stakeholder engagement and management. Provide senior business representation and collaboration with business partners Conduct market analysis, segment and target bancassurance opportunities, implement distribution strategies to onboard partners. To ensure things are done ethically & in accordance to regulatory compliance Review operational processes and control to ensure risk mitigation and compliance with regulatory authorities Conduct product training including mentoring, and training on knowledge & skill Marketing & branding initiatives including internal seminars and event management Active tracking of partner's sales activities and takes accountability for APE & profitability targets Responsible for P&L and monitoring the expenses for resource allocation Requirements: Diploma / Degree with at least 10 years of relevant experience with successful track record Proven experience in sales distribution segments in bancassurance HNW / FA channel Ability to forge collaborative working relationships with various partnership within Manulife Singapore, as well as external partners Proven leadership, interpersonal and strong communication Results oriented and have good business connections in identifying and developing business opportunities Our commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry Our best. Every day. Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.com  If you are ready to unleash your potential, it's time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.  About Manulife  About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and our global wealth and asset management segment, Manulife Investment Management, serves individuals, institutions and retirement plan members worldwide. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2021, we had CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.3 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer  At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.  It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

autonomously aligning personal contribution to the goals and priorities of the team and business Participate in strategic project review sessions to share materials or lessons-learned Participate actively in client workshops where appropriate Demonstrate strong commitment to personal learning and development through attending approved technical training courses, acquiring approved certifications where necessary and using the acquired knowledge to demonstrate subject matter expertise and be at the forefront of technology innovation Create detailed technical designs from high level solution designs, based on customer requirements analysis Coach and train associate technical consultants, whilst also providing guidance to local teams or 3rd party partners in areas of expertise Provide technical subject matter expertise to troubleshoot Assist with creation of new innovative delivery collateral and maintenance of existing delivery collateral Build relationships with Engagement Managers, Project Managers, Practice Principals, Solutions Consultants, and Solution Architects engaged in service opportunities Build positive relationship with customer stakeholders and ensure that customer technical issues get resolved on priority Assist the Project Managers to provide regular communication to the Engagement Manager/Practice team/Sales about the status of Delivery Services engagements Qualifications E/B.Tech/M.Sc./M.C.A/M.S. Certified PM with either PMP or equivalent certification Have at least 15 years of progressive project management experience in large infrastructure related projects Has done roles as a project director or senior project manager in directly managing or recovering difficult customer situations Fast learner who can work under ambiguity Demonstrated experience in managing other project managers or senior technical consultants Team player who can work closely with other internal stakeholders like sales and pursuit teams, customers and service delivery with outcome in mind Has demonstrated experience in managing large and complex infrastructure projects involving storage, automation, compute and network Working knowledge of hybrid cloud desired Team player who can work in an environment of ambiguity Must have good communicate skills Must be customer focused Must be willing to work flexible hours Experience in executing complex migrations. Extensive technical consultancy and Service Delivery experience Technical subject matter expertise across the practice Extensive experience in Hitachi technologies or relevant competitor technologies Extensive design, implementation and operational knowledge including involvement in the setup, operation and transition of operational teams and managed services Appreciation of multiple technology platforms Deep understanding of managed infrastructure technologies and how they can be deployed to fit client solution requirements Have ability to produce crisp customer presentations and good articulation skills in English - needs to control the flow and delivery of technical content to diverse audiences at customer meetings and seminars We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

jobTitle: Head of AML solutions Asia Pacific
description: In March 2016, Quantexa was founded by a team with decades of experience in software, data and advanced analytics. We knew the opportunity was big; every business with data at its core can benefit from what we’re doing, so we hit the ground hard.  In five years, we’ve grown from a few desks huddled in the corner of a shared space to having over 300+ staff worldwide! Having just completed our Series C funding round, attracting more than $90m in investment, we are now in a scale up phase.  Opportunity  Quantexa is looking for highly motivated professionals to lead our AML activities in APAC. As the head of AML solutions for APAC, you will be responsible for creating and delivering Quantexa’s go to market for all AML solutions within the region. You will be an agent for change to bring in a new way of monitoring, investigating and managing AML risk for all regulated industries. You will have to work closely with Quantexa management and Head office teams to help define and deliver the strategy as well as working closely with in-country teams for sales, marketing, delivery, etc for the execution.  Requirements  Typical responsibilities include: Acting as the AML SME for pre-sales and delivery Guiding / creating Quantexa’s AML strategy for APAC Creating and or tailoring solutions for the APAC market place Keeping up to date on new AML legislation and creating / adapting solutions to meet these regulations Guiding the product management team to create solution collateral and contributing where necessary Creation of externally facing content, white papers, news articles, LinkedIn posts, etc Contribute to RFIs, RFPs, etc specifically the solution overview sections Work seamlessly with sales, pre-sales and marketing to deliver the companies sales number Speaking at conferences  Our clients are International and our staff are expected to react to demanding client needs and agendas.  You should have the following: Extensive experience in AML either from a vendor, big four or at a client Ability to manage and interact with senior stakeholder (C suite), industry bodies and regulators Knowledge of core AML areas Experience of AML Investigations, CDD and EDD reviews, Transaction Monitoring scenarios and risk management process Knowledge of Entity Resolution and Network Analytics in the context of Financial Crime Able to articulate solutions and benefits Solution and consultancy oriented approach to selling Speaking at conference and publishing Blogs, Whiteapapers, etc Ability to create solutions from scratch base on customer and local markets needs Thinking out of the box We’re looking for high performing individuals and offer competitive base salary commensurate with experience plus bonus and generous benefits  Benefits  We offer a competitive salary, company bonus and other employee benefits

description: About Us  Real insights, directly from the brightest minds in business, curated to your aspirations.  Tigerhall is a social learning platform that enables professionals, teams and enterprises to reach their goals by learning directly from the most successful business leaders and subject matter experts in industry. Learn sales from the President of Adobe, leadership from the COO of Microsoft, strategy from the President of Mondelez, and much more. Our mission is to replace universities for good and ensure that everyone, regardless of their backgrounds and circumstances, have the opportunity to learn from the very best.  Tigerhall launched in March 2019 and has since raised over US$3M in funding from investors including Sequoia Capital, Taurus Ventures and the XA Network. With 30 tigers on the team we are currently present in Singapore, the US and India.  Job Description Report to the CEO Build out product roadmap with input from team, customers, users and management Ideate new feature ideas and ways to consistently improve the product for users Conduct in-depth user interviews Plan and prioritize the work for the engineering team based on business needs and revenue impact Get input from all relevant stakeholders and align engineering and management with what product is looking to drive in the upcoming sprints Proactively communicate to the entire team when a release is scheduled to happen, going through features we're releasing and explains how it impacts the user Actively support users and reach out to them to ensure they are successful and utilizes the product well Analyse data that informs your prioritization and planning, reflecting on why certain features are performing and others are not, and uses the input from the data to influence his future decision making of the product roadmap and what to build Ensures the team is up to date on what the product can do, what's being released next, what features to look forward to, what sales can start picthing to clients, and how what we released is performing in the app Create well thought through product descriptions and flow charts based on UX research and best-in-class practices of mobile products The Successful Applicant Prior experience in mobile product management and knowledge of best-in-class user experience practices A creative eye and love for coming up with new product ideas and ways to improve the experience for the user An authentic interest in users and their problems with a keen eye for use cases, ‘the unsaid’ in user interviews, and really going deep to understand their lifestyles and aspirations Highly collaborative with strong communication skills; being able to communicate with several teams and being the link between business and engineering Exceptional stakeholder management skills and ability to communicate priorities and limitations clearly Strong organization and project management skills, being able to drive the workflow between business, engineering and design to reach release deadlines Performance driven and results-oriented Curious and always learning Crazy personality is a plus – no one in Tigerhall is vanilla (or llama as we call it) What’s On Offer  Be the chief of a cool product loved by business professionals across the world. Lots of growth and development opportunities as the business continues to grow rapidly. Work closely with a team of top engineers and senior management. Be part of an open, collaborative and fun Team of Tigers.

description: Overall Purpose Of The Role  Strategic and tactical responsibility for implementing engineering and product strategy to exceed customer expectations for product development, quality, cost and delivery, maximising efficiency, optimising and driving excellence.  Responsible for all areas of the Engineering and Product function, striving for best in class products and business practices to deliver to the customer’s expectations, managing teams and projects across the business.  Provide clear leadership and vision, inspire and motivate staff to achieve excellence and mentor them as they develop new skills. Drive Key Performance Indicators across all areas of the Engineering and Product function to ensure that all projects are delivered on cost and on time to the highest quality standards.  You Will Manage and grow both the product and engineering teams as the single-threaded leader of the P&E organization Shape the culture of the P&E organization from “customer obsession” to “delivering results” Drive the vision of our B2B and B2C products through an insightful understanding of our B2B2C business model Drive the engineering vision so that technology provides a differentiated competitive advantage for the company in reducing the time-to-market for the onboarding of our enterprise customers and in providing superior targeting and personalization of promotions for our consumers Work together with the CEO to enable company growth through building and delivering delightful products and the astute use of technology Collaborate with sales and marketing leaders to achieve our company objectives. Keep abreast of and advocate the best practices and technologies to ensure a data-driven, tech-enabled rapid pace of product development. You Are Experienced with product development. You have developed enterprise products and consumer products and could explain the difference between developing products for enterprises vs SMB vs consumers Experienced with strategic tech decisions. You have made sound decisions when it comes to build vs buy of software, choice of public clouds, choice of development partners and microservices vs monolith Knowledgeable about distributed architectures. You are familiar with cloud-native, event-driven and microservices architecture An Agile practitioner: You have deep familiarity with agile development practices. You are an advocate of test-driven development, continuous integration and delivery. You rely on measurements and instrumentation to make data-driven decisions. Respected equally by sales leaders, marketing leaders, product managers and engineers An experienced leader: You have multiple years of experience as a product leader and a technical lead or architect, and at multiple organizations. You know how to grow teams from scratch and have worked in very early stage startups. Business-savvy. You know how your products will drive the top-line of the business and can balance between investments in differentiating technologies while optimizing undifferentiated heavy-lifting for the bottomline

description: Why Work at Lenovo  Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology for all, so we spend our time building a society that’s brighter and more inclusive.  And we go big. No, not big—huge.  We’re not just a Fortune 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. We’re in 180 countries, working with 63,000 brilliant colleagues and counting. And we’re known for the world’s most complete portfolio of smart technology, from devices to software to infrastructure.  With our ingenuity, we help millions—not just the select few—experience our version of a smarter future.  The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...  Description And Requirements  Lenovo (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY) is a US$60 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company serving customers in 180 markets around the world. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that power (through devices and infrastructure) and empower (through solutions, services and software) millions of customers every day and together create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit [1] https://www.lenovo.com,and read about the latest news via our [2] StoryHub.  Our portfolio of high-quality, secure products and services covers PCs, workstations, servers, storage, smart TVs, and a family of mobile products like smartphones, tablets, and apps. Everyone here at Lenovo is an integral part of the company, working together, across continents, cultures, and innovations, all comprised in a friendly, fast-paced, work environment that focuses on one common goal: to be known as the best in what we do.  The Asia Pac Device as a Service Pursuit Director will be responsible for managing a team of Asia Pac-based sales professionals tasked with selling Lenovo’s portfolio of services along with award-winning PCs to customers and partners in a Device as a Service model. The services in a DaaS model include but are not limited to Deployment Services, Premier Support, Service Contract Upgrades, Protection Services, Migration Services, and Maintenance along with professional services that are required to Design, Deploy, and Support client products. In addition, the role will manage the global DaaS software development sales team that will focus on and drive software solutions under the DaaS model.  Your team will be expected to attain sales targets through driving new business and evangelizing Lenovo’s Device as a Service offering. You will need to demonstrate the ability to take initiative and provide leadership in a growing business. You will need to have a successful track record of selling services and complex solutions that enable or enhance a PC hardware sale. You will champion the innovative power of our products to make companies more productive, collaborative and transformative. You will need to understand Lenovo’s portfolio of award-winning products and services and develop strategies to help new and existing enterprise customers find and implement the best solutions.  Reporting to the worldwide DaaS Pursuit Director, the AP DaaS Pursuit Director will be expected to drive sales calls, while also attending joint calls with sales team members at all levels of the customer organization. This is a client-facing sales role requiring deep industry experience, the ability to identify, cultivate, and close net new business, and expertise working large deals at the C level.  Key Responsibilities: Identify, develop, and close new large enterprise opportunities within the territory across multiple verticals Achieve sales objectives for Lenovo while driving growth across multiple product sets Manage and motivate high-performing DaaS and software sales teams to hit sales goals Develop, implement, and execute an effective regional sales strategy to achieve sales goals Develop C level relationships and serve as a trusted consultant to customers Understand and adapt to Lenovo’s ongoing product and services developments and how to incorporate them into an "as a Service" model Lead a cross-functional team within the geographies to keep deals moving through the funnel Ensure that our customers receive world-class sales and customer service Effectively and consistently use the company CRM and other reporting tools to track key sales metrics and consistently meet those metrics  Position Requirements:  We're looking to add talented individuals who are self-motivated and desire boundless opportunities, to join us. Come share in the discoveries that are forged from our shared achievements at Lenovo as we drive the next generation in technology.  Minimum Requirements: BA/BS degree or equivalent professional work experience 10+ years of successful Enterprise technology sales is required Extensive experience managing and motivating sales teams Demonstrated track record of top performance with multi-million dollar quota In-depth knowledge of "as a Service" models and their value proposition Direct experience in IT Services Industry focused on PC’s Proven success in building solutions in the IT services industry Strategic mindset and sound business acumen are required, along with effective decision making, contract negotiation, and partner management skills Excellent communication, both oral and written, and polished presentation skills Strong prioritization skills, attention to detail, commitment to deadlines Proven ability to operate with a high level of professionalism, entrepreneurialism and agility Demonstrated ability to work across all levels of the organization with a teaming attitude Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel Travel estimated at 50%  Preferred Requirements: Experience with MS Dynamics, D365 & ServiceNow Consumption based sales experience in SaaS, DaaS, or Cloud Services MBA or Advanced technical degree  References  Visible links https://www.lenovo.com/ http://storyhub.lenovo.com/  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: MatchMove Pay (HQ in Singapore) is looking to hire a Legal and Compliance Director to serve as MatchMove’s financial regulatory legal counsel across multiple Asia jurisdictions to support a rapidly growing business in the region. Reporting to the CEO and COO, the incumbent will provide support on legal, regulatory and commercial advice for daily business operations and general commercial and transactional matters involving the various global payment platforms in Asia, including commercial and procurement contract negotiations, drafting and reviewing of license applications and regulatory responses in conjunction with applicable laws and regulations framework.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Draft and negotiate contracts for regional payments with business partners covering technical integration, information security, data processing, regulatory compliance, settlement and marketing. Provide strategic legal and commercial advice to our regional sales teams on payment laws, regulations, data protection, compliance and risks relating to our business. Partner with sales, product and compliance teams to resolve open contractual points. Draft and negotiate ad hoc agreements to support commercial activities (e.g. referral, exclusivity). Draft contract templates for new services and update existing ones to ensure compliance with new regulations. Represent MatchMove on various fintech/payments-related topics before regulators, banking partners and other external audiences. Manage and instruct external counsel on regulatory and compliance issues. Coordinate execution of agreements and legalization of documents with regional colleagues and counterparties. Assist in general legal, commercial and regulatory compliance matters, such as MAS audits/reporting and any other regulatory reporting and compliance matters. Work closely with multi-cultural senior management and shareholders. Support corporate secretary tasks and other departments to ensure compliance across the stakeholders  REQUIREMENTS  Qualified lawyer with 6 to 8 PQE with regional experience across APAC, ideally from another FinTech company with financial regulatory background, specifically in payments. Prior experience working in major financial institution, financial services regulatory authority, or sophisticated financial services regulatory practice within a major law firm. Familiar with anti-money laundering, data privacy, consumer protection and anti-bribery issues. A commercially savvy “business enabler”, who can proactively engage various stakeholders. Decisive, with excellent judgment, and adept at making smart decisions when faced with ambiguity and imperfect information. Executive presence, ability to lead and influence, and to articulate legal issues in layman terms. Excellent communicator (written and verbal), with an ability to make complex regulatory concepts clear to business teams, engineers and regulators. Strong knowledge on Singapore laws and regulations especially in the Payment Services Act by MAS.  MatchMove Culture: To work in a fast-moving growing startup, fun and yet professional environment that recognizes and rewards individual contributions and also team success. To work with highly motivated and diverse people who are totally focused on winning by combining great teamwork, rapid execution and an uncompromising approach to quality and customer satisfaction. We strongly encourage Innovation, Collaboration, Creativity, and Initiative.  Come Join Our Dynamic Team!   Personal Data Protection Act: By submitting your application for this job, you are authorizing MatchMove to: collect and use your personal data, and to disclose such data to any third party with whom MatchMove or any of its related corporation has service arrangements, in each case for all purposes in connection with your job application, and employment with MatchMove; and retain your personal data for one year for consideration of future job opportunities (where applicable).

jobTitle: Head of Client Services, Securities Services - Director
description: In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 18,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.  Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 68 markets with more than 193,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region. excluding partnerships BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team.  https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/  Department purpose / objectives The Client Services team is part of the Securities Services Client Development team. The Client Development Team is responsible for sales, client relationship management and client satisfaction. Within this team Client Services oversees service delivery with an overall responsibility to ensure an optimised client experience for each client. The Global Client Services Management team aims to implement a global service model to ensure a consistent top-quality client experience worldwide. The global client services team is composed of the client services teams in each of the locations together with a central team managing the global tools and processes to facilitate their overall mission. The client services team is responsible for service delivery oversight, client satisfaction and client communication as well as managing relationships with the third party asset managers serving the business’s asset owner clients. In addition, the client services team oversees account opening and client onboarding activities (under the responsibility of Business Implementation). Oversight of client satisfaction includes ensuring that the services delivered are aligned with the service level agreements, managing regular client service reviews to ensure ongoing fulfilment of client expectations and working transversally across the organisation to address any issues or queries escalated by the clients. In addition, the client services managers monitor the touch points of the client across the entire organisation to ensure that the clients’ experience with BNP Paribas is optimised. The client services managers are also expected to act as the champions of client focus for the rest of the business. Given the global nature of the business and clients, the client services managers are expected to work together across locations as part of a unified global team serving individual clients in each location and overseeing their clients’ activities anywhere in the world. Purpose Of The Position The Head of Client Services for the location is responsible for the activities of the client services team in the location, which is responsible for the transversal management of the overall client experience for clients based in the location and for clients using services in the location. This means providing management, guidance, information, tools and support to ensure the client service managers are able to optimise their oversight of service delivery in the location. The Head of Client Services for the location is a key figure in the management team of the location to ensure that all of the areas across the business work together to optimise the activities which ultimately impact the client experience. The team manager also represents the location in the global project to transform the overall management of the client experience of the Securities Services business across all locations and to ensure an efficient, consistent and quality approach to achieving the global client services team’s mission. The Head of Client Services should be seen as the local champion leveraging on the uplifting service culture, language and toolkit. Key Responsibilities Of The Role  The head of client services manages the team of people responsible for the following:  Client Understand the client’s strategy and requirements to enable BNP Paribas Securities Services to deliver on the client needs Manage the operational contact between client and the operational areas by ensuring a full understanding of the client’s needs and expectations across the organisation and providing clarity for the actions required to service the client Identify and produce appropriate key management information / business metrics (based on the global standards) to communicate and facilitate the client relationship Host client service meetings Manage client reviews and due diligence questionnaires and visits for existing clients; ensure regular formal performance reviews are conducted with clients according to strategic priorities and client needs Document, coordinate and oversee resolution of problems or issues affecting the quality of service delivery and the overall client experience Ensure clients receive appropriate market and service information by managing the distribution lists for updates and newsletters Organisation Engage the Operations teams in the pursuit of service quality delivery and improvement Ensure an aligned service delivery and communication approach to clients across internal business lines (Asset Owners, Asset Managers, FI&C, Alternative Investors) Facilitate the resolution of escalated operational issues across the organisation by establishing and overseeing a formal service governance framework Monitor the performance of the service delivery against the operating procedures and service levels agreed with the client Use issue logs (query database) for review both internally and with the client Manage process for formal complaints Maintain action plans and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and ensure they are fit for purpose and up to date Ensure consistent messages are delivered to the client around business recovery incidents in accordance to issued guidelines Fully adhere to BNP Paribas Compliance, Financial Security (Know Your Customer “KYC”, Anti-Money Laundering “AML”, Anti-Bribery and Corruption “ABC” and Sanctions), Conduct & Risks policies Business Refer new business development opportunities to the Relationship Manager Contribute to product/service development initiatives Contribute to client strategy meetings with relationship managers Contribute to the development of the BNP Paribas Securities Services brand and market reputation Skills And Experience Required  Competencies required for the role: Extensive experience in a role with a strong client management focus Prior management positions in a fast moving, complex environment Proven ability for clear and professional communication, written and oral (fluency in English and local language required) Ability to identify and implement solutions in a competent and creative manner Ability to work effectively in teams Ability to effectively influence decisions and actions transversally even without direct management control Ability to foster and maintain strong interpersonal internal and external relationships Experience in securities services operational activities useful Experience in operational activities of securities services clients useful Primary Location  SG-06-Singapore  Job Type  Standard / Permanent  Job  CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT  Education Level  Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)  Experience Level  At least 12 years

description: vVolve Management Consultants is a Singapore-based Digital Transformation company making enterprises intelligent using intelligent ERP (SAP S4Hana), Enterprise information management (OpenText), intelligent automation (Microsoft and RPA), Data analytics (different tools), Cloud technologies (hyperscalers like Azure & Google) and Machine learning.   We help enterprises in their Business Transformation journey through Digitization, Automation, and Improvement of business processes.  Job description We are seeking SAP Consulting Director to join vVolve’s management team. Consulting Director is responsible for leading and growing the firm while delivering the top notch client service. Responsible for developing & managing key accounts. The focus is to manage their own projects P/L. Director is expected to have wider experience of SAP Solutions and Customer engagements. Mentor and engage in professional development of team members.  Objectives of this Role  Serve as key advisor to senior client executives and Decision Makers Revenue management & consulting-led pipeline management Mentor and engage in professional development of team members Manage team’s utilisation and forecast Lead firm’s development efforts Build firms USP  Direct and oversee client engagements Consulting for large scale complex & multiple projects Experience in working in a matrix environment and working collaboratively with other teams Continuous learning  Responsibilities  Director is expected to behave like Entrepreneur, identify the opportunities, Customer relationship, Solutioning, Capability building, Delivery and support. Working with clients’ executives to outline roadmaps, budgets & investment proposals Translate customer business issues/opportunities into solution/business requirements Build and communicate the value proposition of the end-to-end solution to client executives and drive transformational business activities Be part of SAP Partner management Develop In-house capabilities Work with other Partners and Sales team to address the customer needs Work with Sales and Marketing team to conduct Seminars, Workshops, sponsor relevant events and write contents in your specialisation area. Mentor and engage in professional development of team members  Skills and Qualifications 10+ years in SAP Consulting Must have international consulting experience Should have managed Project stakeholders and project management SAP S/4Hana experience and good knowledge on Migration of ECC to S4 Should have knowledge and experience of SAP licensing model Exposure to S/4HANA (on-premise and cloud) solutions & value discovery tools for S4HANA are added advantage Able to provide solution using multiple SAP modules or Products Excellent communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, and organizational skills Strong leadership to lead the team & People Person Worked as in similar capacity with track of consistently achieving revenue quota  Preferred Qualifications MBA or a Bachelor’s degree Ability to balance persuasion with professionalism, ability to work with multiple team to address the customer need Passion to be an Entrepreneur Must be able to see big picture and eye for details   Contact Information  CV should be sent to Talent@vVolve.com

We believe that the right idea will move seamlessly across channels: from online to offline, above the line to below the line, in-store to out-of-home. jobTitle: Director of Risk and Compliance (Cards and Programs)
description: What's the story?  Nium is a next-generation financial services platform  that enables companies around the world to unlock new revenue opportunities and improve cash flow economics   Nium is a leader in its geographical and payment service breadth, owning licenses in the world's largest and fastest-growing economies. Our modular platform allows banks, payment providers, travel companies, and other businesses to collect and disburse funds in local currencies to over 100 countries, plus issue physical and virtual cards globally. Our proprietary set of APIs embeds financial services and can bring to life multiple B2B and B2C use cases in a matter of weeks.   Nium is part of CB Insights Fintech 250, which highlights the most promising Fintech companies globally. Today, Nium serves over 130 million customers and enables platforms to provide access to financial services to over 3 billion people across the world.   Where do you come into the picture?   The Risk and Compliance Director is responsible for managing new corporate customers and Program Managers (PM) risk and compliance in the cards space with a view of balancing the risk and return and complying to the regulatory and scheme compliance of the various jurisdictions. The role holder will ensure customer business activities are in line with our company policies and customer financial exposure is properly assessed and controlled within acceptable limits. In addition, the role holder will also conduct regular PM and third-party audits and produces risk and compliance reports to assist in managing the regional clients' portfolio.   The role holder will be the APAC contact point for the regional sales teams on new applications as well as any requests raised from existing clients. Reporting to the APAC Head of Compliance , the role holder will also work closely with the Business, Sourcing, Fraud, and Regulatory Compliance teams to ensure that all related risks are maintained within the company's risk appetite.   What would a day in your life @ Nium look like?   As Director of Risk and Compliance, Cards, for our cards business, you would:   Be responsible for Risk and Compliance programs for institutional clients for the Cards, Pay-in and Pay-out businesses for APAC Be the global subject matter expert from a Risk and Compliance perspective for the Cards business; develop and implement related policies, procedures and processes Partner with business, product, operations, legal and regulatory teams to evaluate, onboard and deliver relevant training to enable success of the program managers or agents Drive improvements in our on-boarding and screening processes and tools, e.g. e-KYC, advance detection Develop and enhance program oversight and audit framework and lead all periodic and ad-hoc program review efforts; develop program monitoring processes and drive governance efforts of all program partners and third-party intermediaries Conduct periodic customer reviews and audits to ensure existing programs are in line with the contractual agreement with NIUM and our AML risk is properly assessed and is underwritten within the approved level. Act as the trusted risk and compliance advisor to all stakeholders across Nium, influence and drive the appropriate risk and compliance culture across the organization Maintain awareness of regulatory developments and incorporate required changes into the Nium Risk and Compliance strategy for Cards and institutional clients. Enhance and lead efforts relating to Risk and Compliance new product road-map updates, work with tech and product stakeholders to drive scalability, efficiency, and effectiveness.  Requirements:  What expertise & experiences would you need to have to play this kind of role?  10+ years of risk management and compliance experience in a banking, payment or financial technology firm Must possess experience in risk and compliance for card issuing and merchant acquiring Strong program and project management skills and experience Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and embrace changes effortlessly Experienced in balancing risk and compliance efforts with business growth objectives  Benefits:  Comprehensive Health Insurance Home Office setup allowance Training & Development 24x7 Employee Assistance Program Recognition framework Generous Parental and Family leave
industries: Financial Services

Through Epsilon PeopleCloud, the marketing platform for personalizing consumer journeys with performance transparency, Epsilon helps marketers anticipate, activate and prove measurable business outcomes. Powered by CORE ID®, the most accurate and stable identity management platform representing 200+ million people, Epsilon’s award-winning data and technology is rooted in privacy by design and underpinned by powerful AI. Management to identify market trends, solution benefits and contribute to direction of product roadmap  Role will include preparing and delivering on product demonstrations  What You Will Need Minimum of 11 years’ industry experience Bachelor’s or Advanced Degree preferred Able to configure / customize demo environments (either individually or working with a remote team) Understand and articulate value proposition of software products to help attract, engage and retain prospects/customers across verticals Be conversant in both the business and technical aspects of solution to confidently meetings, with a strong ability to consume, distill and process information in real-time in order to problem solve in the context of the solution Prior Solution Consulting / Sales Engineering verbal communication skills Will require up to 50% travel

jobTitle: Director, Industry Relations & Global Network APAC
description: A culture of purpose: Where will your BCD M&E career take you?   As perfectionists, artists, strategic thinkers and leaders in the industry, we believe culture is defined by its people. We are looking for exceptional people who rise to our standards while bringing their unique perspective to the table. Are you interested in adding to both our mission and our energy? If so, we want to hear from you!   Director, Industry Relations & Global Network APAC   Reporting to the Managing Director, APAC and Global Industry Relations, the Director, Industry Relations & Global Network will assume overall responsibility to execute BCD M&E's global industry relations strategy and annual supplier income goals for the APAC region. In addition, oversees the APAC global network strategy, aligning with the overall global strategy, in achievement of APAC annual income goals.   The Director, Industry Relations & Global Network will support, execute and drive Industry Relations & Global Network regional vision, strategic plan, business objectives, and Focus Four goals for the APAC region, ensuring oversight, management, performance, and relationship development of supplier partners & global network as directed.       Your responsibilities:   Industry Relations    Supports in the ideation, development, and implementation of Industry Relations strategy and annual objectives. Includes but not limited to supplier partner evaluation/vetting, commercial enhancement of supplier partner agreements, and establishment of new supplier partner agreements, as directed.  Accountable for support in achieving annual global & APAC regional supplier income targets.  Oversees specific assigned global and regional preferred partner relationships including; management, maintenance, agreement renewal, annual strategic plan development/execution, and connectivity w/APAC account teams (includes Global Network).  Responsible for increasing preferred supplier market share & supplier income through regional adoption and compliance of preferred partners.  Work closely with APAC MD, Senior Leadership Team, country leaders & global network leadership in support of global & regional Industry Relations goals and initiatives.  Responsible for APAC Eved adoption & compliance through training, account team consultation, RFP monitoring, & dissemination/review of individual account team Eved stats.  Knows Eved, Cvent, 1000 Meetings functionality at a high level to support simple training and respond to basic regional questions/needs.  Responsible for ensuring Industry Relations quarterly reports by APAC account teams (including global network partners) are timely, accurate, & complete.  Reviews preferred hotel supplier production to goals with each APAC account team and APAC SLT quarterly, and assists with strategies to improve performance, compliance, and drive preferred share.  APAC liaison to global Industry Relations for hotels, DMCs, and other supplier categories as applicable.  Regional contact for Industry Relations for consulting & supplier issue/resolution escalation.  Conducts new supplier partner risk assessments, negotiations, onboarding, & implementations as directed.  Responsible for engagement and leverage of APAC IR Ambassadors to maximize commercial opportunities within each account team.  Responsible for maximizing performance of commercial agreements by increasing regional adoption and compliance of preferred partners.  Ensures all regional supplier partners are vetted & routinely reevaluated to minimize client & BCD risk.  Measures & reports on APAC account teams, markets, and region performance against targeted goals.  Responsible for Industry Relations regional communication, updates, & marketing to support initiatives  Conduit for the voice of BCD M&E and our client base to the APAC industry marketplace.  Supports regional supplier advisory boards, key industry events, speaking engagements, & trade shows as a hosted buyer that benefit BCD M&E & clients, as approved & directed.  Keeps current on industry trends, competitive set, and supplier marketplace.  Travel may be required to APAC offices in support of Industry Relations and/or Global Network initiatives/strategies.  Work closely with Industry Relations leadership team members to manage/monitor sponsorship and comp room needs as applicable for APAC; determine supplier selection strategy per opportunity.  Establish, maintain, and build strong, trusting, & solution-oriented relationships across BCD M&E's global supplier base and with APAC account team leaders in support of daily responsibilities.  Support APAC team as required in the following but not limited to; client/sales/MM consultations, proposal strategies, product knowledge, & presentations where applicable.    Global Network    Accountable for support in achieving annual APAC regional Global Network income.  Oversees new APAC Global Network Partner identification, development, recruitment, contract negotiations, implementation, training, and ongoing management when required by APAC MD.  Responsible for managing and monitoring APAC Global Network Partners as contracted. In addition, ensures metrics are developed (with respective LATAM & EMEA counterparts) to measure Partner performance and that all commitments are successfully met.  Ensures APAC Global Network Partners are receiving appropriate refresh training for ongoing implementations and growth opportunities.  Responsible for ensuring a strong APAC Global Network Partner connection to BCD M&E brand and culture through increased APAC regional leadership interaction and relationship development.  Ensures all required reporting (financial, operational, Industry Relations, others) is accurate, complete, and delivered on time. Ensure Partners understand requirements, expectations, rationale, and their commitment.  With APAC regional leader support, ensure focus on service level consistency and quality, and that Partners are managing to respective BCD M&E & client SOPs/KPIs.  Works to improve upon the value proposition of being a BCD M&E Partner in order to ensure both parties are reaping the benefits of the partnership.  Supports APAC regional sales leader, where requested, to assist with Partner support needs.  Participates in APAC and global hosted industry events and relevant forums where appropriate/approved that support Partner Network strategy and development.  Ensures BCD M&E brand is being represented by the APAC Global Network as outlined in each Partner agreement and always in a beneficial and positive manner for BCD M&E.  Responsible for APAC Global Network Summits. Attends other Global Network Summits as requested.  Highly visible, thus requires a clear understanding of BCD M&E operations, ES, MM, financial models, and client service needs/expectations. Ability to clearly articulate western business practices/expectations.  Act as the APAC regional escalation point for Global Network Partner issue/resolution.  Ensure APAC MD is made of aware of any challenges, issues, or needs along with suggested solution(s).    Industry Relations & Partner Network:    Assumes/performs other duties & responsibilities not specifically outlined herein that are logically inherent to the position, including special projects (i.e. acquisition due diligence & integrations.   You're good at:  Professional business approach, understanding, & ability to work in a multi-cultural environment w/ease.  Ability to lead, set direction, collaborate, & achieve results through others.  Ability to work independently, set strategies, implement action plans, and achieve goals.  Ability to interact and work with all levels of customers, suppliers, industry colleagues, and internal teams/leaders.  Excellent oral and written communication skills, including public speaking & presentations.  Adept at change management.  Effective organizational & time management skills with a strong ability to manage multiple complex projects and timelines.  Ability to think innovatively, strategically and conceptually.  Expert at problem solving; anticipating, initiating, & resolving client, global network, & supplier issues.  Expert in identifying, developing, negotiating, and managing preferred/approved supplier commercial agreements.  Expert in identifying, developing, negotiating, and managing global network partnerships, agreements, and commercial terms.  Excellent relationship management & team building skills.  Able to work well under pressure and adapt to ever-changing marketplace needs & challenges.  Able to delegate, work with, and drive performance with teams who don't report to you directly.  Self-starter who innovates, initiates, and implements new ideas.   You might also have:  Bachelor's degree preferred  10+ years of meetings & events industry experience  5+ years of regional leadership experience  5+ years of supplier relationship management responsibility/accountability  5+ years of negotiating supplier preferred agreements and/or contracts  Minimum of 3 years-experience managing people.  Expert business knowledge and experience working with APAC region markets & cultural nuances  Solid industry rapport with suppliers across multiple supplier categories  Excellent negotiation, contract management, and contract escalation/resolution skills  Strong inter-personnel relationship and development skills  Strong analytical skills  Self-starter  Proficiency in English (reading, writing, speaking)  Proficiency in additional languages a plus (reading, writing, speaking)  Excellent oral and written communication skills, including public speaking & presentations  Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications  Advanced proficiency/experience w/Microsoft Excel & Pivot Tables a plus  Exceptional product knowledge worldwide  Ability to learn and operate in multi-software applications    What we offer you:    A culture of purpose where we are invested in your happiness and career growth  Competitive salary and benefits package   How to apply:   Click apply now to be considered.   Get to know BCD M&E:   At BCD Meetings & Events (BCD M&E), we provide more than meeting and event planning and execution. We are in the business of creating impactful human connections that matter. Connections that inspire, motivate and change behavior for our customers. As the world's most trusted and innovative meetings and events agency, BCD M&E cultivates a culture of people, passion and purpose to drive business forward.   Headquartered in Chicago, with locations in 50+ countries across the world, BCD M&E's team of 1,500+ people are committed to driving success for our customers, our business and ourselves.   See if you belong at bcdme.com.   This position is not open to third-party recruiting agencies.

description: LOCATION: NEAR MACPHERSON MRT STATION ROLE DESCRIPTION The Digital Marketing Executive reports to the Director and is responsible for contributing to the overall marketing strategy across major platforms and channels: e-commerce site, retail outlets, customer relationship management, social media & collaborations.You will play a key role in shaping Dr.Bags digital presence and brand awareness throughout this journey. The main responsibility for this position is to manage online platform such as Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Google SEO and SEM to develop develop, implement, track and optimize our digital marketing campaigns across our digital channels, to support business objectives, lead acquisition, foster customer retention and provide sales support to our community of clients.  The ideal candidate is an articulate, creative and self-motivated individual with a keen eye on beauty. As we continue to lead the luxury restoration industry in Singapore, we are looking for a candidate who appreciates superior craftsmanship, fashion and art. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES Understand Dr.Bags’ brand positioning and develop strategic social media communication plans with clear timelines to enhance and support the brand’s digital content goals and promotions to increase traffic, conversions, leads and growth revenues Manage social media platforms to build communities across different channels such as our website, e-commerce sites, IG, FB, TikTok and retail outlets. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure consistent brand voice and to achieve clear engagement goals. Understand backend of Facebook Commerce & E-commerce platforms. Plan online marketing calendar and social media posts to ensure project timelines and deadlines are met Conceptualise and execute social media campaigns for a luxury restoration brand to engage and start conversations with online communities. Invite and secure partners to collaborate in campaigns. Preparation of content (graphics, photoshoot, videos, content write-up & post-production in line with a creative vision in mind) for IG, IGS, IG live, online initiatives, and collaborations with personalities and key opinion leaders Research, analyse and present novel and fresh ways to approach and execute social content. Track digital marketing budgets to ensure effective budget utilisation Manage & track analytics to keep improving our offers, strategies to generate more leads and conversions Manage clients’ feedback, enquiries and response professionally to ensure high levels of customers satisfaction through excellent service COMPETENCIES Active participation in strategic planning process, developing goals objectives and branding roadmaps Gain experience in Brand Campaign Management Develop effective communication skills and collaboration skills through regular cross-functional communications with Repair, Restore, Refresh and Growth teams Gain experience in Creative writing, Adobe programs, Canva, videography and photography skills Gain experience in Social media Management Gain experience in Customer experience analysis Develop proficiency in market research to understand global market and industry trends Learn to manage and resolve clients’ related issues DURATION OF TRAINEESHIP OFFERED: 6 months (opportunity to convert to permanent role after 6 months) Mid October 2021 to 08 May 2022 APPROVED TRAINING ALLOWANCE Fresh Graduates - $2100 Non-Mature Mid-Career Individuals - $2600 Mature Mid-Career Individuals - $3300 Education Qualifications Required for the Traineeship Role under SGUnited Traineeship: This position is open for both recent graduates and mid-career individuals (mature and non mature). Graduates interested in this position should possess a Poly Diploma Qualification. Mid-career individuals from any qualification level can apply Eligibility Criteria For SGUnitedTraineeships Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident; and Graduated or graduating in calendar year 2019, 2020 or 2021 from polytechnic or university Graduated earlier from above institutions and completed National Service in 2019 or 2020.

description: Let’s Talk About You  Leads the business segment while also developing and managing opportunities / projects to ensure and achieve defined economic results.  Your profile Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field is preferred 10+ years’ experience working for a major electrical contractor, with proven experience in leading teams. At least 2-3 years of work experience in a sales role and relevant training and experience in Project Management and in executing projects Work experience in an engineering role or as a site / field service technical expert would be beneficial. Experience and knowledge of High Voltage transmission industry (including Service) in Singapore / Asia Pacific. Positive attitude to work in challenging environment and in embracing high performance culture. Understands cultural differences and copes with them effectively. Strong competence in using IT Tools including Microsoft, SAP, and Salesforce applications. Professional English required, where additional Asian languages will be a benefit. Willing to travel within the Asian region and from time to time to Europe Ability to improvise and willingness to experience unpredictable situations Your Responsibilities Fully responsible for the country business Profit & Loss targets and manages the budget for Singapore & Brunei for Transmission Services Establish close contact and professional relationships with local Customers (e.g. SP Group, Shell, Exon, Air Liquide, BPC, PUB, PLP, YTL, Sembcorp etc.) & Key industry Stakeholders (e.g. EMA, etc) meeting on a regular basis to ensure successful implementation of ongoing projects and push/secure new opportunities Developing and managing sales opportunities and implementation of projects Drives and implements T SV Hub & local identified initiatives and MasterPlan measures. Creates transparency within the region, including making clear priorities for short/long term growth & sustainability in line with unique local understanding of markets and customers Establish close contact and professional relationships with local contractors (e.g. Guthrie, SWTS, HiPower, etc) and evaluate / develop the potential as preferred suppliers or even as business partners with targets to secure additional business volume. Governance & reporting – Financials / Risks / Value Add / Escalation point / People development Collaborates and explores further growth opportunities with other business units and segments including other service divisions and the other Transmission departments and sales teams. Your opportunities for personal growth The role will give you regional and global exposure The role exposes you to cooperate with many different parts of the organization and all levels of hierarchy providing different insights and angles to the challenges at hand Let’s Talk About Us  "Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.  Siemens Energy Transmission Services division is one of the leading service providers in the world with a broad portfolio of innovative products and services including expert factory and field service support, maintenance, operation, repairs, replacements, modernizations and upgrades of components to ensure the highest availability of high voltage transmission assets - We keep the world energized!  MORE INSIGHTS  Be Energized. Be you.  Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.  Jobs & Careers: https://www.siemens-energy.com/global/en/company/jobs.html  Organization: Gas and Power  Company: Siemens Energy Pte. Ltd.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time

description: Singtel, Asia’s leading communications technology group, provides an extensive range of telecommunications and digital services to millions of consumers and businesses across Asia, Australia, Africa and the USA. With over 140 years of innovation behind us, we continue to push boundaries in our networks and services, to enrich lives and transform businesses.  Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Our diverse business means you will enjoy unique opportunities and rewarding experiences to learn and grow your career in a dynamic industry.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  Job Title - Director – Product Management & Partnership (Cloud)  Your primary responsibility is to lead the overall cloud Product Management/development strategy of new and existing products and services within the Singtel Enterprise Cloud Business.  You will supervise and provide leadership to the Partnership team which will be responsible to identify, managed and maintain strategic cloud and technology partnership which is critical for the expansion and growth of the Singtel and Optus cloud business.  Key Responsibilities To lead the creation of Cloud based products, services and solution that will benefit both SME and Enterprise customers. To accomplish this, you will lead product roadmaps, feature prioritization, and project delivery in the Cloud services portfolio. Define the business requirements to product management and development teams, to turn information in to insights and turn insights in to business decisions Key performance reports for products: Monthly and Year to Date revenue compared to budget Product pipeline and prospects, Closed won/lost Review the reports with Product Managers Analyse, Drive agree corrective actions, track and review financial changes that might impact the product P&L (Profit & Loss)Price revision in different segments and impacts thereof Competitors analysis Ensure new cloud service products end to end enablement : Sales and GTM Day 0, 1 and 2 services capability enablement Process controls in place for new service product release Commercial and legal agreements in place for release. Decides whether the New Cloud Products and related services are aligned to Customer needs and achieving the required objectives Decides on the Cloud Product pricing strategy for wholesale, SME and enterprise; Developing a comprehensive annual plan including time lines to guide the Products Management and development teams in the achievement of the medium and short-term objectives; Actioning the annual plan into quarterly and monthly phases to manage the Product Business Unit Manage and maintain the Cloud Product Development Roadmap and align with cross functional stakeholders to ensure the execution thereof Lead and Manage Product Management & Development Teams Ensure set product targets are met, through regular reviews Review, Agree and update roadmaps Assist Product Managers as appropriate, to engage all departments regarding Cloud product performance and possible enhancement Ensure the Product life cycle management is followed. You will investigate, develop, hypothesize, validate, integrate and deliver on appropriate technical controls into Singtel and Optus Cloud services portfolio and integrating with other products houses as well Work closely with Channel/Partner/Sales -- adding new sales channels and 3rd party resellers and partners. In addition, the role must work closely with Global Products and Cybersecurity Business Units to broaden the cloud portfolio with network and security propositions. Overall responsible for leading strategic Partnership positioning, joint proposition development, joint account development, enablement and managing Singtel and Optus partner relationships at all levels of the business, from global to account and proposition teams. Own and Lead, alliances function and drive partnership with revenue targets through partner Drive sales and partner enablement work closely with management to craft partner programs targeted at increasing Singtel and Optus cloud sales and lead/motivate a small team of high-achievers. Strengthen cloud business capabilities and talent to support cloud sales across Singtel Group CFUs Ideal Candidate Should Possess Masters Level / Bachelor in business, information technology or related field preferred with 15 years of experiences 5 years or more in cloud, business development and Cloud Technology, partners management Working knowledge of architecting Cloud solutions, deploying Cloud/Virtualization solutions in SME / Enterprise customers. Experience in product development and life cycle management; working with cloud solution/product portfolios Knowledge of cloud industry and competitor products and services Experience in building meaningful products, partnerships and ecosystems. The following cloud certifications are highly desired;   AWS Certified Solution Architect – Professional   AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional   Microsoft Certified – Azure Solutions Architect Expert   Microsoft Certified – Azure DevOps Engineer Expert   Microsoft and/or Amazon specialist certifications  We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

description: Shiseido Asia Pacific was established in Singapore as headquarters for the region in January 2016. With Asia’s massive growth potential and Singapore’s strategic location close to key Asian markets, this has enabled Shiseido to garner deeper Asian consumer insights, localize marketing and most importantly quickly cultivate and deliver brands that Asian customers know and love through faster decision-making and execution.  Position Summary A key member of the senior creative team, the Associate Copy Director, will help to deliver premium and aspirational 360˚creative brand and social campaigns, big ideas and exquisite execution across digital and omnichannel platforms. The ACD role will closely partner with the CPB ECD on Experience brand and campaign launches. The role will collaborate with all HQ and international creative teams to ensure excellence in thinking, creative consistency, quality of copy content across all touchpoints needs of CPB campaign delivery, with an emphasis on digital branded and social communications. Serve as an ACD on CPB’s global Business, helping to drive digital transformation in communications, bringing fresh open-minded attitude, creative brilliance with transcreation of big global ideas and an understanding of media implementation. Develop a strong relationship with the Marketing and Digital teams. Develop creative and innovative campaigns that connect and engage with our premium/luxury customers Roles And Responsibilities Create the copy content for assigned promotion assets for “Clé de Peau Beauté” (“Brand”) such as; TV, Print ads, digital content, press kits, point of sales materials. Motivate, direct, lead and mentor a multi-disciplinary team of creatives. Contribute to upskill internal creative teams and genuinely help unlock their best. Encourage the team to think beyond a brief’s checklist and what’s expected Requirements Ten years of related experience of creative direction in an agency setting. Understanding and experience creating integrated content across all marketing channels from digital, social media, paid media, mobile, and print. Highly skilled with leading a team of creative talent with a strong creative vision with an understanding of business objectives.

jobTitle: Senior Director, Demand Facilitation Lead - Asia
description: Join our team as a Senior Director, Demand Facilitation Lead - Asia in Singapore.  We’re Magnite (NASDAQ: MGNI), the world’s largest independent sell-side advertising platform. Publishers use our technology to monetize their content across all screens and formats including OTT, CTV, online video, display, and audio. The world's leading agencies and brands trust our platform to access brand-safe, high-quality ad inventory and execute billions of advertising transactions each month. In April 2021, we acquired SpotX to further enhance our CTV business and better help our clients in this rapidly growing market. Anchored in Singapore, Indonesia, Japan, Sydney, Los Angeles, New York City, Denver, London, Magnite has offices across North America, EMEA, LATAM, and APAC.  The Senior Director, Demand Facilitation Lead - Asia, will be responsible for building and leading the Demand Facilitation team in Asia, with a focus on forming strategic demand-side relationships with the leading media agencies, buying/planning/strategy teams, agency trading teams, DSPs and other strategic buyers in Asia.  Here's What You'll Be Doing Build, train, lead and motivate a sales consultative team across the Asia region. Set the strategy and focus for the team to continue to drive accelerated growth and leading customer service. Manage and understand relationships with buyers across video, display, DOOH and audio ecosystem. Partner with the Magnite supply and demand operations teams, marketing, product and partnerships teams. Evolve & Evangelize all buying techniques utilized through our programmatic and managed service infrastructure to ad buyers Help to build out the business by creating workflows and communicating new process to the sales team Create unique and customized partnership offerings for high profile agency ad buyers Creatively market new publisher inventory to ad buyer network Evaluate the rapidly evolving ad tech ecosystem for new ideas/opportunities to guide the company's business strategy and growth for said holding company Forecast monthly, quarterly & annual revenue for management Meet/exceed quarterly & annual revenue quotas Operates effectively within a global company, soliciting feedback on key accounts from other markets and reciprocating appropriately to ensure effective collaboration. Captures product features required to bring on new business, delivering revenue cases that can be used to aid prioritization. Effectively & proactively communicate strategy and solutions to account team and management. Partner with Asia marketing teams to develop out and attract partner involvement within press releases, case studies, thought leadership, business social sharing and custom events. Be an active and positive presence within the Magnite Asia team Act as subject matter expert internally and externally for programmatic buying and selling of online media. Provide input to Management that helps shape team policies and processes. Travel time expected to be 20-30% of time (subject to new business travel norms) Perform other related duties as assigned by management Qualifications & Experience 13+ years of experience in the online digital space working with DSPs, Agency Trading Desks, Agencies and Brands. Intimate familiarity with online video advertising and the video lumascape. Must have a strong ability to present to small and large groups, including industry events. Effectively engage in detailed conversations with clients of all seniority levels. Successful partnership relations within Agencies: including C-suite, Heads of Digital, Trading Directors and Client leads. Senior connections across DSPs, Trading desks and leading regional brands. Ability to understand/present complex products and deal structures. Desire to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth, and technical environment. Proven track record in selling and leading sales teams in Asia. Bachelor’s degree, MBA preferred. Previous experience working within senior agency roles preferred. Based in Singapore, with 6+ years’ experience in APAC. Here's What We Are Looking For Bachelor's Degree (BA) from four-year college or university, or one to two years of related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Superior interpersonal and communications skills (written and spoken) High level of emotional intelligence Strong presentation and negotiating skills Creative problem solving Works well under pressure, in a fast-paced environment and meets deadlines Nimble and adaptable in work ethic Highly collaborative with other internal team members and salespeople Assertive, ambitious and highly driven to succeed type of attitude Growth mindset Professional, ethical and organized Additional Details We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other federal, state or local protected class. Perks/Benefits: Equity and Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Pension and Retirement Savings Plan in Several Countries, Comprehensive Healthcare Benefits for You and Your Family, Generous Time Off, Holiday Breaks and Summer Fridays, Family-Focused Leave Benefits, and Cell Phone Subsidy Invest in You: Performance Management, and Investment in Diversity Initiatives, Bonusly Peer-to-Peer Recognition Program, Turning Recognition into Tangible Perks and Magnite Swag, Community Service Events, Wellness Coach—Meditate and Recharge with an Unlimited User Account for You and a Plus One COVID-19 Precautions: remote interview process, virtual onboarding for new hires
