jobTitle: Head of Regional Governance and Management
description: About Wells Fargo  Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 20 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Market Job Description  Wells Fargo Corporate & Investment Banking (CIB) delivers a comprehensive suite of banking, capital markets and advisory solutions, including a full complement of sales, trading and research capabilities, to corporate, government and institutional clients. We focus on our clients' overall financial needs, with consideration and respect for their total relationship with Wells Fargo.  Wells Fargo is seeking a Head of Regional Governance and Management to join the APAC COO Office to lead the key teams and functions for the region, including Business Management, Regional Committee Governance, Product Governance, Legal Entity Governance and Property, Resiliency and Safety. Reporting into the Regional Chief Operating Officer ('RCOO'), APAC, this position will act as a key deputy of the RCOO. He/She is responsible for running the organizational strategy from a RCOO perspective, coordinating with the various Functions in the US and the region to ensure effective management of these responsibilities and developing changes for effective and efficient regional transformation and management.  The APAC COO Office has responsibility for supporting the region with the facilitation of key governance and control activities across multiple Wells Fargo legal entities. The role holder will have an excellent opportunity for development across a range of activities and stakeholder engagement in APAC and with the US.  This role will be managing the managers and sub-teams supporting 6 major functions as follows:  Leadership Support & Business Management Activities Manage and be responsible on the drafting of APAC Executive Committee, Operating Committee, and APAC Risk and Control Committee updates on behalf of the Regional COO; and coordinate drafting of International Executive Committee updates on behalf of the Regional President. Oversight of all audit issues assigned to COO, including initial challenge on ownership, ensuring Corrective Actions are designed and owned appropriately to meet required remediation and ongoing oversight. Develop strategy for the team including leading the assessment of current maturity of functions and resourcing and developing strategic, prioritized improvement plans to build new functions or mature existing functions. Business Management Activities Regional Management and COO headcount management and tracking: co-ordinating with talent acquisition on new hire approvals, and broader regional CIB headcount and co-ordinating with Finance/HR on financial projections. Cost management activities, including; review of central COO AU activity, CIB finance forecasting requirements for the COO function, Executing/Advisory for cost allocation methodology for COO and Regional Management costs. Working closely with the Cost & Efficiency Programme Director on the cost & efficiency strategy for COO function, including the co-ordination of COO led cost saving initiatives that may be identified during the design phase. Regional Committee Governance Corporate and Regional Governance management and coordination: Regional Executive Committee, Regional Operating Committee, Regional New Initiatives Committee. Product Governance Product review and approval governance, coordination with global businesses for products to be marketed, sold, distributed in APAC. Legal Entity Governance: For regional Legal Entities: Outsourcing (inter-affiliate and third party), Branch Management Committees and support and Representative Office Governance, Resolution Planning. Property, Resiliency And Safety Business Resiliency, Health & Safety, Incident Management, COVID-19 response & co-ordination, Return to Office strategy, Office Services. This position is a critical leadership role within the Asia-Pacific (APAC) RCOO team and will be responsible for running the organizational development for the team.  Market Skills and Certifications Considerable experience in one or a combination of the following: regional leadership, regional or legal entity governance, strategic planning. Significant experience in leading large and complex multi-disciplinary teams Desired Qualifications Deep knowledge of, and working experience dealing with regulatory rules and oversight in each key strategic market in APAC region. Demonstrated ability to lead in a matrixed environment and navigate effectively across all levels of the organization including developing strong working relationships with Regional Leadership and other senior executives. Exhibit proven success in working across multiple stakeholders to set strategy, construct a business case and plan execution of large-scale, multi-group initiatives. Exhibit an enthusiastic leadership style, driven and results oriented; comfortable working in a partnering environment and sometimes being the leader behind the scenes orchestrating the process. Ability to articulate issues, risks, and proposed solutions to various levels Ability to coordinate internal audits or examinations conducted by external parties Ability to develop operational reporting Proven ability to successfully execute initiatives, manage projects, and drive for results. Display excellent verbal, written and presentation skills; must be able to effectively communicate and broker agreements amongst diverse, differing, competing, and/or conflicting perspectives/priorities. Exhibit proven collaboration/facilitation ability; team player and collaborator with demonstrated success in leading, influencing, motivating and building strong internal relationships. Demonstrated ability to set strategic vision for the team and effectively align resources and influence the right structure to deliver results. Proven ability to manage multiple complex issues and initiatives simultaneously Demonstrated knowledge of the Financial Services industry including strong knowledge of both the Wells Fargo lines of business, functional groups and cultural norms. Have a good understanding of our different businesses and operating platforms across the region to drive ‘One Wells Fargo' and regional initiatives and priorities acting as a balanced regional management function representing the Enterprise and Wholesale view. High level of cultural awareness and sensitivity Leadership Expectations at Wells Fargo  Specifically You Will  As a Team Member manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them. Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks. We Value Diversity  At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. 63615  Reference Number  63615BR-2
industries: Financial Services, Investment Management, and Banking

through deployment, identifying schedules, scope, budget estimations, and project implementation plans, including risk mitigation To coordinate internal and external resources, ensuring projects remain within scope, schedule, and defined budgets, in collaboration with project staff from various functions Analyze project progress and, when necessary, adapt scope, timelines, and costs to ensure description: The Databricks partnership with all three Cloud partners (Azure, AWS, Google) is the cornerstone of the GTM motion for us which accelerates customer success, partner ecosystem adoption & success, and revenue consumption. Databricks is committed to aligning with the Cloud Partners operating rhythms (Product, Sales, Marketing, Field Engineering, SI Ecosystem, Back Office) to provide an outstanding experience for our joint customers. Databricks looks for a smooth and collaborative experience "Better/Together" with Azure, AWS, and Google.  You will grow the entire Cloud program & strategy for APJ working with Azure, AWS, and GCP. Your primary responsibilities include working with the Cloud partners local APJ executive & business development teams and aligning the APJ sales & SI partner organizations with their counterparts to help accelerate customer success and revenue growth. The role also includes teaming with the Databricks and Cloud Partner executive teams to help with the overarching GTM/Cloud strategy. You will report to the Global Head of Sales and GTM for Clouds  The Impact You Will Have Work cross-functionally with Cloud partners and Databricks teams to create the strategy and offers in APJ Drive focus and adoption of Cloud partner funded programs with AEs and sales leaders through joint execution Build and nurture essential Cloud partner relationships in the APJ markets (Japan, ASEAN, ANZ, China) Guide and position the program benefits and catalogue of value added services available to internal stakeholders and partners to accelerate Databricks consumption. This includes quarterly business reviews, promoting relationships at the executive level through executive briefings, thought leadership for AI and ML for new use case ideation, positioning of services, and more. Run the operating cadence and agreement on global and APJ Cloud teams (Sales, Marketing, Field Engineering, and SI partner teams). Work with Databricks HQ Cloud team and co-build strategies, programs, and GTM motions.  OUTCOMES (6 months) Roll out 9 cloud sales plays to all APJ regions Align and orchestrate essential in-region executive meetings Ensure sales and cross-functional teams on the different programs and how to use them in the field with Cloud Partners Establish a consistent Operational cadence with leadership teams to ensure visibility, and effectiveness of the Cloud Partnerships. Help promote an additional 30%+ consumption in APJ by applying Cloud funding and SIs.  What We Look For Experience working at the executive level directly with customers and partners in the the Analytics / ML space Experience building and running a Strategic Accounts/Partner programs Experience working in an Enterprise Software organization and collaborating across multiple teams to promote growth for the customer. Willingness to travel as the business requires. Expect 50% travel. Pending Covid restrictions.  Benefits Private medical, dental and optical Life, accident, disability and critical illness coverage Central Provident Fund for local nationals Equity awards Paid parental leave Gym reimbursement Annual personal development fund Work headphones reimbursement Business travel accident insurance  About Databricks  Want to help speed the development of medical breakthroughs? Make the next mode of transportation a reality? Or discover ways to reverse climate change? We're on a mission to help data teams solve the world's toughest problems. The opportunity is huge and Databricks has emerged as a leader. Thousands of enterprises — including Comcast, Virgin Hyperloop and H&M — already rely on us to power their businesses and we're just getting started. Now it's your turn - join us to grow your career and make an impact with some of the brightest minds in the industry.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

description: What's the role?  We are looking for a P&L experienced leader to lead our Customer Success (CS) and Technical Support (TS) organization. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering post-sales success & support for all HERE products and services in the APAC region. You will be responsible for driving adoption of HERE products / solutions and identifying growth opportunities to expand HERE’s footprint, while demonstrating the value and benefits to customers. You will establish vision, strategy, execution and metrics for the APAC region, aligned with the regional APAC Sales team, and skillfully balancing performance and transformation agendas, while delivering on customer commitments. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering the booking and revenue targets by maximizing the reach of success and support portfolio.  Your Main Responsibilities Include Strategizing and leading the execution of the transformational change agenda that enables the achievement of the company’s Strategy Execution Plan (SEP) in the region Creating a transformation plan that is informed by a comprehensive diagnostic of the existing success and support landscape / ecosystem Creating and scaling capabilities and competencies that do not currently exist Shifting the focus to proactive engagement through the entire customer life cycle, owning and driving onboarding, adoption, expansion, retention and support. Establishing and driving the APAC TS team priorities in alignment with Regional Sales Orchestrating a comprehensive continuous improvement plan on metrics oriented execution, escalation management,CSAT and VOC closed loop feedback and follow the sun/24x7 support strategy and implementation. Establishing interlocks with Product and Engineering, ensuring customer support readiness Assessing and improving technical support system performance (ServiceNow) Recruiting and leading a team of highly qualified technical experts Designing and creating best practices in reporting and analytics Who are you?  To be successful on this role, you possess a demonstrated track record in customer success, technical support, and organizational transformation. You are a strong candidate if you possess the following skills, competencies, and work experience A Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology or related fields 20 + years of total experience with 10+ years of experience in a Technical Support or Customer Success leadership / management role in a Customer Support or Professional Services / consulting organization in the technology industry. Customer-facing client management experience with proven history of growing customer satisfaction, adoption, and retention will be beneficial. Validated track record in building high performing , regional teams / functions ground up Ability to interface and interact with all levels of a medium to large customer organization (Enterprise customers, B2B or B2B2C) Ability to think strategically, account / relationship management skills, analytical thinking skills with business acumen. Prior experience in supporting customers from across the APAC region , with a strong understanding of the cultural nuances of doing business in various countries in the region. Proven track record of meeting and exceeding bookings and revenue targets Strong communication skills in English. HERE is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  Who are we?  HERE Technologies is a location data and technology platform company. We empower our customers to achieve better outcomes – from helping a city manage its infrastructure or a business optimize its assets to guiding drivers to their destination safely.  At HERE we take it upon ourselves to be the change we wish to see. We create solutions that fuel innovation, provide opportunity and foster inclusion to improve people’s lives. If you are inspired by an open world and driven to create positive change, join us. Learn more about us. Watch Video
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Join Affinidi and be part of the future of identity: secure, portable and controlled by the individual.  Affinidi empowers individuals and organisations with ownership and control of their verifiable data, to unlock value across borders and platforms.  Leveraging on the building blocks that Affinidi provides, trusted institutions and entities can issue verifiable credentials to customers, which can in turn be shared with other applications to access services in an open and interoperable ecosystem.  Currently undergoing development are three applications that leverage Affinidi's technology: Safe Travel initiative, a digital medical credentials ecosystem to safely open up international air travel; Trustana, a curated B2B marketplace and trade platform connecting verifiable, international partners for seamless cross-border trade; and Good Worker, an online job matching platform for seasonal workers and employers in India.  Affinidi, along with the applications Trustana and Good Worker, are seeded by Temasek, a global investment company headquartered in Singapore.  We are building a motivated and entrepreneurial team who is passionate about identity, decentralization and technology to make this happen.  Overview:  As the Product Marketing Director, you will shape the future of identity by developing a deep understanding of our customers, their markets, and Affinidi's product portfolio to lead coordinated, successful campaigns and product launches that drive customer adoption and engagement. Through a combination of strategic thinking and operational excellence, a passion for results, and a knack for crafting compelling product narratives, you will partner across functions to create and execute on winning go-to-market strategies across verticals in a new technology frontier. In this highly-entrepreneurial, dynamic, and fast-paced environment, you will work with people who are collaborative, driven by purpose, and not afraid to take risks. At Affinidi, you'll build a career that positively impacts millions of people and businesses across the globe.  What you'll do: Own and drive go-to-market strategy and launch execution for our product portfolio, features, and benefits that drive impact Understand and evangelize for the needs and motivations of our customers, actively identifying gaps and opportunities to better serve the audience Plan, execute and oversee our product marketing strategy, including online, offline, affiliates, partnerships, branding and PR Translate customer needs into clear value props and messaging, from top-of-funnel awareness messages to key points along the customer journey. Develop a culture of rapid testing and experimentation and work cross-functionally to help find product-channel and product-market fit across our portfolio Work closely with the sales and product teams to develop our B2B acquisition strategy, including lead generation pricing, positioning, segmentation, and content creation Hire, develop, and lead a diverse, world-class product marketing team Identify and manage our media agencies and channel partners, securing agreements on the production of promotion of activities. Develop and manage a calendar of events such as webinars, conferences and thought leadership Champion the deployment of methodologies and best practices to provide the appropriate environment and structure for effective execution Build an inclusive culture, where everyone can belong  You should apply if You have 12+ years experience in marketing and business strategy, with a proven track record of building product marketing campaigns that deliver growth and results in a technology company You have launched software products in high-growth, startup environments and complex tech domains, that delighted customers You have highly-developed interpersonal, storytelling and communication skills, working with and maintaining long-term relationships with peers, customers, prospects, and key opinion leaders You believe in Affinidi's vision of Web 3.0 and the paradigm shift to self-sovereign identity, and you bring the long-term commitment to make Affinidi succeed in this space You have worked in or extensively with large enterprises and, consequently, are able to understand enterprise customers, their complexities, and, even further, their end customers You have exceptional organizational and project management skills to keep programs and teams on track You have experience leading and scaling a team You are curious and passionate, with a growth mindset  Bonus points if: You have strong customer orientation with a focus on B2B and deep understanding of developer ecosystem and landscape You have experience in healthcare, financial services or travel-related technology You have experience working with and building a global brand  Equal Opportunity Statement  Our company embraces diversity in all of its forms and fosters an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Overview of job  Mindshare is visionary and a leader in setting best practices in the industry. We aim to keep leading in this space and to demonstrate expertise in this space through one of our key accounts.   This Supply specialist role is critical to achieving that by driving and scaling SPO (Supply Path Optimization) as a practice across markets to deliver value back to the client  This requires the Supply Specialist to the have the following set of skills: evangelizing their products, assessing competition, defining vision, and collaborating with Ad tech partners, operations, and marketing to drive the successful delivery and adoption of their platform. In addition, they would have good understanding of programmatic ads ecosystem from advertisers’ perspective and would have already launched and scaled advertising products for the buyers.   3 best things about the job:  Dynamic – As part of a team at the forefront of all things digital, you will be directly involved in shaping the future of this business in this fast-changing programmatic industry. Great work culture – You will work with a diverse and collaborative group of co-workers passionate about digital media that know how to have fun at the same time. Flexibility and Empowerment – We appreciate colleagues who are tinkerers and problem solvers, those who think outside the box and contribute to new ways of working.  Measures of success –  In three months, you would have:  Built up a thorough understanding of Unilever’s programmatic ecosystem and the Supply Path Optimization framework Good understanding of Unilever’s inventory partnerships and how they work Formed an understanding of the client’s marketing strategy across the region. Established working relationships with SSP & DSP partners Become familiar with the processes within Mindshare and within your team including using GroupM admin, media and finance software. In six months, you would:  Manage initiatives, projects and pilots for deployment across the region Supervising and guiding markets across inventory and supply-related queries, and facilitate training where necessary. Assist with identifying problems and troubleshooting for local markets Working closely with programmatic partners (DSPs, SSPs and Inventory Partners) to build/identify customised solutions for deployment across campaigns. Thorough understanding of Unilever’s inventory partnerships and how they work In 12 months, you would have:  Conceptualized and recommended initiatives & pilots for deployment across the region Have a clear strategy for inventory and supply partnerships in the region Proposed new ways of working and process improvements across all work streams Proven yourself as a reliable POC for client stakeholders Established a strong level of trust among junior members of the team    Responsibilities of the role:  Supply Strategy: Develop a strategy on how to regionally manage supply partners that deliver value while meeting client KPIs. Constantly meet and evaluate new partners as needed. Focus on identifying and growing supply for the client when it comes to video, display, native, etc. Identify and cultivate relationships with supply partners, piloting new initiatives and evaluating the performance of these initiatives. Manage internal stakeholders in line with opportunity to exceed advertiser KPI expectations through use of efficient supply strategies Build best practices across supply management within the region; establish benchmarks and learnings which are measurable Responsible for market roll-out & capability building across local markets. Produce quarterly reports on market, industry and adoption rates for management team measuring the business value of the strategy. Operations: Ensure all technology partners are integrated seamlessly across campaigns Develop a process workflow to streamline operations across multiple parties – trading team, local Mindshare team, technology partners, etc. Build best practices across trading and operations within the region; establish benchmarks and learnings which are measurable Constantly meet with, evaluate, and test new technology partners, data and supply vendors as needed Support, manage and ensure high quality output from local supply leads who are responsible for end-to-end campaign management & governance. Responsible for market roll-out & capability building agenda across local markets. Oversee day to day relationship and communication with client & partners, as well as with local Mindshare teams Platform Strategy & Development - Develop supply pillars for the Trade desk and practically deploy into day-to-day workflows, including but not limited to: Operations – Working with the local markets & regional clients to review, develop and put in place improvements in the operational capabilities, workflows or new technology of the Trade Desk. Efficiency - Working with the trading team to identify and put into practice performance efficiencies in the established working process. Insights – Working with the internal data team to generate regional supply insights and POVs to share at scale across the local markets. What you will need:  7+ year experience in product management, product strategy, Experience in digital advertising landscape (ad servers, SSPs, RTB, PMP, DSPs, DMPs) Deep understanding of supply side of advertising ecosystem Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently Experience in building and managing products from ideation to launch working with a remote engineering team. Deep knowledge of product development dynamics and go-to-market tactics. Comfortable with agile product development and collaborating with multiple teams to deliver product features that are dependent on other product teams Ability to articulate and influence other product teams to help them see the value of problem we are solving and get necessary buy-in Experience partnering cross-functionally with teams spanning across sales/operations, product, engineering, marketing, customer success. Self-motivated individual with strong communication (written and verbal), leadership, judgment, planning, and decision-making skills. Demonstrated prior success within a startup culture, bringing cross-functional projects to closure  About Mindshare  Mindshare, the global media agency network, and part of WPP, the largest marketing communications network in the world, has more than 7,000 employees, in 116 offices across 86 countries.  Each office is dedicated to forging competitive marketing advantage for businesses and their brands based on the values of speed, teamwork and provocation. Mindshare’s network of people are acutely aware of what's happening in their city, and believe all great communication begins and ends in media.  In 2014 Mindshare Asia Pacific was the only media agency to be ranked in the top ten in Campaign Asia’s Most Admired Companies survey, and was also seen as the best agency to work at in the region.  Mindshare APAC has won over 250 awards in the past year - and counting, including the 'Campaign Asia Pacific Agency of the Year, 2013' and the SMARTIES™ APAC ‘Agency Network of the Year 2014’ for the second consecutive year. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com   About GroupM Singapore   GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.  GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

description: Business Function  As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you.  Responsibilities Generate new leads, identify and contact decision-makers, screen potential business opportunities, select the deals inline with strategies, and lead and facilitate campaigns. Track performance of all campaigns. Conduct business value forecast, analysis and partnerships negotiations. Define and execute the marketing and communication activities according to our business priorities. Drive all partnership activities to generate leads and retain existing customers. Collaborate with other teams to promote offerings (i.e. Product, Acquisition, Portfolio, Paylah!, Merchant Business, Corporate Banking, Banca, Rewards etc) Partner with other stakeholder teams across business units (i.e., Marketing, Customer Experience Call Centre, Platform Management, Digital engagement) to develop campaign process and provide necessary analysis and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently. Motivate the team, track performance, and report metrics Work with Line Manager to develop long-term strategic initiatives. Monitor and evaluate industry trends and customer drivers. Maintain and share professional knowledge through education, networking, events, and presentations. Requirements Manage both our existing partners and developing new business opportunities Identify trends and customer needs, building a short/medium/long-term sales pipeline in accordance with targets Manage and implement marketing strategies that achieve strategic goals Take a lead role in the development of proposals and presentations for new business materials to create and nurture business opportunities and partnerships Bachelor's degree in business or management Outstanding poise in a fast-paced business environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficiency with data analysis, forecasting, and budgeting Proven ability to plan and manage resources Excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights Apply Now  We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

description: Our company is currently on the look out for a Business Success Manager - Cyber Security.  The BSM Cyber Security is responsible for the development and growth of both existing and new business with a focus on cyber security and cloud solutions.  The BSM will work within the cyber security sales team and be responsible for: Enabling new business within existing and new (or to-be-recruited) customers within their allocated portfolio. Ensuring the best customer experience possible for all accounts engaged in their product portfolio; Orchestrating teams and resources to ensure rhipe delivers differentiated value-add to customers interested in their portfolio of products. Key Responsibilities Develop and grow new business and expand existing partner base within cyber security and cloud based software. Works closely with the Sales and Marketing teams as well as other internal stakeholders to uncover new opportunities in market to both accelerate reach and drive recruitment for rhipe’s channel. Contributes to the performance of customer recruitment in the territory and providing regular updates and insights on customer performance that might be useful to the Cyber Security Solutions Director, sales teams or marketing organization. Is measured by revenue performance of their product portfolio, number of customers engaged and completing new practice builds, and customer experience survey results of these customers. Drives the best customer experience possible through constant monitoring and improvement of the practice-building process, providing feedback that supports the tiering of customers within the rhipe Partner Incentive program. Works with their Solutions Director and team to create strategic plays through effective customer profiling, action planning and by providing regular insights on the cyber security and cloud market. Contributes to net new business by supporting the qualifying and processing of leads received from various channels to build new practices. Provides the Sales and Marketing teams with insights to help them execute marketing, seasonal and promotional activity that might generate demand and pipeline for customers and territories. Provides regular feedback about the vendors in their product portfolio to help identify risks and opportunities for rhipe and the customer through new product, investments, and cross-selling opportunities to drive revenue. Administers and documents internal business development infrastructure, entering and maintaining contact, opportunity, and activity records in the rhipe CRM system and providing regular reporting through the use of these sales tools. Keeps up to date on certifications across all key vendors and core technologies to ensure a high level of articulation of the value proposition to partners and identification of net-new opportunities. This includes staying up to date with program and licensing changes/updates and solutions across all key vendors. Is recognized as a positive ambassador of the rhipe brand name in all areas of engagement both internally and externally. Experience & Skills Highly desirable - Experience managing or contributing to the running of an IT based or Managed Services based organization in Cyber Security and Cloud Computing solution selling Preferred - Experience in Cyber Security and Cloud Computing Preferred - Experience in a fast-growing, small to medium business Preferred - Experience presenting program content in a 1-many or 1-one environment Demonstrated experience in a similar business development role with channel experience. Strong technical and sales consulting experience and customer focused approach Proven experience in B2B sales and relationship management (preferably with long sales cycles) Proven track record of net new business, maximising relationship A good understanding of key partner and vendor relationships Technical Skills Experience in or demonstrated ability to use Microsoft CRM and Microsoft Office Education Tertiary education in business, marketing or related discipline Professional Training and Certification Highly Desirable: Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP): MS- 900, AZ-900 Why rhipe?  Rhipe is a market leader for cloud and service provider software licensing in the APAC region. We help businesses build, transform and accelerate their journey to the Cloud and our employees are at the heart of what we do.  As an equal opportunity employer we aim to provide a dynamic, supportive and friendly environment. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives and support flexible work arrangements. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a barrier free recruitment process and will consider any requests.

description: Job Description  F5 technologies are at the heart of modern applications that are enabling digital transformation across the globe! We give the world’s largest businesses, service providers, governments, and consumer brands the ability to securely deliver every app, anywhere-with confidence. We do this by working collaboratively in an innovative environment, helping each other thrive and succeed. We take pride in being trusted advisers to our customers, offering the best solutions for their interests!  The role is based inSingapore.  TheSolutions Engineering Director(SED) is a regional manager role, responsible for managing a team of SEs supporting the Regional Sales strategy. This is a people-focused technical sales professional seen as a leader within the sales organization. The SED combines technical acumen and business knowledge to develop regional strategies for revenue growth. The SED drives revenue through account planning, and resource planning and allocation. They help develop and drive innovative technical programs and oversee account level activities. The SED owns the readiness of the SE teams to sell F5 solutions. They provide mentorship, direct management to lower level resources, build, maintain and improve a robust SE team. They help meet regional revenue goals by driving innovative technical programs, and coordinating account-level activities using internal and external network of business relationships to drive teamwork and achieve business goals and regional initiatives.  This Role Will Cover The Following  SE Management Organization / SE to-to-market Provide leadership, mentorship and direction to lead a robust SE team. Define an organizational and technical strategy to support the region. Develop and execute a Team Lead program for potential management promotions. Define compensation plan based on regional goals. Develop and execute a retention strategy and analyze turnover. Define headcount plan to support the region and build a talent pipeline of potential candidates. Works with Sales Leadership and Finance to define quarterly budget. Performance Management Measure team progress against the business objectives and recommend changes. Define and analyse yearly performance objectives. Account Engagement Participate in, and contribute to regular sales forecast and pipeline reviews. Establish and drive process of technical assessment and strategy (Technical Account Plan, Account Plan and Whitespace Analysis), and competitive positioning including documented installed base (F5 and competitive) analysis for named accounts. Assist in qualified partner identification. Drive tracking and reporting team metrics in SFDC. Organizational Development Supervise and measure team progress against business metrics and recommend improvements as needed. Engage with Product Management and Solution Architects to ensure representation of the respective regional requirements. Lead cross functional projects and initiatives beyond immediate area of responsibility, and in multinational environments within the theatre. Initiate and facilitate communications and understanding of customer requirements between customers, corporate, and the field. Business Acumen Provide leadership and direction based on broad knowledge of the region’s business economics and trends of various industries and vertical markets, and how F5’s solutions add financial and strategic value. Provide thought leadership and account direction to customer and partner based on short and long-term business and industry drivers. Understanding of regional channel partner ecosystem. Technical Acumen Solid understanding of Application Delivery, Cyber Security and Automation through CI/CD pipeline. Solid understanding of the global competitive product and solution landscape and can articulate the F5’s differentiation with competitors. Excellent knowledge of F5 products and solutions. Knowledge And Skills 10 years or more experience supporting technical sales of enterprise network solutions to corporate accounts or equivalent industry experience. 7 years or more experience in leading technical sales engineers and frontline managers in a vendor. Multiple language skills are a plus. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!  The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing Alert  Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).  Equal Employment Opportunity  It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

description: Business Unit & Reporting Lines Part of the PMO Group, Account Operations within JLL Work Dynamics Reports to PMO Hub Lead (APAC) Interfaces Interfaces across a broad spectrum of Leadership at Account and Platform levels, Sales and Solution Development teams, technology product owners, and other cross-functional JLL business support functions. Objectives Improve and maintain PDS PMO Group’ regional platform, process and controls Provide and drive superior service to internal and external Clients. Contribute to growth of company. Enhance own professional and personal skills. Meet KPI targets. Delivers operational excellence through the implementation of the PMO 5-phase account management process and systems (including JLL technology systems) for new and existing strategic client teams Establishes a partnership with clients and client teams; builds immediate credibility and deflects conflict under stressful, time sensitive situations Deliver flawless execution of new account transitions and scope expansions to existing Clients Best practice leader in programme and project management process and methodology Works with the PMO Leadership to drive improvement and innovation of Programme Management processes and systems and other related initiatives that enhance the profile of the PMO Group within JLL Accountabilities  Improve Regional Accounts platform, process & controls in the following areas-  Best Practice Maintain and develop the PMO-specific Centre of Excellence (CoE), including contributing to the development of standardised policies, process and procedures, etc.) Manage/curate the PMO online presence Drive knowledge sharing through effective collaboration with counterparts in AMER/EMEA for new Best Practices Develop and manage a process to share best practices and innovations between accounts ‘Audit’ accounts for minimum requirements and Best practice Transition management Interface with Sales and Solutions Development teams to understand the scope of transition / expansion to define the Target Operating Model Lead the integration of PDS product(s) in the Target Operating Model across all business lines, horizontal and vertical Integrates JLL’s 5-phase project management and PMO processes into client process Effectively manages client teams’ expectations with no surprises and regular communication Identify risks and propose solutions to resolve/eliminate Understand the value of, be able to articulate and - where appropriate - negotiate to deploy baseline JLL Technology. Support the configuration , deployment and training process Engage account teams to meet transition and account objectives Effectively communicates and engages PMO Lead and Account Director during transitions; knows when to engage and/or escalate Stays informed on changes to the PDS process and systems Develops Client Playbook as a key output of the programme and project management processes. Contributes as an SME to the PMO and supports any technology platform enhancement projects Documents technology requirements using IT Configuration Guide and/or design-build technology visuals Aggregates and translates account work into marketable deliverables (e.g. Case Studies and White Papers) Leads or participates in the “go live” and “Day 2” training; delivers training on key client specific process information Support the post “Go Live” stabilisation / optimisation period, address iterative improvements in the operating model Key Result Areas Continued development of the CoE Client Satisfaction Scores KPIs Consistent delivery Revenue growth Reapplication of learnings Required Qualifications & Experience A degree in Project Management, Real Estate or related field or; a combination of formal education and work experience of ten (10) years, 6 of which must be related to all aspects of Construction / Project Management / Real Estate. Solid understanding and demonstrated use of technology in the delivery of Project and Programme Management, including Project Management Information Systems, to deliver operational excellence and profitable revenue in overall Account Management Demonstrated technical proficiency and ability to learn system functionality quickly Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to interact with executive level external and internal clients Proven leadership experience; reaches deep into this experience to migrate teams toward operational excellence Highly organized with strong analytical skills; yet, must demonstrate ability to aggregate results and translate into solid recommendations Process oriented with strong technical skills Ability to multi-task and work both in a team and independently Ability to interpret business scenarios to translate and communicate how to apply the PDS Project Management process to that scenario Fluent in spoken and written English. description: Regional Proposal/Bid Management Director  Work Dynamics, Asia Pacific - Singapore  Duties & responsibilities  Responsible for managing and assisting in the continuous evolution of the business and its Sales strategy, responding to requests for proposals and presentations and management of renewals.  General- Assisting with the formulation and execution of growth strategies focusing on winning business, key clients, thought leadership events and exploiting new growth areas Assisting in the generation of new client prospects through industry engagement Proposal Leadership-  As directed by the Head of Proposals & Solutions APAC- Provide leadership, strategy and proposal/solution design throughout the BD process, for all new opportunities and for renewals of existing contracts in a competitive environment Take ownership of Proposals including liaising with clients Engage with all organisational SMEs to ensure that contribution is provided Contribute to and manage writing content Proposal Management- Develop Proposal programs and identify necessary resources Basic Proposal Management responsibilities including- Management of clarification/ addenda processes Capture and distilling of information Management of bid lodgement and governance Kick off + go/no go process Create Proposal strategies and identify, capture and develop win themes Champion proposal best practice Manage multiple assignments simultaneously, while working both independently and with other proposals professionals Understand competitive landscape and seek to positively differentiate Proposal offer Ensure alignment to internal processes and obtain approvals in timely manner Submit consistently high quality, customer focused tender responses within allocated time frame Coordinate internal and independent reviews in line with Proposal program Monitor continuous improvement and development opportunities Work with creative teams to enhance visual impact of tender responses / presentations Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to liaise and negotiate with business and technical stakeholders Work with knowledge management team to maintain Proposal library and other relevant business development collateral Support global sales enablement programs to enhance sales productivity Proposal Writing and Development- Complete Proposal responses according to set standards regarding structure, order, clarity, conciseness, style and terminology Demonstrated ability to develop both business and technical content and adjust documentation language according to target audiences Prepare additional materials including presentation decks, clarification responses and Best and Final Offers Proposal Projects- Work on, or lead Proposal-related projects, from inception through to completion, including for example- Baseline library/ knowledge management Account Summary and Case Study document generation CS Proposal Program- Drive business growth Build robust systems, processes and frameworks to ensure consistency and quality across all pursuits and Proposals Develop and strengthen key SME relationships to ensure quality content extraction and base line library compilation Improve overall Proposal win rate Improve based on feedback from win/loss debriefs Performance objectives Driving business growth Strengthening client relationships and loyalty to improve account retention Building robust systems, processes and frameworks to ensure consistency and quality across all pursuits and Proposals Develop and strengthen key SME relationships to ensure quality content extraction and base line library compilation Improve overall Proposal win rate Improve feedback from win/loss debriefs Skills And Knowledge Required For This Role-  Key skills & experience Ability to communicate and influence at all levels within the organisation with excellent presentation skills and the ability to prepare high standard documents Demonstrated ability to think strategically with a high level of conceptual, innovative, analytical and problem-solving skills directed towards positive outcomes in the development and implementation of Proposals projects Excellent time management and organisational skills with the ability to manage workflow and priorities and meet deadlines Demonstrated experience in client planning processes, client team management and other fundamental business development practices Client focused, demonstrating an ability to provide quality service and advice within the business development and CRM arena Sound decision making capabilities, demonstrating an ability to create persuasive and compelling recommendations Ability to work effectively as part of Corporate Solutions with the capacity to work cooperatively and in partnership with peers Highly organised, with strong attention to detail and flexibility to adapt to changing priorities Excellent verbal and written communication skills Team management experience Intermediate to advanced level in core Microsoft packages – Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook, as well as Adobe InDesign. Experience & Qualifications Minimum 10 years’ experience in a services-related industry Minimum 4 years’ Corporate Real Estate or Facilities Management experience Experience in the provision of expert advice to senior management Proposal management experience.
