description: Position: Assistant Manager – Concierge Services  Salary: $3,500 – $4,300  Working hours: 44 hours/ week, 6 off days/mth (must commit weekends)  Working Location: Orchard Rd, Delfii  Job Summary  The Assistant Manager will create, develop and market an innovative, premium holistic integrated Wellness Centre in Singapore whilst ensuring the achievement of sales goals, business objectives and profitability.  Job Responsibilities  Sales Promote and sell programs, services and products offered by the Centre and conduct walk through of the Centre’s facilities. Strive to achieve sales target through communications and upselling to customers. Concierge and Operations Correspond to internal and external customers enquiries, complaints and feedback, within 24 hours, before escalating to Operations Manager. Responsible for cultivating a cohesive and inspiring workplace culture amongst concierge team and practitioners Ensure Concierge team comply to Company’s code of conduct and grooming standards Provide support for implementation of workshop and programmes as necessary. Ensure SOPs compliance and timely update with MBO to facilitate appointments, bookings, cancellations between customers and practitioners for private sessions and consultations. Ensure accurate and timely administration of medical/clinical follow-up appointments and insurance claims Support manager in implementation of new services and programs and orientation and training of new team members Responsible for smooth operations of assigned service point(s), including concierge services, retail administrative and operational matters. Responsible for two-way communication between staff and management and ensure timely dissemination of information, escalation of issues and recommending solutions to problems. To support management to achieve stable, skilled and motivated workforce and achieve the desired customer and business outcomes. Responsible for the management of Concierge team, as well as the induction, regular competency audit, training and development of these staff, such that they are successful in their assigned tasks for accurate administration of customer journey and excellent customer service at all touch-points. Plan Concierge roster for Manager's approval, and resolve manning issues with Manager. Address wellness practitioners’ feedback and propose solutions to Manager. Retail stocks inventory management and assist to achieve sell-through target Co-develop training materials and structure with Merchandiser To perform other duties as assigned by the company. Job Requirements Candidate must possess at least a Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Hospitality/Wellness or equivalent. At least 5 year(s) of working experience as a Manager specializing in Healthcare, Hospitality and Wellness in the related field is required for this position. Must be willing to work on weekends. Good communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to multitask in a busy front office environment Excellent Team working and practitioner collaboration skills Knowledge of physiotherapy, osteopathy, TCM, Massage, yoga therapy, coaching, counselling and psychoeducation workshops a plus.
industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Head of Customer Experience and Operations (B2C Fintech Mortgage)
description: Make A Real Difference At PropertyGuru.  Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.  At PropertyGuru Group, we believe that every person – no matter what their circumstance – should have a place to call home. That’s why we’ve been on a mission to transform how people find, finance, and own home across Southeast Asia over the last 13 years.  PropertyGuru Finance makes sure that nothing comes between finding a dream home and owning it. We’re on a mission to make home Financing the opposite of what it is today: smart, effortless and transparent. Designed around your needs —and your needs only— to find the best rates and keep your mortgage costs at their lowest. Always.  In Singapore, we built a team with the best mortgage brokers in Singapore —empowered by our proven property market knowledge and technology— to create smart mortgage services that will help you make confident home financing decisions throughout your whole ownership journey. We are aiming high, both in Singapore and outside, and want to become the ‘trusted mortgage advisor’ capturing the majority of Southeast Asia’s mortgage market.  For a full listing of our jobs, visit https://careers.propertygurugroup.com .  The Head of Operations (B2C)is part of PGF leadership team. (S)he is responsible for enabling our growth aspirations by driving a programme of continuous enhancement of organizational capabilities. In so doing, the Head of Operations will apply tried and tested methodologies for process improvement and will hold the teams honest through in-depth reporting and analysis. Most of all, (s)he is a partner to his/her fellow leaders in enhancing customer service and satisfaction, improving sales productivity, defining and (help) building the required operational infrastructure, and driving standardization and repeatability of processes that enable capabilities to be ‘exported’ to new markets in-and outside of Singapore.  Responsibilities  Responsibilities: Operations strategy: Set PGF’s Operations aspirations and define a program of continuous improvement for Consumer Customers. Define the process & capability roadmap that enables PGF’s transition from a traditional mortgage broker to an online broker with front-end banking capabilities Process optimization: Ensure world-class performance of PGF’s core processes: lead capture, client onboarding, client nurturing, lead conversion, lifetime-value/relationship management, order-to-cash, etc. Create and drive a program of multiple process optimization initiatives Partner with Sales, Marketing and Product teams to strengthen their operations Support with analytics, prioritization and operational execution of actions towards structurally stronger capabilities, better customer satisfaction and higher productivity Regulatory compliance: understand regulatory ramifications of PGF’s aspirations and ensure operations and infrastructure are compliant Capability building: Increase PGF’s capabilities in process management & optimization Enable capability transfers across markets Leadership: lead a (2-3FTE) team of business analysts Requirements  Requirements: >8 years recent experience Operations improvement, ideally in consumer customer focus or service industry Proficient in business analytics / process optimization methodologies such as six sigma Highly structured operator with outstanding project / process management skills Situational leader: can both be self-starting and follow guidance Results-driven and fact-based Experience in banking (or other regulated industry) is a ‘high-want’
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Position Summary  The Associate Director (AD) spearheads the Supply Chain Management of Singtel & NCS. He/She is responsible for developing strategic approach to support Consumer/Group Enterprise / NCS delivery teams by ensuring the systems (e.g. SAP system, Fulfilment System (FS) and MTPOS (front-line retail shops’ system) and processes are robust and scalable to meet Business needs while aligning with the Control / Policies. He/She leads the systems automation project planning with Business and IT stakeholders and operationalises the enhanced systems/processes through change management training with internal teams across the business units. The AD also oversees the team to manage the daily operations of the inventory management and channels’ requests for smooth order fulfilment requests.  The Associate Director also champions the digitalization initiatives within SCM for both Singtel and NCS.  The product supported are mobile phones, sim cards, cables, accessories, routers, set-top boxes, white goods, and services supported are delivery services to home/pop stations/offices/self-collection at designated address / redemption counters.  The numbers of own & 3rd party warehouses will be 5.  Key Responsibilities And Results Plan the system architecture and processes of the for efficient and streamlined order fulfilment and deliveries. Serve as the primary contact for 3rd party warehouse service providers / delivery contractors to coordinate and plan the necessary solutions (including IT automation, suggesting improvement plan to meet stakeholders’ demands), attending regular system and process meetings with the stakeholders weekly for inventory planning and allocation n distribution. Early engagement with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities for improvement or anticipate changes due to changing business needs. Champion the Order fulfilment and Inventory systems and processes through regular deployment of trainings (via online or Espresso share point materials) to relevant users. Operationalise the Inventory and Fulfilment system changes and processes with upstream (e.g Products / Sales & Marketing/ Customer Operations/ Online Sales) and downstream (warehouse and 3rd party delivery contractors) value chain Work closely with various IT teams (e.g SAP, FS, MTPOS, Billing ) to ensure minimal system downtime and smooth order fulfilment process Oversee the team handling the daily operational issues or queries related to SAP Inventory, FS and Online integration with SAP, Delivery system from 3rd party Champion the digitalization initiatives in Supply Chain Management; deep dive sessions with Consumer and GE BUs to explore their wish list (e.g RPA to create vendor master or change of bank account details etc) Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business, Logistics or related field 5-7 years of relevant experience, with minimum 5 years supervisory experience Familiar with multiple processes and systems such as SAP ERP System, Order Fulfilment system (FS), Ariba, Tableau / Power BI reporting tool Proven track record in leading and implementing system projects, enhancements to streamline the processes; e.g improve system UI Advanced analytical skills with experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating abundant information with accuracy Strong written, verbal and visual communication skills Ability to manage different stakeholders in Consumer / Network/ GE and NCS Units
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: Role Purpose Merkle, a leading performance marketing agency within CXM Service Line in dentsu International, is looking to grow the team with a CX Solution Partner, specializing in cloud-based marketing technology (MarTech) and data management, to assist the Sales team, and ensure the right MarTech solution is proposed and sold to our clients.   We seek a senior leader recognized for driving corporate vision and client sales, and who has an entrepreneurial growth spirit. They are a Principal Solution Architect who can straddle both business requirements and technology implementations to deliver MarTech solutions.  They drive collaborations as a Trusted Advisor on CX (Digital Transformation and Data Transformation) topics, for effective teaming within client environment, within dentsu’s/Merkle’s, and with partners’ systems / platforms and relevant solutions.  This role in the Merkle APAC Leadership Team provides clients with holistic technology solutions that define and drive Values and Outcomes with/across all areas of MarTech and CX Transformation, requiring cross-functional expertise across these areas.  The experienced CX Solution Partner will lead pre-sales, value engineering and solutioning on proactive CX transformational programs, as well as lead RFPs to address clients’ need to Win. Also ensuring quality delivery, they will define and orchestrate the right mix of talents, skillsets and geographies to be deployed.  This role will develop an APAC Solution Architecture practice that will help clients navigate through the complexities of integrating MarTech components to the enterprise technologies environment.  The successful candidate will demonstrate a history of being highly successful at championing, selling and implementing solutions in large and complex corporate environments, and in dynamic and challenging start-ups. Ideally, a candidate with experience building strong partnerships and relationships in marketing services, technology, or similar, resulting in substantial growth – internally and for clients.  They have to be an expert at scaling clients’ marketing functions up to the next level by developing technology solutions from “concept” to implementation. This role requires a strong understanding of CMOs’, CDOs’ and CTOs/CIOs’ needs and how their functions operate to bridge potential disconnects with business sponsors.  Key Accountabilities Lead and perform MarTech/AdTech Capabilities review for Enterprise Customers across multiple markets Lead and conduct workshops with various stakeholders across different markets to discover customer pain points Develop holistic solution roadmap with a clear articulation of business benefits to the C-Levels Lead and drive Value Engineering with Solution blueprint to solve clients’ challenges with concrete business outcomes (value realization) as Transformational Programs Lead large pre-sales solutioning and transformational/strategic/ integrated RFPs Sales engineering-related solution leadership for digital marketing platform services along with supporting services (analytics, database services) Work closely with alliance partners (Adobe, Salesforce, Google, AWS, Microsoft) and develop expertise in alliance partner platform solutions to enable transformational customer experiences Manage opportunities through the entire sales cycle including client relationships, RFI/RFP responses, pricing, solution presentations, and contract negotiations Think "out of the box” to match technical solutions to business strategies Support the technology delivery organization to ensure the solution fits within the existing tool capabilities, reference architectures, delivery approaches, skillsets, strategic technical direction, pricing and delivery models.  Match client vision to Merkle’s tech offerings, and play a key and critical leadership role to pitch a solution to the client. Be the Tech Team Leader to develop the opportunity through the sales stages for the Sales, Client and Delivery organizations Participate in speaking engagements including “Guru” sessions at Merkle’s C-level invitation-only Executive Client Summits, Annual Client Summits, conference speaking engagements and contribute to Merkle digital marketing blogs Architect and design MarTech solutions that bridge business and technology requirements and ensures usability, accessibility, and performance Work with platform and data-specific architects to design complex cross-channel solutions that involve the integration of various MarTech platforms (Digital Messaging/Campaign Management, Database, CMS, Web Analytics, Decisioning, Personalization, Identity Management, CDP, eCommerce, and Business Intelligence platforms, Loyalty Platforms, Preference Centers, Customer Lookup Applications, vendors/application and sizing) Responsible and accountable for the underlying client technology solution architecture Lead technology conversations with senior management (including C-suite) to present innovative tech strategies to senior client leadership teams - new technology adoption, upgrades of existing technology tools to improve overall operational efficiencies and customer satisfaction Set up, inspire, recruit, coach, grow the APAC Solution Architect Community, and evolve to set up practices over time to scale growth for Merkle Enable countries to pursue new solutioning capabilities (in partnership with Global Merkle Solutioning Group), and to ensure we have capabilities to deliver in APAC (in-market and off-shore) Closely support CGO & CEO to grow APAC Merkle’s integrated solutioning strengths and capabilities. Work closely with COO (on off-shore delivery/solutioning mix), and with Enterprise Growth Leads and Alliance Growth Leads to ensure client engagements and pitches are tight as One Team Work with senior leaders (VP Level) in Merkle, across dentsu, and the client organizations to: - Envision the right solution for the client’s marketing strategy, vision and capabilities, and propose the right solution from among Merkle’s offerings - Organize the company’s overall technical pitch to clients, evolving the message, and ensuring overall pitch success - Build and manage close relationships with client leaders (Business, Marketing and IT) - Build client’s trust - Price the solution - Present and negotiate the delivery model and timing - Oversee the contracting process leading up to final award - Manage the smooth transition to the Merkle delivery team  Person Specification Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, Marketing or Engineering or a related technical field, MBA a plus 15+ years in consulting/solution selling experience with 10+ years in the MarTech/AdTech/Data Management domain Ideally the individual has worked with major consulting firms and with good exposure to the agency business (creative and media) 10+ years of equivalent experience in sales engineering, solution support, MarTech consulting, systems integration, engineering and/or sales Extremely strong customer relationship and people skills Excellent presentation skills Ability to influence technical decision makers and executives through technical presentations, and relationship building skills Strong understanding of how marketing cloud platforms integrate into a broader MarTech ecosystem and how to sell the benefits of a well-integrated MarTech ecosystem Working knowledge of how to deliver cloud-based data management deployment projects in support of a broader, well integrated MarTech ecosystem Ability to bridge business and technical requirements to provide a cohesive, seamless solution to scale and perform Ability to develop a viable, scalable, and integrated technology blueprint across all areas of MarTech with feasible technology choices that meet the clients’ requirements and fit in with existing technology Ability to wear the hats of multiple technology across systems integration, technology consulting, and technology solution design and architecture Ability to participate and lead technology discussions with prospects (RFP IC) Experience in leading large-scale technology implementations including understanding of scoping, estimation, and managing timeline/budget Experience in legacy migration and re-platform of technology solution  In-depth knowledge of: Hands-on delivery experience with at least one of the major MarTech vendors – Adobe, Salesforce, AWS, Google Delivery ofdigital messaging solutions with tools like Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Marketing Cloud, Braze, MoEngage, Clevertap Insider, etc Real-time application integration Data Solutions and CDP (Tealium, TreasureData, AEP, Salesforce, Segment, mParticle, etc) Data and Cloud Migration to SaaS environment  Working understanding of: Enterprise level content management systems such as Adobe, Sitecore, etc. Integration of real-time site optimization, test and target in tools like Optimizely, Adobe Target, SFMC Interaction Studio Tag management in tools like Google Tag Manager, Ensighten, Tealium iQ, Adobe Launch Concepts and best practices within database architecture, navigating both structured and unstructured data, data processing (ETL and services) and customer identity management  Inclusion and Diversity We’re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won’t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That’s what we care about.  So, whether you’re joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.  www.dentsu.com  *Please include an updated CV in your application. **We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  Purpose  The jobholder leads a dynamic, multi-market, multi-product team responsible for delivering high quality service to a diverse range of highly demanding clients and is accountable for end to end delivery of Financial Markets Operations for Asia South Asia Region, covering all the streams of the relevant product operations.  The jobholder plays a critical role in the definition and implementation of transformation initiatives, service and control standards in the countries within the region. The jobholder pulls out country and region specific themes that need to be addressed at group level whilst simultaneously ensuring best practice and Group standards are adhered to in the region. This requires a high degree of understanding of the differences and nuances between the inputs from markets and the resultant impact on the global operating model.  The role requires extensive collaboration with regional and country functions such as Front office, Middle offices, Sales, Client Management, Legal, Compliance, Risk and Product Management to not only drive change in the local country teams when it comes to identifying opportunities for transformational projects but also in the managing of the day-to-day business.  The job holder carries out the end to end operational responsibilities in the region and works closely with the Regional Business Head, FM Regional COO, Regional and Group Risk Heads and the Group Operations Head to ensure that the operational units perform optimally and is able to articulate a forward-looking view of business growth, emerging industry trends and regulations to develop a platform consistent with the Bank's and business' strategic ambition.  This role has supervisory responsibilities and the Bank's supervisory principles must be followed. The jobholder monitors the performance of operations through key metrics such as - volumes, productivity, accuracy, service levels, losses/lapses, issues, risk registers and cost budgets. Collectively responsible and accountable for the setting and governance of infrastructure processes and frameworks for robust compliance and controls. There is a focus on people management and client engagement required.  The jobholder is a member of the Global FM Operations management team.  Strategy Contributes to the definition of best-practice global operating standards and operating environment within the Target Operating Model (TOM) Implements TOM and oversees its ongoing development in the region Ensures compliance with all Group and Country policies, Code of Conduct, statutory regulations and laws Strong advocate of service consistency within and across regions. Actively takes steps to eliminate / minimise use of non-standard solutions Identifies strategic service delivery issues relating to technology, process, human resource and service quality and implements appropriate solutions Ensures the operations teams in the region are optimised and that resources are effectively managed to rapidly fill any service gaps identified Participate in developing the strategic operations direction and roadmap for FM, align with Business Strategy and investment appetite. Support Architecture changes in formulation of Best Practice and apply agreed methodologies in FM and CIB. Drive the global Operations Strategy in ASA region aimed to streamline processes, enhance productivity, reduce risk, improve controls, leveraging technologies. Partner with Architecture on the digital agenda, pre-empt disruptive forces and commercialise innovative use of technologies Deliver a robust control environment which mitigates the risk of loss and safeguards the Banks assets Ensure the client experience is seamless based on efficient processing, timely resolution of client exceptions and is perceived as an enabler by the business to generate and retain client flows. Alignment of activities to support the C&IB utilities model for greater standardisation, process efficiency and cost reduction. Processes Ensures Change Management processes are adhered to in country operations working through the Country leads Ensures that key business practices and service delivery processes are conducted in compliance with Group and country regulatory guidelines Identifies operational risks and enhances control mechanisms, both for in-country processes and services hubbed offshore Update global management in a timely manner on notable operational developments and issues in the region and drives the resolution of thematic client issues and process issues Role models a strong, collaborative business relationship between FMO and hubbed centres. Maintains strong lines of communication with hubs through periodic townhall meetings etc Supports "One Bank" through strong connectivity with support and sales functions and related businesses such as Cash, FM Business Oversees effective management of country budgets. Manages overall regional budget. Deliver Business Efficiency targets Monitors client service standards to ensure high-quality operational and client support services are provided in all countries. Acts as escalation point for country level operational issues - identifies remedial solutions and oversees timely, efficient implementation when required Works closely with country leads to ensure operational platforms support client service level agreements and internal benchmarks as well as identifying opportunities for automation Proactively works with country leads to ensure development of pool of knowledgeable, mobile operations staff Champions the identification and implementation of operational best practice across markets within region and with other regions Ensures compliance with all relevant local and global regulatory requirements and industry best practice Drives continuous improvement culture to maximise cost and processing efficiency Represents the SS business at operational forums, groups and conferences in the region Clients Partner with Countries, FM Front Office and the Regional SS Head to ensure that the key services are being performed to the standard required. Alignment to FM growth targets and creating an agenda which mirrors the aims of the Product & Solutions and Delivery team. Attend Client visits where appropriate to ensure client proposition is understood, constructive feedback attained and resulting actions take to improve or provide positive feedback to staff. People and Talent Develops and embeds a high performance culture; develops talent to ensure a high quality succession pipeline; drives improvement in people engagement; and ensures the team is resourced and trained sufficiently Identifies opportunities for cross-border secondments and attachments to enhance skills of key talent Leads through example and builds the appropriate culture and values. Sets appropriate tone and expectations from the Operations team and works in collaboration with risk and control partners. Ensures that holders of all critical functions are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles, with effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks. Periodically reviews team structure and capacity plans. Sets and monitors job descriptions and objectives for direct reports and provides objective feedback and rewards in line with their performance Risk Management Understands the main risks facing the Group and identifies, assesses, monitors, controls and mitigates accordingly. Manages Operations Risk effectively, including identification, communication and remediation of risks to the relevant forums Accountability - no audit fails; full remediation/root cause analysis and execution for ops losses Governance Embed the Group's values and code of conduct in countries and hubs to ensure that adherence with the highest standards of ethics, and compliance with relevant policies, processes and regulations Aligns the Operations agenda to global and regional business strategies, to global standards and the technology roadmap Actively participates as required in Regional and / or Group committee or working group meetings Reviews effective governance, oversight and controls in the business and, if necessary, respectfully challenges unsatisfactory arrangements and recommends changes Works with regulators in an open and co-operative manner Other Responsibilities Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures; Innovation opportunities: partner with various groups to identify and pursue innovation opportunities which can benefit the securities services business within SCB; Automation & digitisation: plan and execute operational enhancements to further automate business processes while identifying Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead the ASA Region teams to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Qualifications Market Knowledge: - awareness and understanding of the wider business, economic and market environment in which the firm operates. Business Strategy and Model: - awareness and understanding of the firm's business strategy and model appropriate to the role. Risk Management and Control: - the ability to identify, assess, monitor, control and mitigate risks to the firm. Also, an awareness and understanding of the main risks facing the firm and the role the individual plays in managing them. Financial Analysis and Control: - the ability to interpret the firm's financial information, identify key issues based on this information and put in place appropriate controls and measures. Governance, Oversight and Controls: - the ability to assess the effectiveness of the firm's arrangements to deliver effective governance, oversight and controls in the business and, if necessary, oversee changes in these areas. This role would require 15+ years of relevant experience, covering the implementation of strategy into technology solutions, part of which is operating at a regional level of sizeable international companies, ideally with time in the finance sector covering FM products. International exposure, ability to handle cultural diversity and developing high performers are essential to this role.

companyName: Bank of Singapore, Asia's Global Private Bank
description: At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programs that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today!  PMG Management Office (“PMO”) is the Operating Centre of Excellence for Product Management Group across all offerings, all teams and all locations. The team is responsible for strategic initiatives, data management, new products, change and transformation including Advisory & Execution, operational risk and business management.  The Key Responsibilities Will Include  Reporting to the Content Led Wealth Management head, The Product Owner (“PO”) for Advisory and Analytics is responsible for the product vision and roadmap working with squads and project teams to ensure timely delivery. The PO is a persistent role that goes beyond an individual project. The role holder will work with various system and process owners that contribute to or are part of the overall product area. Define strategic product vision for advisory and analytics with the customer experience in mind and related key objectives. The PO is responsible for maximizing the value of the product resulting from the work of the squad(s) while maintaining the conceptual and technical integrity of the features/ components. He has to anticipate & understand client needs and define customer journey. Manage stakeholders, Be the key liaison between squad(s) and users, anticipate and organise/ manage user council / advisory forums as well as conduct user training Establish the product roadmap & ensures availability of product features (via the product backlog) that addresses customers’ needs. Manage product backlog, backlog prioritisation meeting and QBR. Prioritise user stories / product features. Participate in release / sprint planning & provide signoff for sprint demo and feedback to the Delivery team. Evaluate product progress at each iteration (measured against key results), Plan sprints and drive backlog refinement sessions, Participate in Scrum of Scrums, Manages UAT (incl. coverage) & ensures signoff and provide inputs on performance appraisal of delivery team Drive continuous product (& roadmap) improvements new project features and deliveries required to address users’ feedback and changing customer needs. Ensure constant customer feedback loop. Track product adoption & engagement, responsible of ROI. Agree with the technology partner on any squad formation matters such as hiring, mitigation plans. Engage cross-functional stakeholders and users to ensure the released developments meet the user needs (including User Experience) and supports the business objectives of strategic growth, revenue uplift, enhanced client experience, improved risk management and operational efficiency. Partner with external vendors (as required) to jointly deliver the aspirations of portfolio management within scope, timelines, and budget. Engage L&C for feature rollout & obtains regulatory approvals Main Duties  Managing a project team, the Advisory and Analytics PO main responsibilities will be Definition of relevant risk measurement indicators and portfolio risk/return optimization approach, in close collaboration with Front Office and CIO teams. Selection and on-boarding of a new solution for Advisory Portfolio optimization Definition of the Target Operating Model for processes impacting RMs, ICs and Client experience. Streamline the processes to digitalize the advisory, products personalization, and proposal generation. Work closely with in-house technology and architecture team to provide integrated solution that suits with bank of Singapore ecosystem. Requirements Experience in managing Projects end to end, from Inception to roll-out & training. Proven experience in leading transformational projects in wealth & asset management or portfolio management business within a private bank Deep expertise in advisory and portfolio management businesses in wealth management Degree, master’s degree in computer science, Technology, Finance Minimum of 10 years of technical expertise in financial products as advisor, portfolio manager or sales and marketing Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and to adapt to complex demands in a diverse culture A driven self-starter who is delivery focused and possesses strong communication, influencing and presentation skills. Well organized with a natural inclination for conceptual thinking, planning strategy and solutioning; able to multi-task and meet multiple deadlines. Strong stakeholder management skills and good interpersonal skills, the candidate will demonstrate ability to work confidently and collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders of varying seniority. Relevant certifications or qualification (CFA) is advantageous. Primary Location  Singapore  Job  Project Management  Organization  Bank of Singapore Division  Schedule  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  23-Jul-2021, 11:41:16 PM
industries: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services

jobTitle: S&PP Pricing Optimization Lead – Growth Markets
description: About Accenture  Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Job Summary:  Accenture Pricing Architects are a highly visible group with a mission to develop and implement strategies and tactics that enable Accenture deal teams to maximize profitability and achieve desired outcomes for our clients through compelling, market-based pricing and commercial propositions. This role drives key strategic and tactical decisions related to pricing and profitability for a given geography, working across industries and services groups with a focus on building relationships, knowledge, and insights about each commercial environment. Market, Services, and Market Unit leads are trusted advisors within their respective Leadership teams.  Primary responsibilities include:  Establish guidance for Market Unit pricing architect team, provide thought leadership, and influence key decision makers.  Core Service Execution  Market Pricing Strategy and Execution: Support senior leadership in defining Accenture’s pricing approach to maximize profitable growth across Client Groups.  Deal Pricing Strategy and Execution: S&C Pricing Architects design and implement commercial strategies to enhance profitability, overseeing price positioning and client optics, deal shaping, deal qualification activities and financial structuring.  Competitive Positioning: Pricing Competitive Architects build a point of view about competitor pricing and capabilities, derive deal-specific Accenture price target based on differentiation, and work with stakeholders to achieve target.  Rate Card Strategy and Development: Rate Card Pricing Architects design and develop client rate cards for account teams.  Portfolio Ownership: Develop the strategies and tactics to improve the overall pricing within a specific Service and/or Market Unit in partnership with senior leadership. Grow pricing teams’ engagement within the portfolio.  Drive and manage programs that improve sales  Identify and drive sales & pricing performance improvements by developing and implementing best practices, process and reporting.  Support sales professionals/leaders in understanding client requirements, constraints, buyer values and high-level acceptability criteria for any solution.  Work with Solution Delivery and Sales teams in identification, analysis, solution, business case development, proposal preparation and presentation to clients.  Define, monitor and analyze program metrics, targets and strategic imperatives based on fiscal year plans as well as structure and/or review the cost models to achieve the most competitive price.  Operational Execution  With MU and Service Leadership, proactively manage the pipeline to ensure accuracy, identify trends (including but not limited to deal sizes, MD time, ADR / CCI, pyramids, commercial constructs etc.), and provide insight on opportunities for optimization both overall and across priority deals.  Guide Pricing Support team in developing pricing and commercial propositions for bids and proposals, demonstrating the greatest value to clients and driving market-based pricing.  Build and maintain strong relationships both internally within the practice and externally with clients.  Other Service Offerings  Education: Support upskilling of client-facing practitioners and internal teams involved in sales & pricing, equipping them with the context and confidence to defend market-based pricing.  Negotiations: Provide coaching on negotiation tactics and walk-away points and directly participate in client and/or procurement negotiations.  Deal Profitability Triage: For specific opportunities identified by the Market and/or opportunities below deal level targets, identify avenues to increase price and/or margin on the opportunity across all aspects (e.g., solution, costing, commercials).  TPA Benchmark Defense: Lead/support client/account teams through a Third Party Advisor (TPA) benchmark of an existing contract or a sole source pursuit.  Support sales  Build credible relationships and manage interface with Sales Lead(s), Legal, Finance, Contracting, Human Resources, Recruiting, Marketing, and other internal organizations, as well as clients, as appropriate  Understand Accenture assets, offerings and methodologies to match to client business needs effectively  Knowledge & Skill Requirements:  Competitive Analysis: EXPERT  Deal Shaping: ADVANCED  Executive Presence: EXPERT  Market Intelligence: EXPERT  Negotiation: ADVANCED  Pricing & Commercial Strategy Development: EXPERT  Pricing & Profitability Optimization: EXPERT  Educational Qualification  Must have:  Undergraduate degree  English language fluency (oral and written)  Good to have:  Business Management education desirable  Skills & Work Experience  Must have:  A minimum of 12 years of experience  Good to have:  Deep understanding of S&PP processes and tools preferred  Understanding of Finance processes desirable  Other Requirements  Must support/mirror working hours for the supported Market Unit or other business area  Must be flexible with work hours according to shifting business needs  Must have good internet connectivity and distraction-free environment for working at home, in accordance with local guidelines  May be required to travel on rare occasions  Additional Comments  Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.  What Makes a Good Pricing Architect?  Experience working in a senior role with "deal shaping" expertise. Is great at educating and influencing other leaders, to change behaviors in line with desired outcomes. "Grew up" and made Manager on the line.  Highly knowledgeable about the key components of a deal that can enhance profitability, with proven ability to structure different pricing arrangements  Enjoys the hunt - thrives on negotiation, but recognizes a good negotiation should be a win/win  Consummate Learner AND Teacher - we want people who are intellectually curious and quick studies, with a mindset and drive to aggressively change behaviors toward market-relevant pricing  Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with gravitas, confidence and credibility to engage and take on commercial negotiations with senior client decision makers and procurement teams  Well-connected within their practice and viewed as an equal among the deal team - it is best for the practice lead to identify potential candidates (i.e. hand-select the bottle from the cellar)  All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law

description: About ExpressVPN  We’re a fast-growing SAAS tech company providing privacy and security protections to consumers around the world. We build and operate services that are easy to use, fast, and secure. We've been in business for more than 11 years, we’re highly profitable, growing, and actively hiring.  Some highlights: Large customer base worldwide, which brings many challenges and opportunities. We have millions of users who rely on our service 24/7/365 for a broad range of use-cases. Excellence in operations is therefore core to our business. Successful business in a fast-growing industry. We are a leader in a fragmented market and are growing quickly both because the industry is expanding and because we are gaining market share. We have sufficient financial resources to tackle large challenges for the long term. Highly skilled team using efficient processes. Meritocratic culture with fast decision-making.  About Data Group at ExpressVPN  The Data Group’s key objective is to enable all departments to grow the extent of data-driven decision making in both their strategy and day to day, through a self-serve approach. Some of the Group’s key customers are: Sales & Marketing  Product  Operations  Customer Support  Finance Internal Engineering who consume data for analysis or hook into events to reduce complexity of application development and/or for operations.  Current group structure:   Our tech stack currently is mostly AWS Redshift, BigQuery, Spark, Airflow and Tableau, and we imagine it will evolve significantly over time. Data Analysts within our data-insights function partner with business stakeholders to integrate data into their decision making. We need to grow this further to support deeper and wider partnerships.   Data Engineers within our data-engineering function support data-insights by delivering data through managed pipelines, with a continual delivery process to improve reliability. We need to grow our engineering roles significantly and intend to have a range of engineering roles on the team, covering people with backgrounds in software development and infrastructure operations.  We intend to improve more advanced data insights by building data science capabilities. We intend to build a new data-governance function to further define and uphold data standards, policies and processes across the organisation.   Responsibilities of this position  This is a newly created position and your joining the company will mark the beginning of a Data Group to bring together all functions that work in this area.   The data-engineering function will be a key initial focus for you. It needs to grow significantly and the company's data pipelines and responsible engineers are currently spread across multiple teams, so organisational design and data product design skills will be key. You will create a dedicated data-engineering function to build a data platform to support the needs of others in the group (data-insights) and others in the organisation (other engineers). Your responsibilities for data-engineering will include: Create the hiring plan world-wide - set out your organisational design, design plans for assessing candidates, work with our recruiting-team to source and test candidates, hire and onboard new staff. We’re currently very much under-staffed. You need to grow the team significantly. Be the people leader for all members of the function. You hire, train, motivate, assign responsibilities, and hold people accountable. You will compare actual versus expected deliverables at high frequencies, and exchange actionable feedback. Articulate a strategic vision for the data-platform product. Your vision will deliver against both the needs within the data group and broader within the organisation. You will define an agile project delivery approach for your vision, such that data-engineers will start to deliver clear business value quickly.  Design processes, document them very clearly, measuring their metrics, and improving them.  As a follow on from the initial data-engineering focus and to appropriate timings, your role in leading the Data Group will include:  Articulate a strategic vision for the Data Group. Your vision for organisational design goes beyond data-engineering encompassing data-insights, data-science and data-governance in collaboration with each function lead. You will create and execute hiring plans for data-science and data-governance to appropriate timelines matching your overall strategy.  The Data Group works efficiently together across functions in servicing business stakeholder’s needs as a result of your organisational design, product design and process optimisations.     Increase the extent of data-driven decision making in both strategy and day to day across the organisation.  Create a strong culture of agile project delivery, ensuring people across the department understand the business value of what everyone in the data organization works to deliver.  Desired skills and experience Experienced leader of multiple teams in the data space. That means; You’re able to articulate and execute large hiring plans for multiple teams with a track record of hiring great people You’ve managed other people managers for at least 3 years. You’ve demonstrated the ability to develop a team including hiring, coaching and mentoring of team members. You’ve been a people manager for individuals from a different functional background to yours.   You have experience of different data group organisational designs, with some exposure to managing growth and/or re-organisation of such groups.  Product requirements gathering and user stories  You’ve worked with multiple stakeholders to draw out requirements and define use cases and acceptance criteria.  You have a proven ability to assess use cases and requirements, then propose suitable agile product delivery approaches.  Excellent communication skills - you are able to engage people across the organisation at all levels.  Relationships and influencing - able to quickly understand how an organisation works, making connections and building effective relationships with key stakeholders and partners.     Show strong leadership in Data Governance and Quality Define processes and procedures to ensure we meet all our goals in terms of quality for the entire organization Align the data organization with privacy goals of the company Communicate policies company wide and make sure the organization knows how to discover and access data Fluent English written and verbal communication skills  Note: Please do not include any salary information and submit your resume in PDF format.

jobTitle: Global E-commerce Governance Algorithm and Modeling Operations
description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.  Within Product Strategy & Operations team, the Monetization Product organization (MPO) is responsible for Customer Support, Tools & Workflows and Product operations. Its mission is to provide Best in class customer Experience by ensuring excellence in customer service and streamlining process & tools to ensure smooth operations.  As a Global lead for Process & Tools you are responsible for streamlining processes and tools to ensure smooth operations. You will be working closely with the product team to develop/improve Tools and design processes to make operations better. You will be the gateway between product and business teams, gathering requirements from business lines, prioritizing and influencing the product teams on tool development.  Responsibilities Work closely with Product Managers and Engineering to understand the Operations Tools Roadmap and influence the prioritization of teams' needs Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand their requirements and work with Product team to build features on the tools based on user requirements Manage & Inspire a global team while influencing stakeholders and engaging cross-functional partners to evaluate and transform our tools ecosystem Develop the roadmap and operationalize key tools supporting Sales & operations Streamline workflows and processes along with aligning SLA's with key stakeholders Measure effectiveness and make recommendations for ongoing improvement leading to impact Clearly articulate prioritized business needs to the Product Management team and influence their roadmap to address them Build & maintain the knowledge base including self-help module for external clients  Qualifications BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 8+ years with 6 years+ managing large-scale global teams and 2+ years of experience in digital/tools or operations role is preferred Previous experience Influencing and owning an automation tool roadmap, owning canned response content and quality as well as managing and resolving deepdive automation failures Experience managing projects/programs and multi-stakeholder engagements Fluency in Mandarin is a plus

jobTitle: Senior VP, Wealth Transformation Program, Group Retail
description: About UOB  United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.  Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.  About The Department  The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.  Personal Financial Services  We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.  Job Responsibilities Gather use cases in the Wealth Advisory business line and prioritize use cases that are in line with business imperative. Design customer journey and business flow for both online and offline engagements with customers Define the data analytics requirements and customer insights requirements to drive contextual customer engagement for the Wealth Advisory journey Work with stakeholders across business functions to drive end to end solutions to enable wealth journey and solution executions and customer engagement. Support the change management program to ensure that the designed solution is adopted by the stakeholders to realize the business objectives. Actively participate in the overall Wealth Transformation Program, supporting other related initiatives and colleagues as needed to drive towards the common goal for the Program Job Requirements Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in business or marketing. Deep understanding of the wealth advisory journey for different customer segments, from mass affluent to privilege banking Strong understanding of investment and insurance products & business drivers Experience in designing and implemented Digital journeys Actively driving test and learn with data driven insights applied to sales and advisory journey Good knowledge of local financial advisory ecosystem landscape Strong stakeholder management ability Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Confident and professional Experience in project management, technology, Agile approach would be preferred Be a part of UOB Family  UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.  Apply now and make a difference.
industries: Banking and Financial Services

description: Primary Purpose  You will manage service portfolio across Enterprise Data Managed Services (EDMS) in the ITSS portfolio. It is a horizontal role which supports the business and cloud portfolio delivery for the identified areas of focused competences. This includes day-to-day operation and delivery matters, and the P&L delivery owner for Technology Solutions and Day-1 client engagement on delivery matters for those defined competence and account segment(s) assigned.  Responsibilities Project Services Delivery Incorporates the end to end deliverables of the Service Contract to your assigned clients Client engagement with customers, managing external and internal stakeholders’ expectations and deliverables outcome. Growth of the account and looking into delivering excellent Customer Engagement experience. Adopt industry best practices and ensure that the right tools, techniques, methodologies and systems to deliver the services that meet international standards. Perform sales engagement, participate in account growth planning and vendor management with go-to-market teams to facilitate attainment of strong order book through project signings. This include representing EDMS in proposal reviews such as influencing quality assurance of proposals submitted. Day1 Execution Lead both the Service and Technical delivery team in day-to-day TS executional matters, and ensure services are delivered with pride, and sustainable model. The delivery includes leading teams on delivery excellence and driving towards completion of projects against planned milestones and timeline; Service recovery and improvement if there are gaps and escalations; and enhancing the service values to the customer. Engage and manage 3rd party partners, to align their delivery competency and capabilities with client’s service contract to our customers. You are also expected to make tactical plans on a year on year for core each identified technologies appropriate for account/sectors, to ensure year on  year performance excellence and relevance to market situation. A portfolio to assigned accounts, subjective to the size and scale of the service contract. Expected to make strategic and tactical plans in alignment of delivery across multiple service portfolios and support EDMS and NCS strategic business plans. Financial Management Manage the financials for the service projects under your purview. This includes the Business Case of the service contracts on cost of delivery, recovery of cost in respective service centre. Manage a healthy profit and loss across each service contract, per provided based on won contracts/improve and optimize more if possible as part of the discharge of the responsibilities. This includes but is not limited to annual AOP budgeting, financial planning for each service contract or delivery centres, financial for team training plans, and annual team bonding and EDMS level of activities. People and Growth Coach and mentor the delivery teams, either under direct or indirect management (e.g. 3rd party partners or contractors). This include thought leadership, and people management skills for various team under his service portfolios. Coach the Team members to develop Individual Development Plan and proper career path planning. Provide leadership and direction to project teams and oversee the development of competencies and career progression of team members.  The Ideal Profile Should Have / Be Degree in any discipline preferably related to Information Technology Infrastructure Min 15 years in the ICT industry with proven delivery experience in a sizable contract or organization Deep experience in IT services contract and complex implementation projects in both legacy and cloud managed service environment Experience in coaching and recovering trouble projects Good understanding of both business and delivery risks, especially in client work and delivery Strong collaboration and teaming experience, and ability to work with both senior leadership as well as operational and working level executives. Excellent relationship and stakeholder management skills - capable of dealing with people across all levels of a large, complex, fast moving organisation with constant transformation to stay market relevant. Able to develop high-quality presentations by synthesizing key information, financial data, market data and other relevant information  Apply today to be part of the winning team that does great work!  #NCSlife
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Truegenics Pte Ltd is a personal care Vitamin, Mineral, and Supplement (VMS) company that specializes in Direct Response marketing. We sell our own brand of health supplements to a global audience and strive to add more life into their days. We believe that even the smallest action can define one’s destiny and are committed to the creation of products that enhance the lives of our consumers. MISSION OF THE ROLE: This role reports directly to the CEO and is responsible for the full development and execution of Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) strategies in order to help increase conversions and achieve overall company goals and objective. This role will also need to be comfortable managing a team comprising of local and remote employees. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage and lead a team to concept, build, implement and manage a robust pipeline of optimization to drive improvement in conversion rates, cart value and improve customer experience. Spearhead and brainstorm with CEO and key leaders on new strategies that will increase customer acquisition and also lifetime value of our customers. Able to apply and integrate advanced knowledge and best practices to the development of new methods, procedures, and protocols for the Conversion Optimization team. Develop and execute CRO strategies, analyze and oversee split test experiments and leverage on conversion opportunities in order to help the Sales team achieve their revenue goals. Proactively monitor and report on key metrics, split test results and its analysis to key internal stakeholders. Responsible for all funnels set up, optimization execution and reporting which includes conducting UAT (test-buys). Manage multiple campaigns, tasks, and regular product launches with rapidly changing variables. You will need to take end-to-end ownership and accountability for these projects. Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as IT, Sales and Creative Operations in order to ensure smooth operations and that project deadlines are met. Facilitate problem solving and resolve day-to-day operational issues concerning team’s area of work to ensure completion of tasks. Support other ad-hoc projects as and when required. KEY SKILLS / EXPERIENCE: A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Business Information Technology, Business Analytics, Marketing, Information Technology or related field) is required. At least five (5) years of Conversion Optimization experience, with the last two (2) years in a managerial role with people management responsibilities. Experience in the e-commerce industry would be a plus. Basic coding skills in HTML5, CSS3, Javascript is a must. Highly analytical and must be very comfortable with numbers & analyzing of data. Excellent attention to detail. Must be able to hit deadlines and move projects through to completion with minimal supervision. Work well independently and collaboratively with all levels of the organization. Demonstrate ability to work well in a fast-moving environment and react quickly under pressure. Strong project management skills. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to lead and motivate the team members under you. Ability to influence decision-making, work effectively, and implement solutions in a cross-functional team environment. Experience with Microsoft Office suite of programs, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
industries: Health, Wellness and Fitness

description: What This Job Involves  This role aims to work with JLL’s global and local occupier and investor clients to deliver upon their Sustainability ambitions. This role is customer facing, Executive facing, and team oriented. The role will be centred around the following key elements-  Business Development and Sales Enablement Work closely with E&S team and leadership to develop deep market expertise and become a local expert for individual product details, specifications, and value propositions in addition to a clear articulation of user personas and behaviours Join client connections, pitches etc. to provide sustainability positioning and market differentiation Assist in managing the overall BD and sales process, maintaining regular contact with your stakeholders to keep pursuits moving ahead Create a pool of case studies, client success stories, testimonials, research and sales material which can be used in sales situations Contribute to sales for local markets business (Office leasing, Capital markets, Valuations etc.) & identify opportunities for local and regional sales of Energy & Sustainability products Lead Generation Focus on cultivating organic sales opportunities, and targeted messaging to specific client pursuits, with a goal of generating new leads, and helping win new work for local business & Energy and Sustainability Create linkages between lead generation marketing, and wider corporate marketing efforts, such as thought leadership, and broader brand-based marketing Training Develop training materials and run workshops to develop sustainability knowledge within markets teams (working with E&S product enablement, markets learning & development etc.) Performance Objectives  Leadership Position yourself and the team as the go-to experts within the business, and within the market, creating excitement and buy-in to our vision of being a leader in sustainable real estate Maintain strong relationships with senior executives across the business, particularly C-Suite leaders in Singapore BD / Sales Enablement / Lead Generation Measured by BD pipeline size, speed to conversion and margin performance working closely with regional head of sales Maintaining a suite of sales enablement tools which supports the business, and particularly assists project leads in winning work Training Create and manage a series of training for wider business around sustainability working closely with regional product enablement, marketing Background And Experience- More than 7 years experience in delivering sustainability consulting projects, carbon/ESG reporting, green building projects, or in a related role. Proven change agent, collaborator, problem solver, creating win-win outcomes Hold the gravitas and vision required for a role of this scale JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. jobTitle: Director, Head of FX Trading, APAC
description: About Wells Fargo  Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 20 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Market Job Description Develop and implement FX trading strategy in APAC in line with the global FX business plans to grow its revenue base Identify opportunities for the current platform and proactively drive the platform buildout for growth Deliver financial results and market share of our client franchise Partner with the Global Sales team to develop and grow our current client base and to develop strong partnership with our clients Ensure all transactions comply with all operational risk and compliance requirements Serve clients through pricing, construction of robust, data-driven trade ideas, consistent communication with Sales. Generate consistent profitability and manage risk prudently while partnering with various risk management functions. Work with other Trading Desks across locations to accurately and efficiently disseminate market relevant information. Improve trading desk infrastructure by leveraging in-house technology and optimize electronic trading across Asia/Europe/US. Provide feedback on customer satisfaction and make recommendations to drive product innovation Market Skills and Certifications  The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following: Extensive knowledge of FX products and solutions In depth understanding of technological, risk and regulatory trends impacting FX business Technical expertise in regulatory, compliance, and risk management issues. Successful track record of industry thought leadership and developing senior level relationships. Strong experience in developing and execution of business strategies. Ability to analyze data and use for decision-making and managing initiatives. Successful track record in systematically executing initiatives using project management disciplines. Highest level of integrity and good judgement and ability to maintain confidentiality. Strong stakeholder skills and ability to work and lead across functions. Strong commercial judgement, excellent communication and influencing skills. Comfortable working in a matrix organizational environment and partnership skills. University Degree or advanced qualifications and equivalent experience Extensive proven experience with Securities and investment banking experience at leadership level. Experience in leading a FX trading team in APAC. Strong sense of urgency and commitment as well as a strong business sense with a strategic and tactical orientation. Relevant license for conducting FX trading activities. Leadership Expectations at Wells Fargo  Specifically You Will  As a Team Member manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them. Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks. We Value Diversity  At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. 67944  Reference Number  67944BR
industries: Financial Services, Investment Management, and Banking

description: Competitive Package Inclusive Environment About Our Client  Headquartered in Germany, our client is a Global Tech MNC with presence in over 200 countries. They are a strong advocate in digital transformation and continuously disrupts the industries they step foot in. Our client also prides themselves as a diverse and inclusive organization, welcoming all to join.  Job Description Prospecting new technology and infrastructure ideas in the Vertical Markets Business Development for new opportunities within the designated region Build strong customer relationship with existing clients Project support for both new and existing customers Analyze new concepts and market trends The Successful Applicant About 5 years of experience of Sales / Business Development, preferably in Vertical Projects Portfolio knowledge of Factory & process automation within digital industries Experience in managing full sales cycle within Industrial Verticals Strong presentation & management skills Decisive and proactive What's On Offer  The successful candidate will enjoy a successful tenure within an established MNC, priding themselves as a diverse and inclusive organization. Additionally, a structured career path in present coupled with a competitive remuneration.  Contact: Jeremy Tan (Lic No: R2198886)  Quote job ref: 4205851  Brand: PP
