description: Minimum Qualifications University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Mathematics or Statistics Experience building and operating large scale information systems with high performance and throughput Experience growing and leading multiple engineering teams Experience gathering business requirements, formulating metrics and building reports Understanding of data architecture, access patterns, relational / non-relational database concepts, data modeling and application implementations Experience creating rich consumer mobile and / or web applications Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English Strong passion for building a APAC customer-centric business from an engineering perspective Preferred Qualifications Backend development experience with Scala, Golang, Java and / or Python Experience with AWS or Google Cloud Platform Experience in the travel/E-commerce industry Experience with hiring and scaling teams in APAC About The Job  We’re looking for an experienced engineering leader to spearhead our international expansion efforts in Asia-Pacific (APAC). You’ll work with a highly skilled team of technical, data and product-focused individuals, whose mission is to consistently find and deliver the best travel deals and shopping experience for our APAC customers, by localizing existing applications, integrating local content, introducing new payment options and tailoring the Hopper travel marketplace with custom features.  We are looking for a leader experienced in building and working with fast-growing teams, with a focus on fast time to market and operational excellence.  You have strong software, business, data modeling and analytical skills. Everything we do is focused on customer experience, data measurement and delivering value at speed. You’ll be the technical leader responsible for making that a reality and lead the group making that happen.  Responsibilities Collaborate closely with a fast-growing team of business stakeholders and product leaders - you will be a key player on the regional leadership team Launch scalable supplier integration and payment solutions to ensure Hopper delivers the most robust and price competitive flights, hotels and cars inventory to our millions of customers Launch new travel verticals that are of strategic importance for the region like intercity bus travel or alternative accommodations. Launch custom experiments, products and features that will drive adoption of Hopper in APAC Hire and grow a high-performance team, ensuring cultural alignment and introducing processes where needed Set the technology direction for local teams and work alongside travel platform leadership to shape the air, hotels, cars and payments technology roadmaps Coach managers and individual contributors and grow them as leaders and technologists Champion the Hopper Leadership Principles Represent Hopper in the regional technology ecosystem, positioning our employer brand as well as our technical and engineering capabilities Benefits Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options Unlimited PTO WeWork All Access Pass OR Work-from-home stipend Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business Open communication with management and company leadership Small, dynamic teams = massive impact 100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans Despite the pandemic’s impact on the travel industry, Hopper has emerged stronger than ever. As the travel industry continues to rebound, Hopper has seen its valuation more than double since early 2020, reflecting the strength of our mobile-only marketplace and the value customers are deriving from our proprietary suite of fintech offerings.  Here are just a few stats that demonstrate our recent growth: Hopper’s valuation is now over $3.5B, reflecting the strength of its mobile-only marketplace and value customers are deriving from the company’s proprietary suite of fintech offerings. Based on its current run rate, Hopper is pacing towards 330% revenue growth compared to last year, and it has already surpassed its pre-pandemic revenue peak from Q1 2020 by over 100%. Hopper has over 60 million downloads, consistently ranks as one of the most downloaded travel apps, and now has a larger air travel market share in North America than it did before the pandemic (source: MIDT). The company is on track to surpass $1.5 billion in travel sales this year, with 40% coming from the hotel and car rental categories. Hopper’s fintech offerings, such as Price Freeze and Rebooking Guarantee, now represent 50% of its revenue. Given the success of its travel fintech, Hopper recently launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud , where any travel provider can unlock a totally unique revenue stream by seamlessly integrating and offering Hopper’s travel fintech. The industry opportunity for Hopper Cloud is enormous as projections estimate that if all travel distribution channels offered travel fintech, it could increase the total consumer spend for the sector by $200 billion annually.  All this recent growth is just the beginning. There are still so many new opportunities we’re excited to tackle in the next year!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.  foodpanda is the leading, on-demand food delivery company in Singapore, bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture.  We are looking for an experienced Head of Supply Chain to provide expertise and responsibility for the country’s supply chain and demand planning functions. You will lead the end-to-end supply chain in a fast growing e-grocery player ensuring the highest on-shelf availability and low shrinkage (wastage) by keeping the right quantity of inventory available in the right store at the right time.  About The Role  This role will be based in Singapore and will report to the Director of Retail.  What's On Your Menu Supply Chain Monitor weekly/monthly KPIs, making sure supplier performance is in line with targets and identifying root cause and corrective actions to address fulfilment/delay issues Secure sufficient inventory coming from suppliers directly to micro fulfilment centres or to DCs to support fast-paced sales growth Develop and maintain fruitful contractual relationships with supply chain counterparts of FMCG and 3PL partners Demand Planning Produce sales projections based on statistical forecast, marketing activities (promotions, phase in/phase out, new launches, discontinuations) and operational inputs Oversee and ensure that actual stock is within acceptable level and correct stock cover is set on per store/category/SKU level Identify excess/slow moving stock and work with internal stakeholders to reduce excess/slow moving stock Distribution Centre Operations Project manage the end-to-end trial and launch of 3PL solutions beginning with, but not limited to, contract negotiations, service level agreements, tech integration and supplier onboarding Develop a comprehensive network strategy that integrates our distribution center and Dmart network with additional growth opportunities for the foodpanda platform Arrange weekly/monthly performance review with the 3PL partner to follow-up on stock accuracy, inbound/outbound efficiency, including any value-added services, OTIF and distribution cost are within budget Collaborate and drive productivity benefits of 3PLs driving down cost per activity such inbounding, pick & pack and replenishment Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field At least 5 years experience in Supply Chain, preferred in FMCG industry Experience leading 3PL partners in FMCG or direct experience as 3PL for FMCG Ability to work independently and efficiently, across geographic and language barriers Self-starter and independent learner focused on finding solutions Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup. Should have a deep desire to excel and develop a career in a fast growing tech company Strong interpersonal skills to enable solution identification and drive implementation across the organization Ability to use data in all decision making clear argument based on cost benefit analysis What We Offer Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve Vibrant, dynamic & international workplace Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities Tasty Thursdays Birthday Leave Work Anniversar(ies) Leave Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Our People & Places Solutions business - reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do - the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology - we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.  Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed - today and into tomorrow.  Your Impact An underground cable connection delivering clean, reliable energy in Germany that’s the longest of its kind. A large-scale Australian wind farm producing power for thousands of homes. Innovative solutions spanning renewable and thermal generation, energy networks and storage. When it comes to powering sustainable solutions for tomorrow, the future of energy depends on us. We are helping our clients meet the challenges in providing stable base load supply, replacing conventional thermal power plant with renewable energy and developing demand side management strategies. The role of ‘Technical Director - Wind Power’ is an essential component of a growth strategy to position Jacobs at the forefront of renewable energy and to meet the requirements of energy transition activities within the Asia Pacific (APAC) region. This role can be based in any Jacobs APAC office.  Key attributes for the successful candidate will be proven project engineering and delivery experience of onshore and offshore wind power projects in an engineering or consulting environment. The successful candidate will also be able to work collaboratively with our Operations and Sales teams to provide client focus and support, innovative solutions to clients most challenging problems, connect and nurture our technical resources and evolve a wind power technical practise that is future ready and aligned with our regional growth strategy.  Here’s What You’ll Need Ability to assure the quality of technical outputs through the appointment of suitably qualified Technical Leaders within the discipline and their assignment to individual tenders and projects. Develop and maintain the framework of Technical Leaders required to suit the evolving needs of the discipline. Develop and implement a set of priorities and goals to underpin the success of the technical practice through harnessing the benefits of diversity and inclusion by providing visible inclusive leadership, effective succession planning, exploring recruitment and retention strategies and providing mentoring/sponsorship to staff. Know how to effectively shape the direction of the technical practice based on future-focused insights and thought leadership and Jacobs’ focus areas. Provide technical leadership in Sales and actively participate in Client engagement and business development opportunities in pursuit of future work for the business. Identify, manage and mitigate the technical risk exposure to the business by ensuring adequate controls are identified and applied to technical risks in both Sales and Project Delivery. Ability to collaborate with and support the Technical Director cohort to bring the best of Jacobs to bear on every opportunity and project undertaken across the business. Collaborate with APAC Power Technical Directors to develop a leading regional technical practise that challenges the power solutions we provide today and reinvents the solutions we provide tomorrow. Understand Jacobs sustainability values and priorities and work with Jacobs senior leaders to provide thought leadership to our clients, markets and staff on how these are reflected in the actions we take and the work that we do.  Jacobs. A world where you can. From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions - we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. We collaborate and share! By supporting one another, we all succeed.  With safety, accessibility and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too - from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals - all at a single global company. ‘We live Inclusion’ is a key value at Jacobs, we are an equal opportunity employer and encourage candidates of diverse backgrounds to apply. First Nations community members are strongly encouraged to apply.  Please note If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs.  #powersolutionsAPAC  At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.
industries: Civil Engineering, Design, and Information Technology and Services

description: Director, Logistics and Industrial  Singapore & Hong Kong  Who We Are-  We’re a world leader in real estate services and PropTech, powered by an entrepreneurial spirit. We want the most ambitious clients to work with us, and the most ambitious people to work for us. It’s as simple as that. On behalf of our clients we buy, build, occupy, lease, manage and invest in a variety of assets including industrial, commercial, retail, residential and hospitality.  A series of global trends across corporate supply chain, the transportation and storage of goods, the changing nature of retail consumer markets has given rise to an increase in real estate activity within the asset class of logistics & industrial property. This proliferating corporate demand has created a burgeoning capital marketplace – leasable space is at a premium and the race is underway in meeting this demand through investment. This has allowed for an increase in such property as an investment class with a plethora of specialist and institutional fund managers increasing allocation to logistics investments. This has been particularly prevalent in the Asia markets, with its multitude of national jurisdictions, the rising middle classes of emerging markets, and the increasing use of technology applications in retail consumption developing demand for e-commerce.  Keen to further strengthen our client offering in the Logistics & Industrial space, we are looking for aDirector, Logistics and Industrial APACinterested in developing their career with JLL. Based in either Singapore or Hong Kong and reporting into the Head of Logistics & Industrial APAC, this is a regional role that will help to drive our business throughout Asia Pacific by pursuing and executing capital markets transactions across the region’s rapidly growing logistics and industrial market.  What This Job Involves-  Having a business first mind-set  Does generating new business light a fire in you? We, too, are just as passionate about supporting new clients as we are about deepening our relationships with existing clients. In this role, you will act as an ambassador and key point of contact for our Logistics & Industrial clients. You’ll need to be quick to understand their needs and provide suitable capital markets solutions and create opportunities for growth.  Seeing the bigger picture  You’ll work with global developers and investors and develop a strategic focus on generating platform transactions as well as asset level transactions. This can include sourcing for a combination of operators, developers, capital partners and end users for a variety of mandates including JV’s, M&A, Capital Markets and Asset/Portfolio trades.  Thinking big  At JLL we are always thinking big and it’s this commitment that ensures JLL continues to help its diverse range of clients realise their ambitions. This role is no different. You’ll play a key part in our Logistics & Industrial team, leading and supporting with transactions throughout the country and region. You’ll leverage JLL’s global relationships and network to further deepen and extend existing client relationships within APAC, proactively develop relationships with our global Logistics & Industrial teams and work closely with them to facilitate business opportunities to promote cross-border transactions.  Helping Others  You understand the necessity of collaborating with leaders across multiple business lines and multiple geographies to promote the “one JLL” ethos that sets our clients’ needs and ambitions first. This will require you to gain an understanding of the wider organisation quickly and promote your own corporate profile.  Sound like you? To apply you need to be-  Experienced In Logistics & Industrial Assets  We are interested in speaking to best talent who are familiar with Logistics & Industrial Assets. You should have more than 5 years of industry experience in the Logistics & Industrial sector and come from a capital markets background with a proven track record of logistics & industrial deals in an international cross border environment ideally within APAC, US or Europe.  You should also understand the financials involved in a real estate investment deal either from a buy-side or sell-side perspective and possess the ability to run an acquisition or sale process.  A natural networker  A natural networker, you’ll be keen to get to know the movers and shakers in the industry. Whether its Real Estate Funds, Institutional Investors, Industrial/Logistics Developers or Retailers you’ll go out your way to know whose who and whose doing what.  A great communicator  Can you get your ideas across clearly both verbally and in writing? You’ll be working with many diverse interest groups so the way you share information and your ability to persuasively convey information is highly important.  Resilient  JLL is a highly dynamic business. It’s fast paced, and you’ll need to be fast paced as well. You’ll need a positive mind set and a ‘can do’ attitude when building relationships and delivering sales wins. We have a continuous improvement mentality across our business, and we’ll be looking for you to have the same.  What We Can Do For You-  At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realize your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.  Apply today!  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

description: Job Location : Orchard  Industry :Retail  Need to work shift, weekends & PH  Morning shift: 9am to 6pm  Afternoon shift : 1230pm to 930pm Conduct audit checks on cash and gift vouchers Issue Petty Cash; facilitate money-change and pack coins for cashiers Update cashiers of any forged currency to prevent loss and assist in resolving all discrepancy from cashiers Prepare daily report for cash, foreign currency, suppliers’ vouchers Check and finalize all sales amounts with over/short report Prepare and check new floats, sales bags, slip bags, float cards for promotions Any other job-related duties assigned by the Company or your superior.

description: Job Description:  As a Domain Architect for Payments & Cash Management, you will provide solutions for complex, Payments & Cash Management industry specific requirements, using your expert domain knowledge and experience in the industry. You will independently deliver high quality solutions and actively support the Sales team with the existing engagements & new opportunities. You will contribute to the product development and enable the GTM for the product/ solution offerings with Sales teams. Responsibilities: Working closely with stakeholders to develop practical domain roadmaps to move the enterprise towards the future state vision, while considering business, technical and delivery constraints Analyzing stakeholder requirements, current state architecture, and gaps to create a future state architecture vision for one or more parts of the enterprise with a focus on reduced complexity, cost efficiencies, reuse, reduced risk and/or improved business capabilities Reviewing application design, problem ticket and incident to propose short term and long-term resolution to fit with the domain roadmap Guiding and challenge the project on architecture and design decision Governing the technical debt of the domain Reviewing non-functional requirement and proposed architecture changes to anticipate evolving non-functional requirements Developing architecture principles and standards Communicating the principles, standards, vision, and roadmaps to stakeholders and proactively addressing any questions / concerns identified Acting as a trusted advisor to stakeholders in both business and IT to assist in defining and delivering high quality solutions Provide thought leadership on architectural or other topics Work with the Sales team to carve out opportunities in the Payment area Support business development activities with leading the proposals response and developing propositions Provide point of view, conduct workshops with the clients Understand payment related regulatory directives and changes in the Payments eco-system with an ability to identify the processes impacted within the client organization Develop unsolicited payment propositions and come up with new product offerings     Experience Required: Have in-depth experience in deployment architecture with a view on functional disposition, state management, concurrency, coupling, cohesion, performance, and high availability. Familiarity with best practice methodologies and tools for the entire solution lifecycle from ideation to requirements, design, development, testing, deployment, and operations An understanding of all domains of Enterprise Architecture, including the business, data, application, infrastructure, and security domains Familiarity with one or more formal Architecture frameworks / methodologies (TOGAF, Zachman, BIAN, etc.) Practical experience in data modelling, object modelling, design patterns and Enterprise Architecture tool or other software modelling tools. Experience in Payment domain areas – Core Payments, Card Payments, Retail Payments, Institutional Payments, Cross Border Payments, Clearing and Settlement particularly with ACH, Wires, EFT, SWIFT, Faster Payment, ISO20022 Experience with one or more products like Finastra- GPP, FIS, Fiserv, ACI, TSYS, Oracle, IBM Working knowledge of payment messaging standards in the financial services industry Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal Demonstrated knowledge and experience in requirements elicitation, analysis and documentation Ability to facilitate discussions, analyze and de-construct problems, develop structured solutions and categorize challenges in the project environment Highly motivated with strong analytical acumen and problem-solving skills

We want the most ambitious clients to work with us, and the most ambitious people to work for us. It’s as simple as that. Based in Singapore and reporting into the Head of Logistics & Industrial APAC, this is a regional role that will help to drive our APAC business by pursuing and executing leasing transactions across the region’s rapidly growing logistics and industrial market in the South-East Asia (SEA) region. jobTitle: Head of Digital Marketing and E Commerce
description: Our Passion is People & Food!  At our company we are committed to two things, innovation and great food ! We are a F&B group which has a mixed bag of operations. That means you will have the freedom to be creative, take risks, and truly shine. We are committed to our team growing, trying new things, and learning all that they can. Our rapid growth and breadth of accounts translates into exciting opportunities for our people!  Head of Digital Marketing and E-Commerce  Key tasks and accountabilities Manage, create and implement digital marketing campaigns for multiple brands of the group Manage, create and implement social media strategies, tools and presence across all brands. Plan and implement ecommerce strategy Implement website development, working closely with developers and technology team to deliver new functionality. Use analytics tools to report on e-commerce activity. Support online partnerships and advertising including writing ad copy and briefing designs Adding and monitoring onsite promotions and codes, including running usage reports Manage external supplier relationships to ensure website performance is maintained and service level targets met First point of contact for customer website issues and handling/resolving issues where possible Define SEO/PPC strategy alongside our external partner, Reload Monitor PPC campaigns and work on website optimisation projects Implement email marketing strategy as well as monitoring campaigns Advise and support the wider team on email strategy and managing campaign schedules Enable the social media community and engage with key influencers. Oversee the social strategy, developing the content calendar Manage content creation and implementation by the team Use of social media management tools, and moderation across Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and other channels. Ensure marketing campaigns across the division incorporate social media activity as appropriate with realistic outcomes achieved Support the implementation of the overall digital marketing strategy. Interpret analytics and report on impact of community and social activity in relation to performance of the site. Line management of a Marketing team to be hired and created as required. Work with the rest of the marketing team to ensure that our online destinations are providing what users need. Propose developments and improvements as required and work with the team and suppliers to implement. Experience Required Strong track record in digital marketing/ecommerce management Established marketing expertise, ideally developed in publishing or professional sectors Proven track record in managing digital marketing campaigns utilising all digital platforms – Ecommerce, social, email, PPC, SEO Using marketing to successfully drive sales Skills Required Content management systems Email Service Providers Social media management tools Google analytics Well-organised with the ability to prioritise and meet deadlines Able to supervise freelancers effectively through clear briefing, setting expectations and feeding back constructively and regularly Use initiative to develop new ideas and solve problems

jobTitle: Business Development Director - Corporate Services, Accounting, Payroll & Tax Services
description: Job Responsibilities Be responsible for identifying, developing and evaluating marketing plans and strategies that are aligned to company’s overall strategic business objectives and direction locally and regionally. Drive increased revenue and profit to achieve the Company’s ambitious growth. Develop strategy for marketing, business development and sales that encompasses market sizing and dynamics, and customer segmentation including optimising client relationships in existing markets. Build effective and collaborative relationships with customer as well as new and existing clients. Work with HODs of all divisions to understand customer needs and execute strategies planned. Coordinate and communicate across all LOBs to ensure LOBs have a pipeline of new products / services and on-going client engagement activities. Monitor competitors’ current marketing activities and developments, trends, pricing and product offerings in order to maintain, improve and lead market share. Be proactive in understanding current market sentiments and pursuing new marketing strategies. Understand clients’ segments and strategize positioning in order to retain and attract prospective clients. Develop and implement online/ offline leads generation strategies to acquire leads for sales conversion. Manage the Alliance aspects (i.e., gatekeeper, multipliers, chambers, trade associations, government bodies and boards, etc) in order to increase visibility and associations. Establishes and manages effective programs to compensate, coach, appraise and train sales personnel. Formulates all sales policies, practices and procedures. Educates sales team by establishing programs/ seminars in the areas of new account sales and growth, sales of emerging services and multi-services sales, profitability, improved presentation strategies, competitive strategies, proper use and level of sales support, management of expenses and business/ financial issues on contracts. Promote company's Accounting, Payroll and Corporate Secretarial service to potential clients. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in marketing, MBA or similar qualifications in related field Minimum of 10 years corporate services, accounting and audit related industry or business/service solution vendors Experience in developing marketing and sales strategies Proven ability to lead and motivate the sales team towards above average result Problem-solving and analytical skills to interpret sales performance and market trend information Strong Business Acumen with Client Focus Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Strong interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills Flexible and adaptable with working on multiple projects Proactive, resourceful and able to independently multi-task Excellent command of written and spoken English. We regret only shortlisted candidate will be notified.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Job Description Develop business plans for Production Division. These include formulating the master plan for production and shipment based on sales master plan, creating investment plan, manpower plan, P&L plan in order to achieve the overall master plan Oversee, execute and responsible for the achievement of business plans Conduct various meetings and responsible for meeting resolutions, monitor and ensure smooth execution of business plans. The meetings include production meeting, sales meeting, quality meeting, new product meeting, new investment meeting, KAIZEN meeting, cost down meeting, etc. Responsible for product quality assurance Responsible and ensure adherence to the Workplace Safety and Health guidelines which include legal requirements, certification and registration, accident reporting, etc. Implement necessary reorganization for continuous improvement, make decision in hiring, appointment of managers, determine employees’ salaries and allowances, etc Emphasize the growth of organization and subordinates for business continuity and development in the long run Verify and approve product costing, expenses and payment Determine the selling prices and approve discounts application Prepare and present the monthly reports, management reports, annual reports in both English and Japanese languages Acting as key liaison person to interface with Japan HQ, regional offices and the entire group of companies globally Job Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering discipline with minimum 12 years of relevant experiences Possess in-depth knowledge of machine tool production equipment, production system such as ERP, MES, automation, IoT and hands-on operational experiences Possess practical experiences in numerical management, productivity improvement and improvement methods in manufacturing industry Strong leadership, negotiation and communication skills Fluent in both English and Japanese languages (both oral and written are equally important) Familiar with machine tool supply chain, production processes, quality control and quality assurance Well-versed in Workplace Health and Safety, fire prevention management and its relevant rules and regulations Prior management experience in machine tool industry is required
