description: Job title : Technical Director, Singapore  About The Role  The Technical Director, Singapore is responsible for supporting the company’s delivery of technical solutions, projects and support across the key platforms. This includes a leading role in pre-sales/business development and ensuring Overdose’s Southeast Asia technical offer and capabilities are on par with the rest of the network. They are also responsible for assisting the Group CTO with technical projects and functions.  Reports To  Managing Director, Southeast Asia with a dotted line into the CTO  Responsibilities  The role is designed for an experienced Technical Director, to manage project deliverables and client relationships across a large suite of clients, encompassing the following: Leadership: lead a team of technical staff & project management across Full Build, Retainers & Support. Implement tools, workflows and strategies that keep a balanced approach towards efficiency, whilst maintaining staff motivation and independence. SLAs: ensure all technical SLAs are met, and are suitably resourced. Staff will be based Internationally, and the role will require flexibility to communicate across time zones, occasionally at unsociable hours in SG. It is appreciated that this is an unavoidable requirement of managing a 24x7 team. Project Management: ensure the ongoing delivery of solutions ‘on-time’ and ‘on-budget’, liaising with multiple parties across Marketing, Design, Tech and Strategy. Oversee toolset selection for best practice project management methodologies, whilst maintaining company culture and agility. Relationship Management: own the day-to-day relationships with clients. Communicating in a timely, efficient, proactive and results driven mode. Retain and grow client value. Ensure a weekly WIP with every client is adhered to. Strategy: develop creative cross-platform activations to meet and exceed client expectations. Present balanced strategies between Marketing & Technical solutions to ensure best RoI for the client. Platforms: deep understanding of Magento 1&2, Shopify and BigCommerce platforms and all related microservices & integrations. Develop deeper appreciation of marketing platforms. Work with the MD to develop the Singapore office’s position as a commerce technology thought leader, specifically with regard to Magento 2, Shopify Plus, Big Commerce, Commerce Tools as well as headless and composable commerce. Effectively employ OD’s process and methodology to work closely with, and manage offshore development teams in Ukraine and Vietnam plus other locations TBC. Communication Within The Overdose Team Regularly communicate and collaborate with the Singapore and Ukraine teams and the wider Overdose Technical team. Be the conduit into Singapore for the combined technical knowledge of the global tech team; establishing close relationships wth the CTO and the other TDs is essential to this. Prepare and communicate effectively in all team WIP and scheduling meetings. These vary and depend on the department but include Design, Development, Client Success, SEO and Marketing. Collaborate and strategise with fellow team members to help improve the quality and effectiveness of our proposals and projects. Communicate and support all business Directors as and when needed. This may involve contributing to proposals, assisting with client reports and putting forward recommendations for client strategies. Participate in new business efforts, both in terms of scope definition and presentation. Lead the technical solutioning within new business efforts. Essential Skills Required Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team. Exceptional problem-solving skills. Exposure to Google Suite (Docs, Presentations, Sheets). Deep understanding of e-commerce platforms - i.e. Shopify, Big Commerce, Magento 1 & 2. Relevant experience of Magento 1 & 2, Shopify Plus and headless/composable commerce solutions (e.g. Commerce Tools) is essential for the role. Relevant accreditation for Magento is an essential requirement. Ability to manage multiple tasks, and adhere to time pressures and deadlines. Attention to detail, both for work output to clients, but also during an internal review process prior to work being released to clients. Benefits And Perks Competitive Salary Annual performance bonus Annual training/conference allowance Flexible working hours/location About Overdose  Overdose is an NZ head quartered, APAC success story. Having grown from 2 consultants to a team of 300+ worldwide, with additional offices in Singapore, Australia, Ukraine, Germany and the US.  Our services cover the entire commerce lifecycle; from Business Design, Brand, Creative & UX, through to Managed Execution, Platform Architecture, Social Strategy, Search, Insights and Marketing Automation.  We take a firm "no BS" approach to business, and brand ourselves anti-agency. We pride ourselves on delivering fit-for-purpose solutions, with positive RoI for our clients, and a belief structure based around creating mutual value. We refer to ourselves as "digital business accelerators", and operate primarily as partners, rather than suppliers.  In Southeast Asia, we are currently working with premier retail clients such as Courts, Bata Singapore, Whiskers N Paws, etc... to which you will be exposed.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

jobTitle: Managing Director, Data and Software Solutions
description: Make A Real Difference At PropertyGuru. Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.   At PropertyGuru Group, we believe that every person – no matter what their circumstance – should have a place to call home. That’s why we’ve been on a mission to transform how people find, finance, and own home across Southeast Asia over the last 13 years.    Voted by property seekers as “Asia’s Most Influential Brand for Online Property Search”, PropertyGuru enables real-world aspirations through digital transformation and constant innovation. Every day, the work that we do has a real and positive impact on thousands of lives.  As an employee, you’ll be empowered by our community work culture, where everyone has the autonomy, support, and resources to do the best work of their careers. As we evolve our journey to help people make confident property decisions, we stay true to our core values to guide the way we work and the decisions we make every step of the way: we own it and deliver it, we have fun, and celebrate success, we respect and care for each other, we push beyond good, and we create what’s next.   PropertyGuru is committed to the digital transformation of the real estate industry in Southeast Asia by offering our customers data-driven insights and platforms to act upon them to drive tangible business value.  As the Managing Director for Data and Software Solutions, the role will be a mix of venture leader, entrepreneur in residence, and C-suite level leadership focused on building and scaling new products and businesses, both organically and inorganically. You will lead multiple cross-functional teams of digital and non-digital professionals to build a suite of business verticals that will drive significant growth for PropertyGuru in the coming years.  Reporting to the Group CEO, you will be responsible for defining the vision, strategy, and execution of innovative and game-changing products & services that build trust in the ecosystem through transparency and efficiency.  This is a unique opportunity for an experienced and highly motivated leader.   The role :  As the Managing Director for PropertyGuru Data and Software Solutions (DSS) business, you will: Imagine, define and “Create What's Next" for PropertyGuru. Establish and deliver against a Vision for our multi-platform Software and Data businesses, with a focus on enterprise customers in the property sector. Have complete ownership of the business's P&L, including sales quota, commissions, operating expenses, and R&D costs. Partner closely with the corporate development and strategy teams to identify, evaluate, acquire, integrate, and scale companies that will help expedite our quest to build a unified property trust platform in SEA. Build and lead a high-quality team of sales professionals, digital specialists, product managers, and analysts. Proactively identify industry, customer, and technology trends as well as innovation opportunities. Leverage a bouquet of data and SaaS products to offer integrated solutions to a diverse set of enterprise customers, including Property Developers, Banks, Valuers, and Governments. Create a scalable structure and process within the DSS business vertical, ensuring cost-effective use of resources across product lines without hindering the potential of hyper-growth.  Who are we looking for :  15+ years of professional working experience, 8 of which in product/ service innovation leadership in a digital business (ideally working within a fast-paced and competitive B2B software/SaaS environment, one that has experienced rapid growth and expansion). Established credentials of managing commercial teams to drive sales and revenue. Familiarity with B2B SaaS sales dynamics will be preferred.  Experience with change management and building an integrated culture of excellence. Track record of managing multiple senior managers and distributed cross-functional teams. Proven track record of rapidly scaling products and services and comfort with hypergrowth revenue. Demonstrated ability to build a new technology business, business unit, as an entrepreneur or as an entrepreneurial executive. Interest and exposure to all aspects of building a high-growth digital business and teams, including product, strategy, sales, funding, technology, branding, GTM.
jobFunction: General Business, Business Development, and Sales
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: BACKGROUND  The Singapore Red Cross’s (SRC’s) Blood Donor Programme (BDP) works in partnership with the Health Sciences Authority’s Blood Services Group (BSG) to educate, recruit, retain, and recognise blood donors as part of our role as the National Blood Programme’s national recruiter.  To That End, BDP’s Mission Is Aligned With The Following Objectives  With blood donors currently making up less than 2% of Singapore’s residential population, there is an ongoing and urgent need to build a sustainable donor pool towards ensuring a healthy and constant supply of safe blood at all times. Educate the general public on the importance of blood donation towards converting and recruiting eligible new donors Ensuring new and first-time donors are retained and converted to regular donors Recognising regular and champion blood donors and, in turn, inspiring and retaining a new generation of blood donors Working with key partners to ensure blood donation is convenient, safe, and accessible through community blood-drives and group donations at bloodbanks Working with key partners to elevate blood donation as a key pillar of the national and organisational Total Defence, community building, philanthropy/charity, and healthcare agendas JOB PURPOSE  The incumbent will work closely with the Director to oversee the functions of BDP, in particular, in the areas of strategic planning, operations, business process improvement, and partnership development.  Principal Accountabilities  Strategic Planning and Operations Co-develop and co-lead the implementation of a strategic plan aimed at enhancing donor recruitment and retention in accordance with the National Blood Programme’s (current and future) objectives and resources Undertake in-depth analysis of donor (and other publicly available) data to identify trends, “pinch points”, gaps, and opportunities to refine, develop and implement new strategic objectives Work with Donor Managers to plan, organise, and schedule community blood-drives and centre bookings to ensure optimal collection Take ownership of an assigned bloodmobile organiser portfolio and undertake relevant business development and operations management activities towards meeting relevant blood collection targets Compile and update blood collection data for routine and ad hoc reporting Engagement Engage with relevant stakeholders to gain an in-depth understanding of the blood donation landscape and relevant societal/industry trends Establish strategic partnerships with internal and external stakeholders to identify and develop relevant collaboration opportunities Work with Donor Managers to recruit, manage, and continually engage community Bloodmobile Organisers towards increasing the donor pool Develop and lead a comprehensive donor engagement programme focusing on relevant communication, educational, retention, and recognition activities Business Process Improvement Identify and undertake new and ongoing business improvement activities aimed at enhancing operational effectiveness, streamlining processes, and optimising resources Work with colleagues from Resource Development and Volunteer Management departments to identify and streamline public education and supporter-engagement collaboration opportunities Leadership Undertake a leadership, mentoring and coaching role to junior staff within the BDP operations team Manage the workload and establish daily/monthly targets and operational priorities for the Telerecruitment team Plan and manage the roster of the Operations team in consultation with team members Work with the Director to formulate strategies in increasing and retaining the donor pool JOB SPECIFICATION  Qualifications And Experience Possess a recognised university degree with at least 4-6 years of relevant working experience Candidates with supervisory or managerial experience, or experience in developing and managing organisation-wide programmes, will have an added advantage Skills And Knowledge Demonstrated interest in the non-profit/charity sector Ability to co-lead a team and manage, motivate, coach, mentor, and inspire junior colleagues Ability to plan, develop, and implement new initiatives in line with strategic priorities while taking into consideration relevant environmental factors and available resources Ability to undertake strategic planning and analysis activities, including data analysis Experience in sales, marketing/communications, account management, strategic planning, business development or related field Familiarity with or the ability to learn about the blood donation landscape and donor behaviour in Singapore Proven ability to identify and develop solutions to challenges, business development opportunities, collaboration opportunities, and/or process improvement solutions Possess a high level of project management, organisation, and communication skills Self-motivated, responsible, adopts a proactive approach to every aspect of work Ability to deliver a high level of customer service skills and a keen eye for detail Business-level proficiency in Word, Powerpoint, and in particular Excel Willing to work on weekends, public holidays, and/or on a rotating shift as required
industries: Nonprofit Organization Management, Health, Wellness and Fitness, and Hospital & Health Care

jobTitle: Head of Best Practices, PDS APAC
description: What This Job Involves  At JLL, we’re committed to sustainability. We’ve signed the Climate Pledge and committed to achieving net zero carbon by 2040 across all our operations including the client sites that we manage. That’s 10 years ahead of the Paris Agreement.  However, in order to get there, we have a lot of work to do. In APAC we deliver over 2000 construction projects annually and we manage over $12B of capital expenditure on behalf of our clients.  We’re looking for a Head of Best Practices to join our team to own and optimize our end-to-end delivery methodology with significant focus on improving our sustainability best practices and enabling our people on our journey to net zero carbon.  Our goal is to transform the way we plan, design and construct our projects to reduce waste, improve wellness and minimize the carbon impact of the future spaces we deliver for our clients.  Sound like you? This is what we’re looking for-  Responsibilities- Develop sustainability best practices to reduce the carbon impact and improve the wellness of the spaces we deliver for our clients Enable and inspire our people to deliver projects in accordance with our 5 Phase Methodology and new sustainability best practices by providing regular training, communication and nudges Document, optimize and continuously improve workflows, templates and end-to-end business processes and policies related to sales, finance, responsible procurement and project delivery. This includes working with the various stakeholders to implement local strategies and continuously improving the Project & Development Services Project Toolkit Work closely with our digital product owners to ensure that business processes are optimally enabled through our technology platforms Your Experience And Qualifications- 5+ years’ experience with proven track record in sustainable design and construction 3+ years’ experience in process innovation, optimization and continuous improvement using Lean techniques Proven experience in transforming traditional paper-based processes into digitized environments Bachelor’s degree required LEED AP certified WELL AP certified preferred LEAN Six Sigma certified preferred Experience working across the APAC region preferred Your strengths and values- Passionate about sustainability and deeply committed to reducing the carbon impact of the construction industry A knack for taking complexity and converting it into simplicity Outstanding English writing and process mapping skills Attention to detail and a healthy obsession for delivering accurate, high quality output Excellent listening and analytical skills. Culturally adaptable, can understand the needs of a wide range of stakeholders and collaborate with a team to deliver solutions. Personal values that align with JLL’s values of teamwork, ethics, excellence This role reports to- Project & Development Services COO, APAC  Location- Flexible, this is a regional role and can be based out of any country in the APAC region  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at AccomodationRequest@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.
industries: Commercial Real Estate

description: Account Overview  Want to help grow a dynamic, global advertiser at the intersection of digital, data, and mobility? Interested in working for a client rapidly expanding across countries and categories with services benefitting all consumers? Enjoy a constructive debate and not just being an “order taker?” Keen to build and grow a global team aspiring to be THE destination multinational account at MediaCom? When we’d love to talk to you for a role on Team Uber at MediaCom!  MediaCom was recently awarded the global AOR assignment for Uber.  Our role is to help the Uber business grow and “glocalize” the future of Media: ensure its local and global team members are integrating and connecting with agility,and delivering best-in-class marketing experiences to its consumers across its growing range of businesses.  To serve Uber’s needs, we are creating a bespoke solution with the best of WPP for Uber – Accelerate. Accelerate is the opportunity to build what will be MediaCom’s model in a few years. Joining the team provides you with regional CEO & Global Exco Exposure, a start up experience in a large global company and rapid career advancement within our organization.  With 30 countries, +200 plus team members, and regular new product launches, the account is looking for a regional planning and network integration director to manage this complexity with high organization, collaboration, and agility, inspiring markets to be bold and be active participants on the Team Uber community.  Overview Of Role  The Regional Planning and Network Integration Director is responsible for the high quality of regional and local media plans. The director will develop regional planning and activation guidelines as well as managing group of digital planners in delivering biddable campaign approach for local markets. The ideal candidate will facilitate inter departmental, client, and interagency communications that enable us to produce high quality planning deliverables and deadlines in an on-time manner and at the highest quality.  The role requires collaboration with many stakeholders in planning and investment, across many levels, in a highly matrixed organization. In this capacity the Regional Planning and Network Integration Director must be able to manage the many projects we balance.  Working with the team’s regional and global leadership, you will help the team accomplish challenging goals and objectives, balancing client, company, and team priorities.  Your Impact  …as a planning and network integration director Create, optimize, and govern global to regional planning and activation fundamentals Create workflow and processes to enable the production of high quality local/regional plans Help develop and update global/regional playbooks and ensure adoption Manage group of planning managers supporting local/regional plan development Coach and support local teams to “raise the floor and the ceiling” Oversee plan rollups and reporting, ensuring templatization and governance Strengthen and develop regional team connectivity Contribute to global knowledge sharing community Integrate across disciplines of the team, most notably social/programmatic activation functions to ensure local teams are delivering a consistent, high-quality product in line with the account growth roadmap. Support regional leadership in merchandising local work and contributing to global initiatives Improving connectivity between Global and Local to bring to life application and help keep regional/local teams ‘one-step’ ahead on account direction, trends, etc Promotes consistency in key areas (education, communication, operations) across regions …in support of leadership initiatives Advocate and champion market learnings to provide clear visibility across the region/globe - via network highlights, case studies, CRM, etc Understand and support team priorities as given by Client Director and agency management. Partner with leadership to offer input on our service delivery with an aim for outstanding client scores. Support key agency initiatives. Support client QBRs …as a communicator Manage prioritization of projects with regional team, and key clients. Translate regional needs to local and vice versa Quickly understand and apply nuances across markets Ensure client follow-ups are executed in a timely and professional manner. Work with global/regional team to understand where team improvement can be made and execute corresponding plans in line with the role. Your People Skills Culturally agile and able to work with diverse range of skills and backgrounds around the world Ability to influence and build consensus across levels, P&Ls, and borders Able to constructively share feedback – both the good and the tough Ability to drive compliance and accountability with firmness and fairness Drive positive interactions among key team members and client stakeholders. Inspire the team to continually find ways to improve and see both accomplishments and opportunities in a fast-moving environment. Help drive continuous operating improvement and quality performance of metrics Support status calls with internally and with client to better understand and solve for their pain points. Able to respectfully challenge and motivate the client with creditability Your Knowledge & Abilities Extensive knowledge of the APAC media and marketing landscape, demonstrating a depth in both brand and performance-based marketing across all channels Strong experience managing workflow and campaigns across a large global network Cross functional perspective – knows how to “connect the dots” across workstreams and motivate team to deliver promised results Strong knowledge of omnichannel planning, negotiations, and operations Strong understanding of biddable platforms Experience managing negotiations with partners to mutually beneficially results Aptitude and experience with digital strategy and activation across platforms and countries Ability to lead in ambiguous environments – whether that be process, problems, new technology, etc. Adaptability to adjust approach to incorporate new and evolving information as it becomes available – not fixated on initial ideas/approaches as the only way forward. See the big picture and dive into details as needed. Stays abreast of industry trends; not only reads the trades, but also has a POV. Your Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree preferred, advanced degree a plus 10+ years of agency experience desired, with experience leading global/regional planning on other large global accounts More About MediaCom  Welcome innovators, initiative takers and instigators. We are 8,500 of the world’s leading media communications specialists, in 125 offices, across 100 countries. We have a global client roster that’s the envy of our peers. Adidas, Coca-Cola, Mars, P&G, PSA, Richemont, Shell and Sony to name but a few.  We help brands unlock growth through media. We do this using our Systems Thinking approach to data, technology and creativity and design communication strategies that build brands and generate sales. We’re part of WPP, the world's largest marketing communications services group, which gives us access to the richest data sets and most robust benchmarks in the business.  All this has helped us become the first network to hold the big six Media Network of the Year titles concurrently. But the real secret to our success is simple (and not really a secret). It’s our People First, Better Results philosophy. We know that when we invest in our people, we’ll deliver better results not only for them, but also for our clients. We also know that talent comes in all shapes, sizes, genders and ethnicities. That’s why our agencies are open environments that celebrate difference.  Do you want to work with smart, creative, enthusiastic people? So do we. Welcome to Mediacom  For more information, visit www.mediacom.com  Find us on Twitter @mediacomglobal  Like us on Facebook at facebook.com/MediaComGlobalNews  Join us on LinkedIn at linkedin.com/company/mediacom  About Singapore  GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.  GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Associate Director, Reinsurance Claims & Premiums Advocacy
description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting an Associate Director, Claims Advocacy for our Reinsurance Client Services Support team in Singapore.  About Aon  Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.  The Opportunity  The Client Services Support team in Aon Reinsurance Solutions are responsible for providing assistance to clients and reinsurers, whilst continuously striving to surpass service level agreements. They proactively interact with Aon’s reinsurance team and shared services, as well as acting as a liaison between internal and external stakeholders.  Responsibilities:  Create Client Value Forms insights on premiums or claims based on client needs, own expertise and Aon’s capabilities; shares even if they differ from clients’ point of view Contributes to proposals and bid processes for clients and prospects Communicate with clients, sales team, and other operating units to resolve issues, answer questions, and provide assistance in relation to claims or premium matters. Assist client in preparing sliding scale commissions adjustments, profit commission calculation, and retrospective premium adjustments in accordance with contract terms and transmit for client’s approval. Research and liaise with clients and reinsurers as questions arise. Meeting clients’ and reinsurers’ needs through consultative and strategic approach. Building rapport with clients and reinsurers relevant to the territory Liaise with clients to coordinate submission of reinsurance reporting. Consult and serve as subject matter expert to advise with respect to complex, unusual or difficult reinsurance accounting issues. Develop Teams Develops own and the team’s expertise to effectively meet client needs by problem solving distinctive solutions Work with senior team members to identify and offer solutions to problems and disputes. Preparing statistics for the sales team during renewal periods Liaising with the sales team for post renewal updates Monitor compliance with terms of trade and premium payment warranties and liaise with sales teams as required. Assist in communication with clients, prospects, accounting teams, sales team, and other operating units (including the outsource partner) to resolve issues, answer questions, and provide assistance. Interface with global accounting teams. Make observations and recommendations contributing to the sales or operational process. Enable Innovation Generates new ideas and shares innovations; seeks to provide the best solutions through new knowledge and diagnosing client situations Understands and implements best practices to meet client needs; shares innovations with others Oversees accuracy of roles for clients in Contact Management System, and Special Handling for Roles and Banking Details for clients and reinsurers. Actively participates in projects surrounding process efficiency, standardization and automation i.e. UAT Testing, PPV Testing, Develops knowledge of client / reinsurer payment themes to identify new solutions to improve claims payment performance and Premium Payment Performance. Deliver business Results Promotes opportunities for cost savings, productivity improvement and revenue generation Providing input on improving operational efficiency Monitoring of new, renewed and lost accounts Monitoring of scheduled revenue against budget figures. Working together with the respective brokers in ascertaining forecast accuracy on a monthly basis. Ensure Compliance approval is obtained for third party co-brokerages and brokerage only accounts Organize, schedule and attend transactional audits, as necessary. Requirements 8+ years relevant experience, preferably with a sound understanding of the reinsurance industry within the Asia region Detailed, meticulous and able to multi-task under tight deadlines A team player - able to communicate in a dynamic team environment Excellent communication skills (verbal & written) Ability to present to senior stakeholders in a professional environment Strong computer / system literacy, including first class Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills. How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.  2489130
industries: Insurance and Financial Services

jobTitle: Head of APAC Medical Marketing - Nutrition/OTC/Pharma/FMCG
description: APAC Marketing Leader role for a billion dollar category Driving cross-­‐functional collaboration in medical and digital marketing  About Our Client  A global leader in the OTC/Pharma and Nutrition categories, this organisation's global revenues exceed $10billion. A leader in the field of nutritional science, committed to redefining the management of health. This organisation has an extensive portfolio of science-based consumer health, medical nutrition and supplement brands.  Job Description  Drive APAC brand sales and share growth through patient/consumer purchases derived from HCP recommendations Lead the development and roll out of strategic plans that provide clear, actionable direction in the medical channel Co-lead digital and digital marketing initiatives to drive uplift on brand and maximise return on investment Analyse consumer and customer behaviours as well as trends, identifying opportunities for optimising strategies and plans to support local markets Develop industry-leading data-driven strategy, execution of digital marketing including SEO/SEM, digital media, re targeting, content distribution, proximity/local marketing, and mobile. Create a comprehensive long-term digital/social strategy Lead the creation of best-in-class HCP campaigns that are insight-driven and translate science into relevant and compelling communications and programs Work effectively across functions to develop and deliver Medical Marketing materials and Medical Sales tool kits that drive strong execution Collaborate with Sales Force Effectiveness to provide inputs into the national sales meeting process, content, agendas and workshops; elicit efficient product sampling; and drive science-based, action-oriented calls Champion the integration of key opinion leader (KOL) activities as part of Medical Marketing plans, collaborating with Professional Services and R&D to identify and cultivate thought leaders and generate educational content to shape and deploy strategic priorities  The Successful Applicant  Minimum 8 years experience in an APAC/Global medical marketing role in the OTC/Nutrition/Pharma/FMCG industries with basic knowledge of digital marketing Proven track record of growing brands through marketing programs Ability to work cross functionally and regionally (with in country marketing and sales team)  What's On Offer  APAC Leadership marketing role  Contact: Tushar Dadhwal  Quote job ref: 4167826
industries: Pharmaceuticals, Mental Health Care, and Medical Devices

description: Company Overview  Comopack is a start-up company that specializes in the leasing of patented plastic handheld boxes as well as collapsible chemical boxes globally. The plastic handheld boxes are used in the Automotive, Electronics and White goods industries. Comopack’s shares the same founding family as Goodpack, a company that does leasing of metal Intermediate Bulk Containers globally. Comopack’s HQ is in Singapore, with overseas subsidiaries in Netherlands and China. Currently, we are setting up new subsidiaries in India and USA.  Responsibilities Brainstorm, plan and setup the group’s tax structure and income recognition (including all overseas subsidiaries) that is the most beneficial for Comopack. Responsible for the preparation of the Comopack’s group financial statements. Develop our internal accounting software for global usage to ensure proper, complete, and accurate record-keeping within the accepted accounting principles. Prepares and provides financial statements, sales reports, commission reports, analysis, and other reports on a scheduled or unprompted basis. Evaluates departmental performance and makes adjustments to daily operations when needed to ensure the department meets overall goals and objectives. Works directly with multiple departments, Sales, Operations and IT on new or modified, sales orders. Track and maintain Comopack’s global subsidiaries financial performance, reports, tax and other matters. Confers with upper management about budgeting and reviewing strategies to meet overall goals and objectives. Requirements Minimum 10 years of relevant working experience in a Financial Controller role with regional experience and proven finance management. Accounting Degree or MBA Experience in the planning and financial setup of overseas subsidiaries Proficiency and experience in the usage of any highly recognized ERP software. Experience in the setup of ERP software would be an advantage Knowledge of statutory legislation and regulations in the overseas subsidiaries we are/ will be present would be an advantage Hands-on, Analytical and comfortable with sophisticated database/reporting tools to generate management reports Sound knowledge of accounting fundamentals with auditing experience. Able to meet tight deadlines & respond to fast pace working attitude Compliance oriented.
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Accounting

jobTitle: Head of Enrolment and Customer Service
description: In this role as the Head of Enrolment and Customer service (Centre level), you will assist the Director of Planning, Enrolment and Customer service in developing and executing sales & customer management plans for the Centre that you are responsible for. This includes the professional handling of enquiries and registrations across the full range of The Learning Lab’s services and activities.  To manage the day-to-day running of the centre, expansion, and development of TLL programmes, working closely with all departments to provide excellent customer service to learners and parents, and with Marketing to ensure we understand and communicate effectively with our target segments.  You will build and lead a team that is highly motivated to deliver sales targets and first-class customer care in your Centre.  Job Responsibilities  Delivery of Excellent Customer Service Standards To lead the centre’s Enrolment & Customer service team to ensure high standards of customer service across all activities. To collaborate with the Academic Director in managing the day-to-day running of the centre to achieve smooth and seamless operations that is in accordance with the standards set. To proactively engage with internal stakeholders to ensure KPIs and business needs are met. To maximise operational efficiency to meet and exceed internal and external stakeholders’ expectations. To manage customer’s feedback and queries in a timely and professional manner. Delivery of Enrolment, Retention and Conversion Targets To maximise the staff potential of the centre’s Enrolment & Customer service team to meet and exceed enrolment targets and conversion KPIs. To work with the Academic Director in defining and executing the sales strategy of the centre. To collaborate with the Planning Team to optimise class planning in order to meet regional market demand. To strategise and plan activities to improve customer engagement and improve brand awareness and perception. To recruit new students through activities such as facility visits, lead/demand generation campaigns, open houses, and information sessions. To engage prospective students and parents through face to face or phone interactions. In collaboration with centre’s Academic Director, to ensure student retention and re-registration targets are met. To facilitate the new student enrolment and onboarding process. Snapshots Of Our Ideal Candidate Bachelor’s degree in Business Management or equivalent (preferred). Minimum 5 years of managerial experience of leading a team in a sales-oriented environment, preferably in the education industry with proven track record in achieving aggressive sales targets. Experience of and commitment to excellent customer service management. Ability to build strong rapport across all levels, demonstrating strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Experience in managing change projects to drive business. Excellent English and Chinese language proficiency. Resilient under pressure. We operate a seven-day week, and twelve-hour day in our centres. The Head of Enrolment & Customer service must be flexible in their working patterns. The post holder may have to work on Saturday and/or Sunday, although will normally have two consecutive days off a week. Expect the best for the best – an attractive remuneration package.  To find out more, please visit www.thelearninglab.com.sg. Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted within 2 weeks.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Head of Industry Solutions & Architecture, Google Cloud - Singapore
description: The area: Google Cloud  Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers & developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.  The role: Head of Industry Solutions & Architecture, Google Cloud - Singapore  The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.  Additional Role Description  This role is the leader responsible for bringing experience and thought leadership to help set vision, mission, and strategy for the Principal Architects and Industry Solutions Specialists across South East Asia.  Typical days includes engaging with CxOs, public advocate for your Industry pillar as a keynote presenter, in-depth searches with internal Engineering teams on the key use cases for a given customer/market, coaching sales teams through a customer engagement, and/or leading a cross-Google working team through a critical engagement with CxOs.  You will coach and mentor team members and set Key Performance Indicators. You'll adopt the best practices in enterprise architecture set forth by global and regional leaders, develop new solution initiatives, and support a broad cross-functional group of stakeholders. You will help provide feedback to the Product and Engineering teams to help shape product direction.  Responsibilities Work with Sales management to determine proper staffing levels to support annual goals, establish job requisitions, build candidate pipeline, and lead the interview team to fill open positions. Organize, train, and equip the Principal Architect (PA) team. Assess PA team go-to-market readiness, identify gaps in preparedness and build plans to ensure the team is properly trained and equipped to perform in support of annual goals. Work with Cloud Sales team and leadership to identify, qualify, and prioritize coverage for business opportunities. Participate in periodic opportunity review meetings to provide insight into how to best secure the technical win. Maintain customer satisfaction through working with Sales Account, Customer Support, Product Management, Customer Solutions, and Engineering to resolve product problems affecting pre and post-sales customer satisfaction. Travel to visit customers throughout the region. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. 15 years of experience as a Pre-Sales Engineer at an enterprise technology company, or equivalent experience in a similar customer-facing role within professional services, solutions architecture, or systems engineering. Ability to travel up to 50% of the time as required. Preferred Qualifications MBA or Master's degree in Computer Science. 15 years of experience in B2B technology organizations with emphasis on Infrastructure, Database, Analytics, ML, and Applications with experience carrying quota. Experience managing people, and ability to grow and develop talent. Knowledge of Big Data, PaaS, IaaS industry and technical concepts, web application development platforms, and related technologies. Ability to craft a compelling message and tailor it for a given audience.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Description  Position at Mindshare  Overview Of Job  Mindshare is visionary and a leader in setting best practices in the industry. We aim to keep leading in this space and to demonstrate expertise in this space through one of our key accounts.  This Supply specialist role is critical to achieving that by driving and scaling SPO (Supply Path Optimization) as a practice across markets to deliver value back to the client  This requires the Supply Specialist to the have the following set of skills: evangelizing their products, assessing competition, defining vision, and collaborating with Ad tech partners, operations, and marketing to drive the successful delivery and adoption of their platform. In addition, they would have good understanding of programmatic ads ecosystem from advertisers’ perspective and would have already launched and scaled advertising products for the buyers.  3 Best Things About The Job Dynamic – As part of a team at the forefront of all things digital, you will be directly involved in shaping the future of this business in this fast-changing programmatic industry. Great work culture – You will work with a diverse and collaborative group of co-workers passionate about digital media that know how to have fun at the same time. Flexibility and Empowerment – We appreciate colleagues who are tinkerers and problem solvers, those who think outside the box and contribute to new ways of working. Measures of success –  In Three Months, You Would Have Built up a thorough understanding of Unilever’s programmatic ecosystem and the Supply Path Optimization framework Good understanding of Unilever’s inventory partnerships and how they work Formed an understanding of the client’s marketing strategy across the region. Established working relationships with SSP & DSP partners Become familiar with the processes within Mindshare and within your team including using GroupM admin, media and finance software. In Six Months, You Would Manage initiatives, projects and pilots for deployment across the region Supervising and guiding markets across inventory and supply-related queries, and facilitate training where necessary. Assist with identifying problems and troubleshooting for local markets Working closely with programmatic partners (DSPs, SSPs and Inventory Partners) to build/identify customised solutions for deployment across campaigns. Thorough understanding of Unilever’s inventory partnerships and how they work In 12 Months, You Would Have Conceptualized and recommended initiatives & pilots for deployment across the region Have a clear strategy for inventory and supply partnerships in the region Proposed new ways of working and process improvements across all work streams Proven yourself as a reliable POC for client stakeholders Established a strong level of trust among junior members of the team Responsibilities Of The Role Supply Strategy: Develop a strategy on how to regionally manage supply partners that deliver value while meeting client KPIs. Constantly meet and evaluate new partners as needed. Focus on identifying and growing supply for the client when it comes to video, display, native, etc. Identify and cultivate relationships with supply partners, piloting new initiatives and evaluating the performance of these initiatives. Manage internal stakeholders in line with opportunity to exceed advertiser KPI expectations through use of efficient supply strategies Build best practices across supply management within the region; establish benchmarks and learnings which are measurable Responsible for market roll-out & capability building across local markets. Produce quarterly reports on market, industry and adoption rates for management team measuring the business value of the strategy. Operations: Ensure all technology partners are integrated seamlessly across campaigns Develop a process workflow to streamline operations across multiple parties – trading team, local Mindshare team, technology partners, etc. Build best practices across trading and operations within the region; establish benchmarks and learnings which are measurable Constantly meet with, evaluate, and test new technology partners, data and supply vendors as needed Support, manage and ensure high quality output from local supply leads who are responsible for end-to-end campaign management & governance. Responsible for market roll-out & capability building agenda across local markets. Oversee day to day relationship and communication with client & partners, as well as with local Mindshare teams Platform Strategy & Development - Develop supply pillars for the Trade desk and practically deploy into day-to-day workflows, including but not limited to: Operations – Working with the local markets & regional clients to review, develop and put in place improvements in the operational capabilities, workflows or new technology of the Trade Desk. Efficiency - Working with the trading team to identify and put into practice performance efficiencies in the established working process. Insights – Working with the internal data team to generate regional supply insights and POVs to share at scale across the local markets. What You Will Need 7+ year experience in product management, product strategy, Experience in digital advertising landscape (ad servers, SSPs, RTB, PMP, DSPs, DMPs) Deep understanding of supply side of advertising ecosystem Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently Experience in building and managing products from ideation to launch working with a remote engineering team. Deep knowledge of product development dynamics and go-to-market tactics. Comfortable with agile product development and collaborating with multiple teams to deliver product features that are dependent on other product teams Ability to articulate and influence other product teams to help them see the value of problem we are solving and get necessary buy-in Experience partnering cross-functionally with teams spanning across sales/operations, product, engineering, marketing, customer success. Self-motivated individual with strong communication (written and verbal), leadership, judgment, planning, and decision-making skills. Demonstrated prior success within a startup culture, bringing cross-functional projects to closure  About Mindshare  Mindshare, the global media agency network, and part of WPP, the largest marketing communications network in the world, has more than 7,000 employees, in 116 offices across 86 countries.  Each office is dedicated to forging competitive marketing advantage for businesses and their brands based on the values of speed, teamwork and provocation. Mindshare’s network of people are acutely aware of what's happening in their city, and believe all great communication begins and ends in media.  In 2014 Mindshare Asia Pacific was the only media agency to be ranked in the top ten in Campaign Asia’s Most Admired Companies survey, and was also seen as the best agency to work at in the region.  Mindshare APAC has won over 250 awards in the past year - and counting, including the 'Campaign Asia Pacific Agency of the Year, 2013' and the SMARTIES™ APAC ‘Agency Network of the Year 2014’ for the second consecutive year. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com  About GroupM Singapore  GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.  GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Job Responsibilities Oversee the Logistics and Distribution Department, setting of department goals and objectives, and resources planning. Responsible for effective warehouse management process and system by establishing new operating processes and set compliance standards. Leverages knowledge of customers’ business to identify new business development opportunities for the organization. Manages expenses margins to achieve revenue goals outlined in the Financial plan Strategic planning for new accounts set-up, develop operational flow and set-up, collaborate with Sales, Business Development and Information Technology to identify and plan required system integration/enhancements. Contributes to negotiations on Logistics Operations service rates, reviews contractual service agreements in alignment with organization standard practices. Investigate or assist in solving warehousing-related issues/problems and initiate recommendations/provide solutions for improvement. Researches inventory discrepancies to identify root causes and develop process improvement Participates in customer meetings, monthly, quarterly reviews to provides information on productivity and performance Responsible for efficient and cost-effective transportation services from service Providers. Authorized Quality/Operation Procedures, Work Instructions (WIs), and records. Identifies individual and team skills gaps and developmental opportunities in training, courses, etc. to facilitate individual and team development Holds others accountable to established performance levels to achieve individual and department goals Job Requirements Degree In Logistics/Supply Chain or equivalent Preferably with Warehousing/Business Process/WMS Management Distribution/Logistics Operations, Customer Service and Project Management 10 years of experience in Project and Supply Chain Management Possess strong strategic and analytical mindset with strong leadership and implementation capabilities Proficiency in database and Microsoft office

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Position Summary  The Associate Director (AD) spearheads the Supply Chain Management of Singtel & NCS. He/She is responsible for developing strategic approach to support Consumer/Group Enterprise / NCS delivery teams by ensuring the systems (e.g. SAP system, Fulfilment System (FS) and MTPOS (front-line retail shops’ system) and processes are robust and scalable to meet Business needs while aligning with the Control / Policies. He/She leads the systems automation project planning with Business and IT stakeholders and operationalises the enhanced systems/processes through change management training with internal teams across the business units. The AD also oversees the team to manage the daily operations of the inventory management and channels’ requests for smooth order fulfilment requests.  The Associate Director also champions the digitalization initiatives within SCM for both Singtel and NCS.  The product supported are mobile phones, sim cards, cables, accessories, routers, set-top boxes, white goods, and services supported are delivery services to home/pop stations/offices/self-collection at designated address / redemption counters.  The numbers of own & 3rd party warehouses will be 5.  Key Responsibilities And Results Plan the system architecture and processes of the for efficient and streamlined order fulfilment and deliveries. Serve as the primary contact for 3rd party warehouse service providers / delivery contractors to coordinate and plan the necessary solutions (including IT automation, suggesting improvement plan to meet stakeholders’ demands), attending regular system and process meetings with the stakeholders weekly for inventory planning and allocation n distribution. Early engagement with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities for improvement or anticipate changes due to changing business needs. Champion the Order fulfilment and Inventory systems and processes through regular deployment of trainings (via online or Espresso share point materials) to relevant users. Operationalise the Inventory and Fulfilment system changes and processes with upstream (e.g Products / Sales & Marketing/ Customer Operations/ Online Sales) and downstream (warehouse and 3rd party delivery contractors) value chain Work closely with various IT teams (e.g SAP, FS, MTPOS, Billing ) to ensure minimal system downtime and smooth order fulfilment process Oversee the team handling the daily operational issues or queries related to SAP Inventory, FS and Online integration with SAP, Delivery system from 3rd party Champion the digitalization initiatives in Supply Chain Management; deep dive sessions with Consumer and GE BUs to explore their wish list (e.g RPA to create vendor master or change of bank account details etc)  Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business, Logistics or related field 5-7 years of relevant experience, with minimum 5 years supervisory experience Familiar with multiple processes and systems such as SAP ERP System, Order Fulfilment system (FS), Ariba, Tableau / Power BI reporting tool Proven track record in leading and implementing system projects, enhancements to streamline the processes; e.g improve system UI Advanced analytical skills with experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating abundant information with accuracy Strong written, verbal and visual communication skills Ability to manage different stakeholders in Consumer / Network/ GE and NCS Units
industries: Information Technology and Services

jobTitle: Asia Pacific Head of Distribution, Digital and Marketing Technology
description: Overview Of Role  As the APAC Head of Distribution, Digital and Marketing Technology you will be part of the Senior IT Management team at Schroders and report regionally into the Asia Pacific Head of Technology and Change and globally into the Global Head of Digital, Distribution and Marketing Technology. In addition, you will have matrix reporting into the heads of Distribution/Marketing and Digital technology in London. You will be responsible for the leadership and day-to-day management of the Asia Pacific Digital, Distribution and Marketing technology team and on a day-to-day basis will be partnering with Asia Pacific Distribution and Marketing management teams.  Whilst the role sits in the global technology division, a strong commercial and business acumen is needed as is the ability to work directly with our Distribution & Marketing business development teams to create a regionally focused digital strategy and underlying platform that provides the desired customer experience and client services capability and supports the business in harnessing opportunities brought about by digital technology.  Schroders aims to be a leading asset manager in the use of digital and you will be operating in markets where the innovative use of technology, appropriately applied to business channels, is vital. The role requires partnering with Asia Pacific marketing team to support them in developing web, social media and precision marketing strategies targeted at improving Schroders' sales impact, creating efficient online service models and boosting our online brand.  Key Responsibilities  General Day to day line management of the Asia Pacific Digital, Distribution & Marketing technology team. Support Distribution and Marketing to establish new Digital routes to market. Distribution responsibilities include Sales/CRM, Client Insights Unit & Client Service. Marketing includes Events Platform, Pardot & Preference Centre/Client Personalization. Day to day line management of the Conversational experience tools such are Schroder Go (client facing Chabot) and associated pipeline of changes. Ensure effective communications across Digital, Distribution, and Marketing IT staff throughout Asia Pacific and into the Global IT operating model. Provide input and direction to Digital, Distribution, and Marketing global IT strategy Work closely with the business owners to ensure the Asia Pacific requirements for the respective regional business functions are fully represented and integrated into global or regional products. Support innovation practice to seamlessly bring digital transformation initiatives into delivery and achieve outcomes set by the business. Collate all relevant business requirements, business outcomes and articulate rationale for regional spend against global business domain budgets such as Distribution and Marketing. Resourcing Facilitate IT technology resourcing on all active programmes, projects and initiatives driven globally, within region or being handled locally to address business demands. Management and liaison with Asia Pacific technology vendors and or business service providers as required to fulfil the delivery and operational duties of the role. Programmes and Project Work Own regionally-lead initiatives and drive delivery of IT change from inception to implementation. Facilitate global project delivery through local team. Manage key regional business stakeholders, support client engagements and co create a Digital client centric approach to business development. Have a comprehensive of project SDLC processes, particularly Agile, standards & best practices. Understand the Global, Regional, and local technology ecosystem that (potentially) impacts the wider Digital Distribution and Marketing operating model. Point of escalation as required to ensure the business needs of Asia Pacific stakeholders are represented. Provide regular management department / delivery stream updates (business and IT) on progress. Design / Technical Skills Track record/experience of using Content Management System/Marketing Automation and CRM platforms (performing platform configuration changes) Mobile application delivery An engineering and architecture background in web technologies, techniques, and solutions Understands how modern digital technology & data science can be applied to create business value. Software As a Service based Apps: Subscription based Apps that can be used directly by clients on their own computers or phones. IT Risk Management Promote awareness and understanding of and adherence to GTC governance/standards, including Information Security engagement, policies, and controls across the co-created citizen-based development model. Ensure that all APAC Digital products, whether developed in business, with internal technology resources, external parties or a hybrid thereof follow the GT lifecycles of IS engagement, Architecture Review and IT Service Integration by working with the product owners of said products and guiding them through the GT stage-gates. The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications You Need At least 7-10 years of digital strategy, enablement, innovation, and client insight experience Excellent stakeholder management to support internal (including at a senior executive level) and external (including at founder/CEO level) relationships. Strong understanding of digital strategy and technical concepts. Excellent ability to quickly understand business strategy and operating context of functions across asset and wealth management. Understanding of the investment management industry and intermediary client relationships Ability to produce and communicate effective and insightful thought leadership Excellent command of the English language, both written and spoken Knowledge and experience of identifying appropriate technology solutions, understanding the difference between in-house-developed bespoke applications and commercially available off-the-shelf solutions. The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications Preferred Experience in working with start-ups, either within a corporate or start up setting. Ideally has an existing network within the innovation ecosystem. Fluency in Mandarin desirable as this role will require a high level of interaction with Chinese firms and our growing Chinese business interests that will be serviced out of APAC. What You Will Be Like Self-directed and comfortable operating with a degree of ambiguity Capable of remaining positive when under pressure. Highly collaborative and consultative approach Personable, enjoys working with people from a variety of backgrounds Mindful of differences across geographies / cultures and the need to adapt business approach and strategy accordingly. Strategic mindset and ability to distil and collate information from various sources to a cohesive output. Comfortable facilitating and communicating using both business and technology terms. Shows initiative and thrives in a fast-paced and time
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: The Company  My client is an established Petrochemical company and an industry leader - hiring a FP&A talent to support Supply Chain and Business Controlling portfolio.  The Role  Successful candidate & Expectations At least 6 years of strong Regional FP&A/ Business Controlling experience in the commercial sector (MNCs) MUST: SAP and Supply Chain exposure required (understanding supply chain strategies, end to end value chain, inventory & warehouse operations etc) Key traits: Good communication and presentation skills, proactive learner, hands-on, self-starter, strong business partner, team player with a positive learning attitude Relevant Chemical, Petrochemical, Oil & Gas, Manufacturing industry exposure may be helpful This is an individual contributor position and the successful candidate should be comfortable with being hands-on in the portfolio.  Reporting to the Director (Controlling), you will support the Supply Chain function closely in the process of management reporting, business planning, budgeting & forecasting, strategic planning, performance management and development of Supply Chain strategies in the region. As a business partner, you will provide timely and accurate insights, analysis and business cases to support decision making processes relating to distribution and supply chain strategies.  You will work closely with regional stakeholders (including business leaders and manufacturing operations) to support sales and operations planning, focusing on demand & inventory management, production, warehouse management, packaging activities, transportation logistics & distribution arrangement, as well as any other key supply chain drivers. You will monitor, evaluate and perform complex scenario analysis and present financial simulations, prepare and consolidate supply chain results and performance trends, review strategic plans and track supply chain's project costing activities. You will also identify key risks and opportunities revolving around Supply Chain, and drive continuous improvement via regional projects and initiatives.  Apply Today  Please send your resume, in WORD format only and quote reference number GH11921372, by clicking the apply button. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.  Robert Half International Pte Ltd. Co. Registration no.: 200612189E | | EA Licence no.: 07C5595 | Hor Man Teng (Geraldine) EA Registration no.: R1217737

description: Job Description Lead regional compensation and benefit initiatives that are aligned to the global principles and provide flexibility and local customization to account for cultural and market differences. Provide people analytics on a broad spectrum of people issues: diversity, retention, compensation, leadership development, learning and development and other key areas. Optimize regional compensation processes and HR operations including payroll workflow, employee movement workflow, merit increases, and bonuses. Facilitate HR transformation by enable employees and HR team in effective use of HR system, and foster a data-led decision making process. In partnership with the HRBP team to ensure Total Rewards solutions are integrated to enhance the employee experience—Talent Development, Succession Planning, and Performance Management. Provide subject matter expertise and accurately interpret, counsel, communicate, and educate HR Business Partners, and people leaders on pay decisions, policy and guideline interpretations, and job evaluations. Develop knowledge and skill level of team members, build team expertise. Requirements 8+ years' experience in Total Rewards and/or HR Operations. Bachelor's degree or above with fluency in oral and written English communication. Demonstrated global compensation experience in the following areas: base salary, market pricing, variable pay, job evaluation, data analysis, research and cost modeling. Broad knowledge of compensation, sales compensation and rewards practices across APAC. Strong analytical and project management skills, proven ability to design and communicate clear processes, and a detail-oriented yet flexible approach to problem solving. People manager experience and leadership skills. CAN DO attitude and able to work under pressure and driving for results, a self-starter with 8 through ability. Able to function in a matrix organization and build relationships with all constituents.

jobTitle: Controls and Supervision Manager Asia SVP
description: An effective risk, supervision, control and governance framework is critical to the continuing existence and success of the Global Rates & Currencies franchise. The topic has undergone a period of significant and rapid change as global regulators looked to strengthen policy standards and expectations as a result of various issues highlighted in the industry.  In view of heightened expectations from regulators and to ensure a strong & consistent global control environment across the Rates & Currencies business, this is a regional role, and the candidate will work to maintain, define and implement changes to the risk, control and supervisory processes and procedures so that they are consistently robust. The candidate will help drive the direction and growth of our efforts in a manner that is consistent with the evolving landscape. This role requires close cooperation with Control and Supervision Managers in other regions, with X-Markets Risk & Controls, especially regarding Conduct Risk, Governance and Controls, Trading Risk and Transaction & Processing Risk teams.  To work as part of In-Business Risk and Supervision within the Rates and Currencies business, with a primary focus on enhancing and maintaining a strong risk, supervision, control and governance framework for the Rates & Currencies business, with a focus on the Asia region.  This role requires extensive liaison with multiple functions within the business and support functions at all levels, including Rates and Currencies product CAOs and Business Management, Trading, Sales, X-Markets Risk & Controls, Technology, Compliance and Risk, in both the region and globally.  This position directly reports to the Global Head of In-Business Controls and Supervision for Rates & Currencies, with a matrix reporting line to the APAC Regional Rates & Currencies CAO.  Responsibilities Supporting risk, controls and supervision framework for Rates and Currencies across the APAC region, including but not limited to the conduct risk management framework in the business. Support the Business Risk & Control Forums to oversee all aspects of safety and soundness for the business. Support the Business Heads and Business Unit Management with the continuous evolvement of the control framework, to deliver new control initiatives. Support Compliance with development and enhancement of applicable policies and training. Work with the Business Supervisors, Technology & Control partners to efficiently build target state controls, system alerts, and re-engineer processes to ensure effective and best in class controls ensuring consistency in application between all regions and countries. Support evolving the control framework, and assist with delivery of solutions to sufficiently mitigate existing and new emerging risks. Interact with X-Markets Risk & Controls, Compliance, Internal Audit and other control functions to drive forward control enhancement initiatives and investigate control failures. Participate as required in ad-hoc reviews and regulatory / supervisory examinations of the wider Rates and Currencies business. Qualifications The candidate will require extensive experience within a markets business and have an acute understanding of the key controls issues and possible areas of ethical conflicts in order to effectively address these. Subject matter expertise in products, markets, trading systems & controls, preferably in Rates & Currencies. Solid working knowledge of end to end product flows of R&C asset classes. Minimum of 5 years of experience in financial markets including at least 3 years either in the business or business support or control functions. Excellent communications skills (written / verbal) at all organizational levels. Results/task orientated with excellent attention to detail. Ability to manage and prioritize effectively and resolve conflicting priorities. Ability to work well as part of a team and autonomously. High level of computer literacy. Education Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree
