jobTitle: CIB - Wholesale Payments Field Strategy Lead APAC, Executive Director
description: As part of the Wholesale Payments (WP) Client Service and Implementation organization, the Field Strategy team manages complex global product solution launches, ensures global client coverage teams, our clients are prepared for change and designs end to end PSS and field readiness plans and migrations to new WP solutions are delivered with a great client experience. This function requires an experienced manager to lead our APAC based team. This position requires a senior manager who is results focused, articulate, highly organized, resourceful and self-motivated. The individual must be comfortable reporting in a matrixed organizational construct, prioritizing work in a fast-paced environment and have a strong understanding of Wholesale Payments Products, as well as excellent communication skills.  This Leadership Role Includes Serve has single point of contact for Wholesale Payments (WP) Field Strategy (FS) for the APAC region understanding how the FS team works to: Drive the commercialisation efforts of new WP products Ensure client coverage teams and our clients are prepared for change (e.g., products, regulatory) - readiness, field communications and OneSource Equip PSS and field teams with value proposition positioning skills and to prepare the field to be WP trusted advisors with their clients Deliver a great client experience through successful migrations from old to new solutions Act as Field Strategy ambassador to executive management and key stakeholders across WP product, Commercial Banking, CS&I, Sales, Marketing and other key partners Understand success criteria for key stakeholder groups, and ensuring key performance indicators are measured to support overall objectives Understand how disciplines across FS can support the region's business objectives Serve as the local manager for the FS APAC team members responsible for Commercialisation, Change Readiness, Field Enablement and Migrations Responsible for communicating local changes to the team (e.g. location specific changes for real estate needs, etc.) Responsible for overseeing regional employee needs across FS disciplines and bringing the needs back to the matrixed managers as appropriate Act as the International Change Readiness team manager In addition to serving as the local manager across APAC FS resources, this role will also dive deeper into the Change Readiness function by working with the EMEA Change Readiness team to ensure both region's client coverage teams and our clients are prepared for change (e.g., products, regulatory) - readiness, field communications and OneSource EMEA Change Readiness resources will have a dotted line (matrixed) reporting structure into this role Report to executive management and key stakeholders on progress of Field Strategy initiatives Provide APAC perspective to global FS leads for Commercialisation, Change Readiness, Field Enablement, Migrations Center of Excellence This position requires understanding of Wholesale Payments products and solutions. This may include key concepts such as mobile apps, wallets, alternative payments and APIs across the payables, receivables, liquidity, digital, trade and merchant services landscape. This role will primarily provide leadership for the APAC region but will also be responsible for some initiatives which are global in scope.  Key Responsibilities For This Role Include Oversee and manage the FS team based in APAC while closely partnering with the U.S. and global FS teams Provide end to end oversight for team assigned Readiness projects, coordinating with key stakeholders and internal partners across multiple lines of businesses to ensure successful delivery of new solutions aligned to identified KPIs Identify, track and drive completion of initiatives through reporting using established tools Establish strong working relationships and proactively supports the needs of product partners, as well as key stakeholder partners within Field Strategy and across sales, service, onboarding, marketing, legal, compliance, risk and controls Promote partnership and collaboration across stakeholders to successfully deliver based upon established key performance indicators (KPIs) Assist in delivering stakeholder updates for management Provide regional input into global methodology, process and tools for Commercialisation, Change Readiness and Field Enablement Competencies/Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent Minimum of 10 years of experience in payments, technology, e-commerce or financial services. Merchant Service or Treasury Services/Payments migrations experience preferred 5+ years of experience leading teams or initiatives through new product development and commercialization in the payments space, either as a product lead or as an operations lead Track record of successfully running a large-scale wholesale project, merger integration or product integration, with specific experience establishing the strategy, defining the process, leading the execution, addressing product gaps or handling client escalations Knowledge of product development processes, project management processes and understanding of product development lifecycle strongly preferred Strong client management and executive-level communications skills Experience working in a fast-paced and highly cross-functional organization. Prior experience with a consulting firm or an internal consulting/corporate strategy team, including managerial experience motivating and leading high-performing teams is advantageous. Skills Strategic thinker with the ability to reimagine and transform Experience delivering complex process improvement and technology initiatives at scale, collaborating with multiple teams / functions, and driving change within large organizations Strong end-to-end problem solving skills (defining problems, structuring and building quantitative / qualitative analysis, etc.) Excellent communication and organizational skills, meticulous attention to detail A passion for the client and employee experience Ability to handle multiple priorities and produce successful results in a fast-paced environment Demonstrated ability to manage tight delivery timelines, calmness under pressure and adapt to unexpected circumstances - capable of navigating in dynamic and complex organization environments Strong analytical capabilities coupled with the ability to identify issues, gather and analyze data, obtain consensus and implement change JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. jobTitle: IT Project Manager (Transportation Systems) South East Asia
description: YOUR ROLE  This position requires operational and technical expertise and knowledge of Transport Management Systems (TMS) and the ability to manage and drive transportation system projects as a Project Manager. This individual should have the capability to manage and driving comprehensive and complex IT work streams in regional TMS projects from inception to delivery including requirements gathering, functional design, change management, risk management, testing and deployment planning.  The candidate should have prior pre-sales experience and is able to configure and implement TMS hands-on. Extensive knowledge of transport operations is also a must. This resource interacts with internal and external customers, CEVA IT department managers, and various technical teams. The resource uses consultative skills to drive project momentum, manage expectations/risks, communicate effectively, and fronts the operations/business in solution meetings.   WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?  Subject Matter Expert in the TMS application(s) and related processes from a functional point of view. Provide system demonstrations as needed to Management or customer executives. Manage TMS projects from a proper project management point of view, from inception through delivery ensuring completion of the project objectives on schedule and within budget constraints. Configure, implement and deliver TMS & EDI projects for large customers with the support of internal and external solutions and work stream leads. Necessary training will be provided. Develop detailed project charter and plan (goals, objectives, strategy, scope, budget, scheduling, risk mitigation strategies, contingency plans, approach, requirements, deliverables, timelines, use cases, test case, and training needs) utilizing project management disciplines and methodologies including process analysis, mapping and flow charting to ensure synchronization of processes and systems. Engage key stakeholders, define and coordinate activities, communicate changes and progress, build commitment, overcome resistance, implement change management and lead the project. Conduct regularly scheduled project briefings regarding status, issues, and challenges with all levels of business unit, business sponsors and management for all projects and implementations. Utilizing a wide range of skills to influence and drive projects, being objective when needed. Collect metrics on system usage and provide insights into operational challenges Provide mentoring and guidance to develop other team members, including training and knowledge transfer. Responsible for all administrative activities for the team. Create automation solution (post training), using Automation anywhere.  WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?  5+ years hands on implementation and project management experience with Transport Management Systems Functional knowledge of Transport Management Systems (TMS) 5+ years in transport/freight management domain 5+ years project management of a team of IT professionals Business acumen and solid knowledge of applications and implementing logistics technologies. Knowledge in project management methodologies is required. Able to manage self and team effectively in a dynamic, matrix environment. Able to guide customers towards the solution that best fits their needs and aligns with CEVA’s technical capabilities. Able to manage the pressures of cost-effectively selling the right solution and pushing back where needed. Able to translate technical terms to operational teams and vice versa. Able to perform functional analysis and produce effective business requirements documentation. Possess analytical skills enabling trouble-shooting. Capable of delivering written and graphical work products and presentation materials. Skilled in presenting technology solution to internal / external customers in formal or informal situations Fluent and articulate in Business English Positive & professional attitude in stressful environments Self-motivated, self-managed Interface effectively with customers or others associated with the project or assignment. Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Ability to stand-your-ground during challenging engagements Ability to successfully multi-task and establish appropriate priorities. Ability to effectively participate as a team player or leader. Possess excellent follow-up skills.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: As a Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for the technical implementation of all projects assigned to you. You are the primary contact for the customer on all technical matters, and you function as an intermediary between the customer and the different departments within Skyline. The telecom, broadcast and satellite industries will be your playground, where you can apply your affinity for high-tech, software products. We offer state-of-the-art, global leading software solutions in a fast-changing industry. With thousands of drivers, highly advanced features, and a proven track record, DataMiner® is the best-of-breed network management solution for the telecom, satellite and broadcast industries. You can become part of this winning team and apply your skills to further expand our success around the globe. TYPICAL EDUCATION Bachelor, master or doctorate degree in ICT, Software and/or Telecom. RESPONSIBILITIES acquire and maintain detailed knowledge of all DataMiner features take ownership of the full technical implementation of your projects become your customers’ primary contact for all technical matters related to your projects fully understand all aspects related to the functional and technical specifications of your projects ensure sufficient documentation of all technical requests to other Skyline departments to guarantee efficient implementation of all technical aspects of your projects troubleshoot all technical issues that affect project delivery perform quality assurance from a functional perspective on all technical features in your projects create and maintain all required project documentation for acceptance, hand-over, and internal presentation procedures identify potential commercial opportunities and notify the appropriate Sales Manager COMPETENCIES you are a fast learner and adapt quickly to new situations you are communicative and have effective interpersonal and organizational skills you think logically, keeping the client first in mind you have natural technical insight and a positive, can-do attitude you can work independently and prioritize tasks you are passionate about the benefits of software technology TECHNICAL SKILLS familiar with software programming experience with HTML, XML, client-server systems and SNMP profound knowledge of HFC broadband, IPTV, broadcast and satellite systems strong affinity with MS Windows operating systems profound knowledge of TCP/IP (firewalls, routers, …), multithreading, Web Services and .Net Remoting knowledge of MySQL and Apache Cassandra is an asset BASIC QUALIFICATIONS FOR CONSIDERATION this position requires that you work from our offices located in Singapore good verbal and written communication skills in english for international company mandarin speaking to assist chinese customers proficiency in mandarin is essential WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? A competitive salary with extra benefits. A healthy work-life balance. A stimulating, challenging, and fast-evolving technological environment. Work in an international company while still enjoying the advantages of a small-company culture. Be part of a team that has a disruptive impact on the global telecom and broadcast industry. Gain experience with a vast array of cutting-edge technologies. Enjoy long-term stable employment. Grow in your career thanks to in-house training courses, choosing from a variety of professional options.

jobTitle: Lead Enterprise Architect (Senior Manager to Senior Director)
description: About Capgemini  The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Lead Enterprise Architect (Senior Manager to Senior Director)  This role will support our Financial Services Strategic Business Unit (FS SBU) as the Enterprise Architect in pre-sales/RFP processes involving complex sales opportunities, especially in the banking and/or insurance domain. You will collaborate with business development and client engagement teams to assist in pre-sales opportunities like RFP responses, proposal delivery, architecture assessments and technical qualifications  Key activities include:  Work closely with Domain Architects across key initiatives and projects to apply architecture principles and standards, and develop reference architectures and design patterns Provide thought leadership on architectural or other topics, developing a forward looking view of current and emerging technologies and their impact on the Enterprise Architecture Develop technical solution design and work with assigned technical architects and cost architects to create corresponding cost estimates Present and discuss solutions with client executives Lead the translation of the client’s business requirements into systems design Assess the business impact/return on investment for the more complex components of the technology solution Act as customers’ key contact on the proposed technology solution. Work closely with other technology teams to create a holistic technology approach and cost estimate that captures all details, dependencies and assumptions of the technology landscape. Transitioning the solution to the mobilization team for implementation Establishing oneself as a leader in cross-technology issues and risk mitigation  Key Requirements  At least 10 years’ experience in the IT industry, preferably in large, complex enterprises At least 3 years’ experience in Enterprise Architecture in a large, complex, multi-location, multi-national environment Deep experience delivering mission critical, enterprise scale IT solutions in a heterogeneous technology environment Familiarity with best practice methodologies and tools for the entire solution lifecycle from ideation to requirements, design, development, testing, deployment and operations A deep understanding of all domains of Enterprise Architecture, including the business, data, application, infrastructure and security domains Familiarity with one or more formal Architecture frameworks / methodologies (TOGAF, Zachman, BIAN, etc.) Experience with Financial Services Client group (Banking, Insurance, etc), understanding primary industry objectives, market pressure, key value propositions. Experience as solution architect or business consultant in a client-facing capacity. Business function process knowledge in Financial Services (e.g. Banking, Compliance as a Service, KYC, Credit Services) Deep understanding of the cloud-native solution, microservices-architecture and at least one or more of the following areas: API orchestration architecture, mobile-front end architecture, customer engagement architecture Experience with multiple connectivity solutions.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Insurance

description: Global footprint with steady growth Regional portfolio  About Our Client  An established market leader in the industry with the regional headquarters located in Singapore. There is now an opportunity for a talent to lead and develop the pricing framework for the business in APAC & MEA.  Job Description  As part of a high growth international team and reporting to the Pricing Senior Director, you oversee and implement a value-based pricing approach for recommended market prices on new product launches. You develop pricing modelling and have full involvement in driving quotation processes relating to the company's products in the region. You liaise closely with cross functional teams such as Sales & Marketing, Country Management, Product Category teams to negotiate terms for regional deals and actively reviewing terms and prices for the respective regional teams. You are expected to interact closely with multiple business stakeholders in the course of your work and you will have high visibility to senior management.  The Successful Applicant  Ideally, you are a qualified degree holder in Accounting or Finance with at least 10 years of post-graduation experience in a pricing-related environment. Industry exposure in B2C environment within consumer goods will be highly desired. You should be an analytical person with strong problem-solving skills. description: Singtel, Asia’s leading communications technology group, provides an extensive range of telecommunications and digital services to millions of consumers and businesses across Asia, Australia, Africa and the USA. With over 140 years of innovation behind us, we continue to push boundaries in our networks and services, to enrich lives and transform businesses.  Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Our diverse business means you will enjoy unique opportunities and rewarding experiences to learn and grow your career in a dynamic industry.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  The role of Director, Prepaid Product Marketing has a sales and marketing mandate, driving all aspects of strategy planning, online and offline marketing and overall acquisition/revenue growth for the Prepaid mobile business. This includes price plans, data, new products and digital services, roaming, IDD, equipment and latest technologies in support of the consumer group goals and to create value.  Key Reponsibilities Responsible for total Prepaid Mobile revenue, cost, profitability and Market Share targets Closely monitor market trends, consumer behaviors, and technological developments which open up new business opportunities, in order to conceptualize and develop products needed to deliver the revenue on schedule and within the desired cost targets. Lead and shape the market with innovative market offerings, delivering competitive advantage upholding the brand promise and delivering a positive customer experience. Segments served cover local and foreign under residential consumers. Develop effective marketing strategies, identifying target segments, product positioning, pricing and packaging for end-to-end implementation of marketing plans. Development of new capabilities to transform business decisions, deliver customer service and personalized experiences across the group To formulate, track and own marketing budget Build robust relationships with external and internal stakeholders, such as Developers/Vendors/Partners, Marketing, Sales, Customer Care, IT and Network, to ensure strong teamwork in smooth project execution and delivery. Lead, motivate and nurture a high performing team of Product Marketers. Ensure the team is highly engaged, provide constructive and timely feedback, set clear direction and targets, and constantly motivate the team to achieve higher performance. Requirements Bachelor Degree from recognized university, MBA will be an advantage At least 10 years of marketing working experience, preferably with Technology or Telco industry knowledge and people management experience. Good project management and financial analysis skills Possess a technical appreciation of mobile technologies, platforms and device ecosystems Strong negotiation and influencing skills with business partners Strong stakeholder management skills Strong orientation to drive measurable results Exceptional communication and presentation skills Good leadership and people management skills We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

description: The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways — from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.  The RoleDo you want the opportunity to make a huge impact selling cutting edge technologies? Do you have a passion for helping customers? Do you want to sell products for a high growth business unit? If you answer yes to these questions than this may be the role for you.  We are searching for an experienced APM Enterprise Sales Director that has a passion for technology and can deliver bold revenue targets. This role is directly responsible for managing both the APM revenue growth and maintaining the base of APM revenue within your region of the world. This is a customer facing sales role that requires highly motivated individuals with excellent business and industry knowledge.  The APM Enterprise Director will use consultative skills to position AspenTech software and services solutions with our customers both to renew and grow our business. This role will be responsible for the Executive engagements with our APM customers within the region and will have ownership over the strategy to build and grow those accounts into Enterprise relationships. This position will require heavy cross-functional interactions with representatives from marketing, pre-sales and product management.Your Impact Achieve assigned quarterly/annual sales targets for APM business within assigned region. Build ‘Ideal pipeline’ for licenses and services in assigned region to drive future business. Build and manage Executive relationships around APM technology with key accounts. Build strong working relationships with sales and sales management within the Field sales organization. Define account and opportunity strategies that will drive both short term wins while setting up long-term Enterprise relationships. Help manage partner relationships that are strategic to the growth within your region. Work closely with peers within the APM BU to provide customer feedback and define strategies for the future direction of the BU. Gather market information from multiple sources, to analyze competition and consumer/market trends. Effectively negotiate with strength to align with AspenTech's overall strategy and business interests. Exhibit knowledge of industry value chains, business performance, key trends, and investment drivers. What You'll Need Demonstrated success in direct sales of software solutions. A Bachelor's degree is required. Experience in selling of high-value software solutions with consistently over quota achievements. Experience building and maintaining Executive relationships is required. Ability to communicate effectively with Executives is a must. Experience working / selling within the Energy and/or Chemical markets is preferred. Experience selling industrial software, maintenance software, or manufacturing software is preferred. Familiarity with data analytics and machine learning technologies is preferred. Self-discipline and motivation to produce results with indirect supervision. Excellent communication, interpersonal and customer relationship skills.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Vice President; MO Trade Control Professional Markets
description: Your background Ability to work in a pressurized, high volume, deadline-driven environment while maintaining operational excellence. Control focused with a good understanding of risk, P&L and the impact of errors. Able to initiate solutions, take ownership and drive issue remediation. Excellent communication skills at all levels Able to envisage front-to-back flows with emphasis on ascertaining financial/regulatory impact Experience in delivering process improvement and product enhancement. Knowledge of financial markets with solid experience in Trade Support in a similar Investment Bank. Strives to bring new thoughts and ideas to teams in order to drive innovation and unique solutions. Excels in working among diverse viewpoints to determine the best path forward. Experience in connecting with a diverse set of clients to understand future business needs – is a continuous learner Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change. Participate in and drive collaborative efforts to advance tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve an evolving client base. believes in value of diversity so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world. Degree qualification is essential Proficiency in MS Product Suite i.e. Excel, Word Bloomberg, Reuters and corporate action processing knowledge preferable VBA & SQL programming skills preferable. Other Qualifications  ∙ Strives to bring new thoughts and ideas to teams in order to drive innovation and unique solutions  ∙ Excels in working among diverse viewpoints to determine the best path forward  ∙ Experience in connecting with a diverse set of clients to understand future business needs – is a continuous learner  ∙ Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change.  ∙ Participate in and drive collaborative efforts to advance tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve an evolving client base  ∙ Believes in value of diversity so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world  What You Can Expect  APAC Equities Trade Control is responsible for managing the trade capture, reconciliations, lifecycle management, corporate actions and client servicing for the ESSL, ECS and ESS businesses. The products covered are listed and OTC products in equity derivatives across all APAC markets.  We are seeking a dynamic contributor who has proven experience in delivering key business initiatives and in implementation of efficiency/risk reduction processes as part of process streamlining. This role will require the candidate to partner various teams within APAC Equities Trade Control & Securities lending, and offers an excellent career opportunity for the right candidate.  The candidate must possess relevant middle office/ trade support experience in a reputable investment bank. The candidate should demonstrate a firm understanding of equity derivatives trading and end to end operational flows along the lifecycle of a vanilla equity and OTC derivative product. The candidate needs to be process-oriented to drive efficiencies while having a proven track record in effectively managing risk. The candidate needs to be aligned with organizational goals fostering partnership with the business and acting as en effective enabler for our business and our clients. The candidate will also be expected to manage line-contribution towards regulatory projects and other strategic initiatives in addition to running the line. The candidate is also expected be proven team player.  What You Will Do Deliver seamless execution of business deliverables as it relates to new product launches and other business initiatives. Support the Sales and Trading Desks by investigating and resolving issues and enquiries related to trade processing, bookings and breaks etc Partner wide suite of local & global stakeholders in global delivery of initiatives, establishing effective relationship/networks within the organization from front-to-back. This spans from Front Office, Compliance, Legal, Operations, and Technology. Anticipate risks and obstacles and taking ownership to manage these challenges. Be well versed in products and risk management when implementing new products or processes into the line. Streamline processes which may include process automation. About Bank Of America  Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.  Connecting Asia Pacific to the world  Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.

description: NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 49 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation. For more information, visit ncs.co.  Our close-knit teams are accelerating businesses, helping communities and growing smart cities across the region.  We advance our communities by partnering with governments and enterprises to harness technology. We do this by bringing people together to make the extraordinary happen.  Join us and create your own success story by making a difference at many levels. We are looking for a highly motivated individual that has proven track record to take on leadership position as Principal Project Director, Project Leadership for Infrastructure.  Position Summary  As Principal Project Director, Project Leadership for Infrastructure, you will manage service portfolio across Infrastructure in the ITSS portfolio. This is a horizontal role which supports the business and cloud portfolio delivery for the identified areas of focused competences. The responsibility includes day-to-day operation and delivery matters, and the Profit & Loss delivery owner for Technology Solutions and Day-1 client engagement on delivery matters for those defined competence and account segment(s) assigned.  Role And Responsibilities Includes Project Services Delivery Incorporates the end-to-end deliverables of the Service Contract to your assigned clients Client engagement with customers, managing external and internal stakeholders’ expectations and deliverables outcome. Growth of the account and looking into delivering excellent Customer Engagement experience. Adopt industry best practices and ensure that the right tools, techniques, methodologies and systems to deliver the services that meet international standards. Perform sales engagement, participate in account growth planning and vendor management with go-to-market teams to facilitate attainment of strong order book through project signings. This include representing Infrastructure n proposal reviews such as influencing quality assurance of proposals submitted. Day1 Execution Lead both the Service and Technical delivery team in day-to-day TS executional matters, and ensure services are delivered with pride, and sustainable model. The delivery includes leading teams on delivery excellence and driving towards completion of projects against planned milestones and timeline; Service recovery and improvement if there are gaps and escalations; and enhancing the service values to the customer. Engage and manage 3rd party partners, to align their delivery competency and capabilities with client’s service contract to our customers. You are also expected to make tactical plans on a year on year for core each identified technologies appropriate for account/sectors, to ensure year on year performance excellence and relevance to market situation. A portfolio to assigned accounts, subjective to the size and scale of the service contract. Expected to make strategic and tactical plans in alignment of delivery across multiple service portfolios and support Infrastructure and NCS strategic business plans. Financial Management Manage the financials for the service projects under your purview. This includes the Business Case of the service contracts on cost of delivery, recovery of cost in respective service centre. Manage a healthy profit and loss across each service contract, per provided based on won contracts/improve and optimize more if possible as part of the discharge of the responsibilities. This includes but is not limited to annual AOP budgeting, financial planning for each service contract or delivery centres, financial for team training plans, and annual team bonding and Infrastructure level of activities. People and Growth Coach and mentor the delivery teams, either under direct or indirect management (e.g. 3rd party partners or contractors). This includes thought leadership, and people management skills for various team under his service portfolios. Coach the Team members to develop Individual Development Plan and proper career path planning. Provide leadership and direction to project teams and oversee the development of competencies and career progression of team members.  The Ideal Profile Should Have / Be Degree in any discipline preferably related to Information Technology Infrastructure Min 15 years in the Technology industry with proven delivery experience in a sizable contract or organization Deep experience in Technology / IT services contract and complex implementation projects in both legacy and cloud managed service environment Experience in coaching and recovering trouble projects Good understanding of both business and delivery risks, especially in client work and delivery Good communication and interpersonal skills combined with strong problem-solving capabilities and the ability to learn. Strong collaboration and teaming experience, and ability to work with both senior leadership as well as operational and working level executives. Excellent relationship and stakeholder management skills - capable of dealing with people across all levels of a large, complex, fast moving organisation with constant transformation to stay market relevant. Able to develop high-quality presentations by synthesizing key information, financial data, market data and other relevant information

description: Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.  Job Description  The Opportunity    The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering the Head of Finance, Singapore with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.  The role is accountable for the overall management and supervision of the Finance function in the Wealth & Investment Management business in Singapore. As a key member of the management team in MIMS, the incumbent will be a strategic advisor to the business, providing strong financial leadership necessary for the business growth agenda. Reports to the CFO, Wealth and Asset Management Asia (WAM Asia), and the CEO, Manulife Investment Management, Singapore (MIMS).  What motivates you? You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone   We are looking for someone with: University Qualified with recognized professional designation (CPA, CA, CMA or CFA) 15+ years direct experience in Finance roles. Experience in leading a Finance function/department, preferably in an asset management company. Strong business acumen and commercial experience, with demonstrable capability to understand and analyze complex concepts and articulate big picture perspective Strong business partnering, interpersonal and stakeholder management, with demonstrable experience of negotiating and influencing across a wide range of stakeholders Highly developed leadership skills, having extensive experience working within a matrix organization with both direct and indirect reporting influence, to effectively collaborate, leverage and lead teams / individuals across multiple geographies Strong attention to detail with excellent judgement, analytical and problem-solving skills Superior written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to cater a message to various stakeholders, including senior executive and non-technical audiences. Proven ability to be proactive and work independently or part of a team, whilst thriving in a fast paced, high-performing environment whilst managing multiple, changing priorities and requests Proven accomplishments as a change agent with strong execution capability and focus on control and process improvement   On The Job You Will  Strategic Financial Management Oversee the finance financial management function of Manulife Investment Management Singapore Lead the annual planning exercise and periodic forecasts, working closely with local CEO, department heads and regional finance. Provide financial advice and support to the Regional CFO and Singapore CEO, department heads and Board of Directors in the development of major initiatives and business strategy, including the review of business plans Participate in Singapore Management Committee meetings and local Board meeting Day to Day Financial Management Manage all aspects of finance including financial reporting, management reporting, regulatory reporting, audit, tax compliance, transfer pricing, product profitability and cash/capital management. Financial and Management Accounting Provide monthly financial results to Regional CFO, Singapore CEO and Regional finance. Perform relevant analysis, as requested by the CFO and CEO, department heads or regional finance, to assist them with their decision making or analysis Keep abreast of relevant financial, tax and corporate governance developments Ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with relevant accounting standards, internal policies and statutory/regulatory/tax requirements Ensure that an appropriate financial policy framework is in place. This should include sound internal controls including strong focus on balance sheet control, appropriate capitalization policy, expense approval policy and travel, entertainment and business expense reimbursement policy Ensure that information on Assets Under Management (including inflows, outflows and respective fund attributes) are properly recorded in the systems Provide finance support to affiliated company, Manulife General Account Investments Singapore. Finance lead for the HNW segment in Singapore and Asia more broadly, in support of the private bank strategy, including sales tracking of the private bank channel and the development and management of the P/L for this channel in Asia Review the department’s processes periodically to identify areas of improvements and ensure that the finance operational manual is kept up to date Cash Management Monitor and manage the cash position to ensure sufficient liquidity whilst managing any capital injection process (when applicable) Follow up on long outstanding debts and ensure creditors’ terms are met. Regulatory Compliance Work closely with the Compliance team to ensure that the regulatory capital and liquidity requirements are met. Work with external tax agents and Group Tax function to ensure strict adherence to all tax obligations, including transfer pricing policy / regulation Work with external auditors to ensure that statutory requirements are met. Leadership and Team Development Provide strong interpersonal skills with a specific focus on team and individual professional development. Provide regular and constructive feedback and coaching Cultivate an innovative environment by supporting creativity and high-performance teamwork. Focus on strong team engagement and staff morale. Build effective relationships across a wide stakeholder group, and broader Finance function Manage and influence teams and individuals on both a direct and indirect reporting basis, across a complex matrix structure. Actively contribute and enhance the Regional and Global WAM Finance function, working closely with regional finance team, and other local Heads of Finance   Our commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry Our best. Every day. Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.  About Manulife  About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and our global wealth and asset management segment, Manulife Investment Management, serves individuals, institutions and retirement plan members worldwide. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2021, we had CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.3 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer  At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.  It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: Regional Digital Commercialization Head - Institutional Banking Group
description: Business Function  Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards.  Responsibilities Strategize and execute value creation of digital capabilities across IBG working with the regional & country teams in taking the core digital capabilities to the market, driving adoption & realizing benefits in revenue growth, customer satisfaction & cost take outs; Define the channel strategy across markets & segments. Partner with key stakeholders to drive the channel strategy and realize benefits on Customer Satisfaction, Business outcomes and cost take outs; Run the weekly cadence with the markets to track the key metrices and drive a strong implementation regime to meet & exceed the set targets; Conduct market research and gather necessary intelligence to drive innovation and maintain a market leading competitive advantage for DBS; Collaborate with product partners across Cash Management, Trade Finance and Supply Chain for the development of online services to different segment of customers that is fit for purpose; Develop digital engagement strategies that leverages DBS technical capabilities to proactively engage customers to create deep and valuable operating relationships. Drive experimentation at scale to learn and finetune the engagement strategies; Excel in stakeholder management with Technology, Sales, Operations, and Implementation. Product Management Primary responsibility includes driving greater penetration and usage of channels regionally; Leverage on MIS for the tracking, analysis and reporting of product performance throughout its lifecycle including product strategy, product planning, pricing, bundling and issue prioritization; Work with various internal stakeholders and leverage on tools such as direct marketing and campaigns to drive awareness, penetration and usage; Draft and execute internal and external product communication and information. Requirements Ten plus years' experience in the financial services or consulting or software industry; Previous experience in Digital Marketing, Driving commercials or Performance management will be advantageous; Experience with various delivery channels including mobile, internet, host-to-host and APIs. Apply Now  We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Assistant Manager [Wellness Centre/ Retail hours/ Orchard] (JQ)
description: Job Summary  The Assistant Manager will create, develop and market an innovative, premium holistic integrated Wellness Centre in Singapore whilst ensuring the achievement of sales goals, business objectives and profitability.  Job Responsibilities  Sales Promote and sell programs, services and products offered by the Centre and conduct walk through of the Centre’s facilities. Strive to achieve sales target through communications and upselling to customers. Concierge and Operations Correspond to internal and external customers enquiries, complaints and feedback, within 24 hours, before escalating to Operations Manager. Responsible for cultivating a cohesive and inspiring workplace culture amongst concierge team and practitioners Ensure Concierge team comply to Company’s code of conduct and grooming standards Provide support for implementation of workshop and programmes as necessary. Ensure SOPs compliance and timely update with MBO to facilitate appointments, bookings, cancellations between customers and practitioners for private sessions and consultations. Ensure accurate and timely administration of medical/clinical follow-up appointments and insurance claims Support manager in implementation of new services and programs and orientation and training of new team members Responsible for smooth operations of assigned service point(s), including concierge services, retail administrative and operational matters. Responsible for two-way communication between staff and management and ensure timely dissemination of information, escalation of issues and recommending solutions to problems. To support management to achieve stable, skilled and motivated workforce and achieve the desired customer and business outcomes. Responsible for the management of Concierge team, as well as the induction, regular competency audit, training and development of these staff, such that they are successful in their assigned tasks for accurate administration of customer journey and excellent customer service at all touch-points. Plan Concierge roster for Manager's approval, and resolve manning issues with Manager. Address wellness practitioners’ feedback and propose solutions to Manager. Retail stocks inventory management and assist to achieve sell-through target Co-develop training materials and structure with Merchandiser To perform other duties as assigned by the company. Job Requirements Candidate must possess at least a Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Hospitality/Wellness or equivalent. At least 5 year(s) of working experience as a Manager specializing in Healthcare, Hospitality and Wellness in the related field is required for this position. Must be willing to work on weekends. Good communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to multitask in a busy front office environment Excellent Team working and practitioner collaboration skills Knowledge of physiotherapy, osteopathy, TCM, Massage, yoga therapy, coaching, counselling and psychoeducation workshops a plus.
industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: About The Role  Job Description  As a Solutions Director, You Will Work Closely With Sales Specialist Team To Engage In All Stages Of The Sales Cycle To Ensure Product Expertise, Industry Knowledge And User Driven Solutions Design Are Effectively Result In Customer Satisfaction And Our Commercial Success Brings a mix of industry, product, content, regulatory knowledge, project management and customer workflow expertise to collaboratively engage prospects in the solution sales cycle (e.g clarification, specification, documentation, solution technical design, proposal development and bidding) Brings excellent industry network and access to senior decisions makers to drive successful outreach and awareness to the Risk Special Services suite of solutions Drive and manage complex propositions requiring building of a POC, professional services, third party solutions and/or integration with client workflow/systems Working with a variety of stakeholders - manage detail requirements for the implementation delivery, technical and other operation teams (presentations, development of solution design, scoping, proposal, project plan development, statement of work) Gathers customer specific technical and data requirements through face to face interactions with partners, third parties and customers To enhance our solutions, take on market feedback from prospects and customers and relay it back to product management Development and maintain excellent industry network and relationships in the relevant risk and compliance communities, law enforcement communities, regulators and other relevant international non-Governmental organisations About You  You'll be successful in this role if you have: 15+ years experience in law enforcement, intelligence, financial services, legal & compliance, and/ or financial crime compliance industry experience with a proven track record in supporting the sale of software solutions/ content/ services into financial services, large MNCs, law enforcement and other government sectors Strong industry network in the Law enforcement, intelligence, regulator and/ or Risk and Compliance communities University degree Excellent Knowledge of Financial Crime Compliance, investigations, and intelligence requirements in the Finance industry, MNCs and government sectors Excellent Knowledge of solutions and data feeds used for Financial Crime Compliance in the Finance industry, MNCs and government sectors Previous pre-sales experience over software and technical product Expert presentation and communication skill Expert knowledge of product selling cycle What’s in it For You?  You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your  Personal And Professional Growth Through Hybrid Work Model: A hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work. Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.  We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.  Accessibility  As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.  We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.  Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.  More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.  Locations  Singapore-Singapore

description: About Gyro B2B marketing is undergoing a fundamental transformation. Today’s buyers and influencers expect a consumer-like experience. Personal, relevant, convenient, and more valuable than ever before — all delivered at the right time and on the platform and channel of their choice. Their expectations are non- negotiable and, for most businesses, impossible to meet. Humanly relevant creative and content sits at the core of this.  As part of Merkle B2B we believe that the future of experiences is personal, informed by data, powered by technology, and delivered through creativity. We make advertising more addressable, make customer experiences more personal, facilitate world-class commerce experiences, and help clients build customer loyalty.  Merkle B2B is uniquely positioned to help marketers to not only survive but also to win. To redefine the relationship brands have with customers. To architect experiences that surprise and delight. That educate and entertain. That enriches and inspires.  Job Description We are looking for an Art Director who is looking to respond to creative briefs, able to create quality artwork and visualisations reflective of the level of excellence and integrity required from our client's communications.  Responsibilities Generates original, fresh and innovative ideas in partnership with the creative team Ensuring the creative work assigned to the creative team meets the needs and expectations of our clients, overall agency vision, and of the creative leaders.  Develop and execute ideas across communication channels, formats and multiple touch points ensuring visual consistency, quality, freshness and alignment Take ownership of creative, artistic and cultural trends and use them in a manner relevant to the brief, the brand and its users. Participation and collaboration with Account teams on new business pitches and strengthening client relationships by attending client meetings as required with a view to increase sales and brand building  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Web, Graphic, Information, Communication design or equivalent. 3 Years of experience, preferably within a digital/creative agency environment An expansive thinker, editor, designer, but most of all a storyteller who is passionate about creating inspiring work.  Experience in various Adobe programs (including but not limited to Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, etc Experience in creating end-output production.  Additional Requirements Please share your Portfolio that showcases your thinking ability and craft  This role is open to Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents and those with current work rights in Singapore.  Please send your resume and portfolio to Francesca.Babet@gyro.com
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Lead Protein CD&D for the APAC region Manage and develop the Plant Based Meat alternatives systems platform from a technical perspective including: Lead development of APAC Meat Alternative product platforms in cooperation with CD&D, marketing, and sales organizationa Manage initial set-up of system components to add to the overall portfolio Vet new product introductions and align with internal stakeholders Assist with OEM development and manufacture of systems components in an advisory role Assist technical service team by educating the team and assisting with training on how to implement these systems in plant settings. Manage and develop the processed meat applications; soy extension of meat applications Manage and support the development of non-dairy specialized nutrition beverages Identify protein portfolio gaps – source material (i.e. chia), application products (yogurt alternatives and skills (extrusion science) Leadership presence on global subject matter expert teams Educate employees and customers in the technical aspects of the ADM protein portfolio through: Technical presentations internal stakeholders and external customers Training in functionality of protein products Training on System approach for Meat and Meat alt products APAC protein portfolio Work with the APAC commercial lead for protein and assist in confirming suitability of external protein products to be sold by ADM Assist with accessing the functional characteristic of new product additions Work cooperatively with the QA/QC teams in making sure the proper specifications and guidelines are set for introduction of these products. Customer Engagement Available to work directly with customers to develop systems that meet their needs Available for customer presentations and meetings to support local Sub-regional teams. Liaison Role Liaise with Global groups and help to Communicate and transfer internal technical information where applicable. Innovation Assist in the innovation process for developing new products that can be added to the Base systems categories. Technical Landscaping Drive and assist with technology mapping of new areas within protein for APAC Processes Products Technologies

jobTitle: Head of Logistics & Industrial Capital Markets, Singapore
description: We’re a world leader in real estate services and PropTech, powered by an entrepreneurial spirit. We want the most ambitious clients to work with us, and the most ambitious people to work for us. It’s as simple as that.  On behalf of our clients we buy, build, occupy, lease, manage and invest in a variety of assets including industrial, commercial, retail, residential and hospitality. With the changing nature of consumer retail markets, we are seeing increased activity across logistics and industrial asset classes throughout APAC. Keen to further strengthen our client offering in this area we are looking for a Head of Logistics & Industrial Capital Markets, Singapore interested in developing their career with JLL in the Singapore market.  What This Job Involves-  Having a business first mind-set  Does generating new business light a fire in you? We, too, are just as passionate about supporting new clients as we are about deepening our relationships with existing clients. In this role, you will act as an ambassador and key point of contact for Logistics & Industrial clients. You’ll need to be quick to understand their needs and provide suitable solutions and create opportunities for growth.  Seeing the bigger picture  You’ll develop a strategic focus on generating platform transactions as well as asset level transactions. This can include sourcing for a combination of operators, developers, capital partners and end users. This includes sourcing and executing opportunities for a variety of mandates including JV’s, M&A, Corporate Finance, Debt Advisory and Asset/Portfolio trades.  Thinking big  At JLL we are always thinking big and it’s this commitment that ensures JLL continues to help its diverse range of clients realise their ambitions. This role is no different. You’ll play a key part in our Logistics & Industrial team, leading and supporting with transactions throughout the country and region. You’ll leverage JLL’s global relationships and network, being proactive in developing relationships with our global Logistics & Industrial teams to further extend existing client relationships within APAC.  Helping Others  You understand the necessity of collaborating with leaders across multiple business lines and multiple geographies to promote the “one JLL” ethos that sets our clients’ needs and ambitions first. This will require you to gain an understanding of the wider organisation quickly and promote your own corporate profile.  Sound like you? To apply you need to be-  Experienced In Logistics & Industrial Assets  We are interested in speaking to best talent who are familiar with Logistics & Industrial Assets. You should come from a capital markets background and have a proven track record of deals from either an owner, developer, investor or brokerage background.  A natural networker  A natural networker, you’ll be keen to get to know the movers and shakers in the industry. Whether its Real Estate Funds, Institutional Investors, Logistics/Industrial Developers or Retailers you’ll go out your way to know whose who and whose doing what.  A great communicator  Can you get your ideas across clearly both verbally and in writing? You’ll be working with many diverse interest groups so the way you share information and your ability to persuasively convey information is highly important.  Resilient  JLL is a highly dynamic business. It’s fast paced, and you’ll need to be fast paced as well. You’ll need a positive mind set and a ‘can do’ attitude when building relationships and delivering sales wins. We have a continuous improvement mentality across our business, and we’ll be looking for you to have the same.  What We Can Do For You-  At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realize your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.  Apply today!  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.
industries: Commercial Real Estate, Capital Markets, and Real Estate

description: About Capgemini  The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com. We want passionate, energetic people who live and breathe all things insights, data and architecture. We want you to be thinking ‘how can I use what I know?’ and ‘what do I need to learn?’ in order to help your client and Capgemini to achieve their business goals.  Data and Analytics Lead (Insurance domain) (Director)  Lead go to market, business development, solution development, talent and team development, and delivery for global practice focused on Insights & Data across the Financial Services (FS) industry, especially for the insurance domain Key focus of practice is developing innovative solutions related to data, insights, and analytics to meet needs of clients In depth understanding of Insurance clients and their strategy driving simplification of data environments, maximization of usage of unstructured data, advanced analytics including artificial intelligence/machine learning, cloud migration, cloud native, and DevOps and DataOps transformations Provide project leadership to include ability to discuss and champion the business case for change to a business audience, and actively participate and execute high value business solutions. Role includes program planning and deployment, budget management, P&L management, risk management, operations transformation, systems integration, and software development. Creating and negotiating statements of work, program planning and milestone creation, financial reporting. Fluent in Agile and Scrum methodologies. Developing and executing an effective go-to-market strategy for our Insurance business that will position it for very significant growth.  Key Requirements Experienced with all aspects of SAP (HANA) delivery through to hand over to early life support Prior experience of running a practice and its operations is required Ability to work in a dynamic team environment to bring optimal solutions to our clients Experience leading large teams in a remote fashion Ability to attract top talent and grow the practice  Insights & Data (I&D) Global Business Line  10+ years of overall experience in the Insurance industry, with 8+ in a corporate, consulting or similar client-facing role Experience in digital transformation of the Insurance value chain (RPA, Digital Policy Administration, Digital Claims Management, Blockchain) to assist clients in leveraging digital technologies to reduce cost would be ideal. Extensive experience with management consulting or consulting services Insurance and Financial Services domain expertise, especially Life/P&C Insurance Ability to lead and own large, multi-location delivery teams effectively with KPIs around quality, customer satisfaction, and financial competitiveness Ability to independently manage senior customer and internal stakeholders; drive executive presentations independently Work with senior leaders to understand trends, build internal skills, create training programs and have the ability to own pipeline management, financial forecasting, hiring plans Solid experience in independently driving pre-sales initiatives, RFPs, proposals responses, crafting value proposition, estimation, pricing, create customer stories and capability presentations Eager to learn new technologies, team player, mentor for junior team members Flexible with domestic and international travels
industries: Information Technology and Services, Management Consulting, and Insurance

Define the approach for the overall sale of new business and account retention. Develop a comprehensive sales and distribution strategy to maximize sales opportunities Direct the Sales team in generating proposals that define a clear path to client satisfaction and revenue growth. description: Established in Melbourne in 2015, Airwallex is a global payments FinTech company transforming the way businesses move and manage money globally. We have built a global financial infrastructure platform to help businesses transact, collect and pay across 130+ countries and 50+ currencies, without the constraints of the traditional global financial system. We've grown to 13 global locations and have raised over $700 million in funding. To support our ambitious growth plans, we’re looking for smart, collaborative and passionate people who are looking to make a genuine impact.  The Role  Data-driven decision-making is core to sustained rapid growth at Airwallex. The Data Analytics Director will be responsible for building and leading the data analytics function at Airwallex. The function itself will be responsible for driving data analytics, insights and recommendations across product, marketing and sales teams.  Responsibilities Consult on business problems, drive analytic objectives, create practical analytic roadmaps, develop concrete analytic framework, identify data needs and formulate data solutions, manage analysis projects, package and present insights to stake holders at all levels, and finally, implement recommended solutions with a goal to achieve business objectives Building strong, collaborative relationships across key functions (product, marketing and sales), promoting data-driven decision making Leading the data analytics team through all commercial and product analytics efforts, driving the communication of key insights and recommendations Driving the analytics roadmap forward, including identifying high priority opportunities to drive improvements in data analytics (e.g. data enrichment, predictive modelling) Building and developing a team of data analytic managers and analysts, promoting capability and career development Qualifications Bachelor's Degree (B.S.) or equivalent in statistics, math, economics or related scientific/quantitative field plus several years' experience in applied disciplines; Advanced degree (M.A., MBA, M.S., Ph.D.) preferred 10+ Years of experience in leading and managing a data analytics function Experience in building unscalable infrastructure globally to drive for alignments. A passion for people leadership and managing the career development of the team Experience in leading significant change in complex, fast-paced organisations. Strong communication and stakeholder influencing skills Experience in technology, financial services and/or a high growth environment is advantageous At Airwallex you’ll have the ability to make an impact in a rapidly growing, global fintech. You’ll be offered a competitive salary and we also like to ensure we create the best environment for our people by providing a collaborative open office space with a fully stocked kitchen. We organise regular team building events, encourage flexible/remote working and we give our people the freedom to be creative.  Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don’t regard colour, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.  Airwallex does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters.
