jobTitle: Head of Data Content & Research, APAC
description: Reporting directly to the Global Head for this function, who has a team of two hundred, the Head of Data Content & Research drives production of financial publications, maintenance of online databases and products and managing ad hoc requests from clients and media partners.  Client Details  Our client is a global thought leader in the alternative assets space, providing data, analytics and insights to the fund managers, institutional investors etc. They compete with some of the largest data providers in the world and are now looking to increase their share of wallet in the APAC region.  Singapore is the APAC (including ANZ, Japan) headquarters and we are now looking for a senior leadership role based here.  Description  Reporting directly to the Global Head for this function, who has a team of two hundred, the Head of Data Content & Research drives production of financial publications, maintenance of online databases and products and managing ad hoc requests from clients and media partners.  This role will be measured on the following criteria:  Team management: the most important criteria, as this role manages a team of approximately fifty headcounts which includes manager and director level direct reports Subject matter expertise on financial data relevant to alternative assets Leading production of financial publications and be accountable for delivery and implementation including content management on the databases Being the key point of contact for APAC Sales and Commercial teams for all data related queries Being a member of the APAC leadership core group and ensuring the research department has excellent collaboration across departments Develop strong relationships with media partners, when needed Profile  The Successful Applicant  MBA or Masters in Economics, Financial Engineering, or a similar discipline Fifteen years or more in leading data and research teams, with at least five years in a senior leadership role in APAC Experience in managing teams of more than fifty headcounts at an ASEAN, APAC, or Global level Strong understand of alternative assets and ideally, having spent a few years in research roles in early part of your career Represent the firm at industry and academic conferences Flexibility to travel, once borders reopen as the role will require extensive travel in APAC and to the US Job Offer  Our client, a leading player in providing data and insights in the alternative assets apace, is offering an exciting leadership role in APAC.  Candidates coming from research, ratings or data providers will find this a good fit, if they are looking to move to a  senior leadership in APAC role that offers (possible) equity in a privately held, high growth firm.  The role is based in central Singapore and offers excellent medical, dental coverage and a competitive salary package.   Desired Skills and Experience  Head of Data, Head of Research, Head of Research and Data, Head of Data Content, Chief Data Officer, APAC

description: Darktrace  Darktrace’s mission is to minimize the impact of cybe disruption to business and critical infrastructure. By taking a fundamentally different approach to the existential threat of cyber, Darktrace applies the concepts of the biological immune system using Self-Learning AI it developed at it’s R&D center in Cambridge, UK. It’s continuous innovation has led to machine’s that can make decisions and take autonomous actions to thwart in-progress attacks, augmenting human teams. This ecosystem of AI technology and humans working together is critical to the future of cyber.  Founded in 2013, Darktrace is a publicly listed company on the London Stock Exchange (LSE) trading under the symbol DARK.L. The company has over 1,500 employees, working in over 40 countries, and has over 5,000 customers with deployments in 110 countries. Many of the world’s largest financial organizations, energy and utilities companies, technology and healthcare providers, media corporations, and educational institutions rely on Darktrace to minimize cyber disruption.  This is an excellent time to join a fast-growing publicly listed company that was recently named one of Time Magazine’s TIME100 2021 Most Influential Companies.  For more information on our product and company, please consult our website.  Technical Director  You will provide specialized cyber security technical subject matter expertise to prospects and customers in support of existing and future deployments of Darktrace cyber AI technologies. This draws upon both practical and relevant subject matter expertise from prior hands-on experience in areas including threat hunting, red teaming, and/or SOC operations. Education and thought leadership through a combination of blog posts, webinars, and speaking opportunities at technical events may also be part of the role.  Key Duties & Responsibilities Of The Role Become a hands-on expert in Darktrace’s product portfolio, conduct live threat investigations across various digital environments Provide best-in-class subject matter expertise to Darktrace’s most strategic pre-sales opportunities (e.g. discussing a client’s cyber security strategy and Darktrace’s role in it) and existing customers (e.g. how a security operations centre can best implement, operationalise and use Darktrace for Threat Hunting) Provide thought-leadership and guidance for internal technical business unitssuch as cyber analysts or cyber technicians Support Darktrace in technical marketing oppprtunities, such as conducting industry presentations, webinars, or proving input for technical marketing Provide market expertise and customer feedback to Darktrace’s development team to continue shaping our world-leading cyber AI products Shape the go-to-market approach for Darktrace’s various cyber AI product families For this role you need to have the following skill set: Experience in a technical cyber subject matter(s) (Offensive security, Security Operations Center, Security Architecture, Vulnerability Management, Incident Response, …) Good knowledge and understanding of the cyber security industry and market, e.g. common products, security stacks, threat landscape Excellent communication, discussion, presentation and public speaking skills (Essential) Strong analytical and organizational skills (Essential) Be a team player but with the ability to operate autonomously and take independent decisions (Essential) Goal orientated with the ability to self-motivate (Essential) Experience in a high-growth business environment or start-up (Desirable)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security

description: Looking to take your SEO and Digital Marketing career to a whole new level? This role is for you!  First Page Digital is looking for a technically astute and confident Associate SEO Director who loves to drive unprecedented traffic and money keywords rankings for our clients. We're looking for someone who self-driven and who loves to work with inspired (and inspiring) teams. First Page Digital prides itself on being a leader, not only in Singapore but also throughout Australasia in the field of digital marketing. We've won numerous rewards because we love what we do! Passion breeds success!   With offices in Australia, Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Dubai and now Brazil and Panama, you'll be joining a company that rewards success and strives to be the best in the industry. We provide a strong entrepreneurial environment, which has seen the organization ranked #1 fastest growing digital group in Australia 3 years straight.   Rewards you deserve:  Generous remuneration & medical with dental and class pass corporate membership (Salary will commensurate with qualification and experience) Collaborate with a strong, dynamic team. Working side by side talented individuals. Always new and exciting projects. Fun and engaging corporate culture in an accelerated growth phase!   What you'll be doing:  Support the SEO Technical Director and inhouse team of 14 SEO Specialists to execute SEO strategies, implementations and update on the project planning to ensure smooth workflow Be on the cutting edge of SEO, finding new strategies to implement on our clients to drive their organic traffic Developing and implementing effective SEO strategies for the improvement of organic traffic and search ranking and the maximization of ROI SEO pitching together with Enterprise Strategy team to bring in more new and exciting projects Well versed in preparing SEO reports on a fortnightly and monthly basis to be shared with client and identifying areas for improvement Use a variety of tools, competitive research and other methods to discover optimal keyword targets appropriate to the business needs of the client Oversee SEO campaigns which encompass Technical Auditing and Onsite Implementation, Link Outreach and Content development Work with a team of SEO Techs, Content Writers, Campaign Managers, Paid Media and Sales team Format reports and provide top-line insights for on-going performance reviews Able to demonstrate understanding of how duplicate content and page load speed affects SEO by advising clients on best practices for successful implementation and improvement Have the ability to audit prospects & existing clients organic performance. Everything from a backlink profile to analyzing server logs Demonstrate a hunger to stay abreast of the latest industry developments, and factor these into your day to day work. Understand metrics and KPIs and continually suggest optimizations to improve performance Apply, and be able to explain, SEO best practices for site navigation, breadcrumbing, internal links (including anchor text optimization), and HTML sitemaps to client websites Apply, and be able to explain, SEO best practices for domain, sub-domain and directory structure to client websites Have the ability to talk tech with developers, but also layman to the layman Monitor clients sites regularly for crawling and indexing issues. Issues identified will be surfaced to the respective Campaign Manager and Technical Director, documented for client communication/follow-up Use a variety of tools, competitive research and other methods to discover quality potential outreach linkbuilding opportunities   What we need:  Minimum of 8 years relevant, hands-on SEO experience – not just creating documentation for developers to implement Experience using SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, SEMRush, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, SEO related excel/Google sheets functions Experience working with web developers internally & externally You have the ability to implement onsite SEO on most CMS types & static websites, along with familiarity with cloud hosting environments You have a proven track record of organic success. When asked about a website you’ve worked on, you can walk someone through exactly how you did so Able to produce high quality work within a fast paced, dynamic environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Has a strong familiarity with the web development process, including the important points at which SEO must be considered Experienced with international SEO. At a level where you can sculpt a website’s international SEO strategy from scratch Develops knowledge of client’s business, competition and latest industry news and trends Effective time management skills with an ability to multitask and prioritize Strong attention to detail Ability to present and communicate ideas in a coherent and effective manner. Always focussing on driving organic traffic Prior experience in a media agency preferred A ‘Can Do’ attitude   Why us: We want Singapore’s top talent and recognise that means paying them accordingly. Our newly transformed office is a great space to inspire creativity, as well as being close to cafes and public transport. You'll be amongst a highly engaged team of the country's most talented digital marketers and growth experts, with solid prospects for upward mobility.   Please attach your CV and we'll be in touch for a confidential chat. Let's do great things together!

Experience with other Marketing Enterprise Software (E.g., Salesforce Pardot, Adobe Campaigns, UNICA Campaign, etc.) would be highly advantageous Experience in presenting solutions to clients and/or prospects Dynamic and strategic thinker with a background or experience in direct marketing industry A background in managing multiple key projects or consultative work with a good track record of delivering success for client or agency's business Pragmatic problem solver with a keen attitude to deliver business outcomes Work both independently and collaboratively in gathering requirements with minimal supervision Excellent written and oral communication skills  Powered by JazzHR  mc3vsy9fgC

description: In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential.  The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential.  Want to be a part of our team?  Manages the development, implementation and/or maintenance of one or more accounting systems: Journal entries, General Ledger, Accounts Receivables, Accounts Payable, Revenue Reconciliation, Cash Flows, etc. in accordance with GAAP policies and procedures. Designs operational procedures and processes that meet audit standards and improve efficiency. Ensures integration of data produced into systems and supports objectives of financial analysts. Ensures the accurate compilation, analysis and reporting of accounting data and revenue. Participates in annual audits and special projects. May work with external consultants or auditors to provide required information and ensure proper recordkeeping for historical purposes. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function.  Working at NTT  Contribute to strategy  Contributes to business unit strategy formulation and the setting of strategic direction of the organisational unit and takes ownership of the strategic execution within his/her area of responsibility.  Manage financial function  Contributes to the co-ordination and management of the accounting function at Center and overview of the countries. They ensure that all financial processes, systems and policies are established and adhered to. At the Center, these individuals oversee the work in progress cycle and ensure proper and efficient costing, managing operational cost recovery and operational expenditure. They ensure that company assets are included in the asset register and depreciated accurately. They perform a variety of monthly reconciliations to ensure integrity of financial information.  Financial analysis and reporting  Contributes to the analysis and preparation of several financial reports and ensures the distribution and presentation of this information at the relevant forums. This would include the analysis, preparation and presentation of financial reports to clients. They analyse and prepare all month-end and year-end reports, including statutory fiscal reports, management accounting packs, project profitability analysis and variance reports. They need to ensure that the financial information is analysed to enable the presentation of detailed explanations particularly for variances from the financial forecast. These individuals may be required to perform financial preparation and analysis for new business proposals.  Reviews the ERP structures for the region to ensure that the data structure for the profit centers and cost centers and business units are designed and structured to cater to the changing management requirements.  Legal compliance  These individuals implement and manage compliance with financial controls. They ensure legal compliance with regards to legal and fiscal tax requirements in relation to the geography in which they operate and co-ordinate and ensure the smooth running of year end audits.  This Senior Director also manages the auditor relationship at the region, including the audit fees and statutory reporting compliance, and coordinates with Group for Group reviews and audits.  Policies Compliance  Is up to date with the latest accounting standards and Group policies and able to train the countries on the new and updates policies and standards.  Supports management with the strategies in accordance with the standards and policies requirements.  Budget compilation  Initiates the budget process and prepares and submits the annual budget and manages expenditure against the budget and ensures that provisions are made for accruals to ensure adequate cover. They ensure that the budgetary process is used to track and report on all expenditure.  Regional Management Fees  Works closely with Tax and Group to ensure that the management fees are recorded accurately in both legal and management books in countries and Center.  Adhoc Projects  Supports regional management functions in various adhoc projects that are require finance accounting knowledge, including standards, policies and ERP structures.  Manage accounts receivable and payable function  Oversees reconciliations, payments, purchase orders and ensures that the gross profit percentage is maximised. They oversee the invoicing process including allocation of payments and preparing debtor reports. They approve purchase orders and creditors and ensure that these are processed in line with the relevant financial procedures.  Billing management  Manage the accounts billing function to ensure that billing targets are met. They review the order report for commissions and oversee expense claims. They ensure that commissions payable to the Sales organisation are processed in line with corporate policy and accrue for any outstanding balances.  Contract management  Displays good interpersonal skills and manages maintenance contracts ensuring that correct revenue and cost deferrals and contract renewals are processed on their anniversary date.  People management  Acts as people manager for more junior employees in the Finance team. They optimally staff the finance department and ensure the full utilisation of resources. To achieve this, this role coaches and develops individuals in the team. They manage work activities and ensures successful completion of processes.  Behavioural Skills  To have specialist financial knowledge and are process driven individuals who are commercially astute. The display impeccable attention to detail and the work they produce is of superior quality. They are very assertive individuals who display excellent negotiation and problem solving ability. They have excellent verbal and written communication skills and can work effectively in a team environment. They have excellent leadership skills, strategic capability, proactive approach and ability to execute key components which ensure success in this position.  Required Work Experience  18 – 25 years’ working experience  At least 15 years’ working experience in a related field  What will make you a good fit for the role?  Standard Career Level Descriptor For Job Level Directs/controls one or more functional areas through senior managers who are assigned to those areas Develops policies / processes and approves implementation Has in-dept knowledge of organisation / functional area which allows for innovative concepts and ideas Provides operational direction across various areas, groups, and/or operations Seen as influential leader Works with abstract situations / ideas across functional areas Can assess abstract situations / ideas and give direction across major functional areas Mistakes has long-term impact on organisation’s success Negotiates internally and externally at executive level; negotiates on critical matters Influences policy-making Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.  Equal opportunity employer  NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category. description: As part of the continued growth and innovation in our business, ERM has an opportunity for an experienced Digital leader, with a focus on Environmental and Sustainability Digital Advisory Consulting. This role is a key pillar in the deployment of the ERM Digital Strategy towards the APAC region and will have a central position in engaging our clients at the highest levels to understand their aspirations and support them with ERM’s global digital capabilities as digital solutions partner, digital innovation incubator and/or data analytics provider.  Today, companies face a number of demands - to create innovative products, meet shareholder expectations, and operate in a socially and environmentally responsible manner. While some organizations have interpreted this last expectation as the need to simply comply with laws and regulations, many companies are actively leveraging sustainability drivers to create revenue growth, reduce costs, mitigate risks, and strengthen relationships with key stakeholders.  We are looking for a digital leader with a proven track record in being part of this thriving global community – outstanding professionals who combine strong consulting and business development skills with a strong technical foundation – to foster and expand a network of excellent client relationships leveraging digital solutions and services. We seek individuals to help us drive the continued growth of ERM’s business through selling and delivering world-class digital services, recruiting and developing our next generation of leaders, and work with our team members to create a ‘digital mindset’ and integrated solutions, in order to further advance our reputation in the market.  Our Partnership Model Offers Unparalleled Opportunities For Leaders With Ambition, Vision And Proven Expertise, Providing  This is a Partner-level opportunity for a Principal/Director/VP-level professional looking to further their career with an equity stake in a global company that leads the field in sustainability consulting. A career as an ERM Partner is unique. The opportunity to contribute significantly to key decisions, including the overall strategic direction of our organization. Meaningful equity ownership with significant financial and intangible rewards. The ability to provide “thought leadership” on a wide range of technical and business issues impacting our core markets. An extension of ERM’s market position and reach with your established relationships and client base to further drive our growth. Role Profile Being an essential part of cross sector engagement with relevant Global Account Managers, Regional Commercial Leaders and in-country Managing Partners to deliver and contribute to high quality and innovative advisory solutions for ERM clients Actively develop commercial strategies to pursue and win new business opportunities that result in revenue growth with target clients aligned with ERM’s global strategy and leveraging ERM’s global digital capabilities as part of a high functioning, dynamic team. Strategically engage with regulatory agencies and stakeholders to advance our clients’ business interests. Provide business value through high value engagements at the top levels of client organizations, raising the profile of ERM’s capabilities within key client organizations, to identify and shape clients’ needs for ERM services. Develop new client relationships and expand existing relationships by delivering strategic consulting advice, excellent value, and quality service. Maintain pulse on industry business cycles and prioritize sales efforts toward high-potential, top opportunities. Manage capture efforts utilizing technical understanding to develop proposals, including written content, pricing, presentations, and contracting. Building Digital Advisory capabilities and capacity to address the strategic needs of our clients and to successfully deliver our projects. Broadly speaking, the core capability areas are closely aligned to ERM deep domain expertise, across multiple sectors. Build, grow, and manage a high-performance team, serving as a leader and mentor to consultants. Identify emerging talent and work with them to reach their full potential; ensure rising stars are nurtured, developed and given new areas of responsibility. As an illustration, some in-market advisory offerings would include Strategy and Business case development; Digital solutions; funding and financing models, baseline (current state) maturity assessments, Digital operating models Requirements BS/MS in engineering, safety, science, information science, computer science or related degree. Ability and previous experience and/or exposure to growing a Digital Advisory capability Growing and developing profitable workload pipelines, enhancing client relationships and supporting capability/capacity build within teams. Experience in areas such as the following Digital consulting / advisory delivery, and practice building Implementing and supporting clients in enhancing their own digital maturity Ideation and creation of innovative Digital services, solutions, and products (i.e. design thinking, customer experience, ideation etc.) Data analytics and visualization Ability to identify opportunities by taking traditional ‘data heavy’ services and create/sell digital solutions Demonstrable track record in delivering multimillion dollar sales results annually, including successfully winning large and strategic projects. Key Success Metrics Contributing to thought leadership in support of raising our profile as an innovative leader in environmental and sustainability consulting. Building relationships with key client contacts and pipeline of future engagements Converting pipeline to booked sales and billing revenues to engagements. Contributing to skill building, engagement, and morale of the staff in your area. Utilize and optimize the leverage ERM’s global digital capabilities Specific targets across these metrics will be established during month one in the firm.  Who We Are  As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.  Please submit your resume and brief cover letter.  ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.  ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.  Thank you for your interest in ERM!

description: Our client is a world market leader within the marketing and advertising space. We are currently seeking a FP&A Lead for AMEA who will collaborate with internal clients across the business with the goal of driving profitable growth and facilitating the success of the organisation.  Responsibilities  Reporting to the AMEA Finance Director, the FP&A Lead will lead a team of 3, manage budgeting & forecasting processes, performance measurement, decision support, and business intelligence for the business. The candidate will develop monthly and quarterly reports for internal and external stakeholders. He/She will also provide analysis and interpretation of actual performance versus plan/forecast, and assess the impact on future results. Additionally, this role will participate in broader strategic finance team projects and initiatives such as product pricing & analysis, systems and process improvement, and procurement initiatives. This is a highly visible and internal client facing role where the candidate will partner with stakeholders from 20 countries across AMEA.  Main activities Monitor and ensure accuracy of Actual, STF, Commit and RF at regional level Monitor performance by practice / expertise at regional level Ensure implementation of Internal control and Audit recommendation with countries Manage regional validation process of Restructuring (Rform), Investment (Cform) and Real Estate (Lform) Assist countries in Acquisition & Talent acquisition preparation Review and help countries to improve TWC and cash collection Manage Regional HQ business unit Requirements  To be successful in this role, you should have a BSc or MBA in Finance or Accounting and at least 8 to 10 years of relevant Finance experience. The candidate has strong knowledge of Finance and Accounting principles, including Financial Modelling, Budget and Profitability analysis, Variance Analysis, and Financial Reporting. The ideal candidate should have demonstrated ability to apply financial analysis in solving business problems and is experienced in sales and revenue forecasting. You are a strong communicator with excellent interpersonal and presentation skills. Lastly, you are results-oriented, hands-on individual with a strong work ethic and who can operate effectively in a collaborative and matrixed environment. Prior experience in the Advertising field is a plus, but not required.  For more information about this role, please contact Eric at eric@timeo-performance.com. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. We thank you for your understanding.  Registration No: R1110985 / EA License No: 21C0685

description: We have a great opportunity for a talented and self-motivated Project Director to join our EDMS team. At NCS, we seek to nurture talents in creating and developing innovative solutions. If you are passionate about new technologies and new ideas, NCS could be a place for you!  Primary Purpose  You will manage service portfolio across Enterprise Data Managed Services (EDMS) in the ITSS portfolio. It is a horizontal role which supports the business and cloud portfolio delivery for the identified areas of focused competences. This includes day-to-day operation and delivery matters, and the P&L delivery owner for Technology Solutions and Day-1 client engagement on delivery matters for those defined competence and account segment(s) assigned.  Responsibilities Project Services Delivery Incorporates the end to end deliverables of the Service Contract to your assigned clients Client engagement with customers, managing external and internal stakeholders’ expectations and deliverables outcome. Growth of the account and looking into delivering excellent Customer Engagement experience. Adopt industry best practices and ensure that the right tools, techniques, methodologies and systems to deliver the services that meet international standards. Perform sales engagement, participate in account growth planning and vendor management with go-to-market teams to facilitate attainment of strong order book through project signings. This include representing EDMS in proposal reviews such as influencing quality assurance of proposals submitted. Day1 Execution Lead both the Service and Technical delivery team in day-to-day TS executional matters, and ensure services are delivered with pride, and sustainable model. The delivery includes leading teams on delivery excellence and driving towards completion of projects against planned milestones and timeline; Service recovery and improvement if there are gaps and escalations; and enhancing the service values to the customer. Engage and manage 3rd party partners, to align their delivery competency and capabilities with client’s service contract to our customers. You are also expected to make tactical plans on a year on year for core each identified technologies appropriate for account/sectors, to ensure year on  year performance excellence and relevance to market situation. A portfolio to assigned accounts, subjective to the size and scale of the service contract. Expected to make strategic and tactical plans in alignment of delivery across multiple service portfolios and support EDMS and NCS strategic business plans. Financial Management Manage the financials for the service projects under your purview. This includes the Business Case of the service contracts on cost of delivery, recovery of cost in respective service centre. Manage a healthy profit and loss across each service contract, per provided based on won contracts/improve and optimize more if possible as part of the discharge of the responsibilities. This includes but is not limited to annual AOP budgeting, financial planning for each service contract or delivery centres, financial for team training plans, and annual team bonding and EDMS level of activities. People and Growth Coach and mentor the delivery teams, either under direct or indirect management (e.g. 3rd party partners or contractors). This include thought leadership, and people management skills for various team under his service portfolios. Coach the Team members to develop Individual Development Plan and proper career path planning. Provide leadership and direction to project teams and oversee the development of competencies and career progression of team members.  The Ideal Profile Should Have / Be Degree in any discipline preferably related to Information Technology Infrastructure Min 15 years in the ICT industry with proven delivery experience in a sizable contract or organization Deep experience in IT services contract and complex implementation projects in both legacy and cloud managed service environment Experience in coaching and recovering trouble projects Good understanding of both business and delivery risks, especially in client work and delivery Strong collaboration and teaming experience, and ability to work with both senior leadership as well as operational and working level executives. Excellent relationship and stakeholder management skills - capable of dealing with people across all levels of a large, complex, fast moving organisation with constant transformation to stay market relevant. Able to develop high-quality presentations by synthesizing key information, financial data, market data and other relevant information  Apply today to be part of the winning team that does great work!  #NCSlife
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: “Bringing convenience to your everyday” - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’)! So whether it’s by delivering food on our signature pink bikes, providing insights into the newest food trends, or getting you the groceries you need, we’re all about keeping you fed. As we move to grow throughout the Asia-Pacific region, we’re on the lookout for talent who are excited about making a tangible impact with a fast-growing organisation looking to redefine how food, people, culture, and technology are connected.  We are looking for a highly analytical Marketing Controller to join our Regional Finance team based in Singapore, overseeing Marketing spend across all APAC markets.  The Manager, Financial Controller - Marketing (APAC) will partner end-to-end with Regional and Country Marketing Teams to help manage Marketing spend, including reporting, analysis, and compliance. The ideal candidate will have experience partnering with Sales and Marketing teams and will thrive in a culture of accountability and transparency. The individual will have exceptional attention to detail, but will also be a strategic thinker with demonstrated ability to influence.  What’s On Your Plate Collaborate with Country and Regional FP&A and Marketing teams to ensure that Marketing spend and financials are clearly understood by wider teams. Partner closely with the Regional FP&A and Marketing teams to make adjustments to existing processes with a view towards improving transparency and accuracy of our Marketing spend reports Gather, analyze, and disseminate meaningful financial data throughout the organization to assist in management decision-making. Provide proactive insights to highlight opportunities for improvement and find solutions to optimise spend. Educate Country Finance and Marketing teams with best practices on financial reporting and analysis. Support local teams during Month End Close - provide guidance and tools to help them improve accuracy and timeliness of MEC reporting Design, build and implement financial controls to ensure adherence to group controlling policies. Liaise with Intercompany Teams to record regional marketing charges and timely bookings by Countries What You Bring To The Table 5-10 years of FP&A or Financial Controlling background in e-commerce / technology / Food and Beverage or similar industries Background in fast-paced, MNC, entrepreneurial or startup/technology environments preferred. Must have experience supporting a Marketing department and familiarity with Marketing KPIs and levers. Comfortable to sit within the business unit and explain financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders. Able to explain what an accrual is to non-financial stakeholders Experience in providing recommendations based on financial modelling and data to senior management for strategic decision-making Exceptional verbal and written communication and presentation skills working within a regional and matrix management. Experience working with SAP and data analytics including Tableau and SQL BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration from a top-tier university, with finance qualifications (CA, CPA, ACCA) What We Will Feed You A dynamic and challenging work environment. A company committed to developing you personally and professionally. A great working atmosphere with regular company and team events. A vibrant and international team committed to diversity and inclusion. Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company. Other benefits include free food, health and dental insurance, and learning and development opportunities! foodpanda is operated by the Delivery Hero Group (“ DH Group ”), the global leader in the food delivery industry, processing over 4 million orders daily, operating in 40+ markets, with over 25,000 employees and approximately 600,000+ restaurant partners worldwide
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Financial Services

description: The Head of Credit Risk will kick-start the credit underwriting and risk management function for the company.  This individual will define and execute Pace’s global and country-specific credit underwriting strategies, including the advanced development of the company’s proprietary credit risk scoring methodologies to effectively underwrite new opportunities while reducing credit delinquencies, and the implementation of appropriate risk management practices to mitigate credit specific and portfolio specific risks.  This individual will be responsible for all underwriting activities within the company, which includes building the appropriate operational and team infrastructure to handle such activities.  Another integral part of the role is working closely with the product and engineering team to provide direct input into the long-term development of Pace’s automated underwriting and machine learning systems.  Responsibilities Responsible for credit and fraud risk assessment of the current and future consumer credit products Enhance the existing KYC process and anti-fraud policies while optimising risk & reward strategies for the company Manage and execute underwriting activities, developing best practice credit scoring and risk assessment policies (and processes) - taking into account existing users’ behaviour and develop a risk management strategy to maximize CLV (customer lifetime value) Develop and implement the global and country specific credit risk scorecards to standardize and localize credit evaluations of prospective applicants Setup effective risk management KPIs and the necessary systems to monitor and analyse on-going risk decision results Liaise with the product, finance and operations team to optimise risk decisions and processes. Manage risk trends and identify emerging risk factors - actively contributing to the development of Pace’s automated and machine learning credit risk assessment programs Work closely with the sales team to coordinate information requests - support business growth targets and achieve customer acquisition risk management goals Present weekly, monthly, and quarterly credit risk and portfolio assessments to the leadership team Stay up to date on the latest industry and market trends Requirements 6+ years of relevant credit risk experience, including underwriting, credit scoring, risk management Experience in risk management across the full spectrum of customer journey from underwriting, onboarding, customer management from both credit/fraud risk perspective. Experience in delivering risk solutions across credit risk (underwriting, scorecard development, loss mitigation, exposure controls, roll rates, line management) and fraud risk management. Quantitative background in engineering, statistics, math, economics, business or related disciplines. Aptitude to identify new ways to approach risk management - Creative thinker with strong bias to action exhibiting a “can-do” attitude Familiar with statistical analysis tools such as R, Python, SAS and SQL You understand the startup grind and can work autonomously in a fast-changing organization - Willingness to roll up your sleeves and manage “dirty” data (missing or incomplete data sets) and quickly underwrite small businesses from start-to-finish Strong team player who can be an active contributor to the leadership, sales, and product and engineering teams Possesses strong communication, interpersonal and presentation skills; and ability to engage and collaborate with multiple stakeholders across teams. Strong ability to recruit, manage, and mentor junior credit risk analysts for your future team Passion for fintech innovation - Strong understanding of the payment technology industry. Hands on experience in key Asian markets
industries: Design, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Strategic Workforce Planning (ideally along with Org Design experience) Expert Consultant  What can you expect: Lead sales conversations and client project delivery in workforce planning and organization design  We will count on you to Identify and help shape solutions for client problems across Strategic Workforce Planning and Org Design Lead business development efforts including the generation of leads and engagement with clients Lead proposal shaping, solution design fit to client needs and nurture upselling/ cross-selling client opportunities Lead, direct, and guide consulting engagements by providing appropriate guidance to project teams to deliver client value Manage projects to time, quality, budget while building team skills Align Vision: Business strategy and drivers, Strategic capabilities; Current workforce analysis (shape, size by level); Key stakeholder perspectives Define Futures: Future workforce metrics, ratios, and skills; New ways of working (incl. workload model); Demand and supply scenarios and gap analysis Determine Strategies and Design solutions for workforce gaps What You Need To Have Prior experience and depth in HR consulting across domains such as Strategic Workforce Planning and Org Design Data analytics skills to crunch workforce data, demand-supply scenarios, gaps Supported consulting project delivery, led and shaped proposals and client conversations What Makes You Stand Out Thrive in problem-solving, shaping solutions, understanding and solving for client needs Drive a positive, constructive, engaging work and high-performance culture Take ownership in building skills across the team you work with

description: About The Job  It's time to give up the good and go for the great! As APAC Head of Behavioral Science and Consulting you will have a direct impact on getting closer to our vision of democratizing coaching. By leading our team of APAC coaching experts and Behavioral scientists, you will build the interface between coaching science and business practice and make a decisive contribution to the growth and success of our company and our clients.  About The Team  You will be leading a team of international experts in Learning and Development and coaching science, our behavioral scientists, and directly report to our globally renowned SVP Coaching. You will closely partner with our regional sales leaders and our global product, solution, technology and operations teams.  Furthermore you will Coordinate the operations of the APAC team of coaching and implementation consulting experts: Recruit, retain and develop world-class scientists and consultant Build scalable processes and define and monitor KPIs Shape the future of the team, identifying growth opportunities for CoachHub and translating them into project Contribute to APAC team research activities, in liaise with other regional heads and SVP Coaching: Propose research streams and appoint research partners Monitor research projects and ensure deliverables including White Papers, Presentations, book chapters and journal papers which enhance the contribution of CoachHub as thought leaders Undertake conference, webinar and other presentations within the region Partner with all sales heads across APAC to support their teams in achieving sales and revenue targets: Develop POCs to demonstrate the value of coaching to potential and existing customers Further develop our (post and pre- sales) service offering Contribute to the development of reusable training material for our sales force Regularly engage with our top accounts in APAC to make sure you know the day to day reality of your team members (and show commitment to our customers) Collaborate with and consult other internal departments, including Marketing, Product and Operations on coaching practice & concepts and science: Build and sustain strong relationships between the Behavioral scientists and all delivery teams Spread leading-edge knowledge of coaching and its associated use cases Support product development and marketing teams by sharing customer and market insights and coaching expertise YOUR PROFILE You bring at least 3 years management experience in a business role in an L&D consultancy and 5 years experience in a people management role, ideally also outside of consultancy You bring excellent organisational, process and people skills and are highly KPI-driven You ideally have an academic background in psychology, education, cognitive neuroscience, behavioral economics, organizational leadership or equivalent programs, a Phd is a huge plus You ideally have published one or more coaching research papers, and are keen to contribute more to thought leadership in coaching, with an understanding of how to design and publish research You already gained experience in driving behavior change through trainings or transformations for large organizations Your written and verbal English communication skills are on a native level A coach training/certification is beneficial Willingness to travel 20% time on average What We Offer  You work in a top notch startup on its way to become the next unicorn Your own personal coach for unlimited sessions that will help you to unlock your potential and regular growth conversations with your supervisor Growth: An opportunity to join a fast growing and agile company The people: You will join an international team of driven and supportive people on a mission Impact: You have a direct impact on people's lives and make a true difference Feel welcome: First class company onboarding week that will get you settled in in no time, both remotely and in-house Experience a strong focus on professional and personal growth across all teams (we are a Coaching company after all!) Purpose-given work in self-organized teams Flexible work hours for the early birds and night owls Flexible arrangements for parents, we support you to be both a great parent and successful in your career About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn’s Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‘help organisations to unleash their people’s full potential’ attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‘CoachHubbers’ hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.
industries: Professional Training & Coaching

jobTitle: Head of Energy and Sustainability Services, South East Asia
description: What This Job Involves  This role requires detailed leadership and operational expertise to bring the business together and help us achieve new heights, driving growth and change across the business.This role is customer facing, Executive facing, and team oriented.The role will be centred around the following key elements-  Strategic Leadership Creating and driving the overall strategy for the team in South East Asia as part of the Asia Pacific Executive Working collaboratively with Global Product Management and Operations teams, and Asia Pacific leadership to drive a consistent, high performing, scalable business Position yourself and the team as the go-to experts within the firm, driving high levels of engagement, alignment, and growth towards sustainability offerings Identify and nurture high performing talent to drive the business forward, creating win-wins for clients and JLL Position JLL and the Energy and Sustainability business to be a dynamic, market-leading force for sustainable real estate. Commercial Management Helping to refine the suite of services offered, ensuring they are market relevant, deliverable, practical, and profitable Steer the business towards more profitable and scalable offerings Drive a culture of financial literacy and accountability across the teams, fostering engagement and shared responsibility in our growth plans. Business Development, Sales Enablement, and Marketing Take overall ownership for the BD and sales process across the region, working closely with Head of Sales to maintain a pipeline of high value projects, and ensuring win rates are in line with growth plans Create and lead a culture of sales, celebrating wins, and mentoring others to expand their horizons beyond technical delivery, and ensuring the full value of Sustainability is communicated internally and to clients Work with marketing teams to refine and own the ‘voice’ for Sustainability in the market. Help team members understand our value proposition, and provide support in raising this value proposition in the eyes of our clients. Business Operations Support and nurture the South East Asia Energy and Sustainability team, continuing to foster a ‘one team’ mentality which works across all JLL business lines in a collaborative manner Overseeing ESS production activities, ensuring high quality output is maintained, we achieve our revenue targets, and achieve high levels of customer satisfaction. Identify and roll out process efficiencies in terms of production, accounting and finances, team structures, etc. Performance objectives  Strategic Position yourself and the team as the go-to experts within the business, and within the market, creating excitement and buy-in to our vision of being a leader in sustainable real estate Maintain strong relationships with senior executives across the business, particularly C-Suite leaders in APAC, and the Global Product Management and Operations teams. Commercial Achieve agreed revenue and margin growth targets, whilst fostering a high performance culture of accountability within the team Demonstrable improvement in margin performance. BD / Sales Enablement / Marketing Measured by BD pipeline size, speed to conversion and margin performance working closely with regional head of sales Maintaining a suite of sales enablement tools which supports the business, and particularly assists project leads in winning work. Business Operations Create and manage a high functioning team culture and structure Foster deep levels of accountability, teamwork, collaboration, and shared purpose to drive overall success Seek out and drive process efficiencies around the broader business to drive operational and financial performance Process efficiencies around production, resourcing, etc. Staff engagement and career development Create a One JLL culture across ESS Asia Pacific Focus on personal and career development within the team, creating future pathways for growth, strong succession planning, and ensuring JLL is an employer of choice to grow sustainability careers. Background And Experience Proven change agent, collaborator, problem solver, creating win-win outcomes Proven ability to scale and mature businesses, drive process improvements, and create runway for scale Hold the gravitas and vision required for a role of this scale. JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

description: Dental Partnerships Marketing  Shape Zenyum into one of Asia’s most loved dental brands working with an ambitious and smart team to drive our Dental Partnerships side of the business. You will lead our Dental Marketing team, working with our SVP of Marketing and our Global Head of Partnerships to drive brand excellence and business growth across our network of partnerships in seven countries. Based in our Hong Kong or Singapore office, you will be defining the business plans, complete plans of engagement with new and existing partners, and create additional business opportunities with our dental partners. You will have the support of two organizations: the international partnerships organization and the local sales team to drive both technical and business performance. Finally, and most importantly, you will be responsible for driving business growth within our dental partnerships channel. We want every position at Zenyum to be flexible and creative in nature, thus you're also free to explore additional tools and models to engage our partners and help grow our joint business. Help us make Asia Smile More.  Your Responsibilities Will Be Plentiful Marketing Strategy: You will have ownership of our dental marketing strategy, bringing dental industry experience and insights to guide our international marketing initiatives. Brand Strategy: You will be the guardian and the Imagineer of our dental brand. Show us how best to showcase the unique benefits of being a Zenyum partner to the dental community. Partner Community: You will drive stronger relationships with our partners by building a community around the Zenyum brand. Collaborate with marketing and creative teams to plan our calendar of events and develop programmes. Business Development: You will support developing our business via our dental and healthcare partners. To drive additional healthcare opportunities and to ensure our partners are growing their business in parallel with us Insights Generation: You will represent the dentist's point of view, provide strong opinions and insights to internal stakeholders and external partners. You're a fit for this position if: You are a full on team player. Here we “row” altogether with one focus and one direction, we never leave anyone behind and that gives us the extra strength. As they say “culture eats strategy for breakfast” You are driven by results and have a need to get them independent of the circumstances You are accustomed to pressure and enjoy the thrill of the ride. If you have successfully navigated the pressure of delivering results constrained by time, if you have overcome challenges to you or your team performance you will fit right in You are technical in your approach and have experience or passion to design operational flows that improve the customer experience and the efficiency of our joint organizations You are people driven. If your experience and your enjoyment at work are connected to spending time with other people and seeing them grow professionally You don’t avoid conflict and the need to give value feedback to our own internal teams and the partners. We want and need a person who can handle giving realistic input to help others perform better and this requires strength and commitment We'd love to see that: You have 6+ years of experience in dentistry, dental or healthcare marketing and you can drive high-level international strategy Ideally, you have a strong track record of developing high-performance marketing strategies in the dental industry You have deep knowledge of the dental industry across the region Positive attitude in fast-paced startup circumstances and a strong team player working with excellent teammates of different nationalities Strong communication, negotiation, and relationship management skills Are curious and creative in testing out new things with a growth hacking mentality Attention to detail in execution by yourself and your team Language ability in English is needed, Mandarin, Cantonese, other SEA languages are a plus  Your Benefits And Growth Upon Joining Include To join the diverse team of one of the most ambitious and fastest-growing startups in Southeast Asia, funded by Sequoia Capital Work with professionals in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Vietnam, and Taiwan Fast growth and promotion prospects, in a highly successful and ambitious team Be rewarded with an attractive package (employee benefits and competitive salary) About Zenyum  Zenyum is the newest innovation in dental care. We believe everyone deserves an affordable, confident smile. We provide 3D-printed Invisible Braces and a range of Smile Cosmetics, produced under the highest quality standards, to the rising Asian middle class. Zenyum matches professional dentists with cutting-edge technology and offers our patients treatment at an unbeatable cost.  We are a team of experienced internet entrepreneurs and doctors, and are backed by some of the world’s best venture capital, including Sequoia Capital India. We believe in rigorous processes and high accountability towards ourselves to deliver the highest quality standard for our patients. As of today, we are live in seven markets and are expanding across Asia and India within the next months.  Become part of Asia’s biggest success story in Smile Cosmetics.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Consumer Goods

description: Company Description  X0PA AI is an Artificial Intelligence Software as a Service (SaaS) start-up that aims to digitally transform the hiring process. We aim to save companies significant time and cost in hiring while achieving the highest level of objectivity, ultimately enhancing retention, loyalty and person to job and organization fit. Through our AI and Machine Learning capabilities, we can source, score and rank talent to identify the best talent for each organization. X0PA AI has recently launched X0PA ROOM, an AI enabled hybrid video interviewing and assessment platform.  Job Summary  The FInance controller reports directly to the CEO and is responsible for directing, administering and coordinating of policies and procedures related to all financial matters globally.  This is a fantastic opportunity to work hands on with a high performing team in an AI based, innovative, fast-moving, funded start-up.  Job Responsibility Financial Accounting & Operations Oversee the financial & management reporting Maintain accounting records and lead in the monthly closing. Ensure timely financial & management reporting Work closely with the CEO in investor engagements Commercial Finance, Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Analyze business performance versus planned and previous performance, search for continuous improvements and actively drives for innovation in the organization Monthly Management Reports and analysis, Quarter Business Reviews, Annual Budget Planning and other similar finance reviews and planning on sales, margins, OPEX, working capital, product portfolio, and customer analysis. Prepare detailed variance analysis for reporting purposes for business leaders to drive improvement of business performance, identify challenges and the status quo where necessary. Coordinate, plan and execute the forecasting and budget process to run the process for maximum impact and efficiency, during the year monitor alignment of budget and forecasts with strategic and operational plans of organizations. Participate in ad hoc projects and improvement initiatives Process/Systems/Continuous Improvement Design, build and implement financial controls to ensure adherence to internal controls requirements. Embrace and lead process/system/mindset change. Influence pricing decisions and commercial matters. Statutory Matters, including Audit, Tax, Regulatory Issues Prepare month-end, year-end financial package, financial statements & disclosure schedules, tax reporting Consolidate yearly accounts for external auditor, attending to queries and required schedules/ documents for completion of audited accounts Manage internal audit programs on financial processes and accounts Liaise with auditor and tax authority for reporting and tax compliance, etc. Prepare relevant tax documents to support tax computation Job Requirement At least Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related field. ACCA/CA/CFA qualifications is a plus. Data driven approach and strong understanding of data science. At least 3 years of experience in accounting and controlling, experience in start-up environment is a plus. Hands-on experience within the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) function Multi-country and multi-functional experiences Excellent communication skills and ability to work well with people at all levels A practical, hands-on approach to problem solving Strong analytical skills Preferably someone who embraces ambiguity and thrives on building things from the ground up Demonstrates resilience in challenging situations. Able to handle ambiguity and adapt to rapidly changing circumstances in a fast-paced environment Prior experience in the B2N/B2B SaaS domain a plus. What We Offer  We are a bunch of fun loving, self-motivated professionals. We offer an inclusive, diverse and motivated work environment with huge learning opportunities.  In Singapore, we are located at JTC LaunchPad at One North which is a leading start-up hub in Asia and the world, a vibrant start-up ecosystem with opportunities to meet lot of like-minded individuals.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Research

description: The Role  Reporting into the President of Overseas Operation, your key responsibilities are: Oversee full financial insight for the sales operations in the Region; Contribute to formulate the company's long term growth strategy, and participate in strategic planning processes; Provide support in M & A projects including due diligence & document preparation; Provide timely decision management accounts with an emphasis on delivering business and financial performance analysis; Ensure proper internal controls and corporate risk management processes are in place to safeguard the company's assets and on-going operations; Provide strategic business insights on the Regional Business Units; Assist to facilitate various corporate finance activities for the Group; Perform ad hoc duties and handle investment analysis as required; Lead the overseas financial team. jobTitle: Director - Market Product & Integration Lead, Identity Verification
description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Director - Market Product & Integration Lead, Identity Verification  Overview  MasterCard Worldwide is a leading global payments solutions company that provides a broad range of innovative services in support of our global members' credit, deposit access, electronic cash, business-to-business and related payment programs. The Acceptance group’s vision is to enable a world beyond cash through a combination of technology and strategic partnerships. We are creating great experiences for consumers across all channels and all devices, enabling merchants to reach consumers in ways not possible in the pre-digital world. We work with banks, merchants and digital participants to enable consumers to shop and pay.  The Cyber & Intelligence (C&I) solutions team is responsible for sales of world-class risk, fraud, cyber security, and authentication products and services in the AP. The products we support help protect the integrity of the electronic payment system as well as ensure payments and interactions are simple, safe and secure in the digital and physical world. The solutions are primarily focused on fraud prevention, artificial intelligence, risk mitigation, authentication, identity, biometrics and dispute resolution including Mastercard’s latest acquisitions.  Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.  Roles and Responsibilities Regional lead and primary product point of contact in market for identity verification services recently acquired and broader market strategy for identity verification business. Responsible for development of and execution of go-to-market for identity verification services recently acquired. Responsible for development of and execution of go-to-market for of integrated solutions identified as acquisition synergies. Includes identity verification services and other Mastercard Cyber & Intelligence Solutions that secure account opening, card-on-file, e-commerce transactions and other  strategic digital use cases. Responsible for working with Mastercard sales specialists and Ekata sales force to establish establishing integrated sales plan across prioritized markets and segments. Accountable for ensuring that established sales revenue targets are met for recently acquired identity verification services and synergy solutions. Works with Mastercard sales specialists and Ekata customer success team to ensure customers are realizing value of services. Establishes process and runs reporting of KPIs for acquisition and identity verification business to regional and global senior management teams. Captures customer feedback on product and emerging needs and communicates feedback to regional and global Identity Verification product teams. Identifies new opportunities and defines market growth strategy for identity verification business.  All About You Demonstrated consistent success working with partners across other functions in support of product go-to market strategies. Analytical, problem solver with solid understanding of competitive offering, industry trends and the acceptance value chain and its constituents. Have ten plus years of experience in product management and/or solution engineering roles with domain knowledge in payments highly preferred Be trained in product management methodologies and will be experienced in communicating with product managers, technical architects, business analysts and engineers to deliver new solutions. Strong communications and presentation skills, including the ability to work with people across a matrix organization at all levels. Create trust and value while building enduring relationships. Identify and secure executive sponsorship to solidify business relationships and opportunities Strategize and prioritize Go-To-Market strategies and help drive market penetration and revenue growth. Proven track record selling technology solutions directly and through partner channels. Proven people management and employee development experience; Results driven, deadline- focused. Self-starter and quick learner with ability to work independently and through ambiguity.  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

description: Responsibilities Achieve monthly and annual collections targets Work closely with sales and service personnel to maintain good customer credit control Prepare weekly/monthly/quarterly credit control reports for local/regional reporting and credit control meetings Investigate and resolve queries and disputes relating to billing and outstanding invoices Maintain accurate and up-to-date customer profiles Evaluate credit applications and conduct regular credit review and risk assessment Liaise with solicitors on legal matters pertaining to recovery of delinquent accounts Contribute to the team effort by performing other job-related duties as required Requirements At least 2 years’ experience in Credit Control/Accounts Receivable function Possess a Diploma in Accountancy Proficient in MS Office applications Knowledge in SAP is an added advantage Good communication, writing and interpersonal skills Good problem solving skills and able to take initiative Flair for numbers Applicants must be able to commence within October 2021 and willing to commit for a 5-month contract.
