jobTitle: Director, Head of FX Trading, APAC
description: About Wells Fargo  Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 20 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Market Job Description Develop and implement FX trading strategy in APAC in line with the global FX business plans to grow its revenue base Identify opportunities for the current platform and proactively drive the platform buildout for growth Deliver financial results and market share of our client franchise Partner with the Global Sales team to develop and grow our current client base and to develop strong partnership with our clients Ensure all transactions comply with all operational risk and compliance requirements Serve clients through pricing, construction of robust, data-driven trade ideas, consistent communication with Sales. Generate consistent profitability and manage risk prudently while partnering with various risk management functions. Work with other Trading Desks across locations to accurately and efficiently disseminate market relevant information. Improve trading desk infrastructure by leveraging in-house technology and optimize electronic trading across Asia/Europe/US. Provide feedback on customer satisfaction and make recommendations to drive product innovation Market Skills and Certifications  The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following: Extensive knowledge of FX products and solutions In depth understanding of technological, risk and regulatory trends impacting FX business Technical expertise in regulatory, compliance, and risk management issues. Successful track record of industry thought leadership and developing senior level relationships. Strong experience in developing and execution of business strategies. Ability to analyze data and use for decision-making and managing initiatives. Successful track record in systematically executing initiatives using project management disciplines. Highest level of integrity and good judgement and ability to maintain confidentiality. Strong stakeholder skills and ability to work and lead across functions. Strong commercial judgement, excellent communication and influencing skills. Comfortable working in a matrix organizational environment and partnership skills. University Degree or advanced qualifications and equivalent experience Extensive proven experience with Securities and investment banking experience at leadership level. Experience in leading a FX trading team in APAC. Strong sense of urgency and commitment as well as a strong business sense with a strategic and tactical orientation. Relevant license for conducting FX trading activities. Leadership Expectations at Wells Fargo  Specifically You Will  As a Team Member manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them. Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks. We Value Diversity  At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

description: Oracle Enterprise Risk and Finance (ERF) portfolio are looking for a Senior Software Development Director to lead the build out of NEW cloud native products to respond to product demands. This role is critical to the future success of the portfolio and allows a significant cross over between the ERF engineering team and the Portfolio Head. Experience in implementing cloud native solutions in financial services is required.  Responsibilities ·        Manage a team that designs, develops, troubleshoots and debugs software programs. ·        As a Senior Director of the software engineering division, you will apply your extensive knowledge of software architecture to manage software development tasks associated with developing, debugging or designing software applications, operating systems and databases according to current and future design specifications. ·        Build enhancements within an existing software architecture and envision improvements to the architecture. ·        Directs and ensures the implementation of operational policies through subordinate managers Interacts internally and externally with executive management involving negotiation of difficult matters to influence policy.  Preferred Qualifications ·        Overall 15+ years of experience in Information Technology (IT) with 10+ years of total experience in technical architecture, application development, middleware development and database management ·        Demonstrable track record of building cloud native architectures and platforms for SaaS offerings preferably in the financial services or other mission critical use cases. ·        Experience of leading a team that designs, develops, troubleshoots and debugs serverless microservices architecture frameworks including distributed transaction management capabilities ·        Demonstrable experience in formulating and executing an engineering strategy to impact the economics of a SaaS business ·        Prior experience in acquiring organizational capabilities in DevOps and automation paradigms such as infrastructure as code ·        Experience of interacting and supporting CloudOps / SaaSOps teams for deploying, testing and L2/L3 support for Cloud applications.  ·        Technical domain knowledge required Spark, Kafka, Hadoop, AI/ML, and Cloud architecture.   ·        Ability to provide detailed product presentations detailing Cloud Architecture and Implementation and present to Product Managers, Pre-Sales, Sales, Consulting teams and Customers ·        Ability to interact with all customer roles such as CIO, CTO, IT Architects, technical staff and business users. ·        A proven and enthusiastic, high-energy, motivating leader who is visibly passionate and is capable of inspiring and galvanizing people around. ·        A balance of strategic and tactical skills, with a high level of intellectual agility and capacity for thought leadership. ·        A proven ability to navigate and effectively collaborate with other groups and resources in a large complex environment. ·        A bachelor degree is required and masters degree desired with relevant experience ·        Demonstrable understanding of Banking and Insurance industry is required

description: Job Description (Roles & Responsibilities)  ·       Serve as a key technical member of the Solutions Architecture team in helping to enable partners and ensure partner success in building partner practice, capabilities, and solutions on the Huawei Cloud platform. ·       Scope each partner engagement, with attention towards clear and well-defined objectives and success criteria. ·       Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful partner engagements validating POCs, SOWs, new solutions and architecture designs. ·       Demonstrate vision, creativity, business acumen and deep Huawei Cloud knowledge in jointly developing industry and vertical partner solutions. ·       Own each technical enablement and engagement, and help ensure a timely and successful delivery of value. (delivery of actual solutions to be done by Huawei partners) ·       Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the solution architect community. ·       Understand the Huawei market segments, customer base, and industry verticals. ·       Understand and exploit internal Huawei systems. ·       Share partner and customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive improvements.  As a Partner Solution Architect focused on our strategic alliance partners within Huawei Cloud, you will have the opportunity to help shape and take initiative to produce results on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of the Huawei Cloud platform across our partner community.   BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  ·       Be familiar with the functions, principles, and architecture of one or more domains of the public cloud or private cloud. Basic programming knowledge or development experience is preferred. ·       Highly technical and analytical, possess 8+ years of current solution architecture (implementation/consulting) experience ·       Experience in technology/software sales or pre-sales consulting. ·       Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers ·       Ability to communicate fluently in Mandarin and English, in technical and business settings   PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  ·       Experience working within partner and consulting organizations ·       Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud ·       Previous experience with Huawei Cloud is a plus ·       Experience with a programming or scripting language.

jobTitle: Director - Head of Logistics & Industrial, PDS Singapore
description: This role reports to the Executive Director, Head of PDS Singapore and is responsible for logistics & industrial sector within the Singapore PDS business.  You will play an active role within the Singapore PDS Management Team, setting strategy for your sector within the PDS Singapore business, which is part of our wider “Work Dynamics” division. You will drive the overall performance of the sector, across sales, operations, team management and project delivery. You will collaborate and work with leaders of business lines outside the immediate confines of PDS to promote our “One JLL” ethos that sets our clients’ needs and ambitions first.  You will be responsible for the financial management of their business sector. You will work in close collaboration with our sales and business development team, to support the pursuit of new work for the business, follow up on leads and opportunities, prepare proposals, meet with clients to pitch and win new assignments, to achieve growth and revenue targets for the business. You will oversee project delivery and be involved in risk management including the vetting of contracts, insurances, tenders and day to day risks associated with the project. You will provide stewardship and guidance for the team(s) under your charge on projects and also to manage the career development of your direct reports, through mentoring and coaching.  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at AccomodationRequest@am.jll.com . description: Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You've come to the right place. We're looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we'd like to hear from you.  Job Description  The Opportunity  The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering the Head of Finance, Singapore with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.  The role is accountable for the overall management and supervision of the Finance function in the Wealth & Investment Management business in Singapore. As a key member of the management team in MIMS, the incumbent will be a strategic advisor to the business, providing strong financial leadership necessary for the business growth agenda. Reports to the CFO, Wealth and Asset Management Asia (WAM Asia), and the CEO, Manulife Investment Management, Singapore (MIMS).  What motivates you? You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone We Are Looking For Someone With University Qualified with recognized professional designation (CPA, CA, CMA or CFA) 15+ years direct experience in Finance roles. Experience in leading a Finance function/department, preferably in an asset management company. Strong business acumen and commercial experience, with demonstrable capability to understand and analyze complex concepts and articulate big picture perspective Strong business partnering, interpersonal and stakeholder management, with demonstrable experience of negotiating and influencing across a wide range of stakeholders Highly developed leadership skills, having extensive experience working within a matrix organization with both direct and indirect reporting influence, to effectively collaborate, leverage and lead teams / individuals across multiple geographies Strong attention to detail with excellent judgement, analytical and problem-solving skills Superior written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to cater a message to various stakeholders, including senior executive and non-technical audiences. Proven ability to be proactive and work independently or part of a team, whilst thriving in a fast paced, high-performing environment whilst managing multiple, changing priorities and requests Proven accomplishments as a change agent with strong execution capability and focus on control and process improvement On The Job You Will  Strategic Financial Management Oversee the finance financial management function of Manulife Investment Management Singapore Lead the annual planning exercise and periodic forecasts, working closely with local CEO, department heads and regional finance. Provide financial advice and support to the Regional CFO and Singapore CEO, department heads and Board of Directors in the development of major initiatives and business strategy, including the review of business plans Participate in Singapore Management Committee meetings and local Board meeting Day to Day Financial Management Manage all aspects of finance including financial reporting, management reporting, regulatory reporting, audit, tax compliance, transfer pricing, product profitability and cash/capital management. Financial and Management Accounting Provide monthly financial results to Regional CFO, Singapore CEO and Regional finance. Perform relevant analysis, as requested by the CFO and CEO, department heads or regional finance, to assist them with their decision making or analysis Keep abreast of relevant financial, tax and corporate governance developments Ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with relevant accounting standards, internal policies and statutory/regulatory/tax requirements Ensure that an appropriate financial policy framework is in place. This should include sound internal controls including strong focus on balance sheet control, appropriate capitalization policy, expense approval policy and travel, entertainment and business expense reimbursement policy Ensure that information on Assets Under Management (including inflows, outflows and respective fund attributes) are properly recorded in the systems Provide finance support to affiliated company, Manulife General Account Investments Singapore. Finance lead for the HNW segment in Singapore and Asia more broadly, in support of the private bank strategy, including sales tracking of the private bank channel and the development and management of the P/L for this channel in Asia Review the department's processes periodically to identify areas of improvements and ensure that the finance operational manual is kept up to date Cash Management Monitor and manage the cash position to ensure sufficient liquidity whilst managing any capital injection process (when applicable) Follow up on long outstanding debts and ensure creditors' terms are met. Regulatory Compliance Work closely with the Compliance team to ensure that the regulatory capital and liquidity requirements are met. Work with external tax agents and Group Tax function to ensure strict adherence to all tax obligations, including transfer pricing policy / regulation Work with external auditors to ensure that statutory requirements are met. Leadership and Team Development Provide strong interpersonal skills with a specific focus on team and individual professional development. Provide regular and constructive feedback and coaching Cultivate an innovative environment by supporting creativity and high-performance teamwork. Focus on strong team engagement and staff morale. Build effective relationships across a wide stakeholder group, and broader Finance function Manage and influence teams and individuals on both a direct and indirect reporting basis, across a complex matrix structure. Actively contribute and enhance the Regional and Global WAM Finance function, working closely with regional finance team, and other local Heads of Finance Our commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry Our best. Every day. Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.  About Manulife  About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and our global wealth and asset management segment, Manulife Investment Management, serves individuals, institutions and retirement plan members worldwide. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2021, we had CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.3 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer  At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.  It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

description: MatchMove is looking to hire a VP/ Legal Director to serve as MatchMove’s financial regulatory legal counsel across multiple Asia jurisdictions to support a rapidly growing business in the region. Reporting to the CEO and COO, the incumbent will provide support on legal, regulatory and commercial advice for daily business operations and general commercial and transactional matters involving the various global payment platforms in Asia, including commercial and procurement contract negotiations, drafting and reviewing of license applications and regulatory responses in conjunction with applicable laws and regulations framework.  Come Join Our Dynamic Team!  Job Description Draft and negotiate contracts for regional payments with business partners covering technical integration, information security, data processing, regulatory compliance, settlement and marketing. Provide strategic legal and commercial advice to our regional sales teams on payment laws, regulations, data protection, compliance and risks relating to our business. Partner with sales, product and compliance teams to resolve open contractual points. Draft and negotiate ad hoc agreements to support commercial activities (e.g. referral, exclusivity). Draft contract templates for new services and update existing ones to ensure compliance with new regulations. Represent MatchMove on various fintech/payments-related topics before regulators, banking partners and other external audiences. Manage and instruct external counsel on regulatory and compliance issues. Coordinate execution of agreements and legalization of documents with regional colleagues and counterparties. Assist in general legal, commercial and regulatory compliance matters, such as MAS audits/reporting and any other regulatory reporting and compliance matters. Work closely with multi-cultural senior management and shareholders. Support corporate secretary tasks and other departments to ensure compliance across the stakeholders Job Requirements/ Attributes Qualified lawyer with 6 to 8 PQE with regional experience across APAC, ideally from another FinTech company with financial regulatory background, specifically in payments. Prior experience working in major financial institution, financial services regulatory authority, or sophisticated financial services regulatory practice within a major law firm. Familiar with anti-money laundering, data privacy, consumer protection and anti-bribery issues. A commercially savvy “business enabler”, who can proactively engage various stakeholders. Decisive, with excellent judgment, and adept at making smart decisions when faced with ambiguity and imperfect information. Executive presence, ability to lead and influence, and to articulate legal issues in layman terms. Excellent communicator (written and verbal), with an ability to make complex regulatory concepts clear to business teams, engineers and regulators. Strong knowledge on Singapore & Asia laws and regulations especially in the Payment Services Act by MAS. MatchMove Culture To work in a fast-moving growing startup, fun and yet professional environment that recognizes and rewards individual contributions and also team success. To work with highly motivated and diverse people who are totally focused on winning by combining great teamwork, rapid execution and an uncompromising approach to quality and customer satisfaction. We strongly encourage Innovation, Collaboration, Creativity, and Initiative. Personal Data Protection Act  By submitting your application for this job, you are authorizing MatchMove to: collect and use your personal data, and to disclose such data to any third party with whom MatchMove or any of its related corporation has service arrangements, in each case for all purposes in connection with your job application, and employment with MatchMove; and retain your personal data for one year for consideration of future job opportunities (where applicable).

description: Acronis leads the world in cyber protection - solving safety, accessibility, privacy, authenticity, and security (SAPAS) challenges with innovative backup, security, disaster recovery, and enterprise file sync and share solutions that run in hybrid cloud environments: on-premises, in the cloud, or at the edge. Enhanced by AI technologies and blockchain-based data authentication, Acronis protects all data, applications and systems in any environment, including physical, virtual, cloud, and mobile.  With dual headquarters in Switzerland and Singapore, Acronis protects the data of more than 5 million consumers and 500,000 businesses in over 150 countries and 20 languages.  We are looking for a Design Director to take ownership of all digital communication design in the company. We need to grow and improve our website, online sales and promotions, internal and external portals and other digital products. The Director of Digital Design should combine the two main components: 1. A Manager who can plan the work, inspire the team, and build the design processes. 2. An Art Director, who has a modern vision of digital design and also knows UX principles.  Responsibilities Director of Digital Design is responsible for managing and conceptualizing the creative output, including staff supervision and production. The core responsibility is to determine the best way to represent an idea and produce high-level concepts for design projects, across every digital channel. Employ analytical skills to choose and supervise the design team that creates these projects based on specific customers' needs. Requirements Collaborate with designers, lead and mentor them. Conceptualize, design, and deliver web projects on time Work together with the team on Company’s website design, landing pages, special projects, create product visuals — static and motion Support the brand design team on web and graphic design, create and supervise web and product guidelines Lead in the further development of our visual brand strategy and aesthetic Provide a clear channel of communication and coordination between design teams and upper management Work out and deliver functional and communicative design. Partner with freelancers and external studios and get the expertise needed to deliver fresh UX solutions Partner with key stakeholders to set goals, plan roadmaps, prioritize work, and coordinate staffing and resources on established planning cycles Qualifications 6+ years of relevant experience Strategic thinking Ability to build unique design solutions which will surprise and delight clients Ability to manage and lead other creative staff Possess the ability to meet overlapping deadlines in a fast-paced working environment without substituting quality or accuracy Understanding of the latest creative trends Passionate about design, color concepts, typography, hierarchy, and flow Excellent interpersonal skills Ability to resolve complex communication issues Good planning and organizational skills Attention to details

Understand and articulate the value proposition of the broader Aon Cyber Solutions offering (proactive, reactive and advisory services). Support country and regional broking teams in the negotiation and placement of cyber insurance policies. Support deployment of the broader Aon Cyber Solutions offering, particularly scenario development and coverage analysis contained in quantification and simulation services. Negotiate policy wording amendments and endorsements with insurers and drive quality control initiative across all cyber policies placed in Asia Present on cyber risk and insurance in individual client meetings as well as large client events Partner with Aon resources (Sales & Marketing, Specialty Team, GBC and in-Country teams) to deliver the widest practical range of insurance solutions and services to client. Interface with the market and to secure optimum outcome for client risk coverage. Contribute to up to date marketing materials on carrier appetite and solutions available to Specialty clients. Ensure knowledge and best practice approaches are captured, documented and shared among cyber champion network. Contribute, as required, to Specialty Broking and Aon Cyber Solutions initiatives in general. Requirements 6+ years of experience within the insurance industry (or relevant adjacent professions, including law, consulting and cybersecurity) 2+ years of experience working with cyber insurance policies Strong technical skills around insurance policy interpretation and drafting and/or cyber risk Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong cultural fit - ability to forge strong relationships with country and specialty colleagues as well as clients and insurers

description: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  The Role Responsibilities  The purpose of this role is to enable the Bank to drive Digital Sales & Marketing through Performance Marketing for Personal segment across all paid, owned and earned channels. The role will be accountable for designing and driving the Performance Marketing agenda working closely with Personal Banking business and execution teams to identify and support execution of Performance marketing initiatives which drive measurable lift on digital sales & marketing goals. It requires proven leadership, outstanding stakeholder management and knowledge of performance marketing across all digital channels, paid media, data and digital analytics tools, content optimisation, onsite optimisation, keyword research and strategy, AdTech and MarTech, campaign management tools and capabilities. Extensive knowledge of marketing performance management, paid media buying processes and tools is a pre-requisite, with hands-on experience with running marketing campaigns.  Required  To achieve this, the role holder will be part of a Global team of Digital Sales & Marketing experts and is required to Design and implement a Digital Sales & Marketing measurement framework, setting measurement standards, driving execution of attribution modelling, designing reporting, reviewing and streamlining processes, to create transparency on Digital Sales & Marketing performance and set the basis to Performance Marketing optimisation Co-design and implement a Performance Marketing approach and methodology together with Brand & Marketing and Personal Banking teams, reviewing and streamlining processes, reviewing governance, defining clear roles and responsibilities within the design and execution of performance marketing initiatives Provide guidelines, best practices, and recommendations to execution teams to optimise Paid media budgets, Conversion rates and Performance across digital channels and platforms within the sales funnel and deliver sales uplift, supporting ideation and prioritisation of performance marketing optimisation initiatives. Build and maintain toolkits, tests libraries and trainings to optimise marketing performance and upskill execution teams, keeping up-to-date with global best practices, innovations and tech developments within the performance marketing space in order to continuously innovate and drive superior marketing performance Partner with Data, Technology, Build, MarTech stakeholders in charge of building capabilities (in particular Digital Analytics, Test & Target, DMP tools) to ensure alignment and prioritization of capability building with business needs Partner with Brand & Marketing and Media agencies stakeholders to ensure alignment and prioritization of marketing initiatives and media buy processes with business priorities Digital Sales & Marketing measurement Collaborate with data analytics and digital stakeholders to ensure comprehensive mapping of touchpoints across digital platforms and channels in order to map granular end-to-end digital sales funnel performance Design dashboards, measurement and reporting tools to track granular performance across all steps of the digital sales funnel, by channel, campaign, ad set, click source Collaborate with Technology, Data and Build teams to identify and leverage all tools to gather insights on digital sales & marketing performance (including analytics, heatmaps, customer journey mapping, etc) Create standard reporting and business insights for measurement and assessment of digital sales & marketing performance Design measurement methodology to support prioritisation of testing initiatives and assessment of outcomes of the tests and campaigns using statistical significance, control groups, etc. Support the design and implementation of page tagging, configuration of testing and targeting campaigns, and report construction Performance Marketing framework Review and update the framework for Digital Sales & Marketing target setting and tracking with products, segments and countries stakeholders and align stakeholders to ensure consistency in digital implementation within the guidelines Design and implement performance marketing framework and methodology, reviewing and updating playbooks to drive performance marketing across all channels by using MarTech stack and tools available, to be delivered within an agile operating model, including management of Search (SEO/SEM), Display, Social, Aggregators, Affiliates, Partners, KOLs, as well as ongoing management of online conversion rate optimisation Develop and implement clear structures of accountability within performance marketing to ensure team members can perform successfully in their roles and there is clear oversight / supervision / decision making to deliver performance optimization initiatives Evaluate maturity of marketing capabilities and processes and deliver recommendations for continuously streamlining efforts and improving digital sales & marketing performance results Create and disseminate test & learn culture within the organisation to drive performance marketing optimisation Performance Marketing Guidelines, Best practices, Toolkits and Libraries Design and disseminate guidelines and best practices to identify and execute performance marketing initiatives across channels, including SEO, SEM, Display, Social, Video, Aggregators, Affiliates, Partners, KOLs, etc. Run regular assessment and review of performance of digital sales & marketing actions with execution teams, providing them with advice and recommendations to optimise performance across all digital channels Identify new concepts and innovative technologies to seamlessly acquire and nurture customers, tailoring them to markets and segments and socializing them with key stakeholders in order to execute them Build, maintain and disseminate a library of best practices, successful campaigns launch/optimisations and tests with key learning and recommendations Build, maintain and disseminate toolkits to drive performance marketing across all performance levers for all channels Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development of execution teams to drive performance marketing Alignment with Data, Technology, Build and MarTech Be an advocate for investment in transformational initiatives (e.g. building Marketing Technology capabilities, standardizing digital sales measurement) that drive digital sales and marketing volumes and efficiency, collaborating with the Bank's stakeholders to deliver them Collaborate with a range of partners, e.g., MarTech, Data Analytics, Web Management, Online/Mobile platforms, Digital Banking, Brand & Marketing, Marketing agencies, Legal, Compliance, Security, in order to prioritise capability building and ensure access to the right tools and support to deliver execution of Performance Marketing Alignment with Brand & Marketing and Marketing agencies Collaborate with a Brand & Marketing and Digital partners and agencies to align Performance Marketing actions with overall Brand & Marketing agenda and drive synergies and best practices sharing amongst campaigns and Segments Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Our Ideal Candidate Graduate degree 10+ years of experience in running digital marketing for large-scale brands, in house or through digital agencies; 5+ years working in a product marketing capacity preferred, i.e., partnered closely with Agile development teams Expert knowledge of Paid Media tools, including DMP, DSP, Ad servers, Bidding tools Expert knowledge in all Paid media channels, including Search, Programmatic Display, Affiliates, Aggregators, Social Media Expert knowledge of digital marketing principles such as funnel optimization UX, SEO & Landing Page optimization & experience in running A/B tests for campaigns and deriving customer insights a major plus Deep experience in planning and buying of display media, building campaigns, implementing bidding strategies. Experience with programmatic buying a plus Knowledge of Onsite optimization and SEO principles and best practices Experience collecting/analysing data and generation actionable insights using analytics and campaign management programs, e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe, DoubleClick Campaign Manager Knowledge of optimization and campaign management systems, e.g., CMS, Tag Management, Atlas, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager Working Knowledge of other analytics and data visualization tools, including Google Analytics, Google Trends, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, Event Tracking and Tagging (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch) Ability to understand the key business objectives and create a Media optimisation and measurement strategy with strong focus on online sales growth by working with SEO, Web, digital and products team. Compelling vision of the future of Marketing and translation into effective strategies and actions Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. description: Job Summary  The Assistant Manager will create, develop and market an innovative, premium holistic integrated Wellness Centre in Singapore whilst ensuring the achievement of sales goals, business objectives and profitability.  Job Responsibilities  Sales Promote and sell programs, services and products offered by the Centre and conduct walk through of the Centre’s facilities. Strive to achieve sales target through communications and upselling to customers. Concierge and Operations Correspond to internal and external customers enquiries, complaints and feedback, within 24 hours, before escalating to Operations Manager. Responsible for cultivating a cohesive and inspiring workplace culture amongst concierge team and practitioners Ensure Concierge team comply to Company’s code of conduct and grooming standards Provide support for implementation of workshop and programmes as necessary. Ensure SOPs compliance and timely update with MBO to facilitate appointments, bookings, cancellations between customers and practitioners for private sessions and consultations. Ensure accurate and timely administration of medical/clinical follow-up appointments and insurance claims Support manager in implementation of new services and programs and orientation and training of new team members Responsible for smooth operations of assigned service point(s), including concierge services, retail administrative and operational matters. Responsible for two-way communication between staff and management and ensure timely dissemination of information, escalation of issues and recommending solutions to problems. To support management to achieve stable, skilled and motivated workforce and achieve the desired customer and business outcomes. Responsible for the management of Concierge team, as well as the induction, regular competency audit, training and development of these staff, such that they are successful in their assigned tasks for accurate administration of customer journey and excellent customer service at all touch-points. Plan Concierge roster for Manager's approval, and resolve manning issues with Manager. Address wellness practitioners’ feedback and propose solutions to Manager. Retail stocks inventory management and assist to achieve sell-through target Co-develop training materials and structure with Merchandiser To perform other duties as assigned by the company. Job Requirements Candidate must possess at least a Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Hospitality/Wellness or equivalent. At least 5 year(s) of working experience as a Manager specializing in Healthcare, Hospitality and Wellness in the related field is required for this position. Must be willing to work on weekends. Good communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to multitask in a busy front office environment Excellent Team working and practitioner collaboration skills Knowledge of physiotherapy, osteopathy, TCM, Massage, yoga therapy, coaching, counselling and psychoeducation workshops a plus. If you are interested to apply, kindly WhatsApp me your updated resume in DOC file and allow our Consultant to match you with our Clients.  Whatsapp: +65 8778 3126 （Nicole Tan）  Email: nicole_tan@thesupremehr.com

jobTitle: [NGF x EAST] Free Thinking Creative / Creative Lead
description: [NGF x EAST] We’re looking for a Free Thinking Creative. About EAST As NGF’s dedicated creative partner, we work closely together to drive digital campaigns and strategies. Who/what NGF is here. EAST is a data-driven marketing agency, bringing together Creativity and Tech, Analytics, and Content. We’re a sparky international outfit of youthful people across fields from advertising, data science, technology, consulting to content creation who got together to chase new ideas and new innovations on the frontier. Find out more about who we are / what we do here. Role Summary: We are looking for a talented creative powerhouse to add to our growing creative team. Somebody who isn’t afraid of taking risks on their way to creating breakthrough executions that are rooted in a knowledge of what is trending, cultural trends, and brand insights. Somebody who knows the difference between traditional advertising and the industry’s future. The Creative Director is a creative powerhouse with the ability to lead a team, communicate clearly, is the link between the client and the creative team, and will devise a variety of creative ideas in our brand voice across platforms. What you’ll do:  Be a brand custodian - living and breathing NGF/TiNDLE ○  Embody NGF and TiNDLE - you are the voice of the brand ○  Assure a cohesive output while maintaining a high-quality standard ○  Passionate and mission-aligned to NGF/TiNDLE’s brand  Be a creative leader ○  Receive briefs from the client, distill them and share with the team ○  Assure timelines are being met ○  Works well with the team, ensuring that all members are able to work to their full potential.  Be a great brainstormer ○  Work closely with the creative team to craft multi-channel, social-first content and campaigns ○  Coordinate with internal teams and agency to create engaging content  Be the culture vulture ○  Has a finger on the pulse of social media and its different channels ○  Have an understanding of pop culture and the upcoming trends in design ○  Hyper aware of digital and cultural trends to capitalise on for the brand  Be a social media powerhouse ○  Owning the creative direction on our social media channels, websites, blogs ○  Facilitate the expansion into new social media channels (i.e. Twitter, YouTube, Tik Tok, etc.), building engaging and compelling content ○  Develop video series for the different channels ○  Contribute to craft digital campaign ideas with best-in-class creatives  Be a market expansion and partnership trailblazer ○  Developing and elevating trade marketing materials (i.e. sales leaflet, menu cards) ○  Overseeing packaging design and direction (but open to working with external agency) ○  Assist in the campaign development for future markets and initiatives ○  Developing creative concepts for partnerships, coming up with pitch/proposals that are innovative and provide value for both clients and their target audience What you need to have:  Ideally a minimum of 4-7 years of experience working as an all-around creative  Experience with various social networks and digital platforms for advertising and marketing purposes  A great leader - displays good judgment, maturity, and enthusiasm.  Proficient with social media and online content strategy  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Proven ability to meet deadlines, develop plans for the completion of projects and execute based on them  A go-getter attitude - not afraid to share ideas and not afraid to learn  A fresh thinker with creative ideas for content to help support client objectives while pushing the boundaries  Flexible and adaptive to meet changing needs or direction What we have:  A unique opportunity to join a dynamic start-up environment led by a visionary management team  Fast-paced learning curve for willing learners  Fun and energetic team  Excellent career progression development opportunities in a company expected to scale rapidly  Opportunities to influence and initiate strategic changes to the business
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Company & Team – “About Us”  Our country risk intelligence and macro-economic forecasting is used by senior executives within multinational corporations and governments to underpin critical strategic decisions. The IHS Markit Risk Intelligence offering specifically supports the work flow of persona’s focused on managing external risk – such as corporate security, compliance and risk management. For example, we deliver our Country Risk insights to inform strategic security decisions for corporate security teams, our integrated analysis of external risks informs enterprise wide risk management practices and informs risk mitigation processes.  We are uniquely placed in this space as we have one of the most developed Economics and Country risk research and consulting teams in the market and our lead analysts frequently brief Chief Security Officers and Chief Risk Officers across capital intensive industries and financial services.  Our Sales team in APAC works closely with the 300+ researchers, 30+ product management team and 40+ Consultants in the Economics and Country Risk group to add value to our customers’ strategic planning and risk management processes.  Duties And Responsibilities – “Your Role”  You will be a key member of the IHS Markit ECR Sales team in APAC and will drive new business sales into new and existing risk intelligence clients.  Key Responsibilities Include Meeting or exceeding monthly new business goals and driving new customer leads through cold approaches, social selling and coordinated campaign outreach Employing a solution-based sales methodology to best align Economics & Country Risk’s capabilities with prospect needs Providing timely and accurate insight to your pipeline leading to accurate forecasts Representing and promoting the company and business line to senior executives both internally and externally Developing a strong understanding of the value proposition for our offerings as it relates to the corporate security and risk management market Key Qualifications And Skills  Job Requirements – “About You” 5+ years of sales experience. This should include experience of working in a strategic account management role or a complex business development role. Proven track record of selling complex high-value solutions involving multiple stakeholders Experience of selling into Corporate accounts across sectors and/or Financial Services Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to tailor communications to risk persona Proven excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to build effective internal and external relationships Experience selling information services (research, data, consulting) Willingness to travel up to 25% in order to conduct face to face meetings or attend industry conferences (restrictions allowing) Bachelor’s degree minimum Desired: ability to speak a second language in addition to English Job Benefits – “What We Offer” Strong client base and broad product line On target commission plan with uncapped earnings potential Excellent team culture within core Sales team but also wider commercial and research groups Opportunity to work with world experts in the field Options to work from home Exposure to the wider IHS Markit community with options for onward movement over time Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. For more information on the many ways in which we enthusiastically support inclusion and diversity efforts for both candidates and employees, please access our Inclusion & Diversity Statement here .  We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with IHS Markit and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please contact or call +1 212 849 0399. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are considered on a case-by-case basis. This contact information (email and phone) is intended for application assistance and accommodation requests only. We are unable to accept resumes or provide information about application status through the phone number or email address above. Resumes are only accepted through the online application process, and only qualified candidates will receive consideration and follow-up.  IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.  For Information Please Click On The Following Links  IHS Markit Business Code of Conduct  Right to Work  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Pay Transparency  Current Colleagues  If you are currently employed by IHS Markit, please apply internally via the Workday internal careers site.

description: Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.  Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.  Reporting to our Regional Head of Risk you would be responsible for handling overall compliance aspects for Singapore, while also providing support for government relations in Singapore along with regional initiatives. As you grow with Xendit, responsibilities may include further regional perspectives.  Mission  Help us be the fintech start-up of choice that puts forward innovation while ensuring our services are well protected and secure for our clients and their users.  Outcomes Work as part of the Regional Compliance team to ensure that Xendit Singapore complies with all regulatory compliance requirements Responsible for all compliance policies, frameworks and procedures for Singapore, along with reporting requirements Work closely with product managers and sales in order to ensure new product opportunities are identified and considered from a compliance perspective Chair of the compliance committee for Singapore Responsible for handling and managing licensing opportunities Take a lead role representing compliance in projects for product development or potential business strategy opportunities Provide Compliance dashboards and portfolio management overviews by assessing and formulating data into visualisation for senior management review  You may be a good fit if You have 5+ years of relevant Compliance experience within payments, banking or other relevant industry sectors You have experience working with Singapore regulators and insights surrounding relevant regulations You have experience in a fast moving startup or business environment where you are able to balance across compliance/risk and growth You're comfortable with ambiguity and a very quickly changing environment You're great at collaborating and communicating across a company with engineering, operations, risk / legal, government relations, marketing, and sales You have demonstrated abilities to manage and provide project roadmaps along with strong presentation skills. You have a keen interest across risk management, compliance, and products You thrive on autonomy and have proven you can push towards a goal by yourself  It would be amazing if you also have Experience working in the payment industry Experience working with MAS Experience putting into place policies and procedures for a compliance function Business degree, compliance related qualifications or its equivalent in experience You've had experience in fast growing companies  What We Care About Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule. You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.

jobTitle: Director I, GRM Product - East Economics
description: This is a brand-new role providing the opportunity to build out economics capabilities for the organisation. This role will focus on assessing profitability of the individual and group A&H markets, envisioning and creating metrics to evaluate markets consistently and conducting complex analysis to identify pricing/underwriting opportunities to support profitable growth. As part of this role, responsibilities will include assessing profitability and growth of the individual and group A&H products across the region, partnering with global and local teams on various A&H product initiatives, monitoring and evaluating large product initiatives, forecasting our ability to earn target returns, recommending and driving course corrective strategies when necessary, and partnering with markets and global teams to evaluate Product planning inputs and improving overall confidence in our plan. The role will be expected to build significant knowledge of A&H products across Liberty Mutual’s Asia portfolio and establish strong relationships with members of the in-country product team.  Responsibilities Analyze current pricing to determine rate adequacy on all major A&H lines of business Identify opportunities to advance pricing sophistication of product lines, proactively advocate for these changes and gather buy-in from local and global leaders Establish profitability and growth metrics that are consistent across the region, perform regular reviews and present findings and recommendations to local and global product leaders Partner cross-functionally to support development of end-to-end pricing of new products, including pricing research, competitive analysis, etc. Develop operational forecast capabilities and work with leadership to drive favorable P&L results Influence country market product strategy through recommendations driven by analytics Collaborate with decision makers and subject matter experts to identify and develop targeted actions to improve performance Build strong relationships and lead frequent two-way communication with in-country product team members and functional subject matter experts Continually improve process to support increased efficiency and effectiveness Qualifications Proven math and analytical skills, as normally acquired through the pursuit of a bachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Actuarial Science, or related field. Fellowship in Casualty Actuarial Society or Society of Actuaries highly desirable Strong understanding of insurance concepts, actuarial techniques and standards, as well as other business operations including financial, underwriting, legal, statistics, claims, sales, etc. Strong communication skills, particularly the ability to communicate highly analytical and complex concepts to a broad audience Excellent analytic, quantitative, and problem solving skills with proven ability to influence leaders across the organization Strong knowledge of product offerings, business processes, product line systems, underwriting rules, pricing plans, and databases Ability to travel 15%
industries: Information Technology and Services, Insurance, and Financial Services

description: The Company  Global Software MNC and a key leader in its industry, keen to hire a driven, hands-on and resilient talent with strong influencing skills to oversee a regional Project Controlling portfolio.  The Role  Expectations Of a Successful Profile Chartered Accountant, Accountancy graduate from NTU/ NUS/ SMU or equivalent MUST: Project controlling experience, familiarity with percentage of completion revenue recognition, project accounting MNC experience within IT/ Software or related industry can be helpful Required: Good communication and stakeholder engagement skills, strong influencing skills, hands-on, able to challenge status quo, handle difficult conversations, logical, proactive, thrives in a fast-paced & less structured environment Budget: $9,500 - $10,000 x 12 months + Variable Bonus  Reporting to the Regional Head of Finance, you will be responsible for all financial management and controlling aspects of projects, such as managing project revenue and expenses, preparing project budgets and forecasts, review project margins and resource planning, cash inflow management, preparing monthly regional scorecard and presentation; as well as working closely with Project Managers, Sales and Client Engagement teams to drive project profitability, revenue and cost forecasting, cost estimation and participate in regional project review meetings.  You should possess a good understanding of the business and project requirements, and has the ability to deliver operating plans and business partner closely with various stakeholders (including working closely with and guiding an offsite shared services team).  Apply Today  Please send your resume, in WORD format only and quote reference number GH11947073, by clicking the apply button. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted. description: Job Function  Cloud & Software Services  Why SoftwareONE?  For over 30 years SoftwareONE has been the foundation for organizations around the world for their technology solutions. With changes in the market from on-premises to cloud we have always been one step ahead. Underpinning our transitions and evolutions are our seven core values which we expect from all our current employees and look for in our future colleagues. The global nature of our organization allows us to adapt and commit to these values unique to the culture and business needs of each location.  The role Support with the generation of leads Creates external content like blog-articles from time to time (several times per year) Knows how to conduct and advertise appealing webinars. Advanced features such as video and digital whiteboard Is used to speaking freely in front of large groups Leads account planning workshops with various specialists and combines the respective findings into a strategy; ensures the subsequent execution of the strategy  Solutions Development Can anticipate the requirements in a conversation (e.g., on the phone) and directly calculate a rough order of magnitude (ROM) and a very rough business case Leads complex workshops with board-level participation Can create a tailor-made solution for the customer in terms of pricing and scope of services, consisting of standardized and individual modules. Knows not only the challenges of customers but also their markets; uses this knowledge to give customers new insights  Calculation Of Business Cases Divides a solution into parts; estimates the best case and worst-case incl. underlying assumptions; discusses the result with the customer, which results in a realistic estimate for both sides Can present and monetarily quantify the value (e.g., cost-saving or risk minimization) of the solution for customers and incorporates this into an ROI calculation Understands the impact of service and contract types on revenue and profits; uses this knowledge early in the sales process to shape the solution accordingly Negotiates milestones and related payments. Uses professional presentations, but can also use ad-hoc visualizations with analog/digital whiteboard to respond to the situation  Management & Leadership Can explain well and transfer his knowledge to others Is familiar with the most important economic terms and procedures Implements innovative ideas independently and goes above and beyond Can empathize with others and thus solve conflicts. Can sort tasks by importance and urgency  What We Need To See From You  Cross Subject Matter Expertise: Can collect customer requirements for a Compute solution and take over the first qualification of the opportunity Can collect customer requirements for a Future Workplace solution and take over the first qualification of the opportunity Can collect customer requirements for a Software Lifecycle Management solution and take over the first qualification of the opportunity Can explain the business impact of out-tasking; designs individual managed services in coordination with the delivery, but without on-site presales support of the service delivery; can define a complex operational model Gather customer requirements and propose a suitable solution from the SoftwareONE Portfolio that addresses customer challenges and qualify the opportunity  Subject Matter Expertise Cloud-App Executes the ideation process (including functional requirements or user stories) with business areas or IT of the clients using multiple methodologies. Describes architectures, business models and medium complex solutions. Defines a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) and a sprint backlog Has already participated in similar projects and is recognized in the market as an industry best practices leader Can apply practices according to the project needs. Can define the best methods to be applied and propose a high-level project plan for complex and significant projects based on the Priorities on the business roadmap Data Scientist / Senior Data Architect with proven experience Understands and can talk about SQL/NoSql Databases and specialized languages as PL-SQL, SQL, R, Python. Has knowledge in SCRUM Practice, Design Thinking and Data Visualization Certifications MS DP-200/201 Data Engineer MS DA-100 Data Analyst OR MS DP-100 Data Scientist MS AI-100 AI Engineer OR AWS Data Analytics AWS Machine Learning PLUS CRISP-DM MS-900 M365 Fundamentals ITIL v4 Foundation  What You Should Really Know About Us.  Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful. Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. Our culture is unique, and I believe that having the right people, and empowering them to succeed, is the absolute key to our success. Patrick Winter, Founder.  What We Expect From Our Employees  Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics. Our leaders operate with a high levels of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy.  “SoftwareONE is an equal opportunity employer. With employee satisfaction as one of our core values, we are passionate about diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our employees. We want every employee to have the greatest experience of their career.”
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About Supernova We are the fastest growing lifestyle & beauty omni-channel ecommerce company. We build iconic beauty and lifestyle brands for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach, we connect with over 15 million women on social media every week. Headquartered in Singapore, we currently have offices in Melbourne and LA. Our brands include Sand & Sky and Coco & Eve. About Supernova’s Internal Engine Together we create Superstars! Our three company pillars are guided by this motto: Our product and brands are of the highest quality and within the top five in their category; our customers are the focus of our actions and their lives improve with our products; our talent and employees grow and develop within Supernova.This means that investing in hiring, developing and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Living our core values of #MakeAnImpact, #TalkAboutIt, #SeekNewOpportunities, #DelightAndSurprise and #MoveForwardTogether creates a unique culture across five different time zones and allows us to realise the enormous potential of this exciting industry. If you’re an ambitious, smart, natural collaborator who likes taking risks, influencing, and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team. About Coco & Eve Coco & Eve is a Balinese inspired beauty brand that makes products for incredible good hair and skin. Our 100% vegan formulas are infused with the best tropical natural ingredients & potent skin actives with no nasties! Multi-award winning and a beauty editors favourite we’ve spent years testing, developing and perfecting our formulas to create products that give instant, amazing results.  In just 3 years we have grown our cult brand into a market leader in over 50 countries around the world. An exciting future lies ahead as we begin to expand our unique product offerings and begin to grow our digital and retail impact. About the Job We are on the hunt for a superstar design lead to take our brand to the next level! You will be the creative heart of Coco & Eve working with an exciting, positive team with big ambitions and a wide network of content creators based all over the world! You will bring energy, ideas and the ability to bring them to life in a hands-on, fast-paced role, working with the Head of Brand to create cut-through content & a stand out look & feel. You must be equally hands-on & strategic with the ability to conceptualise and execute ideas from scratch to completion. We are looking for someone who can constantly stay relevant (remaining up to date with what's new in beauty, the creative industry & pop culture) & translate that into newness for all creatives. The ideal candidate will be able to collaborate seamlessly with external international content creators/freelancers whilst nurturing & growing an in-house team of designers & creative experts. The role will report to the Coco & Eve Co Head of Brand. Creative photoshoot/ video concepts, art direction, production and delivery. Development of content including; social media ads, emails, web banners. New product range design. Development of retail design strategy (Instore POS etc.) Development of new ideas for brand activation projects that create authentic audience engagement across multiple channels and brand touch-points. Collaborate on gifts & accessories concepts and designs. Develop creative for seasonal and limited products. Collaborate with the marketing team to create new strategies and ideas for social media marketing, EDM, video and website creative Ability to handle cameras & studio equipment (video & photo) for in-house content creation. Conceptualise campaigns to drive sales, exposure, virality. Software skills required: After effects Motion Graphics, Video Editing, Audio Editing, Colour correction. Photoshop Image retouching (product & model), EDM creation, GIFs, web design. (no coding) Illustrator Infographics, print collateral & artworking. About You A forward-thinking creative with a passion for new ideas and real results. You will be driven by the desire to see big ideas become big realities. A hands-on team player that can dive in to new challenges. You have an eye for aesthetics and clean, fresh design. You must also be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and work effectively in both collaborative and autonomous settings. At least 5 years experience as a professional designer / creative. Passionate about beauty innovation and design. Experience in a deadline-driven environment. Job Description:  The Security Services Director - APJ will provide leadership and guidance to the APJ Security Services team in support of CyberArk's enterprise security software sales business. In this role, the role will be managing a team of security services engineers & consultants across Asia Pacific Japan. The Director will manage a variety of tasks within the professional services sales cycle to ensure the successful delivery of the customers objectives and provide best practice and consulting services guidance.  This role will report to the VP, Security Services and work closely with the APJ sales, channels and solutions engineers team. (Lead by example) Manage Service Delivery Process & Escalations Proactively seek out new security services opportunities within prospective accounts and current active customer. Demonstrated ability to motivate teams to deliver exceptional results and ability to achieve results through others is critical Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills to all roles, ranging from IT to C-Level executives Drive for action plans, ownership and results MIS/Computer Science Degree or equivalent experience Ability to multi-task and to work in a dynamic, fast-changing entrepreneurial environment A smart, bold but humble attitude to work collaboratively with CyberArkers across the organization

description: We are seeking a driven, innovative product manager & product owner to join our team in Electrical & Industrial Solutions Group Center of Excellence (EISG COE). This individual would drive product and solution leadership in all phases of business creation. The purpose being to accelerate customer workflows and outcomes through Intelligent Automation (IA) that holistically combines physical, communication and user experience test. You and the IA team will quickly deliver customer solutions and leverage those experiences towards architecting business models and software platforms and frameworks to support scalable development of enterprise workflow solutions. As such, you must be a proven product manager with experience influencing teams and leadership to drive to successful outcomes.  You will work closely with a broad network of Keysight & Eggplant leadership, strategic planners, and directly with customers to understand key challenges and lead productization of concepts and solutions. As a product owner you’ll also be responsible for both product planning and product commercialization. This includes managing the product throughout the product lifecycle, gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, and working closely with software engineering, to deliver winning products. It also includes working with sales, marketing, and support to ensure revenue and customer experience goals are met.
