jobTitle: Controls and Supervision Manager Asia SVP
description: An effective risk, supervision, control and governance framework is critical to the continuing existence and success of the Global Rates & Currencies franchise. The topic has undergone a period of significant and rapid change as global regulators looked to strengthen policy standards and expectations as a result of various issues highlighted in the industry.  In view of heightened expectations from regulators and to ensure a strong & consistent global control environment across the Rates & Currencies business, this is a regional role, and the candidate will work to maintain, define and implement changes to the risk, control and supervisory processes and procedures so that they are consistently robust. The candidate will help drive the direction and growth of our efforts in a manner that is consistent with the evolving landscape. This role requires close cooperation with Control and Supervision Managers in other regions, with X-Markets Risk & Controls, especially regarding Conduct Risk, Governance and Controls, Trading Risk and Transaction & Processing Risk teams.  To work as part of In-Business Risk and Supervision within the Rates and Currencies business, with a primary focus on enhancing and maintaining a strong risk, supervision, control and governance framework for the Rates & Currencies business, with a focus on the Asia region.  This role requires extensive liaison with multiple functions within the business and support functions at all levels, including Rates and Currencies product CAOs and Business Management, Trading, Sales, X-Markets Risk & Controls, Technology, Compliance and Risk, in both the region and globally.  This position directly reports to the Global Head of In-Business Controls and Supervision for Rates & Currencies, with a matrix reporting line to the APAC Regional Rates & Currencies CAO.  Responsibilities Supporting risk, controls and supervision framework for Rates and Currencies across the APAC region, including but not limited to the conduct risk management framework in the business. Support the Business Risk & Control Forums to oversee all aspects of safety and soundness for the business. Support the Business Heads and Business Unit Management with the continuous evolvement of the control framework, to deliver new control initiatives. Support Compliance with development and enhancement of applicable policies and training. Work with the Business Supervisors, Technology & Control partners to efficiently build target state controls, system alerts, and re-engineer processes to ensure effective and best in class controls ensuring consistency in application between all regions and countries. Support evolving the control framework, and assist with delivery of solutions to sufficiently mitigate existing and new emerging risks. Interact with X-Markets Risk & Controls, Compliance, Internal Audit and other control functions to drive forward control enhancement initiatives and investigate control failures. Participate as required in ad-hoc reviews and regulatory / supervisory examinations of the wider Rates and Currencies business. Qualifications The candidate will require extensive experience within a markets business and have an acute understanding of the key controls issues and possible areas of ethical conflicts in order to effectively address these. Subject matter expertise in products, markets, trading systems & controls, preferably in Rates & Currencies. Solid working knowledge of end to end product flows of R&C asset classes. Minimum of 5 years of experience in financial markets including at least 3 years either in the business or business support or control functions. Excellent communications skills (written / verbal) at all organizational levels. Results/task orientated with excellent attention to detail. Ability to manage and prioritize effectively and resolve conflicting priorities. Ability to work well as part of a team and autonomously. High level of computer literacy. Education Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree Job Family Group  Risk Management  Job Family  Business Risk & Controls  Time Type  Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.  Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi . description: Looking to take your SEO and Digital Marketing career to a whole new level? This role is for you!  First Page Digital is looking for a technically astute and confident Associate SEO Director who loves to drive unprecedented traffic and money keywords rankings for our clients. We're looking for someone who self-driven and who loves to work with inspired (and inspiring) teams. First Page Digital prides itself on being a leader, not only in Singapore but also throughout Australasia in the field of digital marketing. We've won numerous rewards because we love what we do! Passion breeds success!  With offices in Australia, Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Dubai and now Brazil and Panama, you'll be joining a company that rewards success and strives to be the best in the industry. We provide a strong entrepreneurial environment, which has seen the organization ranked #1 fastest growing digital group in Australia 3 years straight.  Rewards You Deserve Generous remuneration & medical with dental and class pass corporate membership (Salary will commensurate with qualification and experience) Collaborate with a strong, dynamic team. Working side by side talented individuals. Always new and exciting projects. Fun company that’s on the move! What You'll Be Doing Support the SEO Technical Director and inhouse team of 14 SEO Specialists to execute SEO strategies, implementations and update on the project planning to ensure smooth workflow Be on the cutting edge of SEO, finding new strategies to implement on our clients to drive their organic traffic Developing and implementing effective SEO strategies for the improvement of organic traffic and search ranking and the maximization of ROI SEO pitching together with Enterprise Strategy team to bring in more new and exciting projects Well versed in preparing SEO reports on a fortnightly and monthly basis to be shared with client and identifying areas for improvement Use a variety of tools, competitive research and other methods to discover optimal keyword targets appropriate to the business needs of the client Oversee SEO campaigns which encompass Technical Auditing and Onsite Implementation, Link Outreach and Content development Work with a team of SEO Techs, Content Writers, Campaign Managers, Paid Media and Sales team Format reports and provide top-line insights for on-going performance reviews Able to demonstrate understanding of how duplicate content and page load speed affects SEO by advising clients on best practices for successful implementation and improvement Have the ability to audit prospects & existing clients organic performance. Everything from a backlink profile to analyzing server logs Demonstrate a hunger to stay abreast of the latest industry developments, and factor these into your day to day work. Understand metrics and KPIs and continually suggest optimizations to improve performance Apply, and be able to explain, SEO best practices for site navigation, breadcrumbing, internal links (including anchor text optimization), and HTML sitemaps to client websites Apply, and be able to explain, SEO best practices for domain, sub-domain and directory structure to client websites Have the ability to talk tech with developers, but also layman to the layman Monitor clients sites regularly for crawling and indexing issues. Issues identified will be surfaced to the respective Campaign Manager and Technical Director, documented for client communication/follow-up Use a variety of tools, competitive research and other methods to discover quality potential outreach linkbuilding opportunities What We Need Minimum of 8 years relevant, hands-on SEO experience – not just creating documentation for developers to implement Experience using SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, SEMRush, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, SEO related excel/Google sheets functions Experience working with web developers internally & externally You have the ability to implement onsite SEO on most CMS types & static websites, along with familiarity with cloud hosting environments You have a proven track record of organic success. When asked about a website you’ve worked on, you can walk someone through exactly how you did so Able to produce high quality work within a fast paced, dynamic environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Has a strong familiarity with the web development process, including the important points at which SEO must be considered Experienced with international SEO. At a level where you can sculpt a website’s international SEO strategy from scratch Develops knowledge of client’s business, competition and latest industry news and trends Effective time management skills with an ability to multitask and prioritize Strong attention to detail Ability to present and communicate ideas in a coherent and effective manner. Always focussing on driving organic traffic Prior experience in a media agency preferred A ‘Can Do’ attitude Why Us  We want Singapore’s top talent and recognise that means paying them accordingly. Our newly transformed office is a great space to inspire creativity, as well as being close to cafes and public transport. You'll be amongst a highly engaged team of the country's most talented digital marketers and growth experts, with solid prospects for upward mobility.  Please attach your CV and we'll be in touch for a confidential chat.  Let's do great things together!

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Director, Cyber and Intelligence Solutions - Risk Recon  Job Overview: Develops product strategies and roadmaps to execute to ensure maximum penetration of market segments. Manages and maintains existing product lines on an on-going basis, including partner management. Conducts opportunity assessments on new ideas and concepts. Provides design specifications for product enhancements to Product Development. Defines business and technical requirements, and manages the relationships of technical resources and the Global Technology Organization to maintain and build out platforms. Major Accountabilities: Identify strategic business-building opportunities in products and services that can be offered, developed and implemented to customers Responsible for idea generation; concept validation; and business case development for existing products Apply market research and conduct opportunity assessments on new ideas and concepts and communicate them to Product Development Develop strategy and possible enhancements of product offerings in coordination with Product Development, customers and third parties Develop and implement programs and initiatives using the Go-To-Market process to increase card issuance in both established and emerging markets Oversee the planning, development and design of product marketing strategy from product decision through end of life cycle Build relationships with product groups to garner feedback for development of MasterCard products Oversee the execution of advertising; promotional; and sales programs to meet unit objectives Work with regional/line staff to ensure maximum penetration of market segments. Engage and actively participate during the annual cross-functional alignment meetings in support of annual objective setting and planning cycle Develop and manage relevant budget planning, forecasts, accruals Collaborate with regional and local sales resources in support of product life cycle requirements Education: Bachelor’s degree in business or equivalent work experience. Some advanced education desirable Knowledge / Experience: 8 years extensive experience in product management, product development, product marketing, or business development in financial services and/or bankcard industry preferred. Three to five years of management experience desirable Extensive knowledge of product management principles and product development lifecycle Skills/ Abilities: Ability to interact and coordinate effectively with internal and external business partners Ability to effectively manage multiple functions Ability to manage budgets or financial results Business Acumen with the ability to provide solutions that drive positive results to the customer and MasterCard Self motivated with a proven track record of delivering success while operating within a team environment Work Conditions: Some travel required General office environment  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. jobTitle: Head of Environment Health and Safety APAC, Work Dynamics
description: Head of Environment Health and Safety, Work Dynamics  Asia Pacific - Multiple locations  What This Job Involves  This role reports directly to the Work Dynamics Global HSSE Lead, with regular reporting to the Regional CS Leadership Team and will have accountability for implementation of the global Work Dynamics HSSE program across all APAC Work Dynamics operations  The Regional Work Dynamics HSSE Lead (APAC) will work closely with the regional leaders of our Operations, Accounts HR, Legal, Supply Chain, Sustainability, Technology, Finance, Risk, Audit, Sales and Marketing functions.  Performance Implement global initiatives and JLL’s corporate global HSSE strategy across the APAC Work Dynamics business Oversee APAC operational execution to minimize HSSE risks, injuries, and environmental impacts. Report HSSE performance measurement set by the Work Dynamics Global HSSE Lead – monitoring KPIs and strategic indicators. Ensure that the chosen JLL HSSE Technology in embedded across the APAC Work Dynamics business to ensure consistent delivery systems. Leadership Foster a Culture of Safety by providing effective HSSE technical leadership and communications and achieving regulatory compliance. Lead and develop the APAC regional HSSE professionals, working closely with regional account and operational leadership. Engage and support with key regional Client relationships. Support business growth by representing JLL HSSE in regional business development pursuits. Coach APAC HSSE professionals to grow the knowledge of the team and create clear structure with defined progression. Engage in APAC regional in industry forums and other represent JLL to relevant external audiences. A strong team player with the ability to be flexible in their approach and ensure that regional HSSE teams are aligned to the global HSSE strategy and requirements Standards Oversee the implementation and maintenance of global operational controls, (i.e., process, standards, procedures, and guidelines) to ensure compliance with national legal requirements HSSE obligations and JLL’s HSSE aspirations. Drive the development of best practice HSSE training programs and resources. Implement the JLL Global operating protocols for the safety performance of JLL’s APAC region contractors and supply chain vendors. Monitor regional legal requirements and ensure JLL are meeting regional HSSE statutory responsibilities and best practices to secure regulatory compliance. Oversee the successful management of relevant regional ISO certifications for the HSSE program, while supporting growth strategies related to relevant ISO standards and/or national and industry standards. Implement the JLL global HSSE assurance programme across the APAC regional Work Dynamics functions and accounts to demonstrate compliance with JLL global HSSE standards. Communication and Reporting Performance reporting to the Global HSSE Lead, APAC Business COO and APAC Work Dynamics Leadership Team. Deliver for APAC wide safety communications, events and campaigns for the APAC region in close cooperation with the wider regional APAC Operations functional leads. Ensure effective escalation and management of HSSE accident and incident reporting within APAC, and ensure lessons learned are cascaded to minimize future risk. Promote HSSE successes across the APAC JLL businesses and wider industry forums. Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.  Sound like you? To apply you need to be-  Our Ideal candidate will have- Personal passion for and commitment to HSSE excellence. Extensive relevant senior HSSE regional experience in one or more industry sectors where HSSE is recognized as a critical operational function. Real Estate services experience is desirable but not essential. Experience implementing "Best Practice" approaches in HSSE across multi-country, multi-service businesses. First-hand knowledge of delivering HSSE performance improvement in emerging and developing markets will be particularly valuable. Deep understanding of the HSSE regulatory environment in major markets in APAC. Experience of implementing HSSE technology platforms and data management tools across multiple markets. Experience of client relationship management – meeting the needs and expectations of current and prospective clients who are among the largest, most complex and demanding organizations in the world. An agile approach to leadership and stakeholder management – able to operate effectively in a matrix structure. A strong orientation to goals and measurable results. An excellent understanding of how to use data and analytics to demonstrate and drive continual improvement. Effective communication skills to appropriately coach and educate the business on HSSE across all levels of the organization. Strong cultural awareness- unwavering ethical standards; drives excellence and innately collaborative. Understands how to be effective operating across geographies and cultures. Experience of supporting emergency response and disaster management at a regional level. Professional qualifications and memberships appropriate for the region. What We Can Do For You-  At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realise your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.  Apply today!  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at AccomodationRequest@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

description: Your role  Are you a seasoned solution marketer? Do you enjoy using your skills and experience to drive change and increase revenue?  We're looking for a customer-centric Financial Services Solutions Marketing Director for our APAC region to help develop and lead the GTM strategy and execution for IHS Markit's Financial Services portfolio of solutions, which span five key areas; 'data & analytics', 'post trade processing', 'risk, compliance and reporting', 'financial technology solutions' and 'economic & country risk'.  Key Responsibilities Working with key stakeholders across the Financial Services division and marketing & communications team, and using market research, customer feedback and sales priorities, you will develop compelling and content rich value propositions by target audience which will drive the GTM strategy for marketing communications into target segments Implement, plan, develop and measure integrated global marketing programs to align with the 'Buyers Journey', including awareness, PR, inbound and outbound demand generation, pipeline building, sales acceleration and localization Help grow and implement new digital inbound marketing strategies to help drive further demand from online activity Develop global sales enablement assets and implement training strategies to instruct sales on understanding target audiences, value propositions, buyer preferences, needs, and challenges Build and maintain key relationships with multiple internal stakeholders, including: Financial Services leadership, Sales, Product Management and other worldwide and/or regional/local teams to define and implement GTM strategies with emphasis on the customer Define target Return on Marketing Investment (ROMI) and track progress against those targets Build awareness and generate qualified, sales-ready leads; partner with Sales to drive conversion of leads to pipeline opportunities and closed deals. Evolve strategic alliance partner marketing relationships to increase visibility and drive end user demand for IHS Markit data/solutions via 3rd party platforms. Provide leadership and support for the design, development and implementation of marketing programs; direct marketing activities, including marketing strategy development, planning, creative design and execution, and media buying. Help shape an effective, results- and metrics-oriented marketing organization; work with internal resources, including sales and product management organizations to develop professional marketing communications Manage timelines, budgets, resources, and staff and maintain effective communications and relationships with internal and external partners. Support executive stakeholders on corporate communications and public relations - in collaboration with the Internal Comms and Media Relations teams. Your team  You will be working in the Global Marketing and Communications team and work closely with the APAC Financial Services team.  Your expertise  You have Proven marketing experience (ideally 10+ years) A strong solutions marketing or strategy related background. Extensive experience within the financial services industry or a financial technology related vendor or a consulting firm with financial services/technology related expertise. Prior management experience and proven leadership competencies with the ability to mobilize, motivate and inspire employees and retain talent is valuable. Digital inbound marketing skills covering a wide range of online channels You are Highly collaborative Able to achieve goals through influencing, partnering and developing productive relationships with senior leaders internally and with 3rd party partners and influencers externally. A strong leader who has experience of managing team members across global locations and time zones Flexible Working  We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.  Return to Work  Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting a Director, Forensic Accounting to join our team in Singapore.  About Aon  Headquartered in London, Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.  The Opportunity  In this Director, Forensic Accounting position you will be a key member of the Asia Pacific (APAC) team, focusing on the delivery of claims preparation and business interruption reviews across the Asia region, developing new business opportunities and nurturing existing client relationships.  Responsibilities: Take responsibility for the management of engagements, including the scoping of work, preparation of budgets, resourcing and the execution of engagements within budget Take responsibility for the delivery of all elements of the project plan/engagement Delegate work effectively across the APAC team Lead client market development through high-level relationship building, market shaping, proposal development, whitepapers, and presentations Communicate in a collaborative and client focused manner including drafting client presentations and reports Support the development and implementation of business development initiatives Develop internal and external networks and leverage such networks to secure new engagements Assist broader business development activity across Aon, including participating in key new business pitches Requirements: At least 10 years of experience with a professional service or Loss Adjusting firm Ability to develop and maintain relationships with existing and prospective clients Proficiency in preparation of proposals and presentations to prospects Deep expertise in the preparation of large and complex property and business interruption claims Proven track record in developing new business and staff Strong communication and presentation skills Proficient and confident in public speaking to conduct presentations of analytical results, sales presentations and also speaking at conferences An ability to work towards and contribute to revenue earning to meet annual budgets How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.  2493567

description: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  The Role Responsibilities  Work with the Region Head of Sustainable Finance to drive origination, develop strong client relationships.  The individual will need to be able to identify SF transactions, be a centre of excellence understanding financing structures and industry trends. The candidate will further have to support the regional head develop and roll out regional and global strategic initiatives  Our Sustainable Finance team serves as a centre of expertise on a broad set of ESG topics, providing thought leadership, strategic advice and transaction support for SCB's clients. The group sits within the Commercial, Corporate and Institutional Bank and works with sales and coverage teams to identify and deliver on ESG-related advisory and product opportunities.  The Role described below is for an experienced and self-driven individual who will be responsible for the regional business growth and development.  Strategy Work on the development and implementation of client strategies for Sustainable Finance products Work closely with the Regional Head of Sustainable Finance to develop and execute a plan that would make SC the Bank best known for Sustainable Finance by our clients and other stakeholders. Works closely with the wider SF team, coverage and product leaders to develop and understanding of the competitive landscape and identify prospective partners who can address customer needs and accelerate growth Work closely with group corporate affairs to build a regional internal / external stake strategy promoting sustainability. Ensuring a consistent messaging to the internally and to the wider market Business Drive new sustainable finance transactions and origination across all products, loans, bonds, trade derivatives and deposits Have a good understanding of the client base and proactively build pipeline, identifying core industries Be able to work with relationship teams to develop client transition plans that encourage decarbonisation Proactively keeping abreast of regional global, and industry developments, assess implications and align and develop Bank relevant initiatives across businesses in response to regulatory and industry development in sustainable finance ESG rating and benchmarking analysis for corporates Developing Sector thematic that describe sustainable finance structure alternatives Develop opportunities through attendance at key Industry events as necessary. Processes Proactively manage the designated Sustainable Finance client and product portfolio to ensure, risks are appropriately identified and managed. Maintain Close ties exist with key stakeholders e.g. Financial Markets, Transaction Banking, Corporate Finance, Risk, Country CEOs, Service Delivery, etc. People and Talent Training and capacity building of the regional origination, and risk teams Risk Management Build and maintain an understand on environmental and social risks across industry classes Safeguard the bank against reputation risk damage but proactively developing sustainable finance structures that are in line with global industry best practices Encourage good and proactive management environmental, social, regulatory, reputational and ethical risks governance across by all areas of the business Take the initiative regarding regulatory, reputational and ethical matters, taking the initiative for providing proactive advice to clients. Governance Ensure compliance with the sustainable finance governance structure and environmental and social risk management policies. Challenge improvement of these Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Adhere to local and international regulator prescribed responsibilities and policies. Key Stakeholders Regional management, product, and client teams Global and regional heads of Sustainable Finance Global Head of Environmental Social Risk Management Global Sustainable Finance Team CCIB, GB, FM, TB, CF External: The Bank's customers, competitors, regulators, investors and partners  Our Ideal Candidate Degree (BA or equivalent) 10 years plus Origination banking experience Knowledge and experience across multiple products Knowledge of environmental and socials risks and ESRM policies of the bank Ability to promote good teamwork, collaboration and management of conflict across stakeholders Ability to independently drive initiatives with minimum hands-on supervision Client focused with ability to establish and leveraging high impact relationships and presenting creative solutions Strong communication skills and stakeholder management skills Delivery and execution focused Ability to work with lots of moving parts and complexity Highly skilled in creation of briefing materials, report writing and preparation of presentations Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

description: Join Affinidi and be part of the future of identity: secure, portable and controlled by the individual.  Affinidi empowers individuals and organisations with ownership and control of their verifiable data, to unlock value across borders and platforms.  Leveraging on the building blocks that Affinidi provides, trusted institutions and entities can issue verifiable credentials to customers, which can in turn be shared with other applications to access services in an open and interoperable ecosystem.  Currently undergoing development are three applications that leverage Affinidi's technology: Safe Travel initiative, a digital medical credentials ecosystem to safely open up international air travel; Trustana, a curated B2B marketplace and trade platform connecting verifiable, international partners for seamless cross-border trade; and Good Worker, an online job matching platform for seasonal workers and employers in India.  Affinidi, along with the applications Trustana and Good Worker, are seeded by Temasek, a global investment company headquartered in Singapore.  We are building a motivated and entrepreneurial team who is passionate about identity, decentralization and technology to make this happen.  The role:  The Director of Product Design will have a seat at the product leadership strategy table and will report to Affinidi's senior product leader. You will be responsible for the processes across a complex set of stakeholders, products, and shared experiences, particularly in development of the vision and strategy for Product Design at Affinidi, building upon existing design systems and brand guidelines. You will collaborate with leadership and the marketing creative director to establish an industry-leading experience across the entire student and customer journey. You will also partner with the product leaders to develop the strategy for our new product research team.  Ideally, you will work closely with leadership across Product, Content, Engineering, and partner teams to deliver complete user experiences for all of Affinidi's products in order to improve the lives of Data owners and the outcomes of our Enterprise and Government customers. Additionally, you will lead and build a growing team of experienced product designers and define how product design operates at Affinidi.  What You Will Do Collaborate with Product leadership and contribute to product strategy and roadmaps to help us achieve our company vision and outcomes. Define how product design operates at Affinidi, including user research practices, ideation processes, strategy, interaction design, prototyping, success measurement & analytics, and visual design. Work cross-functionally with leaders in product management, engineering, marketing, services operations, customer success, and business development. Recruit, hire, and lead an excellent team of product designers to execute our product vision and strategy.  Responsibilities Manage and mentor our product designers, and one marketing designer. Foster their growth through development planning, performance management, collaborative work, and real-time design feedback and coaching Oversee the design team's efforts across all product initiatives, partnering with product counterparts to ensure strong execution from concept through launch and beyond Partner with Product Leadership to inform the product roadmap, strategy, and vision Identify appropriate methods for measuring design team effectiveness, and drive continuous improvement in team performance and design quality Manage our product design roadmap, project planning and task prioritization Recruit and onboard new designers over time as the business grows  Experience 4+ years of experience as a Design leader, and ideally several more years in a mentorship capacity 10+ years of progressive experience in UX and product design, with a focus on web and/or mobile products A mix of high-growth Consumer and high-touch Enterprise experience is preferred, since you will design for both audiences and more at Affinidi Experience applying user research methodologies and product data/analytics to inform design decisions, including partnering with Research for data-driven persona creation and quantitative research projects An inspiring portfolio that demonstrates experience managing design processes, leading design projects, crafting design systems, working through complex user flows, and shipping products that are functional, intuitive and visually compelling You can effectively partner with individuals from other parts of the company, such as Marketing Creative, Product Management, Engineering, Customer Success, Support, Sales, and Operations, leading major cross-functional initiatives Proven ability to identify and execute on opportunities for team improvement over time Meaningful experience working closely with executive teams in presenting design vision and strategy, systems, and recommending product or creative strategies Knowledge of associated practices, including UX writing, User Research, Motion, UX, and accessibility standards  Bonus Working knowledge of some industry design tools - e.g. Figma, Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop, Principle, Framer, and any other tools needed to get the job done Experience with motivation and habit-driving applications, since skills training is challenging and requires motivation, habits, and grit  Equal Opportunity Statement  Affinidi embraces diversity in all of its forms and fosters an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us.  We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

description: The Internal QM Controller ensures that organizational processes – and the goods and services that result – comply with the requirements of standards (e.g., ISO 9001 and FSSC 22000), as well as customer, regulatory, and the organization’s own requirements.  Key Responsibilities Daily evaluation (and sample checks) on the operational and administrative, processes, inventory platform (Unleashed), facility security and document-flow for compliance with quality management requirements Periodically inspect and calibrate auditing tools (e.g., scales, thermometer, loggers, etc) Assist in development routine of audit plans, audit schedules and sampling program Participate in quality management audits (and lead by the senior manager, when needed) Identify processes, situations, etc., where organization is meeting requirements, as well as identify opportunities for improvement Assist audit team in developing audit reports; present audit findings and analysis to top management, as needed Assist with follow-up audits, internal training, implementation and correction as required May be required to develop internal auditing and testing parameters Required Skills Internal Auditor Certification ISO 9001, or higher. Experienced in carrying our internal quality management checks and audit independently. Have a good knowledge on the flow of documents (forms, records, etc) from initial order (i.e., sales) to production (final product) to fulfilment (delivery). Experienced in inventory management checks and facility security checks. Experienced in identifying process gaps and suggesting solutions. Experienced in employee counselling, internal training, and basic level of investigation. Independent and organised in documenting daily activities, findings, and progress of implementation. Chairing discussions with senior manager, proposing improvements, implement approved improvements. Skilled in microsoft word, excel (including Gantt Chart), PowerPoint, basic data analysis, and some experience in using ERP/inventory software platform. Adhere to all EHS rules and requirements and take adequate control measures in preventing injuries to themselves and others as well as to the protection of environment and prevention of pollution under their span of influence/control.

jobTitle: CIB - WP - APAC Regional FIG Liquidity Pricing & Balance Optimisation Manager, Executive Director
description: The position reports to the APAC Liquidity Deposit Management and Account Services Lead. The scope of the role includes FIG pricing strategy and governance, balance sheet management, analytics and advisory. The role will also support the expansion and commercialization of strategic initiatives for Wholesale Payments and the FIG franchise.  The position works closely with the Regional and Local FIG Sales Heads, WP Global Product Team, WP APAC Country Heads, WP APAC Local Product Managers, together with partners including Group Treasury, Legal, Compliance, Risk, Operations, Technology, Implementation and Client Service.  Responsibilities Include  Product Management: Contribute to setting product and pricing strategy for the APAC FIG franchise, ensuring alignment with Global strategies and APAC/Local priorities Leverage data and analytics to support balance management and advisory around liquidity optimisation across the FIG portfolio Developing a robust understanding of market dynamics across the region - competition, regulatory changes, emerging client requirements and product needs as they related to FIG Maintain thorough knowledge of all relevant global (Basel III, GSIB, FDIC etc.) and local regulations as it relates to overdraft, deposit and account services products and resulting impacts on the liquidity portfolio Partner with CIB Treasury and Corporate Treasury on balance sheet management initiatives, identifying opportunities for growth and optimize deployment of deposits. Identify product gaps, prioritize enhancement requirements and develop business cases to support investment requests. Work with the Client Service and Implementation teams to streamline processes and achieve a consistent client experience. Contribute to the creation and delivery of training to functional partners on product mechanics, positioning and selling guidelines for deposit and account services products. Work closely with functional partners pre and post releases to ensure new product functionalities are delivered as per specified business requirements. Manage day-to-day priorities in relation to the products by working closely with functional partners and by providing expert support to front, middle and back office. Provide direct support to clients during and post implementation as required. Ensure comprehensive on-boarding and servicing procedures are in place and up to date. Risk, Regulatory & Remediation Management Ensure understanding and identification of the risk attributes to the product portfolio and the client segments utilising the products in scope. Work closely with functional partners in Risk, Legal and Compliance to ensure new regulations are fully understood and acted upon efficiently and in a timely manner. Ensure risks and impact by segment are fully understood and documented appropriately. Ensure strong controls are in place end-to-end, including all activities related to client on-boarding, operational processes, legal, compliance, accounting and tax. Ensure strong end-to-end product management control framework is maintained and updated in line with changes in legal and regulatory environment. Work with functional partners in operations and technology to actively support minimization of manual processes and activities. Strategic Planning Work with Wholesale Payments and FIG Sales colleagues and peers to analyse client needs and competitive, industry and market trends. Provide feedback to product management team on market intelligence. Fully understand market requirements and contribute to development strategy for the products in scope. Working closely with the Global team and other Liquidity Product Managers to provide innovative solutions globally and in APAC. Collaborate with Legal, Risk and Compliance to align product documentation negotiations and control points in client negotiations. Align closely with Treasury Services business / product partners to ensure strong cross-sell opportunities to drive multi-product revenue. Qualifications / Experience Bachelors degree or equivalent Minimum 15 years of relevant banking experience, preferably within Transactional Services, FI Sales or Liquidity Management. Experience in liquidity products, deposit management and pricing across multiple geographies, is strongly preferred. Experience in price negotiation required Track record of strong partnerships with key stakeholders, and especially of execution credentials. Understanding and appreciation of the Liquidity regulatory and control environment Strong verbal and written communications skills. Strong financial, analytical and strategic skills. Organizational, administration and project management competencies. Collaborative attitude, with proven ability to work across global matrices. J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

jobTitle: Assistant Wellness Centre Manager【Gym Industry/ Orchard/ 44hrs shift】-7912
description: Job Responsibilities  Sales Promote and sell programs, services and products offered by the Centre and conduct walk through of the Centre’s facilities. Strive to achieve sales target through communications and upselling to customers. Concierge and Operations Correspond to internal and external customers enquiries, complaints and feedback, within 24 hours, before escalating to Operations Manager. Responsible for cultivating a cohesive and inspiring workplace culture amongst concierge team and practitioners Ensure Concierge team comply to Company’s code of conduct and grooming standards Provide support for implementation of workshop and programmes as necessary. Ensure SOPs compliance and timely update with MBO to facilitate appointments, bookings, cancellations between customers and practitioners for private sessions and consultations. Ensure accurate and timely administration of medical/clinical follow-up appointments and insurance claims Support manager in implementation of new services and programs and orientation and training of new team members Responsible for smooth operations of assigned service point(s), including concierge services, retail administrative and operational matters. Responsible for two-way communication between staff and management and ensure timely dissemination of information, escalation of issues and recommending solutions to problems. To support management to achieve stable, skilled and motivated workforce and achieve the desired customer and business outcomes. Responsible for the management of Concierge team, as well as the induction, regular competency audit, training and development of these staff, such that they are successful in their assigned tasks for accurate administration of customer journey and excellent customer service at all touch-points. description: Manage a team of 14 SEO Specialists Hands-on SEO experience - not just creating documentation for developers  About Our Client  An award winning Digital agency. Our client is looking for a technically astute and confident Associate SEO Director who loves to drive unprecedented traffic and money keywords rankings for their clients. They are looking for someone who self-driven and who loves to work with inspired (and inspiring) teams. The agency is a leader, not only in Singapore but also throughout Australasia in the field of digital marketing.  Job Description  Support the SEO Technical Director and inhouse team of 14 SEO Specialists to execute SEO strategies, implementations and update on the project planning to ensure smooth workflow Be on the cutting edge of SEO, finding new strategies to implement on our clients to drive their organic traffic Developing and implementing effective SEO strategies for the improvement of organic traffic and search ranking and the maximization of ROI SEO pitching together with Enterprise Strategy team to bring in more new and exciting projects Well versed in preparing SEO reports on a fortnightly and monthly basis to be shared with client and identifying areas for improvement Use a variety of tools, competitive research and other methods to discover optimal keyword targets appropriate to the business needs of the client Oversee SEO campaigns which encompass Technical Auditing and Onsite Implementation, Link Outreach and Content development Work with a team of SEO Techs, Content Writers, Campaign Managers, Paid Media and Sales team Format reports and provide top-line insights for on-going performance reviews Able to demonstrate understanding of how duplicate content and page load speed affects SEO by advising clients on best practices for successful implementation and improvement Have the ability to audit prospects & existing clients organic performance. Everything from a backlink profile to analyzing server logs Demonstrate a hunger to stay abreast of the latest industry developments, and factor these into your day to day work. Understand metrics and KPIs and continually suggest optimizations to improve performance Apply, and be able to explain, SEO best practices for site navigation, breadcrumbing, internal links (including anchor text optimization), and HTML sitemaps to client websites Apply, and be able to explain, SEO best practices for domain, sub-domain and directory structure to client websites Have the ability to talk tech with developers, but also layman to the layman Monitor clients sites regularly for crawling and indexing issues. Issues identified will be surfaced to the respective Campaign Manager and Technical Director, documented for client communication/follow-up Use a variety of tools, competitive research and other methods to discover quality potential outreach linkbuilding opportunities  The Successful Applicant  8 or more years relevant, hands-on SEO experience - not just creating documentation for developers to implement Experience using SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, SEMRush, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, SEO related excel/Google sheets functions Experience working with web developers internally & externally You have the ability to implement onsite SEO on most CMS types & static websites, along with familiarity with cloud hosting environments You have a proven track record of organic success. When asked about a website you've worked on, you can walk someone through exactly how you did so Able to produce high quality work within a fast paced, dynamic environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Has a strong familiarity with the web development process, including the important points at which SEO must be considered Experienced with international SEO. At a level where you can sculpt a website's international SEO strategy from scratch Develops knowledge of client's business, competition and latest industry news and trends Effective time management skills with an ability to multitask and prioritize Strong attention to detail Ability to present and communicate ideas in a coherent and effective manner. Always focussing on driving organic traffic Prior experience in a media agency preferred A 'Can Do' attitude  What's On Offer  You'll be amongst a highly engaged team of the country's most talented digital marketers and growth experts, with solid prospects for upward mobility.  An expert in SEO and a passionate team leader.  Contact: James Sibly  Quote job ref: 4213647

description: Company Background  ERM is a leading global provider of environmental, health, safety, risk, social  consulting services and sustainability related services. For nearly 50 years we have been working with the world's leading organisations, delivering innovative  solutions and helping them to understand and manage their sustainability  challenges.  Our clients around the world are in diverse industry sectors and ERM supports them to understand and manage their environmental, health, safety, risk and  social impacts. To do this, we have more than 5,500 people in over 40 countries and territories working out of more than 160 offices.  THE APAC BUSINESS  Under the leadership of Mark Errington – Regional CEO, the APAC business is responsible for 20% of the global revenue for ERM.  The aim is to grow our 9 business lines in a positive manner by embedding a high performance commercial culture, increase ERM’s market share in the region, and bring in a commercial structure that reflects both the region and BU growth and high value sales.  There is a focus on LCET (Low Carbon Energy Transition), ESG and Sustainable Finance and Digital/Technology.  APAC is split into the following Business Units  South and East Asia Singapore, Vietnam, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia Myanmar & India  Central East Asia Hong Kong, China and Taiwan  North Asia Japan and Korea  ANZ Australia and New Zealand  The Region has about 1000 staff with an HR team that consists of up to 25 across the various countries.  The Role & Key Responsibilities  ERM currently has a need to hire a Regional HR Director.  Given the markets in which ERM operates, it is essential to bring on a team to  deliver against the challenges and needs of the business and therefore the RHRD will work closely with the business in making this happen.  Being based in Singapore, reporting to the Regional CEO and the Group HRD,  having had experience in a similar role, working for an organisation in the professional services space, it would also be good if they came from the  environmental, sustainability or climate change arena.  Being part of the HR Senior Leadership Team and also the Regional Leadership Team, the RHRD will work closely with the Regional CEO, engaging senior  business leaders, developing the strategy and supporting the recruitment within the sectors as mentioned, with the help of the Talent Acquisition team.  The position collaborates with leadership on human resource-related initiatives to help drive positive people and business outcomes, assesses and anticipates HR-related requirements, while balancing the needs of the business with those of the global, regional and BU organisation. Developing partnerships across the HR function to deliver value –added service to leadership and employees that reflect the business objectives of the organisation, while proactively communicating, the RHRD maintains an effective level of understanding about organisation and  business strategy, financial position, culture and competition. Overall goal is to align with the business strategy, and support the ability to attract, develop,  engage and retain, the best and brightest talent in the industry.  Responsibilities Provide consultation to BU Leadership on resourcing planning, talent and performance management, employee engagement and employee relations. Take a leadership role in developing a culture that enables employees to perform in accordance with ERM’s values achieving the goals of the business. Effectively lead implementation of global and regional HR initiatives and programs, adjusting as needed for the business. Be able to challenge, advise and give direction when needed. Anticipate people related events and situations that have an impact on the business and proactively communicate with the business leadership to manage impacts and mitigate risks. Manage BU Human Resource Managers in implementing policies and procedures, compliance, and annual human resource initiatives. Take a coaching approach and provide BU leaders and managers information to facilitate effective and consistent people management (expecting and enabling managers to assume increasing responsibility for all aspects of people management). Provide operational and strategic HR consultation on the interpretation of employment legislation, performance management, and risk analysis to support. Responsible for execution of BU annual HR processes to include performance reviews, goal setting, salary adjustments and bonus process, talent reviews and succession planning, etc., for the assigned BUs. Support Group/Corporate and regional HR initiatives and projects, as well as communication. Drive effective execution of on boarding, assimilation and engagement of employees within in the BU. Leverage internal networks to develop integrated solutions for BUs in partnership with other groups such as Finance, IT, Communications, etc. Coach and mentor HR team members and Managers through BU leadership. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in human resources management, Business Management/Administration, or related field; Masters’ preferred. Advanced knowledge of employment laws and general HR expertise; able to make effective employment and performance recommendations based on laws and company polices. Strong track record of this role, having worked across APAC. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate, collaborate and influence at all levels of the organisation with the goal of continually helping the business improve operating performance; ability to display courage. Strategic communicator, verbal and written; effectively frames and shapes conversations, able to deliver difficult messages. Demonstrate sound judgment and the ability to balance the needs of the assigned BU with those of the overall company. Demonstrate talent management (TM) acumen and the ability to communicate with and coach leaders and mangers about TM programs to include talent reviews, career framework, succession, etc. Minimum of 10 years of progressive HR experience; in a consulting environment a plus. Results oriented, identifies key data sources and utilises data driven insights about key metrics to improve business decisions and problem solve. Proficient in analyzing qualitative data; exceptional analytical and quantitative skills. Builds relationships and works well across functions and geographies. Demonstrates strong leadership capabilities, including employee coaching, objective setting and professional development. Prioritizes and oversees multiple projects in fast-paced environment; thrives in highly complex, matrix environment. Works with diverse stakeholders and builds strong collaborative relationships; manages competing agendas and priorities vertically and across different businesses. Ability to travel 20%, primarily in the Business Units supported. Who We Are  As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.  ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.  ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability status.  Thank you for your interest in ERM.

description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting an Associate Director - Cyber Solutions to join our Specialty Insurance Broking team in Singapore.  About Aon  Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results.  The Opportunity  As part of the regional cyber team, the Associate Director - Cybe Solutions will be responsible for driving the growth of cyber insurance throughout Asia. This will include leading cyber insurance broking strategy on medium to large accounts, prospect engagement, technical guidance for country colleagues and thought leadership.  While cyber insurance will be the primary focus, the candidate will be expected to support adjacent specialty insurance opportunities (particularly where cyber risk is relevant to the exposure) and the broader Aon Cyber Solutions offering (proactive, reactive and advisory services).  This position will report directly to the Head of Cyber Solutions - Risk within the Aon Cyber Solutions Team.  Responsibilities: Provide specialist technical advice to colleagues and clients on managing exposure to cyber risk and cyber insurance. Understand and articulate the value proposition of the broader Aon Cyber Solutions offering (proactive, reactive and advisory services). Support country and regional broking teams in the negotiation and placement of cyber insurance policies. Support deployment of the broader Aon Cyber Solutions offering, particularly scenario development and coverage analysis contained in quantification and simulation services. Negotiate policy wording amendments and endorsements with insurers and drive quality control initiative across all cyber policies placed in Asia Present on cyber risk and insurance in individual client meetings as well as large client events Partner with Aon resources (Sales & Marketing, Specialty Team, GBC and in-Country teams) to deliver the widest practical range of insurance solutions and services to client. Complete contributions to tender responses to ensure timely submission and quality of reports. Ensure implementation of broking excellence initiatives including: Pricing & Profitability; Client Promise; Sales / Cross Selling; SPS; Wording/Slip standardization; Standard Contracts; Data Quality; Broking operations process flow; Carrier / market engagements; Commission Grids. Interface with the market and to secure optimum outcome for client risk coverage. Contribute to key thought leadership content for our clients and markets, and demonstrate understanding and insight into the industry, clients, risks and solutions. Contribute to up to date marketing materials on carrier appetite and solutions available to Specialty clients. Ensure knowledge and best practice approaches are captured, documented and shared among cyber champion network. Contribute, as required, to Specialty Broking and Aon Cyber Solutions initiatives in general. Requirements 6+ years of experience within the insurance industry (or relevant adjacent professions, including law, consulting and cybersecurity) 2+ years of experience working with cyber insurance policies Strong technical skills around insurance policy interpretation and drafting and/or cyber risk Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong cultural fit - ability to forge strong relationships with country and specialty colleagues as well as clients and insurers How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.  2490762

The incumbent will learn both soft and technical skills as well as develop knowledge of the industry and business. Required Skills/Experience A Seasoned Technical Architect and professional with minimum of 10 years of experience, ideally as an IT Engineer qualified with solid domain knowledge • Extensive experience in pre-sales for a technology company within financial services (banking or insurance) or alternatively for an auditing or consulting firm • Extensive knowledge of cloud deployment options • Data Life-cycle Management & Big Data Adoption • Understanding of security, coding languages, sizing (R, Python…) • The candidate is expected to spend a significant portion of their time meeting with clients face to face across Asia • Excellent presentation and communication skills with ability to deliver presentations to large CIO’s/CTO’s & their teams and an ability to interact effectively with different levels of management. • Sales flair to enable consultative selling • Appreciation of technology and ability to relate to customer needs • Cross-Team player as well as excellent people management skills • Ability to operate in undefined environment
