description: About The Job Director Of Engineering  TreeDots ensures that unsold food never goes to waste. We want it to make its way to businesses like restaurants, cafes and others that can benefit from it. Treedots wants the world to achieve more with less, and reduce precious food waste in order to reduce our already overtaxed food production environment and lessen the burden on the climate.  We accomplish this by building an innovative platform that digitises the existing offline Business to Business (B2B) process of connecting food suppliers to their purchasers who need regular food inventory to operate their businesses. This domain has never been broken into before with a software solution, and to this day most transactions are handled with pen and paper over the phone. We believe that our team will be the first one to succeed, and we have an exciting track record and trajectory of traction to prove that this is possible  With one foot in Southeast Asia and one in Silicon Valley, we are an Amasia VC venture-backed growth-stage startup with the ambitions of the next great tech success story. We believe that Treedots’ cause makes a real difference, and we are looking for more missionaries like us to step up to this important challenge. We have real, large paying customers and we are building a company on real business fundamentals.  Job Description  We are seeking an experienced, talented Director of Engineering to join the engineering team at Treedots in Singapore or remotely anywhere around the world. You’ll be bringing your skills and expertise to design, build and scale our highly available and distributed SaaS platform and its numerous applications that make our business possible and essential to many.  You will be working in an Agile and test-driven environment, given the autonomy to decide the best way to design, ship and support the system. You will use the best tools for the job and follow industry best practices to ship a product that is truly valuable to our users and partners.  Some of our engineering focuses for 2021 are Build infrastructure and architecture that powers our application on all client platforms (web, iOS, Android) Enable a service-oriented architecture at TreeDots Expansion to 4 - 6 Engineering teams Planning and executing the development of an extremely ambitious roadmaps covering multiple different products to serve the Food Industry from end to end In this role you will Lead the engineering team of 30 - 40 people, and growing, managing three engineering managers, a Dev Ops and Data Lead to build a technology that powers trust and convenience in the Food Industry. Our teams are highly remote and diverse throughout Asia. Be responsible for the delivery and maintenance of all TreeDots products to its customers and internal toolings for our team. Be responsible for TreeDots' uptime and SLAs to users, internal and external partners. Be responsible for TreeDots data successfully flowing into the hands of its users such as customers, sales team, business operations and product management and others. Be responsible for the compliance to regulations related to our technology in the region such as PDPA, Digital -Banking license and others Sit on the leadership team in TreeDots, together with the Directors, Product Lead, Head of Marketing and more. - - The Product Lead will be your main peer in discovery and delivery of product to our users. Your first month at TreeDots Get to know the rest of the leadership team Get to know your direct reports and staff Get to know TreeDots products and its roadmap Get to know TreeDots product delivery process Your first six months at TreeDots Propose and guide revision to TreeDots product delivery process, including process around partnering with Product Management team and making sure users receive the right solutions to their needs on an efficient and timely manner Guide TreeDots in the process of integrating with other technologies as you see fit in improving the internal processes for internal staff Own and manage the engineering team hiring process, building a culture and tradition of technical excellence on the team. Coach your reports and ensure that they and their team are successful. Oversee the team in delivering major critical improvements and expansions to the product. Communicate your teams' progress and status to the company and relevant stakeholders Your first year at TreeDots Shape the direction of TreeDots as part of TreeDots leadership team Shape the direction of the technology roadmap for TreeDots Why is this position available?  Our engineering team has been rapidly expanding over the year and now requires a stellar individual in bringing out the potential in the team in ensuring that the technology runs alongside with the other business functions and supports the growth of the business.  Where will you work?  Our HQ is situated in Singapore but our team is highly remote across Asia with only one Engineering Manager in Singapore. You can work anywhere within Singapore Timezone (GMT +8).  Minimum Requirements 7+ years of management experience building engineering teams and extensive experience with managing managers Experience and success as a coach. Mentorship is one of the most important aspects of this role. Excellent soft skills. You'll be working across the entire TreeDots organization, building relationships and partnerships with other leaders to accomplish large-scale technical goals Razor sharp verbal and written communication skills Ability to attract top talents and build high performing teams Bonus Points For Experience managing people across multiple locations, especially in Asia Experience with procurement and ecommerce platform Benefits Excellent career progression with huge growth potential Flexible working arrangements Nurturing and dynamic global team Opportunity to put your skills in solving a real environmental problem
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Company Description  ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®  We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.  Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.  Job Description  What you get to do in this role: You will report to the Head of Expert Services APJ. You and your team will actively work with customers and alongside partners to provide ServiceNow Platform leading practice guidance. To achieve excellent business outcomes underpinned by a technically healthy platform this team must be at the forefront of these leading practices, collaborating across ServiceNow, to both receive the latest standards, but also to feedback and support their continuous improvement. You are accountable for partnering with ServiceNow account teams and across Customer Outcomes to allocate the right consultant at the right time in the right place. Driving best in class execution, utilization management, measurable KPIs and SLAs determining success, building a world class team that can not only deliver, but in many cases partner with sales teams to help articulate the value proposition of Platform Architecture services. Additionally, you must have the ability to continuously learn and improve from our customers, your team and from our Product Development and Sales Teams. This feedback loop is critical to constant innovation, improvement and growth of the overall Platform Architecture capability in the GEO, both directly as well as through Customer Outcomes Excellence and Product Development. Delivery success criteria such as time to value, accuracy, health scan and NPS Talent and roles’ rotation to Customer Outcomes strategy Productivity / Utilization Subject Matter Expertise Technical Consultative Skills Cost to serve/margin Employee Voice Survey Training Hours Talent development and recruitment Qualifications  To Be Successful In This Role You Have Matrix management leadership experience Experience in running Professional Services Organizations both internally and in the field. Strong understanding and experience of the Services Integration (SIs) operating model, having worked with or for large SIs. To demonstrate strong business ownership, embrace accountability and be a hands-on, people-centric leader To have a growth mindset, and be driven to constantly find and execute learnings to improve the execution and organization for the benefit of our customers and talent A proven track record in successfully navigating customers through complex situations To be proactive, critical thinking, problem solving, manage escalation, ensure conflict resolution, a thought leader at executive level Global thinker/background Servant leader Accountable and inclusive Change Agent with confidence and credibility Familiarity with ServiceNow’s offerings Enterprise Architect certification (Togaf, IT4IT, etc) Excellent communication skills – both verbal and written skill Customer facing presence with business outcome orientation in Service Delivery Technical consultative skills Experience managing consultant utilization and Service Demand forecasting Experience creating and managing metrics and Key Performance Indicators Experience with personnel management and staff development on an APJ level. Software implementation and Business Process background Service Offering Portfolio Creation and Innovation Best Practice desire and re-invention capability Enterprise approach with a global reach JV20  Additional Information  ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.  If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.  For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government. description: As Responsible Cyber continues to grow, we are expanding our team. As a cybersecurity product manager you will be responsible for supporting a high performing team, providing high-quality and holistic cybersecurity product management for our platfrom IMMUNE. We are establishing a truly talented team and as such are looking for a driven consultant with a proven track-record of at least one year in product management, in particular Security-as-a-Service "SaaS" in information security.  Cybersecurity Product Manager, Responsible Cyber  As a cybersecurity product manager in our fast-growing development team, you'll spearhead the development and to-market strategy of our flagship Security-as-a-Service & cyber risk management platform.  At Responsible Cyber, you will... work closely with the engineering team and senior management to define, manage, and execute a product vision have an opportunity to make a real impact on the future of the organization develop, prototype, and document a cyber risk methodology to integrate the platform's security assessment tools into a broader cyber risk management framework partner with sales and consulting team to understand customer needs and translate them into product features conduct competitor research and produce compelling sales strategy briefs that drive customer adoption in underserved segments Our ideal candidate... is passionate about countering cyber threats and stays up-to-date with industry trends has 1-2 years of work experience, or relevant educational qualifications / internships is familiar with industry-standard cyber security frameworks such as NIST, ISO-27001, and CIS Controls can collaborate with both technical and non-technical audiences, from executives to engineers, to implement and manage long-term projects s an organized self-starter, able to scope projects and work independently in a dynamic start-up environment excels in data-driven research and is proficient in Excel modeling and data analysis has impeccable communication skills, with a proven track record of producing high-quality strategic briefs and research reports Seniority Level  Junior / Mid level  Industry  Computer & Network Security  Employment Type  Full-time  Job Functions  Product Management  Non-technical Skills Team player Excellent time-management skills Great interpersonal and communication skills We are having BIG dreams, join us to make them happen !  Compensation  2k-4k per month depending on experience

jobTitle: Executive Director - Front Office Risk Manager - Global Markets
description: Nomura Overview  Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking), and Investment Management. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com  Responsibilities Responsible for Front Office Risk and the effective evaluation, and management of Risk incurred through the daily activity of Nomura Global Markets. The focus will be on the monitoring and reporting of the risks from all Financing Businesses within AEJ GM Instrumental in exercising active risk management, interfacing with local management, Sales and Trading, Product and Structuring. The role will require coverage of both local and global risk control functions. Ensure that risks are both identified and assessed and that appropriate mitigation and management measures are implemented in a comprehensive, appropriate and forward-looking manner, in accordance with governance principles. Co-ordinate operational risk issues, implementing quality assurance for risk issues (e.g. procedural monitoring and control plan implementation) and reviews and analysing existing business processes and challenging control procedures. Requirements Candidate should have at least 12 years overall experience as a Risk Manager with a minimum of 8 years covering Credit Risk in the Global Markets environment Candidate must have relevant experience working in an Investment Banking/Global Markets environment covering portfolio monitoring of credit (prime) financing Have experience in looking at leveraged Credit risks, which may emerge in products like Prime, Credit Repo and Structured lending Having experience in assessing financing risks associated with large deals is a plus Must possess strong analytical skills The person should have good communication skills as the job will involve a permanent interaction with senior stakeholders as well as the Trading team. Ability to speak and write a second language (Chinese/Bahasa) would be desirable as the clientele coverage would come from Asia markets Diversity Statement  Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities, and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation.  DISCLAIMER: This Job Description is for reference only, and whilst this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, it is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts, requirements or working conditions associated with the job. The management reserves the right to revise the job and may, at his or her discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.  TS ID: 1204686
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking

jobTitle: Associate Director, CFCC Advisory, CCIB Client Coverage
description: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  The Role Responsibilities  Strategy Support the implementation of the vision, strategy, direction and leadership for CFCC Advisory, consistent with Global Head, CFCC Advisory, CCIB Client Coverage's vision and strategy and in support of the Bank's strategic direction and growth aspirations Demonstrate the appropriate culture and practice of CFCC standards (including conducting business within regulatory requirements, and to high ethical standards) within the Bank and embed a Here for good culture and the Group Code of Conduct Business Develop a foundational understanding of the business model and strategy in order to provide required oversight support and challenge in order to enable appropriate and sustainable CFCC outcomes. Build and maintain an effective and constructive relationship with all key business and functional stakeholders that is based on trust, capability and integrity, providing timely, responsive and quality advice and guidance to enable the business and functions to meet/ achieve their strategic tactical objectives. Provide robust challenge to relevant business stakeholders where activities are outside risk tolerance/ appetite, escalating as necessary, until appropriate oversight and ownership is achieved including actions and plans to address any remedial action needed to come back within risk tolerance/ appetite. Provide and communicate timely CFCC related advice, analysis (and challenge when appropriate) in relation to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM, including product design through to post sale reviews / assessments, new business initiatives, bespoke projects, remedial activities (including nature, scale and rigour of past business reviews), and transactional advice. Support the maintenance of global CFCC standards in accordance to standards set by senior management. Support the maintenance and refresh of relevant CFCC frameworks applicable to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM. Support the implementation of relevant project(s) from a CFCC perspective by providing advice and coordinating any necessary country / regional Compliance engagement. Support the implementation of the SPOC-COE model. This includes (but not limited to): taking ownership of incoming queries by not handing them off, taking a leading role in actively becoming the go-to person for the business/function and ensuring advice provided is consistent throughout CFCC Advisory in relation to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM. Processes Support the governance and oversight over the implementation of CFCC related policies and procedures with respect to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM (to enable compliance with such policies and procedures). Support efforts to establish and maintain effective processes (including training, advice and support) to ensure that policies and standards to address CFCC risk are effectively implemented across CB, GB and GSAM Support the provision of second line challenge to processes owned by CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM, including (but not limited to) specific Risk Framework Owner oversight of Complaint Handling, Client Off-Boarding, Know Your Distributors, Bad Debt Sales, Enterprise Appropriateness, Regulatory On-Boarding, CDD, AML Surveillance, and Customer Screening in CCIB Client Coverage. Support the development of policies/standards/DOIs (including training, advice and support) (including training, advice and support) to address CFCC risks across CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM, aligning with relevant regulatory requirements. People and Talent Support the provision of ongoing training and development to ensure that team members are competent, suitably skilled and qualified for their roles, ensuring that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks. Provide constructive developmental feedback at business, function, country and individual level as appropriate, on CFCC matters. Support the migration of skill, knowledge, best practice and lesson learned across the network between CFCC Advisory and Centres of Expertise colleagues especially in relation to legal/regulatory risks and compliance with relevant regulations and internal policies/standards as they pertain to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM. Contribute to the agenda of, and engagement within CCIB Client Coverage CFCC functional meetings, and promote adherence to the stakeholder map, ensuring efficient alignment of business and function. Collaborate with training teams to input into training curriculum to support closing of capability gaps and to meet the training needs of CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM Risk Management Support efforts to anticipate horizon risks that may have a significant impact on the Bank, and CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM, and develop effective strategies to mitigate such horizon risks including global standards for conduct of business. Support efforts to ensure the effective management of CFCC matters in CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM, and management of related regulatory issues that have a significant impact on the Bank In the event of serious regulatory breaches, or where risk tolerances have been breached, ensure appropriate and timely escalation within the Group and that actions are taken quickly to remediate and/or activities are ceased. Ensure proactive and timely identification, assessment, advice and dissemination of evolving regulatory changes/practices and associated risks impacting CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM. Support a programme for conduct, financial crime and compliance monitoring, surveillance and/or assurance for CB, GB and GSAM Support the implementation, and contribute to the management of MI / trackers across all aspects of coverage and responsibility to ensure all issues and matters relating to CCIB Client Coverage are tracked, followed, regularly assessed and reported on including oversight of risk acceptance and/or mitigating action plans, identification and management of high-risk clients or specific country reviews relating to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM. Assist and support investigations concerning CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM Support / assist in the maintenance of risk acceptance and/or mitigating action plans relating to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM where CFCC is the RFO. Support control improvements, enhancements and simplifications relating to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM processes that manage CFCC risk, where appropriate. Collaborate with relevant business and CFCC stakeholders to work towards holistic risk management across client segments / products. Governance Support the identification and escalation of potential risks and issues to senior management through appropriate governance channels and the Quality Assurance framework. Support the management of end-to-end life cycle of audit, assurance and regulatory reviews in relation to CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM, including tracking, remediation and preparing lessons learned from such reviews. Support the development of appropriate Lending governance measures so that Lending approval documents reflect all relevant regulatory requirements. Within the Group's overall ERMF, support the development of appropriate risk-based compliance frameworks for identifying, assessing, managing, monitoring, mitigating and reporting CFCC risks across CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM. Develop or assist in developing and recommend (for approval by the relevant Risk Committee and/or individuals), appropriate standards to manage CFCC risk in CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM. Project/Change management Assist from a CFCC perspective in the review of new business requirements and provision of solutions for CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM where required Support key change programmes and projects for CFCC Advisory, CCIB Client Coverage and GSAM Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk and CFCC matters. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across the Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Support efforts to drive the CCIB Client Coverage CFCC Advisory team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; and The Right Environment. Key Stakeholders GB and CB COO teams GB and CB FCC (Group, Region and Country) GB and CB Legal Client Lifecycle Design Management team GSAM Policy and Performance team Group Credit Risk Group Operational Risk Group Internal Audit CFCC Centres of Expertise Other Responsibilities Embed Here for good and Group's brand and values in CCIB Client Coverage CFCC Advisory Team Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and standards. Our Ideal Candidate 5+ years of experience in CFCC Risk Type Advisory Cross-functional Collaboration Managing Change Organizational Governance Regulatory Environment - Financial Services Risk Management Data gathering and reporting Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: About The Company  About the job Intelligent Automation Product Owner (R&D Engineer) We are on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world’s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~14,000 employees create world-class solutions in wireless communications, 5G, automotive, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. We’re recognized as a Great Place to Work across the globe due to our robust culture and dynamic working environment. Our global team acts as one, using collaboration, inclusivity, and integrity to advance technology. We’re driven and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our strong culture extends far beyond our own walls. We leverage our corporate social responsibility framework to support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability. Our technical solutions – and our methods for creating them – help connect and secure the world. Job Description  We are seeking a driven, innovative product manager & product owner to join our team in Electrical & Industrial Solutions Group Center of Excellence (EISG COE). Drive product and solution leadership in all phases of business creation. The purpose being to accelerate customer workflows and outcomes through Intelligent Automation (IA) that holistically combines physical, communication and user experience test. Working together with IA Team to deliver customer solutions and leverage those experiences towards architecting business models and software platforms and frameworks to support scalable development of enterprise workflow solutions. Influence teams and leadership to drive to successful outcomes. Work closely with a broad network of Eggplant leadership, strategic planners, and directly with customers to understand key challenges and lead productization of concepts and solutions. Responsible for both product planning and product commercialization. Managing the product throughout the product lifecycle, gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, and working closely with software engineering, to deliver winning products. Working with sales, marketing, and support to ensure revenue and customer experience goals are met. Key Responsibilities Work with IA leadership to create the intelligent workflow automation vision and translate that into products, solutions and roadmaps Drive new SW & ARR product concepts and business models leveraging the Company’s broad portfolio of technologies including Eggplant Intelligent Automation Collaborating with prospective users and clients to understand and anticipate their needs and translate them into product requirements Working with R&D to develop user stories; managing the product backlog and prioritizing them based on changing requirements Monitoring and evaluating product progress at each stage of the process Liaising with the product team and end-users to deliver updates Participating in Scrum meetings and product sprints Lead all aspects of product commercialization including product validation, acting as owner for R&D development, and working with internal teams to setup product to succeed in the company’s channels and go-to-market structures, etc. Work in a complex, rapidly-changing environment often with conflicting demands, in which others have large stakes and dependencies on your decisions and leadership Effectively communicate and interact up and down across the cross-functional teams and organizations in verbal, written and interactive methods. Job Qualifications BS or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent discipline 5+ years relevant business and/or engineering leadership experience Proven track record to do what it takes to deliver our products to customers on schedule Understanding of design quality standards Understanding of the test and measurement markets from a customer workflow and user-centered design perspective IIn-depth knowledge of Scrum and Agile software development methodology Proven experience in customer interactions and comfortable engaging leadership at our customers Proven ability to lead a business segment, develop a strategy and set a prioritized plan Strong analytical, problem-solving and especially prioritization skills Proven track record in positively influencing business decisions Good balance between technical knowledge and business acumen Strong leadership skills; collaborative working style; excellent written and verbal communication. Ability to integrate group and company-wide goals and objectives Ability to work in a complex, rapidly-changing environment often with conflicting demands, in which others have large stakes and dependencies on your decisions and leadership Consultant in Charge  Ken Ng | 019 213 2628 | ken.ng@hunters-in.com

TO TRAIN STAFF IN HAIRDRESSING. TO HANDLE MODELS FOR SHOW, TRAINING AND PHOTOGRAPHY. Requirements MIN. 12 YEARS EXPERIENCE. KNOWLEDGEABLE AND ABLE TO HANDLE CAUCASIANS & ASIAN HAIR. ABLE TO WORK INDEDEDENTLY.

Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.  Job Title: Legal Director, APAC  Reports to title: Chief Legal Officer  Classification: n/a  Department: Legal  Office Location: Beijing, Shanghai, or Hong Kong or Singapore  JOB SUMMARY: The Legal Director, APAC will handle a variety of legal matters for our APAC regional office including commercial contracts, employment, litigation, vendor contracts, and property. The geographic coverage includes Mainland China, Malaysia, South Korea, Vietnam, Singapore, Indonesia, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Australia.  This Role Involves  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Partnering with the sales teams across the APAC region on contract negotiations with customers, as well as negotiation of vendor contracts. Supporting the Data Protection Officer with data privacy compliance, including negotiating DPAs. Advising the People Team on APAC employment matters, such as employment disputes and redundancies. Advising the CLO and other execs and managers about various legal and non-legal issues. Working with the CLO on various special projects, which may include updating regional employment agreements, rolling out localized versions of company policies, etc. Travelling to other offices as/when needed, likely no more frequently than a few times per quarter. Additional Responsibilities And Information This role will be the first dedicated in-house counsel in the region. For that reason, the successful candidate will be independent and self-motivated. The reporting line in this role will be a direct line to the CLO who is based in New York. There will also be a dotted line in region which will be agreed before starting in the role. Given the time zone differences between New York and China, some out of hours meetings may be required from time to time. You are a team-player and collaborate with colleagues across the business. Flexibility and practicality are key – you know how to take the right risks at the right time. You are a clear and concise verbal and written communicator. You are great at distilling complex concepts into easily digestible morsels of information. You are pragmatic and able to compromise. You will excel at prioritizing your workload and being efficient. Not everything needs to be perfect. You will be a good judge of when excellence is required and when “good enough” is good enough. You will be kind and have empathy. You will deal with tough situations, but you don’t have to be tough to work with. Qualifications a law degree and any corresponding certification that may be required to practice law in China as in house counsel minimum of 4-6 years of legal experience, with at least 3 of those years as in house (preferably within a software or other technology company) Fluent in spoken and written Mandarin and English, including the ability to negotiate contracts in both languages. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS  Required: Ability to practice law as in house counsel in Mainland China or Hong Kong  As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.  Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .  Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.  Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: 0046-Compliance and Control Analyst [ Bank Industry/ Audit/ Risk and Control]
description: Key Responsibilities Help drive a strong control culture and ensuring permanent controls readiness through proactive risk management and issue self-identification. Monitor the Retail control scorecard metrics and key performance objectives and looking into opportunities to strengthen the internal control environment. Prepare the quarterly Retail Update Control meeting deck ensuring material risk and control issues and trends identified across in the retail businesses are discussed and progress updated are being highlighted. Design the quarterly Retail Newsletter providing key updates on retail control matters to the retail banking community. Scan the corrective action plans across the region and provide insightful analysis of issues and trends for proactive risk management and inputs for the regional lesson learn Work with the Regional Retail teams to develop and implement a robust and integrated Risk and Control framework, partnering on various initiatives and enhancing and strengthening the MCA program. Provide specialist risk and control coordination, advice and guidance to ensure a consistent MCA program, PRCs (Processes, Risks and Controls), Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for risk and control across Retail businesses, including monitoring and reporting processes. Drive critical enhancements to the Manager's Control Assessment (MCA) program through alignment with evolving risks as well as changing business needs and policies, and ensuring the mapping of the Regulatory Control Matrix to the MCA is comprehensive Introduce and continuously evaluate the Digital Monitoring Tools/ CAATTS for effective MCA monitoring for Retail Bank. Implement KAAC across Retail Banking MCA program, working with cross functional regional partners to strengthen the use of Key Automated Application Control (KAACs) and ensure annual testing is effectively conducted. Evaluate consistent application of KAAC across Retail Banking businesses in the region. Collaborate with countries on Audits, Escalations, Lesson learnt exercises, P&L remediation and leading horizontal reviews based on emerging issues identified to check for applicability and relevance across Asia/EMEA GCB. Lead or support as appropriate the root cause analysis of material risk events and control breaks, work with country/regional functions and businesses to establish effective feedback loop to augment control management and share lessons learned with the country and region teams. Actively work with the Regional and Country Retail Product teams to review and ensure that potential Sales Practices, Conduct Risk and TCF issues are appropriately and adequately remediated on a timely basis Provide advisory and support to the Retail Bank team on Internal Audit reviews and regulatory exams Support the Transformation and strategic initiatives to ensure that risk and controls are adequately managed and addressed prior to implementation. Essential  Knowledge/Experience: At least 5 to 7 years of banking experience in banking products and processes with strong strategic, analytical and project management skills Experience in audit or risk and control frameworks Previous experience should include a multi geography exposure / remit and understanding across Asia and preferably EMEA. Skills: (technical skills)  Essential Strong understanding of regional GCB Retail Bank business landscape and Retail/Wealth Management/Insurance products Good understanding of various branch, digital and other customer engagement channels Skilled with office documentation software/applications (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access) Excellent quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills with attention to details Qualifications: (degree/certifications)  Essential Bachelor’s degree Competencies Excellent communication skills, able to communicate effectively with senior internal stakeholders. Excellent writing skills and is able to communicate critical information in writing to a wide variety of different audiences. Resourceful, meticulous and detail oriented Strong stakeholder management skills with an ability to influence, negotiate, persuade and adapt. Ability to work independently, interface and execute with a sense of urgency and to deliver on tasks effectively and efficiently Ability to manage competing priorities and the interests of various stakeholders Works well as a team member and contributes to the overall team beyond self

jobTitle: Partner, Environmental & Social Due Diligence, Sustainable Finance (Director Level)
description: Our Partnership Model Offers Unparalleled Opportunities For Leaders With Ambition, Vision And Proven Expertise, Providing  As part of our continued growth and innovation, ERM is seeking an experienced leader to join our global consulting firm as a Partner in Singapore. The Partner will drive growth of ERM business in the M&A practice.We are looking for an established leader interested in being part of this thriving global community – outstanding professionals who combine strong consulting and business development skills with a strong technical foundation – to foster and expand a network of excellent client relationships with corporate clients, private equity and M&A law firms. We seek individuals to help us drive the continued growth of ERM’s business through selling and delivering world-class services, recruiting and developing our next generation of leaders, and further advancing our reputation for Merger & Acquisition transaction solutions.Recognizing that environment, social, governance, and health & safety performance have become business-critical issues for many enterprises, ERM, as the world’s leading sustainability consultancy, is uniquely qualified to advise Fortune 500 companies, leading Private Equity firms and Investment Banks on environmental liabilities, risks, and opportunities. Our M&A practice is the market leader, providing highly innovative advisory services across the full breadth of acquisition, divestiture and capital raising deals. We partner with our clients to identify risks and opportunities on their HSSE / ESG performance across their investment lifecycle. With annual global sales in excess of $70 million, the practice is one of the fastest growing in a business with annual double-digit growth.This is a Partner-level opportunity for a Principal/Director/VP-level professional looking to further their career with an equity stake in a global environmental leader that aims to lead the field in sustainability consulting.A career as an ERM Partner is unique. The opportunity to contribute significantly to key decisions, including the overall strategic direction of our organization Meaningful equity ownership with significant financial and intangible rewards The ability for “thought leadership” on a wide range of technical and business issues impacting our core markets. We are looking for established leaders who wish to be part of our thriving global community – outstanding professionals who combine strong sector knowledge and networks, business development skills, technical expertise and a sound understanding of environmental and social governance issues.Responsibilities:The M&A Partner will report to the ERM Singapore Country Manager. The primary focus will be on client account development, sales, and delivery of the full spectrum of ERM’s consulting services to deliver strategic value to our clients.In particular, the successful applicant will play a key role in growing ERM’s Transactions Services practice across its broad portfolio of service offerings, including: EHS due diligence for Mergers & Acquisitions and project financing Post-merger integration Management system gap analysis and benchmarking Sustainability assessments Deal negotiation support The Partner will be responsible for: Actively developing commercial strategies to pursue and win new business opportunities that result in significant revenue growth with target clients aligned with ERM’s global strategy. Developing new client relationships and expand existing relationships by delivering strategic consulting advice, excellent value, and quality service. Leading complex due diligence consulting engagements involving multi-site portfolios and multi-person project teams nationally and globally. Work with clients to find solutions to transaction-driven environmental issues, including EHS compliance, remediation, portfolio issues, Brownfields, and liability cost estimating. Building growing, and manage a high-performance team, serving as a leader and mentor to consultants. Identify emerging talent and work with them to reach their full potential; ensure rising stars are nurtured, developed and given new areas of responsibility. Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment to build ERM’s global business, as well as to lead client and practice teams. Leverage the Mergers & Acquisitions role to provide services related to site remediation, EHS compliance, management systems, outsourcing, and integration support, among others. Requirements: Minimum BS in engineering, science, business, or related discipline; advanced degree and/or professional registration a plus. Extensive years of progressive experience in a consulting environment, or a related, equivalent field, working at a high-level with corporate, financial, and legal clients; Demonstrable track record in delivering multimillion dollar sales results annually, including successfully winning large and strategic portfolios. Preferably experience with cross-border transactions. Well-versed in environmental risk, environmental compliance, health & safety compliance, and remediation liabilities as they relate to transaction agreements. Offer recognized technical expertise and an established reputation in the marketplace. Business acumen to understand business risk and challenges, and recognize corporate opportunities Experience in running a small/medium-scaled business or team Organizationally savvy in order to work across a matrix of line management, services, and other sectors Positive outlook, collaborative, and driven by the success of ERM as a global company. If this sounds like you, and you're looking to join a fun and vibrant team where you can add real value and make a difference, then we want to hear from you.At ERM our only asset is our people and we strive to provide a working environment and benefits that both attract and retain top talent. We offer a competitive package, flexible working options and a strong team atmosphere and a professional and collaborative culture.Who We Are:As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. ERM and our partners are driven by a dynamic vision: By 2021 we will be the clear leader in our chosen markets, we will double in value and we will deliver on our promises to our clients, our people and our investors. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability status.
industries: Environmental Services, Civil Engineering, and Oil & Energy

description: Responsibilities Attend to vessels to verify health, safety standards and execution of environmental protection policy onboard. Guide vessel in compliance to Company’s policies, international rules & regulations and oil major’s requirement. Advise on changes in legislation and/or industry best practices and submit recommendations for approval. Proposal amendments of company’s SMS manuals for approval. Conduct annual internal Safety Inspection (Marine) and Navigational Audit on board vessels. Conduct Internal ISM audit and co-ordinate external ISM/ISPS/MLC audit on board vessels. Guide vessel in preparation of SIRE Inspection and carry out pre-vetting on board prior to the inspection. Arrange and attend to vessel SIRE inspection and follow up with rectification report within due dates for approval. Follow up vessel’s PSC/FSC inspection and any other external inspection/surveys (Terminal Inspection, P&I survey, Banker Inspection etc.). Conduct investigate and report for marine incident, accident, casualty and customers complaints, as required. Implement and monitor corrective actions for any Non-Conformance relating to health, safety and environment protection. Evaluate Master and sea staff’s performance via internal inspection onboard and proposal actions to be taken. Conduct crew interview as crewing department requested. Prepare relevant TMSA element upload as assigned. Monitor and process vessels routine reports. Monitor vessels deficiency report, especially for critical equipment to ensure deficiencies are timely close-out. Carry out sales & purchase inspections and tasks related to taking over vessels and newbuilding, as assigned. Arrange for vessel safety equipment service (life rafts, fire-fighting appliances etc.) within due dates. Monitor and supply vessel operations related equipment service (cargo hoses, fenders, mooring ropes, UTI etc.). Verify all deck repairs, stores, maintenance and servicing quotation/invoices for approval. Controlling of budget of deck store, spares and repair. Any other duties as assigned by the Marine Manager. Requirement COC Class 1 or 2 holders with sailing experience on oil tankers. At least 3 years’ experience as a Marine Superintendent in ship management operations. Strong communication and interpersonal skills Ability to handle multiple projects and good organization skills Analytical, able to work independently, results-oriented, resourceful, and pro-active.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Oil & Energy, and Maritime

description: About the Role You will be working closely with our technology experts to lead solution designs, and have the chance to be mentored by our CTO. This role will focus on DevOps and Applications Development, including Mobile Apps Development. You should be an eager learner and highly adaptable as you will be involved in multiple technologies and disciplines. You will have opportunities to demonstrate your technical capabilities as well as developing your leadership skills with us.  Role and Responsibilities You are expected to perform the following duties: Work with sales and business development team to develop GTM solutions and proposals Engage customers and partners to advance opportunities by carrying out activities such as technical whiteboarding, solution architecting and wireframing, providing technical contents and inputs for solution proposal, solution presentation and application prototyping if required. Lead applications development projects and/or DevOps implementation or services projects related to Kubernetes/ Openshift and provide consulting to developers around Agile implementation, CI/CD methodology Source for and engage with solution partners to deliver scopes that the Company may not have the technical capabilities for Be involved in POCs (Proof of Concepts) Be involved in testing: systems, regression, performance or penetration. Analyse technology issues and troubleshoot/triage to determine the root cause and provide a resolution or workaround. Work with clients and other technologists and project managers to deliver the outcomes expected. Promote Digital transformation thought leadership for the Company Write technology white papers as required Speak at technology seminars as required Technical account management Be involved in the hiring and mentoring of applications development engineers where required  Experience and Personality Ideals 3-8 years’ experience in application development projects will be advantageous. Aspiration to develop as a digital technology expert is key. Some understanding of applications/development, quality assurance and integration methodologies, concepts and facilities in a cloud environment. Strong analysis, decision-making, and problem solving skills. Demonstrates logical abstract thinking and assimilating/adhering to project goals and deadlines. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues, clients, vendors etc. Resourceful and able to manage your own work with minimal supervision. Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. Ability to work well under pressure and as part of a team. Good interpersonal skills Pays attention to detail. Know how to have fun in challenging situations Qualifications and Education Requirements Degree or Diploma in Infocomm Technology would be advantageous Fluent in English, written and spoken
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Markets Valuation Risk Control is a part of Markets Risk and Controls, which establishes and maintains a robust 1st Line of Defense control environment and culture to minimize operational risk within the business. Markets Valuation Risk Control sets the standards for the quality of front office management of valuation risk, manages implementation of those standards and is responsible for Markets wide governance of 1st Line price risk.  This role will have responsibility for key front office controls relating to risk emanating from the use of market data inputs in the valuation of financial instruments. The role will involve senior level engagement with the business, O&T, 2nd line of defense, control functions and managing relationships with Internal Audit and regulators.  Key Responsibilities Provide centralized support to APAC Trading, Business Managers and Sales on valuation risk related policies and requirements Design and implement governance and provide oversight over consistent market data usage, collateral valuation and client valuations for the APAC region Monitor valuation risk controls, analyzing control metrics and investigating operating effectiveness for the APAC region Facilitate and implement documentation of the control environment for market data usage, collateral valuation and client valuations for the APAC region Facilitate senior governance forums in relation to market data usage, collateral valuation and client valuations Challenge current practices which are not fully aligned with the firm's standards, and identify necessary corrective actions and facilitate resolution of identified inconsistencies Drive standardized and consistent mechanisms to evidence controls and supervision, and ensure alignment with longer term infrastructure initiatives Assess internal / external events, perform lessons learned analysis and implement enhancements as needed Manage deliverables across multiple businesses and stakeholders Coordinate and lead regulatory and Internal Audit engagements and remediations, ensuring timely response and delivery for APAC region Qualifications Robust understanding of typical data structures for market data utilized by derivative models Significant experience with designing and monitoring key controls over valuations in a trading environment Experience dealing with regulators, Audit, Compliance and other risk and control functions Strong controls mindset, identifying and mitigating risks, communicating and escalating concerns Effective people, project and change management skills Ability to identify areas subject to heightened control risk and to design efficient approaches to mitigate the risk on a sustainable basis Experience with generating creative solutions, differentiating and prioritizing realistic enhancements and driving change-related projects Strong communication skills, with ability to influence senior stakeholders, adjust communication style for the target audience and to facilitate and lead governance forums Ability to assess and critically challenge information and processes, delivering appropriate outcomes Competence leading in dynamic, challenging environments while providing creative solutions Ability to collaborate across businesses, regions and support functions Education Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience, Master's degree preferred Benefits Flexible work arrangements in an organization that acknowledges life - work balance Career management and mentoring by senior colleagues and leaders Opportunity for participation in managerial development initiatives Inclusive and friendly corporate culture where diversity and equality is widely recognized Job Family Group  Risk Management  Job Family  Business Risk & Controls  Time Type  Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.  Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi .  View the " EEO is the Law " poster. View the EEO is the Law Supplement .  View the EEO Policy Statement .  View the Pay Transparency Posting

jobTitle: 7104-Compliance and Control Analyst [Changi | Banking | Audit, Risk and Control, from banking / finance]
description: Location :- Changi  Duration:- 12 Months ( Convertible/ Renewable )  Monthly Salary :- $9,500 SGD Max Gross  Key Responsibilities Help drive a strong control culture and ensuring permanent controls readiness through proactive risk management and issue self-identification. Monitor the Retail control scorecard metrics and key performance objectives and looking into opportunities to strengthen the internal control environment. Prepare the quarterly Retail Update Control meeting deck ensuring material risk and control issues and trends identified across in the retail businesses are discussed and progress updated are being highlighted. Design the quarterly Retail Newsletter providing key updates on retail control matters to the retail banking community. Scan the corrective action plans across the region and provide insightful analysis of issues and trends for proactive risk management and inputs for the regional lesson learn Work with the Regional Retail teams to develop and implement a robust and integrated Risk and Control framework, partnering on various initiatives and enhancing and strengthening the MCA program. Provide specialist risk and control coordination, advice and guidance to ensure a consistent MCA program, PRCs (Processes, Risks and Controls), Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for risk and control across Retail businesses, including monitoring and reporting processes. Drive critical enhancements to the Manager's Control Assessment (MCA) program through alignment with evolving risks as well as changing business needs and policies, and ensuring the mapping of the Regulatory Control Matrix to the MCA is comprehensive Introduce and continuously evaluate the Digital Monitoring Tools/ CAATTS for effective MCA monitoring for Retail Bank. Implement KAAC across Retail Banking MCA program, working with cross functional regional partners to strengthen the use of Key Automated Application Control (KAACs) and ensure annual testing is effectively conducted. Evaluate consistent application of KAAC across Retail Banking businesses in the region. Collaborate with countries on Audits, Escalations, Lesson learnt exercises, P&L remediation and leading horizontal reviews based on emerging issues identified to check for applicability and relevance across Asia/EMEA GCB. Lead or support as appropriate the root cause analysis of material risk events and control breaks, work with country/regional functions and businesses to establish effective feedback loop to augment control management and share lessons learned with the country and region teams. Actively work with the Regional and Country Retail Product teams to review and ensure that potential Sales Practices, Conduct Risk and TCF issues are appropriately and adequately remediated on a timely basis Provide advisory and support to the Retail Bank team on Internal Audit reviews and regulatory exams Support the Transformation and strategic initiatives to ensure that risk and controls are adequately managed and addressed prior to implementation. Essential  Knowledge/Experience: At least 5 to 7 years of banking experience in banking products and processes with strong strategic, analytical and project management skills Experience in audit or risk and control frameworks Previous experience should include a multi geography exposure / remit and understanding across Asia and preferably EMEA. Skills: (technical skills)  Essential Strong understanding of regional GCB Retail Bank business landscape and Retail/Wealth Management/Insurance products Good understanding of various branch, digital and other customer engagement channels Skilled with office documentation software/applications (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access) Excellent quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills with attention to details Qualifications: (degree/certifications)  Essential Bachelor’s degree Competencies Excellent communication skills, able to communicate effectively with senior internal stakeholders. Excellent writing skills and is able to communicate critical information in writing to a wide variety of different audiences. Resourceful, meticulous and detail oriented Strong stakeholder management skills with an ability to influence, negotiate, persuade and adapt. Ability to work independently, interface and execute with a sense of urgency and to deliver on tasks effectively and efficiently Ability to manage competing priorities and the interests of various stakeholders Works well as a team member and contributes to the overall team beyond self
industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: Reporting to Head (SDN & IP Services), this role will oversee and drive software and product development of integrated products across networking, cloud and security. In addition, the role will be responsible for the suite of ICT managed services across WAN, LAN and WiFi. The role will have to successfully manage, track, execute and deliver the program objective from a business perspective in terms of revenue, costs and customer adoption.   Key Responsibilities:  Product management of next-gen software networking services such as SD WAN, security, including roadmap planning, product life cycle, product development and processes Responsible for portfolio of ICT managed services such as WAN, LAN and WiFi to drive life cycle management and new growth areas Monitor the development of new technologies, assess their value-add potential and applicability for adoption Responsible for partners and vendors management program and planning Oversee and drive the implementation of strategic projects by leveraging on networking, data analytics as well as software technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes Work closely with the software team to design and build technology that leads to a business purpose and customer value. Drive the strategy and execution of pre-sales and delivery of networking and cloud products and services. Provide leadership and management of projects and deliverable plans, risks and issues with resolution in order to maintain program timelines, milestones, cost, quality and scope Develop and maintain the program environment to support each deliverable and outcome, ensuring consistent and effective proactive reporting, tracking, communication, and stakeholder management Hold regular steering committee level meetings to update management for decision making, prioritisation, stringent program delivery tracking, revenue/cost tracking and forecasting Work with various stakeholders in Finance, Operations, Sales in GTM activities for the products under the program    The ideal candidate should possess:  Minimally a Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent. MBA is advantageous. More than 10 years Product /Solutions Architecture experience Experience with the Cloud (IAAS, SAAS, PAAS) market Experience in networking technologies such as IP, SD WAN & ICT managed services Architecture design /implementation experience with multiple compute, storage, networking and virtualization technologies. Strong business acumen and ability to construct and evaluate business case and business performance Ability to engage partners and vendors for product launches and joint partnerships Ability to work with multiple stakeholders across diverse teams. Good project management skills
industries: Computer Networking, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: Responsibilities Oversee the art department by hiring, training, assigning, scheduling, and mentoring staff Establish art department standards for production, productivity and quality Ensure team adheres to current processes, identifying opportunities for continuous improvement, and proposing and creating processes and tools to support design operations Collaborate with marketing and sales divisions in creating marketing plans, aligning team priorities with business objectives to deliver high-quality work on time and on budget Analyze market trends, consumer need, and the competitive landscape, and track campaign performance Work with the entire creative team to establish a unified brand understanding and voice for the company, helming a creative audit to elevate our innovation Conceptualize campaign vision, harnessing original graphics, copy, content websites, social media, and other marketing materials Develop creative briefs based on ideas established in brainstorming sessions with direction, schedules, and expected deliverables for the creative team Delegate projects to in-house designers and oversee storyboards Obtain team approval by presenting final layouts, storyboards, and illustrations, encouraging members to provide feedback, and responding to internal commentary and requests Present or oversee presentation of final concepts and coordinate production and dissemination for cross-organizational use Requirements Bachelor’s degree in fine art, graphic design, or similar discipline 8+ years as a professional graphic designer with 4+ years of experience in management role Proficiency with design software Exceptional capability with typography, layout, and prototyping Highly skilled with leading a team of creative talent Strong creative vision with an understanding of business objectives

description: Company Description  ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®  We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.  Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.  Job Description  What you get to do in this role: You will report to the Head of Expert Services APJ. You and your team will actively work with customers and alongside partners to provide ServiceNow Platform leading practice guidance. To achieve excellent business outcomes underpinned by a technically healthy platform this team must be at the forefront of these leading practices, collaborating across ServiceNow, to both receive the latest standards, but also to feedback and support their continuous improvement. You are accountable for partnering with ServiceNow account teams and across Customer Outcomes to allocate the right consultant at the right time in the right place. Driving best in class execution, utilization management, measurable KPIs and SLAs determining success, building a world class team that can not only deliver, but in many cases partner with sales teams to help articulate the value proposition of Platform Architecture services. Additionally, you must have the ability to continuously learn and improve from our customers, your team and from our Product Development and Sales Teams. This feedback loop is critical to constant innovation, improvement and growth of the overall Platform Architecture capability in the GEO, both directly as well as through Customer Outcomes Excellence and Product Development. Delivery success criteria such as time to value, accuracy, health scan and NPS Talent and roles’ rotation to Customer Outcomes strategy Productivity / Utilization Subject Matter Expertise Technical Consultative Skills Cost to serve/margin Employee Voice Survey Training Hours Talent development and recruitment Qualifications  To be successful in this role you have: Matrix management leadership experience Experience in running Professional Services Organizations both internally and in the field. Strong understanding and experience of the Services Integration (SIs) operating model, having worked with or for large SIs. To demonstrate strong business ownership, embrace accountability and be a hands-on, people-centric leader To have a growth mindset, and be driven to constantly find and execute learnings to improve the execution and organization for the benefit of our customers and talent A proven track record in successfully navigating customers through complex situations To be proactive, critical thinking, problem solving, manage escalation, ensure conflict resolution, a thought leader at executive level Global thinker/background Servant leader Accountable and inclusive Change Agent with confidence and credibility Familiarity with ServiceNow’s offerings Enterprise Architect certification (Togaf, IT4IT, etc) Excellent communication skills – both verbal and written skill Customer facing presence with business outcome orientation in Service Delivery Technical consultative skills Experience managing consultant utilization and Service Demand forecasting Experience creating and managing metrics and Key Performance Indicators Experience with personnel management and staff development on an APJ level. Software implementation and Business Process background Service Offering Portfolio Creation and Innovation Best Practice desire and re-invention capability Enterprise approach with a global reach JV20  Additional Information  ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.  If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.  For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.  Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Job Responsibilities Supporting the Consumer Business Unit within Singtel. Responsibilities include providing advisory, transactional and project management support to the business to procure goods and services, mitigate risks, ensure legal compliance, advice and provide training on new laws. More specifically the role includes supporting the procurement of devices, media content, various sales and marketing initiatives. Support to certain corporate groups within Singtel such as the procurement and HR divisions General advisory work relating to laws particularly in the following areas - Intellectual Property, Privacy, Consumer Protection, Competition and Telecommunications. A working knowledge of consumer related laws and regs in general is required. Some litigation experience would be beneficial but not essential as well. An active member of the group legal division contributing expertise to special interest groups and building our knowledge base. Assist with managing contract managers and providing legal training sessions The Ideal Candidate Should Possess The Following A good Law Degree from recognized university and preferably be admitted to the Singapore bar. , Minimum 8-10 years PQE, with experience in SGX listed company secretarial work Good working knowledge of the following areas of law, IP, Privacy, some litigation management experience Familiar with Telco or TMT environment in Singapore Able to identify issues and propose practical solutions Technical Proficiency with MS Office Applications Good interpersonal skills and able to interact and work across functions and levels. Good communication, writing and negotiation skills. Team player able to work independently with good people management skills
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: Opportunity to work closely with an entrepreneurial and fast growing project development team in ASP, to support all stages of a renewable energy project development lifecycle - including due diligence, land campaigns, procurement, interconnection, offtake, acquisitions, joint ventures, sales, construction and disputes. Ability to work on a varied and broad range of transaction documents in compliance with company guidelines and preferences, in each case while being encouraged to participate in and help shape strategic initiatives to further business objectives. Broad exposure managing external counsel across a wide range of practice areas, including M&A, tax, permitting, environmental, interconnection and other regulatory areas. Empowered and equipped with resources to strive for constant improvement and advancement of best practice through development and implementation of systems, processes, guidelines and forms to create efficiencies and lay groundwork for future growth of the business.

description: Introduction To The Role  Our client is on its way to building a top-tier Digital Bank here and is looking for Design Director to join their fast-growing team in APAC. You will part of the leadership team overseeing and scaling the design team to the next level. You will lead a team of highly talented and passionate designers on a high-visibility project in the region, building products from early stage.  Responsibilities Leading the vision of a user-led environment, placing users at the core of everything they do. Build out the foundational UX team, coaching and mentoring the team and identifying necessary training and education required. Execute all phases of design work such as user research, defining POC, execute UX flows, apply visual design systems, creating prototypes, creating production-ready designs and participating/conducting usability testing Advocate best design practice, inspire creativity and identify growth opportunities for the team. Constantly driving challenge-based collaboration to spur a high-performing culture that will develop high-quality products. Desired Qualifications/Certifications Experience in UI/UX, Research and Product design in an e-commerce or hyperlocal setup Strong application of conceptual thinking, dynamic user experiences, data-driven analysis and decisions, and familiarity with mobile-first designs. Experience building digital native application and responsive web design Experience working across multidiscipline and the Agile way of working Knowledge of creating wireframes, user flows and sitemaps. Experience in leading and executing user research interviews, moderated and unmoderated usability testing. For more information you can email Celestine Chia in our Singapore office on celestine.chia@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 527263 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest.  http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/Z6nKOS/design-director-apac-digital-bank-sales-marketing-singapore-singapore-14817331  Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544
