description: Job Title : APAC-SG-Compliance and Control Analyst (SGD)  Location :- Changi  Duration:- 12 Months ( Convertible/ Renewable )  Monthly Salary :- $9,500 SGD Max Gross  Key Responsibilities Help drive a strong control culture and ensuring permanent controls readiness through proactive risk management and issue self-identification. Monitor the Retail control scorecard metrics and key performance objectives and looking into opportunities to strengthen the internal control environment. Prepare the quarterly Retail Update Control meeting deck ensuring material risk and control issues and trends identified across in the retail businesses are discussed and progress updated are being highlighted. Design the quarterly Retail Newsletter providing key updates on retail control matters to the retail banking community. Scan the corrective action plans across the region and provide insightful analysis of issues and trends for proactive risk management and inputs for the regional lesson learn Work with the Regional Retail teams to develop and implement a robust and integrated Risk and Control framework, partnering on various initiatives and enhancing and strengthening the MCA program. Provide specialist risk and control coordination, advice and guidance to ensure a consistent MCA program, PRCs (Processes, Risks and Controls), Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for risk and control across Retail businesses, including monitoring and reporting processes. Drive critical enhancements to the Manager's Control Assessment (MCA) program through alignment with evolving risks as well as changing business needs and policies, and ensuring the mapping of the Regulatory Control Matrix to the MCA is comprehensive Introduce and continuously evaluate the Digital Monitoring Tools/ CAATTS for effective MCA monitoring for Retail Bank. Implement KAAC across Retail Banking MCA program, working with cross functional regional partners to strengthen the use of Key Automated Application Control (KAACs) and ensure annual testing is effectively conducted. Evaluate consistent application of KAAC across Retail Banking businesses in the region. Collaborate with countries on Audits, Escalations, Lesson learnt exercises, P&L remediation and leading horizontal reviews based on emerging issues identified to check for applicability and relevance across Asia/EMEA GCB. Lead or support as appropriate the root cause analysis of material risk events and control breaks, work with country/regional functions and businesses to establish effective feedback loop to augment control management and share lessons learned with the country and region teams. Actively work with the Regional and Country Retail Product teams to review and ensure that potential Sales Practices, Conduct Risk and TCF issues are appropriately and adequately remediated on a timely basis Provide advisory and support to the Retail Bank team on Internal Audit reviews and regulatory exams Support the Transformation and strategic initiatives to ensure that risk and controls are adequately managed and addressed prior to implementation. Essential  Knowledge/Experience: At least 5 to 7 years of banking experience in banking products and processes with strong strategic, analytical and project management skills Experience in audit or risk and control frameworks Previous experience should include a multi geography exposure / remit and understanding across Asia and preferably EMEA. Skills: (technical skills)  Essential Strong understanding of regional GCB Retail Bank business landscape and Retail/Wealth Management/Insurance products Good understanding of various branch, digital and other customer engagement channels Skilled with office documentation software/applications (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access) Excellent quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills with attention to details Qualifications: (degree/certifications)  Essential Bachelor’s degree Competencies Excellent communication skills, able to communicate effectively with senior internal stakeholders. Excellent writing skills and is able to communicate critical information in writing to a wide variety of different audiences. Resourceful, meticulous and detail oriented Strong stakeholder management skills with an ability to influence, negotiate, persuade and adapt. Ability to work independently, interface and execute with a sense of urgency and to deliver on tasks effectively and efficiently Ability to manage competing priorities and the interests of various stakeholders Works well as a team member and contributes to the overall team beyond self
industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: The Director for Network & Security Operations will provide the necessary leadership and direction to deliver reliable and quality network and security services for enterprise customers. The incumbent will be responsible for strategy, financial planning and budgeting, business planning and leading a Network Operation team who is responsible for designing, Implementation and operation of services across Telco and ICT services, new service launches and supporting new business opportunities.   Responsibilities  Strategic and Functional  * Accountable and responsible to manage Global Network & Security Operations across Telco and ICT * Providing strategic leadership in terms of technology for network and cyber security competency * Overseeing and managing the service delivery function for Telco services from pre-sales to post-sales   Financial  * Developing the annual budget planning for the services and ensuring the financial KPI's are delivered * Managing the Operation expense and capital expenditure for the Network Operations function * Driving the revenue over cost improvement for the department through effective cost management initiatives   Business  * Leading and managing the network & security operation function for corporate network & security services * Tracking, monitoring and managing the network to ensure that the network, security elements and service levels deliver the expected performance in accordance with the SLA * Innovating and crafting solutions to meet customers' requirement in cost effective way * Working closely with the internal stakeholders to ensure the services are delivered smoothly and meet SLA requirements * Ensuring overall reliability, availability and operational excellence of Network Infrastructure * Leading Cyber Security operations for Enterprise business * Managing 3rd party suppliers and product principles in engineering, pre-sales and service delivery phase * Acting as single point of contact for Network & Cyber security operation on the Infrastructure, technical leadership to drive standardisation, scalability and service improvement through innovative approach * Leading and supporting in customer and regulatory engagement from technical perspective. * Ensuring compliance to Networks and Systems Security, Change Management policies and Service Assurance requirements * Ensuring compliance to IMDA Code of Practice e.g. Outage Reporting Code, Service Resiliency Code, Quality of Service Code, Secure & Resilient Internet Infrastructure Code * Developing and driving Operational Excellence initiatives to increase automation, increase efficiencies with aim to optimize resources and year-on-year increased productivity * Developing and driving Service Excellence initiatives to enable visibility of service & system performance for reviews and to reduce network faults/incidents, reduced churn and improve customer experiences.   People * Providing thought leadership to teams of highly technical staff to ensure Operations achieved High Network Availability, Fast service turnaround, Effective Problem Management and adaptation of top tier Telco best practices in Change Management processes * Planning and executing the necessary training and skill set development for the for team members to ensure team adequately trained in respective platforms and future technology areas * Formulating effective & efficiency work processes within division and cross-functional interworking to facilitate team executions are aligned to work processes; Smooth execution of projects with appropriate resources and support; Conflicts resolutions and clearing of road blocks to enable projects completion with teams collaborations * Inspiring teams to achieve goals with service excellence and innovations * Attracting and retaining staff   The ideal candidate should possess  * Degree in Computer / Electronics Engineering preferably with major in communication, or any other relevant discipline * At least 15 years of experience in Network infrastructure design, build and operate with minimum 5 years in management role * Strong knowledge on network equipment, technology, routing protocols and network management systems * Strong leadership, Interpersonal and mentoring skills * Ability to work under pressure and matrix organization * Customer Focus, drive for results * Proven operational experience in managing Network & Security operations
industries: Computer Networking, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: Roles & Responsibilities Responsible for annual and five yearly inspection, service and repair of all lifeboat and davit of various make in the industry. Coordination with vessel superintendents, Class surveyors and shipping agents Assist with documentation with Class Audits Ensure all activity is align with company set policy and Procedure. Ensure all servicing onboard and ashore at workshop are as per schedule set by the department Prepare all documents such as service report, time sheet and issuance of final certificate upon work completion as necessary. Work with Sales and Operation team to coordinate workflow/scheduling. Qualifications Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in Engineering (Marine) or equivalent. With minimum 10 years experience in lifeboat/davit inspection is essential Possessing lifeboat manufacturer license is preferred. description: Company & Team - "About Us"  Our country risk intelligence and macro-economic forecasting is used by senior executives within multinational corporations and governments to underpin critical strategic decisions. The IHS Markit Risk Intelligence offering specifically supports the work flow of persona's focused on managing external risk - such as corporate security, compliance and risk management. For example, we deliver our Country Risk insights to inform strategic security decisions for corporate security teams, our integrated analysis of external risks informs enterprise wide risk management practices and informs risk mitigation processes.  We are uniquely placed in this space as we have one of the most developed Economics and Country risk research and consulting teams in the market and our lead analysts frequently brief Chief Security Officers and Chief Risk Officers across capital intensive industries and financial services.  Our Sales team in APAC works closely with the 300+ researchers, 30+ product management team and 40+ Consultants in the Economics and Country Risk group to add value to our customers' strategic planning and risk management processes.  Duties and Responsibilities - "Your Role"  You will be a key member of the IHS Markit ECR Sales team in APAC and will drive new business sales into new and existing risk intelligence clients.  Key Responsibilities Include Meeting or exceeding monthly new business goals and driving new customer leads through cold approaches, social selling and coordinated campaign outreach Employing a solution-based sales methodology to best align Economics & Country Risk's capabilities with prospect needs Providing timely and accurate insight to your pipeline leading to accurate forecasts Representing and promoting the company and business line to senior executives both internally and externally Developing a strong understanding of the value proposition for our offerings as it relates to the corporate security and risk management market Job Requirements - "About You"  Key Qualifications And Skills 5+ years of sales experience. This should include experience of working in a strategic account management role or a complex business development role. Proven track record of selling complex high-value solutions involving multiple stakeholders Experience of selling into Corporate accounts across sectors and/or Financial Services Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to tailor communications to risk persona Proven excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to build effective internal and external relationships Experience selling information services (research, data, consulting) Willingness to travel up to 25% in order to conduct face to face meetings or attend industry conferences (restrictions allowing) Bachelor's degree minimum Desired: ability to speak a second language in addition to English Job Benefits - "What we offer" Strong client base and broad product line On target commission plan with uncapped earnings potential Excellent team culture within core Sales team but also wider commercial and research groups Opportunity to work with world experts in the field Options to work from home Exposure to the wider IHS Markit community with options for onward movement over time Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. For more information on the many ways in which we enthusiastically support inclusion and diversity efforts for both candidates and employees, please access our Inclusion & Diversity Statement here .  We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with IHS Markit and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please contact or call +1 212 849 0399. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are considered on a case-by-case basis. This contact information (email and phone) is intended for application assistance and accommodation requests only. We are unable to accept resumes or provide information about application status through the phone number or email address above. Resumes are only accepted through the online application process, and only qualified candidates will receive consideration and follow-up.  IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.  For Information Please Click On The Following Links  IHS Markit Business Code of Conduct  Right to Work  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Pay Transparency Current Colleagues  If you are currently employed by IHS Markit, please apply internally via the Workday internal careers site.

jobTitle: Cloud Architect (IBM/Azure/AWS) (Senior Manager to Senior Director)
description: About Capgemini  The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Cloud Architect (IBM/Azure/AWS) (Senior Manager to Senior Director)  To be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) with cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure and/or IBM Cloud), or cloud-native SaaS solutions (Snowflake, Databricks, CrowdStrike, etc). Lead internal technical team of SMEs to deliver quality solutions and proposals Serve as the SME in the development, deployment and management of cloud and on-premise infrastructure solutions Possess good and current hands-on working experience with technologies involving DevOps CI/CD development (scripting such as Python), Infrastructure automation using IaC such as Terraform, Cloud Formation, cloud services on IBM/Azure/AWS Own the infrastructure solutions being proposed to client; this includes designing the solution, defending the solution, working with delivery teams to ensure the successful deployment and with operations teams subsequently. This includes infrastructure solutions for Enterprise Compute/Storage, Network and Security, DR & Backup, and End User Computing for medium & large enterprise solutions Present and defend the solutions including articulating the value proposition Ability to stay current with key technology trends, products offering from multiple vendors and industry best practices Possess strong technical skills with working knowledge and experience on server technologies, virtualization, middleware, networking, security, storage, software defined network, and databases  Key Requirements  10+ years of experience in an architect role, leading IT initiatives and in support of complex infrastructure technologies in various enterprise environments Experience in an Architectural practices/standards. 10+ years of experience as a SME/pre-sales for infrastructure solutions with experience in Cloud technologies and service delivery management. Professional experience as IT Project Manager within Financial Services domain), delivering according to SDLC frameworks, methodologies and best practices within Agile and/or Waterfall frameworks Advanced knowledge of BI tools (Tableau & Power BI), MySQL, Linux/UNIX OSS and/or NoSQL Database knowledge. The depth of knowledge on how Enterprise customers implement OSS RDBMS or Azure CosmosDB or other NoSQL platform such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Couchbase, Hbase, etc. both on-premises and in the cloud. required Experience data modeling and transformation of large-scale data sources using Hadoop, Spark, Hive, EMR, or other Big Data technologies such as Java, Node.js, C#, Python, SQL, Spark/SparkSQL, Hive/MR, Pig, Oozie and streaming technologies such as Kafka, Kinesis, NiFI etc. Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift Experience with MS Azure to include, SQL Server on Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics/SQL DW, SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) and/or Azure Resource Manager (ARM) template Experience in architecting data pipelines and solutions for both streaming and batch integrations using tools/frameworks like Glue ETL, Lambda, Google Cloud DataFlow, Azure Data Factory, Spark, Spark Streaming, etc.  Flexible with domestic and international travels

description: If you’re obsessed with shifting the conversion needle, not afraid to learn from failure, and have a natural ability to empathize with customers, we would love to talk to you. This role will stretch your creative thinking, power of analysis, and leadership potential. You’ll evangelize world-class design and grow our conversion mindset across the entire business.  Your design solutions and split test ideas will be seen by hundreds of millions of web visitors each year. Are you ready to help us win?   About the team We believe good design is as much about empathy, behavior, and emotion as it is about utility and ease. We’re guided by a highly iterative user- and conversion-centric design process that combines research, data, and thoughtful critique. We are never satisfied with the status quo.  Our UX & CRO design function works across our main website and other owned channels, as well as on partner websites to optimize funnels for sales and retention. We’re scaling this function rapidly, and we’d like a Lead Conversion Designer who wants to be part of an industry-leading vision.  We craft delightful experiences that empower people to make their digital lives more private and secure.  Responsibilities As the leader, your team will be: Designing and delivering CRO, UX, and UI solutions to optimize our main website and partner websites, and drive conversions across the sales funnel. Your contributions will be critical to meet our business, end-user, and branding needs. Your expertise will drive the ideation and testing for team leads and business partners across the company. Specifically, you’ll drive solutions with Pay Per Click (PPC), Product Marketing, Social Media, and SEO teams to optimize sales funnels for hundreds of campaigns across web, mobile, and emails. Conceiving of ideas and hypotheses for A/B tests to improve conversion funnels and user-engagement. Drawing on the expertise of our in-house data analysts to understand retention, acquisition, and sales drivers and drop-off points in order to create well-informed design solutions. Defining and maintaining the UX and UI patterns across our web platforms using our internal design system. Using the ExpressVPN’s visual identity, and recommending where/how it needs to adapt to suit our conversion goals. Running ideation and design thinking workshops to drive and support our discovery processes. Partnering with UX Researchers to understand the needs, behaviors, motivations, pain points, and opportunities for our customers.  Your team’s success metrics will include: Sales and retention uplift attributed to your conversion rate optimization solutions. Ratio of winning split tests across all web funnels your team touches.  Contributions towards conversion rates from free trial to paid users. Consistency of user experience in partnership with other design functions. Speed of delivery. Your team will propel the design that keeps several other teams charging towards their end goals in revenue growth and customer retention.    As leader of the team, you will: Evangelize our UX and CRO vision and ensure excellence and continuous improvement across all funnels coming through the web. People-manage other conversion and UX designers.  Set goals and track progress, manage performance, assign responsibilities, coach, train, motivate, and hold the team accountable for delivering the expected results. You’ll manage several talented individual contributors. Make hiring decisions as you recruit world-class talent to scale your design team. Design, enforce, and improve processes for your team. Foster a culture of creativity, efficiency, and learning from failure. Train your team and others across the company as needed. Independently navigate stakeholders, and reframe business problems as design problems to promote collaboration. Promote a brand that consumers trust and recognize. Manage your team’s work in conjunction with our internal project managers and product owners. Be responsible for the quality of all output from your team, by seeking early feedback from, and providing visibility to major stakeholders where necessary. Lead by example, demonstrating your mastery of UX design craft and CRO best practice.  Requirements Please get in touch if you have the following skills or experience. We’re excited to tell you more about this role and our company. Extensive and proven design experience shipping quality UX and UI resulting in high-impact-to-conversion rates. Demonstrated track record of leading and managing UX designers  Must have experience with interviewing candidates and making hire/no-hire decisions, performance management, conducting peer design reviews, and creating skill development plans for your direct reports. An outstanding portfolio showcasing world-class designs, including a foundation in typography, interaction, and visual design that reflects best practices and industry trends. Excellent design skills with expert knowledge of branding, prototyping, interaction design, UI design, UX writing, UX research, and information architecture for digital products. Strong experience with split (A/B) testing. Excellent problem-solving skills. Strong communicator with excellent command of the English language. You’re great at leading people from diverse backgrounds and cultures toward a singular goal or vision. Able to take direction and execute projects; you deliver impeccable projects on deadline. Great organizational and project management skills. You can define a vision and see in your head how it should be implemented. You are confident but willing to learn. You give and receive constructive criticism well. We want to learn with you, and from you. Based in either Singapore or Hong Kong, and willing to travel between the two locations when required, post-pandemic.  Optional  User research experience: Planning, recruiting, conducting, and reporting on user research. Experience hiring senior UX designers Expertise in Customer experience design Comfortable communicating with developers on technical topics  Profile of an ideal candidate You ideate quickly and naturally. You see losses as learning opportunities instead of failures. You’ll try things 5, 10, 100 times if needed, iterating and perfecting through testing along the way. You’re a great coach. You’re able to balance nurturing with demanding speed and quality. You’re a master of your craft. You can confidently assess current strengths and weaknesses combined with overall business strategy and turn that into a long-term experience design vision. You excel at and enjoy stakeholder management. You're excited to work with colleagues across functions to bring out everyone's best thinking, and you can communicate your vision for the future in a way that inspires your colleagues to join you. And when senior stakeholders disagree, you're eager to collaborate to forge the best outcome.  You have held a design leadership role but you more often get hands-on. You’re comfortable creating design solutions or delegating to others.  You believe in the power of a strong brand identity. You’re data-driven. You understand what drives sales and increases customer acquisition and retention and create design solutions accordingly.  You have an intuitive understanding of how people think and make decisions. You pride yourself on being organized and can deliver on tight deadlines. You demand excellence, have great attention to detail, and take pride in the quality of your work.  Note: Please upload your resume as a PDF and do not include any salary or compensation information in it.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Newly Created Regional Role With Team Management Responsibilities Work For A Fortune 100 Company As the manager of the East Region Non-Price Predictive Modeling team, you will provide analytical direction for a team of data science and advanced analytics professionals. You and your team will develop, integrate and champion the use of predictive models and analytical tools to enable data-driven decision making and help GRM East Region achieve their profitability and growth goals. This role requires broad knowledge of predictive modeling techniques, and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues. This is a highly visible role that will connect often with senior management and other groups across Liberty Mutual. You will provide analytical assessments of business issues to management and a mixture of technical and non-technical audiences so good communication skills are essential.  Responsibilities:  Manage, coach and develop a team of up to five data science and advanced analytics staff in various geographic locations. Collaborate with other business partners to develop appropriate statistical approaches and tools that will drive strategic decision making related to challenging problems central to our business. Understand the competitive marketplace, business issues, and data challenges in the markets in order to deliver actionable insights, recommendations and improve business processes. Develop, implement and monitor timely and practical modeling and analytical solutions to complex problems that drive change across GRM E&W global operations. Supervise and perform highly complex, technical and creative predictive modeling projects. Effectively communicate results, insights and recommendations in written, oral and presentation formats to technical and non-technical audiences. Regularly engage with LM data science community and cross-functional working groups. Expected global travel: 10-20% (dependent on company travel guidelines and policies)    Requirements :  Master's degree or higher in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or any other quantitative field OR comparable actuarial education/designation with 5 to 7 years of relevant work experience. Proficient in predictive analytics including experience in model development, validation, implementation and monitoring.  Proficient with at least one language for data analysis, such as R, Python or SAS. Proven ability to lead and drive projects and assignments to completion through others, and effectively engage talent. Knowledge of insurance principles, underwriting and the various functions of an insurance organization, including Finance, Underwriting, Sales and Claims desirable. Exceptional planning, analytical, decision-making, communication and project management skills. Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing. Strong interpersonal and communication skills to establish and build effective relationships. Ability to give effective presentations to and influence senior leaders and other groups. Management experience is preferred.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Insurance, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Senior VP / First VP, Head of AML Compliance Operations, Personal Financial Services
description: About UOB  United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.  Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.  About The Department  The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.  Personal Financial Services  We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.  Job Responsibilities Oversee and lead Team to manage the day to day AML (Anti-Money Laundering) compliance operations covering Name Screenings, Ongoing Reviews, post-Suspicious Report Transaction reviews and FATCA/CRS reviews. Review compliance controls in relation to new products/services and including the implementation and operationalization of the Compliance Policies and Procedures. Establish, review and update SOPs, processes and guidelines for effective controls that are efficient and meet regulatory best practices and industry standards. Resolve and assess risks when business decisions are made and provide sound coherent and consistent recommendation to Senior Management. Close work collaboration with Sales and Distribution on AML matters. Liaise and resolve regulatory concerns with Compliance, Audit and Regulators, and including coordinating related inspections. Participate in AML related transformation projects. Job Requirements 10 years of relevant experience in AML (for Retail Banking customers). Extensive knowledge of MAS regulatory requirements. Hands-on and experienced leader who motivates and develops people to maximize their potential. Good communication and presentation skills. Good analytical capability with high attention to details. Able to translate Policy/Procedure changes to process and execution changes to be performed by the Team. Be a part of UOB Family  UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.  Apply now and make a difference.
industries: Banking and Financial Services

description: In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential.  The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential.  Want to be a part of our team?  The Principal TS Systems Integration Specialist is to provide design, configuration and escalated problem management in client environments of high complexity.  They define system architectures for business opportunities during the project take on phase. They design and develop integration plans and create links for multi-platform, multi-vendor business solutions. These individuals identify and develop technology related opportunities and integrate IT resources to fulfil project requirements. They are able to compile technical specifications in a clear, concise, unambiguous manner to explain the advantages and disadvantages of options leading to the final solution and are able to create alternative solutions as backup planning.  The Principal TS Systems Integration Specialist establishes a track record of exceptional performance with regards to a combination of technical, service and/or business ability. These employees work towards expert level certification, whilst at the same time developing business knowledge.  Radford Information  Responsible for translating the client’s business requirements into specific systems, applications or process designs for very large complex technology solutions and integrating architecture. Acts as an advocate for the client as the ultimate authority on the architecture designed to address client business problems. Provides direction for design activities. Often project-based, sometimes working at customer sites.  Working at NTT  Key Roles And Responsibilities Deliver technical solutions to clients and take responsibility for the standards of work, project sign off and client satisfaction. Oversee the design or build of customized architecture or applications, integrating it with new or existing hardware, packaged and custom software, and communications infrastructure. Interpret client requirements and decompose them into hardware and system requirements and specifications. Contribute expertise towards a proposed technical solution and will work with internal colleagues to define the roadmap and milestones. Provide pre-sales support identifying opportunities and contributing expertise around the design and configuration requirements in relation to RFP / RFI and proposals of medium complexity. Provide user support, assisting with troubleshooting and design, configuration and escalated problem management. Develop technical training materials and conduct training programs and educate engineers on basic technical details. Act as key project team members charged with the analysis of user and technical requirements, specifications development, solution design and development, and in some environments may consult on testing and deployment processes. Expected to be technology leads for specific technologies and to use their deep knowledge of these technologies to propose enhancements and improvements. Oversee the design or build of customized architecture or applications, integrating it with new or existing hardware, packaged and custom software, and communications infrastructure. Develop systems to manage and monitor the progress of integration during the project planning phase and after initiation. Ensure the necessary resources required during the integration phase. Assess and effectively manage all risks associated with the project integration. Develop and manage stakeholder relationships to ensure the client’s expectations are met and business growth is achieved. Provide stakeholders with accurate and meaningful information and conduct analytics to support management decision making. Knowledge, Skills And Attributes Knowledge and understanding of IT industry environment and business needs Ability working with clients and business teams to create client-orientated solutions and services Interpersonal skills with the ability to develop and maintain strong stakeholder relationships Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to present information clearly and succinctly The ability to recognise opportunities for enhancement and continuous improvement Displays persuasive and confident presentation, writing and report/proposal ability High level of technical ability with respect to market, verticals, horizontals, business administration and business change Ability to work in high-pressure situations Ability to establish and manage processes and practices through collaboration and the understanding of business Ability to manage urgent and complex tasks simultaneously Academic Qualifications And Certifications Relevant Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Relevant technical certifications Project management certification (preferred) Required Experience Broad range of experience working with clients to understand their requirements and define appropriate solutions Demonstrated project management experience What will make you a good fit for the role?  Standard Career Level Descriptor For Job Level Have broad expertise, uses skills to achieve goals in creative and effective ways Works on significant issues Creates formal networks involving coordination among groups Exercises independent judgment in methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results May supervise the activities of others Typically requires extensive related experience with a Bachelor’s or equivalent degree; or extensive experience and a Master’s or equivalent degree; or a PhD or equivalent with moderate experience; or equivalent experience Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.  Equal opportunity employer  NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category. jobTitle: Technology Innovation – Blockchain & Multiparty Systems Technology Associate Director
description: About Accenture  Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  We are:  Our Multiparty Systems Practice is the leading-edge innovation arm of Accenture’s Technology business where we are shaping the future for our clients, Accenture, and the world. We are disrupting our clients’ core businesses and transforming industries in order to propel them into the future and create better products and services. As an elite global group of business strategists, architects, engineers, and entrepreneurs, our team is redefining how industries collaborate, build, and thrive in the face of unprecedented change. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in Accenture Technology Vision 2021.  Our team is deeply hands-on, highly technical lead-from-the-front thought leaders. We are solving some of the hardest problems in enterprise technology and transforming and disrupting established industries.  We are doing this by leveraging the power of new architectures and technologies, and developing capabilities in blockchain, distributed systems, decentralized identity, confidential computing, multiparty computation, extended reality, quantum computing, robotics, application security, delivery innovation, no-code/low-code systems, and radically human systems.  You are:  A passionate senior leader who brings technology innovation, facilitation skills, and an entrepreneur mindset to invent offerings and assets that provide valuable solutions for clients. You have excellent interpersonal, communication and listening skills. You are a life-long learner and energized by solving new problems and transforming how our clients think.  The Work  You will often be:  Demonstrating significant innovation and thought leadership in technology architecture that has been applied across multiple clients globally and is being used in solutions with demonstrated success in sales and/or delivery.  Leading the creation of new or evolving existing offerings and assets, and assessing the value the new capabilities could unlock for organizations and ecosystems.  A leader in developing Accenture's response to the emerging technology trends in the market shifting how businesses apply key technology innovations.  Articulating and explaining Accenture's technology vision and strategy at Accenture's most significant/critical client(s) across the globe.  Shaping and delivering solutions at our most technically complex client engagements and early adopters, reviewing technology approach, architecture, and risk on most complex IT programs in their area.  Building the business and pioneering the use of new and emerging technologies, such as decentralized identity, confidential computing, extended reality, quantum computing, or robotics.  Teaching and sharing expertise across the global market, providing leadership to other technology architecture executives and seen as a leader in developing our next generation of technology architects.  Responsible for mitigating risk for the future projects with existing legacy systems.  You should have experience with some of the following:  Leading functionally and technically diverse teams in complex, globally dispersed, program delivery.  Understanding when, and when not, distributed ledger technology would be an appropriate solution for to address various business and non-functional requirements.  A desire to work in a collaborative, fast paced environment, where innovation and pushing boundaries is the status-quo.  A passion for learning and experimenting with new technologies and connecting these technologies to business outcomes.  Qualifications:   1-3 years of hands-on experience with one or more blockchain platforms: R3 Corda, Hyperledger Fabric, DAML, Enterprise Ethereum, Hyperledger Indy/Aries:  Configuring nodes in a distributed network.  Developing and testing smart contracts.  Key management.  Network architecture and operations.  7 years of professional working experience leading or developing in software engineering teams  4-7 years of software design and development experience in one or more of the following areas:  Microservices development in Spring Boot or Node.js (Express, Hapi, Koa, etc) frameworks for service integration and application programming interface (API) development  Data design and database configuration  Continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD)  Functional and unit testing automation  Infrastructure provisioning and configuration  3-5 years of experience managing distributed teams, conducting performance reviews and assisting others with career development.  3-5 years of experience designing, delivering, and assessing complex technical architecture solutions  Project experience leading geographically distributed teams, particularly offshore engineering teams in South Asia and Asia-Pacific.  Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree - STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) majors preferred.  Bonus points if:  You are certified in distributed ledger technologies: Hyperledger Fabric Administrator/Developer, R3 Corda Certified Developer, DAML Certified Developer.  You have architecture certifications. Examples: TOGAF, AWS Solutions Architect Professional, Microsoft Certified Solutions Architect Expert, GCP Professional Cloud Architect  You have project experience through all phases of a typical software development lifecycle (SDLC), preferably with agile methods like Scrum, Kanban, SAFe.  You have experience in modern front-end (Angular, React, Vue, WASM, etc.) or mobile development.  You have knowledge and experience with emerging technologies and trends such as decentralized identity, confidential computing, extended reality, quantum computing, or robotics.  You have architecture or hands-on experience with modern DevOps tools and workflows such as: Atlassian suite, GitHub, VSTS, Jenkins, Octopus deploy.  You have experience with reliability engineering including monitoring, performance/resiliency engineering, and designing high-availability systems.  You often formulate and articulate new points of view on emerging technologies, as demonstrated by internal or external thought leadership contributions (e.g. videos, whitepapers, conference presentations)  You have open source community participation and contributions… please share with us links to your work.  You will also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

description: Role Summary We are currently searching for an experienced Cloud Engineer with a solid track record of developer experience in full stack applications. The successful candidate will have individual experience in architecting CI/CD cloud architectures and designing and developing full stack applications on cloud from APIs to clients. As Cloud Engineer you will be working with the Head of Application Development and the rest of our R&D teams to architect reliable, best practice CI/CD serverless architectures on cloud. Our systems cover a wide range of web and mobile applications required to support our hardware portfolio of products. As part of our new cloud strategy, we are looking for a talented individual having demonstrated strong ability to understand user requirements, user personas, defining user interfaces and implementing them leveraging the latest development tools and stacks on AWS cloud infrastructure. Key Responsibilities Define, review, create and contribute to product requirement specifications Define, review, create and contribute to cloud architecture design Develop micro-services and own their deployment and operations Contribute to the selection of technology stacks and cloud architectures Develop mobile applications Develop front-end applications Develop cloud back-end applications DevOps development required on all aspects Writing test cases and executing tests Able to work with distributed remote teams Organizational Hierarchy Direct reporting to the Head of Applications in terms of responsibilities, schedules, HR-related topics, and status reports Works closely with the Applications team to design the different architectures and applications Works closely with the marketing and sales teams to capture requirements Works closely with the embedded developers on the system integration Requirements Must be able to demonstrate having had development ownership of code Capability to design, code, test and write documentation. Demonstrate a solid track record of prior experience in web, mobile and cloud applications Working knowledge and understanding of Agile software development. Previous experience in IoT, Edge and AWS services is a plus Skills 5-10 years of experience in cloud and web development Knowledge of Javascript, Node, Python Developer and Devops experience on AWS Beneficial & Desirable Experience in lighting, HVAC control, and automation Experience with Azure or AWS IoT cloud solutions Job Offer Organisation with strong business growth Attractive salary package If you are interested in the role and like to discuss further, please click Apply now or email at hr@interel.com Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted. Company Overview INTEREL creates intelligent sustainable environments and is on a mission to empower companies that create smart living experiences, to use their and the world’s resources more efficiently by connecting utilities, things, and people through the best technology ecosystem. INTEREL’s smart building ecosystem consists of a beautifully crafted hardware portfolio of smart thermostats and room control devices, powered by INTEREL OS, featuring the connectBsmart™ IoT connectivity framework, and the Home of Things and Hotel of Things™ integration platforms. Together these products and services provide customers and partners a solution to retrofit, merge and virtualize, what otherwise would be several difficult to manage, siloed CAPEX investments. With 500.000 devices installed, INTEREL solutions have created smarter and more sustainable buildings in over 45 countries across the world. To learn more, please visit: www.interel.com
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: The Social Outcast - Woodfire Smoked & Charcoal Grilled Joint. Rebranded and relocated to The Grandstand at Bukit Timah, Turf City. A place where you get your hands on both grubby food and fine dining experience in one place. With the team expanding, we are looking for committed, fun-loving individuals to join our Outcast Family.  Full Timer - Salary Ranging from 2.8k - 3.2k. Flex / 2 off days per week. Staff meals provided.  Job Description As a Head Chef, the incumbent will be working closely with the Executive Chef in contributing towards the delivery of quality food to all guests at a consistent level while demonstrating an understanding of food hygiene and safety in the kitchen to set a good example for all chefs in the kitchen. The top priority of the Head Chef is to ensure that all good production is achieved on a satisfactory level or beyond the service standards. The incumbent must assist the Executive Chef in exercising cost controlling to minimise wastage and spoilage of kitchen resources. The Head Chef has to demonstrate and practice high levels of working hygiene and safety in the kitchen at all times. Stock check and ordering of all ingredients Hold weekly meetings & AAR with individual departments on performance, feedback and seasonal specials Ensure the whole team performs a deep clean of the kitchen. Propose, R&D, and complete menu creation on time-based on deadlines on the R&D schedule Ensure On-Time Performance of the Kitchen Solve all issues occurring in the kitchen on a day to day basis Forsee and plan for big events and busy periods Ensure quality of the whole kitchen Ensure compliance with all procedures, rules and regulations as set out by the SOPs, hygiene guidelines and internal procedures To assist in identifying problems, conducting investigations and resolve routine problems Work with Management to boost sales and effective product launch Any other duties as assigned Requirements Enthusiasm to develop your own skills and knowledge plus those around you Adaptability to change and willingness to embrace new ideas and processes Ability to work unsupervised and deliver quality work Positive and approachable Ability to work well in a team Excellent listening and communication skills, and with an energetic personality Knowledge of best practices for safety and sanitation Passion for delivering great food and service Multitasking and organizational ability Applicable for Singaporean / PR Citizen / Work Permit.  Please send your resume to hello@thesocialoutcast.com with Subject : Applying for Head Chef Position.
industries: Food & Beverages, Leisure, Travel & Tourism, and Hospitality
